669754000.name: Interesting wine stop
669754000.author: a TripAdvisor user
669754000.reviewBody: We stopped at the main winery in the Valle de Santo Tomas with a small group and had an interesting experience. We were driven throughout the vineyards on a trailer pulled by a tractor stopping very so often to taste a wine in the vines. That was fun as the day was gorgeous. We returned to the hillside tasting room and had an off in the dark tasting experience that didn\u2019t quite cut it due to technical difficulties and uncertainty with the translations. However overall the folks were very friendly and tried hard to make our visit informative and pleasant. It would probably be a good idea for the winery to polish up those items or stick to the vineyard tasting experiences. \n\nThe wines we had were cleanly made though one was over the hill. This is something we\u2019ve noted at several Mexican wineries, they\u2019re holding onto their wines for way to long before releasing. This place is worth the visit especially if you can set up the vineyard tasting on a nice day. Cheers

659888277.name: Wine Tasting Without The Tour
659888277.author: a TripAdvisor user
659888277.reviewBody: Stopped here on a cruise tour for some wine tasting.  This is one of the oldest wineries in Mexico, dating to the 1880s.  The actual winery has moved out of the city due to urban growth, but you still get a brief tour of what the old winery looked like, plus a tasting of four of their wines plus their olive oil varieties.  I thought the wines were all very good, and the prices are very reasonable (around $15 US).  Enjoyed this stop very much.

659061218.name: Entre Santos
659061218.author: a TripAdvisor user
659061218.reviewBody: This is a winery inside Santo Tomas\'s vineyards. Behind the OXXO at the only light . You can enter through The Santo Tomas entrance....go up to the top.  Very nice next to Concert venue.  All ST wines available.  3 wine taste..$100 pesos...5 wine...$250.

648233562.name: If your goal is to buy good wine, go here
648233562.author: a TripAdvisor user
648233562.reviewBody:
In their premium tastings they have a line of wines named after winds of the world and roughly in the $30-40 USD price range. (This label does not encompass all their wines in this range.) If this is what your budget allows, try these wines. They are of the quality I would expect for this price, which is often not the case in the Valley. The wines already have a fair amount of age on them--I bought a 2009, 2011 and 2013, although most were 2015s. If you prefer to cellar them for a few more years they have character to take it. 

I was there on a Friday in winter, and my server was restricted in the number of bottles he could open for me. The last time I was there was more in the main tourist season and the server gave me a much broader range of tastings.

I make this my first stop because I know I'm going to get something good.

634402850.name: Shore excursion
634402850.author: a TripAdvisor user
634402850.reviewBody: I went to this winery as part of my shore excursion when sailing on the carnival imagination out of long beach. This one of the oldest wineries in this country and i learned tons of great facts and history like Al Capone being supplied liquor from here during prohibition. I personally did not like the wines but a lot of people took home multiple bottles.

633380804.name: amazing experience
633380804.author: a TripAdvisor user
633380804.reviewBody:
his winery has 27 harvests and some have won double gold medals. They also make olive oils. We opted for wine tasting and traditional visit for $ 13 per person. We saw the old warehouse with large wooden barriers for wine and where the bottles are corchean by hand. The guide, Jamie, has told us. He was very knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. We inform ourselves and we make sure that we will get an individual treatment.

When the carnival tourist bus appeared, they were given the "young wines" and no store excursion. Jamie brought us to our little table. Samples of bread, cheese and olive oil were offered to everyone.

We compiled some wine and olive oil.

620250947.name: Not only wine - so non-alcohol drinkers are welcome for an excellent olive oil, chocolate and cheese experience
620250947.author: a TripAdvisor user
620250947.reviewBody: Visiting a bodega makes sense if you drink wine. We cannot drink any alcohol. But we had a wonderful time since Tours by Mariana took us here for olive oil, chocolate, and cheese tasting. Olive Oil was much cheaper than in California, and it was for us much more abundant in the taste. We bought some bottles to take it back to Europe. No need to hide behind the Italian, Greek, Maltese, Spanish olive oils... Chocolate was produced to pair for the wines. But who cares: it was a different flavor from that chocolate I could get in Belgium or Switzerland. Surprising was the cheese which was also very nice. Even you have the impression that you need to be qualified to see the bodega when you are drinking wine, you will be nicely surprised to see how much they had around the bodega.

603595491.name: Best wine tasting experience
603595491.author: a TripAdvisor user
603595491.reviewBody: This review is long overdue! And to be honest it was the best wine tasting experience we had while traveling to Valle de Guadalupe. Bodega Santo Tom\u00e1s was our first stop on the itinerary. \nSanto Tom\u00e1s is one of the oldest wineries of Mexico and since I tried their wine its my favorite! Try the Barbera with their chocolate! Be sure to make a reservation before arriving, this way your experience will be personal and private! When we arrived, Alfredo asked if we wanted the tasting in their private room, which we did. As we saw people arriving from a cruise ship gathering around the bar area we had a room all to ourselves and a personal explanation! Alfredo was the best, he knew the history of Santo Tom\u00e1s back to front, as well as information on how wine is made, etc... he made it interesting, funny and it was a fun experience! Their wines are the best and their treatment and tasting experience was by far the best! And we tried a lot of wineries... I truly recommend this place and the Barbera wine!

593897170.name: We found a good one!
593897170.author: a TripAdvisor user
593897170.reviewBody: This place is a great little gem tucked up in a hill. The staff is very knowledgeable and the wines were yummy. I am not a lover of ro\u015be but there blended ro\u015be with granche was delicious! They have a tasting room (which was a life saver, it was hot this weekend) and outside seating as well. Definitely worth putting on the list if you\u2019re out trying different wineries.

588407219.name: The Wine Tasting is a must
588407219.author: a TripAdvisor user
588407219.reviewBody: I like to experience wine offerings from all over the world. I am partial to our California Wines, but the Mexican vintage will grow into its own. Having sampled wines from different parts of the world, one gets to appreciate what a pleasant experience we all share when we can come together for a simple, chilled bottle of vino with bread.

588323670.name: A great place to visit
588323670.author: a TripAdvisor user
588323670.reviewBody: The tour was great. Had wine tasting also history of the place. The guy was awesome  and nice. Also had olive oil tasting with bread and cheese. Wonderful staff and prices are great not to expensive.

579966336.name: Concert night
579966336.author: a TripAdvisor user
579966336.reviewBody: I found that during this event, everything from the parking to the service inside was very well organized. They also provide shuttles to take you from your parking location to the concert both ways which was incredibly helpful. Once inside the waiters were at every other table making sure everyone\u2019s needs were met. The bathroom situation is pretty much the same as it is in all major events. Long lines for the women and no lines for men, but I am sure no one can\u2019t help that.\nWould definetly visit again for another event.

571378708.name: Unique Winery
571378708.author: a TripAdvisor user
571378708.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of a bus tour during our cruise. It wasn\u2019t very busy and the battery told us the history of the winery and explained the different types of wine and oils. The wines were inexpensive, but still very good. I asked to purchase an extra class since it was so good and they just gave me another for free with the tasting! Very nice people and great wine!

570224049.name: Wine with friends!
570224049.author: a TripAdvisor user
570224049.reviewBody: I always wine taste with good friend and today was good!   We were all on a weekend cruise and walked here from the ship after the shuttle dropped us in town. About 6 blocks and well worth the walk.  We ordered by the bottle and sat outside.  The young guy brought us meat and cheese players to go with our 3 bottles. We all decided the tempranillo was best out of the 3 we chose.  The young man behind the counter showed us the underground storage and told us stories of the past history of the place.  Very cool place!  The street is under construction but do let that stop you.  Just think how wonderful it will be when it is done.

564003051.name: Great hospitality
564003051.author: a TripAdvisor user
564003051.reviewBody: The vineyard was beautiful, the tasting room is nicely decorated, and their wine was great and inexpensive compared to CA wineries.

561615881.name: A must, at the wine country.
561615881.author: a TripAdvisor user
561615881.reviewBody: This is the oldest winery in the region,  it\'s a little hard to find but it totally worth it, make sure you follow the right direction on the signs and not the GPS .\nPrices are okay, wine is good and their chocolate is great.

560687790.name: Great wine, great staff, great value!
560687790.author: a TripAdvisor user
560687790.reviewBody: My friends and I had a fantastic visit from California! Delicious wine at great prices, beautiful views, and very friendly staff. In particular, Raul was extremely helpful (and gracious when I broke my glass after a few bottles!) and gave us some great recommendations. We ended up spending the whole day there! I can\'t recommend this place more highly.

555728097.name: Good wine beautiful place
555728097.author: a TripAdvisor user
555728097.reviewBody: This is a must \nThey have three locations make sure which one you want to visit there is a tasting room in downtown Ensenada, a tasting wine house in one of the vineyards in la ruta del Vino and a big place in the vineyard were is the wine cellar, in this one you can have a tour of  the vineyard and the wine cellar  but you must have to call in advance for reservation and all the information,if you don have a lot of time you can go to the wine Tasting house in the vineyard in la ruta del Vino it is a beautiful place and they have a nice room for the tasting they also have good olive oil try the olive oil tasting you\u2019ll be surprised  \nThese wines are very good quality I\u2019m sure you will find one for you and the place invite you to relax and enjoy

543460311.name: Quick stop by
543460311.author: a TripAdvisor user
543460311.reviewBody: Stopped here as part of Ensenada City Tour through cruise ship. Nice little cellar with wine tasting of 4 wines and several olive oils. Bartender informative and nice.  Not big wine drinkers but my 18 year old son was excited to try all of them. Bought several bottles of olive oil to take home. Glad we stopped by.

533576066.name: wine, wine, wine!
533576066.author: a TripAdvisor user
533576066.reviewBody: i had a great experience at Santo Tomas! Ive tried many wines, but the flavor & texture of these wines are great.

501066149.name: Visited both
501066149.author: a TripAdvisor user
501066149.reviewBody: We first went to the vineyard south of Ensenada, to see where it all started. The next day we found the bodega in town (Ensenada). This is where they brought the grapes to be processed in the 1930\'s. If you only have time for one, go to the bodega in Ensenada. They have little shops all connected. You can purchase foods for your wines, or across the street is the restaurant.

487558194.name: Delectable wine, friendly & passionate staff, warm ambience
487558194.author: a TripAdvisor user
487558194.reviewBody: We had a great afternoon here! A group of coworkers wanted to meet up after nearly a decade of not seeing each other; some of us flew up from Mexico City and some of us drove down from San Francisco. This was the perfect place for us to get together and catch up on our first full day together. The staff was amazing, generous, warm and passionate about sharing information about the history of the winery; also gave us GREAT tips on where to eat. We bought at least one or two cases of wine; it was amazing. Highly recommend you stop in for an afternoon of good wine and relaxing.

474815037.name: Good time, good wine!
474815037.author: a TripAdvisor user
474815037.reviewBody: Santa Tomas wine is among the best of Baja\'s, especially at a reasonable price.  The Bodegas\' tasting room is an inviting corner to head for a few hours of comfortable and relaxing sipping of whites, reds, port and desert wines.  Offering a surprisingly vast array of simple to complex vintages, the staff is knowledgeable, warm and welcoming.  While no food is currently served on site, next door one can pick up various nibbles such as a cheese tray, and bring it along to enjoy with the wine.  Tastings are offered starting at about $5 and the Bodega is conveniently located in the heart of Ensenada. The wines are also available by the bottle so be sure to take some with you!

449258229.name: Santo Tomas on Route 3 Valle de Guadalupe
449258229.author: a TripAdvisor user
449258229.reviewBody: We did NOT go to the location in the city of Ensenada - we went to their beautiful new winery on Route 3 in the Valle de Guadalupe. It had an excellent tasting room and beautiful views. It was sunset by the time we found it (we drove ourselves) and we were very lucky. As nice as wineries in CA and the hosts were very nice. We took home wine too.

447607336.name: Very Wine and Olive oil!!!!
447607336.author: a TripAdvisor user
447607336.reviewBody: This tour was booked as part of a tour from Carnival Cruise.  We took a Christmas Cruise and enjoyed this portion of our tour, we tasted 4 wines, a white, a rose, two reds and an olive oil. The guide was very knowledgeable. I recommend this if you have the opportunity to book a tour that includes Bodegas de Santo Tomas.  You can also book a shuttle to this winery as well.

447225610.name: Santo Tomas is a relaxing setting and has lovely wine
447225610.author: a TripAdvisor user
447225610.reviewBody: A vist to Valle de Guadalupe should include a stop at Santo Tomas winery. The tasting room is beautiful and the staff will serve you if you want to sit outside under the umbrellas. We stayed longer than expected because it was such a lovely setting and the wine was very tasty. I highly recommend the Cabernet Savignon to purchase.

441444740.name: Great Wine!
441444740.author: a TripAdvisor user
441444740.reviewBody: We were just in Ensenada, wanted to do some different this time.  We walked to this Winery from our cruise ship.   it was very nice, very friendly staff, bought a few bottles.  Recommend this to anyone going to Ensenada looking for something to do!

431263466.name: Good wine but expect a long wait!
431263466.author: a TripAdvisor user
431263466.reviewBody: Went to the Valle de Guadalupe over the weekend and was excited to check out Santo Tomas.  The tasting room is relatively small but very nice.  We arrived early enough where we thought, "perfect timing" we sat down and after about 10 minutes someone told us they\'d be right with us. 20 minutes later it\'s like we were non existent. I went back and asked the initial person who helped us and he said he\'d be right over. He came over with a tasting of their chardonnay which was really good.  After that one tasting it was about 30  minutes later that he came back and couldn\'t recall what he gave us.  Again, this place was not packed at all.  We then had another person come over and finally give us the rest our tasting.  The wine here is really good and if the experience was better I would have purchased a bottle but the tasting took so long along with trying to pay which took forever...I was just over it at that point and itching to get out.

422266277.name: Wow-Top Rate Wine Tasting Experience.
422266277.author: a TripAdvisor user
422266277.reviewBody: What exceptional wines. Walked out with 6 bottles of wine. The most wine we can get back across the boarder. Edwardo was superb! No reason to go anywhere else for wine tasting!

420887698.name: The sensory wine tasting is out of this world
420887698.author: a TripAdvisor user
420887698.reviewBody: We went on a great wine tasting experience with WHALES OF BAJA R. V. CARAVANS  that included whale watching and wine tasting, the sensory wine tasting was a new type of wine tasting we had never participated in before. R.V. caravaning and wine tasting a great combo.

365482148.name: The buying experience could be much better
365482148.author: a TripAdvisor user
365482148.reviewBody: I took my wife to get a some wines from Bodegas de Santo Tomas. I was expecting to find someone  that could advise us, gives some information on the wines, and explain the characteristics of the wines. Unfortunately, this place reminded me of a liquor store, with two workers checking out people and using the computer.

343615456.name: Impressive
343615456.author: a TripAdvisor user
343615456.reviewBody: Easy location in Ensenada, if you don\'t have the time to explore the Guadalupe Valley or the vineyard south of Maneandero. \nImmaculate wine tasting room that was once the office of one of the Mexican Presidents in 1930. Still has the original floors and a huge vault of the time period.\nAnd the wines! Rich and full of heart. Don\'t miss trying the Berbera. It is known as the "Teacher of the grapes" Spend all afternoon, it is like a mini class on understanding the wonders of wine making.

342434132.name: With A Little Work Could Be So Much Better
342434132.author: a TripAdvisor user
342434132.reviewBody:
This is the oldest winery in the Baja with some wonderful history.  My husband speaks Spanish, so we were able to read the signage that was only in Spanish.  We also asked a number of questions about the history before a large group came in from the cruise ship.  

They had 4 wines to taste - 3 of them sweeter.  Even after I explained that I like drier wines.  There was zero flexibility in what they were willing to provide in the tasting.  And the person pouring the wines didn't really provide any information on the wine, where the vineyards are, how long the grapes were cellered, unless we specifically asked.  What she did do is tell me what I was going to taste - pineapple, spice, etc.  Hello.  The point of wine tasting is to permit me to determine what I'm tasting, not putting ideas in my head.  If you tell me I'm going to taste pineapple, then yes, my brain says "pineapple."

There is a nice big area, but only one table.  I would add some hi-boy tables so people at least have a place to set down their glass.  

A large group came in from the cruise ship while we were there.  The person leading the tasting could so improve the experience.  Provide some history. Provide instruction on what people should be looking for in color, aroma, etc.  But don't tell them what they are tasting.  Ask them what flavors they are tasting?  Make the experience interactive.

According to the staff they are going to have a tour soon which displays some old equipment, demonstrates some of the wine making process.  Once that is operating, I"m sure the experience will be more worthwhile.  

The area across the street there is a wonderful pizza shop, cheese shop, some tables where you can sit and have wine from the Santo Tomas bodega.  There are also an organize food shop and organic vegetable produce market.  Both worth checking out.

Avoid on days cruise ships are in port.  If you want to have any attention from the staff.

336823460.name: New Year\'s
336823460.author: a TripAdvisor user
336823460.reviewBody: Great environment full of fun..... the new Napa Valley n closer to home... lots of wine selection plus great food to go along with the wines.

333055288.name: Beyond Wine
333055288.author: a TripAdvisor user
333055288.reviewBody: I\'ve read about Santo Tomas being the oldest vineyard/winery in Valle de Guadalupe, Mexico so I was interested in checking out this place to see if I\'d find a couple of bottles of wine not readily available in Milwaukee and I could share with my dinner club. None of the reds available for testing interested me so I decided to focus my attention  other items in this bodega: olive oils, canned tuna belly, and chocolates.I was pleasantly surprised to find other items in this bodega: canned tuna belly, chocolates and olive oils. I tasted 6 different olive oils and bought 3 bottles  and several cans of tuna to give to fellow foodies back home. My foodie friends raved about the olive oil and the canned tuna that was packed in quality olive oil. On our second trip to Valle de Guadalupe\'s wine route Thanksgiving weekend,  we made a point of stopping here to get more olive oils and canned tuna and added dark chocolates to our loot. Given the quality of olive oils and the canned tuna, the prices were amazingly reasonable\u2026about $4.00 for 500 Ml at an exchange rate of 15 pesos to a dollar.

300896999.name: Very Nice Winery
300896999.author: a TripAdvisor user
300896999.reviewBody: Don\'t stop here if your a cheapo! This is a good historic winery and it will cost you a few bucks for a great memorable experience.  Have some wine, have some cheese and crackers... When you got your wine legs going take a walk among the vines.  Enjoy!!\ud83d\ude1c

297030917.name: Oldest Winery in North America
297030917.author: a TripAdvisor user
297030917.reviewBody: This is the Napa valley of Northern Baja California. If you enjoy wines and will be traveling through you will have over 150 winery\'s to choose from. There are such great views of the vines and surrounding mountains. This place was founded by Spanish Monks back in 1888. Now its one of the best wines in the area. They have three locations to choose from and each one is different vibe. Enjoy

288718788.name: A great half day trip south of Ensenada
288718788.author: a TripAdvisor user
288718788.reviewBody: We stayed in the area south of Ensenada to hike, beach and generally explore. We decided to go to this winery one morning You have to reserve a guided tour which we did not but they have a small area where you can self guide and taste their different varietals right off the vine. It was pretty cool. You can do walk in tastings.

287667654.name: Oldest  Winnery in California
287667654.author: a TripAdvisor user
287667654.reviewBody: First, if the young girls are pouring, AVOID! Not very knowledgeable and certainly not friendly to seniors.  However the Temprarillo is the best, just the best which I always try to order in resturants when in Mexico, high quality consistent,  Cab and Babera also excellent wines, here you chance to sample without investing,  listen to daCoach! available in Grocery Stores, hint hint

285303153.name: Wine tasting in Downtown Ensenada
285303153.author: a TripAdvisor user
285303153.reviewBody: We popped in Santo Tomas\' wine store for a tasting.  It\'s not on a vineyard, and they no longer make wine at this location, but the store/tasting room is new and well appointed.  We paid $16 for 8 pours (4 white, 3 red, and 1 port).  We found the wines easy to drink and well priced.  The gal pouring for us was knowledgeable and friendly.  Nice experience all around.

262011108.name: Wonderful Wine and Olive Oil ...
262011108.author: a TripAdvisor user
262011108.reviewBody:
I have to admit that I am not a wine drinker so my review of the wine is based on my husbands response to the tasting.  The tasting room itself was beautiful and contemporary.  The neighborhood leaves a lot to be desired but once inside you will be transported to the wonderful world of wine.  We sampled two white and two reds.  My husband who usually drinks only red Italian wine, said the wines were very good.  He especially like the white, which he normally doesn't care for.

I on the other hand is a fan of the olive oil … what a huge surprise and wonderful treat.  They have an oil that has won two gold medals in Milan, Italy.  We sampled six different oils.  mmm mmm good …

The staff was friendly and informative.  The room clean, cool and modern.  They were not pushy about buying their products, but they were passionate about the products.  We left with wine and olive oil for both ourselves and gifts.

This is a must STOP and sample destination.

257468810.name: Fun place to visit
257468810.author: a TripAdvisor user
257468810.reviewBody: Santo Tomas was a tour we took, the young lady that told us about the winery and types of wines made. The building itself was beautiful.  We only tasted four wines but that was enough. We also got to taste some oils they made with bread and cheese.

255258732.name: Great wines...great atmosphere!
255258732.author: a TripAdvisor user
255258732.reviewBody: We stopped and tried some of their wines and stayed and had a bite to eat outside.\nGreat winery...they had a vendor on site cooking fresh calamari that was really good !\nGreat location...close to Ensenada

252687436.name: The Best wine tour !
252687436.author: a TripAdvisor user
252687436.reviewBody: A GREAT TOUR GIDE TRACY. \u00c1 REAL PLEASURE !\nWe\'ve been on sunday 1/2 / 2015 at the Bodega SANTO TOM\u00c1S . it was a great experience , i live on the Canarian islands and had  quiet a few wine catas , BUT this has been the Best until now !\nThe wine is okay , but it was the explendid tourgide ( Tracy ) who made this experience fabulos !

252313130.name: Fun excursion
252313130.author: a TripAdvisor user
252313130.reviewBody: We bought a last-minute excursion from our cruise ship that was titled "Blow Hole and Wine Tasting". This portion of the tour was quick. The building itself was beautiful and full of history, but small. We only tasted 4 wines, which was a little disappointing. The wines were delicious, but it was a pricey tour from the ship. I don\'t know if there is a cost if you just wanted to wander in.

241325278.name: Great Tour Guide
241325278.author: a TripAdvisor user
241325278.reviewBody: A friend and I just went on a 3 day cruise to Ensenada.  We didn\'t want to do any planned shore excursions and decided that we would just walk around and figure out what we wanted to do once we got there.  We ended up walking to the Bodegas de Santo Tomas and we were pleasantly surprised.  The wine tasting was only $19.00 for 5 wines ($49.00 on the ship but included transportation).  David was a fantastic host and we tried some truly unique wines.  Was a great way to spend our day.

230714214.name: Santo Tomas Winery offers a pleasant tasting opportunity
230714214.author: a TripAdvisor user
230714214.reviewBody:
Santo Tomas Winery, in the Santo Tomas Valley, 25 miles south of central Ensenada, offers a beautiful environment and a pleasant tasting room. 

The tasting run $19.00 USD for five large tastings or you can buy individual bottles and drink on site.  You can sit outside on tables or inside near the many racks of wine.

For about $8.00 USD, you can get a prosciutto, cheese and cracker plate.  We did this and it was exceptional.

Santo Tomas is actually closer than Guadalupe Valley, and the road south now has a variety of new plantings and other tasting rooms.

This is an easy 3 hour excursion, you get to see some beautiful Baja countryside and see a side of Baja many will never experience. 

If you want to add 3 more hours, take the road immediately across the highway from Santo Tomas to La Bocana, the river mouth on the coast.  Pastoral, green and beautiful, the road ends at a fishing village.  You can take a side road at the coast for about 3 miles and see the location of the colony made famous in the book "God and Mr Gomez".  All fun!

225552407.name: Tasting room where you cant taste a thing
225552407.author: a TripAdvisor user
225552407.reviewBody: I went there because it was a nice place. Actually the place is very nice and apealing if you like the modern type of look. \n\nEverything eas great till i asked for a wine tasting, none where avaliable.... So... Very nice tasting bar without wine to taste. Didnt work out for me.

218375412.name: Too fancy for me
218375412.author: a TripAdvisor user
218375412.reviewBody:
Once you get to the tasting room you walked up the ramp through HUGE double doors into a gorgeous room.  The place is really nice and modern with bottles of wine stocked from ceiling (high ceiling) to floor.  The glass casing which showcases the boxes of fine chocolates they sell is also where you do the tastings with a guide.  

I've been here twice and wasn't able to do the tasting the first time because apparently they only do it on the hour, so if you miss it you'll have to wait for the next one. This time, we came with local friends (who also owns a B&B down the road) and were able to get in on the tastings. The 3 wine plus chocolate tasting is $10 ($100 pesos) per person. My bf and I shared one tasting because i was still full from breakfast. Wine and chocolate pairing sure is like heaven in your mouth!

After the tasting, we sat in the outdoor patio over looking the winery and were treated by our friends to more wine (Mision 1888), which is our favorite wine and actually the cheapest one! You can buy them at the local liquor stores around Baja for cheap! We always get a bottle or two before heading back to the states.

The experience here was very nice but i only give it only 3 stars because it's too pricey for my liking and i dont like that you can only doing the tasting on the hour.

211775787.name: Compared to other vineyards, poor ...
211775787.author: a TripAdvisor user
211775787.reviewBody:
We found the staff to be nice enough, but rather opinionated - given their youth, it seems they could not possibly pronounce with such authority on the wines ... the details of which one girl spouted forth on, and I could not have possibly disagreed more on! But, tasting, at the end of the day, is very subjective. But after 30 years of doing this kind of thing pretty frequently, not boasting, but all over the planet, I thought everything we tasted was really terribly mediocre.
 
We did have excellent, superb wines elsewhere (Monte Xanic, L.A.Cetto - though the Mondavi of V de G, some great wines, Encuentro, Quinta Monasterio - brilliant ! and my favourtie, Carrodilla) - infact EVERYWHERE else in the Valle de Guadalupe - went to 21 wineries in total, all fantastic. 
I did like the Santo Tomas port though. Just not anything else.

202717152.name: Tasting Room in Ensenada
202717152.author: a TripAdvisor user
202717152.reviewBody: We booked this as an excursion on our cruise. What we didn\'t know was that the visit is to the tasting room and not to the winery. This is not the wineries fault though.  We were taken around a room in a warehouse that looks like it may be used for displays. Not much was labelled and a lot more could be done with this space. There were some old farming implements there a bit of info would have gone a long way.\n\nWe were then taken to the tasting room, this looked a lot more professional and the wines weren\'t too bad. More seats would be a good idea. Not many people bought wines a few bought chocolate.

201217071.name: Wonderful!
201217071.author: a TripAdvisor user
201217071.reviewBody: The very best Tinto (port wine) I\'ve tasted since travelling in Australia.  They also make a wonderful chocolate for wine pairing.  An enjoyable experience in Ensenada, Mexico.

194578011.name: Lovely place but not particularly customer-friendly
194578011.author: a TripAdvisor user
194578011.reviewBody: We visited the actual winery in Santo Thomas on our way back to San Diego from mid-Baja because it is easy to get there, is well-appointed and love tasting in different wine regions. The access road is lovely, punctuated with really lovely signs that pique your interest and tell the story of this venerable operation. The tasting room was open and lovely but since we were not in a group, the only person in the tasting room spoke no English (the winery specifically mentions that there is English spoken here) and couldn\'t help us at all. We have some rudimentary Spanish but he had no interest in trying to help us and called someone up from the winery. Unsure of what to do next, we drove around the winery, which is a wonderful round building that sits up on a hill from which the vinyards fan out around. Being persistant, we returned and found an English-speaking person who informed us that they had 5 wines open to taste for $20. We split a tasting (too expensive for two in our opinion) and asked about available food. After some prodding, our server brought us some delicious rosemary cheese with Ritz crackers and we enjoyed the one reserve wine that she poured last. We purchased a couple of bottles of wine and the tasting plus wine and food came to more than $60 - rather pricey we thought, and without the customer service we ususally experience at wineries. During the course of our tasting, the server told us all about the wonderful tours for which one must reserve. Too bad - we would have enjoyed that and felt all the worse about the winery for knowing there was something we weren\'t able to experience. Meh.

190973969.name: Winery?
190973969.author: a TripAdvisor user
190973969.reviewBody: Bodega de Santa Tomas, Ensenada Mexico \n\nSome enjoy wine, others don\'t.  Short, sweet and simple- some folks need to enjoy their tastings, others are content to throw a shot across their tongue and call it done.  Our tour group arrived and stepping off the bus noted the winery had a location on the opposite side of the street as well this side, ours was the showroom entry. The showroom had a previous life as a bank and its old vault was obvious as wine shelves framed its door.  Over the counter just inside the front door hung a large menu of wines and their associated prices. The entire room was dark possibly from the black paint used to adorn the walls.  Granted, bottled wines do not relish the companionship of direct sun and even less, the associated heat.  However, the room was cool making it wine friendly.  Being an oenophile but not a connoisseur this was to be my introduction to this wine making region. Too bad their taste offerings were not those of other vintners.  Beginning with the vessel in which the tasting was being offered this showroom apparently came down on the side of the tour participant describe in the opening remarks as those who don\'t enjoy wines.  The red and white offerings were rendered in small, non-transparent cups thus offering little bouquet to enjoy.  There was plenty of the counter wines to go around but their best was only released at the insistence of several of the more knowledgeable tour participants.  This wine tasting tour did not rise to this traveler\'s expectations.   Conversely, it did provide some interesting photographic opportunities of a large vat, waiting wine bottles and other scenes

190868255.name: Rude and confusing
190868255.author: a TripAdvisor user
190868255.reviewBody: We got tired of walking around the souvenir shops and went inland a few blocks to the BST in-town winery.  We were told a tour was $5.  But as we prepared to pay for the tour, a tour bus rolled in.  We were shooed away, told we could not join in on the bus\' tour, and told to come back at 1pm.  But when we were leaving we noticed a sign out front saying the place was closed from noon-2pm.  We went back in to inquire not wanting to come back at 1pm to find the place closed, and a very rude fellow told us to come back at 2pm and that the tour would be $20 per person.  Needless to say, we did not come back at 2pm.

186082001.name: The oldest winery in Mexico
186082001.author: a TripAdvisor user
186082001.reviewBody: We\'ve been visiting the winery for many years and never tire of it. The wines are consistantly good, and the artifacts are amazing. I love the paintings of the Friars and the altar boys- full of fun and mischief. a must see in Ensenada

166929056.name: What an amazing tour!
166929056.author: a TripAdvisor user
166929056.reviewBody:
I was reading some of the reviews here and was extremely disappointed by the comments.  I'm guessing that these people went to the tasting room in Ensenada as opposed to going to the actual winery in Santo Tomas.  My husband and I recently took a tour of the actual winery in Santo Tomas and let me tell you I was completely blown away!!!  

We went with my parents and a family friend on a private tour of the winery which wasn't insanely expensive ($78.00 per person).  The tour was 3 hours long and took you out into the vineyard to do the tastings.  Fernanda, our tour guide, was extremely knowledgeable and you could sense her passion for the winery.  It is an extremely educational tour and spoke to the history of the vineyard, the 22 varietals grown there, their wine making process and the different vintners that have overseen this amazing place.  The whole tour is very well thought out and even appeals to those who are not wine enthusiasts (both my mom and husband are not wine drinkers, but THOROUGHLY enjoyed the tour.)

If you get the chance can want to travel a little farther south of Ensenada (approx. 45 minutes), it would be WELL worth your time.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

161218761.name: Not worth the money
161218761.author: a TripAdvisor user
161218761.reviewBody: I have visited many wineries in Valle de Guadalupe and feel Santo Tomas is not worth the $20 wine tasting. That includes a tour, which we didn\'t do because it was reserved for 40 people. Nobody showed up. Customer service was okay (we were the only people there) and wine is mediocre.  I can\'t believe they charge $20 for 5 wine tastings. I\'m not cheap,  but it is not worth it. The only pro is the view. I suggest you go for the view and skip the wine tasting.  There are many wineries in Valle de Guadeloupe with better wine at a reasonable price. My favorites are  Baron Balche and LA Chetto. I will never go back.

159274662.name: Waste of Money and Time on Experience
159274662.author: a TripAdvisor user
159274662.reviewBody: We got there at 11AM ish and made a reservation for the 12-noon Tour. We paid the $200 pesos per person ($16.48) and watched the groundhogs run from rock to rock while we waited. We ended up being the only ones to show. We were also told the tour was an hour long. We thought we were taking a tour of the entire winery, not just one building. We also spent 10 minutes watching a video with pictures and music. We were done in 30 minutes of the tour and the wine tasting was sort of interesting but were only able to try 5 different wines and a very small amount of each, certainly not $33 worth. There was no cheese, chocolate, crackers or whatever everyone else is mentioning and maybe it was because we were the only ones being toured, but when we were done, I thought we just gave them free money. We ended up buying their Olive Oil though since that was good. Never again though...

157158645.name: Learn something new
157158645.author: a TripAdvisor user
157158645.reviewBody: decent wine from the baja area of mexico, well i had never even heard of it. well worth a visit even if your not bothered about the wine (which you should be) the crackers and chocolate make it interesting. some fine choices of wine and decent quality, well worth the visit.

153479685.name: Nice experience, but the chocolate was the best part
153479685.author: a TripAdvisor user
153479685.reviewBody:
We went to several wineries in Ensenada area, there are LOTS.  This was on our list, so we dropped by (no one was there but us).

The man walked out (after a bit) and advised it would be $ US 40 ($ 20 per person) for the tour, which included samples of 5 wines, olive oil and chocolate.

The tour was good, it was one of the best we saw all day.  Very informative.

However when we went to taste the wines, the ones they gave us were not to our taste.  Not a fan of the red wines, or any of the wines they provided.  Disclaimer, we are not wine experts, just like to taste and drink it.  As we progressed he observed we didnt care for the tastes, so by the time we got to the 4th and 5th taste, we were pouring it out.

Trying to salvage the time there, we asked to move on to the oil.  He pointed to the cups and oil, and left to do something else.  (I have always got bread or crackers, not straight oil), so for me, this was a not good taste.  I asked him if we could try a taste of chocolate (after the oil and wine, we needed a palette cleansing), he said they did not have any to provide. (lots of boxes sitting here), he then suggested if we got some wine he could provide a taste. Well, we bought a box from him just to get the tastes out.  The Chocolate was pretty good - type was matched to Chardonnay - a white chocolate/nut mix. So, basically US $ 49 later (tour plus chocolate) we left with a bad taste, good tour and ready to give up on the rest of the day.  It was better at other places.  I think our driver was embarrassed by the experience as well.

Since this review is of Santo Tomas - The area is very nice, the tour is good, and the tasting room very elegant.

Thats really all we can share.

142724447.name: Nice experience
142724447.author: a TripAdvisor user
142724447.reviewBody: Before my visit there, I didn\'t know that Baja California produce very good wines, I was pleasantly surprised with their quality and taste.

141693034.name: Good Mexican Wine
141693034.author: a TripAdvisor user
141693034.reviewBody: This is the second oldest winery in the americas, They have many labels from very affordable to very expensive, all very good.

138691553.name: Rich in wine tasting luxury
138691553.author: a TripAdvisor user
138691553.reviewBody: Everything about this wine tasting venue speaks good taste.  The Bodega welcoming salon is rich in style and appropiate for a high end wine tasting room.  The tour of the old Bodegas is educational and rich in history.  A luxurious treat in the middle of downtown Ensenda.

137097720.name: wine route
137097720.author: a TripAdvisor user
137097720.reviewBody: ask for a tour to the wine route and taste some of the good wines they  have in Baja, I recomend to visit no more than three wineyards a day because you will teaste at least three different\nwines in each place.   and  beleve me its very good.

135982104.name: One of the best winerys in the region.
135982104.author: a TripAdvisor user
135982104.reviewBody: If you are in Baja is a MUST take the tour for the winerys and in Dowtonw you can find Bodegas de Santo Tomas... there is a pretty good restaurant with excellent food, it smell delicious because there is wood bareels of wine, the wine is really good and they have tours and explanations of the process.

135641182.name: World famous Winery
135641182.author: a TripAdvisor user
135641182.reviewBody: If you are a foodie and want to know where your wine comes from this is the tour for you. Their wines are demanded in wine countries so it is good.

134485485.name: A wall of wine to satisfy all cravings
134485485.author: a TripAdvisor user
134485485.reviewBody:
Our group traveled to Santo Tomas at the end of a full day and we were prepared to run in and out, maybe after a quick sampling of a wine known to a couple people in our group. We stayed for almost two hours, enjoying the great afternoon sun, an amazing breeze that cooled us off even on a 90 degree day, and panoramic views of the valley. 

We got lucky in that the bodega normally closes at 5 and having arrived about 4:30, we were able to also sample and purchase food products from a pair of local women who had set up a small stand just outside the entrance to the main building. The women offered homemade empanadas with mango, strawberry and apple fillings (all delicious) and a wide array of sauces and spreads, including mango lime, mango chipotle, chimichurri...and really good olives. I don't know how often they are there, but if you see them, try everything. The quality off the product is excellent and the flavors proved to be very pleasant surprises. 

In terms of wine tasting, I was able to sample about five wines, all quite good, though my favorite was a cab sav, followed by a Syrah. The winery produces grapes in three different valleys and the variety of wines is unusual for the area, I think they mentioned 35 varieties. Since they only export by mail order, you won't find these wines at your local Costco - at least not yet. We went to several other wineries, but the selection was largest at Santo Tomas and the wines were really quite tasty. 

Of course, sipping it on the terrace of the the bodega under a comforting shade, our eyes filled with nothing but sun-drenched hills, vineyards and olive groves dancing in the light wind, it would have taken some dedication to a gripe to be able to complain at all. 

The most challenging part of the experience is driving down to Ensenada (about 90 min from TIjuana), a relatively easy experience except for the Tijuana part. I recommend a Mexico GPS program of some sort, pointed towards Ensenada. Shortly after the final toll booth, look for HWY 3 and head east...from there it may get tougher but locals are quite friendly and eager to see tourists return; don't be afraid to ask for help - or too surprised if it is wrong...

133781310.name: a famous winery
133781310.author: a TripAdvisor user
133781310.reviewBody: Santo Tomas is international famouse for excellant wines and for a resturante that serves outstanding foods prepared by an engienous chef

132251058.name: Wine Tour
132251058.author: a TripAdvisor user
132251058.reviewBody: Beautiful tasting room and patio. Helpful staff. I showed up the day after a large party so I got to taste some of the reserve wines.

131991156.name: Relaxing, nice view
131991156.author: a TripAdvisor user
131991156.reviewBody: On a recent trip to Ensenada we stopped by this winery and had a white wine tasting. Some interesting things are happening in the Baja California wine industry and we were eager to sample the wine from one of the biggest and oldest wineries in the area. The wine was tasty and fresh as we sat on the patio and enjoyed the view. It doesn\'t get much more relaxing that this place. The only drawback is that they don\'t provide bread or cheese (or other things to munch on) with the wine like some wineries do. The chocolate we purchased to have with the wine was quite pricey. Overall, a good value and a great location.

131291036.name: Not very helpful
131291036.author: a TripAdvisor user
131291036.reviewBody: I stopped by with my boyfriend to check out some of the local wines. Because I am not familiar with wines from this region, I asked for a sampling. We were told we had to pay for set wine tasting for $13.50. I was not interested in trying 5 different wines, just one type in particular. To no avail the sales staff did not budge. Needless to say we purchased a bottle of their Syrah (typically one of my favorite varieties). \nI was a bit disappointed and needless to say the bottle that we purchased was ok.

129878430.name: Go Solo
129878430.author: a TripAdvisor user
129878430.reviewBody:
On the Carnival Inspiration stop in Encinada my son and I decided to skip the organized excursions and do our own tour.  We took a taxi ($4) from the shuttle to this oldest winery in the area.  The vineyards are now 15 miles away but the original buildings are still here.  

This winery has 27 vintages and some have won double gold medals.  They also make olive oils.  We opted for the traditional wine tasting and tour for $13 per person.  We saw the old warehouse with huge wooden barrels used to age the wine and where the bottles used to be corked by hand.  The guide, Jamie, took just the two of us here and volunteered to take pictures of us with our cameras.   He was very knowledgeable and spoke excellent English.  He asked if we would be willing to wait a few minutes for the scheduled tour to arrive for the tasting and assured us we would get individual treatment.

When the Carnival tour bus showed up, they got the "young wines" and no warehouse tour.  We got both the young and the traditional wines which Jamie brought to us at our little table (one of maybe three.)  Samples of bread, cheese and olive oil were offered to all as well.

We bought some wine and olive oil and Jamie got us a taxi driver who took us all the way back to the ship to drop off the bottles for only $3.

129312900.name: Santo Tomas: Great Wine Tasting!
129312900.author: a TripAdvisor user
129312900.reviewBody: My wife and I visited the Santo Tomas Bodega in the heart of Ensenada and took the museum & wine tasting tour.  The staff there is very nice. Because we went on a Tuesday, there were no crowds; in fact, it was just another couple and us. So we got a very personal service.\n\nThe museum is contained in a large warehouse and that part of the visit took just about 15 min\'s. You can take pictures of some interesting and old wine making equipment. We then moved on to the wine tasting itself. Our guide let us taste two whites, two reds and a port. Make sure you select the "old vines" tasting - that way you get to taste the best wines they have. He was extremely knowledgeable and we learned a lot about these excellent Mexican wines. It is amazing how much Mexican wines have improved in the past 30 years. I lived in Guadalajara 1982-84 and in those days Mexican wines were mainly of table wine quality. The wines today that are produced by e.g. Santo Tomas are really as good as anything you can find in top wine quality countries around the world. We also got to taste the olive oil they produce. We highly recommend a visit to this bodega and to taste their excellent wines!

127838195.name: Great Wines Enthusiastic Staff
127838195.author: a TripAdvisor user
127838195.reviewBody:
Beautiful views from patio and a marvelous tasting area. 

Very helpful well informed multi-lingual staff.  I ended up with several lovely bottles of wine in hand -  whites and reds -  including a delicious red from some of the oldest vines in Latin America. Chocolate, the worlds best olive oil on sale as well.

Loved the visit...well worth the short wine-country drive from Ensenada!

127083850.name: Good job of handling a crowd.
127083850.author: a TripAdvisor user
127083850.reviewBody: We went with a cruise tour and they did a good job of getting us in and out. However, their premium wines received nothing more than a general nod in the direction of the wall where they were shelved. I like good wine; an opportunity to taste them would have led to an opportunity to buy them.

125149695.name: Outstanding employees at a beautiful winery
125149695.author: a TripAdvisor user
125149695.reviewBody:
My girlfriend and I visited Santo Tomas between Christmas and New Years. The winery is in a beautiful location. The view from the top of the hill on which it sits is amazing. The tasting area has an incredible decor. The food and drink were outstanding. We thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff at Santo Tomas made the beauty of the location all the better.

We accidentally locked our keys in our rental car. All phone numbers for service under our Mexican insurance were locked in the car as well. Santo Tomas employee Jarret went above and beyond and found someone to come out from Ensenada to unlock the car for us. 

Thank you, Jarret and Santo Tomas for a truly exceptional evening. We can't wait to come back!

124276355.name: Food and Jazz
124276355.author: a TripAdvisor user
124276355.reviewBody: What can be more fun great food and music in an old winery barrel room

121890191.name: grapes and olives
121890191.author: a TripAdvisor user
121890191.reviewBody: their olive oil is amazing.  one top honors in italy. great staff and easy to get there

121163962.name: Two big wine warehouses
121163962.author: a TripAdvisor user
121163962.reviewBody: Street market on 7th every Saturday.  Charlies has excellent hamburgers and Covellis, great pizza.  The wine warehouses are very well stocked.  The wine festival every September is worth visiting.  Street is closed and excellent bands on a large stage.  Wine by the glass.  Fun.

118083761.name: Great place to learn and enjoy wine more
118083761.author: a TripAdvisor user
118083761.reviewBody: Visited this place and have relatives that live in Ensenada: it is safe. One of them drove us to the winery. Tijuana which is 2 hours away from Ensenada, not so much but safe to go through to. Take a bus to Ensenada, that will make you feel safer than driving your own car, even when that is also a good option. \nStaff is friendly, warm and even showed us some videos of the vineyards and story of the winery house. Was indeed worth the visit and encourage you to visit it as well.

116783939.name: Must visit for the wine buff
116783939.author: a TripAdvisor user
116783939.reviewBody: Historical part of Ensenada and the Baja wine scene.\nGood selection of wines in all price ranges, quick tour of facitiles and art expo(ceramics and oil paintings).\nWine tastings

110014028.name: The Wine Tour 2009
110014028.author: a TripAdvisor user
110014028.reviewBody: We enjoyed this tour as part of the blowhole/wine tour offered on the Carnival Cruise ship Paradise. Although, we probably won\'t visit the blowhole again (once was enough), we will definitely buy more wine from Santo Tomas. Just finished our last bottle from 2009. We\'re taking a cruise just to buy more wine ;D

55022103.name: Not an especially interesting tour, but the Santo Tomas wines are good
55022103.author: a TripAdvisor user
55022103.reviewBody: As far as winery tours go, it\'s not particularly interesting, because, obviously, you\'re not touring the winery (which is located 44km south of Ensenada), so you\'re mostly looking at some antique wine-making equipment and oil paintings that were done in the 1970s.  On the plus side, you do get to taste several of the wines at the end (many of which are very good), and buy some if you want to.  On the other hand, you could just go to Covelli across the street, share a wonderful salad or wood-fired artisan pizza and order several glasses of Santo Tomas (and other local wines), enjoy your custom-made wine-tasting in a lovely environment, and then go across the street and buy whatever bottles you like. Just a thought.   If you have the chance, you really should drive out to Guadalupe Valley or Santo Tomas valley and see/experience the wineries - they are beautiful.

17580990.name: Walking tour of winery
17580990.author: a TripAdvisor user
17580990.reviewBody:
Very nice winery in downtown Ensenada.  This winery location is not really functional, although they store some stock in the cellar.

The tour guide was friendly and a family member.  The tasting afterwards was excellent.  They didn't put one or two bottles out, they had six (3 white and 3 red).

Prices were a little high, but it is high quality wine and worth the price (in my opinion).  They do take credit cards, that was a plus...

They offered bread and cheese to go with the wine, to help clear the palate between tastes.

Well worth going on, especially if you can make this a companion to the La Bufadora tour (which we did) as a Carnival Cruise passenger.

4312621.name: Wine tasting at Santo Tomas and in the Valle de Guadelupe
4312621.author: a TripAdvisor user
4312621.reviewBody: Wine tasting should entail a visit to wineries set out in the producing areas, by the common wisdom. So tasting in town seems to go against the grain. But in the case of Santo Tomas, make an exception. They are probably the best producers in the Valle de Guadalupe, and their in-town tasting room is convenient. They now charge a bit more than those in the Valle, but their quality is much higher and finer. Just next door is La Esquina de Bodegas Restaurante, excellent for lunch or dinner, set in part of the old winery production center, with an adjoining art gallery of local work. Charming. But be sure to visit the Valle itself, perhaps try one of the other wineries, visit the tiny museum that documents the Russians who settled the area and started the wine-making process in the late 1800s, stop on the way out or back on the only route (Route 3) about 20 miles from Ensenada at Restaurante Los Naranjas for a delightful lunch in a bucolic garden setting.\n

1557145.name: Wine tasteing
1557145.author: a TripAdvisor user
1557145.reviewBody: I have done the tour a couple of times ,it used to be 2 dollars ,The tour takes about 20 minutes and then some wine tasteing , I have read that the price is 5 dollars now, they have discount coupons around town 50 cents off.

659536282.name: Incredible view
659536282.author: a TripAdvisor user
659536282.reviewBody: Nice and dangerous drive to the vineyard, the property host lots, hotel, wine tasting, very impresive party area that would make a spectacular wedding event, have to take property transportation to go up to the bar and viewing area, incredible views with good eats, just remember drive back is dangerous., Don\u00b4t enjoy the drinks to much or better yet take a designated driver.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

648398873.name: The best view in Ensenada
648398873.author: a TripAdvisor user
648398873.reviewBody: Great place to see sunset! Place is relax-mexican style, quite friendly environment. Service very good. Bring a jacquet for fresh afteenoon. Shouldn\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

609405454.name: Best getaway ever!
609405454.author: a TripAdvisor user
609405454.reviewBody:
We left San Diego in the morning with no expectations on a Tuesday. 
Came back with a smile in our faces the size of Cuatro Cuatros project! Huge!!! 
Top notch project with incredible taste! 
the views, the people, the wine all wonderful! 
Congratulations! 
We will be back!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

587889986.name: Fabulous Project
587889986.author: a TripAdvisor user
587889986.reviewBody: This great project overlooking the vineyards and blue Pacific ocean is a must visit to all who enjoy a luxurious planned community bound to be the most exclusive residence on the Ensenada  Baja coastline! With a huge array of vineyards and fabulous views this is a MUST VISIT....

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

527432696.name: Great dining and view
527432696.author: a TripAdvisor user
527432696.reviewBody:
Tasty sangria
Mushroom Ceviche 
Fish ceviche
Mini burger 
Brie cheese with chistorra
Very windy.
You'll be ask to pay an entrance fee of Mpesos $100.00

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

510583658.name: Restaurant complaint
510583658.author: a TripAdvisor user
510583658.reviewBody: The winery itself is very nice,so are the waynes,the view up in the mountain at the bura`s bar,its so beautiful,but at the restaurant they keep on doing something very wrong,they do not give the tourist guides operator,any food not even a burrito wish is the minimum they can do for somebody who bring bussines to the place,the restaurant prices are high and if you bring a party of 5 , 6 , 7, or even 10 customer the less you (cuatro cuatros manager) is to give a least a burrito to the tourist service provider, I`ve been taking customer to your place I thing I deserve a least a taco.or I will take my bussines somewhere else. Jesus Guillermo Vidal Tourist guide.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

506829616.name: View  WOW!!!
506829616.author: a TripAdvisor user
506829616.reviewBody: As soon as you get there your are enchanted by the view of the Pacific Ocean!!!! the wine and food was excellent. we tried the "jurel" Ceviche!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

491516429.name: Disappointed!
491516429.author: a TripAdvisor user
491516429.reviewBody: They need to do a better job of informing customers they will be close for private event got all the way up there to find a small little sign saying closed and the guy at the gate was very rude.  Would\'ve been nice if they had posted it on their website and or made a Big sign. Had a wait for about 10 minutes to find out we couldn\'t even get in with so many  cars trying to come in and one man at the front of the locked gate

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

474296109.name: You just can\'t miss this sunset
474296109.author: a TripAdvisor user
474296109.reviewBody: We were there for the sunset. We had the wine tasting and some snacks, all was very good and the service was excellent. The place is basically an open terrace with tables.\nBut the view! It is breathtaking!\n If at all possible make a reservation and do not miss this place

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

449297093.name: VIEWS!
449297093.author: a TripAdvisor user
449297093.reviewBody: The views at Cuatro Cuatros are stunning.  This restaurant/bar sits at the top of a hill; you can go "glamping" at the bottom of the hill in large furnished tents set up for visitors in the valle. You can see up and down the Baja coast for miles and miles at Cuatro Cuatros.  The wine is decent, food is pretty good, but go here for the views.  Enjoy something from the bar while you watch the sunset.  Cuatro Cuatros is definitely a highlight while in the Valle de Guadalupe and a must see.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

443611875.name: Literally the most amazing sunset I have ever seen...
443611875.author: a TripAdvisor user
443611875.reviewBody: No matter what you do when you are in the Valle you HAVE to make time to go here for the sunset.  There is a separate restaurant and vineyard but the real highlight was the beautiful perch that they have created on the edge of the cliff to watch the sunset over the enormity of the Pacific.  After an hour or two, the atmosphere just gets more fun and the sky opens up to all the stars you can imagine.  This was an absolutely magical place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

439306183.name: Poor service...
439306183.author: a TripAdvisor user
439306183.reviewBody: We arrived there to have some cocktails and there was a poor service, there was no light, and we didn\'t received a good service , they even ask for payment before arriving the place...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

368864118.name: Most beautiful place to view the sunset and sea
368864118.author: a TripAdvisor user
368864118.reviewBody: Make sure to visit the Cuatro Cuatro\'s point of view at the end of your visit to the Guadalupe Valley or just if traveling to Ensenada, the detour is worth it. I recommend you to get before the sunset and stay to look it, the views are so amazing! The entrance is free, but the service of the bar is not so good. The wine they make and sell is very expensive for not being good... Take photos, have a romantic sunset and that\'s enough.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

366220633.name: Plan your event here!!
366220633.author: a TripAdvisor user
366220633.reviewBody: My wife and I recently planned a cocktail and appetizer hour for our wedding guests at Cuatro Cuatros. The manager, Andres Blanco, gave us an easy, stress-free planning experience and evening. The grounds were beautiful (be sure to see el Mirador), the food and drinks were delicious and the service was excellent. Strongly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

350453968.name: The best hotel! We will be back!
350453968.author: a TripAdvisor user
350453968.reviewBody:
I select this hotel as recommended by a friend and I will be forever grateful. It is the perfect escape out of the city, the noise and the technology chains that keep you stressed. 
The hotel consists in 8 luxury tents that provides you with the best experience, the bed are delicious, the dawn from your tent is amazing, even the noise at night is just simply out of this world. It takes you to a different place and time.

Unfortunately for us, due to the season the vineyards were not at the best but it was incredible. The kitchen of the hotel is delicious. We had breakfast always there with typical Mexican kitchen dishes.

The hotel offers you different tours, among which you can find a sailing experience that was amazing. The hotel is just 20 min away from Valle de Guadalupe and it was the best experience to know this amazing secret of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Tijuana-Ensenada Km. 89 s/n El Tigre

672844308.name: If this is a must see then...
672844308.author: a TripAdvisor user
672844308.reviewBody: If you happen to be walking at the port on a hot day, this is worth 5 minutes. If you have kids with you,they will enjoy playing in the waters. However, this is not a Bellagio-level fountain. This is a shopping mall level fountain. Yes you don\u2019t expect it in Ensenada... but it\u2019s not worth walking far to see.

667254675.name: Nice views of the bahia
667254675.author: a TripAdvisor user
667254675.reviewBody: This is a very nice spot to take pictures of the bah\u00eda and see the cruisers that stop at Ensenada and also the big container ships. The dancing fountain is a light and music show worth the wait.

625159675.name: Similar To Fountains In Vegas
625159675.author: a TripAdvisor user
625159675.reviewBody: The fountains are very pretty and have music synced to the water spouts.  It\'s a nice place to spend 20-30 minutes while walking around the town at night.  Plus the port in the background makes a nice scenic backdrop.

624809054.name: Great Show on the Water
624809054.author: a TripAdvisor user
624809054.reviewBody: What a refreshing experience to see a free water show near the water!  Even during the day the water shoots up in a myriad of eruptions that can be seen from the harbor.

611941326.name: Nice
611941326.author: a TripAdvisor user
611941326.reviewBody: In the daytime it\'s just a tourist trap. At night, if you catch it, the light show is nice. Parking is nearly impossible, like everywhere in this town where the tourists go.

593015052.name: Best Time Ever
593015052.author: a TripAdvisor user
593015052.reviewBody: We arrived at the Bandera/Malecon late in the night but to tell you the truth the water lights was all I wanted to see which I did, like I\'ve been here in the past when I was younger not much has change so I didn\'t mind skipping the boat rides, buying souvenirs and walking around eating food. Tho like several family members who have never been here and wanted to go on the boat rides, buy souvenirs and walk around eating we had to come back the following day which it was so worth it. If you are near the Bandera/Malecon pass by and visit this place tho make sure not to arrive late in the night, the majority of the puestos close around 7:30 pm and if I\'m not wrong the boat rides close around 6:30 pm.

577246311.name: great show
577246311.author: a TripAdvisor user
577246311.reviewBody: wondered out for a walk and came across this light and water show going on as well as a live band. free to public and suitable for all ages.

550107127.name: Great Evening of Entertainment for Families:  Lights Music & Playground!
550107127.author: a TripAdvisor user
550107127.reviewBody: We were recently here with a 13, 9 and 5 year old.  Everyone enjoyed.  We wandered the boardwalk close to the waterfront, looked at the cruise ships docked, and enjoyed the water show that took place at 8pm with the fountains and lights reminiscent of Disney.  There were places to get treats like churros, cafe, and ice creams and it looked like there was a market that had already closed down for the day.  The playground emptied out when the light show began, so it was the perfect time to use it and parking was easy to find after a loop. There is also a little tourist train if you are interested in driving around the few border streets.

547240897.name: Beautiful Water Show to Music!
547240897.author: a TripAdvisor user
547240897.reviewBody: Music and Lights included, this is hands down a fabulous water display. The music us choreographed to the fountains in a mesmerizing display. However, TripAdvisor does not recognize it as a fountain nor a water show but a park . Not to be missed!!!

533804362.name: Ensenada Oct 2017
533804362.author: a TripAdvisor user
533804362.reviewBody: The water show begins around 8:00 and runs for about an hour.  Remember you are in Mexico and nothing is written in stone.  The music is modern and the lighting with the water is amazing.  Excellent place to walk to after dinner.  Located on the malecon or boardwalk.

520116025.name: Free water, lights, music display. Water spouts shoot out at various lengths and colors.
520116025.author: a TripAdvisor user
520116025.reviewBody: This excellent water/light show was fun for the family to watch. The children ages 5-20 enjoyed the show. There is live music playing in the back ground. I think it runs Tuesday-Saturday nights at around 8 pm. I think it may be 30-45 minutes long. There are vendors all around selling things and the main street in Ensenada (first street) is nearby.

508110093.name: Nice Fountains
508110093.author: a TripAdvisor user
508110093.reviewBody: Not gonna lie these water works are wonderful, but it tends to get crowed during peak times so you can\'t really get a great view.

507883663.name: Great!
507883663.author: a TripAdvisor user
507883663.reviewBody: I love coming in here. The new fountains definitely are amazing, It\'s great for a nice walk and people watching. The harbor tour are pretty good deals and I like to go every now and then.

502661091.name: Fantastic Lights, Colors, Music.  Wow!
502661091.author: a TripAdvisor user
502661091.reviewBody: This relatively new attraction by the waterfront is delightful, night or day.  During a summer day, children by the dozens frolic in the ever-changing dancing fountains, as their parents and other bystanders  watch with big smiles.  At night, starting at 8 pm, the fountains are gated off so no one can run through them, and the light show begins.  The fountains and lights are synchronized to music, from classical to pop, with breath-taking swings from murmuring puddles to tall, pulsing geysers.  Hundreds of people gather to watch, small children on their parents\' shoulders, everyone with a cell phone held high, taking photos and movies.  Nearby, toddlers (and older) can ride plush jungle animals to the sounds of Lion King or other fun music.  A small electric train also offers rides starting from here.  Cotton candy, churros, coldstone ice cream, and snacks of every kind are available from street vendors.  And beyond this plaza, you can stroll in either direction along the waterfront, watching the boats, the ships, the tugs, and all the happy families glorying in their time to relax.  Good for the soul.

472764317.name: Excellent place to walk, sit and people watch.
472764317.author: a TripAdvisor user
472764317.reviewBody: A nice little Malecon or esplanade along the waterfront. It was very clean and modern. A few "marineros" trying to sell you a harbor tour for 30 pesos but nothing aggressive. Great selection of places to eat, be sure to visit Tres muelles on the north end. The big flag is on the south end. We sat on one of the many benches and watched people and families walk by while soaking up the sun.

661665923.name: Lovely hike
661665923.author: a TripAdvisor user
661665923.reviewBody: The walk was lovely, the area is well kept and clean. This is a rain fed waterfall, and there was only a trickle of water. However it was still worth the hike!

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

623380359.name: A Relatively Easy Hike, with Amazing Views!
623380359.author: a TripAdvisor user
623380359.reviewBody: Hop around a few boulders, and splash in collecting pools as you hunt down some waterfalls. My husband and I found this spot while exploring the wine region in Valle de Guadalupe, so we certainly weren\'t prepared to hike (okay...we were wearing sandals, so we did it barefoot). It was a magical addition to a day. We passed several camping spots on the way into the canyon that we are sure to try soon. They even had tire swings on a few of the mature trees that made me feel like I was 7 years old again :)

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

583889832.name: Rappelling in Mexico
583889832.author: a TripAdvisor user
583889832.reviewBody: El Salto (the jump) is a beautiful canyon located off the Tijuana \u2013 Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76. This facility has a parking area with a day use fee (around $2), or camping fee (around $4). There a toilets, a small store, picnic benches, grills, and some playground and sports equipment. It is excellent spot for rock climbing, rappelling and hiking. In the rainy season you can view a spectacular +100ft. waterfall.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

576253915.name: A taste of classic Baja only an hour from the border
576253915.author: a TripAdvisor user
576253915.reviewBody: This is an awesome and deep little black-rock canyon.  Waterfalls are beautiful whenever they\'re flowing which they weren\'t while we were here this month, but we still had a blast working our way into this canyon and free-climbing out.  I jumped into the deep and cold pool at the bottom, but it was tough to get out again.  Next time I\'ll bring ropes.  This place is well signed but off the free road between Rosarito Beach and Ensenada.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

571982409.name: Nice wilderness area near Ensenada
571982409.author: a TripAdvisor user
571982409.reviewBody: Beautiful area about 30 minute drive from Enesenada. The trails are poorly marked, and it\'s only about a 20 minute walk to the falls (or the area where they apparently occasionally run), but you can hike beyond that if you want. There is a steep trail to the left (north) of the falls which climbs a ridge to an amazing view of another canyon and no sign whatsoever of civilization. Worth the climb!

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

556909873.name: Nice Place for a Hike
556909873.author: a TripAdvisor user
556909873.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the short hike.  Directions to the trail are pretty sparse, but walk through the main campground.\n\nOnce you get to the falls (in season) / canyon  you need to scramble over some boulders...which I love.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

545572259.name: Good for a quick weekend gateaway
545572259.author: a TripAdvisor user
545572259.reviewBody: Camping site is just average, it\'s better as a one day hiking, the good this is that is very close from the border

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

545077520.name: Better be in shape
545077520.author: a TripAdvisor user
545077520.reviewBody: This is in quite an isolated appearing area behind the city of La Mision on the old road. It is quite dramatic scenery. Don\'t walk alone and carry water.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

495860245.name: Beautiful and relaxing
495860245.author: a TripAdvisor user
495860245.reviewBody: The location is accessible by any kind of vehicles. The cover charge is reasonable. It has plenty areas to enjoy a BBQ! Grills and table provided. The trail is clear of obstacles and easy access for kids. The canyon is impressive but not accessible or safe for kids. However,  any adult or teenagers can easy hike this trail (as long they are in a decent shape / water (10 essentials). Make sure to select the free highway Ensenada -Tijuna@! If you select the visual highway you will be in the wrong rode!

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

481312331.name: Won\'t be the last time
481312331.author: a TripAdvisor user
481312331.reviewBody: I went for the day with my family and it was fun. We enjoyed the hiking trail, walking through the canyon, beautiful views. An effective way to disconnect from the city and enjoy nature.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

435093590.name: Beautiful Camping Spot And Awsome Hiking Area So Close to  Rosarito and Ensenada
435093590.author: a TripAdvisor user
435093590.reviewBody:
This is a great little side trip if you are on Federal HIghway 1 (the free road)  between Rosarito Beach and Ensenada on your way to the Gudalupe Valley or just to come and do some tent camping.
It located at km 76 and there is a sign marking the way.
Once you get off the road you drive on a smooth dirt road and just follow the signs for a few blocks. SIgns mark the way pretty well along the dirt road.
The entrance fee is 30 pesos per person or about $1.65 at today's exchange  rate.
The majority of the camp sites are nestled under shady oak trees and have a picnic table, rustic fire ring and grill. 
There are rustic public restrooms and "showers".
Not recommended for RV's unless you are dry camping.  Also there are quite a few low oak tree branches that will block your way to most camp sites.
I just went there to see the falls which is an easy and level 20 minute walk from where you park your car. The trail gets pretty rocky as you near the falls so I would recommend hiking boots. I had on tennis shoes and made it find but for climbing all over the rocks I wished I had my boots on. I was also wearing shorts which is not too bad but on way back to car I wanted to go off the path and do some exploring but I would have spend more time off the path had I been wearing pants.
You definitely want to bring some water with you even if y ou are just hiking to the falls.
Of course with this drought we are having there is no active water fall but still a beautiful area. There were two tiny pools of greenish water but that's about it. I spoke with the guy at the gate and he said if keep following the trail past the canyon you wiill find two small lakes. I was definitely not prepared to do this but plan on coming back real soon as I have a beach house in Rosarito.
The camp ground also has a volleyball court, swings, and small soccer field. 
I was there the first week of November and the temperature was about 70 degrees and there were probably three family groups camping.
There is also a little outdoor covered patio area with some table and a small store so you can buy a soda or chips. He had beer but said he ran out of ice so I passed on having a cerveza.
I am looking forward to coming back and bringing my young nephews to do some hiking and exploring.  The camping would be for any age but the hiking would not be very good for young children. I would say 10 years old or older.They would love it!
