address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

434115243.name: Amazing natural spot for climbing, hiking and camping
434115243.author: a TripAdvisor user
434115243.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this place multiple times on the past 15 years. It never disappoints. There\'s a ranch about a mile off the highway were you pay the owner for parking your car so it\'s secure. After that, you decide to camp right beside the ranch, or walk around 2 miles to the canyon. I always choose the latter. It is more secluded, sheltered from the wind and low temperatures, and way cooler. You can hike, mountain bike, rappel down the canyon walls; there are also multiple climbing and bouldering spots available. Keep in mind that the only proper bathrooms are  on the ranch. No electricity, running water or immediate help are available. If you\'re in for an adventure, this is it.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

414057426.name: The big challenge of the year
414057426.author: a TripAdvisor user
414057426.reviewBody: This hike was very challenging for me on the final part. I was not ready to climb the last vertcal mountan. My condition was a little less that what was need. I finished but it was very difficult. I needed a little mor water for this distance. I was not discouraged because I did it a second time but I believe it is for people a little younger than muself. 68 years at that time. It can be dangerous for someone with the wrong boats with the silicon bolders. I would reccomend it for people under 50 years of age in good condition.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

397281268.name: Quick hike to a beautiful landscape
397281268.author: a TripAdvisor user
397281268.reviewBody: I went with a friend - we spent a bit of time looking for the hike, it was on a trail behind a campsite that was being occupied.  From the highway, follow all of the signs all the way until you reach the parking lot.  Then head down and left from there, until you pass a swing set on your left, then turn right and pass a couple campsites until you reach the trailhead.\n\nIt\'s a short hike into a beautiful gorge.  Would not take children, since wandering would probably be dangerous at the end.  Otherwise, an easy hike for most.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

380703149.name: Miles Away
380703149.author: a TripAdvisor user
380703149.reviewBody: I guess it was literally and figuratively miles away. The hike was short but, like every review of the place mentions, it depends on how much scrambling around the creek you do. We went up and around some of the different areas, bouldering and climbing up rocks. It was really fun and the scenery was beautiful. It was dry season so no waterfall but I can imagine it being absolutely stunning!! A great stop and it\'s not far from Wine Country. You can camp there too. It\'s great, really.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

374302806.name: Fun Place To Hike
374302806.author: a TripAdvisor user
374302806.reviewBody: My family and I have hiked here on various occasions.  I have taken my 5 year old on the hike with no problem.  There are some areas you need to watch your step because of the rocks and boulders.  At the end you will be at the mouth of a canyon where people go repelling and rock climbing.  Do not go during the rainy season because you cannot do the hike.  Much of the hike is in a dried up river bed.  Also, if you feel like being adventurous....  As you near the mouth of the canyon, there is a trail that breaks off to the left.  It\'s hard to find but it goes over the final mountain on your left side.  You go up and over the mountain and come down on the other side of the canyon.  From there you can see a small lake which has fish in it, and you can get into the canyon on the bottom if you wish.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

367052296.name: A really off time
367052296.author: a TripAdvisor user
367052296.reviewBody: This is a great place for camping and/or hiking. You have to bring the whole equipment, because there is no store near by, but they do have WC\'s. You just need to consider that you have to really carry on all the things that you bring because there are some spots that a car may not reach.\n\nThe view is awesome if you hike to the waterfalls, and even if it has not rained the view of the whole wall of big rocks is a picture must.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

344853908.name: Awesome short hike with amazing payoff
344853908.author: a TripAdvisor user
344853908.reviewBody: ABSOLUTELY worth the adventure.  We stopped in here on our way to Valle de Guadalupe and were very pleasantly surprised.  The trail is through the back of the campground to the Northeast and is only about 1km (call it a 10 minute walk).  Once you reach the canyon/waterfall there are huge boulders that you can climb around to different areas of the falls.  Tranquil pools of water collect and flow depending on the time of year.  It costs a couple bucks (maybe $2/person) to park for the day and you can camp for ~$5/person if you please.  I cannot wait to go back and explore more!!

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

330537950.name: One of my favorite places for camping and day trips. Dog friendly.
330537950.author: a TripAdvisor user
330537950.reviewBody:
Amazing geology, beautifully scenic location. Dog friendly. Day trips or camping overnight. Great for hiking, boulder scrambling, rappelling, climbing, car camping, backpacking (showers and toilets with running water). Huge, beautiful rock formations. There is a kind of black, shiny, smooth rock here that I just love to touch. Lots of places to explore. There is a trail up and over a big hill. It's steep, but really worth the effort (vale la pena!), because the views from the top are stunning. Go down the other side, into the canyon, surrounded by rugged rock cliffs and you come to a little lagoon, with a sandy inland beach, and fish in the lagoon! I'd love to know the story of how that lagoon was formed and how the fish got there! 

Or you can make your way across the flat rock mesas to the cliffs that drop down into the canyon. A popular place for rappelling. There is a stream and many small ponds around throughout this area. 

It's only about an hour's drive from Ensenada, mostly on the paved free road (highway), only the last little bit is on a dirt road in decent condition.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

289654951.name: El Salto, Ensenada, Baja California
289654951.author: a TripAdvisor user
289654951.reviewBody: Great place for hiking, rock climbing, enjoy nature, waterfalls during rainy season. They have some picnic area & bathrooms.

address.streetAddress: Off The Tijuana - Ensenada Libre Highway at KM 76

660145619.name: Great Building
660145619.author: a TripAdvisor user
660145619.reviewBody:
This building is near the Cruise Port - go out to the main street - across the street on the Right Side is the Building.

Venture forth and see the great building and the Museum.  Lots to see with small cost.

 The building was built for high speed boats to come down during the Prohibition era to gamble and drink from California.  Stayed here in the 50's with parents when we drove down on a gravel road

659113288.name: Beautiful Historic Building
659113288.author: a TripAdvisor user
659113288.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old former casino with lots of history.  The tours are probably very worthwhile but we just walked around on our own with no fee.

638875840.name: Good food, good weather, good fishing, friendly people
638875840.author: a TripAdvisor user
638875840.reviewBody: Changes in latitudes = changes in attitudes.  Relax.  Guadalupe Valley wines much better than I expected.

575684358.name: The home of the Margarita
575684358.author: a TripAdvisor user
575684358.reviewBody: A great way to see a Mexican town and its history is to book a tour . Ensenada has so much history and the local people are also friendly. You must visit the Hussongs Cantina where the margarita was invented.We had a fantastic tour guide with great local knowledge ( Jackie Kennedy).

495858322.name: Awesome landmark!
495858322.author: a TripAdvisor user
495858322.reviewBody: This is a most to see while your visit to Ensenada. The architecture is just impressive! It has old pictures of the years this hotel was in its most busy years! It is well maintain. The bar has a sign in which states "the birth" of the famous Margarita.\nNo cover charge and it is located very close to the cruise terminal.

473467005.name: A must see in Ensenada
473467005.author: a TripAdvisor user
473467005.reviewBody: Had read about this hotel as it was a playground for a lot of Hollywood celebrities such as Lucy and Desi Arnaz. Jack Dempsey actually helped fund the construction.  Beautiful Spanish colonial architecture rich with beautiful tile work and painted murals throughout.  Take some time and stroll the halls of this historic landmark in Ensenada.

472083348.name: Wonderful Historic Building
472083348.author: a TripAdvisor user
472083348.reviewBody: We took a 3 hour guided tour of Ensenada (4:30 - 7:30 pm) during our Princess Cruise port stop and are we ever glad we did!  One of the stops \'The Riviera del Pacifico\' was once a very glamourous resort and casino, a favourite of Lucy & Desi Arnaz (I Love Lucy).  Our guide gave us a brief description and then we explored the building and grounds on our own.  During our visit, a wonderful performance was in progress - singers, dancers and other entertainers to watch.  I walked around admiring the beautifully painted ceilings, the gorgeous arched rooms.  You could imagine what this place must have been like it it\'s glory days.  This property is also famous for the Margarita drink that was created in honour of one of it\'s owners.  Locals and the Mexican government saved the Riviera del Pacifico from being torn down ... it is now a wonderful Cultural Centre.   I would definitely visit this fantastic property again if I ever get the chance.

465623747.name: A Beautiful Landmark
465623747.author: a TripAdvisor user
465623747.reviewBody: I have visited this attraction twice during 2 Princess Cruises shore excursions that included a second stop to La Bufadora. I enjoyed my tour guides on both trips. This site is close enough to the port that you don\'t need to take a shore excursion to visit it but there doesn\'t seem to be any tour guides on site to show you around the place. The history of the once casino resort/hotel is fascinating. And getting a complimentary margarita at the end of my tour was a great bonus. There is also a little bit of souvenir shopping you can do on site. I totally recommend coming to visit if you\'re interested in the local culture or historic buildings. Folks on tours should remember to bring a little bit of cash to tip the bartender, the tour guide and the bus driver.

456446921.name: Interesting guided tour
456446921.author: a TripAdvisor user
456446921.reviewBody: It was one of the stops on a Cruise Excursion. Interesting narration of the origin of California and Baja California. Visit of the building with information. Refreshments were included in the tour and also wine tasting where you could buy wine from the region. Outside, in the courtyard, there are merchants with a good choice of products and souvenirs.

435361120.name: Interesting Place
435361120.author: a TripAdvisor user
435361120.reviewBody: Visited as part of an excursion form our cruise ship.Nice gardens and craft booths.Lots of history also.Took in the Mexican Folklore Fiesta as part of the tour and it was fun.Worth a visit

434097009.name: Worth a Visit
434097009.author: a TripAdvisor user
434097009.reviewBody: Visited this historical building as part of a cruise excursion, and we really didn\'t expect much.  We were very pleasantly surprised.  The tour guide was excellent, and conveyed her passion and pride about the history of the site and the city of Ensenada.  She told many interesting stories and facts about this beautiful building and site.  She spoke English very well which was appreciated for those of us who don\'t speak Spanish.  The building was beautifully restored, except the carpets and tables/chairs were pretty worn.  There are lots of historic photos that help tell the story--the captions are in Spanish; even if you don\'t understand Spanish, you can get a sense of the history just from the photos.

391591552.name: Interesting building with interesting history - free
391591552.author: a TripAdvisor user
391591552.reviewBody:
Take a few minutes to walk the grounds and through the building.

Much early 20th century history here.

Several parties including weddings were being set up while we were there, but you are welcome to wander through.

Definitely worth a stop.

374300405.name: Great Place To Visit
374300405.author: a TripAdvisor user
374300405.reviewBody: This is our favorite place to go and walk around.  The gardens are beautiful and it\'s well preserved.  It\'s fun to walk around and imagine all of the Hollywood celebrities that frequented the place during prohibition.  Lucille Ball and Dezy Arnet being the most famous.  You can walk around most of the complex and no one will bother you.  So have fun and explore.

364026841.name: Cool Stop
364026841.author: a TripAdvisor user
364026841.reviewBody: This is a cool stop if you are in Ensenada. Our tour guide said this is where all the locals like to gather for events. Awesome history of the building and the building has some very nice architecture. The building does have some strange smells. At the end of the tour they said we can get free drinks from the bar, but they just give you a little cup but hey its still free. In the courtyard, there are some vendors that sell souvenirs. Our total visit time was just 45 minutes, there is not much to it

353694236.name: Worth the stop
353694236.author: a TripAdvisor user
353694236.reviewBody: Interesting history (hotel/casino a short boat ride from San Diego, designed to attract the well-to-do and famous during Prohibition in the US) in a classical-looking building.  Building has either been well-maintained or, more likely, well-renovated, but regardless is in very good condition.  Easy to access and you can spend as much or little time here as you like - but be sure to spend at least some.

338578280.name: Cool 1920s Era Hotel Building
338578280.author: a TripAdvisor user
338578280.reviewBody:
This is perhaps the single coolest building in all of Ensenada.
It was built as a hotel about 100 years ago. The place catered to Hollywood stars who wanted to slip across the border for relaxation and naughty fun.

The building has been beautifully restored and is well worth seeing. It no longer operates as as hotel. It has been repurposed as a civic center building.

I would encourage you to read a bit about the history of the building before you visit - you will enjoy what you see so much more.  This is also suitable for families with young children.

330065876.name: Margarita-ville :)
330065876.author: a TripAdvisor user
330065876.reviewBody: This is a really cool place if you are into local history.  The building and grounds are beautiful, and it was interesting to look at all the old photos hanging up depicting the glory days.  Our tour guide was great and very informative, and the free margarita at the end wasn\'t bad either!

326947812.name: Beautiful!
326947812.author: a TripAdvisor user
326947812.reviewBody: We should take in a few trips to the Rivera del Pacifico!  It was a wonderful trip!  I would go back again, if the time was right!  The ocean was smooth!  Great!

309300773.name: Amazing views !
309300773.author: a TripAdvisor user
309300773.reviewBody: One of most beautiful scenery in Baja is Bahia Sal si puedes, located just south of Bajamar north of Ensenada.  For me is one of the most beautiful bays in the in Mexico.

267389443.name: On our own
267389443.author: a TripAdvisor user
267389443.reviewBody: The building and grounds are beautiful. We read that you could take a tour and were told a guide would be there in 20 minutes. Meanwhile we were given a brochure with a history of the peace and done pictures. No guide ever showed up. To be fair we were there on a week-day and there were no cruise ships in port, so much of the town was closed). Anyway we just explored on our own and saw some beautiful ceilings and chandeliers. The biggest and most elaborate chandelier in what had been the casino was outstanding except that the room was unlit. If we could have taken the guided tour to enrich the history and had rooms lit, I would have given it a higher rating. I do think the grounds were lovely and worth  a stroll.  One more important thing. This is where the margarita was developed. We had one at the bar and it was, hands down, the BEST MARGARITA I have ever had!  Worth a visit just for that.

260101804.name: Birth place of the Margarita!
260101804.author: a TripAdvisor user
260101804.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture. Absolutely magnificent to be where the stars from the 30s hung out, apparently Al Capone was a regular here. We had a margarita at Bar Andaluz, it was great, we were almost the only ones there.

257469878.name: Awesome history
257469878.author: a TripAdvisor user
257469878.reviewBody: This is a great tour.  The inside is beautiful and the history attached to it is awesome.  It once sat on the edge of the ocean  but now they have build up land in front of it.  It was very interesting to learn about the celebs who visited and that the start of the margarita was there.

252421822.name: Faded Playground of Rich and Famous
252421822.author: a TripAdvisor user
252421822.reviewBody: This site is worth visiting as it has a rich history and a vibrant present. Be sure you hire a guide to show you the hidden secret passageways that celebrities of the Golden Age used when visiting special friends (and keeping it secret). You\'ll get free samples of margaritas, beer and coke (made with real sugar). The guide will tell you that the market in the patio of Rivera del Pacifico is one that benefits the center and that is true. But he\'ll also allude that you cannot bargain and that is NOT true. Be prepared to ask for less.

246695536.name: Beautiful piece of history
246695536.author: a TripAdvisor user
246695536.reviewBody: I don\'t know why this is not recommended to everyone getting off the cruise ships as one of the best spots to wander during time ashore! In fact, I have seen people ask what there is to see and the Museo and Cultural Center are not even mentioned. Only a 15 minute walk from Mercado Negro, the Museum is small and there is a $2 USD or 20 peso fee to enter, but there is good history and lovely artifacts documented. Next door, the center is open for free and you can wander the gorgeous ballrooms and learn the history of the hotel and casino. The gardens are beautiful, the theater is huge, and the margaritas are so good! \nIt doesn\'t take very long to see, so if you are getting off the ship and want to look at more than cheap souvenirs, go see this glorious building! \nWe were not here on a cruise, we are in town for a week, but it seems like the perfect on-shore thing to do.

240594684.name: Fascinating piece of history
240594684.author: a TripAdvisor user
240594684.reviewBody: Its a shame that this building isn\'t more well known and frequented.  It is a stunning 1930\'s structure with amazing meeting and banquet rooms, the type that are so rare in a very recent, modern city.  The history is fascinating, and the period architecture if beautiful.  If you are looking for a way to spend 30 - 60 minutes being constantly wowed by artwork, architecture, arches, hand carved features and design, this is the place for you.  Plus it is one of many places that claims to have invented the Margarita.  Seems a great venue for weddings and parties as well.

230592939.name: Land Mark
230592939.author: a TripAdvisor user
230592939.reviewBody: Nice old Spanish building were Margarita was born! Nice place to visit and have a drink. Definitely take time to walk around inside and out, you\'ll find a cute little area.

202718105.name: Looks good from the outside
202718105.author: a TripAdvisor user
202718105.reviewBody: This is an old resort/casino from the 1930\'s which was frequented by Al Capone. From the outside it looks really stunning. The inside needs help.  The courtyard is filled with traders selling "Mexican" arts and crafts. Lets just say I saw boxes with Made in China written on them. Not so good then, a bit of a let down.

194670494.name: Tranquil
194670494.author: a TripAdvisor user
194670494.reviewBody: I think there is a museum, we did not go in.  We saw some random outdoor mariachi performance, then some random indoor Mexican Folk dance.  Their website has no information on any of these activities.  It was a draw of luck.\nThe facility is quite a tranquil place to spend a good 20 minutes to walk around.

190575709.name: land Mark
190575709.author: a TripAdvisor user
190575709.reviewBody: Its really quite a site. Built for parting and gambling for the Hollywood elite. The details and craftsmanship are very impressive. They don\'t build them like this any more. A must see.

186081126.name: Riviera
186081126.author: a TripAdvisor user
186081126.reviewBody: Also known as the Jack Dempsy Museum- The boxer got his start in Ensenada and his money helped build the Riviera- so the story goes. It was also the hang out for Hollywood movie stars that came to Ensenada for gambling The Riviera just celebrated its 83 Birthday! a must see in Ensenada.

175638859.name: Festivals and Festivals and Festivals!
175638859.author: a TripAdvisor user
175638859.reviewBody: The party never ends! The other night we went for the Tequila and Mariachi Festival...it was awesome! The regular price was $250 pesos but we arrived at 9:00 pm the last day so the price was reduced to $150 pesos which is the equivalent of about $13.00 USD and for that we received a small ceramic shot glass and about 50 different booths offering tastings of their finest tequilas! Needless to say the night was a blast! We ended up buying four bottles of different tequilas aged differently, one was aged in a wine cask and had a beautiful fruity flavor. The Riviera hosts many festivals as well as weddings and theatre productions. A win/win all around!

139518392.name: Wonderful
139518392.author: a TripAdvisor user
139518392.reviewBody: Well my father rebuild this in the middle 70 to the 80 and since that i always love it, i been in all the secret places around, and behind the doble walls, and at the top of where the big chandelieris, so warm memories and interesting place to visit.

672843352.name: You can check off a port
672843352.author: a TripAdvisor user
672843352.reviewBody: Ensenada is a small tourist town south of Tijuana. The good is it doesn\u2019t have the hustle of the border town. But it only has the touristy items. The shops are all cheap tourist souvenirs. It\u2019s a pleasant stroll to walk off sea legs, but 1 hour is sufficient. And plenty of bars to sell you tequila.

671480364.name: Anniversary cruise
671480364.author: a TripAdvisor user
671480364.reviewBody: Took a tour with our cruise ship down First street. All the shops have such cool stuff. You just want to be very careful that you are really getting the real stuff if you are looking for certain items. The owners were very helpful if we had questions and they will work with you on some prices!

663327430.name: Pretty tourist street where locals shop too
663327430.author: a TripAdvisor user
663327430.reviewBody: Some of the nicest restaurants and some really good shops are found on this street. Plan at least a couple of hours to stroll and shop and don\u2019t forget lunch - either at the fabulous El Rey Sol or a great taco stand. If you opt for a taco stand, El Rey Sol has a pastry case that will astonish, so save room for desert. The loose rule of thumb is the better shops are at the south end, but there are exceptions so wander the whole street. Your children will be delighted. It is completely safe - just enjoy yourself

660932639.name: Great to sit al fresco on the sidewalk and people watch
660932639.author: a TripAdvisor user
660932639.reviewBody: You can find many shops, restaurants, pharmacies, and bars. I personally like to sit outside and have lunch and watch all the tourists coming off the cruise boats. There is a lot of shopping, including stores that let you sample lots of tequila, mezcal and Mexican wine.

660126269.name: Embarcadero and First Street
660126269.author: a TripAdvisor user
660126269.reviewBody: A new area where you can get food, tours and trinkets is the Embarcadero or port side of Ensenada which has be fixed up greatly, head up from the Cruise Port on the Left, cross the first bridge and walk up at the top go right to First Street and down back to the Cruise port.  \n\nAll shops look the same and if shopping work your price from the various shops.  First street hold man museums near the Cruise port and if this is what you want go see them.  Have fun and be careful

658859080.name: Very scenic
658859080.author: a TripAdvisor user
658859080.reviewBody: Took a three-day cruise out of Long Beach to Ensenada. First time in Mexico, it was very scenic, nice shopping district, plenty of vendors and you will find plenty of deals all along the strip.  All vendors sell the same items, just about, so you should have many souvenirs to bring back home.

653021452.name: More relaxed than Avenida Revolucion in Tijuana
653021452.author: a TripAdvisor user
653021452.reviewBody:
The tourists here tend to be a bit of a different crowd than in TJ, so the offerings are a little different and the hustle is gentler and smoother.  It's a good place to walk around - you;'ll see many things of interest and they don't overpower you with the pitch to buy.

btw, you're gonna see a lot of dried shark's mouths - from tiny to huge, bristling with teeth...

of course, if you are a seasoned traveler in mexico, you won't need to go here at all - you'll want to head for the mercado central.

either way, a visit to Hussong's Cantina is a great way to finish up!

650336705.name: Lots of shops but they all had the same things
650336705.author: a TripAdvisor user
650336705.reviewBody: We where here on a cruise with a few hours stop in Ensenada.  We took a city tour that dropped us off here for an hour to shop.  It felt safe and while they wanted you to look at their stuff or come in their shop, if you told them no thank you, they for the most part didn\'t push it.  An hour was plenty of time for us here.

640884901.name: Ensenada is a gem on the Mexican northern coast for cruisers to explore.
640884901.author: a TripAdvisor user
640884901.reviewBody: Ensenada was the first stop on our 14-night, and our second, Panama Canal cruise with NCL in November of 2018. Never having visited this city before, I searched and found out beforehand that Ensenada has the reputation of hosting the LARGEST Mexican flag in the world. Wow! The flag was huge and made everything around it small in comparison. I was not sure whether my wife and I walked down the "First Street", but we did walk along the downtown streets where tourists are the main attraction. Instead, we walked through a local garden as part of its "Cultural Institute", peaceful and quite under a blue Mexican sky, and we were able to admire, among other objects, the stature of the first Portuguese who reportedly discovered Ensenada in the 16th century. I made sure, as I always do so during my travel outside the United States (Saint Peter\'s Cathedral in Rome, and Saint Paul\'s Shipwreck Church in Malta, for two examples), to visit the main local church in Ensenada, where a sculpture of Jesus Christ stands tall with an inscription saying that the sculpture was made in France and then transported to Ensenada in or about the 18th century. My wife and I even participated in the Sunday mass given by the church priest when, in that process, I watched, and was deeply moved, by a local believer, who, though dressed in what looked like his work clothing and appeared quite beaten in his daily life, was perfectly in attention to every detail of the ongoing church mass. That church visit was what made my visit to Ensenada complete and lasting in my memory.

633881709.name: first street
633881709.author: a TripAdvisor user
633881709.reviewBody: Our day was long, full and busy! We had never been to Ensenada before so we\'re full of anticipation and quite excited.\nWe spent a pleasant hour or two exploring First Street. Lots of different shops selling clothes; luggage; alcohol; sweets; ice cream (lots!); small cafes and restaurants. We visited a jewellery store and I bought a pretty necklace and ear-rings (for half the asking price). If I was "done" then am not bothered. The set is very pretty and much remarked upon by family and friends.\nOur tour guide was a delightful chap and I appreciated his help climbing aboard the minibus on my crutches. Next he took us to visit Bodegas de Santo Tomas.

627539529.name: Typical Mexican shopping street
627539529.author: a TripAdvisor user
627539529.reviewBody: Not a lot happening in Ensenada, so we opted to walk down First Street. Salesmen weren\'t as intense as Tijuana and were good natured. We enjoyed our time and then back to the ship!

622973263.name: Main Drag for shops and restaurants.
622973263.author: a TripAdvisor user
622973263.reviewBody: Fairly typical \u201ctourist\u201d main drag. But, the vendors were friendlier and more humorous than most we had experienced. \u201cHey, stop here and buy something you don\u2019t need\u201d sort of thing. Several decent restaurants, some clothing shops and all sorts of shops with \u201clocal\u201d wares...many having similar merchandise. We had fun talking to the vendors and checking out the wares. Plus...stopping by a place or two for beers and snacks. We were there from about 11:00 am to 2:00pm on a Saturday and felt 100% safe. A great street for a stroll. Some interesting pharmaceutical shop displays as well. Like I said..fun stroll.

621893062.name: Festive, busy, happy
621893062.author: a TripAdvisor user
621893062.reviewBody: Very typical of Ensenada and the tourist culture, many places to shop for Mexican artisan products and of course, always time for a beer!

618991909.name: Tacky
618991909.author: a TripAdvisor user
618991909.reviewBody: This street is filled with hordes of tourists looking for cheap curios and souvenirs. I\'m sure that they find them, but overall it\'s just plain tacky.

615581539.name: Mandatory Visit When In Ensenada
615581539.author: a TripAdvisor user
615581539.reviewBody: Eurobar, Hussongs, Papas & Beer, Las Kawas, El Manguito... Just to mention a few of them, venues, food, party, entertainment... this is the main street where party and happenings take place in town, if you come down to Ensenada you must visit it when the sun goes down I will recommend start with a few shots at Hussongs and then God (if you believe) will tell. 100% guaranteed fun. If you come with your car, park it in the pay parking in order not to get an unwanted surprise.Be respectful and tip nicely and you will be treated like a king. No tracksuit or sweat pants allowed in mostly any of the nice venues.

613967871.name: First street
613967871.author: a TripAdvisor user
613967871.reviewBody: It nice lot of tourist stuff to buy tequila shops trying to sell u bottles and papa\'s and beer . It got little bit of everything good place to go take a nice walk

611937646.name: As expected
611937646.author: a TripAdvisor user
611937646.reviewBody: Tourist prices. Tons of stuff you can buy. Restaurants and shops. Try the street stalls for the best prices on food.\nIf you come in on the cruise and are walking, this is your place to go.

606783015.name: Good time
606783015.author: a TripAdvisor user
606783015.reviewBody: When you come here most stores will be selling the same souvenirs from store to store. Some have a few differences but not much unless you go into a specialty store/boutique. Still a good time to walk around and shop for souvenirs. There\u2019s several restaurants or food carts (which are better than the restaurants!) throughout. Most of the stores take credit cards and will take US dollars too. Kids enjoyed it, lots for them to see. Stores close early evening and only the restaurants/bars remain open later. Recommend to use comfortable walking shoes as there is a lot to see.

594419027.name: Super Cute!
594419027.author: a TripAdvisor user
594419027.reviewBody: Super cute destination, you will basically find everything here, from food to entertainment to alcohol to shopping and COFFEE!  Love this place.

592217407.name: Great restaurants and food
592217407.author: a TripAdvisor user
592217407.reviewBody:
I went here in summer 2018. The food are amazing (both restaurants and street food). Ensenada is famous for sea food. So, you will enjoy lots of great sea food (their fish tacos are the best). For 7-8 US dollars, you can grab great restaurant food (one meal). For 3-5 US dollars, you can have great street food that will fill you up. I recommend street food though. You can try different varieties from different vendors. 

Safety: this area is very safe. There is a police station about one block away from the street. I was walking alone at midnight and didn't feel tiniest bit unsafe. 

Cleanliness: this area is very clean and well maintained. Couple of blocks away from here is a port where lots of cruise ships stop. Therefore, they have tried to make this area touristy to attract the cruise passenger. 

Must go place in Ensenada in my opinion.

589163403.name: Cheap and easy souvenirs
589163403.author: a TripAdvisor user
589163403.reviewBody: We drove to the area and walked around town. Found parking for $5 for my hubby\'s truck and then toured around.  A lot of places are accommodating for lack of Spanish and the area is quaint.  We went on Monday and a lot of places were closed, but came back around on Tuesday.   To get to the area driving there\'s a toll 37 pesos or roughly $2, accepts cash or card for the tolls \n

580627165.name: fun to stroll and shop
580627165.author: a TripAdvisor user
580627165.reviewBody: I love this town.  I have been here many times and at first did not like it.  I have since just enjoyed what it has to offer.  I have purchased leather and blankets and still use them today 2 years later.  Also discovered that if you are shopping, ask for tequila and they will happily give you a shot!!  We ate at a corner tiny restaurant and had the best meal ever.  We met some locals from america who retired there and got some great insight.  I am going back in July and can\'t wait!

577911925.name: The Ecclectic First Street, Ensenada
577911925.author: a TripAdvisor user
577911925.reviewBody: I loved strolling along this street in late afternoon as we made our way to Cantina Hussong\'s -- where according to local lore, the margherita was invented.

574463307.name: Disappointing
574463307.author: a TripAdvisor user
574463307.reviewBody: Stopped here for a day on our 4 day cruise.  Didn\'t have a huge expectation of what we\'d find.  Good thing.  Very little to do but mill around shops and restaurants/bars that had the same wares and promotions.  Had a beer at an outdoor bar where several men stood around on the sidewalk - looking like bouncers but it was 11am.  Definitely don\'t need to go back.

573852913.name: The Uniquea Shop is a must see.
573852913.author: a TripAdvisor user
573852913.reviewBody: This shop has an amazing variety of interesting and reasonably priced gifts. Located downtown on Av Lopez Mateo between Riveroll and Alvarado.  Proceeds help fund a home where a wonderful Canadian couple Sandy and Randy take in young girls and give them love, food, shelter, schooling and job training. Next time in Ensenada, stop by the shop - many items are made by the girls. Or consider donating to the cause. They can use money, clothing, toiletries. For more info, you can check them out oncten.org and look under Missionaries and then Mexico.

567045535.name: Always seems to happen!
567045535.author: a TripAdvisor user
567045535.reviewBody:
The City of Ensenada invested $$$ into this section of town only to scum to the darn tourists and booze cruises! 
The result is too many vendors selling trinkets too many vendors selling Viagra and the artisans and locals moving elsewhere. 
Now the number of Bars out numbers all other businesses.
Even Hussong’s has been regulated to a side street......

564003862.name: Nice place to go out
564003862.author: a TripAdvisor user
564003862.reviewBody: Our group went to Le GARAGE it was fun and had good drinks and if you don\'t feel like being in a crowded area upstairs you can go downstairs and chill.

563999840.name: Fun Times in First Street, Ensenada!
563999840.author: a TripAdvisor user
563999840.reviewBody: In February, I had the opportunity of bringing some fellow teachers/clients for a Girl-Get-Away/Spanish Immersion weekend to Ensenada and Guadalupe Valley wine country. Our hotel was located in what I consider the "heart" of Ensenada, First Street. Even though it is the crossroad for tourists embarking from the cruise lines, because it was still early in the season and less touristy, we experienced seeing the native "Ensenadians" living their lives. We saw them enjoying date nights out in the town, eating meals at nearby restaurants and cafes, and taking Sunday strolls with their families. For our own "Ladies Night" out, we truly saw First Street come alive at night and it delivered. It was an easy walk from our hotel to Papas and Beers. As I always advise my clients, its always safer to walk in groups or taking an uber at night, but we felt relatively safe. Always take in stride that in Ensenada or in Mexico (or really any city in the world, yes, even Paris), you will will see the good, the bad and the funky, but that is truly immersing yourself in a culture. There were cute shops that looked fun and inviting and made us want to come back and shop. I look forward to returning with my next set of language/travel adventurers and experiencing more of this part of town.\n                                  - Melinda Turner, Todos Azul Language Immersion Tours

557784852.name: A LOT OF FUN
557784852.author: a TripAdvisor user
557784852.reviewBody: My favourites - Los Costillos across from El Rey Sol (i spent A LOT of money here but the quality of the silver is excellent), El Rey Sol - i couldn\'t get enough of this restaurant - excellent pastries too! The linen store - i bought a lovely shawl (super heavy cotton) and use it as a table cloth. So many fun places and so many great stores. Take your time. The north end of the street is cheap and cheerful, while the south end is more reserved and refined.

555299230.name: Ensenada is a great place to shop.  The shop owners love to take care of tourists!
555299230.author: a TripAdvisor user
555299230.reviewBody: We arrived on a rainy day.  We do not drink much alcohol.  We thought we would just walk through downtown and see what they had.  We did not expect to spend much, if at all.  We found quality Vanilla!   The good stuff that is hard to find in the US grocery markets.  My wife has been looking for 2 years for simple medium sized sterling silver hoop earrings.  We found them and they were reasonably priced.  I was in Catalina the day before and shirts were over $100 for a button down, collared shirt.  Downtown Ensenada had great shirts for great prices!  I bought two.   The shop keepers are very friendly.  They carry on honest friendly conversation.

555051569.name: A few things to be aware of when shopping here
555051569.author: a TripAdvisor user
555051569.reviewBody: Yes, it is a tourist trap, but it is fun.  Lots of different stores.  A few things you should consider when shopping here.  First, everything is negotiable, the merchants expect that you will dicker with them.  Second, if you are buying jewelry, it is best to buy it from one of the jewelry stores.  Some of the vendor\'s jewelry is not as advertised, but the jewelry stores are really good about making sure their items are real.  Third, don\'t venture off 1st Street to areas you don\'t know, they can get unsafe fairly fast.  The 1st Street area is kept very safe by local police and storekeepers since it is a huge source of revenue.

553219817.name: Touristy but fun environment
553219817.author: a TripAdvisor user
553219817.reviewBody: First street is made for tourists. It has all the typical tourist junk you\u2019d expect: t-shirts, souvenirs, overpriced bars with watered down alcohol, etc. But, there are also some higher end shops where you can kind nice, decently priced jewelry, leather goods, and shells. You need to know what you\u2019re looking for or be ok with getting a little ripped off. It\u2019s still fun to walk up and down the street and feel the environment

552572634.name: Uniquea
552572634.author: a TripAdvisor user
552572634.reviewBody: Beautiful store with a wide range of unique quality gifts! A pleasure to browse through. So many differing types of gifts!

548249282.name: Tons of shops.
548249282.author: a TripAdvisor user
548249282.reviewBody: If you like sterling silver this is the place to go, tons of shops that sell anything silver, just beware some shops sell knockoff Tanzanite, clearly not the real thing. \nMany restaurants and bars also close by, including Starbucks and McDonald\'s.

543461179.name: Street Tacos
543461179.author: a TripAdvisor user
543461179.reviewBody: We were looking for the taco truck parked near McDonalds because one of the TripAdvisor reviewers gave it a thumbs up. We were just off a cruise ship and it was Revolution Day. We followed the parade and came to McDonalds... And there was the truck (well actually a trailer left there by another vehicle. Think Roach Coach.) As soon as the parade was done we crossed the street to the corner across from McDs.\n\nThese guys were busy feeding the parade crowd, but got to us after a short time. Their breaded shrimp taco is fantastic. Shrimp cooked perfectly, covered in a crispy breaded coating. Piping hot and ready to go. I agree these street tacos are King!

539844921.name: Lots of shops
539844921.author: a TripAdvisor user
539844921.reviewBody: If you enjoy shopping set up for tourists or want to be hustled into an eatery, this is your spot. It didn\'t really have much of an appeal to me. There was however one great surprise. When you get to a McDonald\'s (yes, no kidding, those things are everywhere) you can turn left from First Street and find a food truck parked there. The gentleman who owns it said he has been there for something like thirty years ( sorry I can\'t remember exactly how long). They make the absolute best tacos I\'ve ever eaten - and the prices were unbelievably inexpensive. He could have easily charged twice the price or more and I would still be raving about the place. I urge you to go there if you find yourself in this area. The food truck gets a six out of a possible five. The rest of the street - just not for me...

538617580.name: Uniquea is a very unique store on First Street with a unique mission
538617580.author: a TripAdvisor user
538617580.reviewBody: We stopped into this quaint store which features jewellery made by young ladies who live in a safe home in Ensenada. All purchases provide housing, food, clothing and education for these amazing young ladies.

536168647.name: Shopping district
536168647.author: a TripAdvisor user
536168647.reviewBody: Fun shopping experience. Make sure to stay on First Street, the side roads get a little scary. \n\nWe found some amazing deals on fun cheap toys for our kids. It\u2019s a must to experience

533571801.name: great walk!
533571801.author: a TripAdvisor user
533571801.reviewBody: This is the main street from Ensenada, great restaurants, tea and coffee shops, and local stores with region products. you can enjoy this stroll day and night!

532443126.name: Cruise ship port
532443126.author: a TripAdvisor user
532443126.reviewBody:
Glad our tour bus stopped there but typical street vendors lined up both sides of the streets constantly trying to get your sell.
Gets very tried of all the pressure. In fact i would bought more if they weren't begging for business.
We were looking for pure vanilla for baking. We were informed that most pure vanilla at the shops on the street weren't pure. If you want pure vanilla they said stop at a local grocery store where the locals shop. Which we did!

531995641.name: We Enjoyed First Street...
531995641.author: a TripAdvisor user
531995641.reviewBody:
Let me preface this review by saying that we cruised Ensenada for the "cheesy" or "touristy" things. So, First Street delivred for us. Yes, there were people trying to solicit our business at every corner, but I have experienced this during many vacations. The atmosphere was lovely with music, laughter, couples in love, families with children, friends hanging out, and sole travelers. We talked to several locals who gave us a history of the area. The food was decent at a local taco shop where we enjoyed the outdoor seating and live music under a sidewalk canopy.

We opted to visit an "off the beaten path" bar called QueZesos (I believe) instead of the more popular branded bars, and we were glad that we did. There was a rooftop area that allowed us to see the hillside homes and the corner of First Street that intersects near Papas and Beers. The food (pizza) and drinks were very reasonably priced. But, I'd go for the drinks and maybe pass on the pizza and try some tacos in Mexico.

One of the taxi drivers actually help us navigate the streets instead of trying to force us to get a taxi ride. A local at the one of the shops (that we didn't patronize) helped us find what we were looking for in another store. So, everyone wasn't out to make a quick buck (though many were).

We would visit again if ever in Ensenada.

522066118.name: So nice in the summer.
522066118.author: a TripAdvisor user
522066118.reviewBody: So I must admit this was my first trip to Ensenada, so I expected so much and this area delivers. As compared to other areas I visited which had very little night life! This area is all one needs to get that fun night life.The eateries are terrific and the bars are great also!!!

520108242.name: Cruise ship drops off passengers 3 x week, caters to tourists: bars, shops, food
520108242.author: a TripAdvisor user
520108242.reviewBody: We stayed three nights in Ensenada through airbnb. When the cruise ship was there it was soooo busy with loud music and lots of street vendors, When the cruise ship was gone most of the stores were closed and few street vendors. It was fun to see it both ways. Many people approach you and ask you to buy things. Some of the shops didn\'t haggle, but anyone walking around would. There is a light/water show with live music in the evenings at 7 or 8pm from Tuesday -Saturday -just a street or two away near the water in the pavilion area. I would not want to sleep in this part of the city, we were a mile away and we could hear hear the music. There were a lot of shops that catered to tourists.

518965200.name: Good for s short stop
518965200.author: a TripAdvisor user
518965200.reviewBody: Best advice is to find a place with a set price for a bucket of beers. Don\'t get fooled into paying more than normal. The guys will do whatever they can to get a dollar out of you. Don\'t trust them and ask around before committing to a bar. If you have the money to blow, knock yourself out but you been warned.

518644377.name: Lots of pubs and cool stuff
518644377.author: a TripAdvisor user
518644377.reviewBody: My wife an I brought her parents here for a family wedding this place is just so awesome probably the most friendliest of all the Mexican places I\'ve been to.

507954223.name: Shops and Food Galore!
507954223.author: a TripAdvisor user
507954223.reviewBody: Street vendors a selling handmade crafts line the streets, wonderfully colorful restaurants and food vendors selling all sorts of great stuff... but slightly touristy and slightly overpriced, but just slightly.

505320337.name: a fun walk with lots of places to stop and eat, and or, drink
505320337.author: a TripAdvisor user
505320337.reviewBody: this is the main drag in ensenada. we were in ensenada for three nights and walked it each one. there are so many places to eat, we loved the glassed in ones right on the sidewalk! kind of like Paris, without the french. live music, too loud sometimes, playing on the street. wonderful bakeries and coffee shops. of course we walked into Hussongs (and right out again!). passed by Papas and Beer......shoud i say we are in our 60\'s! all in all it\'s a fun area, just about 5 or 6 blocks long. one evening we walked toward the water and the huge mast, and were surprised to see a wonderful dancing fountain lit up in different colors!

500554033.name: Love Calle Primera- had a store there for many years. a fun place and a lot of unique gifts to take home
500554033.author: a TripAdvisor user
500554033.reviewBody: A trip to Ensenada is NOT complete without a visit to Calle Primera- ( First Street) lots of good shops, food and drinks- more than you can do in one day!!

470862257.name: Waste of time
470862257.author: a TripAdvisor user
470862257.reviewBody: Came here as part of a \'wine tasting and shopping\' tour from Carnival cruise. Just some shops selling crappy stuff. If you want to buy trinkets, it\'s ok. Bargain like crazy if you buy anything. It\'s a shady area so we got back to the bus after half hour or so.

466650721.name: Active
466650721.author: a TripAdvisor user
466650721.reviewBody: More shopping...shop after shop of the same items, and people trying to get you to visit, to drink their tequila, etc. Fun, and lots of activity, but the barking gets old pretty quickly.

464608388.name: Meh.
464608388.author: a TripAdvisor user
464608388.reviewBody: Sort of sleazy feel to it. Didn\'t really feel all that safe. The shops sold the same kitschy "I went to Mexico" souvenir. It was just ok for me.

464577870.name: OK
464577870.author: a TripAdvisor user
464577870.reviewBody: Same old stuff that they sold 40 years ago. All the curio stores selling twisted Corona bottles and ceramic frogs playing pool. I grain of rice with your name on it or the ten commandments and of course Oaxaca women with their babies strapped around them. If you have seen it once who needs to see it again. If your wife is shopping go to Hussongs and down two or three.

459870515.name: Tourist trap
459870515.author: a TripAdvisor user
459870515.reviewBody: You can tell most of their customers are dropped on their door step from the cruise ships. Good to get trinkets for souvenirs. Most are willing to bargain and cash is king.

457378597.name: Stay Away From the Silver Shops!!!!
457378597.author: a TripAdvisor user
457378597.reviewBody: This was an add on after a wine country tour with Carnival.  This is our second time doing the Wine tour and it is wonderful.  Our tour guide (female) dropped us in the shopping district directing us to a specific silver shop...stating that most of the others sold silver plate jewelry.  $300.00 and 2 wearings later we have unwearable silver plate necklaces.  Stay away from silver in Mexico!!!!!

451248431.name: All kinds of places for all kinds of people
451248431.author: a TripAdvisor user
451248431.reviewBody: Everything you look for on one street. From restaurants, bars to cute little coffee shops, tattoo shops and souvenir stores. I recommend going in the evening, maybe walk around a little bit and catch the night lights. It is quite the experience.

450314168.name: Beautiful scenery
450314168.author: a TripAdvisor user
450314168.reviewBody: I went at night and the place looks beautiful with all the lights, there is a variety of souvenir shops and other and restaurants of all types so you can decide from a variety of options, the place is very tourist friendly.

448897816.name: Walking around and good food
448897816.author: a TripAdvisor user
448897816.reviewBody: First street has all sorts of shops, good restaurants and place to have coffee or ice cream. Worth visiting and walking around.

448732043.name: Big disappointment.
448732043.author: a TripAdvisor user
448732043.reviewBody: Beggars of all ages. Overpriced goods (junk) with aggressive vendors. Unfair exchange rates and hidden charges in the restaurants.

444104391.name: Lots of hawkers, some aggressive
444104391.author: a TripAdvisor user
444104391.reviewBody: Visited today on a day trip from our cruise ship. We saw on Tripadvisor that First Street was only about three fourths of a mile from the cruise port and had planned on walking, but they had buses lined up to take visitors to First Street, $2 to get there and $1 to come back to the cruise ship. It was heartening to see the double layer of Mexican security coming back to our ship, once on the bus and a second time at their welcome center, (then of course the third time to get onboard). So we took the bus to First Street and using the service was seamless. First street has the usual shops, and a large number of pharmacies, and restaurants and bars. We didn\'t buy anything but enjoyed walking around. You can get a number of medications, clothing, touristy kind of things, and pottery here. We enjoyed the colony of sea lions where the ship\'s anchor tied up and got a lot of good photos. I would recommend what others have mentioned, to stay on First Street. We took a side street back to the building where you get on the bus (you need to go inside a building and the buses are in the back), and on the side street ran into a partially dressed person who might have been mentally ill, but he wasn\'t dangerous.

443594087.name: First visit to Ensenada, Mexico
443594087.author: a TripAdvisor user
443594087.reviewBody:
On a Californian Coastal cruise we visited Ensenada.

Our day was long, full and busy! We had never been to Ensenada before so we're full of anticipation and quite excited.

Our tour guide took us to see some old buildings that had significance locally but did not impress me much. There was no signage anywhere; no people inside this large wooden structure and nothing written anywhere! At the entrance are @ 12 stalls selling hand-made jewellery; hand-knitted tops; bags; fridge magnets; souvenirs. Post-tour everyone was given a drink of their choice. On our way out we looked around the stalls again and bought a couple of souvenirs to much nodding and smiling from the stall holders!

Our tour guide was a delightful chap and I appreciated his help climbing aboard the minibus on my crutches. Next he took us to visit Bodegas de Santo Tomas.  There were trays of tasty bread laid out for us and samples of each of their many wines. Delicious! Several people bought wine to take home.  

We spent a pleasant hour or two exploring First Street.  Lots of different shops selling clothes; luggage; alcohol; sweets; ice cream (lots!); small cafes and restaurants.  We visited a jewellery store and I bought a pretty necklace and ear-rings (for half the asking price).  If I was "done" then am not bothered.  The set is very pretty and much remarked upon by family and friends.

Interesting city to visit and quite different to any city we've ever visited previously.

435642933.name: The actal name is Lopez Mateos
435642933.author: a TripAdvisor user
435642933.reviewBody:
Although many refer to this as first street it is actually Lopez Mateos and is the tourist district (actual downtown or Centro is 5 blocks) away lots of shops, bars and restaurants and all types of food.

Most people in this area speak English, but if you speak Spanish so much the better, do go to an ATM and get pesos to pay with, you well do much better on buying things or paying a restaurant bill.  The current exchange rate is 18.5 up to 19.1 to 1 dollar

You well find the people to be very friendly and helpful,  Please do not give to the beggars the city is trying to discourage them from being in this area.

Do not be afraid to try the street stands as there are some very good.  If you see a number of the locals around them and the police stopping by you can be fairly certain its good.

I have lived here for 14+ years and find it to be a very nice city

435621680.name: Pharmacies and dentistsfor low level tourism.
435621680.author: a TripAdvisor user
435621680.reviewBody: I had my expectations but the street is fully of very low level souvenir stores, in fact the worst I have ever seen. I collect magnets from my trips and I struggled a lot to find one, quite lousy and cost me 5 US as if I were in DC. sad and poor. i would not dare walking there by night

427640161.name: Jewelry shopping fun and sunset margaritas
427640161.author: a TripAdvisor user
427640161.reviewBody: This is a great area to meander and check out some of the great silver jewelry Mexico is famous for. There are also lots of boutiques that offer modern pieces that are unique and make great gifts or statement pieces for yourself. My two favorite boutiques were Bulldog and one inside the restaurant Rey del Sol. Bulldog offers ver contemporary boho clothes and accessories and Rey del Sol has lots of home accents. Both places offer higher quality items that don\'t break the bank. \nAfter shopping you can get a ceviche tostada at la Guerrense food cart on the corner of Alvarado and finish you day at the Riviera with a margarita from Bar Andaluz, the birthplace of the drink.

414595197.name: Fun
414595197.author: a TripAdvisor user
414595197.reviewBody:
This is in the Zona Turistico of Ensenada, easy safe walking with lots of shops and restaurants.
Interesting and fun, good shops, be smart, ask questions 
There were a variety of restaurants and the people were very friendly and helpful.

408547906.name: lots of shopping
408547906.author: a TripAdvisor user
408547906.reviewBody: Lots of stores for everyone to hit. You can find anything and everything, including buying your favorite bottle of alcohol.

403747524.name: Ensenada Visit
403747524.author: a TripAdvisor user
403747524.reviewBody: This is the tourist area with lots of shops, restaurants, and drinking establishments.  This is similar to most tourist shopping in Mexico.  It is near the Malacon so a short walk to visit there and observe the bay area.

400080372.name: Busy until  3-4 am every day
400080372.author: a TripAdvisor user
400080372.reviewBody: I stayed at a hotel right on Avenue Mateo Lopez (one block away from Papas y Beer and Hussong\'s Cantina.  Street was busy in both directions from 2 pm until long after 2 am.  Many bars/restaurants open and loud music playing from each one.  Felt safe even though there were several locals/gringos sleeping in doorways later in the evening.  If driving, watch out...locals don\'t necessarily stop at the stop signs.

397067839.name: Good deals but don\'t buy silver
397067839.author: a TripAdvisor user
397067839.reviewBody: You can get good deals but be careful . Especially the days with the cruise ship in, many stores have commission salesmen, that double or even triple the real price to bargain with you. Most people lose out and get ripped of this way. Better go to the stores that have fixed prices and mark their merchandise. This way you can compare the prices. Below the Plaza hotel between Gastelum and Miramar street is a store owned by an older couple that operate their business for more than 30 years and always give you the best prices. The name of the store is curios El Sol at number 520. And finally , don\'t buy any silver. 90% is fake although many salesmen are very good in convincing you otherwise.

392687685.name: Definitely worth seeing, but some aggressive tactics on display
392687685.author: a TripAdvisor user
392687685.reviewBody: Fun but ultimately exhausting with sales tactics so aggressive they leave Tijuana and even Morocco in the dust. Prepare for everyone to have a hand out - "hey Amiga/amigo, come in my shop!" Some vendors or pub touters will even step in your path or try to follow you. It\'s a pity, since some of the shops have interesting merchandise that we would have liked to explore at our own pace, but sometimes had to leave since we were basically being chased around. Some places are an exception though and if you firmly state you would just like to have a look, you\'ll be given some space. We did find some lovely children\'s clothes and curiosidades in some of the shops. There\'s also a lot of crap, but it\'s interesting, colourful crap.\n\nDo try the street food - the tacos pescados and mariscos in particular. Keep some loose change in your pocket for the down-and-out women and children who are grateful for any pesos you can spare. Avoid the big pubs aimed at the cruise ship passengers - smaller bars and restaurants are better, particularly those frequented by locals.

391569782.name: Good Variety of Shops, Resturants and activity.
391569782.author: a TripAdvisor user
391569782.reviewBody: Very busy place with lots of action.   Great shops, variety of resturants and bars.  Parking was a little difficult, easier with a small car.

389962967.name: Overpriced because people coming off the cruise ships come here first
389962967.author: a TripAdvisor user
389962967.reviewBody: There are many sights better than First Street in Ensenada and the only reason it is even on the map is because this is where passengers from cruise ships land and it is within walking distance. The food is subpar, overpriced and the restaurants don\u2019t even super authentic flavors. If you just drive a few miles inland, you\u2019ll get much better food and much cheaper. The thing is the tourists don\u2019t have easy transportation so they are relegated to these areas. Even though the prices are inflated greatly here, it\u2019s still not too expensive but just expensive relatively.

385071970.name: Typical Tourist Mexico Shopping
385071970.author: a TripAdvisor user
385071970.reviewBody: The people were hospitable.  Younger people were having a GREAT time partying in the drinking spots and spilled onto the streets with drunkenness and dancing. There is nothing special about 1st street area shopping.

384119529.name: Interesting
384119529.author: a TripAdvisor user
384119529.reviewBody: This place has really gotten a lot bigger. More small shops and restaurants everywhere. A can not miss when in Ensenada.

382352967.name: Free WiFi Zone
382352967.author: a TripAdvisor user
382352967.reviewBody: There are Night Clubs, Bars, Cantinas, Pubs, etc., we went on Saturday night and was busy. You can find all kind of bars with live bands or Karaoke or Salsa clubs; the ambience feel pretty safe and there are free Wifi that was very convenient since our data service was horrible and we were able to used Uber in our way back. Just be aware that prices are little high and they take your dollars at very lower conversion. So I recommend that uses money exchange locals with NO COMMISSION.

382070147.name: A must when here
382070147.author: a TripAdvisor user
382070147.reviewBody: Had a blast walking and shopping here.  My kids found so many things that they wanted.  All the shop owners were nice to them and worked with us on a price we were both happy on.  Wish we could have seen it under the lights.  That would have been fun but on a cruse and in port you have limited time.  Make the most of yours and visit here.  You\'ll be happy you did.

381948500.name: Nothing new
381948500.author: a TripAdvisor user
381948500.reviewBody: Well, there is nothing different to do in this street... A lot of shopping and not very good restaurants.\nI will definitely go somewhere else if you are short of time.

381245104.name: picturesque street
381245104.author: a TripAdvisor user
381245104.reviewBody: Full of art and crafts shops, nice and cozy caffes and restaurants. At the end of the street you can find bars and more night life place to visit

378872101.name: Up & Coming Mateos is no longer only for los gringos
378872101.author: a TripAdvisor user
378872101.reviewBody: I have watched Mateos evolve into a vast variety of eclectic along with informal restaurants, intriguing shops, and...wonderful Ensenadans. Worthy of strolling, day or night, when the cruise ships are at sea!

375484315.name: Seeing something new each time we walked it
375484315.author: a TripAdvisor user
375484315.reviewBody: We were here for 3 days and walked  it probably 4 times.  Everytime we did, it seemed like we were seeing something we didn\'t see the time before.  We bought windchimes and things for the grandkids.  It was extremely clean and well kept up.  When you visit, make sure you have enough time to stop for a drink and eat!

374298406.name: Like Any Older US Town Main Street
374298406.author: a TripAdvisor user
374298406.reviewBody: The government spends a lot of money keeping this area nice and clean.  Especially with all the cruise ships coming in all the time.  The stores are a nice mix of high end galleries and jewelry, all the way down to tourist keepsakes.  There are also a lot of nice restaurants.  At night this becomes the party zone.  Especially on the corner of Ruiz.  So if you like to go out and drink the night away, then this is the place for you.  Not my cup of tea, but to each his own.  :)

372233947.name: Family Baja trip
372233947.author: a TripAdvisor user
372233947.reviewBody: Fun stay in Ensenada. We walked to near by shops and eateries. We stayed at Hotel Corona and Spa. We had delicious appetizers and margaritas at El Corralito.

370299549.name: Only visited because it was a cruise ship stop
370299549.author: a TripAdvisor user
370299549.reviewBody: I\'ve actually been here twice on 2 different cruises over the years. It\'s not a stop I\'d ever pick on my own and quite frankly should have just stayed on the boat. It\'s dirty and you get haggled constantly with the same stupid lines! I understand they are just trying to make a living but C\'mon!! Merchandise is tacky and cheap for the most part. There are some finer shops but that\'s not the norm. There are bars and restaurants but I was on a cruise ship so never ate or drank at any and wouldn\'t want to anyway.

370264265.name: A shopping area - to take a stroll
370264265.author: a TripAdvisor user
370264265.reviewBody: We, a group of eight, friends and spouses, were in the port city of Ensenada as a part of our cruise. We walked from the cruise terminal to the shopping area.This place is nice for a stroll. There are a number of shops, cafes and restaurants. One can pick-up a variety of stuff, such as souvenirs.

367531748.name: there are jewels here
367531748.author: a TripAdvisor user
367531748.reviewBody: this is the principal "tourist strip". However, among the cheap junk, there are some places that are lovely. Many of the best places are at the far south of the street \nThere you will find the elegant Patio Bar (top notch margaritas); the fabulous french pastry at El Rey Sol, There is a wonderful leather boot shop (high quality Mexican made) and a furniture store that will make you wish you"d bought a big wallet and an empty truck. Hogaza Hogaza is an excellent little coffee shop and bakery with nice lunches and treats. There is a local wine store if you haven\'t time to drive out to the Valley. Just behind the Patio Bar you will find a nice little shop that specializes in well made and designed Mexican made resort fashion. At the north end, there are bars, hawkers and yes, occasionally, drunks. However, if you can spend the time to sort through this, you will find a great little oyster bar, and a charming shop that specializes in the true Mexican crafts from the mainland. We spend several months a year in Ensenada. At  least once a week, we park and walk the street, buy some pastry, have lunch, get some bread. There are still pleasures and treasures to be found on First (Lopez Mateo)

367075233.name: Great tourist spot
367075233.author: a TripAdvisor user
367075233.reviewBody: Amazing tourist venue, the selection of shops is extensive. Clothing, leather goods and all sorts of souvenirs. I do not recommend the pharmaceuticals, mainly generics and cannot be verified as name brands. Quite a wonderful selection of restaurants and bars.

365802136.name: nice and clean and they don\'t bother you too much to buy stuff
365802136.author: a TripAdvisor user
365802136.reviewBody: nice and clean, lots to see and if you are hungry and thirst, good place to be but it caters to the tourists

365721374.name: Fun place to just walk and explore the Mexican culture
365721374.author: a TripAdvisor user
365721374.reviewBody: I love walking here there\'s so many fun things to see especially because it\'s by the beach and filled with bars

365478372.name: really great place
365478372.author: a TripAdvisor user
365478372.reviewBody: I was very impressed by encenada. This past April I had the chance to go down there with my family, and I was under the impression that it would be similar to Tijuana, but I can definitely say that it\'s really clean, with great restaurant venues, and the Malecon is clean with some restaurants and great sea food market .

363730718.name: Lots of street vendors, restaurants, bars and begging children!!
363730718.author: a TripAdvisor user
363730718.reviewBody: Typical tourist street. Lots of coffee shops, restaurants, bars, stores. Street is filled with street vendors( most selling the same items).  We were able to find " Mexican Jumping Beans", so that was nice...Lots of begging children!!

359466006.name: Been here before, and it is just people trying to sell you crap
359466006.author: a TripAdvisor user
359466006.reviewBody: I guess I am a bit jaded, but the street is filled with street vendors all trying to sell you the same thing as the last 20 you just walked by. The restaurants are not very good and the margaritas are made with sprite and crappy tequila. There is also a drug store every 10 shops selling Viagra and such. If you want drugs, ask the price at at least 2-4 shops, because the prices very widely. don\'t just take the first one because you think the price is cheap, they are all check, just some more that the others.

357774972.name: Orale\'
357774972.author: a TripAdvisor user
357774972.reviewBody: a nice place to find food and drinks!\nthe night life is great! in the Day there are fresh seafood vendors \nthat have fresh stuff!

356132005.name: Tourista Shangri-La!
356132005.author: a TripAdvisor user
356132005.reviewBody: All the Mexican trinkets you could ask for! The vendors will give you a bargain on days when the cruise ships are not here

355871952.name: Enjoy the lively scene
355871952.author: a TripAdvisor user
355871952.reviewBody: Enjoy the easy life walking by little shops, restaurants and taco stands.  There are some traditional shops selling souvenirs and some "finer" art gallery-type shops

354579570.name: A beautiful and famous street!
354579570.author: a TripAdvisor user
354579570.reviewBody: The first street is lovely! Coffee shops, restaurants, bars, stores, the lights at night looks beautiful, its safe to walk around even at night.

354531388.name: Quaint and eclectic mix of shops and restaurants
354531388.author: a TripAdvisor user
354531388.reviewBody: There were tons of shops and restaurants to fill an afternoon. I felt safe walking around during the day and evenings. It was pretty quiet in March period. There was some street musicians and some music coming out from a restaurant nearby with a band.

344867358.name: Main Shopping and Dinning Area
344867358.author: a TripAdvisor user
344867358.reviewBody: This is the main shopping and dinning area in Ensenada for tourists. Many street vendors and shops, most selling the same items. You will find some unique shops selling art and a stained glass shop that makes their items on site.

341982718.name: Typical high pressure Mexican souvenirs..with one exception
341982718.author: a TripAdvisor user
341982718.reviewBody:
First street is like any other tourist trap shopping district in a Mexican tourist town. However, we did find a shop with some wonderfully polite, respectful folks and good prices on clean, quality merchandise. 

Alina shop, right next to El Cid hotel was a delightful shop. Very personable owners that have been in this location for 20+ years. All merchandise is clean and well presented. Give it a try!

340515338.name: this is THE place to start your Ensenada visit
340515338.author: a TripAdvisor user
340515338.reviewBody:
First street is one of the most tourist-y places you'll find in Ensenada. 
- Gift shops
- restaurants
- bars
- massage parlors
- cafes
The closer you get to the north part, the more loud and party the mood. The closer you get to the south, the more family friendly it gets. Also good for a nice walk and to obtain more information about the city and it's surroundings.

336999937.name: Very nice
336999937.author: a TripAdvisor user
336999937.reviewBody: It\'s a really nice turistic area, reminds me a lot of my childhood, how much I loved going to Ensenada. There are a lot of stores with very interesting things for sale and really good restaurants ( a little expensive though) but the visit is worth it.

335533663.name: Curios shopping during the day, amazing night life thereafter!
335533663.author: a TripAdvisor user
335533663.reviewBody: It\'s a fun street to Walk up and down during the day. There are plenty of small coffee shops, pastry shops and stores to take the people watching in and buy some local items. At night this street is consistently turned into the best place for nightlife and action. With several clubs, bars and great atmosphere, look no further than 1st St. for more than enough entertainment at night, until you drop!

331935870.name: Fun time
331935870.author: a TripAdvisor user
331935870.reviewBody: Our cruise ship stopped in Ensenada. We walked the shopping district. Sure the people kind of heckle you to buy, but you learn to say no.  Each store we stopped at they were ready to strike a deal telling us we were their first customer of the day even though they had been open for a couple hours. It was fun. A very cultural experience. Got some great fish tacos.

331309678.name: Short bus ride from the cruise stop
331309678.author: a TripAdvisor user
331309678.reviewBody: We came here during our day stop off the Carnival cruise. It took roughly 15 mins by mini bus from the cruise dock. There are plenty of shops to buy souvenirs and other small knick knacks. Plenty of small restaurants alongside the walk way as well.

330841160.name: Good tourist stop
330841160.author: a TripAdvisor user
330841160.reviewBody: 1st st or Lopez Mateos to most is a tourist street filled with shops, street vendors, pharmacies, restaurants and bars. On cruise ship days it is very busy. Take a couple of hours and stroll the street on both sides. There are lots of hissers but no real problems. It is safe.

330590463.name: small downtown in ensenada
330590463.author: a TripAdvisor user
330590463.reviewBody: walked there for couple hours before dinner. we tried massage shop and restaurant after being tired of walking. I would say exostic experience

326989543.name: First Street....WOW!!
326989543.author: a TripAdvisor user
326989543.reviewBody: We went to the First Street...WOW!  What a street!  Only two ways...of course, they have some streets, but they have no name.  We took quite a bit of time when we got back to the Blow Hole.  It was enjoyable!  There are many, many bars...some not too shabby, and who knows what you want!  Strippers, etc!

324259701.name: Always a good time
324259701.author: a TripAdvisor user
324259701.reviewBody: Been coming here some 50+ years, still ready for another good time. Shopping is what it is, some good jewelry spots, pharmacy with cheap ibuprofen, the trinket spots are basically the same, but we do have out favorite eating and drinking spots, that we keep going back to. Hussongs is always a good time.

319041539.name: Oh, you like Raiders, I got something for you!
319041539.author: a TripAdvisor user
319041539.reviewBody: Bad idea to wear sports affiliated gear here. We were approached by everyone selling anything NFL related.  I do not like the lion cub on display where you pay $25 to "save its habitat".  The $1 beers were just what you needed on a hot day.  The bracelet makers and name on rice makers made my son\'s day.

317609560.name: Walked the streets of Ensenada
317609560.author: a TripAdvisor user
317609560.reviewBody: We walked the streets of Ensenada. Saw the same stuff in every shop and were called friend by all the shop owners. The least they might have done was call me amigo. After all we were in Mexico.

316698461.name: Safe Tourist Trap
316698461.author: a TripAdvisor user
316698461.reviewBody: This street caters to the tourists. They all speak English, much better than people back home. They are friendly, but they do have an agenda (to sell you something). We bought some jewelry and I\'m pretty sure we could have gotten it much cheaper if we had just walked away. They will follow you down the street.

309825368.name: Loved Ensenada, Mexico
309825368.author: a TripAdvisor user
309825368.reviewBody: We took a taxi to town.  We felt safe.  We shopped, walked around the town.  There were people trying to sell their items, but they were not pushy or annoying.  We had dinner in a local restaurant, they were very pleasant and friendly.  We also went the local, historical bar.  There was special for their local beer which was fantastic.  We loved that

306695756.name: Something for Everyone
306695756.author: a TripAdvisor user
306695756.reviewBody: CALLE PRIMERO or FIRST STREET has Something for everyone who is in the mood for shopping, browsing, dining, snacking, drinking or JUST HAVING FUN!!!!!\nThe old town shopping district has had a near complete makeover from the past several years when tourism was limited because of the economy... and a lack of cruise ship stops.... But it is now back into full swing.  So whether you are looking for bargains on everything from TACOS or Souvenirs....please stop in again.... you will like the fresh look!

305557034.name: The new Ensenada
305557034.author: a TripAdvisor user
305557034.reviewBody: The cruise ships bring so many lively people to Ensenada, and the good news is they do not take the rare parking spaces.  First street has such a variety of restaurants and upscale silver shops.

302980260.name: Ensenada... A must!
302980260.author: a TripAdvisor user
302980260.reviewBody: Great shopping and fun! Got a swimsuit, t shirt with Ensenada motif and souvenirs! Visited a Buddhist themed store and cafe and the fun filled restaurants and cantinas. Come when the cruises are here in Ensenada that\'s when the ambiance steps up a notch... There\'s also upscale shopping and dinning... and wine tastings there, too. Ensenada, here we come!

302009247.name: Go to Have Fun
302009247.author: a TripAdvisor user
302009247.reviewBody: Hmmm . . . okay.  Not my best trip.  I have been to Panama City and I guess this is better than that experience.
