I have not been to Cabo or Mazatlan, but I am thinking that may be a much better experience.  I have been four times, all during a cruise.  I have not been overly impressed during any visit.  If your goal is to go to the bars and drink tequila - you will probably have a fabulous time.  Otherwise, I would stick to cities that are a little more developed.  Ensenada, while it has cleaned up, is still very rough around the edges.

300697595.name: Ensenada Espectacular
300697595.author: a TripAdvisor user
300697595.reviewBody: Fun! Great music and lots of fun! bought so many decorative pieces for our home and office. Beautiful place and great people. Fish tacos and bottled soda awesome! very lighted and safe for everyone. Kids go nuts wanting to buy everything as

300478347.name: Warnecke Birthday Bash
300478347.author: a TripAdvisor user
300478347.reviewBody: Awsome!!! Great food, great music. People where awesome. Great place a couples get away.  Weather was awesome.  Margaritas,  mango, guava,  strawberry,  have to try them all.

290884584.name: Best Tourist Walk in Baja
290884584.author: a TripAdvisor user
290884584.reviewBody: This a very great tourist zone in the heart of Ensenada, with a friendly and safe environment able to walk 24/7. With lots of places to visit like shops, restaurants, and bars.

287428561.name: Experience Ensenada !
287428561.author: a TripAdvisor user
287428561.reviewBody: This is a fun place to truly experience Ensenada and all its magic...by day lots of fun shops with lovely art, jewelry, curios, pottery and clothing, oh, you have to buy a blanket...they are handy for the beach! The restaurants are fabulous...El Rey Sol, great food, and drinks...also the fish taco stands are fun and tasty treats...experience the same area by night and it is a hopping place...from Husongs THE BEST Margaritas:)!) to Papas and Beer..Have a wonderful Ensenada Experience.

286490757.name: Avoid
286490757.author: a TripAdvisor user
286490757.reviewBody: Stay on ship! Nothing here but begging children and merchants chasing you down. Cruise lines take notice and find some where else to dock! Oh yes there was several places to eat and drink but thats it.

282204469.name: Tourist strip ... not the best place to visit Ensenada if you want a good impression!
282204469.author: a TripAdvisor user
282204469.reviewBody: Tourist strip ... not the best place to visit Ensenada if you want a good impression!\n\nToo many hawkers yelling at you about going into their bar or buying their merchandise.

281724066.name: First impressions of Ensenada
281724066.author: a TripAdvisor user
281724066.reviewBody: My husband and I have lived in Ensenada for a year. Life in the US midwest is much different than it is here.  We were so annoyed in the beginning when women with children would hold out their cup for money as we passed by. And when we saw the children being taught by their mothers to do the same.  We just couldn\'t understand how people could live this way.  As time went by and we became more acclimated to the way of life here, it hasn\'t necessarily changed our feelings about begging on the streets or being "hounded or followed around."  We just know now why it is this way.  It is a custom. Been this way for centuries. There are no jobs for people; many have kept to the life of begging. It is all they know. Others have developed innovative ways of selling whatever they can to survive and sustain their families. Many Mexicans are hard working people. All around this town the local people help them by dropping a few coins into a cup or the grocery store baggers hand when he loads your bags into the car, or by buying a flower from a seller on the street, or paying a musician a bit to play you a song.  If  they didn\'t ask you to contribute or sell you something, they would have no money at all.\n   We have learned how to deal with this lifestyle; to offer the respect the people here deserve, we simply shake our heads while saying "No Gracias" with a smile.  You will get a smile back. Guaranteed.

280634127.name: Not much to see
280634127.author: a TripAdvisor user
280634127.reviewBody: My wife and I drove down to Ensenada, Mexico for a fun trip.  It was fun alright ? We walked on First Street.  We saw a poor woman with 3 kids, one on her arms and 2 followed her. She asked for money, so i gave her one buck US. As we walked towards the end of the street, a whole bunch of children followed us and asked for money. Dear Lord, have mercy.\nWe walked to the beach and saw Cruise ship on the water unloading so many tourists. On the way back we saw street vender parked on the corner with policemen on their motor cycle eating seafood.  So we ordered and ate, afterwards we wondered our stomach can handled it or not. It was a friendly place but not much to see.

280491669.name: Felt hounded to make purchases
280491669.author: a TripAdvisor user
280491669.reviewBody: I took a cruise to Ensenada and was looking forward to spending the day shopping. I hadn\'t realized that that shop keepers literally follow you around the store asking what you\'d like and trying to get you to haggle. Even walking down the street you are bombarded.  I understand this is the custom. I just didn\'t respond well to the constant pressure. There was nothing relaxing about the experience. I\'d hoped the prices would make the visit worth it, but I could find similar items in Los Angeles (olvera street) at the same price.

277634499.name: Please treat the market people with respect
277634499.author: a TripAdvisor user
277634499.reviewBody: They will give you good deals and play your heckling game if you like, but respect them, this is there life and you are a visitor

275096160.name: Fun shops
275096160.author: a TripAdvisor user
275096160.reviewBody:
Might want to check out prices then go back if you think its a better price, it seems things are way off for same things....
can be a rip off if you don't compare.  not great food on this street, over priced and not good.
I get better Mexican food in Los Angeles area.
But fun place I guess for something different once a year.  But place doesn't change, see one store you've seen them all. :( no creativity.

273903056.name: All in one place
273903056.author: a TripAdvisor user
273903056.reviewBody: Bar\u00b4s, restaurant\u00b4s, clubs and more, this street is the night heart of the city, if you want to have a nice time with friends or family you will definitely find something to do there.

269183298.name: Get Ready to be Bombarded
269183298.author: a TripAdvisor user
269183298.reviewBody: Pros:  Prices from street vendors are cheap, but you get what you pay for. The brick and mortar stores are a bit more rigid on prices, but a deal can still be made. People are very friendly.\n\nCons: be ready to be mobbed by street vendors, some as young as a few years old. Some will poke you to pay attention to them.

266446049.name: Major Tourist street
266446049.author: a TripAdvisor user
266446049.reviewBody: This is the street to go and purchase all kinds of trinkets. From shark jaws to pottery, shirts, etc. Great eats here too. Fromthe world famous REY SOL to NOVOLATOS sea food cocktails. Papas & Beer at one end.

263248987.name: Gilbert Aragon & family Street Vendors, True Artists
263248987.author: a TripAdvisor user
263248987.reviewBody: I stop in Ensenada every time I drive to and from Loreto, Baja.  Sometimes Gilbert Aragon is set up on Calle Primera, also known as Avenida Adolfo Lopez Mateos.  He makes copper wire animal, cactus and scorpion sculptures, recycled can toy airplanes and more.  This March when I was in Ensenada he was there with his daughter and I bought a number of small pieces for $5-$10.  As I bought more he gave me small discounts.  These are beautiful presents and I\'ve only ever seen them in Baja.  I read online at Trip Advisor that they are sold at another location in the Ensenada area.  I have seen them in Loreto too at the Pemex gas station and in local shops there.  Stop at Gilbert\'s table and enjoy this handmade local craft!

260058188.name: Primerear
260058188.author: a TripAdvisor user
260058188.reviewBody: First street or Primera is a site you cannot miss. Commerce restaurant bars pharmacies hotels and more. People in the past used to make rounds in their fancy cars just to watch people and to be seen, that is referred by the locals as "primerear" It is the heart of the city where everything happens. Just come and take a stroll among a very diverse and colorful collection of everything.

259853824.name: I hate this place. Read why.
259853824.author: a TripAdvisor user
259853824.reviewBody: We drive to ensenada each year, this street is made for cruise tourists who are typically an embaressment to the us stumbling around drunk. The whole time you are accosted with high price junk made in mexico and china. There is soo much more to ensenada area than this street. Rent a car, drive to country, visit wine country, see beaches (real ones) and lots of other things. Want to get drunk and buy cheap crap..walk this street.  There are a few exceptions to crap here, but not many.

258485081.name: Worth the walk.
258485081.author: a TripAdvisor user
258485081.reviewBody: It was worth the walk around. We felt safe. We hired a taxi that gave us a nice tour of the city and sights. Lots do see and do and places to eat

258246822.name: Lots of Food and Drinks
258246822.author: a TripAdvisor user
258246822.reviewBody: Typical for a port city. But fun really when there are not so many tourists in town when the ships come in. You will always find a place to get cheap Margaritas and tacos.

255278694.name: Interesting place
255278694.author: a TripAdvisor user
255278694.reviewBody: If you are traveling south to see  the American concept of "Mexico" then this is you place. Lots of chap stuff, often (believe it or not) made in China!1 Mexican trinkets made if China are not all that charming. But it is a lively place and you can pick up a lot of \'stuff\' to give to friends and relatives when you return home.  You cheeky crucifixes and black velvet paintings are bit items here.

252093160.name: The Place to Go For Inexpensive Food and Gifts
252093160.author: a TripAdvisor user
252093160.reviewBody: The shuttle from the cruise ships drop you off here. This is about 4 blocks of shopping and places to eat. They all pretty much sell the same items so bargain  and if necessary walk away a part of the bargaining process. Vendors who sell items on the street are very persistent. Two vendors followed us for blocks trying to sell their items. Mostly cheap jewelery. As they follow you the cost drops of course. There are several pharmacies where you can buys drugs that you cannot buy over the counter in the US. The prices are about the same as in the US but you don\'t need a  prescription. There are many places to eat-some a little fancier than others. We ate at a little place and got some good food for the price. Unfortunately, I can\'t remember the name. Three fish tacos and a beer for $6 and it was delicious.

247767897.name: Tons of junk to buy, but hey, it\'s what the people want!
247767897.author: a TripAdvisor user
247767897.reviewBody: The cruise ship crowds all want hats and beads I guess because they\'re everywhere. But it\'s safe downtown - safer than a LOT of US cities.

242131858.name: Tacky
242131858.author: a TripAdvisor user
242131858.reviewBody: This is at the very least the main drag for tourists in Ensenada. It\'s colorful; it\'s fun; it\'s noisy; it\'s tacky; it\'s high energy; & most vendors take "no, gracias" graciously.

238386005.name: hawkers!
238386005.author: a TripAdvisor user
238386005.reviewBody: fun to navigate, but gotta keep sense of humor!  One merchant was really cute, said, " Come in, I promise to rip you off for less!"

237152744.name: Just okay
237152744.author: a TripAdvisor user
237152744.reviewBody: All the shops generally sell the same things. Nothing is that great, but you can find some cheap gifts in the area for $2. Food is excellent, best taco\'s I\'ve had in my life (only comparing to USA mexican shops). Food prices were reasonable, much cheaper than in the USA for a soft taco (1/2 the price). You can expect to see mothers and children asking for money or asking to buy their goods. No one was very pushy at all and went away if you told them no thanks. \n\nOverall good experience and not as bad as I thought it would be.

234093556.name: FOCAL POINT OF ENSENADA
234093556.author: a TripAdvisor user
234093556.reviewBody: I ENJOY the niGHTLIFE area HERE. Hussongs and Papa\'s and beer are extended stays when i visit. FROM  the villa marina hotel back to where papa\'s and beer is many THings to see, buy, eat etc. ETC. etc.

234023290.name: Touristy, only if you don\'t have time for anything else
234023290.author: a TripAdvisor user
234023290.reviewBody: Geared for the last minute souvenir or just not taste for the real local stuff, OK to walk thru maybe grab some java on one of the coffee shops.

227719264.name: Nice area
227719264.author: a TripAdvisor user
227719264.reviewBody: If in Ensenada and you want to do the tourist thing they are very nice clean shops and the people are not pushy like in La Bufadora.  Hussong, Papa\'s and beer and El Roy Sol are all located there.   It is a short walk over to the Riveria, birthplace of the Maragarita and some really beautiful architecture.

226402281.name: Remember, you are in Ensenada, Mexico
226402281.author: a TripAdvisor user
226402281.reviewBody: Embrace the cultural diversity... Stay in tourist area... Go yo La Bufadora and visit the wine route... We loved LA Cetto... Oh and eat lobster in Puerto Nuevo!

225775715.name: Do not miss 1st street
225775715.author: a TripAdvisor user
225775715.reviewBody:
Some people may say this is just stereotypical Mexican tourism, but regardless it is fun. In comparison to tourists traps across Mexico, 1st street has lots of options for good food that is cheap, as well as cheap beer. It may look a little touristy, but the specials that are typically going on at the bars and restaurants are great.

Some of the hand made souviners are completely generic, but you will also find some very unique vendors.

The area is safe and lots of people speak English if you do not have any Spanish skills. 

Make sure not to buy any of the Cuban cigars that everyone is selling, they are fake.

223672481.name: First street is the premier place to shop for souveniers
223672481.author: a TripAdvisor user
223672481.reviewBody: As with Avenida Ruiz, First Street caters to cruise ship patrons, so on cruise ship days they tend to be a bit crowded, but fun nevertheless.  As with other downtown areas where souvenirs are sold, the bargaining is better on non-cruise ship days.  This is the only place for a wide range of souvenirs now that La Bufadora has shut down.  You will enjoy a walk down First Street with its many shops and good eats, singing Mariachis and more.  They have wonderful art pieces as well.

220142101.name: Port of Call
220142101.author: a TripAdvisor user
220142101.reviewBody:
My husband and I stopped in Ensenada when we sailed the Pacific Coast with Disney Cruise Line.  After we took an excursion to the wine country in the valley about 30-minutes from Ensenada, the tour dropped us downtown before we headed back to the ship.

I was surprised about the amount of bars (I feel like I saw 14 Papas and Beer locations in one block) and shops that sold the same, cheap souvenirs.  There were, however, a few gems to be found.  In fact, my husband still remembers fondly the time where he held a baby tiger and got the picture to prove it in a shop in Ensenada!  I found a shop that sold local artwork and picked up a great one-of-a-kind souvenir: a numbered and signed 2x3" painting of a stylized cruise ship by a local artist.  It fit perfectly in our scrapbook!

We took a cab for less than $5 back to the cruise ship.  There is a particular corner where "official" cabs are waiting to take tourists back to the ships, so check with your cruise director about how to get back to the port once you're dropped off and enjoy Ensenada!

219931480.name: The only place to be in Ensenada.
219931480.author: a TripAdvisor user
219931480.reviewBody: Just like the title states, if you are in Ensenada this is the Main Street with fun bars, tasty restaurants that serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The food is mainly seafood for great prices. All meals were around 50 dollars for the 5 of us.

216578326.name: Typical tourist trap
216578326.author: a TripAdvisor user
216578326.reviewBody: This is a street dedicated to selling trinkets to tourists.  Pushy salesmen, and cheap good should be expected. On the plus side...it\'s clean. Wasn\'t worth getting off the boat for.

203356418.name: Ice cream and coffee while people watching
203356418.author: a TripAdvisor user
203356418.reviewBody: If you come to Ensenada...this street is a must see at least once. Cobblestone street and outdoor cafes fill the street. The South end in my opinion is nicer. The North end is filled with bars. Liquor stores let you "taste" the goods in hopes of you buying. Yes...tons of street vendors. All in all, worth a visit.

203075679.name: This was our second port of call with carnival cruises !!! 4 night cruise !!
203075679.author: a TripAdvisor user
203075679.reviewBody:
Visited 15/04/2014 

We didn't book any tours with the cruise ship as the activates on the port was not much of interest to us.
We decide to leave the ship at 11.00 am to venture into the port,where we just walk 20 mins into the Main Street where there is heaps of shops to buy from.First stop was Starbucks ,where we can use the toilets and wifi for free,as the Internet on ship was very expensive !!!. Had some nice coffee here too,while roaming on the Internet.

After our well rested stop,we went to the second street where heaps of shops were selling tourist items to purchase..locals seem very eager for tourist to buy.Caps were all copy's selling for $6.00 USD.locals seem very friendly,but I was always looking out for our safety in the area, as too many locals try to stop us and buy !!! Buy !!! ...... Was their words...so just be careful,where you go and who you speak too.!!!!

We ending having a lovely foot massage for 2 person,$30.00 for both at Ki massage .Then I got my pedicure and manicure done for $25.00 USD.

You are able to buy cheap spirit here,but you need to declare before you go back on the ship and they hold them for you until you leave the cruise ship at the end of the cruise.

We did enjoy our day here at port,weather was lovely,locals seem nice...some bargains to buy..

The ship stops at this  port  for a whole day,cruise ship left at 8.00 pm...

Ciao 

ELISA

200832951.name: Shop,Eat & Enjoy
200832951.author: a TripAdvisor user
200832951.reviewBody: lots of stores to buy lots of restaurants to eat enjoy the weather walk around to visit town walking distance from everything also visit mercado negro great place to shop for sea food and the best part all the mexican curios real handmade

197860076.name: Cleaner than the bahamas
197860076.author: a TripAdvisor user
197860076.reviewBody: This was your average street for finding inexpensive souvenirs.  For the most part it was fun.  We had one gentleman walk out of his shop and approach us to come inside.  When my husband didn\'t acknowledge, he picked a fight.  I said no thank you, he insulted my husband to me, and we walked on.  I didn\'t feel unsafe, it was just annoying.  Two of my kids were done after 20 minutes, because they thought kids begging and selling was sad.  The other two liked it.  I didn\'t feel that the prices were that great.  Inflation has hit Mexico too.  In total I would say that we spent 80.00.  I would say to skip the kids cross bows and sling shots.  They broke while they were in cruise storage.  The cruise ship makes you check them in, and you have to pick them up on your last day, as you are trying to get off the ship.  A pain in every way!

193776946.name: Tourist street, very clean.
193776946.author: a TripAdvisor user
193776946.reviewBody: Everytime we come to Ensenada, we stay close to this street, they have gushed it up  for the  tourists.  Lots of shops and bakery\'s and dessert shops, hotels, bars....really great restaurants,  freshly painted sidewalks, wine shops,  it seems dog friendly.  When the cruise ships arrive, this street fills up, some very loud music and drinking especially on cruise ship days. Very busy on those days...otherwise very pleasant. We Like First Street, it is also called  avenida Lopez Mateos.  Have enjoyed this area.

192476178.name: Good for a short stroll
192476178.author: a TripAdvisor user
192476178.reviewBody: We regularly walk on this street while in Ensenada as a port from the cruise ship. It  is only 20 minutes stroll from  the ship and is dotted with souvenir ships and restaurants. Papas and Beers and Husson\'s is popular with tourists. However, we go to eat where locals go. Bargaining is a must on this strip for your curios.

192255017.name: Ensenada, Mexico
192255017.author: a TripAdvisor user
192255017.reviewBody: Took a short walk from the cruise ship to Ensenada, Mexico.  If you like trinkets it is the place to go.  The best window shopping was further down the street where they had some nice art pieces. Did find some nice pieces from little street vendors who were tucked between buildings and priced reasonably.  We did not eat in Ensenada, but the cafe were full of activity.

190838943.name: Just walk around!
190838943.author: a TripAdvisor user
190838943.reviewBody: I have never found too much of interest here.  The blowhole is nice to see once and there is shopping at this site, set up similar to swap meet booths.  It is quite a drive so you do get to see the terrain along the way.  We end up just walking around town, a little shopping and a lot of people watching.  The bothersome situation we experienced were all the bar employees insisting you come in to their establishment.  Some get testy and play 20 questions of why you won\'t come in!

190582542.name: nice safe walk
190582542.author: a TripAdvisor user
190582542.reviewBody: Mostly for tourist. During periods of no tourist the street is mostly dead. Walking is safe and the environment is pleasant. There are restaurants and shops lining the street. I have walk it at all hours and never had an issue. The side streets to the east are not as safe. I would avoid parking there.

187476143.name: Nice, touristy area in Ensenada
187476143.author: a TripAdvisor user
187476143.reviewBody: First street is not very far from the cruise ship terminal in Ensenada and a safe walk. Just make sure not to go too early because nothing is open early in the morning and there are no restrooms at that time.

187390241.name: >> Safe Walk from the Cruise Ship Terminal
187390241.author: a TripAdvisor user
187390241.reviewBody:
Not sure what you want to do when getting off the cruise ship?   If you're okay with walking and shopping, this is where you need to go.

Easy 3/4 mile walk from the terminal.  Walk towards the giant flag.  Stick to the main roads.  Don't wander off.

Some great deals:

- Personalized and handmade to your specs - namebands w/ your name on them.  US$3 if you get like 3 or so.  They will otherwise tell you they are US$5.  A bargain.  If they don't have the name(s) that you want, they will make them for you in about 5 mins each.  Quality is excellent.

- Mexican Jumping Beans.  US$1 (negotiated down from the $2 or so they want).  Available at about 50% of the stores on the tourist row.

- Carmel Corn.  The BEST.  Just past the Plaza with the 3 heads.  Best you ever had.  DO NOT pass it by.  Get a bag for snacking while shopping.  You will buy 2 more on the way back to the Cruise Ship.  No joke.

Oh yes... if you need the restroom and not a customer... customary charge is US$1 to US$0.50.  No joke.

185577337.name: You will LOVE downtown Ensenada!
185577337.author: a TripAdvisor user
185577337.reviewBody: If anyone visits this city they must visit the stores and eat at the restaurants or vendors. I have been there several times and even at night I have never been concerned about safety. The police patrol the area and the shop owners are family oriented good people. The police are not there to stop Americans visiting and promote tourism. Now if your drunk or obnoxious then sure you will get in trouble but overall they keep the streets safe for everyone and as a young woman I have shipped til odd hours of the night and felt comfortable. I am not the party type but the guys that work security around the bar scene will also help you and direct you where you need to go. Try going during the Baja 500 or 1000 so you can see how crazy it is with tons of festivities and food. It\'s really cool to see so many people from all over the world get together to party and celebrate together. Just always bring extra clothing for the nights that get chilly once the sun sets because the ocean breeze does cool it down quite a bit even in summer if your used to the heat like in SoCal. If your from a colder climate then you will probably enjoy the night time and not notice the cooler weather. Have fun, be safe, and enjoy!

182775470.name: Expected but still enjoyed it
182775470.author: a TripAdvisor user
182775470.reviewBody: When our cruise ship made port in Ensenada, I had no intention of leaving the ship. Wife had planned on shopping, so figuring out quickly she would try it alone, I of course said I\'d go. The shopping area is safe in the daytime, but I wouldn\'t go it alone. Walking with someone is fine. Yes, the expected street vendors are out in force, but don\'t buy the on the street items...go into the shops to find deals on some actually nice items (SOME...NOT ALL!). Take a relaxing break at Papas & Beer...their security folks keep the street vendors away while you enjoy a Dos X or two ($4 each). Final note...don\'t be afraid to barter! Found my wife had a hidden talent in negotiations! Best move is to start walking away...they will follow and the price seemed to dropped with each step! Came away with some nice jewelry for presents...and an unexpected fun time.

182640146.name: Great area tp shop and find excellent restaurants
182640146.author: a TripAdvisor user
182640146.reviewBody: I recommend parking in one of the pay lots up near Black market and walking the length of this street.  Unless you hate people watching, getting deals, or great restaurants you will enjoy this diversion.  I would say this place is like going to some of the places you used to go when you would cross the border, but safer and cleaner.  Its only a block away from the water front as well.

174655410.name: Cruisin\'
174655410.author: a TripAdvisor user
174655410.reviewBody: Love walking and checking out the vendors and shops. I enjoy stopping for a drink at Hussongs or Papas and Beers.

174530474.name: nice walk
174530474.author: a TripAdvisor user
174530474.reviewBody: This street is pretty much the main street. I enjoyed walking up and down this street because it was close to our hotel. The southern side of the street definitely has a better, brighter, cleaner feel. Northern side is where all the rowdy fun is. However..we ran into couple of odd men down this road at night. Just go where you need to go and ignore them. Don\'t let a few of them stop you from walking this street. People like that are in almost any part of the town around the world.

170228287.name: Cool little spot
170228287.author: a TripAdvisor user
170228287.reviewBody: My friends and I walked around Ensenada and happened upon First Street, immediately realizing it was a tourist spot. There is an amazing little taco place right across the way from El Ray Sol Restaurante, I tried the Asada, shrimp and fish...all delicious and the service was excellent.

170046292.name: You should go only once.
170046292.author: a TripAdvisor user
170046292.reviewBody: It is a place to visit one time. no much to do besides shopping for traditional handmade art and other stuff. The main attraction is the  marine geyser or blowhole but it won\'t "blow" most of the time.

169680763.name: Shop till you drop!
169680763.author: a TripAdvisor user
169680763.reviewBody: (I live in Ensenada so I\'m not writing this from a tourist\'s point of view).  First Street is full of shops and restaurants and street vendors and I love to go and just walk around, get something to eat, do some window shopping.  The prices are good and negotiable.  The restaurants are overall excellent and reasonably priced.  Morning, afternoon or evening:  There\'s lots to see.

168934104.name: almost free
168934104.author: a TripAdvisor user
168934104.reviewBody: everything is almost free the vendors say. tourist shopping area with restaurant and bars like papas and beer , hussongs, mango mango. took awhile to find parking.it was fun.

166549204.name: "Everything almost free" - or so everyone says
166549204.author: a TripAdvisor user
166549204.reviewBody: I was not on a cruise, but we visited it anyway and it is the typical tourist alley. 90% of the items are in every store. I would not pay "Ship" prices to get here.....

165987169.name: Don\'t bother getting off the boat!
165987169.author: a TripAdvisor user
165987169.reviewBody: We could see a sweet little church in town so expected the town would be charming.  We took the bus, that\'s at the pier when you get off the ship, into town.  It\'s a sales pitch to take a tour to La Bufadora for 1/2 the price as the cruise ship\'s excursion.  On the bus, the woman in front of us, who had been to Ensenada before, told us to take off all our jewelry.  As we started toward First St, the police were moving people who had slept on the street.  Kids, with boxes of knick-knacks, approached us to buy something.  Foolishly, I bought a box of 4 "Cuban" cigars--at least I wasn\'t foolish enough to pay full price--they were un-smokable!  We stayed with the woman from the bus, as she seemed to know where to go & what to do, but not for long as we didn\'t feel safe.  We walked as fast as we could back to catch the bus back to the ship.   There are Mexican wares for sale in a pier building.  That\'s far enough--at least for us!

155902847.name: Tourist Zone
155902847.author: a TripAdvisor user
155902847.reviewBody: First Street is defiantly a tourist zone, Americanized is how i would describe it. Little more expensive than the rest of Ensenada but a good time, everything there is walking distance in the morning. Had a couple of tacos and margaritas. They were Yummy!!

142514008.name: shopping
142514008.author: a TripAdvisor user
142514008.reviewBody:
When you got out of your ship make a left if you wish to walk here. Left again at the bridge. Heading the big flag way will take you there. this area is cross from the big flag.
it was fun walking around in this area.
shop, eat and drink. it's all here. Do bargain when you shop.
starbucks and mcdonald are even here:)

140889059.name: nice,nice and peacefull fishing town
140889059.author: a TripAdvisor user
140889059.reviewBody: I went to ensenada and had a great time eat ,drunk and shopped, while you are there visit the store that is across from papas and beer, named mexican fire opal ,ask for RUBEN and get a 30% off

135018024.name: Great walking street
135018024.author: a TripAdvisor user
135018024.reviewBody: Intersesting shops and some nice restaurants. A great street to stroll along.

132549394.name: Calle Primera
132549394.author: a TripAdvisor user
132549394.reviewBody: I love first St. or as the locals call it "Calle Primera", I call it The Strip, because it has everything, shops, bars, restaurants,nail salons for the lady\'s,outdoor coffe cafe for your caffeine fix. You can spend hours here. From here you could find taxi drivers that will take you to many of the popular sites, like the Buffadora, some wine tours at Valle de Guadalupe, etc.

132482023.name: On the Ok side
132482023.author: a TripAdvisor user
132482023.reviewBody: It is a noisy fun street. It seems pretty safe but we left early because it is more for the young-single crowd. I do not know how it looks at night but just for the amount of alcohol being consumed it seems trouble.\nMy advise: go but when it gets late stay out of trouble makers going early to your hotel.

132310365.name: Be careful of massage clinic on first
132310365.author: a TripAdvisor user
132310365.reviewBody: First street is great, the atmosphere up near thr clubs is awesome. The shops along first street are great too and the silver is amazing. But I must warn you. There is a massage clinic on first street, it\'s on the left hand side, I think the second block if your walking down from mango mango. I went their to have a massage and got a male, he was the only one working and whilst massaging my neck asked if I wanted a "full chest massag". It was so discusting and I felt violated but thought it might have been standard here in Mexico because I\'m from the otherside of the world. So I strongly suggest not going here!

127707380.name: Very Fun
127707380.author: a TripAdvisor user
127707380.reviewBody: It\'s a very interesting street in Ensenada port, the first thing you\'ll find are some hotels, coffee shops and later find a wide variety of shops, bars and clubs with all varieties of music for all tastes. From a glass of wine to party until dawn

125965996.name: Do and Don\'ts of Ensenada
125965996.author: a TripAdvisor user
125965996.reviewBody: Mango Mango was a blast! Good 80s & 90s music and lots of sun. Pappas and Beer ripped off some of our female friends. Promising free tequila but not letting them leave without paying for all their shots. \n\nThere is a Tequila shop on the main street. South of Mango Mango on the oppostite side of the street.  Very knowledgeable about Tequilas but watchout for the Spanish speaking 30 something Irish guy. He told me I couldn\'t get Esperanto Tequila in the states. Told me a bottle sells for $200 and charged me $130, making me think I was getting a good deal. I found out when I got back the the bottle sells in the states for only $89. I think the smooth talking young bald 30 something Mexican guy was honest but not his biz partner. I only wish he would have stepped in to advise me correctly.  If you know the name of the shop please let me know. They do give free tastings and have a tip jar in the tasting cabinet.

125533679.name: Souvenir Shopping is a BLAH!
125533679.author: a TripAdvisor user
125533679.reviewBody: If this is your first time to Mexico, then you will have a blast looking around the shops for souvenir items. Unfortunately for me, I have been to different parts of Mexico looking for souvenirs that are unique in that city, and come to find out that many of the items are the same in Puerto Vallarta, Cabo San Lucas, and Ensenada. The only thing that is changed is the name of the city on the merchandise. You are better off saving your money for the delish food on the streets than you are spending it on generic merchandise.

124276369.name: The Seafood Fiesta
124276369.author: a TripAdvisor user
124276369.reviewBody: Enjoy all of the local eateries with the fresh seafood brought in just steps away

122796281.name: My Favorite Evening "People Watching" Stroll
122796281.author: a TripAdvisor user
122796281.reviewBody: I live in Ensenada part-time and I love taking a stroll down "First Street" aka Calle Primera in the evenings, and yes it\'s very safe. There\'s some very good restaurants, some fun bars, cantinas, clubs, and lots of interesting people enjoying themselves. My favorite place to hang-out is El Corralito Cantina & Restaurant. I like to sit outside, have a wine or a tequila, enjoy watching a "game" on the big screen TV in the outdoor patio if something\'s on, and enjoy the robustness of a vibrant little city. Of course when the cruise ships are in, it does tend to get a little rowdy, but still enjoyable nonetheless...

122208170.name: Hussong\'s Cantina, Karaoke next door
122208170.author: a TripAdvisor user
122208170.reviewBody: Did some major partying & Calle Primera is the area to go for this.

121163761.name: It\'s not all junk
121163761.author: a TripAdvisor user
121163761.reviewBody: Check out Jay\'s Multi Cultural on Riveroll and Primera.  Great Leather store on the corner of Macheros and Primera.  Try Seven Leagues Tequila - you can\'t buy it in the States. But Primera is a tourist street.  Walk up to 5th (Juarez) and back down Gastellum or Ruiz.  That is the heart of the city where most Mexicans do their shopping.

672146276.name: great visit to ensenda
672146276.author: a TripAdvisor user
672146276.reviewBody: had a wonderful time learned a great deal with a really good guide would definatley do again cant wait ti visit

659563564.name: Visit the History Musuem of Ensenada
659563564.author: a TripAdvisor user
659563564.reviewBody:
Great place to visit - may be hard for some people because of the stairs up and down.  You have to pay around $6 US for 2 to see. Takes about 1+ hours and gives the history of the area to include pictures of the early missions, either in ruins or still operating.

Spend some time to see and understand, very interesting the history of more than Ensenda

Within walking distance of the Cruise port - head out to main road and go right across street.

652725670.name: amazing place
652725670.author: a TripAdvisor user
652725670.reviewBody: not to be missed place.. which is well preserved and full of history..truly the walls will speak to you

650195317.name: includes a very interesrting historical museum!
650195317.author: a TripAdvisor user
650195317.reviewBody:
we went on a slow day, so no margarita, no dancing, no vendors except the permanent one inside the entryway.  the casino was viewable from the museum, through slits in the ceiling coping - a lovely room.  the main hall was closed - it looks like a civic or state assembly hall, but could be used for dancing with galleries around.

this place was once the riviera hotel & casino, and they have lots of great pictures of the construction back in the 20s.  the museum has a number of small rooms that are made to be a real travel adventure - you enter through 'rock caves' (built by local craftsmen) made out of fibreglas.  these are decorated with simulations of ancient petroglyphs.  

the exhibits follow the history of baja and of course all of mexico, from prehistoric times to the early part of the 20th century, including fine baskets, weapons, the age of colonisation, maritime history, etc.  fascinating!

and they have a great little gift shop at the end of yoiur touir upstairs 7 downstairs through the various rooms.

639262480.name: The absolute highlight of our city tour!  The Folkloric Show was fabulous!
639262480.author: a TripAdvisor user
639262480.reviewBody:
We (two couples, brothers with our wives) really enjoyed the Riviera del Pacifico as the highlight of our city tour in Ensenada.  Our guide, Abner, "El Guapo" had told us we would stop here last before returning to our ship, the Emerald Princess, docked at the pier.  We had a wonderful time.  We shopped for all our souvenirs from all the vendors booths that were set up on the day of our visit.  

We had an enjoyable time in the bar, learning about how the drink "the Margarita" came to be invented there.  We also enjoyed tasting free: sodas-Mexican Coca Cola (it is made with real cane sugar): Tecate beer; and last but not least Margaritas - all were delicious.  Note: There was ice in the soda, but none of us got affected by it (in case you were wondering)  The same with the Margaritas - since they were free several of our group went back for more and more (after all we were not driving we were on a bus tour going back to our ship.  

The real highlight was the folkloric floor show in the main ballroom which was wonderful, colorful and fabulous.  It featured dances from different regions of Mexico, great Mariachi music and a special performance by a rope tick master (his name escapes me but not his age he was 81!  Doing the lasso around and round and up and down over his body and head.  At one point he laid down on the floor while still doing the lasso it was amazing!!  Most people his age would need help getting up . . .  We really were impressed!  This is a must do in my opinion!  I should also mention that they took American money dollars and gave change in American dollars.  This building was said to have been an old casino now a cultural center.  It is also available to rent for events.

638103044.name: Really enjoyed it
638103044.author: a TripAdvisor user
638103044.reviewBody: We visited here this week as a short visit while on a stop off at the port. The history was really interesting, not least about the margarita! The music and dance show was brilliant and made for a wonderful short visit. Wish we could have stayed longer.

636924950.name: Beautiful Place to Visit!
636924950.author: a TripAdvisor user
636924950.reviewBody: As part of our tour, the tour guide stopped here to visit. We learned the history of the Cultural Center and how it came about. When we first walked through the doors we were given a small margarita which was nice and very tasty. There is a small courtyard which has a small shopping area and tables and chairs if you want to take in the ambiance.

614740200.name: Old casino now cultural center
614740200.author: a TripAdvisor user
614740200.reviewBody: We visited this place during our cruise excursion trip of Ensenada after visiting \'La bufadoraa\' .\nIt is Huge complex in Mexican & Spanish style. It\'s local name is "Riviera del Pacifico Cultural and Convention Centre" built in 1930 as a gambling casino. This place is full of history. It has beautiful buildings, gardens, and beautiful ceiling.\nWhen we visited this place, they are celebrating 70th Anniversary of famous drink "Margarita". They called that Margarita is invented here. As a part of celebration they gave all of us free Margarita drink prepared by traditional method.

611940246.name: Small and somewhat interesting
611940246.author: a TripAdvisor user
611940246.reviewBody: The old building and history are of interest. Not a must see in my opinion but if you have an hour to kill, go for it!

587881003.name: Ensanada Cultural Center a great stop
587881003.author: a TripAdvisor user
587881003.reviewBody: The history of this site is remarkable as is the structures. The water pools and statues are beautiful and inviting. The inside is filled with history. Lucille Ball, Merle Norman, and many more graced the walls here. Free tour and a small bar in the back. A great stop.

568137121.name: Must see while in Ensenada
568137121.author: a TripAdvisor user
568137121.reviewBody: The Riviera Cultural Centre or Cultural Center of Ensenada is a beautiful mexican building located near the cruiseship dock. It was first an hotel and casino resort, today it\'s home to culture (local activities and and exhibits). Not mutch to see exept a few fresceos and the beautiful wooden ceilings and candelabras, very well maintained to date and it\'s Bar Andaluz. They say that it was where the world famous Margarita cocktail was created (?).  The Marguaritas are very good. On weekends and when cruise ships are in port, there is a small. market near the bar terrace where you can buy from local artists and others. A one hour to an hour and a half should be sufficient.

566098331.name: Wonderful building. Limited exhibits.
566098331.author: a TripAdvisor user
566098331.reviewBody: Go for the building and the history of it. The cultural displays are informative and useful to see. The manager of the museum is an awesome guy. Very knowledgeable and friendly.

557785095.name: Go to the antique BAR!
557785095.author: a TripAdvisor user
557785095.reviewBody: It\'s a lovely place. They have incredible events - especially during the wine harvest festivities. The margaritas (not the ones they serve the cruiseship folks), are to die for. I loved this place.

533803591.name: Ensenada Oct 2017
533803591.author: a TripAdvisor user
533803591.reviewBody: Riviera Cultural Center has a docent-guided tour of the center\'s exhibits highlighting the art, culture, history , and architecture of Ensenada.  There is a lovely bar where you can enjoy a margarita , beer, wine or other beverages as well a many vendors in the courtyard selling their wares.

522070112.name: It\'s small but worth the tour.
522070112.author: a TripAdvisor user
522070112.reviewBody: This center compacts a fast history in a short space. When I was walking through the space, local students spread out all over, in attempt to capture the complex art work on the ceilings! Th escape deserves the time needed to absorb the pure beauty of the space.

520110463.name: Interesting building for the architecture, detailed ceilings, large historical rooms
520110463.author: a TripAdvisor user
520110463.reviewBody: My teenage daughter and i walked through the building in a few minutes. It is beautiful on the inside but we don\'t read Spanish so we could not understand the explanations of things. It looked like a historical building that you can tour, large elaborate rooms, chandeliers and ceilings, lots of wood, a few paintings and photographs.  There were vendors in the courtyard outside the museum.

505909976.name: Great Historical experience
505909976.author: a TripAdvisor user
505909976.reviewBody: My family and I stopped at the Centro Cultural during our stay in Ensenada. The center was full of history. As we were looking through, a worker stopped us and began to tell us stories about the Center\'s past. He even told us that there are daily 9pm night tours in which people can go to. In these tours you are told stories, including ghost stories).

495856992.name: Interesting and historical
495856992.author: a TripAdvisor user
495856992.reviewBody: The museum is small but has plenty historical items! The kids read most of the information bullets and kept interested. The cost is less than $5 per person. Easy access from the cruise terminal. It a great treat for anyone that likes history.

495019782.name: I should have taken the tour.
495019782.author: a TripAdvisor user
495019782.reviewBody: My wife and I strolled into the Cultural Center while visiting Ensenada as part of a cruise package in June. We decided to forgot the tour and just visit the building ourselves. The grounds were beautiful, and it was nice to see they were in the process of restoring parts of the building. There was a tour going through when we came, and we stole a few moments of their time in front of a large map of Baja, but didn\'t linger with them as we hadn\'t booked the tour. I think we would have enjoyed it more if we had.

475383219.name: Amazing place!
475383219.author: a TripAdvisor user
475383219.reviewBody: The architecture of this building is simply incredible! Beautiful woodwork, tiles, and history come together to make this a must see. Carefully and lovingly maintained, this is a great tourist attraction. My husband and I visited Ensenada on our honeymoon and are so glad we chose this tour from our cruise ship. If you love history, this is for you.

472084149.name: A Must Visit
472084149.author: a TripAdvisor user
472084149.reviewBody: Fantastic property, formerly the glamorous Riviera del Pacifico resort and casino.  While we were there, a wonderful performance was taking place, singers, dancers, Mexican cowboys displaying their roping skills.  Gorgeous painted ceilings, chandeliers, lovely grounds.  Definitely worth a visit and staying for awhile!

464797445.name: A good way to understand the area
464797445.author: a TripAdvisor user
464797445.reviewBody: A good place to understand the history and culture of the northern part of Baja California, including the native people, the land and the Spanish invaders.  the place is larger than it looks and most exhibits are in both Spanish and English

464787369.name: A whole lot of history
464787369.author: a TripAdvisor user
464787369.reviewBody: Beautiful place.  Preserved.  You learn interesting history tidbits.  Our guide was awesome.  Great stop.

457492724.name: Beautiful Historic Building
457492724.author: a TripAdvisor user
457492724.reviewBody: This building is being well maintained and is used for social events. It is a reminder of past times but with its use for social events, it continues to maintain a presence in the lives of those who visit it and helps make new memories for all guests.

455610596.name: off the beaten track museum
455610596.author: a TripAdvisor user
455610596.reviewBody: it was definitely worth the visit to this excellent museum of the history of Baja and Ensenada.  They had a small gift shop at the end and the displays were done extremely well.  After thge museum it was a short walk back to the ship.

447605461.name: Riviera Del Pacifico
447605461.author: a TripAdvisor user
447605461.reviewBody: Excellent, was booked through Carnival Cruise line.  Guide Joanna was filled with knowledge and pride.  This made the tour extra special.  Be aware, she will make you sing a song in Spanish if you are late to the bus and have to make everyone wait.  HAHAHA

389871909.name: Beautiful building that takes us back to the prohibition era
389871909.author: a TripAdvisor user
389871909.reviewBody: Opened as an hotel & casino this building has great decoration that takes us back to the 30s. Visit the several rooms and bars, fountains and yards. It is great for a quick visit.

386257920.name: An incredible beautiful building with a fascinating past...
386257920.author: a TripAdvisor user
386257920.reviewBody: While I have seen the beautiful elegant building  during my many visits to Ensenada and I always wanted to see it... I finally have the chance not only to admire but  learned its interesting history... It was built as a hotel the 1930 in a luxurious  dramatic style right on the beach of Ensenada for its wealthy and famous American clientele that was getting "thirsty" under the Prohibition Era. But the hotel was never profitable due to the end of the prohibition and bad road from the United States. It went from being a hotel to a military headquarter ,partly demolished  and its gorgeous enourmous chandelier was not robbed only because it didn\'t fit through the door until finally taken  by the Mexican government... to be converted to a cultural center...\nThe really beautiful roaring 30-40 feet ceiling on the main salon is built in intricate worn cypress wood with a enormous glorious chandelier with perfectly laid floor in the most exquisite Spanish motif.  But the most striking of all, right off the main atrium is located the biggest bar area. Built in dark wood, there are seven BAR areas with an amazing mural in the background despicting the SIX sins of mankind plus the portrait of the painter in the last one.... There are 3 great ballrooms (salon) which are used to celebrate weddings and birthdays.  My favorite is the Salon Rojo with a beautiful great Painting on the fireplace with its own authentic Spanish courtyard.  Even the colorful history of the American woman named Marjorie King Plant, which inspired the creation of the famous Mexican cocktail "Margarita" in one of Bars of the hotel, added an allure to this beautiful mystical place.  \nIf you are visiting Ensenada, visiting this gorgeous building is a must.

374692764.name: Very good mixed cultural events
374692764.author: a TripAdvisor user
374692764.reviewBody: Saw a very good guitar recital with a quartet of excellent players.   Nice venue,  easy access,  and good artwork abound.

374299652.name: Small Museum Within The Riviera
374299652.author: a TripAdvisor user
374299652.reviewBody: Visiting the Riviera Hotel and Casino is a must while you are there.  The museum is not very interesting, but the price is pretty cheap anyway.  I think it cost around 2 dollars per person.  So it\'s worth it just to walk around more of the old hotel and casino.  The exhibits are outdated and need to be renovated.

364737878.name: Good Piece of Architect History
364737878.author: a TripAdvisor user
364737878.reviewBody: The building it beautiful and the history is colorful. Definitely didn\'t need a lot of time here to appreciate it for what it is. Never fails with vendors waiting for you, but their margarita was good!

363669703.name: Charming and historic building
363669703.author: a TripAdvisor user
363669703.reviewBody: Used as an event location for locals, this charming building is what\'s left from a prohibition casino and hotel complex for north Americans. Well worth a gander. Don\'t miss the original casino room rotunda with it\'s fantastic ceiling or the stunning wall paintings in the reception room just off of that painted by an artist who influenced muralist Diego Rivera. At one end of the building is a charming local museum which is installed up and around the rotunda of the casino room. If you go to the museum, you\'ll have access to the little peepholes that looked down on the casino floor that allowed the owners to monitor the gambling. The courtyard is a bit tacky filled with tourist trap stands but walk around the grounds and you can see a living, breathing, functioning facility that found a life serving the community instead of serving the vices of wealthy1930 era gringos intent on drinking and gambling.

340454636.name: birthplace of the margarita
340454636.author: a TripAdvisor user
340454636.reviewBody: we went with the tour from the cruise ship.  What a surprise.  The architecture was stunning, history amazing and the best margarita ever.  Don\'t just take my word for it try one.  its free with the tour and you can buy one for 3 USD.  There is a little market outside.  The venders will negotiate

339979524.name: Interesting
339979524.author: a TripAdvisor user
339979524.reviewBody: We didnt plan to stop here, we where driving by and decided to stop for exploring the place and take some pictures because the place looked pretty (we didnt know it was a cultural center). what a pleasant surprise! the guard took us on a tour around the place, explaining that once it was a famous hotel, big Mexican and Hollywood stars loved to party there, he showed us pictures and a room with a bar where the "Margarita" was created, he told us the story and explained the architecture wich surprised us because it has many mazonic details in it.... It is very interesting, and for free, we only gave a tip to the guard who explained all this to us

323541206.name: More great entertainment here than you might realize...
323541206.author: a TripAdvisor user
323541206.reviewBody: When my husband and I first landed in Ensenada, we really were not very interested in attending the Cultural Center (CEARTE.)  But nudging and invitations from friends helped us experience a wealth of great performances. Jazz concerts on the outdoor stage, dancers on the platform under the canopy and performances inside the building.  Jazz concerts, beautiful dancers, Ensenada orchestra,  performances by professional musicians, free films in the summer.  Many of the performances are free and some require a small payment, but whatever it is it is well worth it! And the art exhibits inside are just top of the line. You can get coffee and sit at tables/chairs in the foyer or walk through the galleries. Or you can visit the bookstore onsite as well.  The staff are quiet but offer to help you if you need something.  I like the fact that kids show up with their parents and therefore are introduced at an early age to the wonderful world of creativity.  I recommend this highly to everyone who visits Ensenada.

323023366.name: Cultural Center is famous, very beautiful and very elegant
323023366.author: a TripAdvisor user
323023366.reviewBody: The cultural center has a nice little museum that for a couple bucks donations.  It used to be a hang out from Frank Sinatra and friends.  The grounds are beautiful, you will often see wedding photos being taken.   they also have frequent special events, we prefer the \'foodie\' ones, great place to stroll around and enjoy the fresh sea air while hopefully tasting some special treats.  Last Sunday they had a food truck taste off... wow that was fun.

319444852.name: Margarita maybe
319444852.author: a TripAdvisor user
319444852.reviewBody: We visited the center on a carnival cruise over the 4th of July. It has a very interesting history. One of the stories our tour director said. Was that is the home of the margarita maybe it is maybe it is not. We had the Mexican Coca Cola made with cane sugar. It was a nice treat on a hot summer day. The center really has some cool architecture in it. The building has been through a lot in its days.  A must see if you are in Ensenada.

318387106.name: Lots of history here
318387106.author: a TripAdvisor user
318387106.reviewBody: Visited the cultural center on a shore excursion off a Disney cruise ship. We would have liked to spend more time there. We were fascinated by the history of this place as a spot built so Americans could have a place to drink alcohol during the Prohibition Era.

317119300.name: Near the cruise port...GREAT HISTORY...$2 donation (?)...small museum.
317119300.author: a TripAdvisor user
317119300.reviewBody: Yes, I would recommend, especially if you are interested in the culture and history of Ensenada and the Mexican peoples.  It\'s a small museum, within walking distance of the cruise ship terminal, less than 45 minutes to see if you take time to read the history.  Much is in Spanish, but there are interpretation books available and much has both languages.  Slightly warm inside so be prepared for that if it bothers you.  No AC.  Enjoy!

310366731.name: Folkloric Show at the Center
310366731.author: a TripAdvisor user
310366731.reviewBody: We took a ship\'s shore excursion in Ensenada that ended up at the Cultural Center for drinks and a folkloric performance.  It was hot, and the drinks hit the spot.  The building was once a casino and along with the grounds is definitely worth seeing.  The show was delightful.  Folk dances from various parts of Mexico were performed.  The dancers were energetic and moved with a sense of joy.  An elderly man did tricks with ropes which belied his years.  I should be so spry at his age (unfortunately not too long in coming). If you get the chance to go there, you\'ll enjoy your visit.

289364359.name: If you have some free time, go here to spend 45-1 hour.
289364359.author: a TripAdvisor user
289364359.reviewBody: This is a place to visit if in Ensenada with extra time.  It will take you about 45 minutes to walk through and has some interesting information about the area.

283350420.name: Cultural Center of Ensenada
283350420.author: a TripAdvisor user
283350420.reviewBody: The old hotel is a must see across the main street from where the cruise ships dock..  It takes you back in time when Hollywood stars visited and gambled and did whatever.  You can still sense its glory days.  My favorite spot inside is the wall that has tiles with names of Hollywood\'s brightest stars who visited...almost better than watching old movies on TCM.  The Riviera must have been THE place in its day.  Located across the street is Ensenada\'s modern art gallery, also worth a visit.  We are retired in Ensenada and never grow tired of visiting the hotel.  As the old postcard we have of the hotel says, "Where time is measured by night and day."  They claim to have invented the margarita there, but so does Hussong\'s so who the heck knows.  Enjoy your visit to safe and friendly Ensenada.

277725483.name: May 2015
277725483.author: a TripAdvisor user
277725483.reviewBody: Carnival Cruise has 3days Get Away departing from Long Beach CA , then go to Ensenada. It\'s a small town with two Main Streets. Down down area is only 6 or 7 blocks. I enjoyed their beautiful landscape. Even the Stone Chairs in the park are unique , both ends are made by special tiles.

273813834.name: Beautiful ceiling
273813834.author: a TripAdvisor user
273813834.reviewBody: It was great to see the 300 year old, beautifully hand-painted ceiling of the building. The tour guide gave us the history of the building which included classic Hollywood stars like Lucille Ball and Desi Arnez.

260724414.name: the town of Ensenada
260724414.author: a TripAdvisor user
260724414.reviewBody: fish tacos are a must, any where in Ensenada, Papas and Beer for the real bar experience and Husongs bar is right near and a must also

260120642.name: Interesting architecture, woodwork, paintings, tile
260120642.author: a TripAdvisor user
260120642.reviewBody: Built as a casino during the depression and prohibition, beautiful architecture and woodwork. Interesting paintings in the bar with mixed race couples, probably considered very racy back in the day. I would recommend stopping to take a look around. Also lovely gardens with cactus and succulents.

255701693.name: Living History
255701693.author: a TripAdvisor user
255701693.reviewBody: This building has its roots from the old gangster days. Once owned by Al Capone it is steeped in history and folklore. Inside view the holes in the wall above the casino area where guys watched to make sure nobody was cheating at the tables! Check out the original chandelier hanging in the gaming area, exquisite! These days you can have your wedding reception there or your school formal. It is just a wonderful piece of local history.

255276501.name: Interesting Place
255276501.author: a TripAdvisor user
255276501.reviewBody: Mexican cultural centers are not what one would expect if you are looking fore an American type of center.  It is Mexican.  It is interesting and it does, or will, add to your trip to ensenada

252090177.name: Good Selection of Wines at Good Prices
252090177.author: a TripAdvisor user
252090177.reviewBody: We visited this winery as part of the tour so we got VIP treatment. We got a tour on the wine making process that was given by a member of the family that owns the winery. We found out that 50% of the wine in Mexico is made by this winery. After the tour, we were served cheese, wine, olives and bread and sampled four of their wines. I am not a red wine drinker and prefer sweeter whites. They had several and I was able to sample those. They also sell excellent olive oil and olives. My girlfriend who is a chef bought some to bring back home.I would definitely recommend that you stop here as part of a tour. It is quite a drive from downtown Ensenada so if you feel comfortable driving in Mexico then given it a try.

251001516.name: Casino From Years Ago
251001516.author: a TripAdvisor user
251001516.reviewBody: This was built originally by the Hurst family to be the larger than Monte Carlo. It only made it to #5, but you will be amazed in the detail of the wood designs and artwork throughout the facility.

246581154.name: Not worth a stop
246581154.author: a TripAdvisor user
246581154.reviewBody: The building is beautiful but not worth a stop.  The interior court yard is filled with vendors trying to sell their goods , nothing interesting just a old casino short history of this building from the tour guide.

226948519.name: You will LOVE Ensenada!
226948519.author: a TripAdvisor user
226948519.reviewBody: If you live in California, Ensenada is at your fingertips... Come visit and ENJOY a TASTE OF MEXICO!

221766988.name: Worth a visit
221766988.author: a TripAdvisor user
221766988.reviewBody: This is a lovely old building, built originally as a hotel and casino and visited by the rich and famous in its past history. Our guide described the development of the building, now used for cultural events and it\'s place in history as the birthplace of the Margarita cocktail. A small market is outside selling tourist nicknacks of reasonable quality and the vendors were polite and not pushy at all. A good way to fill in an hour.

201586739.name: Showcase of Affluence in the 1930s
201586739.author: a TripAdvisor user
201586739.reviewBody: It was originally built as a gambling casino & luxury hotel in the 1930s.  According to our guide it was the biggest Casino in the world. It was shut down when Mexico banned gambling but was restored through the combined efforts of the state government and the private sector.  Today it is mostly used for cultural events and exhibitions.  Try to visit this place when you are in Ensenada.

200833150.name: Beautiful Architecture, great margaritas!
200833150.author: a TripAdvisor user
200833150.reviewBody: Lovely, historical location with classic architecture, well kept and gorgeous! Our tour guide gave us the historical background on some of the lovely rooms that are currently utilized for special events. We were shown photos of the lovely lady that the margarita was named for and given FREE samples! They also produce wine and served beer. The wrought iron and art installations are authentic and the story behind why some of the art remains is a good one. If you get the opportunity to visit Ensenada you will be impressed with this location.

198401608.name: Wonderful
198401608.author: a TripAdvisor user
198401608.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed the walking through the grounds as well as inside.  Best to go on your own and enjoy at your leisure.  Hurrying through on a tour skips over so many of the interesting features.

195845190.name: Why was it so empty?
195845190.author: a TripAdvisor user
195845190.reviewBody: We just happened to walk by after our visit to town back to the cruise ship. This white building caught our attention and we walked into this empty museum. A very nice lady met us in the office/store area. We paid our $2 pp fees for the museum and enjoyed a very nice visit of this informative museum. There were just the three of us the whole time we were there and this place is right across from the entrance to the cruise port. I asked the lady if they have done any publicity at the port she said they were working on it. After the museum, we walked outside to the back of the building to the casino/cultural center/court yard where there were a little more people. Vendors were selling your normal souvenirs in the courtyard. I believe there is a restaurant there also. We were told that tours do come by the courtyard area but not to the museum. Check out the old casino which is empty now, but the woodwork on the ceilings are beautiful! We also walked around the garden area which was very nice. It was a very pleasant visit and I do recommend visiting the museum if you are in Ensenada.

195713847.name: L. A. Cetto Winery, Ensenada, Mexico
195713847.author: a TripAdvisor user
195713847.reviewBody: We took a ships tour to visit two vineyards one of which is listed here. We were impressed with the amount of wine produced by these wineries. The quality of the wine is comparable to Napa Valley wines. After the tour we were both given a complimentary bottle of wine to take home. Although the area is not spectacular in scenic charm, it has it\'s own uniqueness.

192616405.name: Time Well Spent.
192616405.author: a TripAdvisor user
192616405.reviewBody: We had a \'last port of call\' at Ensenada with our HAL Hawaiian cruise and we took the excursion (about 3 hours) that drove us around Ensenada (other than the university it\'s not much to see, at least on that tour drive), and then we went to the Cultural Centre and so glad we booked this. I must say the vendors that are in the courtyard did not seem to have quality offerings, as most of the items seemed quite cheap and uninspiring if one was looking for somethiing that truly showed a cultural aspect. The building is a delight to see and has a very interesting history. Several ceilings are really magnificent in their structure and painting, some wonderful ironworks, doors, and photos on the wall of historical moments. But the best were the dancers, the Mariachi Band, and most of all, the 76 year old \'cowboy\' and his lasso performance....he is just amazing. The costumes, the commentary, and the music all made for a good insight as to the culture and history. The show does not skimp on the performances and you certainly \'get your moneys worth\'.\nTake this in, it\'s a delight!

187457163.name: Surprisingly awesome
187457163.author: a TripAdvisor user
187457163.reviewBody:
We toured this building in Nov. 2013 as part of our Princess Sapphire Cruise excursion to La Bufadora.  I'm glad we stopped because this was the best part of an otherwise dismal experience in Ensenada.  

Yes, there are a few kids selling trinkets outside the building but they aren't at all aggressive and they don't chase you or plead.  For that matter, the few vendors inside the courtyard of this great cultural treasure don't harass either.

The building inside is a remarkable bit of history under restoration and depending on how good your tour guide is (ours was EXCELLENT), you will further appreciate the stunning murals, tile work, imported ironwork, etc.

To top it off, there are very good Margaritas for sale at a reasonable $3.00 which far outshine the Free samples of sweet slush.  Our party of 6 agreed they were the best Margaritas we sampled during our cruise, onboard or in port at Cabo San Lucas or Puerto Vallarta.

This building is available for events such as parties, weddings, conventions and such.  It's on our list for an Anniversary party in the future!

184984851.name: Beautiful building - not surprised there are "vendors"
184984851.author: a TripAdvisor user
184984851.reviewBody: This tour stop was included on another trip.  The building is beautiful but not worth a stop.  The interior court yard is filled with vendors trying to sell their goods and just when you think you\'re done with the shopping, the vendors move their children to the front of the buiding so when you exit you are faced with begging children selling junk for a few bucks.

176826862.name: Beautiful structure, and a lot of culture
176826862.author: a TripAdvisor user
176826862.reviewBody: I was glad we had time to visit the Cultural Center.  We learned a little bit about the history and traditions of Baja California, and particularly Ensenada.  We didn\'t realize many things, like Ensenada is the largest city in all of Baja, until we went to the Cultural Center. Very engaging tour guide!

175482819.name: Old Ensenada charm
175482819.author: a TripAdvisor user
175482819.reviewBody:
If you don't visit the Riviera Cultural center, it's like you didn't go to Ensenada. It's part history museum, part landmark. big part fun... It's a real old time  luxury casino with the traditional Baja style, there is something for every one and great opportunity for wonderful pictures and memories.

Even dough is "touristy" you'll be able to feel the local flare with some cute wedding or quinceañera happening there, hey, if they like you, you may even get invited to the party as a guest of honor! (It happened to my mom!)

Please don't forget to bargain your price on anything sold in the street or souvenir market, no matter how inexpensive you think it is you can get it for much less!

155732063.name: Go back in time
155732063.author: a TripAdvisor user
155732063.reviewBody: This is a must see.  If there is an event there it is even better.  We always stop here when we are passing through.  You can walk through the old casino and visit the ballroom.  There are paintings  on the wall from the 20\'s.  There is an old menu to view.  The bar is usually open and they are very friendly there.  There is also a history museum in there.  What a great place.

150460048.name: Wonderful cultural show!
150460048.author: a TripAdvisor user
150460048.reviewBody: Visited the cultural center on the eve of January 19, 2013. A cultural folkloric show had been arranged for the 65 of us from the HAL ship Zaandam taking an city excursion. Vendors were out selling their wares, only had a limited amount of time to shop. The show that we saw was simply wonderful. I encourage anyone that has the opportunity to attend the show in this old casino to do so. If the weather is chilly, do take a wrap. The temp was supposed to be 61, but it certainly did not feel like it.

145492879.name: Ensenada Tacos
145492879.author: a TripAdvisor user
145492879.reviewBody: Ensenada tacos are great and this building is a reminder of the good old days when prohibition drove many south of the border. If you time it right, get there when the cruise ship guests arrive and join in for a beer and Margarita. (The Margarita claims to have been invented there after Rita Hayworth formerly known as Maragarita ..........)

141872507.name: Best if you can go to an event
141872507.author: a TripAdvisor user
141872507.reviewBody: Beautiful, historic site. Wide and multidimensional and practical spaces with original art work. The people that work the gardens are very talented and well-spirited. Definitely worthwhile to check out. But better yet is if you can go to an event, that will allow you to feel more belonging in the surroundings. Great if you are a conference planner.

130540063.name: A Taste of Mexican Cultural Flavor
130540063.author: a TripAdvisor user
130540063.reviewBody: For visitors to Ensenada in Baja California - the Mexican Reviera, a visit to the "Cento Civico" - the Cultural Center provides a taste of Mexican cultural flavor. This is a one-time hotel where in the days of prohibition in USA - was patronised by Al-Capone !

126412572.name: Gorgeous interior ceilings
126412572.author: a TripAdvisor user
126412572.reviewBody: This is a beautiful building, lovingly restored from its former use as the casino in the 1920s.

122977734.name: Day in Ensenada
122977734.author: a TripAdvisor user
122977734.reviewBody: Our Princess cruise stopped in Ensenada in Sept. 2011. We enjoyed the day walking through town shopping and sitting in a local cafe with afew beverages.

696833.name: Gorgeous
696833.author: a TripAdvisor user
696833.reviewBody: We caught a Mexican wedding at the cultural center along the waterfront. It has beautiful inner courtyards like something out of Zorro, a historic well and quaint gardens in the rear.\n

658676683.name: Tour guide of doom
658676683.author: a TripAdvisor user
658676683.reviewBody:
We sailed in on the Disney Wonder on 3/14/19, just my wife and me.  We were greeted by our tour guide on the bus and as we started driving she began to point out everything she hated about Ensenada. First she wanted to mention how “we” have a Pizza Hut, a Carl’s Jr. and other American fast food. Then we heard about how the food here she heard was ok but she never eats here.   Next the shopping. There’s lots of shopping she points out, Costco and Walmart and such but she never shops here. It’s too expensive she says, tells us to drive to America and save money. Then she tells us how every travel guide has a 4 year degree like marine biologist and how she has a degree in translation. Next we hear how the winery we are going to says 1923 but she warns it’s really 1985 and they’re lying. Then the nice waterfront homes she points out are too far from the after for her liking, oh and here are some that have a gas station in front of them. She mentions how the winery is nice but she doesn’t drink wine and doesn’t even like wine, she likes scotch. 

After we toured the winery, which was very nice, she told us the gentleman dressed in old Aztec clothing and performing for tips was a fraud. She said he was a ‘very nice man’ though. 

All in all she gave us no desire to want to see anything of Ensenada, no desire to ever return and no positive stories to relate too. She was a horribly bitter woman with no love for Ensenada at all.

650736656.name: A MUST
650736656.author: a TripAdvisor user
650736656.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time, sit back, relax and be prepared to be transported to a beautiful and slower paced time. Both wineries have charm, beauty and wonderful wines. The tour guide and driver were amazing (Carla was guide, Juan driver I think) they were fantastic! Fun, educational and a gem of tours!

615208642.name: Family owned winery
615208642.author: a TripAdvisor user
615208642.reviewBody: We visited this winery as a part of our shore excursion. This was my first Mexican wine tasting. The place is laid back and can tell that it is family owned. They have a huge backyard and multiple tables  to sit. We took pictures with the vineyards on our view. I loved that design of the wall of the main building and had a nice outcome on our photos. The shop located inside the main building consist of their produced wine, jams, salsa and spices. They also sell breads and fresh mexican juices.

588405324.name: Eating and shopping in the sunshine makes for a fun vacation
588405324.author: a TripAdvisor user
588405324.reviewBody: We relaxed at La Casa de Dona Lupe by doing a little shopping as we dodged the cats and chickens roaming around freely with kids chasing them. The wildlife and children running around reminded us that country life is really that simple. We sipped some wine, but reserved our biggest purchases for spicy Mexican candy.

559678763.name: Not really worth it
559678763.author: a TripAdvisor user
559678763.reviewBody:
Wines are not really good. You will have a hard time finding one that you really like. They taste as cheap wines.
Restaurant: slooooow service. Pizza was overcooked, both pizzas we ordered were late.
Place was clean.
I do not recomend it.

554124779.name: Fun but so so
554124779.author: a TripAdvisor user
554124779.reviewBody: Wine and pizza was good but the environment felt like someone\u2019s big back yard. Not the best environment, but still not so bad wine.

552243030.name: Relax!!! Bring a book, you are here for the ambiance not the wine.
552243030.author: a TripAdvisor user
552243030.reviewBody: We to landed at La Casa de Dona Lupe as part of our cruise excursion Ensenada WineTour.  This stop was very relaxing and had a family owned environment.  Loved the roosters running about.  The organic pizza and bakery was fabulous. Drink the wine to wash it down but it wasn\'t worth purchasing in my opinion.  My Fianc\u00e9 truly enjoyed the fresh made jalape\u00f1o bread.  I enjoyed the affordable chair massage and live music. On our next trip out we intend to bring a book and relax for a while. Oh and be sure to try the olives!

551211574.name: Average Winery Tour - part of a package
551211574.author: a TripAdvisor user
551211574.reviewBody: While on a Carnival Cruise to Catalina Island and Ensenada we decided to go on an Ensenada Winery Tour.  This one was included in the package and was ok.  They had wine tasting tickets that allowed you to select up to 5 of their wines, but there wasn\'t much to the wines (good table wines, nothing to shout about).  They also cooked 2 fresh pizzas for the group (veggy and meat), which were quite good.  They were pretty good sized pizzas, enough for the entire group of 20+.  There wasn\'t much to see here, just sit out in the courtyard and taste wine.  There is a gift shop where you can also taste tequilas, and purchase all sorts of organic products.  It was ok, but I wouldn\'t choose this winery by itself...as part of the package it worked well.

535801653.name: Nice wines, nice pizza, nice setting
535801653.author: a TripAdvisor user
535801653.reviewBody: Our cruise excursion of Ensenada wineries took us to this winery.  This is a large facility and has multiple wines to choose from, as well as Mexican jams, vanilla, and other products.  They also served us pizzas, as nice touch.

533801472.name: Ensenada Oct 2017
533801472.author: a TripAdvisor user
