533801472.reviewBody: Another stop on our bus tour was La Casa de Dona Lupe winery where we were able to sample specialized organic red wines, delicious home made jams, hot sauces, olive oils and cheeses.  The owner, Dona Lupe, greeted us and welcomed to the picnic style outdoor area.  Here we enjoyed pizzas, breads and samplings of both red and white wines.

464648524.name: Always good in valley
464648524.author: a TripAdvisor user
464648524.reviewBody: Go past la cento and go to the best. Great for couples or family. One of best in valley and not pretentious. Go down 3 into valley and turn right after passing bungalows on side of mountain. Thank me later. My complaint is it used to be small and unknown. You will love lasagna.

464647109.name: An interesting Ensenada side trip...
464647109.author: a TripAdvisor user
464647109.reviewBody: We\'ve been to Ensenada more times than we can recall over the past 50 years...yes, it\'s changed.  The past 12 years, we stop several times a year as a ticket punch for a cruise.  Twice, we have taken an inexpensive ship excursion to two wineries out in the countryside - this is one of them.  Our first visit was entertaining - great nibbles, wine, more nibble, more wine and we did some shopping for infused olive oils and some tasty jams.  We were also entertained by an Aztecan-style fire dance.  Second visit, less food, less wine and no entertainment.  I would hope that second visit was just a fluke as we were impressed the first time around to return.

459865643.name: Great original winery
459865643.author: a TripAdvisor user
459865643.reviewBody: Loved this winery!  The honey wine is amazing!!!  The food, jams, jellys, oils and salts were excellent. We loved being able to try all of the jams and marmalades. We would love to visit again during the summer season!

457382163.name: Best Winery since La Cava
457382163.author: a TripAdvisor user
457382163.reviewBody: Great people, food, wine, entertainment and even had a massage.  Brought back loads of jalapeno preserves and vino!

447222039.name: La Casa de Dona Lupe is a great experience!
447222039.author: a TripAdvisor user
447222039.reviewBody: Visiting La Casa de Dona Lupe is like going to your great aunts house. It is a very local setting with outdoor seating and a large retail space inside that sells sauces, salsas and other condiments that are delicious. The food is cheap eats but the atmosphere with the chickens and children running around is very authentic and fun. Dona Lupe was in the house when we visited and made the rounds for photos and a chat. La Casa is definitely worth a stop if you are in the neighborhood of Valle de Guadalupe, its down the road from La Cetto winery.

447032534.name: It\'s a tourist trap!
447032534.author: a TripAdvisor user
447032534.reviewBody: Good idea, but really bad execution from a culinary stand point. The food was terrible and very expensive (from a price/value POV).

437108627.name: Growing and making good business
437108627.author: a TripAdvisor user
437108627.reviewBody: I Remember 4-5 years ago, this place was a small house with lots of goods, pizza and wine.  Now they have a great restaurant and I can tell by the smell that the LAMB was so good...  Just tasting wine and having "mermeladas" with all kind of combinations, my favorite is Chocolate with Chipotle.  My little daughter loves the sweet ones and my wife the Olive dip.  You can spend hours trying all different mermeladas and some of the local wine will be served outside, with a very nice humor and good attention.  Not the finest and exceptional wines, but fine enough to try something different.

436683503.name: Great Place
436683503.author: a TripAdvisor user
436683503.reviewBody: Great organic wines at a beautiful setting. The chickens walking around add a lil authenticity. Loved the white wine the most but appreciate trying them all. They also offer great spreads and jams in the store, all were amazing. Staff is top notch. Look forward to going back. Also the owner jumped in our bus to say goodbye to us. A must when in the area

436158657.name: Entertaining and worth exploring Princess Cruise excursion
436158657.author: a TripAdvisor user
436158657.reviewBody: Our group of 4 hopped on a bus outside Cruise terminal.  We were cruising on the Princess Ruby late September. This winery excursion had us entertained by our host Abner who talked nonstop till we reached our destination.  Winery was pleasant. A nice warm day.  We indulged in wine tastings and pizza. The shop there had food items to purchase and clean bathrooms. I highly recommend this tour.  I never knew that Ensenada had so many wineries on the outskirts of Ensenada.

432804096.name: Winery excursion
432804096.author: a TripAdvisor user
432804096.reviewBody: Carnival cruise line, winery tour, visited 2 wineries on this tour; LA Cetto and La Casa de Do\u00f1a Lupe, very informative tour. Tasted 4 wines at LA Cetto (2 white and 2 reds).  Great tour tour guide.  Second winery; 6 wines for sampling, got to meet Do\u00f1a Lupe, had some great pizza, and other products; jams, jellies, preserves and great spreads.  Great tequila sampling also, very relaxing atmosphere sitting on the patio tasting wines and sampling foods.  Well worth the modest price for the tour it\'s a must do.  Corporate winery vs family run winery.  Would definitely do this tour again.

424778833.name: Enjoyable and family friendly
424778833.author: a TripAdvisor user
424778833.reviewBody: On of our stops during our private wine tour, our guide was able to avoid it during the cruise ship bus tours. So we arrived it was relatively quiet. They have local musicians playing in the middle of the large shaded open air patio/dining area. The place had a great shop for jams, spreads, sauces to try out. The cantina food shop smelled great although we didn\'t get to eat there. We had a small plate of bread and cheese that was enjoyable. The wine pours are in this shot glass and have a variety of wines to choose from. That being said, the shot glass pour somewhat turned me away....made it look cheap and unclassy. You cant swirl and bring out the flavor, its not enjoyable as it is in a wine glass.

423384490.name: Cruise excursion
423384490.author: a TripAdvisor user
423384490.reviewBody: We stopped here as part of an excursion on a cruise we were on. This is a very quaint and lovely place. We were able to sample 4 different wines in addition to olive oils and jams. Dona Lupe herself came to greet us and thank us for coming. They had some Native American dancing and music happening as well. We did not leave empty handed and enjoyed ourselves. I would be willing to come again and try some new things next time.

422133973.name: A peaceful retreat
422133973.author: a TripAdvisor user
422133973.reviewBody: Dona Lupe has been in the valley long before the fancy wineries came along, so don\'t expect that. What they do have is awesome pizza in a lovely yard, great jams and marmalades, honey, olives, oils and breads. Great place to stock up on picnic goods. The wine we liked the best was the sweet red--not really into sweet wine but this one was really tasty and we got 2 bottles. A great place to pick up a few gifts. We visit the valley often, and never miss a stop at Dona Lupes!

404295316.name: There is something off about the wine....
404295316.author: a TripAdvisor user
404295316.reviewBody: Like others, this was part of a day trip we took from our cruise.  The people working there were very, very nice.  The food was also very good.  We had pizza, and while skeptical, it was actually very delicious.  The wine, however, was a horse of a different colour.  I have been drinking wine my entire life and have been to wineries all over the world.  There was just something not right about these wines. First, I had three samples side-by-side and not only did they all look alike, but they all tasted the same as well.  Quite frankly, it tasted like grape koolaid with alcohol in it.  I felt like they were not oaked at all.  The atmosphere was really cool and the food was excellent.  So, if anything, go for the food and atmosphere.

399341289.name: A world of delicious!
399341289.author: a TripAdvisor user
399341289.reviewBody: What a picturesque place. Beautiful, tranquil location with amazing homemade breads, jellies, spreads and treats. Definitely plan a stop here while you\'re in wine country.

391749991.name: Don\'t GO!!!
391749991.author: a TripAdvisor user
391749991.reviewBody: We went because this place was on a magazine as the best place to have breakfast IN THE WORLD!! And in that article they say that they have good lunch also..... the place is a ranch, with a terrace overlooking the vineyards and mountains, is on the backstreet of L A Cetto winery, BUT the service terrible, they change their style to pizzas and pastas and they are horribly bad, a guy was washing wastebaskets right at the center of the terrace were customers were having lunch, the wine is awful and on top of it they try to charge me more then what then the price tag of the menu... never coming back!!

391223591.name: Peaceful and Delicious
391223591.author: a TripAdvisor user
391223591.reviewBody:
Peaceful spot at the mountains. Beautiful view, delicious fresh waters, huge variety of organic homemade products at the store, delicious bread, affordable prices.
Mother earth is present in every corner. 
The long way driving is worthy.
I'll get back there the next time I am in Ensenada.

385934244.name: Go for the food, not the wine.
385934244.author: a TripAdvisor user
385934244.reviewBody: We visited here as part of a Carnival Cruise excursion of the Ensenada wine country.  We visited L.A. Cetto first for wine and it was very legit, followed by Dona Lupe.  Lots of specialty foods here that are worth the visit, but certainly not the wine.

380096672.name: So-so wine; fun patio.
380096672.author: a TripAdvisor user
380096672.reviewBody: This was part of our ship excursion\'s wine tour. We had a wine-tasting and some pizza.  We did not care for either.  However, we enjoyed visiting with our friends on the patio in the shade. There were some crafts for sale and we bought some earrings and other fun stuff.

378410857.name: Nice views, food is not good
378410857.author: a TripAdvisor user
378410857.reviewBody: Nice place to spend an hour, have a drink, nothing fancy.\nEven my 9 year old got bored. Don\'t waste your time. There are lots of other places to go in Ensenada/Ruta del Vino

375646681.name: Great food and views.
375646681.author: a TripAdvisor user
375646681.reviewBody: Visited last weekend and it was a very nice surprise to see a place with so many options to seat with a view (also with an inside seating area). The menu is good with all natural ingredients and fair prices.

362633412.name: Great atmosphere!  Fun Place!
362633412.author: a TripAdvisor user
362633412.reviewBody: Drove ourselves here, easy to find.  Very nice outdoor setup.  Handmade pizzas available as well as other snacks.  We opted for the cheese, bread and cold cuts platter which was very tasty.  They also have craft beers and craft beer tasting.

358577509.name: Southern Hospitality
358577509.author: a TripAdvisor user
358577509.reviewBody: The lady was very nice & helped us get around her yard. She had massage therapists waiting to rub our feet & stiff shoulders from the bus ride. We loved the cheeses & hot jalapeno jellies. Wine servers were very generous with the wine and we felt mellow very quickly, which was a good thing, because our bus driver was barely tapping the brake and the trip back to the docks is all down hill....lol

356831613.name: Great jellies, food and fun
356831613.author: a TripAdvisor user
356831613.reviewBody: This winery was so much fun.  The wine was ok, but we had a great time at this winery as the people who run it are the most gracious people.  They greeted us with a tasting of salsas in their little shop, then tasting of several jams and jellies.  The jams were so very good and we loved the chipotle hot sauce.  Then onto the patio for wine tasting.  Very nice patio with tables and chairs. They had a table to walk up to get your wine tasting, which you could take back to your table.  Also they set out bread and cheese for us.  Then they brought out some delicious pizzas.  An Aztec dancer performed for us while we were on the patio, very nice.  Then we were given tastings of special tequilas, one vanilla cream and the other mango.  Both were so good.  I would definitely go back here.  The wine was just okay but the lady who owns this place and all of her employees are so warm and made me feel very welcome.  I\'m still enjoying my jalape\u00f1os jam and chipotle hot sauce.  Just wish I would have picked up a bottle of the vanilla tequila.

353659297.name: Rating isn\'t for the wine...
353659297.author: a TripAdvisor user
353659297.reviewBody:
This was one of the two stops on our Winery Tour purchased through our Carnival Cruise, and while the wine was fairly awful, the setting was great and the chair massage was fantastic. I loved being out in the fields with the vineyards, horses and more, it was the kind of place I would love to host a rustic, evening outdoor party. 

The two best parts about visiting here were the organic jams in the shop and the chair massage that was not only better than anything I got on the ship (and dirt cheap). I brought home two jars of organic jam and wish that I had known how good they were, because I would have filled a bag and brought more home. There is also a tasting bar at the back of the gift shop, and if you're chatty and really nice, you'll get to try all sorts of interesting flavored tequilas. We enjoyed our time at this makeshift bar much more than outside where the wine tasting and pizza (what???) was.

The chair massage was all of $5, and was supposed to take 10 minutes but when there were no other takers, my masseuse asked if I wanted her to keep on going. Ummmm, yes! She had strong, magical hands that made my neck and shoulders feel as though I hadn't had too much to drink the night before, which wasn't the easiest of feats to accomplish.  Do make sure you tip these girls well, what they do is worth much more than they charge, and it is so much less than you would pay on the ship.

347218897.name: Charming organic winery, restaurant and store
347218897.author: a TripAdvisor user
347218897.reviewBody: We took a wine tasting tour while on a cruise and this place was one of the wineries we visited. I didn\'t care much for the wine, but I did buy a large bottle of vanilla that I\'m excited to use. We always get vanilla on our trips to Mexico but this was the first time we found organic vanilla. They also have essential oils and other great herbs, jellies and natural, organic items. We also liked the Mayan dancer who performed and the roosters.

338577120.name: Wonderful Blissful Day
338577120.author: a TripAdvisor user
338577120.reviewBody:
I was a cruise ship passenger to Ensenada. We decided to take an all day shore excursion which visited La Casa de Dona Lupe and one other winery. 

I highly recommend taking a group tour 

The drive from the cruise ship dock to the Santa Inez Valley is lovely - it follows the coast and then turns inland a few miles North of Ensenada. The Valley itself is a beautiful area - several different vineyards, and charming little villages. It is  lovely 45 minute ride through some of the most beautiful scenery in the area.

This winery is not some big huge company, it is obviously a smaller more personable place. It is obvious that these folks take great pride in their wines. You see their "heart' in every aspect of the winery.

They have a little Cafe/gift shop where they serve organic pizzas. Our group tour sat on the outdoor patio and had a light lunch of pizza and wine. It was one of the most memorable parts of my time in Ensenada.

I highly recommend this attraction - even if you are not a wine drinker.

335038406.name: Good wines, great setting
335038406.author: a TripAdvisor user
335038406.reviewBody:
Dona lupe serves wines, james, oils and salsa. They also serve Pizza in their restaurant. The wine tasting is very affordable and they serve a generous selection. Their Grenache was excellent and we picked up a bottle (again at a very affordable price). 

Their selection of Jams and oils were excellent as well. they had  a generous spread for customers to sample from. They even had their own olive oil and we purchased a small bottle which had some spices marinating in it as well. 

At the end of the afternoon, we sat down for a pizza at their restaurant. The pizza was ok (definitely had better pizza this side of the border) - thin crust style. But the setting and the ambience made it a very memorable afternoon.

322683500.name: Wines, Salsas, Jams.....and Pizza?
322683500.author: a TripAdvisor user
322683500.reviewBody: What a gem!  We were on a cruise excursion winery tour this October which was our first-time visit to Ensenada and the country\'s local vineyards.  La Casa de Dona Lupe is a quaint winery with a family-style atmosphere.  We enjoyed the visit and wine tastings that were offered along with cheese and crackers and various home-made salsas.  Top it off......there was a variety of pizzas served during our visit.  This was a very enjoyable stop during our winery tour.......walking away with some jars of home-made jams we purchased in the store!

313781941.name: Charming organic winery!
313781941.author: a TripAdvisor user
313781941.reviewBody: My wife and I visited La Casa be Dona Lupe during a recent visit to the Ensenada area. This is one of the only organic wineries in the area. The owner is a very charming 84 year old women who is one of the best hostesses we have met. The on site store offers numerous food products (hot sauces, homemade jams, baked items, wine, homemade olive oils, etc). We sampled 3 wines along with tastes of some of the food items. It felt like visiting the home of a special friend. Great experience!

311087163.name: Highlight of the Winery Trip especially for non-drinkers!
311087163.author: a TripAdvisor user
311087163.reviewBody: I went on a trip to the Wineries in Ensenada with friends.  One of our stops was at La Casa de Dona Lupe.  I\'m not a drinker, so the wine sampling which others enjoy, just isn\'t my thing.  My friends wanted to eat somewhere else, but the kids were starving, so the kids at here.  My son ordered the lasagna.  It was excellent and very large.  I ended up sharing with him.  There are musicians dressed in feathers playing music outdoors which brings a lot of atmosphere to the place.  The sitting area is huge but it was very hot out, so we had to work hard to find a spot that would give us shade and maybe a bit of breeze.  Keep in mind you\'ve got to know your table number before you order or you\'ll be waiting in that food line for nothing.  The best part for me was trying the jams and cheese spreads.  They have about 20 different bottles out for you to try.  I wanted to try all of them!  But I was embarrassed as there\'s a lady behind the counter watching you.  Not that she said anything when I tried about 8 options, but I felt embarrassed tasting so many.  Each is better than the next.  I ended up taking home the Mango/Tamarindo/Chipotle spread.  I let our au pair have some when we got home and it was such a hit with both of us, that she probably had most of the bottle within 1 1/2 weeks and I barely got 3-4 spreads of toast out of it all.  I know she went online trying to figure out how to order more because she got addicted.  So did I.  Bring some jam home.  If you don\'t, you\'ll kick yourself.

308404211.name: Breads, Jams, Salsa -- Must Try
308404211.author: a TripAdvisor user
308404211.reviewBody: The breads, jams and salsa are wonderful. The Wine making is ok. Give them a few more years. But to be here and try the wines was wonderful. The staff is very friendly. The grounds are very unique. I was really glad I came ans spent some time here. Very authentic.

299721639.name: LOVE the JAM tasting - LOVE the show - LOVE our guide David!
299721639.author: a TripAdvisor user
299721639.reviewBody: We LOVE this place!!  The jam tasting is fun and we all went home with lots of it!!!  We were treated to a cultural show outside and loved it while we ate lunch!!  Everyone loved their lunch!!  Our guide David Marmolejo https://www.facebook.com/ldstourguide/timeline  is AMAZING and has always provided us professional and amazing experiences!!   If you want to see photos or contact me feel free to anytime!!!  Tina utahforeignexchanges@hotmail.com

282982116.name: Simple can be fun and tasty
282982116.author: a TripAdvisor user
282982116.reviewBody: We took a shore excursion from Ensenada that took us to two wineries next to each other.  The first was L.A. Cetto, the largest in Mexico and then this one, which is owned by a wonderful lady who greets all of her guest and thanks them personally.  These were two extremes.  One flashy, sophisticated and huge.  The other small, basic fun and down to earth.  The wines are great.  They also have jams and jellies and relishes and dips and all sorts of goodies.  They serve burgers and pizza and has a real down home Mexico feel.  This little winery is only 5 minutes from L.A. Cetto.  Don\'t miss it.  It is fun and lively.  They even have ladies giving massages.  Just plain old fun.  They let you sample the jams and jellies and then you can get some wine, order a big pizza and have a great day.  Thanks so much to the wonderful owner.

273512319.name: Great wine!
273512319.author: a TripAdvisor user
273512319.reviewBody: If you\'re interested in the wine making process the tour I attended here did not go into depth about it nor show you how they process their grapes. But that was a-ok for me.  The wine here was tasty and they had small slices of pizza bread that was freshly made there.  There is a store inside that has a lot of fresh made products including jams and olive oils that  that.  It was a quaint winery  that gives you a nice variety of wine.  \n\nTruly I felt as if I were at someone\'s home in their backyard having a GREAT time.  There was an Aztec dancer to entertain us as well.  Bring a couple of bucks to tip him he walks on fire.

272518881.name: The Honey Wine is amazing!
272518881.author: a TripAdvisor user
272518881.reviewBody: This winery is sort of Mom & Pop place as it\'s very laid back and casual. They have a honey wine that is absolutely delicious. I\'m usually not a fan of sweet wine but this is an exception. Could almost be served as a liqueur. The jams and salsas are wonderful to sample too. The warm bread served with fresh farm cheese and jalape\u00f1o pepper was great along with their piping hot pizza made out of very fresh vegetables and cheese. Well worth the drive to get there.

268728002.name: Very nice small vinery
268728002.author: a TripAdvisor user
268728002.reviewBody: From L.A. Cetto, it takes 8 min driving to La Casa de Dona Lupe; this is family owned vineyard and not related to L.A. Cetto. There was no tour in this place and we went immediately to taste wine. Everyone got a ticket first and can sample up to 4 wines. I liked dry red wine and some people loved the Honey wine. They also provided delicious pizza, jams and salsas and there is a store you can purchase these homemade goodies. I like the setting in this place, very relaxing and their toilet was very clean.

260032882.name: You Have to Try the Tequila!
260032882.author: a TripAdvisor user
260032882.reviewBody: This winery was the second stop of a wine country excursion we took while on a cruise...there\'s no tour of the winery itself - and that\'s fine.  Head to the patio, taste some of the wine, but be sure to taste the delicious breads and pizza they set out - and the salsas...try it all!  The vines are actually up close and personal so you\'ll get some good pictures while on the patio, too.  BUT be sure to save time for stepping inside and tasting the tequilas!  Those were absolutely great!  I had no idea there were so many flavored tequilas.  Hector, from the winery, was fun and I think most of us back in that room (tasting the jams and tequila) purchased a bottle of tequila when we left - it was that good!

255675572.name: Great little family owned Vinyard, Bakery and tasting room!
255675572.author: a TripAdvisor user
255675572.reviewBody:
On a four day Carnival Cruise this was second stop on a two winery tour. The wine was not to my liking, though not bad. They have an interesting sweet red Honey wine. The highlights of this winery are the bakery and the wide assortment of spreads, jams, salsas, dressings, olive oils and something like tapanades. Sweet, savory and all different spice level.

The breads and pizzas, made fresh while we were tasting, were very good. They had a bread stuffed with blackberries, pineapple and cream cheese and one with fairly spicy jalapeños and cream cheese;both served warm. 

The day we were there,  they were offering 10 minute chair massages for 5 bucks. Fun, small family owned. It was delightful!

242539714.name: Very Good Wines, Pleasant Patio
242539714.author: a TripAdvisor user
242539714.reviewBody: We were in Ensenada on a Carnival Cruise and booked a wine tour thru Shore Excursioneer rather than the cruise. It was cheaper and we had a private taxi to Valle de Guadalupe for the two of us. Dona Lupe is a relatively small winery that makes and sells jams as well as organic wines. We tasted four reds, all of which were very good. I liked the full bodied nebbiolo best. The pours were generous although not in typical bowl wine glasses, and the server made no attempt to describe the wines or sequence them properly. Her English was almost as limited as my Spanish, so communication was impossible. Many thanks to the other taster who translated for us.  The absolute best part of La Casa de Dona Lupe is their relaxing, tree shaded patio. We had lunch there and sampled a few jams; we could have stayed there all afternoon. An Indian DJ in full regalia played Rolling Stones and Doors records at a reasonable volume that added to the laid back ambiance.

241124288.name: Chill atmosphere, delicious wine, jams, and sauces
241124288.author: a TripAdvisor user
241124288.reviewBody:
Carnival Imagination Cruise Ashore Tour:

We really enjoyed this winery, locally owned/operated - smaller winery. They have the perfect outdoor patio in the vineyard for sitting and tasting wine, eating cheese, jalapeno cheese bread (amazing, we bought some), jams, jellies and pizza. Perfect place to chill out. Really pretty winery as well. The patroness was lovely - the staff weren't unfriendly - but they weren't really friendly either, though the girl giving the tastings seemed to warm up as the afternoon went on.

Their gift shop was awesome, great selection of everything - wines, jams, herbs, bread, souvenirs, - they let you taste anything before you buy...except the liquor.

If you are going on the tour - go straight to the patio first as everyone enters the gift shop first and it's quite crowded and small, so don't be in a rush to buy in the gift shop the tour gives you plenty of time to go in later during/after tasting when it's not so crowded with other tour goers.

Quaint winery, good scenery, clean bathrooms...would definitely go back.

240895294.name: 3rd time and it still impresses!!
240895294.author: a TripAdvisor user
240895294.reviewBody: it had been 7 months since our last visit and this was our 3rd time to the winery in total as part of the cruise excursion- We could do without LA Cetto now and just come here as we love it that much. You can sample 4 wines or for me just the Honey wine 4 times ;) and the jams and liquors inside- which we ended up buying more liquors than wine this time- the staff are friendly and Dona Lupe once again thanked us for coming and was thrilled to hear that it was our 2nd visit of the year and even took a picture with me- try all of her goodies from the pizza to the jam and you wont be disappointed- they seem to be expanding and we cannot wait to see how it turns out..

240409382.name: Nice little winery
240409382.author: a TripAdvisor user
240409382.reviewBody: Went here as part of a two winery excursion while on a Princess cruise. Nice little winery with decent wine. My understanding is this winery is organic. Not only do they make/sell wine, but they also have jams, salsas, homemade pizza and more. Their pizza was quite good but I opted not to taste the salsas etc. While onsite, they have entertainment, a gentleman in costume who tells a story and dances with fire (I have some pictures but will have to post them later). He does not hesitate to pose for photos and appreciates any tips for his performance. There are tables out back to sit and enjoy the scenery and some food/wine while you visit. Very much a family feel to this adorable winery.

237832134.name: Vino Veritas...In wine there is truth!
237832134.author: a TripAdvisor user
237832134.reviewBody: And I must speak the truth about this little gem I recently discovered as part of an excursion I went on in conjunction with a Princess cruise I had taken. I have been to several wineries literally ALL over but the quaint, relaxing atmosphere here made me want to take a siesta and not get back on my tour bus. As others have mentioned there is more than wine here...jams,liquors,fresh bread...pizza....and such a lovely inviting place! A must see if you are in the area or if you come to port as part of a cruise that stops in Ensenda!

234787902.name: To wine or not to wine...on cruise excursion?
234787902.author: a TripAdvisor user
234787902.reviewBody:
After 12 cruises, we are the type that do our own thing, excursion-wise. That said, not being huge fans of Mexico and it's reputation (we live next door in San Diego, CA), our cruise was to stop in Ensenada, Mexico. 

We decided to book this 2 winery excursion through Carnival. The first stop was a large, commercial place called L. A. Cetto which I've reviewed separately. The second was this mom and pop type smaller place, La Casa de Doña Lupe. 

What a great experience! Did you hear me? Great experience!

We felt safe and comfortable the entire tour. Very professional.

Upon boarding the VERY nice tour bus, our guide introduced himself as "Rigo". But, because he has super curly hair, he said he is AKA Curly. He told some cute stories along the way, pointing out significant Mexican sites. Curly also pointed out how "quiet the ride is TO the wineries...and that the ride back is entirely different!" 

Boy, was it! So much fun!

We had a nice group of people ranging from early 20's to late 60's. It happened to be my 50th birthday and 31st anniversary that week of the cruise, so the whole bus sang to my husband and I!

Wine and taste are subjective to the individual, so I'll not review the wines themselves.

The wineries on this tour took us to the Valle Guadalupe area of Baja California.  

Be sure to dress comfortably, as there are areas that you'll walk over sandy/gritty driveway, and brick patios. High heels aren't a good idea here. Flat shoes or sandals, or even flip flops are perfect. It is nice and cool inside the commercial buildings at large winery, but most of your time is spent outdoors at La Casa de Doña Lupe. It could be hot and dry outdoors depending on time of year. We were there in late May, and it was absolutely perfect. 

Here they have a tiny local market and grill, a very limited amount of touristy items such as chili sauces, soaps, herbs, and such. I am not sure if you can bring herbs back to the US.? But, you can bring the sauces and such.

There is a nice patio area here with pub and patio tables and chairs. If you want shade, there are large trees with seating areas under them. Chickens and roosters roaming free. 

I was pleasantly surprised to see a woman offering neck and back massage under the trees. She has one of those chairs on which you sit and place your face into the doughnut shape cushion - while seated. For only 5$US, I received a nice 5 minute (more like 7+ minutes) massage and left feeling so great!

Oh, wine! 

Back to the wine... Here, they serve wines for tasting in what I thought were glass votives. More homey feeling. Like you were at your aunt's house for a backyard gathering. 

They'll give you a ticket that they tear a piece off upon each tasting. Up to you which ones you'd like. They also served some yummy thin crusted pizza or flat breads, freshly baked bread with cream cheese and jalapeño filling, and a variety of hot sauces. We loved it! Trust me, try it all!

Time to head back to the ship, Rigo and the driver, Jesus, gave us a parting gift of a bottle of wine, which was a nice touch. They also offered a chance to be dropped off in town if you'd like. Several did. We chose to go back to the ship.

Tip: Bring a bit of cash if you'd like to purchase anything at the smaller winery, and to tip. I believe that the larger place takes credit cards. Tips are also appreciated by the driver and guide. Tips at the wineries are not promoted, but, they deserved them for doing such a fantastic job of serving the small tour crowd.

All in all, it was A+ and we'd do it again! Forget the shopping for junky trinkets...take a winery tour and see the countryside.

Another tip: For CALIFORNIA residents, you are allowed to bring back up to 5 CASES of wine per person (as opposed to the smaller amount per person for hard alcohol). I didn't believe it and looked it up myself. 

Here is what the California ABC website states upon returning from Mexico:
"A California resident or any other person crossing the international border via common carrier may bring in a reasonable quantity of alcoholic beverages (up to five cases or 60 liters) provided the beverages are for personal or household use." https://www.abc.ca.gov/permits/importing.html
For non-California residents, you will have to look up your state's ABC laws.

224189296.name: Adorable winery!
224189296.author: a TripAdvisor user
224189296.reviewBody: I visited this winery as part of a Carnival Cruise excursion and I was pleasantly surprised. The grounds are beautiful and the staff is so friendly. They have a store right next to the winery where they sell yummy treats and flavored tequila.

220141053.name: Disney Cruise Line Port Adventure
220141053.author: a TripAdvisor user
220141053.reviewBody:
My husband and I took a Pacific Coast Cruise aboard the Disney Wonder a few years ago and our original excursion was canceled because they didn't meet the threshold of guests to sign up, so we booked a wine country tour instead.  We visited both L.A. Cetto and La Casa de Dona Lupe, both in Valle de Guadalupe about 30 minutes outside of Ensenada.

This was the second stop on the excursion, and we had already purchased more wine than we would be able to take back to the US with us on our fist stop, so we didn't purchase any more wine here.  The winery is smaller and more rustic-feeling than LA Cetto and offered more artesian food for purchase along with the wine.  They also had a patio instead of a tasting room, so we sampled wines outside.  There was no tour of the winemaking facilities, instead, they had two traditional Mexican musicians performing alongside the patio.

By the end of our tour, we were exhausted and almost fell asleep on the 40-minute bus ride back to Ensenada.  We would book this port adventure again, but probably not for a few more years, after we'd had time to visit the Ensenada area a few more times and take in a few more experiences.

213508730.name: Great Setting
213508730.author: a TripAdvisor user
213508730.reviewBody: On July 1st visted La Casa De Dona Lupe as part of a Carnival shore tour. The setting is natural as one can see the vineyards and be given several wine tasking glasses. The jams, cheese, olive oil are home made. The staff are so engaging. We had a group of school children take the tour of the winery and we felt we were in a natural setting and at home.\n\nRMS

204530530.name: we love this winery!!
204530530.author: a TripAdvisor user
204530530.reviewBody: We were on the cruise excursion with the LA Cetto winery (see review) and we could not wait to return to this little gem! We sampled more of the liquors (and bought a couple) and jams and breads this time around- had the pizza and did the wine tasting- Dona Lupe was there and greeted us like we were family- you don\'t see much of a tour- but that\'s okay- the honey wine (for us sweet wine people) was the best of the day! The wines are a little more pricey- but you\'ll appreciate the effort that goes into them.. there were also cows in the field adjacent and an Indian performer -  We will forget doing a ship excursion next time around and do a private tour that just comes here and spend more time minus the 100 other people. It is rather warm there and wear the bug spray as we got a few bites -

201259024.name: dona lupe organic winery
201259024.author: a TripAdvisor user
201259024.reviewBody: A must if you\'re in Ensenada area.  Wines are delightful,  jams are delicious,  food is great, all things made there good.   Love love the roosters chickens an baby chicks outside!  A lot of fun!  Remember this is a very warm area, so dress for it!

200233332.name: Disappointing Winery on a Cruise Ship Excursion
200233332.author: a TripAdvisor user
200233332.reviewBody:
This was a cruise ship excursion during a port call in Ensenada. John, I and 45 of our closest friends were bused to two wineries: one very large and one very small.

As we left the port, our guide (Gloria) strongly hinted that we should be tipping her and the driver (Jesus) at the end of the tour. During the 40-minute drive, Gloria gave us some information on the history and economic conditions in this part of Mexico but admitted that she did not know much about wine (she prefers whiskey) or the wineries we would be visiting. As we approached the first winery, Gloria informed us that she would handle the tips there but we should tip at the second winery. John and I have toured and tasted at over 100 wineries all over the world and this is the first time there has been any suggestion that the wine pourers were expecting us to tip them.

The second winery, La Casa de Dona Lupe, is an extremely small wine operation. In addition to wine, it produces liquors, herbs, jams, spreads, filled breads and pizzas. We were encouraged to taste the jams and spreads on our own; Gloria had a couple of the stuffed breads and pizzas cut up so that we could each have a small taste of those. Each of us received a card that entitled us to four small pours of wine. No descriptions of the wines were offered by the pourers; in fact, they never spoke at all and Gloria was naturally of no help. I did not see a tip jar but no one there was doing anything that deserved a tip anyway. The wines were non-vintage and of uncertain variety. They were at best drinkable but only marginally. The food was better. At one point, we had a brief glimpse of Dona Lupe herself and there was a costumed dancer doing native dances and selling jewelry. At least there were clean bathrooms.

The other winery was L. A. Cetto. Altogether this was a decent way to spend a port day in Ensenada. However, we would not seek out any of the wines we tasted to purchase in the future.

197650355.name: A Wonderful Find!
197650355.author: a TripAdvisor user
197650355.reviewBody: We visited this winery as part of a cruise ship tour and are going to go back on our own!!  We loved it.  First, the wines.  All wines are organic and are quite flavorful.  I\'m not a wine expert, but heard from others visiting the winery that the wines are good.  They are a little pricier than some of the larger wineries but well worth the additional cost.  The honey wine is more like a mead (sweet like ice wine) and I love it!  Beyond the wine, do not miss the salsas and breads.  They are both delicious and reasonably priced.  Toss the tabasco, kids!  These sauces are amazing.  The bread is fresh and tastes great.  You can grab some Mexican cheeses, sauces, bread, and wine and have a really fun dinner.  We also got to taste the pizzas, which are most on a whole grain thin crust.  Very good.  One tip: if you\'re headed here as part of a cruise ship visit and you\'re going to La Cetto first, save some money and room for Dona Lupes!

193265557.name: Shore Excursion Gem
193265557.author: a TripAdvisor user
193265557.reviewBody: We recently did a shore excursion wine tasting through our cruise line.  This was our second stop on the tour.  We found it to be a great experience.  I have a picture of one of the most beautiful sunsets I have every seen.  There was a fire dancer on the grounds adding to the experience.  The wine was good but the jalepeno bread and the pizza were even better.  This is definitely a place that I would come back to as everything is organic.  I was most impressed with the habenero and chili sauce available for sale and brought those back with me.  This trip was without my hubby...but the next trip I go to here will be with him!  Highly recommend!

188152075.name: Aztec dancing, good honey wine, beautiful lanscaping.
188152075.author: a TripAdvisor user
188152075.reviewBody: The best excursion  the owner dona lupe come out to greet us to her home, we are welcome to her backyard, were we are served delicious honey wine, chesse, salsa and the best pizza I have ever tasted. The added bonus in an aztec dancer dancing as you are enjoying the winery views.

185860241.name: Beautiful Location....
185860241.author: a TripAdvisor user
185860241.reviewBody: We did this as an excursion to wine taste, the snacks they served, pizza and cheese and jalepeno stuffed bread was very tasty.  They also had some awesome olive oil combinations and some fabulous hot sauces. You can sample till your hearts content.  I think I ended up purchasing 4 bottles.  The wines themselves were not very impressive, but we still had a fabulous time and the staff was very friendly.

177931948.name: Great pizza and snacks!
177931948.author: a TripAdvisor user
177931948.reviewBody: We were referred to Dona Lupe\'s for the pizza rather than the wine tour or tasting, and it was great!  Many combinations to choose from and reasonably priced.  They also offer many dips --- with free crackers! --- for snacking on.  My very favorites were one with creme cheese and one with green olives.  They have samples to taste before you make your decision to buy, but that just makes your decision more difficult!

172120217.name: Cool place
172120217.author: a TripAdvisor user
172120217.reviewBody: La Casa de Do\u00f1a Lupe was the second stop on the winery tour offered by my cruise ship recently. It is located just a short drive from LA Cetto, the first stop. What makes this stop unique is that it is a ranch, not a large commercial winery. There are four wines for tasting, a white, two reds and honey wine. While I normally do not like sweet wines, the honey wine was very good. You are offered bread and cheese with your wine, and pizza is available for purchase. I\'m not a wine expert, but I do consider myself to be a pizza connoisseur, and I definitely recommend it! Inside the shop, there are many jams, jellies, hot sauces and other products to sample. Don\'t miss the opportunity to try them all. Olive oil is also available for sale. I came home with three bottles of infused olive oil and two bottles of chipotle hot sauce. I will go here again the next time I cruise to Ensenada.

168336367.name: A charming spot in Guadalupe Valley
168336367.author: a TripAdvisor user
168336367.reviewBody: This is such a nice treat after driving up and down the "Route de Vino" all day. Dona Lupe is a charming hostess and very inviting. All of the oils, spice mixtures and baked goods are wonderful products make on the premises. The vineyard is organic and run by Dona Lupe and her son, Daniel. Wine I bought and brought home were two bottles of her Cabernet Sauvignon and were very full flavored and delicious. \n\nIt\'s just such a welcoming place in a beautiful surrounding. A memorable place in Baja\'s Guadalupe Valley.

159756385.name: Best part of the wine tasting excursion I took through Carnival
159756385.author: a TripAdvisor user
159756385.reviewBody: The pizza was delicious and the wine was pretty good too. My fav was the store with the most delicious spreads I have ever tasted. <3 definitely recommend it!

153479936.name: Should be on your list to visit - enjoyed it.
153479936.author: a TripAdvisor user
153479936.reviewBody:
We had visited several places, with mixed results.  This one was down the road from another one, and we asked our driver to side track to it.  I enjoyed it (disclaimer - we are not wine experts, we just travel a lot and like to drink wine).

This place had a very welcoming, non-pretentious feel to it.  You have options for bread, jelly, oils, spices, wine (of course) and lunch options!

The wine was good, not great, but good.  If we had not already bought some we would have added a bottle.  But the lunch, the jelly, oil and bread we purchased all made up for it.  Plan this as a lunch stop and you will not be disappointed.

Very welcoming and nice people.  Most drivers will drop by there if you are just running in.  They also have some non-standard nick-nacks that you will not see at the other places.

Recommended.

151183540.name: Wine was undrinkable, but the food was great!
151183540.author: a TripAdvisor user
151183540.reviewBody:
Went here as part of a tour with Carnival.  The place is cute and they are adding an add'l building.  The bathrooms are very nice.

I drink a lot of good wine and this place should not call itself a winery, as I don't think we drank more than 1 taste of each and we shared about 7 different tastes and all were undrinkable.  Just awful!

But we got bread and pizza and dips and they were all delicious and made up for the awful wine.

Cute winery cats too!

Inside they have a lot of items for sale.  We didn't have much time, but tasted the chocolate chipotle sauce.  I don't know what I would use that for but it was delicious!

150364854.name: More of a Restaurant than winery, but very good!
150364854.author: a TripAdvisor user
150364854.reviewBody: We stopped here on the Carnival winery tour, and while I wouldn\'t classify it as a second winery (after L.A. Cetto), it was a nice little stop, with a shop that featured dozens of jams, jellies, chutneys, honey, and other tasty morsels.  They have wine tasting in the back patio, and their honey wine was right up my alley!  Their organic pizza was a little underwhelming, but being from the Bay Area, I think I might be a little spoiled in that regard.  Dona Lupe came out and thanked us for stopping - she will be 82 in a few months!\n\n

144521395.name: Great Food, Wine and Jams!
144521395.author: a TripAdvisor user
144521395.reviewBody: I just came back to my house after visiting Dona Lupe\'s and as always, after going to the Valle de Guadalupe, I am well satisfied. I have visited many times before, but had to make sure I placed my review. The food and wines are excellent and take some whipped butter or jams with you. I am sure you will enjoy them at home or on your further travels.

142152528.name: Guadalupe Wine tour package from Disney Wonder
142152528.author: a TripAdvisor user
142152528.reviewBody: We were cruising on the Disney Wonder and took the ship wine country tour for $35 per person (which is really cheap considering it included the tasting fees, snacks, and a free bottle of wine from L.A. Cetto Winery)  which include La Casa Dona Lupe and L.A. Cetto wineries.  Dona Lupe is a small organic winery.  The wines were just so so but it is still worth a visit for the free pizza, bread, cheese and tastes of jams and jellies as long as it is not the only winery you go to.  We also bought a large glass of tasty sangria for $2 And a small jelly jar of grape seed powder for $7.  Aztec dancers and chanters performed in the exterior courtyard while you were tasting and eating.  It\'s a beautiful setting, and the eating area is lovely. \n\nAlso part of the tour was the nearby L. A. Cetta was a larger commercial winery with a great facility tour and the guide that talked to us about the wine business in Mexico.  If I had to choose only one this would have been it.

134875483.name: Organic wines and fine pizza!
134875483.author: a TripAdvisor user
134875483.reviewBody: La Casa de Dona Lupe is a hidden jewel of a winery located behind L.A.Cetto winery in the Valle de Guadalupe. The wines are organic and unique, must experience the love that they are made with. The food is excellent, and the owners are very health-conscious and organically inclined. The make some delicious jams and hot sauces and carry many unique products made either on location or in the area. Lovely outdoor dining area is the perfect place to spend an afternoon!

132935791.name: Great Friendly Staff
132935791.author: a TripAdvisor user
132935791.reviewBody: I usually stop at Dona Lupe when I bring friends to L.A. Cetto as it is a very unique spot in Valle de Guadalupe with one of the friendliest staffs in the region. The wine is not one of my favorites, as most of the reds have a very sweet honey taste that is accentuated when served outside in the warm garden area. I love the oils and organic jams although they are a bit overpriced. The pizza is very good as are the home baked cookies! It is more of an attraction than a winery and a fun place to stop for refreshments and snacks.

132038258.name: Not a destination
132038258.author: a TripAdvisor user
132038258.reviewBody: After reading the great reviews of La Casa Dona Lupe, we made a trip with that as our destination. Maybe it\'s a seasonal thing, or for weekends, but we were disappointed in it as an experience. It\'s a beautiful setting, and the eating area is lovely. When we found the store area there were many jams. jellies, oils etc, but when I tried to get a taste of wine, the woman behind the counter looked puzzled, then left and came back with a bottle of wine which she tried, unsuccessfully, to open. Eventually, after breaking the cork and getting help, she got it open and gave me a taster cup (corked). Finally, a woman dresses as Dona Lupe came in and after giving us the pitch about the jams and spreads told us she would find someone and give us a tasting ($5 four 4 tastes) He poured the last sip then left. We were a little puzzled, but went back inside and bought a bottle of wine to go with our spreads and bread. After that we went down the roads to La Cetta and had a nice tour, and four tastes (no charge) and a guide that talked to us about the wines.

130230921.name: divine wine and beautiful olive oil
130230921.author: a TripAdvisor user
130230921.reviewBody: The Merlot is a rich dark red and so tasty. The olive oil clear and pure. We bought a bottle for everyone on the gift list. The chile based oils and jams are perfection. There are light snacks to enjoy with a glass of wine. Dona Lupe is a real person, and if you are lucky you will get to meet this elegant and gracious woman. She\'s one of the pioneers of wine making in the area. The grounds are attactive. Wine tastings are available. There are several nice small wineries in the area, but this is one of the best. Much of her wine is organically produced. A real treat. We spent several weeks in the area and took the pleasant drive to the valley several times. We always found ourselves at Dona Lupe\'s picking up a lunch treat and a bottle of wine for later.

129898421.name: Delicious wines, jams, and pizzas
129898421.author: a TripAdvisor user
129898421.reviewBody: Wine tasting of 4 wines, very good, we bought a nice Tempranillo. They also make about 2 dozen different jams from various fruits and chiles, which are all available to taste. They were excellent. We also had a pizza Espa\u00f1ola, which was very tasty and an excellent price (I believe $85 pesos). We will definitely be coming back and plan to bring friends.

129779564.name: Small family run winery worth the visit
129779564.author: a TripAdvisor user
129779564.reviewBody:
We opted to tour La Casa de Dona Lupe winery as part of our wine country tour excursion from our cruise ship.  There were sketchy accounts of what to expect.  Now that we have been there I am certainly glad we chose this tour.  

First, we were surprised to learn that any wineries existed in Mexico.  The area near Ensenada has the right climate and altitude for small harvests of grapes for wine.  Our tour included a stop at the store stocked with local food products and offerings of free samples.  Just behind the store front is a small outdoor patio where the wine tasting is found.  You are also served delicious pizza and bread.  Even though the wines are not exceptional the cabernet sauvignon, merlot and zinfindel were very drinkable.  

There was also Aztec dancers and chanters who entertained us during the wine tasting.  Be aware the entertainers will come by asking very politely for donations.  Overall, I recommend this tour just for the local flavor and moutain valley scenery.

128940472.name: some where in the background of all that burning sensation...
128940472.author: a TripAdvisor user
128940472.reviewBody: I have been to this vineyard twice now-\nthe memory that I have of this place that stands out the most is eating the super hot salsa they serve when you order light foods to eat while you sit and drink wine. There was a selection of different kinds of jams, spread and whatnot to put on fresh bread and I had so much of this salsa that I went off into my own little transcendental moment induced by capsaicin overload while my boyfriend and his family spoke about ecumenical matters in Spanish some where in the background of all that burning sensation... It was a lovely time. :)

128097363.name: Very nice and authentic Wines and Jams
128097363.author: a TripAdvisor user
128097363.reviewBody: We visited here recently on a tour with Princess Cruises.  Loved it.  The staff was lovely as was Dona Lupe who came out to greet our bus.  I highly recommend this tour with the cruise line. The jams and jellies are a bit pricey, but are very, very good.

124276444.name: The best organic wines
124276444.author: a TripAdvisor user
124276444.reviewBody: it\'s all good for the taste and the quality. They even have great food products and the staff is beautiful just like Mama Dona Lupe

659569884.name: Short Walk from Cruise Port
659569884.author: a TripAdvisor user
659569884.reviewBody:
Walk for the Cruise port - go straight to main street - turn right and go across street to large white ornate building entrance is near the middle - Cultural Center. Pay small fee to get in. Lots of stairs up and down and work your way through the Museum.

Very interesting to see and understand a little about the history of Ensenda and the area.

Worth your time to see.

643810639.name: Learned A LOT. You don\'t need to speak Spanish to visit.
643810639.author: a TripAdvisor user
643810639.reviewBody: While exploring Ensenada for the first time,  I saw a marker for this museum on Google maps and my wife and I made a pin GB of trying to find it. After walking around for a while, we went in a side gate after passing the open air theatre (under construction). We walked around the beautiful garden and observed the statues, plants,  and plaques that talked about historical figures of Ensenada (in Spanish). We left and walked around the front of the building to discover this wonderful museum. The man at the desk spoke no English but,  after passing a very low admission fee, have us a binder with information I  English on the exhibits. Nearly all of the signs for each display was in Spanish and English.\nI am so excited we visited. There are a series of Baja missions we weren\'t aware of. We got to learn so much about the history of Ensenada and its people. I can\'t believe they\'re as me to offer so much I  this museum with such a low admission cost. There are MANY rooms and stations in the museum.\nI do wish my Spanish was a bit better.  The gentleman at the desk had stories and anecdotes about the building he wanted to tell me but I missed a lot of what he had to say because I struggled with interpretation. All the same,  it was fantastic experience. The trinkets sold in the gift shop are great.

623858787.name: Snapshots of History
623858787.author: a TripAdvisor user
623858787.reviewBody: This history museum that is a short stroll (/2 block) from the cruise pier tells the story of Ensenada from the original Indians- (beads, baskets, pots) , through the missionaries (religious objects), to the current archeological digs in the area (a new photo exhibit of cave art). The 2 awesome Chinese stone lions at the front gate suggest the Chinese influence in the past and present. The stucco white exterior belies the dark, crammed interior.  This is my second visit and have found that at least one room had changed in 2 years. There is a small gift shop at the entry staffed often by volunteers and a minimal entrance fee.

539545979.name: Very well done!
539545979.author: a TripAdvisor user
539545979.reviewBody:
This little museum doesn't a very good job of presenting the history of Ensenada and the region. The exhibits are not elaborate, but the documentation is very strong and there's an English translation accompanying the Spanish narrative.

We were presented an English guide (notebook) when we entered and found it to be useful in guiding our tour through the museum. 

We were visiting midday during the week, so it was not crowded and we could stroll through, reading the descriptions of the artifacts and taking our leisurely time.

505634145.name: Lovely little museum, 5min walk from cruise ship
505634145.author: a TripAdvisor user
505634145.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this little museum about the history of Ensenada. Had some nice exhibits & a gift shop. The man who checked us in was very friendly too:-) I think it was a couple dollars donation per person. Definitely a nice safe alternative to shopping or the bars. We had shopped in the morning, then had lunch on the boat, then walked to the museum:-)

502660066.name: Exhibits in Old Jail Cells--Interesting and Charming
502660066.author: a TripAdvisor user
502660066.reviewBody: The photos posted by others are of the first half of this wonderful little museum, just a half block off the main drag.  Excellent displays and descriptions of the paleontology and anthropology of Baja California, including huge mammoth bones, lots of spear points and arrows, and baskets, dioramas, and explanations in Spanish and English.  We enjoyed that half, which is more carefully curated than the second half, but we loved the jail cells in the other half, which are still a work in progress (which somehow made them even more charming).  You will need to use a flashlight (most people have one on their cell phones) to inspect some of the old jail cells, which, in a few, display artwork by the resident inmates from years ago.  The museum must cater to school groups as well as tourists, because one cell is unexpectedly and delightfully filled with dozens of transformer action figures, something to bring a smile to any visitor\'s face.  A couple of the cells contain old photographs, and some old letters, still being curated at the time of our visit.  Really, if you can take a half hour away from the craziness of the shops and bars and street vendors, we think you will love this free museum.  Note that some of the reviews have this museum confused with the one at the old casino at the other end of town.  The two are totally different.

492884054.name: Weekend visit
492884054.author: a TripAdvisor user
492884054.reviewBody: If you\'re from southern California, you\'ll notice many similarities in the history of the region.  It was a not crowded and most things were printed in both English and Spanish.

476207675.name: Learn about the history of Baja
476207675.author: a TripAdvisor user
476207675.reviewBody: The museum walks you through the history of Baja from prehistory to the native people to the arrival and live under the missionaries.  It\'s just $2 US to get in and worth the hour it takes.  Most signs are bilingual Spanish/English.\nThe gardens outside of the museum are worth a visit as well.  There are well maintained and have a nice little cactus and succulent collection.

435977010.name: WHAT DO YOU EXPECT FOR TWO DOLLARS US?
435977010.author: a TripAdvisor user
435977010.reviewBody: A fifteen minute walk through, that\'s all.   So, so much more could be done. Exhibits need to be changed every year, not every decade

391589035.name: Interesting museum of the history of the area and the jail - FREE!
391589035.author: a TripAdvisor user
391589035.reviewBody:
This is a free museum just at the end of the tourist street in Ensenada.

Look for the white jail facility.

Wander in and see the exhibits.  The history section is in both English and Spanish.

The jail section doesn't have English language labels.

Clean restrooms are at the back of the compound.

642278396.name: Great day for a ride
642278396.author: a TripAdvisor user
642278396.reviewBody: We hit port in Ensenada where Jose picked up all the people who booked the excursion. On the ride to the ranch he tells you about where to shop and how to get back to the boat if you choose to go shopping after the ride. Once at the ranch we were all matched up with a horse (school yard pick) and while doing this an unfortunate incident happened. One of the horses got spooked or something and about 4 horses took off. A couple riders fell off as they did not pull back on the reigns. The staff was all shocked as something like this has never happened in 28 years. It\'s a sad thing to have happened and Rita was very upset. We could either stay and ride or go back to the ship. We chose to stay and had a great ride with very scenic views! The Cowboys all make sure you feel ok in the saddle and ensure you all stay together. Some of the sights were beautiful! Back at the ranch you can have chips, salsa and punch. You may also opt in for a margarita if you like. The horses were all well fed (they are not skinny) and well behaved other than at the beginning. I actually calmed down the one house after the incident and was able to grab his shank and give him back to a handler. It was a great morning and the weather was perfect. Dress appropriately people! You do not need to look and dress like you are attending a fashion show. Wear proper attire!

635476988.name: Very nice horse excursion, good value and fun
635476988.author: a TripAdvisor user
635476988.reviewBody:
I’ve ridden horses since I was five and i always dread rentals because with all the liabilities, lawyers manage to take all the fun out it. Not this place, it’s very safe and all that, however you do actually ride geldings that have a bit of zip through a beautiful plateau with plenty of rock, hill and a bit of Mexican trotting. 

A guy name Miguel picks you up at the cruise terminal and takes you up to the ranch which is owned by an American. She loves horses, you can see that immediately. The animals are healthy and their feet look good. She also has three super large Shepard dogs. Super friendly. 

This place is worth the money for sure.

628238894.name: Good for all ages
628238894.author: a TripAdvisor user
628238894.reviewBody: When in Ensenada on cruises, we\'ve done this excursion several times.  Once just my husband and I, and another time with our grandson who had never been on a horse before.  It is great way to spend the day.

626278331.name: I went from terror to Bliss
626278331.author: a TripAdvisor user
626278331.reviewBody: I took the horse riding excursion from the Norwegian Bliss Oct 2018. It was a last minute decision and turbed out to be the best excursion ever. My comfort zone is a car with a steering wheel in my hands, not a saddle and reigns. I\'ve never ridden a horse in my life!! When I got on my horse, Cajefe, the ground looked and felt as though it was a mile away, my instinct said .. get off, get off now! I said as much to Rita and Jose.  They convinced me to stay, I\'m glad they did. By following their lesson and advice, after the first ten minutes, I was calling Cajefe "baby" and stroking his neck while holding the reigns with one hand. Horse excursions will always be on my list of things to do. I hope you give it a try.

569801170.name: My Favorite Excursion to Date
569801170.author: a TripAdvisor user
569801170.reviewBody:
Miguel welcomed us as we came off of our Carnival Cruise. He was professional and entertainingly informative as we traveled to the ranch. He pointed out interesting tidbits about the area along with answering questions from curious travelers.

The horses were fresh, well fed, impeccably trained, and spoiled. Our photos were taken before we went off, and we enjoyed a beautiful ride along a rustic trail that provided spectacular views of the hills and the sea.

Miguel accompanied us along with a few other Cowboys and he would ride to us and take photos for using our cameras. My phone fell out of my pocket during at trotting session and Miguel brought it to me.

After the ride, chips and salsa along with complimentary fruit punch and water were made available to us as well as carne asada tacos we could purchase for only $5. There is also a bar where Rita, the owner, makes outstanding margaritas and serves cold beers. You can purchase photos taken at the beginning of the ride in a festive frame and there are other small items available for sale.

My friend and I agreed that this is the best horse riding excursion we have ever experienced. We take one everywhere we go. Thanks especially to Rita and Miguel.

560280710.name: Bachelorette Excursion to Rancho Los Bandidos
560280710.author: a TripAdvisor user
560280710.reviewBody: Great excursion, with transportation to and from ranch.  Horses appear healthy and well cared for.  Staff and guides are friendly and most helpful.  Excellent family and group activity.  Horseback riding trail that offers beautiful view of ocean.

548881297.name: Best time ever
548881297.author: a TripAdvisor user
548881297.reviewBody: The horses are beautiful, well trained, happy and healthy. The cowboys definitely know what they are doing. Our main guide Jose...rock star! The views are breathtaking! Your jaw will drop! You will have a smile on your face the entire time. Everyone at Rancho Los Bandidos is super friendly. You will feel like family. The homemade tacos...best tacos EVER!!! Hats off to the woman who owns the place! She has done an amazing job! This was a shore excursion so we had a time limit. Honestly, I would have preferred to have spent another 1-2 hours at Rancho Los Bandidos than walking around downtown. Wishing I was on the trail right now! This is a must do!

501663301.name: Great excursion run by GREAT people!!!
501663301.author: a TripAdvisor user
501663301.reviewBody: We booked this excursion via our cruise ship (Carnival) and it was fantastic.  Don\'t be fooled by on-shore bookings that might be a little less expensive.  With Rancho Los Bandidos you are getting a reputable company (run by an American, if that makes a difference to you) that only works with the cruise lines.  We were met right at the port by Miguel who is so personable and professional.  We left on time and he filled us in on many Ensenada highlights during our 20-30 minute bus ride to and from the ranch.  Once there we were greeted by owner Rita and her ranch hands who had a team of healthy horses of all sizes ready for our group (13 of us in our family) plus 2 or 3 other smaller groups.  The horses looked so healthy and happy and we had a fantastic 4 mile ride.  Wish we could have gone a little faster but I understand that we had various ages and sizes and the horses needed to stay together.  Once back at the ranch, we were met with drink, food, photos (all optional) before heading back to the port.  So much fun!!!

478367542.name: Top of the world views!
478367542.author: a TripAdvisor user
478367542.reviewBody: The views cannot be matched. The trail that the Los Bandidos use is up on a plateau that gives you an exceptional view of Baja California. I have been horseback riding several times, and this crew treats its customers right. All equipment is new/ or well maintained, and the horses are well trained for even the most novice of riders. Tucked in the cliff side just outside Ensenada, Rancho Los Bandidos stable is a humble, but well run stable. If you book with a group a small chips and salsa snack w/ juice is available after the ride. The only things I wish were different.. the ride there.. and I felt it was a little short, but that may be because I enjoyed it so much!

440357643.name: Awesome experience
440357643.author: a TripAdvisor user
440357643.reviewBody: We just returned from our cruise and our highlight was the horseback riding here. We had our kids of 10 and 7. I have to admit I was skeptical of any excursion and hoping for at least a mediocre outcome and/or my kids would enjoy it. \n\nOur guide was Jose who rides with you in the van and then is lead of three cowboys throughout the ride. The trail was magnificent as others pointed out in the hills with beautiful views of the ocean and Ensenada. The hills themselves were picturesque. Jose and the others were very attentive to the safety and comfort of the children on the ride and everyone. I felt our children were in good hands. This is a definite must.

426229377.name: Beautiful horses and spectacular views!
426229377.author: a TripAdvisor user
426229377.reviewBody: Miguel was our guide from the cruise ship to the ranch.  He was very friendly and informative regarding the area.  The ranch itself was lovely, the horses beautiful and well cared for.  I have some experience riding, and didn\'t need much help, but the staff seemed very attentive to those who did need some help.  The ride was long, with great views of the bay.  My only complaint was that we were not able to stop at the summit in order to take some photos of the bay.  The salsa back at the ranch was so good, it was almost addictive.  Wish we had time to actually eat there.  I would definitely recommend this excursion.

418333215.name: Beautiful horses and views!
418333215.author: a TripAdvisor user
418333215.reviewBody: This was a wonderful ride with beautiful and well cared for horses!  We were greeted at our cruise with our tour guide, Jose. He took is out to the gorgeous ranch in Ensenada and gave us helpful and fun tips about Ensenada itself.  Upon arrival, the horses were beautiful and seemed very happy.  The trail was on top of the mountains of Ensenada overlooking the tropical coast of this beautiful city.   At the end of the ride, we had the pleasure of eating delicious carne asada tacos and mango margaritas.   I would defiantly recommend this ride and cannot wait to come back !

416954677.name: Very Friendly Guides & Beautiful Views!
416954677.author: a TripAdvisor user
416954677.reviewBody: The horses were lovely, and the views were gorgeous. It was one of the longest rides we\'ve ever been on. The guides were wonderful: So friendly and helpful. And as a plus, we got to eat homemade tacos, and chips and salsa (and beer) after the ride. It was great! :-)

377320111.name: Highly recommend
377320111.author: a TripAdvisor user
377320111.reviewBody: The views of Ensenada Bay and the gorgeous terrain were wonderful.  The group was very supportive of the more inexperienced among our group.  Carne Asada tacos afterward were awesome!!

372407030.name: Thank you Rita & Miguel
372407030.author: a TripAdvisor user
372407030.reviewBody:
I came from the Carnival ship and this was a great excursion.

Consider washing your hands right after riding the horses though -- don't touch your eyes, and wear long pants.

Miguel was very informative during the transfer rides and the tacos & margaritas were good too!

369620125.name: Great time try Rita\'s Taco\'s
369620125.author: a TripAdvisor user
369620125.reviewBody:
I took a carnival cruise and this was one of the options. The horses looked well taken care of and healthy. It's your typical horseback ride that's delivered now days. Wear a helmet and the horses pretty much walk one on front of the other. Every now and then the horses will pick up speed for a few seconds.  :)

Your able to take pictures, but no real stopping along the way. 

It was an enjoyable ride. The rides roughly an hour. just depend on if people have issues along the way. The make a loop around a hill. Don't remember the miles but i tihnk 5 or 6...

Afterwords they offer the option to purchase margarita and tacos'. TAco's were amazing!

368792207.name: Beautiful Views and Great Guides!
368792207.author: a TripAdvisor user
368792207.reviewBody: My friend and I booked this tour through our cruise ship. It was a fantastic experience! All the guides were very friendly and professional, from the bus driver to the caballeros. I was pleasantly surprised with beautiful, healthy horses. The views were amazing. (Make sure you wear clothes to get dusty.) Authentic tacos with beer and mango margaritas are available at the end of the tour for a modest extra charge. The tacos were the best I\'ve had! A special shout out to our main guide, Miguel, he was the best! Mucho Gusto! Muchos Gracias!

358619335.name: My daughter fell in love...with horses of course
358619335.author: a TripAdvisor user
358619335.reviewBody:
We were skeptical at first, thinking our only day in Ensenada would be taken up all by our horse excursion... quite the opposite. The ride to the ranch was a history lesson and site seeing experience.
Upon arriving at the ranch, we saw a beautifully maintain ranch with healthy, happy horses and ranch hands/guides. 
Safety and fun were the main concern from everyone envolved.
We were hand selected for our individual horse by the lady who owns and runs the ranch. Each horse had a unique name. The ride was a pleasurable pace allowing everyone to feel comfortable and safe. The views were spectacular and u could take photos while riding along. The ride was long enough to enjoy nature and the beautiful animal/horse we were riding. After the ride were able to purchase tacos hand made on the ranch. Chip and salsa were free..and delious too. We are telling everyone we know about our fantastic experience. .we will definately be back...until then we will have to satisfy my daughter's new love locally..

352982058.name: So much fun
352982058.author: a TripAdvisor user
352982058.reviewBody: We booked this as an excursion with Carnival Cruises. We had so much fun. Miguel, our tour guide, was extremely nice and funny, As we were being shuttled to the ranch, he gave us some history of Ensenada.  He went one by one and took pictures of everyone while riding! The views were breathtaking and when we got back, the ranch owner had delicious food and drinks for us to purchase which were amazing. Highly recommend a visit!

350227131.name: Great Experience!
350227131.author: a TripAdvisor user
350227131.reviewBody:
We signed up for the Horseback tour in conjunction with our Carnival Cruise. Our guides were very professional and friendly. Always looking out for our safety, as well as taking pictures of us with our own phones/cameras.

It was the first time to ever ride a horse, and I'm glad we did it with Rancho Los Bandidos!

Please say hi to my faithful steed; Dos Equis :)

346755538.name: Awesome Experience and views to boot!
346755538.author: a TripAdvisor user
346755538.reviewBody:
We did this as a shore excursion on the 4 day Carnival Cruise and very happy that we did. You get picked up from inside the ship and taken to the ranch by a small shuttle bus. Our guide had a wealth of knowledge about Ensenda, what to do, the best place to buy souvenirs, how to haggle (hehe), where to go. So on the drive up to the ranch, we got a lot of information.

Once at the ranch we got our helmets and were given safety instructions as well as how to control the horse. It was a quick lesson, but informative. This was the first time that we had gone horse back riding, so I was a little scared. During the ride, there were plenty of guides to help keep the horses in line if needed. So I felt very safe and even had the confidence to make my horse do a slow trot. The guides did encourage us to go faster at times, which surprising but fun! They knew the trail really well and would tell us when a tricky part would be coming up, so like I said, I felt quite safe as a first timer.

When you get to the top of the trail - the view of Ensenada bay is amazing! Well worth the ride up. During the ride, the guide would also ask for our camera/phone and they would take the photos. Great service!

You get the options of either getting a lift back to the ship, or to the middle of the town or if you wanted to do a little more exploring, they are also very happy to organise a taxi for you to go up to the blow hole.

All in all, would definitely recommend this, especially if you are a first time rider.

332496151.name: Great experience for all ages! Beautiful views with Great guides and horses!
332496151.author: a TripAdvisor user
332496151.reviewBody:
This was a great experience all around! After boarding our shuttle and meeting our guide Miguel (who is very entertaining, knowledgeable and showed genuine concern for each person), we then began our 10-15 min ride through town to the ranch. 

Along the way Miguel informed us of the history of the town and surrounding area and made sure to engage each person in conversation. The ranch was better than I expected, VERY clean and well taken care of. The ranch is owned by a lady named Rita who has lived there for the last 25 years. The horses are very healthy and well trained, you'll see this after the ride when they go to the corral by themselves!

The views along the ride are spectacular, even on an overcast day such as ours. So bring your camera (or phone)! We had 2 cowboys with us along with Miguel who filled us in on even more of the history of the ranch lands. He was also nice enough to take pictures of us along the ride with our cameras. They do take a picture of each person/group before heading out which you can purchase after the ride.

We were provided with water and punch along with this chips and salsa in the main room. Carne asada tacos were available for purchase at 2 for $5 (as of this writing) which were delicious. They also have beer and Tequila shots for purchase and a small gift shop. Miguel answered any questions anyone had about the area or even the surrounding areas. It was interesting to know that Titanic and Pirates of the Caribbean were filmed in the bay.

On the ride back to the ship, Miguel informed all of us how to get the best deals when shopping and how not to get ripped off, especially if purchasing silver. He also informed us that the ranch is building a Bed and Breakfast, though he didn't have a date for the possible opening.

Again this is something I would highly recommend and will definitely do again next time in Ensenada!

331269173.name: Great place and great people!! LOVED IT!! The views on the ride are amazing!!
331269173.author: a TripAdvisor user
331269173.reviewBody: We arrived Friday December 4, 2015, for the morning ride (which we highly recommend). The guide Miguel was not only knowledgeable but extremely funny and entertaining.
