The owners name is Rita, she is from Laguna Beach, CA and she keeps a really clean and wonderful ranch that you and your family will enjoy. The drive to the ranch is 15 minutes away form the cruise ship. The horses are really well taken care of and easy to ride. The cowboys that accompany the ride are friendly, caring and accommodating. We highly recommend this adventure. The tacos available for purchase at the end of the ride are awesome and inexpensive (2 for $5.00). They have beer and tequila shots for you to purchase. Its a little dusty so dress appropriate for riding horses.

304444734.name: Absolutely fantastic experience! Great guides, great facility.
304444734.author: a TripAdvisor user
304444734.reviewBody: These people are absolute pros. Complete professionals at their craft.  The horses are beautiful and well kept. The guides are knowledgeable and fun. Their salsa was delicious. Have a cowboy experience.  Ride through the stark beauty of the hills overlooking the bay.

290199997.name: Rancho Los Bandidos Enseenada Review
290199997.author: a TripAdvisor user
290199997.reviewBody: Great place! My wife and I went there 10 months ago. Going again in 6 weeks. Great fun, great food and drink. Staff and owner are wonderful. This experience is worth twice the price they charge.

289016893.name: Adventure with the family \u2764\ufe0f
289016893.author: a TripAdvisor user
289016893.reviewBody: Excellent experience for our whole family. Jose our tour guide was fantastic, he made sure that our kids are safe and having fun especially our 9 and 10 years old. The view was breath taking and the food was scrumptious \ud83d\ude04

286730562.name: A great excursion for Ensenada
286730562.author: a TripAdvisor user
286730562.reviewBody:
Wanted to do something different in Ensenada this trip, so booked this excursion through Carnival.  So glad that I did.  Miguel (our guide) picked us up at the ship and took us to a small bus which transported us to the ranch (about half an hour away). 

Once we arrived, all the horses were waiting for us, and they assigned us to a horse based on height, weight and riding experience.  The horses were beautiful and obviously well cared for.  We rode for about 70 minutes, up the hill, with a great view of the area and the water.  One note: Don't dress too nicely!  It's a dusty trail and you will get dirty.  Miguel and the cowboys were excellent guides and did a great job keeping everyone together.

After the ride, we came back to the main building to clean up, and there were chips and salsa waiting for us.  There was also other food to purchase, if you wanted.

It was a great morning, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for something different to do in Ensenada.

278492847.name: Horseback Riding
278492847.author: a TripAdvisor user
278492847.reviewBody: this was an excursion on the last day of our 4 day cruise on Carnival\'s Imagination.  Well worth the money.  They transported us about 1/2 hour to the ranch from the port and our guide gave us a lot of information and things to do in Escanada.   We arrived at the ranch about 40 of us and each person matched with a horse.  The horses were clean and healthy.  This was not a 15 minute ride, it was over 2 hours.  We climbed the mountain and could see the sea below.  Absolutely beautiful.  After the ride there were homemade tacos, salsa and chips, great tequila, and cervesa.   Endulge!

268228383.name: Rancho Los Bandidos- horseback riding
268228383.author: a TripAdvisor user
268228383.reviewBody:
This was an excellent experience. The crew the was so fantastic.  Jose, our tour guide, was friendly and nice and genuinely seemed interested with us. The whole trip was explained to us,  they showed us how to get on the horses, learn to balance and never left our side throughout the ride.  

The views were fantastic! My horses name was Sevillon and these horses are so well trained and taken care of. 
They also has chips and salsa,  water,  and fruit punch for us age the ride. 

Highly recommend this ranch and horseback riding!

267008405.name: Thoroughly enjoyable ride!
267008405.author: a TripAdvisor user
267008405.reviewBody: My husband and I thought we\'d do something different whllst on our recent cruise and we\'re glad we did. The whole horse riding experience was great and the horses seemto be well cared for. The trek enables you to have some of the most beautiful views over the bay and the horses are very easy to handle.

259291264.name: Great Experience- Great People
259291264.author: a TripAdvisor user
259291264.reviewBody: My husband and I decided to go horseback riding to try something new. What a great experience! We were met right on our cruise ship and shuttled to the ranch. Along the way, the guide gave explanations/ history of the area. Very informative. Once we got to the ranch, we were given a brief explanation of how to handle to horse and then one by one we were given a horse. We walked single file along the most beautiful path with breathtaking views of the ocean and the countryside.The cowboys stayed close by and guided us and the horses. After the ride, we could buy souvenirs, including a picture of both my husband and myself on our horses (cheap!), a drink or tacos. I was devastated to learn that they only accepted cash and we had only brought our credit card. I really wanted to buy the picture of us together on our horses. The owner was amazing! She gave us each a drink, tacos and our picture and asked us to mail the money. No questions asked. Her trust and faith that we would be honorable was humbling. I was completely blown away, I didn\'t know people like that still existed! Thank you Rita, we will never forget your kindness!

259181702.name: hello
259181702.author: a TripAdvisor user
259181702.reviewBody: i had great time the people were so nice. if you have vaction coming to baja mexico love it great staff and hourses well.

239207084.name: The highlight!
239207084.author: a TripAdvisor user
239207084.reviewBody:
As a dad of three boys we were looking for a memorable day for my 13yr olds birthday whilst on our 4 day carnival cruise
So glad we chose this onshore excursion!
Our guide 'Miguel' was absolutely brilliant! He gave a full commentary of buildings and life in this town as we travelled on the way to 'Bandido's Ranch'. The horses were very well loved and cared for. The Cowboys were extremely professional and safety was paramount! The trail rose 1000 feet above sea level and encompassed brilliant ocean views which provided great photos along the way. After the ride, refreshments were offered with lovely tacos & local beers
My 3 boys are still raving about it! A highlight of our 32 day trip of the USA & Mexico
Thanks Miguel!!!

216428962.name: Excellent Excursion
216428962.author: a TripAdvisor user
216428962.reviewBody: I went on this excursion in May 2014 while on the 4 day Carnival cruise to Catalina Island and Ensenada. It was an excellent choice, if you have any experience on horses they will put you at the back of the ride so that you can hold the horse back and get a little bit of a gallop in occasionally. Our guide was awesome he took pictures of us on the ride using my iPhone and we had lots of chances to take our own shots as well. The ranch is in the hills and we met the owner who is an American, her horses are well fed and well trained. After the ride we had fresh tacos and other refreshments at the ranch, there is also a gift shop to browse through. All riders must wear a helmet. I would definitely do this excursion again!!

214915224.name: Horseback Riding for Novices, Experienced, Family, Singles, Young, Old, Big, and Small
214915224.author: a TripAdvisor user
214915224.reviewBody: I would highly recommend, in my case, this family excursion/adventure for every walk of life. My tween son and I, middle aged, have never road horses until that morning on the beach at another location in Ensenada where we felt highly stressed out, and worried about our safety and wellbeing.  We had a communication break down because the men in charge didn\u2019t speak English. The horses felt like they in pain and couldn\u2019t handle my weight.  I felt bad for the old, overworked, scrawny, unhappy horse, so we cut our $30.00 an hour horse ride short.  Lastly, there was a misunderstanding about our carriage ride back to our Carnival Cruise Ship. They wanted $20.00 a piece to and from our ship to the horse riding beach.  The $40.00 carriage ride was not worth the worry of getting cut by the exposed rusty edges of the rickety carriage.  Even though the morning horseback riding experience left both of us weary about our upcoming afternoon horseback riding excursion at Rancho Los Bandidos, I was glad we did have this negative morning beach experience, so we could compare and contrast the similarities and differences between the two horseback riding experiences.  Although Rancho Los Bandidos cost twice as much as the horseback riding on the beach, it was WORTH THE MONEY!  I consider Los Bandidos a value for the price by way of safety being number one, a clear and simple lesson on how to ride and control the personalized horse they match you up considering, weight, height, personality, and riding experience. There was constant assistance in clear understandable English, tour explanation of the area, and safe monitoring of the single file line ride through the gorgeous hills overlooking Baja Mexico/California. We stopped to take photos to capture the majestic view. The ocean never looked so beautiful matching the magnificent blue skies while the wind gently whisks through ones hair riding through the slow to medium horse ride.  If you don\u2019t have a camera, they take your photo on your horse just before your ride that you may purchase for $10.00 after the ride is over where they allow you to freshen up in the restrooms, and make your way to the Saloon where they have free lemonade, punch, cold fresh water, chips and salsa.  Tocos cost a dollar and tips are appreciated at this point. They have well earned their tips by being courteous, friendly, helpful, efficient, called you by your first name, drove us in an air-conditioned but to and from the ship.  All was included with the cost.  I plan on doing this again with my son, but next time bring his older sister, so she may also have a priceless Baja California/Mexico memory of a lifetime.

166799670.name: Beautiful view and exciting ride!
166799670.author: a TripAdvisor user
166799670.reviewBody:
I've been on quite a few horseback trail rides and this is the best. Organized, safe and exciting. 

I went in conjunction with the Carnival Inspiration 3-day cruise to Ensenada. The guide met us on the pier and we loaded up into a bus that took us to the ranch that's tucked away in the hills. 

Upon arrival, we picked up our helmets and the horses were brought up saddled and ready to go. The cowgirl (lead guide, speaks fluent English) assigned us our horse. I'm guessing she did it by riding experience, height and weight...(?)

On the trail, we lined up head to tail, about twenty of us. There are 5 cowboy guides total keeping everything orderly and give us tips (toes up, heels down!) The ride itself is really fun and NOT BORING. I've been on trail rides where the horses just walk slowly, ambling along and that's just boring.

On the ride, every so once in a while, the horses would have to trot to keep up with the line. For a novice rider, that's pretty exiciting and give a sense of real "I'm riding a horse!!!" 

All in all, a LOT of fun. I definitely recommend this. 

A few things... it can be quite dusty (you are in Ensenada after all...) so I'm really glad I brought my sunglasses. Liberally apply sunscreen also!

151197806.name: We had a BLAST!
151197806.author: a TripAdvisor user
151197806.reviewBody:
We went on a Disney Cruise last September that had a stop in Ensenada Mexico. At first DCL was not going to let my son ride because he was 10 and their (DCL) age limit was 12 so in my research to find a place where we could go horse back riding on our own I found Rancho Los Bandidos...here it turns out it was the company that was doing DCL's excursion..to make a long story short I worked with the owner of RLB and got DCL to lower their age restriction to 10.
We were greeted at the port by our wonderful hosts and rode a crazy old bus to the farm.
Once there we were greeted by the owner Rita & more of her wonderful staff.
I was given the privelidge of riding her horse!
We had just a amazing ride and so much fun!!
We came back and had beers and homemade tacos that were to DIE for. They are by far the best tacos I have EVER had. The bar is just the coolest place!
I sincerely hope to get back to Ensenada some day and do a private ride here!
If you are on a cruise that stops in this port and they offer horseback riding GO GO GO!!

656881482.name: Never found La Lobera
656881482.author: a TripAdvisor user
656881482.reviewBody: The road in February was horrible but we followed it the best we could until we decided we would never find La Lobera.  We finally had to turn around.  Signage was good at first but there was none when we needed it the most.

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

365291854.name: Very Beautiful
365291854.author: a TripAdvisor user
365291854.reviewBody: Just traveled to San Quintin this last weekend and was a bit dissapointed with the valley of San Quintin itself. Nothing to do, no camping \u00e1reas only one access to the beach through the Old Mill \u00e1rea but is really not worth swimming in and is a bit dirty. For beautiful beach areas you must drive to the outer parts of San Quintin where you will also find La Lobera which is a very beautiful \u00e1rea really worth visitng. At La Lobera, you will see a huge beautiful sea cave enjoyed by lots of sea lions. You can also enjoy the costal \u00e1rea where you can sit and watch really huge waves crash into the cliffs.

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

346703342.name: Nice place to relax
346703342.author: a TripAdvisor user
346703342.reviewBody: It,s quite far away from the higway but is a beautiful place to be.. the ocean looks great and the sea lions are fun to watch.

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

339972151.name: Amazing Nature
339972151.author: a TripAdvisor user
339972151.reviewBody: If you are coming from Ensenada is a 3 hour 30 min drive. Take the "Carretera transpeninsular" all the way south. Between San Quintin town and El Rosario pay attetion because there is only one small blue sign on the road that will tell you where you have to turn right immediately and leave the road..... keep going to the beach and you will find this beautiful place. I do not recomend driving a small car as there is no pavement, no signs, no security, get a truck and if its rain season make sure it is 4X4 as it can get veeeery muddy. This is a natural human population free place. The sea comes through a cave where sea Lions have their own private beach, it can all be seen from above. The ocean views are amazingly beautiful and the sunset is breath taking.  After your visit, if you are driving back to Ensenada once you get back in the road, about 5 min drive, take a look in the right side there is a small place called "Parcela 12"  they have all you can eat for $100 pesos, different types of home made plates, you can see the kitchen from your table. Everything is clean and the food delicious. The perfect place to finish this trip and go back with a full happy stomach

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

329279005.name: Great stop to stretch your legs
329279005.author: a TripAdvisor user
329279005.reviewBody: This is a short drive from the highway between San Quintin and El Rosario, just a few kilometers before the military checkpoint. When driving south keep an eye open to your right, there are some power line post near the exit and its marked by a small sign. 2 WD vehicle OK when dry. Don\'t leave small children unattended it has a small barrier letting you know not to cross or you\'ll drop the 20 odd meters to the beach below with the sea lions.

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

293701958.name: Fraud
293701958.author: a TripAdvisor user
293701958.reviewBody: This shouldn\'t even be advertised. The road is closed, but even if you manage to walk trough, you will get to a surveillance booth and a fence that forbids access. The place is private now.

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

278189661.name: Worth a visit
278189661.author: a TripAdvisor user
278189661.reviewBody: It\'s a pretty cool place to visit for many reasons. It used to be a natural cave, but the top fell through forming something like a stadium size ocean water pool with a beach and sea lions. This is quite unique. But there are a few more reasons to get there. The coast is rugged and beautiful, the road goes through a desert canyon (it\'s not paved, but graded, so you don\'t need a 4x4 or any special vehicles) and senor who lives there gave us a very nice presentation about the lions and the sea creatures they farm for those lions. He speaks Spanish only, but he is super friendly and does his work very well, so a few dollars would be a well deserved donation.

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

271826186.name: Cool!
271826186.author: a TripAdvisor user
271826186.reviewBody:
I personally didn't find it that big of a deal, the scenery is beautiful tho... well in general the ocean is beautiful..
and there are a bunch of sea lions in the cave; looking comfortable while you just stare at them.
so it's a nice quick stop if you're going somewhere else, just snap some pictures enjoy the view for a bit and go... :D
(I do remember however that to get there, there is this dirt/sand road that if you're going in a small/old car, you probably won't make it cause you have to pass this sort of small ravine full of sand where you car can get stuck, but it's honestly not that bad)

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

156038108.name: BREATHTAKING! Don\'t miss this if your near!
156038108.author: a TripAdvisor user
156038108.reviewBody: Wow! We though we were just going to see some sea lions but we also got to walk on the edge of the world! Beautiful rock formations, birds, patterns in rocks, 30 pesos to park, the view was priceless!! Eh also cultivate seafood near, and you can watch them farm lobsters. Amazing. I wish I was still there. Bring a nice camera & sunblock! Liquid\'paradise!

address.streetAddress: Playa del Socorro km. 47.5 carretera Transpeninsular #1 entre Ejido Valle tranquilo y El Rosario

675983541.name: Great Winery, Wine and Winemaker
675983541.author: a TripAdvisor user
675983541.reviewBody:
The following is a brief overview, with some details, of a two-day, weekend trip in May 2019 of six wine-loving adults from San Diego to Guadalupe Valley for winetasting.  We planned the trip's itinerary ourselves by researching wineries, wines, restaurants, Airbnb's and routes on the internet.  Three married couples went.  The three husbands are partners in home winemaking, so we selected wineries whose wines were highly rated rather than wineries that were highly rated for their facilities, views or food.  We only took USDs, not pesos, with us.
We left San Diego about 8:30am in an Uber XL for the border, arriving at PedWest (directly across the street from Outlets at the Border) about 9:00am.  We then walked across the border thru PedWest, stopping at Mexican Immigration/Customs Center building to fill out visa forms (we all have Passport cards plus Global Entry cards), then arriving, about 9:30am at a plaza where taxis await passengers.  Here we met up with our Mexican driver and his van.  
The driver, Antonio Hernandez, and his wife, Rosa, live in Guadalupe Valley.  They have started a small Guadalupe Valley tour company with at least two new, very nice vans that we road in; one just right for the six of us, and a second much larger.  We found this couple through common friends/acquaintances, and were extremely satisfied with their services.  Antonio ferried us around from Saturday morning until Sunday late afternoon when he dropped us off at PedWest.  He charged us $70 USD per couple per day, but we paid him $80 USD per couple per day to include tip, so at the end of our trip we six paid him $80 USD X 3 couples X 2 days = $480.  I think we gave him $500.  It was well worth it.  Their email address is Alanantonio08092017@gmail.com, and Antonio's cell phone is 011-52-1-646-144-0374.  Our plan was to visit three wineries and two restaurants (lunch & dinner) on Saturday and three wineries and two restaurants (breakfast and lunch) on Sunday.  
On Saturday, after being picked up by Antonio in his van, we drove about 35 miles to Gary's La Fonda restaurant on highway 1D, about 3.3 miles south of Campo Lopez.  This is an interesting restaurant, with a great ocean view and roosters walking around the tables, in which we enjoyed our lunches and drinks.  After lunch, Antonio drove us to Guadalupe Valley, about a 25-mile trip.  We stopped first at Tres Valles winery.  This is a small winery with a small wine tasting room, but their wines, Assistant winemaker Alejandro and their art creations were great.  This was one of our favorite winery of the six that we visited, if not the favorite one.  Next, we visited Vinisterra winery that had great wines and vineyard views.  We recommend this winery too.  Our last winery of the day was Vinas de Garza.  This winery and its wines were OK, but we liked the first two much better.  I probably would not recommend this place but try another in its place.  We then drove to our Airbnb and checked in and rested up a bit before leaving for dinner. 
Our Airbnb was a nice, two story house, on a nice piece of property with vineyards, in a gated community.  It had two very nice bedrooms and bathrooms downstairs, and some beds (but no bathroom) in the second story loft that we did not like much.  It was a "cabana" located in the Ejido el Porvenior section of the Valley, across the street from the restaurant Finca Altozano, and cost us $405.65/night.  The owner is Carlos Bernardo, phone 011-52-1-646-226-8616.
Saturday night we ate at Laja restaurant, an outstanding restaurant that we highly recommend.  Reservations are probably necessary since it is not large.  They have prix fixe ("fixed price") menus, probably different every night.  The menus lists eight items, in groups of two, with and without wine pairings.  One must choose a four course or eight-course meal, with or without wine pairings with each course.  Our menu listed Lettuce salad / Octopus, Bonita fish tartar / Mushroom risotto, Catch of the day / Braised beef, and Coffee panna cotta / pastry.  Their price for the four-course meal (which we all had with wine pairings) was 920 pesos, or 1,420 pesos with wine pairings, and for the eight-course meal, 1,350 pesos, or 2,050 pesos with wine.  They exchanged at only 17 pesos per USD, so total bill for six of us without tip was 8,583 pesos, or $504.88 USD if US cash were used.  I used my credit card that does not charge a currency exchange fee, and exchanged at 19 pesos/USD, so cost was only $451.74 USD before tip.  It was expensive, but we all felt it was well worth it, and we hope to return to this restaurant someday.  After dinner, we returned to our Airbnb for the night.
Sunday morning Antonio picked us up and drove us to Hacienda Guadalupe restaurant where we had great breakfasts.  We next went to the Wine Museum, which we all enjoyed.  We also went to the local Russian museum that was OK but not great.  I highly recommend Hacienda Guadalupe for breakfast, and a visit to their Wine museum.  When we started our trip, we told Antonio where we wanted to go, only allowing him to determine the order.  Antonio knows the Guadalupe Valley well, and therefore has his recommendations for wineries and restaurants.  If/when we return, we may let Antonio at least propose his favorites to us.  On our trip, he especially promoted a winery J.C. Bravo, for their dry-farmed wines, so we decided to visit his recommended winery in lieu of planned L.A. Ceto winery that has high ratings for both wines and winery.  L.A. Ceto is a large winery, and we prefer smaller wineries such as J.C. Bravo.  We enjoyed this winery; it was OK, not great.  We then went to La Lomita and Vino de Piedra wineries, both very nice wineries with great wines.  We recommend both of them.
Before heading home, we had lunch at Finca Altozano restaurant.  Lunch and the restaurant were great.  After lunch, Antonio drove us with some wine that we had purchased at wineries back to PedWest where he dropped us off and we paid him.  We walked back thru PedWest, then Ubered home, arriving home about 7:30pm, very tired.  It was a great trip that we hope to repeat sometime.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

658890377.name: Wine
658890377.author: a TripAdvisor user
658890377.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this winetasting. Especially if you enjoyed reds this is a must go to. The winetasting is 200 pesos but what makes it really good is that if you buy a bottle then therefore that money is applied to it and so your tasting is free. Alejandro was extremely helpful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

576231731.name: Great first taste of The Valley of Guadalupe.
576231731.author: a TripAdvisor user
576231731.reviewBody:
Jalá is one of our favorite wines. So we had planned to make Tres Valles one of our trip’s necessary stops. 
The winery was the first we found on our route and what a fantastic first experience that was. 
April is the perfect time of the year to visit because none of the wineries are crowded. 
For the full hour that we were there, we had a most enjoyable and informative conversation with Alejandro not only about their wines and their process but also about the indigenous Kiliwa tribe whose language informs the names of their wines. 
The wines got better and better starting with the Jalá which we already liked. 
Our only regret is that they can’t make it a bit easier to import these extraordinary wines to the US. 
Tres Valles set the tone for an extraordinary wine tour of The Valley. Loved the wines and the service.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

571367498.name: Delicious wine, great place!
571367498.author: a TripAdvisor user
571367498.reviewBody: Being in Ensenada and visiting the wine country in El Valle de Guadalupe is a must, and Tres Valles turned out to be a great surprise: the place is clean, well designed, with lots of wood and industrial sculptures of desert animals, and of course, delicious wine, both white and red. Wine tasting was very insightful with lots of information regarding wine and its process. 110% recommended.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

539434191.name: Great Wine Tasting/Winery to visit!
539434191.author: a TripAdvisor user
539434191.reviewBody: Winemaker Joaquin Prieto is turning out deee-double-licious red blends year after year. Choosing select grapes harvested from 3 different valleys and carefully crafted with minimal intervention, Tres Valles Vinicola is sure to please your palate! Knowledgeable staff are happy to talk with you about the Tres Valles wines. Visit in August or September and you could get lucky with a tour of the winery and a taste of what is currently in production.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

488259803.name: Winery
488259803.author: a TripAdvisor user
488259803.reviewBody: Wonderful local winery, I highly recommend a stop here\ud83c\udf77  It\'s off the beaten path, but makes it all the better once you find it\ud83d\ude0e

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

466160968.name: Great Wine Great Time
466160968.author: a TripAdvisor user
466160968.reviewBody: We had a wonderful visit at Tres Valles Vitivin\u00edcola! Alejandro took us on a tour of the cozy grounds and explained to us all about the process and history of wine making. We asked a ton of questions and he was very knowledgeable and passionate. Afterward we tasted the wines which were very good. I like how the owner works with an interesting local artist to make the wine labels and how he uses local indigenous words in the names of his wines. Very recommended!

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

464378325.name: Pretty cool place!
464378325.author: a TripAdvisor user
464378325.reviewBody: Had a good visit and admired the landscape. Very nice environment and the staff was friendly and resourceful!

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

463063767.name: Had a great time.
463063767.author: a TripAdvisor user
463063767.reviewBody: The place is quite beautiful and cozy.\nThe wine a superb taste. I definitely want to go back. Totally recommended.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

462102396.name: Great little winery with friendly staff!
462102396.author: a TripAdvisor user
462102396.reviewBody: This was our first stop in the valley and really set the tone for the trip. Alejandro gave us our tasting and was very friendly and knowledgeable about the region.  The wine was good and Alejandro gave us great recommendations for the rest of our trip!

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

460783004.name: Alejandro from the staff
460783004.author: a TripAdvisor user
460783004.reviewBody:
We were received by a guy named Alejandro. He was super friendly and made our experience worthwhile! 

The weather was a little bad and he offered to drive us back to Ensenada. Congratulations for the service.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

457445239.name: Recommend this winery for one of your stops.
457445239.author: a TripAdvisor user
457445239.reviewBody: The grounds are very nice, the wines are good and the staff was friendly and informative.  I would go back for sure.  \n\nWe purchased 2 bottles (1 red, 1 white) to enjoy back in the states.  They had a nice variety to taste.  We tried: Sangiovese, Nebbiolo, a couple of red blends, and 1 white blend.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

427717608.name: Enjoy some excellent local wines and get personal attention touring the winery.
427717608.author: a TripAdvisor user
427717608.reviewBody: Tres Valles makes some of the best wines in Baja Wine Country. Located in San Antonio de las Minas, you can start your winery hopping here on your way out to the valley. The staff are very personable, and bi-lingual. Alejandro will give you background and explanation of the wines you are drinking, and if there aren\'t too many visitors he will also take you into the adjacent winery to explain what is happening there. If you happen in at the right time of year, you can also taste the wines that are just then in fermentation. Wine tasting is free when you buy a bottle, which of course you should!\nTres Valles recently built several guest rooms for rent, so give them a call and see what\'s available.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

403854624.name: Great experience! Fantastic wines!!
403854624.author: a TripAdvisor user
403854624.reviewBody: I discovered a really fantastic wine to enjoy with your girlfriend or boyfriend. Kojaa!!!! \n\nAlex gave us a beatiful tour and a nice wine cata.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

391047417.name: Fantastic Fine Red Wines-Incredible Prices-Love at First Sip!
391047417.author: a TripAdvisor user
391047417.reviewBody: I  helped my father make wine in the 50s/60s/70s in California. I know the process and what goes into making a fine wine. They are getting everything right at Tres Valles Winery in the Valle de Guadalupe, 15 miles inland from Ensenada, Baja Ca. The location is in the westward vineyards, closer to the ocean, with some incredible local craft art. Some of their red blends rival Cain 5 in Napa, and at only a fraction of the price. The best bargain is Jala\' 2013, a blend of Cabernet Sauvigon and Grenache Noir, only 200 pesos ($11.25). It is a rich but not heavy blend with a great finish. The deal of the century has to be a blend called MAAT 2013 that is 90% Grenache Noir, 10% petite Sarah and is just ambrosia from start to finish, 250 pesos ($14) They had 2 others that were a tad fruity or a tad dry but still excellent. I just didn\'t buy those. If the two wines I recommended were for sale in Napa or central California, you would be paying at least $30-50. for them. If you buy two bottles of wine, there is no tasting charge. The Barista Alejandro was very knowledgeable and helpful. He is studying for a Doctorate in Viticulture. If you only have one day to taste wine in this wonderful valley, make sure to taste at Tres Valles!!!! If you thought this review was helpful, let Trip Advisor know.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

390835117.name: Great wine tasting!
390835117.author: a TripAdvisor user
390835117.reviewBody: Had a great experience! Alejandro was very helpful and charismatic. Wines were comparable to Temecula or Napa Valley. Would recommend to anyone!

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

361034244.name: Very clean, refreshing and enjoyable
361034244.author: a TripAdvisor user
361034244.reviewBody: We are from the west coast of California and Washington where wine is predominant. We enjoyed the folks explaining the winery and its wines. You could tell these wines were from another country. We never new they had wineries in this region of Ensenada, Mexico. It was a perfect March day. I\'m sure it would be too hot in the summer.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

289297826.name: Artsy, Hip location
289297826.author: a TripAdvisor user
289297826.reviewBody:
I loved the location. It was our first stop to our very first winery in Valle de Guadalupe.

I was not particularly fond of the wines (too dry for me) but my husband loved them.

Our Wine Expert was very knowledgeable and pleasing. He even gave us a tour.

I would come again just to in this location it was breathtaking. We even heard peacocks from another neighbor but it was beautiful as we finally saw it. The Art work was amazing. Great if you like taking pictures.

address.streetAddress: Calle Lerdo de Tejada Ignacio Comonfort

676320675.name: Good to see a bit of history
676320675.author: a TripAdvisor user
676320675.reviewBody: Good to see a bit of history, instead of the constant hawkers. Would have liked to have had a bit more explanation around the three busts. Not much else to see here.

571575161.name: beautiful dancing water fountain
571575161.author: a TripAdvisor user
571575161.reviewBody: I am sorr to say that the dancing water fountain in this plaza was the highlight of my stop in Ensenada

554910032.name: One location to take pictures
554910032.author: a TripAdvisor user
554910032.reviewBody: After we get a short city tour, we must going back to our cruise, we stop at this place, it\'s nice to see, clean and something that we can take a good pictures.

522067088.name: Something to See
522067088.author: a TripAdvisor user
522067088.reviewBody: It\'s something to see to educate oneself on the history of the area.Nearby are the more local historical sites, so it\'s a good jumping off point to start ones tour of the town.

500972428.name: OK to explore around the area. It gives you a good experience about Mexico and Ensenada, but not much more
500972428.author: a TripAdvisor user
500972428.reviewBody: We came on a cruise and spent a couple of hours at the plaza neighborhood. Ensenada is cleaner than average Mexican cities. The Plaza Civica offers some good experiences about Ensenada. But honestly the plaza is pretty bare, not a whole lot of stuff to experience. Get a fish taco and a margarita, walk around, take some photos. That\'s about it.

458336937.name: Great Piece of History
458336937.author: a TripAdvisor user
458336937.reviewBody: We came to this location through a tour. The statues are beautiful and the history behind them is very interesting. There are about 4 monuments in the same location.\n\nThere are also people who come out from behind things to sell you their handcrafted items, which is a little creepy. However we learned to just say no thank you and keep walking if you don\'t want something. Remember they barter. I did get a bracelet from one, because it was worth it to me.

451250881.name: Nice for day and night
451250881.author: a TripAdvisor user
451250881.reviewBody: There is not a lot to see in the actual plaza but the three heads. But  if you walk around it you get a beautiful view of the ocean. Good to visit day or night. It is right behind first street so if you get hungry there are a bunch of places to grab a bite.

448896150.name: Outdoor market at Plaza Civica
448896150.author: a TripAdvisor user
448896150.reviewBody: There was an outdoor market the night we visited, music, food and many interesting handmade things to buy as souvenir from Mexico.

436599962.name: A COMPLETE BUST OF A TOURIST ATTRACTION
436599962.author: a TripAdvisor user
436599962.reviewBody: This is a plaza you will walk through in two minutes and then ask yourself why they wasted the limited budget in such a meaningless way.

423593839.name: Good Photo Op
423593839.author: a TripAdvisor user
423593839.reviewBody: Plaza Civica is good for a quick photo stop.  There is not a lot to do here but the guides share the history of the 3 men the statues are for.

418254629.name: If your close by you should stop and see.
418254629.author: a TripAdvisor user
418254629.reviewBody: It\'s a nice place to sit and admire the views and weather.  Lots to eat from street vendors.  Nice big trees.

417352454.name: Interesting
417352454.author: a TripAdvisor user
417352454.reviewBody: In the port by the cruise ships. New fountain with lights at night. Great vendors and a fun place to visit

415150504.name: small little spot for local history (a local Mount Rushmore). Worth the visit on weekends
415150504.author: a TripAdvisor user
415150504.reviewBody: The 3 heads are of Benito Juarez (separated church from state), Miguel Hidalgo (initiated the movement for independence) and Venustiano Carranza (promulgated our current constitution)  who are historical Mexican figures. This is a very wide-space spot that is totally worth visiting on weekends because of the different markets that get set up. On these markets you can find organic food and different hand-crafted products.

407571619.name: Sunday Funday
407571619.author: a TripAdvisor user
407571619.reviewBody: They had an event, that was part farmers market and part souvenir store. My parents bought organic honey and some amazing coffee

389759077.name: Free Wi-Fi
389759077.author: a TripAdvisor user
389759077.reviewBody: If you are a tourist and let\u2019s face it, everyone here is basically a tourist, and if you need wifi, Plaza Civica has it for free. We stayed 3 days in Ensenada and didn\u2019t have an international plan for our phone so we needed Wi-Fi. We went to 3 different places and even an internet store and nothing. Then, we decided we didn\u2019t need Wi-Fi and just did the top things to do in Ensenada and we took pics of the beautiful area Plaza Civica which is rich in cultural history. We were there on a weekday and there were no special events, so there was not much going on and then lo and behold, free Wi-Fi, lol.  There were not even much people out. I read about the events but knew that was on the weekend and special holidays. There were a few kids so actually this place is very nice just to relax, chill and surf the net.

385029083.name: Interesting Plaza
385029083.author: a TripAdvisor user
385029083.reviewBody: We arrive at the plaza from the ship to wait for our tour. Although the information on each monument was in Spanish, it was nice to see some history displayed out in the open. There are a lot of children selling items and it takes away from just being able to walk around.

378401862.name: Plaza comes alive at events
378401862.author: a TripAdvisor user
378401862.reviewBody: I have gone to ensenada a few times and sometimes there are events going on and sometimes there is not. This last time i went there was and event and there was a little bit of everything. I was a fun time with the family.

374300892.name: Just Another Place To Walk Around
374300892.author: a TripAdvisor user
374300892.reviewBody: This is just another place to wander while visiting Ensenada.  I do suggest always stopping by on a weekend here.  This is where they have events almost every Saturday and Sunday.  Sometimes the events are fun, and sometimes they are just o.k.  They do have a lot of food and wine events here so it\'s nice to stop by and try the local fare.

365482855.name: Interesting place to take walk
365482855.author: a TripAdvisor user
365482855.reviewBody: I took my family in our way to the malecon, it\'s a good place to take some tourist pictures, as we certainly did, and if you are not familiar with all this historical figures please google them

357774268.name: A nice peaceful place!
357774268.author: a TripAdvisor user
357774268.reviewBody: My Wife and I travel to Ensenada often, Our Daughter and Grand Daughter Live in Near by Valle De Guadalupe. This Plaza has several cultural events through out the Year. Live Music food and drinks!

357189844.name: It\'s a good landmark from which to start your stroll, especially if you are coming in by cruise ship.
357189844.author: a TripAdvisor user
357189844.reviewBody: This  plaza commemorates three prominent men from Mexico\'s turbulent history - Miguel Hidalgo, Benito Juarez, and Venustiano Carranza. There is often some sort of event taking place there, such as the bugle and drum corps competition that was ongoing during my most recent visit. There is also a bandstand nearby, as well as the big flagpole that the huge Mexican flag is supposed to fly from. I\'ve yet to see said flag, but one of these days... Be advised that there is a LOT of construction ongoing in this area!

338577960.name: HUGE HEADS
338577960.author: a TripAdvisor user
338577960.reviewBody:
If you have a background in Mexican History and culture, this will be  a really cool place to visit.  Three of the people who made significant contributions to the History of Mexico are honored here. 

For those of us who are not Mexican, this is really a iut outside of our range of understanding. Three large gold heads of people you do not know, or do not know about.

327527319.name: A Great Place to People Watch or Buy Treasures.
327527319.author: a TripAdvisor user
327527319.reviewBody: My husband and I live in Ensenada and enjoy the "Plaza of the Three Heads" or "Plaza de las Tres Cabezas."   This civic and cultural attraction opened in September 1974 to honor three Mexican  historical icons.  You will find it to be a good place for people- watching or just taking a rest from a walk around town. You might want to relax here after a wonderful meal or to end the work day..  Often the plaza is filled with vendors selling everything from books,  jewelry,  handicrafts,  food, etc.. You may enjoy musicians and/or dancing on the stage or on the plaza itself.  There is music all over Ensenada!  This attraction is well worth your time.

326944662.name: Wow!
326944662.author: a TripAdvisor user
326944662.reviewBody: We shared the view from Plaza Civica.  Some very interesting Mexican people.   Included were many politicians.  I would not go back again---there are so many--restaurants, etc.

319043837.name: The heads were like Mt. Rushmore in Ensenada
319043837.author: a TripAdvisor user
319043837.reviewBody: We waited here while waiting for our shuttle.  It was a nice park, pay to potty. Couples kissing. Little girls hawking their goods.

296778383.name: Very nice place
296778383.author: a TripAdvisor user
296778383.reviewBody: great place to people watch and many events are here. farmers markets to Native Indians dance ceremonies complete with drums

258246531.name: HISTORY
258246531.author: a TripAdvisor user
258246531.reviewBody: Take a Mexican friend and have them explain who the big heads are. Also really cool, huge flag, i believe it is one of the biggest in Mexico.

254780787.name: right downtown- with lots of history and usually a lot of fun events
254780787.author: a TripAdvisor user
254780787.reviewBody: At plaza Civica you\'ll find  the three heads - we call them Manny mo & Jack- but they are past presidents I think - anyway- always  the busy plaza with lots of fun events  either very mexican, or  food oriented-- Ensenada is in the top 10 of foodie places in NORTH AMERICA!! you won\'t go home hungry!!

253858556.name: Three Heads
253858556.author: a TripAdvisor user
253858556.reviewBody: FYI - Google Maps and other sources call this the Plaza de Las Tres Cabezas.  I couldn\'t find it on Google until I realized the name was not Plaza Civica.

246689836.name: Big Heads
246689836.author: a TripAdvisor user
246689836.reviewBody: It is an interesesting spot for a quick look.  Mexico has had a very turbulent political history.  Interesting to see some of their past leaders portrayed.

223673879.name: Central location for many local sites to see
223673879.author: a TripAdvisor user
223673879.reviewBody: This park which is a tribute to Mexican leaders is a central focal point for downtown Ensenada.  To the east is First Street where you can shop for hours.  To the north with a short walk, you will come to the fish market where daily catch is displayed and sold.  it is quite a large fish market.  Walking through the fish market to the bay, all the fishing boats are there, some still unloading their daily catch.  You can also find a short boat rides to take you around the bay of Ensenada, and other restaurants.  it is refreshing to be by the docks to see all the wildlife, seals, birds and such.  A fun day for family.

198272238.name: Not worth getting off the cruise ship for
198272238.author: a TripAdvisor user
198272238.reviewBody: We visited this Plaza on our way from our cruise ship to the Ensenada town centre.  Although the head sculptures in this plaza were quite impressive, the general impression of Ensenada was not a favourable one. There was an awful amount of poverty about and most of the Mexicans did not warm to the cruise ship visitors.  We would not get off the ship again should we ever park up in this part of Mexico.  This port made Cozumel and Cabo San Lucas seem like five star destinations!

187476417.name: Nice area
187476417.author: a TripAdvisor user
187476417.reviewBody: Nice views to see on the way to First street. Be cautious of pushy sales people on the streets trying to bring you places and sell you anything they possibly can.

187389537.name: >> Look for local Events in this area
187389537.author: a TripAdvisor user
187389537.reviewBody: This is a nice plaza that you will walk by from the cruise ship terminal to the Downtown area.\n\nWhen we were there, there was a large number of booths setup selling local arts and crafts.  Incredible and non-touristy.  I had a great time there.  The prices that they were selling for were pretty much as stated.  Not much negotiating there... unlike the touristy shops.

175494098.name: A place to stroll and relax
175494098.author: a TripAdvisor user
175494098.reviewBody: The secret is to walk slowly, take in the local flare, and eat, eat, eat... all the sea food you can, the churros, the elotes (corn on the cob), cotton candy, etc. if you see the stand full of locals, it means it\'s delicious and safe to eat. Don\'t miss the opportunity to buy something real tasty and sit on a park bench to enjoy it, It\'s the local way to do it right!

132482055.name: family fun
132482055.author: a TripAdvisor user
132482055.reviewBody: Safe and nice for picture taking. Horses and bike rides.

625161312.name: Dried Up Lake When We Went
625161312.author: a TripAdvisor user
625161312.reviewBody: It\'s a pretty place to go hiking, but it\'s basically just a big highland desert.  There was 0 water in the lake and just a bunch of cows grazing in the dried up lake bed.  There are some neat rock formations which we climbed up and took some nice scenic photos.  The road to this place is pretty nasty, and so you would be best to go in a 4X4.  The oil gauge on our car kept lighting up from bouncing around so much.  Had us a bit freaked out.  Plus it\'s about 1 hour on that horrible road and not much to see at the end.

659069167.name: Unique experience for this city girl
659069167.author: a TripAdvisor user
659069167.reviewBody: I was so amazed and a bit grossed out by this fish market. Everything is so fresh and looks amazing. I wish we were staying in town and could have bought something for dinner. I\u2019m not used to seeing fish in this manner and wow, it\u2019s eye opening!  The shrimp, octopus, oysters, muscles, etc are fascinating to see. Some of the fish piled so high you\u2019ve never seen anything like it!  Walk past it and if possible, buy something!

594423086.name: SEA WORLD!
594423086.author: a TripAdvisor user
594423086.reviewBody: This place has everything under the sea.  Can you say super fresh, well it is. There are also places to eat around it, so have walk around and then grab some food! enjoy!

544045881.name: GOOD - BUT WATCH!
544045881.author: a TripAdvisor user
544045881.reviewBody:
I visit this market a few times a year to shop and have acquired a few tips along the way.  For starters, walk the ENTIRE market even if you think you see what you want right away.  Usually I scope out 1 or 2 stalls to come back to depending on what I'm looking for,

Always negotiate the price.  Don't expect 1/2 off, but you should get something.

Pay in pesos not dollars.

Fresh fish is weighed "on the fin" - so you pay for the entire fish.  If you just want fillets, they will do it for you, but you still pay for the whole fish.

Speaking of weighing, make sure that they put the metal "basket" on the scale before they weigh your purchase to make sure it is fairly close to zero.  A favorite "trick" is to leave the basket off and have the scale set at zero -  so when the basket is put on with your selection you get shorted (paying for the weight of the basket too).

Friendly banter does go a long way here.  It can be a shopping adventure!

BTW - outside of the market are several small restaurants.  The 2nd one from the street is my favorite.  Excellent FRESH fish tacos that are very reasonable.

539940546.name: Best fresh seafood
539940546.author: a TripAdvisor user
539940546.reviewBody: I make a trip down to our friend casa in Rosarito yearly. We always plan a dinner one night during our stay  to gather everyone and have a great fiesta at our friends casa! We bought fresh Blue fin tuna and jumbo shrimp and it was incredible. The tuna was caught that morning and we got it for a great price. I sliced it up into steaks and grilled it rare YUM! The shrimp we did on the grilled with oil and garlic in a basket  and also boiled some for a shrimp cocktail. YUM again. If you want fresh seafood at go prices ..this is the place!

523916467.name: Appalling
523916467.author: a TripAdvisor user
523916467.reviewBody: I\'m a chef and obviously foodie so could not get here fast enough.  I was literally shocked.  Filthy, flies everywhere, no produce covered except by flies.  I had brought overseas visitors staying with me in Mexico to the market to buy dinner.  I was beyond embarrassed and disgusted.  I had raved about this place from what I had heard and we were \'in for a feast\' that night.  Not.  I\'m surprised it is allowed to stay open.

508465697.name: Not so fresh... Lots of bugs
508465697.author: a TripAdvisor user
508465697.reviewBody: This place is a solid meh... fish is not as fresh as I thought it would be and literal SWARMS of flies. Not going to lie though, their wide variety of fishes is pretty impressive. Definitely not a must see in my eyes, but if you have some time in your hands, you might as well check it out.

479513262.name: GO TO BUY, NOT AS A DESTINATION VISIT
479513262.author: a TripAdvisor user
479513262.reviewBody: Freshest of fish as you would expect, but nothing special to see. I visit all the marketplaces all over the world and this one is small and average.  Interesting to see if you have some extra time in the morning, but not worth going out of your way unless you are looking for shrimp for your Bar-b. If you found this review helpful please tap the Thumbs Up tab below.

446109959.name: Fresh fish for cheap
446109959.author: a TripAdvisor user
446109959.reviewBody: Stopped at the fish market on the way back to the condo and picked up Shrimp, Lobster, Black Sea Bass, octopus and some really good smoked marlin for less than $40. \nIt is an open air market but is clean and I did not see one bug. Everything smelled fresh and it all BBQ\'d nicely.

436886059.name: Fish Market
436886059.author: a TripAdvisor user
436886059.reviewBody: One of my FAVORITE places to visit, buy and EAT! I love to take pictures of the various fishes, crabs, oysters, lobster, squid, sharks just bought into the market. You can pretty much name and you\'ll find it; depending on the season..Fresh, the smell of the ocean. There are various sea food family restaurants; which are delicious. Its worth a visit!

426707529.name: Great fish
426707529.author: a TripAdvisor user
426707529.reviewBody: We picked up some pulpo (octopus) and a large rockot (a red sea fish, very meaty firm white flesh. There are a lot of flies around but it\'s easy to pick up some fresh and good quality fish. A couple of vendors were selling fresh vegetables as well.

422152481.name: What a place!
422152481.author: a TripAdvisor user
422152481.reviewBody: I have seen some fancy fish markets but never one quite like this! All the fish is very artfully and meticulously displayed. Every kind of fish you have every heard of and plenty that you haven\'t! They don\'t cook for you, but plenty of stalls around selling fish tacos, ceviche, and shrimp cocktails. If I lived near this market I would be there every day! If you love markets, check this out--it\'s an experience!

389767552.name: Come only if you want to cook
389767552.author: a TripAdvisor user
389767552.reviewBody: My wife wanted to cook crab so we went to the Fish Market. If you are visiting  from a cruise ship, then no need to stop by because they will not cook your seafood. This is not one of those markets where you can buy fresh fish and they cook it for you. \nWe were staying in a house and so we could cook. We bought 2 smaller crabs for only 50 pesos (less than $3!) Here they have their prices listed so they won\u2019t cheat you because this is not really a tourist place. If I lived in Ensenada or was here on a camping trip and will cook with an open fire, then this is definitely the place to load up on your crabs as they are still alive when we bought them. If you want lobster, you have to come very early in the morning or they will sell out by midday.

345080689.name: Great Outdoor Fish Market
345080689.author: a TripAdvisor user
345080689.reviewBody: This is a great outdoor fish market in Ensenada close to downtown and the cruise ship port too.  Fund to walk through or stop off for a shrimp cocktail or ceviche cocktail.

336536630.name: A quick walk from the cruise terminal.
336536630.author: a TripAdvisor user
336536630.reviewBody: This is something to see and do while here since there is not much after you get off the ship. They have restaurants in front of the market and many little areas with bars. They also have people selling souvenirs near by. It\'s cool and interesting. As far as the seafood goes it looked really good and fresh to me but am not sure of the prices.

325768892.name: Decent proce for fresh seafood
325768892.author: a TripAdvisor user
325768892.reviewBody: The Market was conveniently and centrally located. Fish are fresh and the price is decent, just note that the price here is close to what price you pay at the supermarket in Los Angeles. The place was fun and the vendors are always trying to lure you to buy at their stall. Also note that you will need a place to store the fish, so you either need to be prepared and bring your own cooler or buy a Styrofoam at the local market.\nI enjoyed the market noise and smell of the place. Just so you know!!!

315215697.name: Got screwed
315215697.author: a TripAdvisor user
315215697.reviewBody: Saw a nice tuna,,,asked for a few pounds,,,,,,he took it to the back and returned it wrapped up,,,,,when I got home, the fish I saw was not the fish I paid for,,,,it was old and had internal parasites,,,worms,,,,\n\nYep, bait and switch,,,I was a fool not to see them take the fish I selected,,,,

290781928.name: Lots of veriaty
290781928.author: a TripAdvisor user
290781928.reviewBody: Small market of fresh fish, all prices are set the same between vendors, it\'s all about the choice and freshness. We sampled smoked Marlin ans Tuna, sat down next door to a restrurant and had marlin and tuna tacos.. Excellent food..

255235991.name: BEWARE, BAD SEAFOOD!
255235991.author: a TripAdvisor user
255235991.reviewBody: We were in there on a Monday morning hoping to get fresh seafood. Don\'t count on it! The first two stalls on your right as entering the market from the small parking lot appear to be professional, however, here is how it works. If they size you up as tourists (gringos), they figure you\'re not cooking in your hotel room and pull a bait and switch. They grab a piece of fish or whatever you choose and switch behind the counter for their old stuff before weighing it. The crab claws we had when we got home were spoiled (foul), the corbina water-logged and fell apart after baking (inedible), our friend bought the halibut but it was switched with ray or shark that was rotten and inedible when arriving in San Diego that evening (look in the black bag before leaving if you\'re smart, we trusted them, our mistake). We grabbed two small lobsters which were overpriced and of fair quality, however, I could have bought them in Los Angeles for the same price or less after assessing our first two loses. Bottom line, beware, we will never shop there again, this place needs fish police badly. These guys are con artists. We saw them bringing in frozen bluefin tunas from last summer, good luck with those. BEWARE, or you will be the victim of unethical fish mongers too!

225553006.name: If you re into markets, go there
225553006.author: a TripAdvisor user
225553006.reviewBody: If you are visiting ensenada and you like local markets, to to the fish market. Things are fresh abd you will find a bunch of restaurants where you can eat.

218351233.name: Its a Experience
218351233.author: a TripAdvisor user
218351233.reviewBody: A cool place to see all kinds of different seafood an a great way to spend a afternoon in ensanada grab some tacos an enjoy

216927223.name: Various restaurants to eat at
216927223.author: a TripAdvisor user
216927223.reviewBody: Fresh seafood & tacos, various stands selling various merchandise, boat rentals, nice walking and views but remember you are at a fish market so it is smelly.

202542723.name: beautiful and exciting
202542723.author: a TripAdvisor user
202542723.reviewBody: we were staying in a nearby hotel with no cooking facilities, so it was fun to just observe.  The merchants were raucous and randy, it was fun walking around and got us primed and ready to go eat some fresh seafood

189191606.name: Very fresh fish at low price
189191606.author: a TripAdvisor user
189191606.reviewBody: I had brought two big fresh fish (almost 2 Kg)  for only eight dollars.  and went across the alley to have the restaurant to cook it for me and only charge me eight dollars for cooking.  The only problem is they only know way to cook the fish is deep fry.   But the fish taste very good.

162600944.name: watch yourself
162600944.author: a TripAdvisor user
162600944.reviewBody: Do not let them sell you a black bag full of lobsters, actually look at them or they will give you babies.  Trust no one.  Also those cards for free drinks?  Those drinks are virgin they have no alcohol.  Wonder why you can drink 6, 2 for price one margeritas and not get drunk, they have very little tequila.  Be prepared to pay 4 pesos to pee.  Mexico is beautiful and the people are friendly but the constant bombardment of people wanting your money is very tiring.

14329528.name: Interesting Scene
14329528.author: a TripAdvisor user
14329528.reviewBody: I have mixed feelings about this place.  Here is the positive first:  the taco stand we ate at was very tasty.  Here are the negatives: you will be yelled at by all the people lining the street to come in and eat at their taco place (very annoying), the place reeks of fish (obviously) and the ground is soaked with fish guts and such.  A guy does periodically walk up and down the street dousing it with bleach!  If you are an adventurous eater and person in general, I would check this place out.  If you cannot stand the sight of fish or the smell, DO NOT GO HERE!

653233764.name: Best wine in Valle
653233764.author: a TripAdvisor user
653233764.reviewBody: This was our first winery that we stopped, we tasted 3 wines for $100 pesos. My personal favorite was Reserva Real. I regret not doing the tour, they have them every hour and they are less than $400 pesos. I highly recommend this winery! \u2764\ufe0f

633878241.name: New Owners from Spain!
633878241.author: a TripAdvisor user
633878241.reviewBody: Wow this place has class. We did a tasting here on our way through the wine country and it didn\'t disappoint! They told us they have new owners from Spain who plan to update, upgrade and even put a restaurant here. It is beautiful with flowers planted everywhere and the wine was delicious.

656881385.name: Fun drive through
656881385.author: a TripAdvisor user
656881385.reviewBody: Plenty of shops, hotels and restaurants along Avenida Lopez Mateos.  Spend some time just walking the street and enjoying the sights.

637465034.name: Tourist stuff
637465034.author: a TripAdvisor user
637465034.reviewBody: This is an interesting street - crammed with tourist junk with an occasional and almost astonishing shop selling fine crafts and high end silver. Mcdonalds exists within 4 short blocks of the fabulous El Rey Sol, a french restaurant nearly a century old, with lovely servers of the old school. Pastries to drool over. The rule of thumb here is the further south, the nicer the restaurants and shops - although even this is not quite true because there is a great chicken place and a beautiful crafts shop more north.  Just walk the street and let your nose and common sense guide you to the good spots.  Avoid the pharmacies with overpriced fake pills. However, for the most part, this is an enjoyable and harmless bit of fun. Bring the kids. They will love it and convince you to buy cringe worthy souvenirs. Totally safe in daylight hours. Too many drunk gringos at the north end of the street at night. This is where all the bars are. The police regularly patrol to assure visitors are safe. It\u2019s well lit and well maintained. Worth a visit for the carnival atmosphere and the occasional high quality shop and restaurant. Make time for a latte and pastry at El Rey Sol. Unforgettable.

631289825.name: Best place to go out at night in Ensenada
631289825.author: a TripAdvisor user
631289825.reviewBody: This avenue has a lot of bars and great night life. There are also many restaurants with many options

613964550.name: Mariachi loco tequila shop
613964550.author: a TripAdvisor user
613964550.reviewBody: This is a cool tequila shop they give you free samples of tequila and also a I\'ll engrave your bottle for free. But the gentleman engraving the bottles told me ppl sometimes give him tips. I bought a bottle of tequila and had him engrave it nice new store.good prices and fun

611942780.name: For cruise ship tourists
611942780.author: a TripAdvisor user
611942780.reviewBody: It\'s all here and at tourist prices, which if you bargain, can be okay. Restaurants are pricey for Mexico but there are some good ones.

542998329.name: Always Fun
542998329.author: a TripAdvisor user
542998329.reviewBody: We love strolling the Avenue with all the tourist shops.  I\'ve been visiting for years and never tire of exploring this street.  The old restaurants are dependable and some of the new ones look inviting.  Lots of changes over the last year-positive changes.

542102368.name: Nice place.
542102368.author: a TripAdvisor user
542102368.reviewBody: We stopped here on our Disney cruise and did a little shopping, it wasn\'t the best place we have been to and my family dint feel that safe but it was good to see the Mexican culture, there wasn\'t a lot to do here so we just had some lunch and headed back to the ship early.

541686246.name: The shopping is here
541686246.author: a TripAdvisor user
541686246.reviewBody: If you have the patience.  Many shops seem to have the same things. But there are gems. Just keep walking until you feel the right atmosphere.

498889359.name: good shopping
498889359.author: a TripAdvisor user
498889359.reviewBody: The shopping is good, haggle lots, I got one vendor to go half of what he asked and I could\'ve gone more I think but I wasn\'t really interested, that was the key, beware of fake silver and counterfeit, great eating places down by the restaurant area, free WIFI by the park just west of that street

489230989.name: Bought a nice chess set
489230989.author: a TripAdvisor user
489230989.reviewBody: You need plenty of energy to withstand the onslaught of vendors and touts. A lot of the same merchandise is repeated in store after store. I was looking for a nice chess set and finally found a nice one. Be prepared to bargain. They expect you to.

486651790.name: Ugh, nothing interesting
486651790.author: a TripAdvisor user
486651790.reviewBody: Stretches on about 4 blocks a street full of merchants selling the exactly same stuff and waiting for you to bargain on it. With a little exception stores are the same and everybody greeting you with the same phrase and asking same hight price for a lot of cheap non-authentic souvenirs. I guess if you want to buy something special you need to come prepared, knowing the prices you\'d pay elsewhere and knowing what you are looking for (like cigars or tequila brands). It\'s not dangerous and you can easily walk to/from your ship.

482188807.name: Where to shop
482188807.author: a TripAdvisor user
482188807.reviewBody:
Ensenada is a small town with very little to see. This street is a long one with probably most of the shops and variety

There are also some markets and bars next to this street

This was the only mexican city I visited so far, I believe it might not be the most interesting one to visit

389963728.name: It\u2019s harmless so just look around
389963728.author: a TripAdvisor user
389963728.reviewBody: So many people seem to be worried about the vendors pushing their wares but they are harmless. Just tell them no gracias and they\u2019ll leave you alone.It\u2019s still not pretty exciting but something to do and you might even find something you like. Just remember to haggle prices down to a thrd of their original asking price.

389148285.name: Great Silver Shops
389148285.author: a TripAdvisor user
389148285.reviewBody: This street is a safe walk from where the cruise ship shuttles leave off passengers. Usually the ships provide maps of the area.  This street was easy to find.  If you\'re interested in purchasing good silver (not the street vendor silver trinkets), this is the place to find a unique item.  You can find touristy junk as well.

385956466.name: If you don\'t mind getting accosted every few feet
385956466.author: a TripAdvisor user
385956466.reviewBody: If you have ever been to Revolution Blvd in Tijuana then you don\'t need to bother coming to Ensenada. If you\'re in college and still binge drink and think doing shots is the way to have fun then this place is for you. But if you have higher expectations then go to Cabo.

380980591.name: Nice city to visit
380980591.author: a TripAdvisor user
380980591.reviewBody: Nice city to see. It has lot of restaurant store, and night life, some have live music too. Walk around the harbor and don\'t forget to eat the seafood village (They said that if you don\'t eat a seafood taco there, you don\'t visit Ensenada). Plus you can buy all kind of flesh sea food there too. Check carefully with the hotels around this street. Because the noise (music from the night club) will not let you sleep at night. So ask above the noise on the hotel you will stay. Don\'t forget to visit too - La Bufadora (1hr driving from Ensenada). Nice place to visit and take pictures. Check Ensenada and La Bufadora web-sites.

363951725.name: Avenida Lopez Mateos
363951725.author: a TripAdvisor user
363951725.reviewBody: Avenida Lopez Mateos!\nThis is like the main drag for Tourists.\nPlenty of shops and restaurants to try. But get off of the beaten path and explore the local hang outs like Mariscos El Guero!

363682528.name: Tourist trap
363682528.author: a TripAdvisor user
363682528.reviewBody: If you\'re on a cruise and you have to go somewhere quick, I suppose this is the only touristy place to go but I\'d recommend the Cultural Center where at least you get to see something of Ensenada/Mexico instead of an aggressive tourist trap where the vendors constantly accost you (in weirdly perfect American English) as you walk up and down this garish street trying to get you to buy tacos, beer or cheesy souvenirs. The aforementioned plaza at the cultural center has some tourist souvenir stands and a atmospheric little bar if you need to get your fix. I will say that it\'s probably safe to eat, drink and walk here for tourists which is more that can be said for other areas in town.

326942161.name: Lopez Mateous was beautiful!
326942161.author: a TripAdvisor user
326942161.reviewBody: We walked up and down the streets.  It was wonderful. So, so many Mexican people.  I would go again!  We really liked the people.

290784275.name: crowed
290784275.author: a TripAdvisor user
290784275.reviewBody: no curbside parking, park on a side street, no worry, its safe. lots of nice resturants to chose from, from simple tacos, burgers and ribs, Seafood dinning to your sports type bars for heavy drinking. nice shops for jewerly and clothing..

283293909.name: You want souvenirs? You\'ll like this place!
283293909.author: a TripAdvisor user
283293909.reviewBody: All the goodies that you could load yourself down with are available here. Booze, drugs(legal and probably otherwise), cigars, native crafts (some even made in Mexico!), and lots of restaurants and nightclubs.

282204713.name: Tourist strip just like First Street ... not the best place to visit Ensenada if you want a good impression!
282204713.author: a TripAdvisor user
282204713.reviewBody: Tourist strip just like First Street ... not the best place to visit Ensenada if you want a good impression!\n\nToo many hawkers yelling at you about going into their bar or buying their merchandise.

268226933.name: Avenues Lopez Matroska - Ensanada, Mexico
268226933.author: a TripAdvisor user
268226933.reviewBody: This area is a great shopping area. Lots of souvenir shops, as well as restaurants and clothing stores. The people are very friendly and a lot of them speak great English.

262949952.name: Lots of great stores and vendors!  Best Vendor the Copper Sculpture Man!
262949952.author: a TripAdvisor user
262949952.reviewBody: This is a street full of great craft markets and more!  But the best vendor on the street is the man who makes copper wire sculpture.  I love these items.  My favorites are the Hermit Crab (white), the little frogs, the amazing lizards and the 2 items I bought years ago from the same man\u2026.the cactus with marbles and the scorpion!  I have these in my Baja Room.  I would recommend looking these over carefully and buying many!  I look at this wire sculpture as a Baja art, never seen it anywhere else in Mexico.  \n\nOn a side street is a store with leather& horsehair ranch made crafts\u2026.hat bands, tack for riding and more. I\'ll post photos of these items.  I have a few hat bands and leather and/or horsehair keychains from ranches\u2026.they\'re beautiful!

261721669.name: A Nice Place to Visit, Before going somewhere else...
261721669.author: a TripAdvisor user
261721669.reviewBody: Being Mexican, bilingual, and a seasoned budget traveler, I enjoy Avenida Mateos for what it is and what it\'s not. It isn\'t real Mexico. It\'s a place where tourists can feel safe and speak in English for the most part. The food is good and there are some venders selling some very well made, high end merchandise. On both counts, it\'s expensive. At night it\'s a great place to party; Hussongs, Papas and Beers and a host of others. There are some great places to sit down for a nice cup of coffee and people watch. Generally for me, it\'s a place to walk around perhaps sit down for a cup of coffee or an ice-cream. I prefer to shop and eat where I rarely see other Americans. It\'s just a preference. If I\'m in Mexico, I prefer to be in real Mexico. However, for many people, they are most comfortable being in an area that reminds them of home. To each his own.

253195306.name: Busy, noisy
253195306.author: a TripAdvisor user
253195306.reviewBody: Busy, noisy, but when we were there, lots of stores just weren\'t open. Don\'t know if it was because cruise ships weren\'t in port or what, but aside from the heavy auto traffic, it seemed quite dead.

248570466.name: Facial and Massage
248570466.author: a TripAdvisor user
248570466.reviewBody: I have had many massages, and this is one of the best.  Ladies, there were 3 of us that had a massage on January 8th.  We were celebrating my daughter\'s birthday.  The facilities were clean.  The staff was friendly and professional.  We all filled out a form with a front and back picture of a person for us to indicate any muscles that needed attention and the pressure (light, medium or hard) that we wanted.  The massage tables were laid out with fresh clean sheets and a light blanket with subdued lighting and soothing music playing low.  The ambiance was relaxing.   After disrobing to panties left on, we let them know we were ready for our massage to begin. The women were very good about maintaining our privacy with draping the towels over us.   From the top of our heads to the bottom of our feet, kinks were worked out and kneaded just perfectly.  We were all impressed with the strength they had to keep the pressure required for the hour workout!  The women all did a fantastic job...we will go back every time we are in town.

240901911.name: Nice day in Ensenada
240901911.author: a TripAdvisor user
240901911.reviewBody:
My husband and I visited Ensenada on Nov 19th.  We were aboard the Princess Golden which stopped here for the day.  We were told by our cruise director that there were no taxis to take us within the cruise terminal and that we needed to take the shuttle.  We paid $2 per person to ride a shuttle, which they waited until EVERY seat was full before we left.  They took us on a very short ride to town, in which we probably could've walked seeing it was maybe  a mile or so.  You can see the cruise ship from where they drop you off at McDonald's. They charge $1 for a return trip.  

We felt very safe the whole time here.  People were friendly and joked around.  Had a couple vendors that were pushy but for the most part, a good experience.  Definitely many pharmacies around if  you want to get any meds.  Good prices.  We were especially looking for some dia des los muertos items for my daughter who is taking a Spanish class and has an interest in this holiday.  We asked a few vendors, but not many had anything of super interest until we came across Casa Ramirez store.  We had the pleasure to meet a lady at the store who was very informative and took her to the upstairs of her store and had a beautiful altar set up to view.  They had tons of items to choose some that it was a hard decision!  Awesome store and wonderful staff!!!  Highley recommend seeing their upstairs if you are at all interested in the Day of the Dead items and traditions.  

One thing I wasn't thrilled with was that most of the stores didn't open until about 10 am or later.  Our ship got into town at 8am.  So we walked around for about an hour trying to find places to shop. Not sure why they open so late when a cruise ship is in port?  I thought their livelyhood relied on the passengers being in town?  But, once they open, you can have as much alcohol as you want, even at 10am!  Lots of little cafe style bars around.

Was a typical town with shops.  Nothing too exciting.  Not many picturesque photo opportunities.  Probably won't visit here again.

240004730.name: Average shopping district in a border town
240004730.author: a TripAdvisor user
240004730.reviewBody: We stopped in Ensenada while on a cruise and opted to visit the shopping district. Having been to many border/tourist towns in Mexico it was what I expected. There are a lot of shops all selling the same stuff, so be sure to shop around before buying. And don\'t pay for an "excursion" to the street, it\'s about a half mile walk from the dock to get there and there are signs to direct you.

240003580.name: A typical tourist shopping street
240003580.author: a TripAdvisor user
240003580.reviewBody: We walked here off the cruise ship because it was the closest thing to do in Ensenada. It was exactly what I was expecting of a Mexican tourist shopping street. You get asked by ech shop owner to come in and look at their "Almost Free" wares. After you have been in two, you have seen everything that this street has to offer. We found a couple things, grabbed a margarita and then headed back to the ship. It was nice to walk around and stretch our legs, but this will definitely not be repeated if we ever go back.

237187578.name: Those Pharmacy Guys are annoying.  Great prices on Kahlua!
237187578.author: a TripAdvisor user
237187578.reviewBody: I don\'t mind walking down a street meant to entice tourists to spend money, but please, stop with the questions already.. That an the massage parlors that promise a "happy ending" (I got three of those in the span of a block, LOL)   One good thing  is that I scored a liter of Kahlua for 12.00

234079423.name: LOTS OF SHOPPING
234079423.author: a TripAdvisor user
234079423.reviewBody: I ENJOY the niGHTLIFE area HERE.  Hussongs and Papa\'s and beer are extended stays when i visit.  to the villa marina hotel back to where papa\'s and beer is many htings to see, buy, eat etc

228482089.name: Are you an Ugly American??
228482089.author: a TripAdvisor user
