228482089.reviewBody: I have spent almost 30 years visiting First Street, and have befriended many of the local vendors. They sell quality goods, and Street vendors and shop keepers CAN NOT SELL THEIR PRODUCT FOR LESS THAN THEY BOUGHT IT!!  Many times the typical UGLY AMERICAN will offer the vendor less than half price for their goods-- DO THE MATH FOLKS!! One vendor  has lovely purses from Chiapas that she sells for $25.00 -these are hand made by her family-- She needs at least 15.00 to break even- It\'s a slap in the face to offer her $10.00- and she sits out there all day trying to sell her purses and jewelry- These people are HUMAN BEINGS AND NEED TO EAT TOO!  Be courteous- Please!

217136397.name: Go With  A Large Crowd
217136397.author: a TripAdvisor user
217136397.reviewBody: My teen daughter and I went into Ensenada when our Carnival Cruise ship stopped here for the day.  We thought it would be safe since it\'s a port of call and decided to see a bit of the city rather than do a preplanned short excursion.  I thought I was prepared....but once we got off the ship and walked a ways down....it became apparent I had no idea where to go for the "shopping".  Not many Americans were around either, so we really did not feel very safe.  But we caught up to a couple who showed us where to go, and once we found this street and saw all the other Americans and stores, we felt better.  But this street is off the main street and the main street is really pretty creepy.  I\'m no na\u00efve traveler, but this even caught me off guard.  We spent  about an hour here...nothing really exciting and not many deals to be made even though we tried.  From a cultural perspective, it was good for my daughter to see the horrible conditions and appreciate what we have in Northern Ca...but all in all, next time, unless I\'m with a large crowd of people, I will skip this and do a planned excursion which I think it safer.  I really do not know why Carnival stops here at all....maybe you have to venture further out into town where it is nicer.  Biggest piece of advise....KNOW WHERE YOU ARE GOING BEFORE YOU GET THERE.

213509619.name: Plenty of Sellers
213509619.author: a TripAdvisor user
213509619.reviewBody: This is the hub of Ensendada with many merchants and venders trying to sell you their items. Many are persistent so by prepared to say no when needed. Also try to have some idea what you want to buy. Other tourists enjoy the food and drinks so to party.\nRMS

213209754.name: Recent trip to Ensenada, Mexico with the Family
213209754.author: a TripAdvisor user
213209754.reviewBody: I spent the weekend with my wife and two kids (ages 4 and 6). we started off by having coffee at Starbucks :).  we walked around the area trying different taco stands.  we stopped at Tacos Mi Ranchito El Fenix, La Floresta, and the Anthony Bourdain made famous Tacos Lily.  all three places were delicious.  good selections of condiments and tasty fish tacos.  the tortillas aren\'t homemade, but i understand its hard to make tortillas in a small stand.  my favorite is still Tacos Lily, but u can\'t go wrong at any of three places.  i didn\'t get a chance to try Marcos Antonio or Fish Taco Ensenada because my wife and kids were stuffed.  My kids loved Lily\'s. \nprices for tacos are about 12 to 18 pesos.  very cheap!!!\nshopping in the area is also fun because you can bargain.  i bought my lil boy a guitar for $5 U.S. dollars.  a bargain and it made my lil boys day.

212940504.name: Shopping in Ensenada
212940504.author: a TripAdvisor user
212940504.reviewBody: We like to visit the local shops and find unique items to add to our folk art collection, dia de los muertos collection.  Most of the shop clerks are very helpful and some bartering can be worked into the sale.  We usually ask if it is the best they can do on the price and then make counteroffers.  Happy shopping..

210021900.name: fun little tourist strip
210021900.author: a TripAdvisor user
210021900.reviewBody: this is where you will find every tacky t shirt, useless trinket, cow skull and ugly blanket you have ever wanted. Bargain away. At the north end, you will find cheaper hotels and bars. The further south you travel, however, things move up the scale and you will find some good silver shops, really nice places to eat and wine shops. There are also a couple of nice hotels. Everything is walking distance. Ensenada is not a big place.

207552660.name: Good local shopping for cruisers
207552660.author: a TripAdvisor user
207552660.reviewBody: On a recent cruise we ventured over here for some shopping. After having chosen la bufadora on our last trip, we wanted something a little different. We were pleasantly surprised by the selection and friendliness of the shop owners. There were some great accessory stores, ladies clothing boutiques, and Jewelry stores in addition to the normal Mexican goods. It felt very safe and I highly recommend a short shuttle ride here if you don\'t feel up to a 45 minute bus ride each way to la bufadora.

194670284.name: Five Blocks of Craft and Crap!
194670284.author: a TripAdvisor user
194670284.reviewBody: It is busy street of endless shops selling everything you don\'t need, such as leather sandals, purses, Mexican ponchos, souvenir magnets, wrestling costumes, etc.\nYou CAN walk from cruise ship terminal and it is not that far, or there is a shuttle costing US$3.00/return, taking you from cruise ship terminal to/from a plaza, one block from the beginning of Avenida Lopez Mateos.\nThere are plenty of toilets which charge a fee.

192475951.name: A good place for short stroll
192475951.author: a TripAdvisor user
192475951.reviewBody: We came here twice this year on cruises, one of which was a back to back with Ensenada as a port. It is a quick 20 minute walk from the port, heading into town. Yes, it is touristy, but is safe and is dotted with not only souvenir shops but also great local restaurants off the main street. The famous Husson, where Margaritas were born, is located just off Avenida Lopez Mateos as well as Papas and Beer, where many tourists ends up. Try La Compadre! Bruno is the owner and is a graduate from Napa Valley Cooking School in California. He makes great seafood plates while his mom runs the other side of the restaurant  where she and her staff cooks up all the rest--carne asada, chicken, pork etc.. GREAT food! Cheap prices!\n\nPrices are better at the marketplace at La Bufadora if you are looking for bargains. However, as everyone knows, one needs to negotiate for your goods.

192240560.name: Great way to go shopping
192240560.author: a TripAdvisor user
192240560.reviewBody: If you like to walk a lot - here\'s your place and well worth it. Many small and medium size shops with everything one might like to  take home as a souvenir. Leather goods, dresses, shoes, you name it and you\'ll probably find it. All the typical stuff one expects on a Mexican shopping excursion.

191009018.name: Not sure why the cruise would choose this place to stop!
191009018.author: a TripAdvisor user
191009018.reviewBody: It\'s hard to walk down the Main Street and not get pestered and the shops all basically sell the same tack -- I should have stayed on the ship.

186080656.name: First Street
186080656.author: a TripAdvisor user
186080656.reviewBody: The street with all the shops, as well as Terra Peninsular where you see art from the local indigenous people, great food as well as shopping not only from Mexico but also Russia, India, China, Japan- etc.

182153008.name: Very relaxing.....
182153008.author: a TripAdvisor user
182153008.reviewBody: Great place to walk around, eat and shop. Prices are are a little high for Mexico which of course I compare with US. Tacos at La Bufadora cost $2.00 while in the states you get them for about a buck. I am not sure if it\'s the economy or being a tourist spot that their prices are higher.  i prefer using pesos than dollars as the locals seems to convert the currency on a lesser exchange rate. It\'s lobstor season but I\'d rather but lobstors here in US rather than over there as the prices are very inflated.\nOverall south of the border is not the same and NOT that affordable anymore.

155295257.name: Spiffed up
155295257.author: a TripAdvisor user
155295257.reviewBody: I returned to Ensenada after an almost 30 year absence and it sure has cleaned up.  The streets were spotless and the sidewalks literally gleamed.  The sidewalk vendors weren\'t too pushy.  The rose vendor is charming and a hoot,  The southern end has some nice higher-end restaurants and stores if you\'re looking for something less kitchy to buy.  I was saddened to see the effect of the economy and the bad press the narco wars have wracked on this charming town.  Don\'t be scared away, we felt very safe and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

151246189.name: Ensenada shopping on Av. Lopez Mateos
151246189.author: a TripAdvisor user
151246189.reviewBody: Av. Lopez Mateos is ls also o known as First St., Only a couple blocks from the cruise ship terminal. and perfectly safe . It is never overcrowded with tourists.  Parts of First street on the Southern end houses the better quality shops such as Los Castillos for silver and Casa Colonial for Mexican designer clothing and the Blue Shell for fun funky items. Always fun to walk First Street and maybe stop for a coffee at one of the many outside coffee shops. Street vendors usually on every corner, I have never found them pushy or aggressive. On the North end are the not so trendy shops  but fun. If only interested in a Margarita, stop at Papas and Beer or Hussongs bar and watch the world go by  .  Ensenada is a fun place, ,

150365941.name: Being a seasoned haggler, even I was intimidated,
150365941.author: a TripAdvisor user
150365941.reviewBody: The shops had some cute stuff, but the incredibly aggressive salesmen and street vendors got to me after a while.  I like to haggle, but when the sellers started touching me, pulling my arm, I almost lost my cool.  I had gone shopping while my fianc\u00e9 was enjoying Papas & Beer, but I cut it short once I had grown exhausted from running the gauntlet of pressure.  \n\nOverall, some cute stuff, but not worth the hassle.

150151326.name: Supresa y Execellente!
150151326.author: a TripAdvisor user
150151326.reviewBody: My friends and I were pleasantly surprised by how clean the streets were and how safe we felt shopping up and down this avenue.  We shopped and walked the 8 blocks from our ship had a massage and then shopped our way back.  \nDon\'t expect to find anything but kitschy hats, silver, turquoise, blankets, great looking cowboy boots and tequila, oh and vanilla, lots of vanilla.  Not sure how old the vanilla was in some cases(no pun intended), the bottles were rather dusty. \nPlan on bargaining, the vendors expect it and it makes shopping that much more interesting and entertaining.

142513442.name: shopping
142513442.author: a TripAdvisor user
142513442.reviewBody:
our taxi drop us off here after we went to Las canadas and La bufadora.
here, you can just walk around, eat, drink or take pictures as much as you like with an african  lion for $20. Poor cub just want to rest and people try to wake her up. 
if you are too tried to walk back to the ship. there is a taxi that will take you back for $1 pp. some of them ask for $5.
Bargain on what you want to buy because the price is pretty high.  
we were having fun bargain on the child blouse and pant, hat and leather bottle holder. 
Carnival and Disney ship came in the same day so the street was filled with people. it was fun walking around.
we drop by sea lion area on the walk back to the ship to the right of the big flag, one of them try to get the bird that was standing on the dock or just want to say 'hi':)

135276085.name: Calle Primera Image....
135276085.author: a TripAdvisor user
135276085.reviewBody: I live in Ensenada and the buldings are very ugly, like the tenants are very negligent. It\'s like they don\'t care about the city image...

135031656.name: If Disney Resorts were to make "Mexicoland", if would look like this
135031656.author: a TripAdvisor user
135031656.reviewBody: I am always surprised by the number of people I know who are afraid to get off a cruise ship and walk through downtown Ensenada. Other than the amount of alcohol available (and a few sketchy "gentleman\'s clubs" near Ave. Miramar) the place is relatively sterile, with stereotypical Mexican shop owners selling belts, sunglasses, and any number of one-of-a-kind Mexican curios. There is a fairly heavy "tourist police" presence, cameras on every corner, and a moratorium on begging -- although I did notice more women with children selling Chicklets on the street, although they did not follow people around like in other cities. \n\nMy wife and I love to visit here, but it is really like an adult Disneyland... not really authentic, like a stereotype of what Mexico should look like. If you are visiting from the cruise ship, really -- it IS safe to walk off the ship and walk to the main shopping and entertainment district. You won\'t get mugged or pick pocketed, will find the food tasty and safe, and will find bargains on jewelry and trinkets.

134064528.name: A fun time to show your spanish skills.
134064528.author: a TripAdvisor user
134064528.reviewBody: I had a fun time exploring the street shops while my wife was getting a facial treatment at Massage & Facial Care on the same street. The locals warmed right up to me and we all had some laughs and they helped me with some great purchases. There are some GREAT ironwood sculptures up and down the street.

128148143.name: A great walking street
128148143.author: a TripAdvisor user
128148143.reviewBody: Lots of shops, restaurants and coffee shops. A great place to just walk and window shop.

127383041.name: A fun main drag
127383041.author: a TripAdvisor user
127383041.reviewBody: There are so many shops and restaurants to look at and choose from.  No one tries to pressure you--it\'s fun to shop and bargain.  The food is fresh, tasty, and inexpensive.

123748132.name: Typical tourist trap
123748132.author: a TripAdvisor user
123748132.reviewBody: This was like any other tourist strip.  Filled with colorful displays of not really authentic "Mexican" items & other things.  It\'s interesting to explore for a short period of time, but nothing spectacular to us.  The vendors are a bit pushy, but lots of jokes thrown in to soften it.

3510587.name: Shopping in the Tourist Zone
3510587.author: a TripAdvisor user
3510587.reviewBody:
Overview:
The main shopping area in the tourist zone along Lopez Mateos is appealing with brick paved sidewalks which are cleaned every morning. Since this is in the tourist zone, expect to pay higher prices though. Streets are packed with tourists when the cruise ships are in (Wednesday, Thursday, and Saturday).

Don't miss trying some of the Mexican Ice Cream, which is much better than what you get in the U.S. and is all natural...the way it used to be made.

If you would like to shop where the locals do, then simply walk four blocks into the city (on Ruiz or Gastelum) to a street called Juarez, which is lined with all kinds of stores, cheaper prices, and less sales pressure. Watch where you step though because the sidewalks may not be as well maintained as Lopez Mateos

Pesos or Dollars:
U.S. dollars are generally accepted here, however note that the exchange rate may be better or worse depending on the store. 

If you plan to convert to pesos, the ATM machines at local banks like Banamex or HSBC have excellent exchange rates (better than the currency exchange houses). Visa/MC also have good exchange rates, but many banks now charge an additional 2%-3% fee for foreign purchases in addition to the 1% that Visa/MC charges to do the conversion, which seems unreasonable to me considering the bank doesn't add any value to the transaction process. Check your bank's policy so that you are not surprised after the trip.

Safety Tips:
Ensenada, unlike Tijuana, is a reasonably safe place to party and have a good time. Here are a few basic DON’Ts to stay clear of problems.

1.) Don’t talk to the Raterios! These are the guys hanging out on the street that usually make an attempt to approach gringos looking for a good time. Most of them speak good English. They always act as if they are trying to help you find anything you may be looking for. Let me just call them what they are: hustlers. You will end up broke & unhappy if you waste you time talking to them. They are smart and have a playbook of games. Just say no thanks or ignore them and keep walking. They don’t want to waste time either and will move on. 

2.) Don’t walk down any street in Ensenada with a drink in your hand.

3.) Don’t bring or buy drugs period!!!!! 

4.) Don’t ever hit anyone or start a fight unless you want a tour inside of the local jail. 

5.) Don’t get so drunk that you can barely walk down the street.

6.) Pedestrians have the right of way in the crosswalks, however you should still exercise caution before stepping out into the intersection.

Important Note About Street Beggars:
Some people may be shocked to see elderly women and young children begging (or selling gum), however be aware that the ones you see in the tourist zone are known to be exploited by a crime organizations who keep most of the money for themselves and chase away others who might have a legitimate need.

619584444.name: Good Wine, the visit was a let down
619584444.author: a TripAdvisor user
619584444.reviewBody: A friend recommended this Winery, upon 1st impression I liked the appearance of the winery. We entered the tasting room and our server was not the most knowledgeable or energetic. He did mention that the night before there was a huge event, so I am sure the main crew had the day off.

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

570646835.name: Some of the best wine you will find in the valley.
570646835.author: a TripAdvisor user
570646835.reviewBody: This was our fourth and last winery stop in the valley. We found some of the best wines here, and purchased several bottles.\n\nBeautiful architecture, but stop by for the wine and chit-chat. You will be impressed, believe me.

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

489663182.name: One of the must stops in  Guadalupe
489663182.author: a TripAdvisor user
489663182.reviewBody: Christoph the vinemaker received us in May 2017 and gave us the "personal" tour of the vineyard. \nPedregal wine is in my opinion one of the best in the valley really enjoyed his company and had a great time touring the facility.\nLocal cheese and bread as well as some cold meet was served do recommend the experience because of the high quality of the wine.

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

437816034.name: Worth the Stop!!!
437816034.author: a TripAdvisor user
437816034.reviewBody: This is a small winery, but don\'t let this mistake you it was one of the best winery that you can stop by. The employees are very friendly and make this experience of wine tasting very enjoyable. They are willing to answer any question you have regarding the winery and their brick building. So if you plan on going to The Valle de Guadalupe you should stop by. Awesome experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

412046965.name: Great wines but experience could improve
412046965.author: a TripAdvisor user
412046965.reviewBody: The wines are great but they don\'t take advantage in the very nice locations to make the wine experience better. They should have more tables, chairs, food and maybe have the tastings in front of the house which is nicer.

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

401480490.name: Very good experience and worth the stop!
401480490.author: a TripAdvisor user
401480490.reviewBody: The winery is very well kept and the employees knowledgable about the local wine culture. Served some local cheese & bread to compliment the wines they were showcasing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

259591259.name: Great wine, cool architecture, a must visit!
259591259.author: a TripAdvisor user
259591259.reviewBody: This is a small place for which you will find the turn off on the western end of the Ruta del Vino, but it is well worth exploring again and again. I have visited probably 5 times and always stop here because the wine is great the the hosts are very accommodating and friendly. The building in which the tasting room is house is a brick dome, very unpretentious but very cool. This is not your Monte Xanic (which is also great) or LA Cetto-type of place, but you will be pleasantly surprised by the quality of what you taste here. Make sure to get a bottle, the tastings are free when you buy one!

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

143402876.name: divine intervention
143402876.author: a TripAdvisor user
143402876.reviewBody:
We were on our way to a different winery at the end of our day and it was closed.  Decided to stop as Vinisterra gates were open.  There was a group in the winery when we came in that obviously enjoyed what they tasted as we had to wait a bit as the one person serving was busy dealing with their purchases.  After a short wait and an apology for the wait it was our turn!
AMAZING-- In fact I am drinking a glass of their modest price wine tonight to see if still tastes as good as we remembered from yesterday.
Our group hands down felt the quality was best at this location.  The modest price wine $20 was a Tempranillo blend under their Domino label.  Great value.  Wish we had bought more as this a darn good wine.  but.... their premium wine which ran about $40 was perfect, we personally only bought one and saving it for an occasion to show off the quality of Guadalupe Valley wines.
Our only regret was that we ended the day here, if we had started here I think we would have bought more .  We are fortunate that we have a house in Mexico so we are not under the constraint of only bringing back one or two bottles, but our wallet was getting thin at the end of the day. Highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Calle Miguel Lerdo de Tejada 466 San Antonio de las Minas

672162558.name: Cool spontaneous trip around the harbor.
672162558.author: a TripAdvisor user
672162558.reviewBody: For 30mins, the price was reasonable. I think 25$ a person and we had a group of 6. Our boat ride ended up being a little over 45mins. You can drink and play music. \nThe only negative thing was the views were that great. We cruised around other boats and rocks.

659573880.name: Now a major walk area to see parts of Ensenda
659573880.author: a TripAdvisor user
659573880.reviewBody: Use bridge from cruise port to see this Marina.  Walk along looking at the sights and sounds.\n\nPark is on your right - lots of places to eat and take small boats out of the marina. Lots of vendors attempting to sell you something, either a tour, food or trinkets. Very interesting

647995789.name: Lots of animals to see in the small Marina
647995789.author: a TripAdvisor user
647995789.reviewBody: The Marina is small, in half an hour one can watch everything. Even though, by boat is a short trip, there a plenty of thing to do right out side the Marina, don-t miss the fish market. Kids, will have a great time.

609983586.name: Small Marina but full of life.
609983586.author: a TripAdvisor user
609983586.reviewBody: We could walk from our Hotel Posada El Rey easily, the walk is safe and the stroll is pleasant. Love the boats in the harbor. There are places for refreshments or fresh fish tacos and beer.

557993783.name: I miss it
557993783.author: a TripAdvisor user
557993783.reviewBody: I spent some of the best times of my life in Ensenada and the Aduana was one of the places we used to go to daily to just sit down and look at the sea or simply have a drink. There are no words to describe how beautiful the sunset is over the bay and how much I miss those beautiful sunny days. Ensenada is one of the best places in Mexico.

544233400.name: Ensenada Cruiser Stop
544233400.author: a TripAdvisor user
544233400.reviewBody: A mandatory stop for boats entering Mexico, the Aduana is customs central. Spanish ability or an interpreter  might be helpful. Typical but fairly smooth transition with paperwork. Boats entering Mexico require registration to be legal. That includes a Mexican liability insurance company policy and a TIP, or Temporary Import Policy.

533573062.name: great view!
533573062.author: a TripAdvisor user
533573062.reviewBody: i enjoyed a lot the stroll in the boats!!!! you can feel the breeze! its a lifetime experience! this is a must if you visit ensenada :)

448090852.name: FUN!!!!
448090852.author: a TripAdvisor user
448090852.reviewBody: I have only been there twice. They have great festivals during the summer. There\'s a stand that sales Pina Coladas in a pineapple and their amazing! The boat rides are a bit scary depending on who you boat with! There fun but my first time I thought it was just going to be a soft cruise. To my surprise the man driving the boat was going extremely fast and it felt like the boat was going to tip over (multiple times). My boyfriend and I where so scared but after noticing that many of the passengers new was coming we figured that was what should be expected. It was so much fun, after realizing that was the intention . The driver also stops right next to he seals; allowing you to get great pictures!

389964102.name: Not the nicest stroll
389964102.author: a TripAdvisor user
389964102.reviewBody: I should have been more careful. I read the review and saw a nice walk. I didn\u2019t realize there was only one review. I woke my wife up and said let\u2019s take a walk and we did and it was not a nice stroll. It was filthy and full of garbage. Do yourself a favor and stay in the touristy areas or stay on the boat.

331464556.name: Nice walking place
331464556.author: a TripAdvisor user
331464556.reviewBody: Walked it Saturday afternoon with my wife, beautiful weather.  I enjoyed this along with the Port of Ensenada.

625160609.name: Excellent Place To Hike
625160609.author: a TripAdvisor user
625160609.reviewBody: As you start ascending up the mountains, the flora and fauna will change before your eyes.  You will soon be immersed in pine trees and even find snow depending on the time of year.  We took a tour of the observatory and found it pretty fascinating.    There are some great trails nearby, including a 4 KM hike straight up the mountain which ends in an amazing view of the Sea of Cortez.

itemReviewed.name: Observatorio Astronomico Nacional de la Sierra de San Pedro Martir

address.streetAddress: Acceso al Observatorio San Pedro Martir Mountains KM 92

561501833.name: An absolute treasure to visit!
561501833.author: a TripAdvisor user
561501833.reviewBody: It\'s amazing to have such a treasure that barely gets visitors. This National Park and Observatory arw manned by some of the nicest people you could meet that are eager to teach us the importance of what they do and how they go about doing it.

itemReviewed.name: Observatorio Astronomico Nacional de la Sierra de San Pedro Martir

address.streetAddress: Acceso al Observatorio San Pedro Martir Mountains KM 92

495608241.name: Mexico\'s 2.12 M Telescope in the Sky in the Sierra San Pedro Martir
495608241.author: a TripAdvisor user
495608241.reviewBody:
The Observatorio Astronomico Nacional de la Sierra de San Pedro Martir is 100 Km from Mex 1 just west of San Telmo just south of Punta Colonet at Lázaro Cárdenas. You take the left if coming from Ensenada. It is about a 2+ hour drive to the top.

The road is a scenic ribbon winding up the mountain to about 9,300' above sea level. The views are spectacular. You will see a foliage change with the altitude. Pine trees are above 7,000'. During the winter months is is possible to see ice in the streams. 

The sky is very clear here and that is why it is located here. The telescope in housed on the 3rd floor with all the monitoring done on the 2nd floor. 

It is one of 10 telescopes on the mountain with more being built and is the largest one. We were lucky enough to get a tour inside the housing and to be able to walk around the building on the upper catwalk. One should call ahead for access to the upper road as it is about 1 km walk from the parking area up to the telescopes.

It is open to the public basically from 10AM - 1PM and 2PM - 3PM daily. Rancho Meling is back down the Observatory Road about 50 Km and has very basic hotel rooms with food if you don't want to drive the 92 Km back to Mex 1.

The 2.12 M Telescope as well as the others are very interesting as is the surrounding National Park.

itemReviewed.name: Observatorio Astronomico Nacional de la Sierra de San Pedro Martir

address.streetAddress: Acceso al Observatorio San Pedro Martir Mountains KM 92

593411268.name: Great wine and hospitality!
593411268.author: a TripAdvisor user
593411268.reviewBody: I don\'t regularly write reviews but our experience at ATP was incredible! They have excellent wines and their hospitality was second to none. My favorite wine was the Ensamble. We thoroughly enjoyed the appetizers and bread dipping oil as well. They have great stories behind their winery and wines. The scenery was nice around the vineyard and throughout the region. I would highly recommend a visit if you are in La Valle de Guadalupe!

address.streetAddress: Calle Sin Nombre San Antonio de las Minas

470917041.name: Vino!
470917041.author: a TripAdvisor user
470917041.reviewBody: It was awesome Alex explained wines in great detail! Great wine tasting! And easy to talk to! I would come back again!

address.streetAddress: Calle Sin Nombre San Antonio de las Minas

656881703.name: Great rock paintings
656881703.author: a TripAdvisor user
656881703.reviewBody: A lovely stop and a great 10-minute hike up to the small cave and colorful rock paintings.  Informative interpretive signs along the trail are very interesting.  Should see!

551669754.name: Exotic nature
551669754.author: a TripAdvisor user
551669754.reviewBody: Coming from Sweden this nature and all the endemic species were really exotic to see, specially came for this. The rock paintings were also awesome, imagining that people were on the exactly same spot a couple of thousands years ago. Paths with signs that told the story of the indigenous people and the presence of the jesuits in the area, too bad the signs only were in spanish.

451075552.name: interesting stop
451075552.author: a TripAdvisor user
451075552.reviewBody: This cultural/historical site is a nice stop along travels north or south.  Directions from outdated guide books are confusing. The place is now well marked with a sign (NOT the stop at the geodesic dome, but the next stop south at KM 171.  The trail is well marked, with informational signs and pit toilets.  This area also has blue palm trees. While these rupestres are not as magnificent as the bigger sites (requiring a permit and a guide), they are very accessible and interesting.

414057911.name: Women having a baby
414057911.author: a TripAdvisor user
414057911.reviewBody: I found a painting off the normal trail on the other side of the highway that was in a craved out boulder with a women having a baby with a face that I will never forget.

392587317.name: Small Example but Worthy!
392587317.author: a TripAdvisor user
392587317.reviewBody: These cave paintings are very interesting though they don\'t have the size or the imagery of their larger cousins further south.  However, they are so easy to visit and in such a beautiful area full of life that I highly recommend seeing them on your drive south or north.

368734032.name: Hundred plus miles south ensenada
368734032.author: a TripAdvisor user
368734032.reviewBody: North of catevina three miles and catevina is THE place to stay if near there at night. Great cave paintings, lots in area and in a semi river bottom area. Worth seeing.

356178921.name: Ancient Baja rock carving and painting
356178921.author: a TripAdvisor user
356178921.reviewBody: From the California border and for 600 miles south, there are spectacular rock carvings and colorful rock paintings. These are thought to be at least 10,000 to 13,000 years old. They are leavings of the first peoples who entered the Americas. Many are close enough for the traveler to find themselves. The really special ones are further in.There are certified guides at many of the larger towns onthe way down the Baja peninsula. Where they are shaded from the sun, these paintings are very colorful. The drawings are accurate depictions of people, animals and sealife. If this type of travel interests you, it is a must-see. Best time of year is from late October to early April.

336790646.name: Never found this site
336790646.author: a TripAdvisor user
336790646.reviewBody:
The coordinates on the trip advisor map/directions were totally wrong. 😜
It took us to a trash dump in the town of Ensenada. 

I guess you will need to use other directions to find the cave paintings. I think it is actually a number of hours away.

291895139.name: Historic
291895139.author: a TripAdvisor user
291895139.reviewBody: These old rock paintings are losing their lustre, but are still worth the trip to see.  The only other similar paintings that I am familiar with are above Loreto

260894161.name: A glimpse at 10,000 years ago
260894161.author: a TripAdvisor user
260894161.reviewBody: Apparently no one is sure who painted this rock art.  Even the native people who met Spanish explorers in the 1500s claimed no ancestral connection to the artists.  Unlike most cave art in BC, these paintings are only a short distance from the highway, though there is a somewhat steep and slippery climb to reach them.  Beautiful view across the desert from the top, where the cave is located.

609060577.name: Awesome place kids of all ages!
609060577.author: a TripAdvisor user
609060577.reviewBody:
Great place for kids of all ages (I mean ALL ages). I've seen toddlers to seniors having some serious fun here. It is in a warehouse and has ample play space with lots of different zones for various activities. We started coming here when my daughter could barely move and the toddler section was perfect because it is usually off limits to older kids. There are basketball courts, dodgeball, huge trampoline centers, and other activities. They even have a mini compressed air gun activity section. Lots of fun things to do. 

The only reason why this place didn't get the 5 stars is because the staff they have "watching" the kids are usually busy checking their phones or flirting with each other. As a mom who is concerned for her kids' safety, this irked me on more than one occasion. So just keep an eye on your little one and you should be fine. 

Definitely recommend this place for a great time and diverse family fun.

572277818.name: Wear the kids out!
572277818.author: a TripAdvisor user
572277818.reviewBody: You can\'t beat the price or how clean the place is. By the time two hours were done we had hot sweaty kids. There is a nice place for parents to sit & visit or be on the free Wi-Fi as the kids play. So if you have kids of any age (adults can jump too) then make this a stop! Lots of things there to keep them busy.

550330982.name: Jump for Joy!  Fun Family Friendly & Affordable Active Activity!
550330982.author: a TripAdvisor user
550330982.reviewBody: We regularly visit trampoline parks in San Diego, but this one was excellent and CLEAN!  It was so fresh I thought it had just opened.  Located near a Sam\'s Club, Flyers is easy to find and has some parking available in the front.  It is usually open until 9pm so it is a good thing to do in the evenings if you have children.  Or are on a date and need some exercise.  There is a small snack bar in the front with refreshments for purchase.  Check in was easy.  It costs about 105 pesos to jump for an hour.  Small kids likely under 4 of age jump for 79 an hour and there is a great space for them to use.  We had 3 girls 13, 9 and 5.  Everyone was happy and definitely done after an hour.  There were yoga balls, slides, foam pits, and trampolines for our littlest and dodge ball, foam pits, trampolines, etc. for the older ones.  You do have to buy their socks- which are about 45 pesos per pair and are reusable.  Come on a Monday or Tuesday and there are some sort of specials where you can enter 2 for 1 or get a discount.  We would definitely come back and are happy we noticed this while driving by.

494102275.name: Visita al acuario oceanico
494102275.author: a TripAdvisor user
494102275.reviewBody: A unique adventure. Very good assistance in the water, very safe even the surf during the trip is enjoyed.\nVery convenient facilities! \nYou have to like wearing a neoprene suit for an hour

424397532.name: Don\'t Go, Since It\'s Not Opened
424397532.author: a TripAdvisor user
424397532.reviewBody: After visiting Ensenada two years in a row on a Princess Cruise, this attraction is still not ready for tourists.  We couldn\'t find out why. The building looks completed.  We went to the nearby Caracol Museum Exhitibits in stead.

368740509.name: Not open yet. Maybe june 2016
368740509.author: a TripAdvisor user
368740509.reviewBody: Really nothing to say. We ts not open, never has been yet this is top 10 to do in ensenada. Good idea but like many things in Mexico may or may not see light of day. Website is down but phone works.

662751521.name: Fun Museum
662751521.author: a TripAdvisor user
662751521.reviewBody: This was a great place to visit. Our tour guides did great with our lack of knowledge speaking Spanish. They were fun and we learned a lot from all their presentations. Our son loved all the hands on exhibits.

632619575.name: Fun Family Time
632619575.author: a TripAdvisor user
632619575.reviewBody: Very. Lots of hands on things to do. Would be great for families with younger children. Most things in English and Spanish.

625161864.name: Not Very Exciting
625161864.author: a TripAdvisor user
625161864.reviewBody: So far they only have the Salon de Tierra which is about half of the museum open.  I am sure when the Salon del Mar opens up it will be nicer.  As that part is going to have a big aquarium.  For now there is not much to see and not worth paying to go in.

547269532.name: Science Museum with interactive displays and dome theater.
547269532.author: a TripAdvisor user
547269532.reviewBody: This is a museum with science displays.  Many are hands on or interactive.  They showed us a film about Mayan astronomy in English even though there was no show scheduled. I is a short walk from the cruise port and the suggested contribution was $3.50 each.\nThe staff and volunteers were very helpful and friendly.

505913691.name: Beautiful Science museum
505913691.author: a TripAdvisor user
505913691.reviewBody: I came here because I was told it was an aquarium. But, we realized that was not the case. Instead, El Caracol is a Science Museum, perfect for children of all ages. The Museum offers a variety of hand on experiences. My children, age 3 and 5 really enjoyed it. However, because it was still under construction or they were remodeling, we were not able to se le much. Aside from that, what we did see was great.

495861566.name: Good site for children
495861566.author: a TripAdvisor user
495861566.reviewBody: It located just across from the cruise terminal. One exposition is permanent while the other 2 exhibit change. The permanent exhibit is interactive and educational. Kids are entertained and the information bullets are in English/ Spanish.  The cover charge is low. The young staff is helpful and friendly.

424404737.name: Short Walk from Princess Cruise Dock
424404737.author: a TripAdvisor user
424404737.reviewBody: At this time, there are three halls at the Caracol to visit for a small fee:  An Earth Science Center, The Poles (global warming), and Galleon Treasures (which exhibited mainly broken blue and white dishes).  It took less than an hour to visit all three halls which are geared to school children on field trips. In the future, a planetarium will be opened. It is NOT a MUST SEE on a list of things to do in Ensenada.

391588099.name: The major modern museum in Ensenada -- at the right price!
391588099.author: a TripAdvisor user
391588099.reviewBody:
This is a new museum (opened June 2016) focused on the sciences.

The first section to open is on the land.  This is a large, many-technique section taking the visitor from the creation of the earth 4.6 billion years ago, along the path of the development of Baja, the paleontology to modern issues such as the severe water shortage in Baja and new energy needs.

There are some good hands-on exhibits.  Generally, I would suggest this is for kids 6 to 8 to adults.  Not much here for really little kids.

The price is more than right from a visitor's perspective:  general adult admission is 60 pesos ($3.30 as of 7/2016).

There is an interesting exhibit on the Manila Galleon wreck found on the Baja coast.

There is also a temporary exhibit on the sea and one in another location on global warming in the antarctic.

This is not a place for creationism fans or climate change deniers:  the science is pretty clear and presented that way.

The location is right to the right as you leave your cruise ship, or at the south end of the boardwalk area.

Allow about 1-1/2 hours to see most of this.  If you want a bit of good educational experiences along with your Ensenada visit, this is a good one.  Most of the labels and videos are in both Spanish and English.

Watch for the coming sections.

625161417.name: Pretty Statue
625161417.author: a TripAdvisor user
625161417.reviewBody: They are trying to restore this area and add a nice garden.  As of now it\'s just a big statue with a pretty view on the side of a small university.  Not much to see, but something different if you want a nice view of the city.

611943864.name: Nice place
611943864.author: a TripAdvisor user
611943864.reviewBody: Quiet place with a great view of Ensenada. Parking can be a challenge. A taxi ride might be worth it but don\'t expect much.

571963872.name: Absolutely Astonishing Goddess Tara Statue !!!
571963872.author: a TripAdvisor user
571963872.reviewBody: This is a nice quiet place, upgrades were being made during our visit to the garden and surround areas, she is beautiful, she is very nicely preserved, the colors are bright and I love what she represents, it looks kind of accuard due to the location that she is seen from the city but it is really easy to get to. Great place to meditate specially during the early morning.

617133043.name: la mar y las olas.
617133043.author: a TripAdvisor user
617133043.reviewBody: excelente destino para turistas apasionados de las olas y la mar, excelente lugar para practicar el Surf, y el bodyborning en las olas. lugar para acampar, para caminar y para admirar la mar y el viento, y la sal, y ademas cuenta con un excelente restaurante de desayunos, comidas y cenas, eventos sociales, pero su especialidad el Surf. perfecto a nivel mundial, o minimo del pac\u00edfico americano.

address.streetAddress: 99 km off of Tijuana to Ensenada, then off the stand

539224096.name: Muy buena playa para el surfing.
539224096.author: a TripAdvisor user
539224096.reviewBody: Es una buena playa para el surfeo solamente, as\u00ed que si no saben surf o quieren irse a meter nada m\u00e1s, no es recomendable ya que las olas son super fuertes y es peligroso para ni\u00f1os y tambi\u00e9n para adultos.

address.streetAddress: 99 km off of Tijuana to Ensenada, then off the stand

420381172.name: Reserva de surf
420381172.author: a TripAdvisor user
420381172.reviewBody:
Si te gusta el surf, este lugar te va encantar; si hay viento del Noroeste prepárate para divertirte como nunca con una derecha perfecta, fondo de arrecife y piedra, esta playa te ofrece sanitario, regaderas y un exelente vista, aparte de ser playa también cuenta con una zona de vivienda con un diseño entre colonial y californiano; es una zona semiárida, rodeado de yucas, con un lindo arroyo que desemboca en el mar, en temporada de lluvia ese arroyo crece de forma significativa.
Por esta linda playa atraviesa la famosa falla geológica de San Andrés, por lo que el trabajo de remodelación es constante.

Durante el año, la playa es sede de varios torneos de surf, tanto nacionales, internacionales o conmemorativos a hermanos surfers que partieron antes que nosotros. Es una buena opción para acampar o buscar la opción de airbnb. Una lugar 100% familiar, espacio para andar en bicicleta o tirar la caña a la orilla del mar.

address.streetAddress: 99 km off of Tijuana to Ensenada, then off the stand

651055059.name: Ruiz av in Ensenada
651055059.author: a TripAdvisor user
651055059.reviewBody:
Referred to as "gringo gulch" by some. 
As a 42 year American resident of Ensenada reject that very derrogetary name.
Ruiz av where it intersects with 1st street is  home to Hussongs bar and a couple other bars. Frequented by criuse ship visitors that want to drink more.  Ruiz crosses 2nd st. More unsavory Bars and
Is area to stay away from. Continue on Ruiz are businesses the locals frequent. Sears, banks, clothing.
Nothing of interest to cruise ship 
People.

624814030.name: Shopping Mecca
624814030.author: a TripAdvisor user
624814030.reviewBody: When a cruise ship is in port, this street is filled with sidewalk vendors, tourists shops, cafes, and people.  However, if you go before mid-day when the cruise tours are over and folks flood this area,  you can enjoy the architecture, stop in to one of two regional museums, and find your special souvenir without too much trouble. As there are park benches along Ave. Ruiz, you can indulge in people watching.

572559824.name: Sushi
572559824.author: a TripAdvisor user
572559824.reviewBody: We have visited this sushi bar 4 times, first visit the fish was fresh, sushi chef entertaining .... good. Tonight, we could not eat any items we ordered. To be fair, they comped our food and only charged for our drinks. The manager admitted they had a problem with their suppliers. So why were still serving this rotten excuse for SUSHI??

481055389.name: Main tourist street in Ensenada
481055389.author: a TripAdvisor user
481055389.reviewBody:
Just got back from bringing visiting Australian relatives down to Ensenada for the day.  It was mid week but the Carnival cruise ship was in port so the downtown street was active.  All the shops have pretty much the same merchandise and fight for your business.  

Decide what you want, ask for the beset price and then move along.  As you leave, prices will get lower and you have a better spot to negotiate from.  

For food, we usually walk from here to the dock area and eat at one of the seafood restaurants on the dock.  For drinks, Hussongs is still my favorite place.  Old fashioned bar with reasonably priced drinks.

442490680.name: NOTHING IF IMPORTANCE HERE BUT MAYBE BANKS
442490680.author: a TripAdvisor user
442490680.reviewBody: Walked one end to the other and didn\'t find a singe store of true interest. Couple of ATM machines that you might need in a pinch

436933326.name: Gringo Gulch
436933326.author: a TripAdvisor user
436933326.reviewBody: Main downtown strip where all the cruise ship touristas go. A few decent restaurants, and blocks and blocks of the SAME blankets, tee shirts, leather beer can holders and souvenirs. \nBeen there. Done that

389963280.name: Shops during the day and clubs by night
389963280.author: a TripAdvisor user
389963280.reviewBody: I asked my friend to take us here to Avenida Ruiz. He told me cruise ships weren\u2019t there so it would be dead. He said he\u2019d take us when the cruise ships docked. It was a vast difference in the area. With or without the cruise ships, this street really didn\u2019t have it happening.

380702874.name: It\'s where the people are
380702874.author: a TripAdvisor user
380702874.reviewBody: There were a lot of travelers in the area, which made for a pretty rowdy scene. I think you should be careful in them, they probably water down the drinks and my credit card was stolen out of my purse somehow. Just be on your guard.

374301666.name: Only The First Block Is Worth Visiting
374301666.author: a TripAdvisor user
374301666.reviewBody: Ruiz is more of a local street and not geared towards the tourists.  One the first block between 1st and 2nd street is worth visiting.  That is where you will find the bigger clubs and also Hussongs the oldest bar in the Baja.  From 2nd to 5th street are stores for locals like clothing, shoes, eyeglass shops, and things like that.  Nothing interesting at all.  After 5th street there is nothing on the street.  Mostly houses and a few local business\'s.

367396588.name: Bathroom stop
367396588.author: a TripAdvisor user
367396588.reviewBody: This is where the cruise ship shuttle drops you off to either go on a local tour or to walk around downtown Ensenada.  The best bathroom stops I ever have in a tourist spot in Mexico.  There are shops and drinks close by.

326944539.name: Avenida Ruiz--Great!
326944539.author: a TripAdvisor user
326944539.reviewBody: We walked up and down around Avenida Ruiz--very interesting!  So many, many Mexican people and so many, many "tourists."

300519754.name: Nice place to spend an afternoon and evening.
300519754.author: a TripAdvisor user
300519754.reviewBody: Lots of small shops and bars for an afternoon relax and a couple of Margaritas. Especially Cantina Hussong\'s is worth a visit in the evening.

252660053.name: Hussongs
252660053.author: a TripAdvisor user
252660053.reviewBody: This is the place the locals all gravitate too. Fun atmosphere lots of bands lots of drinks! Lots of travelers filling the streets good for the economy.

237081124.name: Okay, but to much merchant pressure
237081124.author: a TripAdvisor user
237081124.reviewBody: Walking down this street is difficult because the merchants are out in full force trying to get you inside to buy. You can\'t just walk down it casually without being harassed.   They are at times rude and not very nice if you don\'t go into their shop.  I heard a few not so nice comments if you decline.

234094395.name: THE NIGHT LIFE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
234094395.author: a TripAdvisor user
234094395.reviewBody: I ENJOY the niGHTLIFE area HERE. Hussongs and Papa\'s and beer are extended stays when i visit. ONCE THE Carnival cruisers leave, this place becomes what is truly is, a NIGHT LIFE SPOT!. Its not big, but lots going on here.  many live music areas.  dont be afraid to rub shoulders w the locals. As long as U show respect, and dont show ur rump, U will be just fine!

223671549.name: Lots to see, very colorful and representative of Mexican Art
223671549.author: a TripAdvisor user
223671549.reviewBody: Avenida Ruiz is very close to the cruise ship port and caters to those visitors on days the ships are in.  They are also open other days where if you are visiting Ensenada, they tend to bargain more with you than on cruise ship days.  It used to be worth the drive to go to La Bufadora for many of the same items offered on Avenida Ruiz, at a lower price.  But since La Bufadora is closing for renovation, Avenida Ruiz is the spot to go for a great time shopping in Ensenada, lots of mariachis, colorful shops, good restaurants and margaritas... Mexican culture abounds.

218730382.name: EXPENSIVE
218730382.author: a TripAdvisor user
218730382.reviewBody: Again, Carnival cruisers crowd out the rest of us.  The prices for food are high, the products were high and vendors may not negotiate.

192243747.name: Worth a visit when in Ensenada
192243747.author: a TripAdvisor user
192243747.reviewBody: A lot to see - small shops, food stalls, restaurants, street enrtertainment and much much more !\nNot too far from Hussong\'s Cantina a rustic bar over 100 years in business. Well poured drinks and quick service. Prices very reasonable. Strolling Mariachis and Trios. A visit that  I will not miss on my next visit to Ensenada !

189543122.name: Mango Mango is no more :-(
189543122.author: a TripAdvisor user
189543122.reviewBody:
We have been here soo many times, I can't even count them all... and after all the trinket shopping is done, we would always end up at the Mango Mango on the corner. 
However, we were here again around December 10th, and Mango Mango has been replaced with Papas & Beer. (they used to be accross the street)

The beer and food prices have increased dramatically, the atmosphere has gone to crap, and the amazing guacamole made table side is now gone!!  :-(

184528636.name: Nightlife and some Restaurants
184528636.author: a TripAdvisor user
184528636.reviewBody: This is where most of the bars are, you can find from a very old Cantina called Hussong\'s to a nightclub called Lutzenkirch. It is very easy to pub crawl, most of the time there is no cover. My favorite is Ultramarino, where you can find the famous oyster shots. There are also some Restaurants like Mahi-Mahi (Very good seafood) or Temaky (Japanese). Very nice environment, a couple of different choices.

166618671.name: GREAT SHOPPING IN THE OLD TOWN OF ENSENAD
166618671.author: a TripAdvisor user
166618671.reviewBody:
Avenida Ruiz is the main drag  in the tourist section of Ensenada. Here you will find many mid-priced trinkets and souveniers in and old town atmosphere. Also located in this area, are the important hot spots for young people such as Papas and Beer and others. When the ships are in or on a holiday weekend, the town is bubbling with excitement. This is a good venue for young and mature alike as well as older children. 
The locals are always polite, asking you once to enter their shop and not badgering you if you decline. On Avenida Ruiz you can buy such things as leather goods, silver jewelry, tee shirts, swim suits, dresses and objects de arte. Personally I would stay away from the art. And although there is lots of silver around, bring or ask the patron for a magnet when checking for authenticity. Prices are good and you can usually bargain with the seller. The area is very safe for tourists as there is a high level of police presence.
This area also has a few nice cafes and restaurants that cater to the tourist trade, serving above average cuisine. 
At night the shops close and it's party time. Enjoy !!!!

142832988.name: Nightlife
142832988.author: a TripAdvisor user
142832988.reviewBody: Great bars and food. Be sure to go to Hussong\'s Cantina and the taco shop right next door. The best in the city!

142514343.name: it look fun
142514343.author: a TripAdvisor user
142514343.reviewBody: Lopez Mateo and Ruiz is home of Papa and beer and Mango Mango.\nWe didn\'t go in there but it look so fun. Oct 7 afternoon, it was fill with people. I was sure they were having a great time. party people should try:)

121163343.name: Where all the tourists go
121163343.author: a TripAdvisor user
121163343.reviewBody: Hussongs, Mango Mango, Papas and Beer.  Ruiz is the heart of the Ensenada tourist zone.  Every American ends up here.  A treat is the Mexican side of Papas and Beer with pretty senoritas singing along with the Mexican pop.  But for my taste head father afield and discover the real Mexico, the real Ensenada.

3510790.name: Exploring beyond the Tourist Zone
3510790.author: a TripAdvisor user
3510790.reviewBody:
After shopping along Lopez Mateos you will come across Mango Mango, a popular restaurant/bar, at the corner of Ruiz. Heading into the city on Ruiz is Hussong's Cantina and more shopping. There is also a large department store called Dorians. In the smaller stores you may be asked to check any bags near the door (this is done to reduce shoplifting). Also be careful where you step since the sidewalks may not be as well maintained.

After four blocks Ruiz will intersect with the large Avenida Juarez which is where many of the locals shop for cheaper prices. When crossing busy intersections you should wait for the green light. The best streets to walk between Avenida Juarez and Lopez Mateos are either Ruiz and Gastellum. The other streets are OK, however there is not much to look at. I recommend avoiding walking down Miramar, which gets rather seedy after a block or two.

558401411.name: Continued great quality and Friendly service...
558401411.author: a TripAdvisor user
558401411.reviewBody: I first visited the fine winery approximately  three years ago and found the quality of wines to be well above average of the newer wineries production. It was a great surprise to see Roberto (an old friend from another producer) at the wine bar. As always a very friendly and knowledgeable host. Wines were as usual very good and better than many of the newer smaller producers. I highly recommend  that you visit this producer if you tend to like quality above commonality.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Tecate Ensenada 5 Wine Route, Valle de Guadalupe

490376563.name: Great wine, great time!
490376563.author: a TripAdvisor user
490376563.reviewBody: We stopped by Vinas de la Erre as part of my birthday wine tour. I really loved the blended white. The tasting area is a large open area under a very large metal structure that is attached to the wine facility. It is very nice when it is hot outside, plenty of shade. They also have individual shaded areas to enjoy your wine with the views of the vineyard and the valley. Overall, a very nice stop on a tour of the valley.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Tecate Ensenada 5 Wine Route, Valle de Guadalupe

440458189.name: Wine Tasting in Mexico Baja California
440458189.author: a TripAdvisor user
440458189.reviewBody: This is my second visit in the last few months to Baja. We adore the wine scene here. This is my first time visiting Vi\u00f1as De La ERRE and definitely not my last. This is a very beautiful vineyard situated on a golden sandy rock background. Perfect location for a wedding for sure. Beautiful scenery beautiful mountain views. The wines are simply amazing and the pourer was very pleasant and attentive.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Tecate Ensenada 5 Wine Route, Valle de Guadalupe

427679104.name: Magnificent Addition to the Valley
427679104.author: a TripAdvisor user
427679104.reviewBody: We stopped by here last weekend to sample some wine, and were splendidly surprised.  The views were splendid and the staff quite friendly.  The Mezcla Bordaless stood out with fantastic taste and a robust body.  The Sauvignon blanc was dry, fruity & delicious.  Don\'t pass them by!  Worth the stop!\n

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Tecate Ensenada 5 Wine Route, Valle de Guadalupe

390116336.name: Fabulous family owned boutique winery producing elegant well-structured wines
390116336.author: a TripAdvisor user
390116336.reviewBody: The winery is known for its big reds that are well balanced, soft on the palette and can be enjoyed all year round. The tasting room is conveniently located along the Ruta del Vino and provides panoramic views of the Valle de Guadalupe.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Tecate Ensenada 5 Wine Route, Valle de Guadalupe

326099682.name: Dia De Los Muertos
326099682.author: a TripAdvisor user
326099682.reviewBody:
As the title says. We went to this Vine yard for their day of the dead wine tasting/food truck event.
The scenery was gorgeous. The area where we were situated was clean and offered a great view of this vineyard and others in the area.
Although it wasn't as large as last years event (as we were told by some people we went with). It seems that we all had an enjoyable time trying various wines from this vineyard and trying the food trucks.
We would definitely return.
Unfortunately I have no photos, they're all on my wife's camera.

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Tecate Ensenada 5 Wine Route, Valle de Guadalupe

275331658.name: My favorite winery in Guadalupe Valley!
275331658.author: a TripAdvisor user
275331658.reviewBody: This was my third visit to the wine country outside Ensenada, Mexico. I have found my favorite winery! Great personal service from the wine maker/owner, Ernesto Rocha, who took such pride in the making of the wine, sharing about the history and background of Vinas De La Erre. A beautiful sauviogn Blanc and Cabernet Sauviogn that I had to buy to bring home! \n\nBeautiful facilities, not pretentious or commercialized like some of the larger wineries. Perfect for a group of friends to share a bottle and take in the views of the valley. The owner and staff are bilingual and were so gracious in answering our million questions about wine making and all the great things to do in the area. Highly recommend this winery for a visit in Guadolupe Valley! My new favorite winery!

address.streetAddress: Otro Carretera Tecate Ensenada 5 Wine Route, Valle de Guadalupe

677418589.name: Excellent place to visit
677418589.author: a TripAdvisor user
677418589.reviewBody: Don\'t buy any food near inside the market, expensive and unhealthy.  Wait until the end of the street to park, don\'t believe the people stand in the road, there are a lot of parking near the entrance

676165229.name: Flea market/ Blowhole
676165229.author: a TripAdvisor user
676165229.reviewBody: Didn\u2019t care for the Flea Market. The views of the ocean and blowhole was amazing! Too bad we had to walk through the flea market to get there.

676139508.name: Awesome place to see
676139508.author: a TripAdvisor user
676139508.reviewBody: This was a cool little excursion for our day in ensenada.  The Open Air market was cool we got nice and wet from La bufadora and we had really great tacos.  I also had my first pina colada in a pineapple.  Just make sure you learn the art of the haggle with the shopkeepers and you too could walk away with a Burberry purse for cheap well a fake one anyway

675006744.name: Fun flea market
675006744.author: a TripAdvisor user
675006744.reviewBody: The actual blow hole is underwhelming but the flea market you walk through to get to it is a blast. If you go make sure to stop and have lunch at Lidia\u2019s Tacos! Amazing food~especially the lobster tacos\ud83d\ude00 it is located at the beginning of the flea market.

674292776.name: Enjoyed the day
674292776.author: a TripAdvisor user
674292776.reviewBody: Shopping and sight seeing, enjoyed our time \n\nLots of vendors! Enjoyed eating food from various stands.

671883155.name: Worth the Trip
671883155.author: a TripAdvisor user
671883155.reviewBody: Such a natural wonder, that I was really disappointed to see how thronged with touristy shops and the tourist gauntlet that you have to go through to even reach La Bufadora.  However, it was worth the journey.  It impressed us all.

671479961.name: Anniversary cruise
671479961.author: a TripAdvisor user
671479961.reviewBody: We took a bus from the port to here. We then walked through the market to get to the Blowhole. No one really moved so that others could look. You had to pay if you needed a restroom. Once you started your walk back through the market again you just felt overwhelmed by the people. You couldn\u2019t just look without feeling pressure to buy and some were very pushy. I was very disappointed in how you couldn\u2019t go to the site without going through this area.

670273761.name: Nice place to visit.
670273761.author: a TripAdvisor user
670273761.reviewBody:
Booked the La Bufadora Adventure through the cruiseline on our recent trip and we were not disappointed. The one option that we picked to go with included 1.5 hours here to explore on your own.

Be advised the restrooms are not free, you will need to pay 50-75 cents to use them.

You first have to navigate through a flea market type set up to get to the geyser.  Vendors have all types of items for sale and many offer samples of food and drink.  Pina Coladas, candies etc.  Our guide recommended tacos for one of two places, and I can say they were the best I’ve ever had.  Anything here In the states is now a joke compared to the tacos in Ensenada. We had them from a sit down restaurant close to where the bus parked.

The blow hole or geyser was not yet crowded, I think ours was the first tour to arrive that morning.  It is about 50-60 minute bus ride to get out to it, but the scenic ocean views are amazing. The water erupted a few times we were there.  I have heard people complain of the crowds before, but go early and you will have no problems.

670002292.name: Tourist Trap, But You Knew That Going In
670002292.author: a TripAdvisor user
670002292.reviewBody: Fun place to visit but a long walk from the parking to the blowhole.  It cost 50 to 75 cents to use the restrooms, no free restrooms at all.  The blowhole is the 2nd largest in the world but is best visited when the sea is choppy. The day that we were there the spout was about 75 feet but it can go to over 200 if the ocean is active.

669912308.name: The famous blowhole
669912308.author: a TripAdvisor user
669912308.reviewBody: I took a cruise to Ensenada and then took a tour bus to La Bufadora. The bus ride out to La Bufadora was beautiful and had lots of scenary. The blow hole itself is beautiful to watch and the surrounding environment is gorgeous. One of the bonuses of visiting is to get to the blow hole you have to walk through a little market that has lots of food, drinks, and items for sale so you get a taste of the local culture. I enjoyed my experience and I\'m glad I went.

668745632.name: Gotta Go
668745632.author: a TripAdvisor user
668745632.reviewBody: One of three in the world, ya gotta go. More commercial than the one in Australia, but you\u2019ve got to see it. Nature is pretty spectacular. Bonus tip, as you round the last corner the bay comes into view, take the first parking lot. It\u2019s the upper grass lot. Head to the south east corner and you\u2019ll see a walking path. Head down that until it hits a dirt road and follow that to the upper view area. It offers the best view of the bufadora without ant of the crowds. You also get to avoid the vendors and the crowds on the road the lower view area. It\u2019s a 10 minute walk, shorter than the vendor walk, offers great views of the bay, super cacti and some stunning flowers. Enjoy.

667047391.name: The Blowhole at La Bufadora is a must see in Ensenada
667047391.author: a TripAdvisor user
667047391.reviewBody:
Go see the Blowhole if you ever visit the La Bufadora in Ensenada. The blowhole spews a water stream every few minutes so you get lots of photo ops. Beautiful views. The only issue is that you have to walk by hundreds of people that are trying to sell you stuff/goods just to get to and from the blowhole. The good news is you just have to politely say no and keep moving. You have to pay if you want to use the bathroom. When I stopped by a shop for some tequila tasting they let me use the bathroom for free in the hope that I was going to buy some tequila. On the walk to the Blowhole the vendors will give you small samples of pina colada and churros to taste with the hope that you would buy some when you return back from viewing the blowhole. We ordered some open shell clams that were filled with shrimp and cheese from the last vendor on the right, just before you get to the blowhole sight. The food was good but the margarita wasn't as strong as I would have liked but the flavor was good. 

We visited La Bufadora as part of a Carnival Imagination Cruise excursion in which a tour guide picked us up from the ship, gave us an Ensenada history tour on the way to La Bufadora and safely returned us to the ship. 

La Bufadora and the blowhole are a must see if you visit Ensenada. The drive to La Bufadora is also very scenic.

665357116.name: Great little adventure
665357116.author: a TripAdvisor user
665357116.reviewBody: We drove from Ensenada, it was easy to find and a short drive. There are plenty of people selling parking for $3. You need/get to walk through a flee market to get to the blowhole. There is no fee at the blowhole, just parking. It was impressive and fun to watch the water. The market was also fun and had everything you\'d expect. They took pesos or dollars. I would go again

664895616.name: Simply Beautiful
664895616.author: a TripAdvisor user
664895616.reviewBody: My wife and I took a  Day trip  Here. Great place to visit especially when the tide is high in the blowhole is really active.\nPlenty of food is offered for sale here lots of souvenirs and the most amazing views of the Pacific Ocean. If you are driving it only cost 40 pesos to park all day and to visit  La Bufadora there\'s a Small fee.  Well worth the trip just for the  Views of Encenada a in the distance any the beautiful waters of the bay along the way. \n

664232788.name: La Bufadora
664232788.author: a TripAdvisor user
664232788.reviewBody: Had a great time with friends. Good weather and good food. Amazing view. This place has grown so much in the last twenty years.

662837853.name: Quick getaway
662837853.author: a TripAdvisor user
662837853.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I took a cruise to Ensenada and when we arrived there we took a tour to La Bufadora and it was amazing to see. To get there you need to go through the open market and to get amazing tacos you need to get them from Lida\u2019s and there is two locations in the La Bufadora area.

662091884.name: Blowhole was spectacular - Tacos at Tacos Lidia were AMAZING!
662091884.author: a TripAdvisor user
662091884.reviewBody: To get to the blowhole (La Bufadora), you need to pass through an open-air market with many vendors, all trying to get your attention to sell you whatever they have.  There\'s a lot of choices, and many of them quite good.  We were lucky enough to be here at a higher tide time, and the blowhole put on a spectacular show.  \nDefinitely not to be missed though is Tacos Lidia at the beginning of the shops - it\'s off to the side where the buses park, and the food is fresh, flavorful, and some of the best tacos I\'ve ever had.

661938515.name: La Bufadora
661938515.author: a TripAdvisor user
661938515.reviewBody: My husband and I took our kids here to visit for the first time. It was nice to see their reaction as they went through this experience that we went through when we were young.

660944045.name: Popular Place To Visit In Ensenada Mexico
660944045.author: a TripAdvisor user
660944045.reviewBody: My wife and I visited this place twice through cruise ship when we dock in Ensenada Mexico. Lot\'s of stores, gift shops and restaurant around the area. Food are good, just pick the one that is cheap. Because they are all the same taste anyway. We went to a $1 tacos which is really good. And the churros, don\'t buy to the restaurant, buy to the people with a small stand because it\'s really good and cheaper.

660455600.name: Cool place
660455600.author: a TripAdvisor user
660455600.reviewBody: the blow hole is very cool. There is lots of things to buy in the shops. They are ALL trying to get your money. Make sure you begin with them.

659890315.name: Natural Wonder, But Prepare For The Attack Of The Vendors
659890315.author: a TripAdvisor user
659890315.reviewBody: This is about a 40 minute ride from downtown.  It\u2019s a must see if you are in the area, but keep your expectations in check.  If the tide and wave action is high, you will get a memorable sight.  The waves crash into the coast, you can hear the water pressure building, and you see the spray out the other side.  There is plenty of area for viewing, but you can\u2019t actually see where it comes from \u2013 just the spray which can be anywhere from 20-40 feet high, up to as much as a 100 feet.  The only downside is you have to walk though a gauntlet of shops/stalls with people hawking basically the same tourist junk you see everywhere in Mexico.  There are several restaurants where you can eat, some with great views of the ocean.  If you are going to buy something, just remember NEVER accept the first price.  If you are willing to walk away, you be amazed how much the cost comes down with just a few steps.

657916166.name: If you like souvenir shopping it could be OK
657916166.author: a TripAdvisor user
657916166.reviewBody:
That part we most disliked was walking through the long gauntlet of shops and getting yelled at from both sides to come look at their goods.  Many were too aggressive of sales people for my taste.  If this atmosphere bothers you, I suggest you stay away.  We'll never go back.  If you like type of shopping you'll have fun and the selection of things to buy is good.

Once you get down the shop lined path which is at least 200 yards long, you will arrive at the main attraction, the blow hole.  The day we were there the seas had it working pretty good and we enjoyed that part, though it was pretty crowded with other spectators.

Overall the interesting positive experience of seeing the blow hole was not worth the negatives of the long drive and having to walk through the annoying vendors, at least not to us.  Knowing what to expect you can decide if it sounds fun to you.

657894341.name: Check the wave action in town before you head out there...
657894341.author: a TripAdvisor user
657894341.reviewBody:
The trip out there from town is kind of a schlep.  On the day we went, the ocean was very calm and the bufadora wasn't boofing at all.  

The zillions of curio vendors are fun, and the thrill of getting to pay $.75 Americano to take a leak cannot, of course, be overstated.

Good fun anyway, but don't get your hopes up for serious boofing on a calm day.

656948500.name: Good time
656948500.author: a TripAdvisor user
656948500.reviewBody: Enjoyable experience , shopping, fun looking around, good food, entertainment, family friendly, beautiful environment

656881250.name: Fun to see at the tourist trap
656881250.author: a TripAdvisor user
656881250.reviewBody: Part of the fun is passing through all of the tourist trap vendors and seeing all of their wares.  The Bufadora gave us a good show and yes we paid $5 pesos to use the bano.

656113861.name: Worth the detour if it\'s on your way
656113861.author: a TripAdvisor user
656113861.reviewBody: The drive from the main road to the beach is not long--about 3k--but it is pretty rugged. We had a 4-wheel drive vehicle, but the other folks who we met there had a regular car, so 4-wheel drive is not necessary. It was fun to see the sea lions lazing on the beach, through the collapsed roof of the cave.

654617628.name: Overall Good, could of been much better!
654617628.author: a TripAdvisor user
654617628.reviewBody:
Overall our trip to La Buffardo was worth while. There was some major disappointments. I understand that it's Mexico and there are some basic luxuries that are absent but it kind of was ridiculous. We came from a cruise ship I would not recommend booking your excursion through the ship because you pay triple we walked off the cruise ship hopped on a bus paid $4 per person then went to downtown where we book the 2 were which was $17 per person down to La Buffadora.  The bus was nice enough and the tour guide was pretty good she did make some strange jokes about America which I felt were kind of like jabs saying look at those American standing outside of home depot waiting for work obviously not the case. Lebouf adores clearly a tourist trap designed to try to rip people off to buy junk from China which was disappointing.  We were hoping to really get a sample of the local culture however it was more like a flea market of junk and pushy merchants.

You weave your way through the streets and your letter by our tour guide which clearly has set this up to visit certain vendors and to promote their goods which I can understand the pina Colada drinks or delicious the charoses were good but all overpriced which again was disappointing. 

I was with kids and I felt safe the whole time however the merchants were very pushy and of course we ended up by in some small Knick knacks such as the guitar and some toys which were from China and the merchants lied about making from hand. Would you actually get down to the blowhole it really is nice and something to see but you have to go through the tourist traps of merchants.

Members of my party clearly had to use the restrooms and they charged 50 cents per person even the baby I was carrying. The explanation I got from the tour guide was they didn't have running water so it justified them charging for the bathrooms but over all I just didn't feel like I could trust anything they were saying because of the blatant lies that I had heard for most anything. 

 We did stop at Habana banana and got the family package which costs over a $100 to have a meet and greet with the baby lions and Tigers. I felt it was worth it because when's the last time you were able to do that in the States and so we thoroughly enjoyed that I wouldn't do it every time in of course these told us it was 10 minutes in I was more close to 3 to 4 minutes that you got to be there with the the animals themself. 

The highlight of the trip was at the very end of the merchants and they had a clam filled with shrimp and cheese 2 of them were $8 which was delicious and the baby Tigers along with the blow hole itself. 

A worthwhile visit I Would recommend going I just wouldn't mess around with any of the merchants and don't expect to be blown away by the experience. 

If these merchants would just understand that if they offered quality products and were honest with there dealings they would end of making more money. I felt like they were just trying to RIP off every Tourist and milk them for every dollar they could. Bad Business Model.

652725843.name: amazing place
652725843.author: a TripAdvisor user
652725843.reviewBody: admittedly getting to it can be a challenge navigating between hundreds of stalls , but it worth the walk to see it blow

652295313.name: La Bufadora Tour
652295313.author: a TripAdvisor user
652295313.reviewBody: What an amazing experience!  Benjie, our tour guide was quite informative with a great sense of humor.  We learned that there are only 3 Blowholes of this magnitude in the world, La Bufadora in Mexico, Australia & Hawaii.

652143672.name: Wonderful
652143672.author: a TripAdvisor user
652143672.reviewBody: It\'s great, But We\'re more interested in the hand-painting artist there and had our own art pieces to bring home.

651916906.name: Cruise to Ensenada
651916906.author: a TripAdvisor user
651916906.reviewBody: Had a great time! We didnt buy the package thru the ship. Instead we took the bus to place and bought a combo pack. Blow hole, shopping,  and horse back riding for 1/3 of the price! Had a great tour guide Gustavo! Told great stories! Walk us thru all the shopping and made sure we were all ok! We had a blast then he took us horse back riding on the beach!

651294280.name: typical Mexico tourist destination
651294280.author: a TripAdvisor user
651294280.reviewBody: La Bufadora is one of the places that is frequented by the many cruise ship passengers  that visit Ensenada....and it caters to them. Typical of many places in Mexico, there is a charge to use the \u201cpublic\u201d bathrooms and a charge for parking. After parking, to get to the blowhole you must pass through a long row of venders giving away free samples and selling souvenirs, food, cigars, clothes, etc. The venders were polite but they obviously are trying to attract business so they can appear pushy.
