The blowhole itself is not very impressive, but maybe it depends on the day that you visit as to just how impressive it is.

649761801.name: High waterspout
649761801.author: a TripAdvisor user
649761801.reviewBody: If you like waterspout, this one takes an 80\'-100\' prize.  It blows with every high swell from the ocean. To get there you\'ll need to pass by a long street of food, liquor, and craft vendor\'s stalls, but they were well behaved if you said not interested. Toilets cost about one US dollar.

646476014.name: Bufadora
646476014.author: a TripAdvisor user
646476014.reviewBody: It would be a really nice experience if you didn\u2019t have to walk through the rows of people selling trinkets to get to it.

646379116.name: atractivo no 1 de ensenada
646379116.author: a TripAdvisor user
646379116.reviewBody: churros pi\u00f1a coladas yumi yumi recomendada la visita\nnice nice you visit the blow hole the more persons in the ship  visit this site

645803633.name: Natural Ocean Blowhole View
645803633.author: a TripAdvisor user
645803633.reviewBody: Took a scenic drive to the this coastal place to check out the natural sea blowhole.  \nAfter arriving we stopped and had some awesome shrimp tacos at the first taco stand to the right side of the alley as you head down towards the blowhole.  Also lots of local people with souvenirs and different items to check out along the way.  Lastly the blowhole was spectacular and enjoyed sitting around the place listening to the sea eruption and taking in the coastal views.

644833135.name: Not worth the drive
644833135.author: a TripAdvisor user
644833135.reviewBody: A long drive out of Ensenada to watch the ocean crash into rocks and spit back out. The views are nice, so it wasn\'t a complete waste of time

644221154.name: A fun excursion....beautiful views, shopping, food and a blowhole!
644221154.author: a TripAdvisor user
644221154.reviewBody:
The blowhole was very active on our visit and gave quite a show. We were told it is the second largest in the world. The views were breathtaking.  We were fortunate to capture a rainbow photo during one of the blows.

We enjoyed the long market street.   It was quite crowded with tourists.  A fish taco is a must to complete the experience.  

I would recommend a visit to this unusual site.

643673991.name: The Real "Fish Taco"
643673991.author: a TripAdvisor user
643673991.reviewBody:
The ocean is beautiful and views are inspiring.

Traveled with grandmother and child(8).  

Taco Cantina (5 star rating) First, you must eat the fish, shrimp, carne or any of the tacos at the small cantina on the right side prior to entering the marketplace.  All food is well seasoned, all salsas are fresh, and tortillas are made while you wait.  Each taco price ranges from $1.50-$2.00 dollars, U.S. monies.  Although other taco vendors are within the marketplace, none of them, out-cuisine this one.  

Steamed clams with shrimp are at the end of the marketplace nearer the blowhole. Churros are along the pathway. Purchase churros from vendors that prepare in front of you. Why? Fresher and authentic ingredients.

Essential information to know:
Restrooms are $1.00 everywhere within the La Bufadora marketplace.  You will receive toilet paper. Restrooms are typically clean/sanitized with soap and water.  However, take your hand sanitizer along with you.

Take cash and avoid using credit/debit card.  I had 8 stacks of mixed bills in $20.00 increments with the money on my person rather than backpack/purse.  I felt completely safe, but as a tourist, I even caution against fellow tourists.

Weather was about 60 degrees and brillant sun shine. We had on light jackets and thin long sleeve shirts. Too warm for hat, scarf, gloves and other un-necessities. We enjoyed the marketplace 
11-2 p.m.

It is a marketplace and hustlers are all along the pathway. Rather than becoming irritable or repeating yourself, just smize (smile with your eyes) and keep walking.  The vendors just talk and bargain and are used to tourists ignoring them. Just, ignore with kindness. Many of the vendors are English and of course Spanish speaking. They all speak "cash."  

Tips to keep the kiddos engaged: 
I taught my daughter a few Spanish phrases to practice. I then taught her the 3 keys to bargaining when she wanted a neon backpack and not to accept first deal.  She mind as well practice early. Business transactions occur at all ages.In fact, she bargained the beautiful marble dominoes on my behalf. True, she impressed me. She then had to take 10 pictures (her own camera) and then create a collage of her experience at the end of the day.  

The blowhole was not active this day. More of blow-flatulence.

643639397.name: Open market is worth its experience
643639397.author: a TripAdvisor user
643639397.reviewBody: Shore excursion with our cruise @Carnival , This La Bufadora and open market blew our minds. A must experience. You must try the street food if you are not too stomach sensitive. BBQ\'d clams were something to cherish for along with Gallons of Pina Coladas.

643577047.name: A nice alternative to the bars in Ensenada while at port
643577047.author: a TripAdvisor user
643577047.reviewBody: La Bufadora itself is nothing to necessarily write home about, but the excursion as a whole is a good way to spend the afternoon.  The bus ride to La Bufadora is a little long, but there are plenty of sights along the way - especially as you near the coast.  While some may not like the gauntlet of vendors between the parking lot and La Bufadora, it does offer a lot of unique shopping and food options.  And the tequila tasting was a nice distraction.  When you reach the water spout it can be very crowded, but as long as the tide is up you will see the water shoot into the air.  And the snorting sound is pretty hard to miss as well.  For a low cost on-shore excursion, especially with a group, I would recommend this.  Not the only thing to do in Ensenada, but if you go there more than once than this should be on your todo list.

642579599.name: Amazing
642579599.author: a TripAdvisor user
642579599.reviewBody: What a fabulous experience. The day we visited the blow hole was very active. Sat and watched it for over an hour. Lovely experience. This is why have given 5 stars.  However Did not enjoy the constant hassle from traders as you walked to and from the blow hole. If they left you alone we would have browsed and bought some things but they continually bothered you. Was also dismayed and shocked to see lion and tiger cubs in a small enclosure in a bar!!!! This is a disgrace!!! This part of the experience I would give 0.

642548502.name: tourist trap
642548502.author: a TripAdvisor user
642548502.reviewBody: While the bufadora was amazing,  20 minutes of running the tourist gauntlet sales was maybe not worth it. An hour drive from Ensenada.

640769930.name: Skip getting off the boat in Ensanada Alltogether
640769930.author: a TripAdvisor user
640769930.reviewBody: It made me choose a rating or I would have left it blank.  We took the Carnival Cruise, Splendor, excursion to Bufadora but our boat did not get in until 3pm. The tour group took us to a boring old Casino for over an hour and then the 45 min drive to Bufadora meant we arrived after dark. We did not see anything of the spout since it was dark but that was not even the bad part.  The bad part was the scary vendors in their garbage swap meet that harrassed us and there were no restrooms that were working.  Our tour guide said we could use the restroom at what looked like the only clean restaurant but they closed the restroom due to backed up sewage. So he took us to place making some kind of Mexican food on a grill and talked them into letting use use their restroom, but that bathroom had no soap, no lights and no and did not flush Thank heavens we did not buy food there like they said we had to to use the bathroom. The vendors were scary and the stuff they sell is the same made in a Mexican or Chinese factory that you can get at the little shops right on the pier when you get off the boat. If you insist on getting off the boat avoid the excursions I heard everyone complaining about them.

640417338.name: It doesn\'t take long to wait
640417338.author: a TripAdvisor user
640417338.reviewBody: It took nearly 45 minutes to drive to the La Bufadora \'Blow Hole\' site, but you only have to wait less than a minute to see the \'Blow Hole\' performance!  But, the drive is worthwhile if you are looking for some great shopping in a safe environment.  Our biggest complaint was that we only arrive there about 30 minutes before sundown and MOST of the shops have NO LIGHTS!  We had to use the flashlight attachment on our cell phones to see.  Too bad for them.  They lost a lot of business because we could no longer see!!

640368139.name: great place to visit
640368139.author: a TripAdvisor user
640368139.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a blow hole, you can admire this nature wonder and make some great photos. It is also a nice place to enjoy a couple hours strolling around, there are shops and places to eat good food for cheap prices.

638962382.name: Exciting Ensenada, Mexico
638962382.author: a TripAdvisor user
638962382.reviewBody: I took a cruise on Princess Cruise Line.  We stopped in Ensenada, Mexico.  I visited the La Bufadora (Blow Hole).  Fun place.  Good shopping and many stalls to sample and purchase food.  If you cruise take the tour leaving just outside the cruise terminal.  The price is right for the trip.

637917022.name: Tourist Trap
637917022.author: a TripAdvisor user
637917022.reviewBody: If you are in within 10 miles it\'s worth a visit but don\'t go out of your way to see it. When you arrive don\'t fall for the official looking parking attendants. Keep driving down the road even though the street is lined with vendors. There is a free parking area closer to the blowhole. Dodge the vendors until you reach the end of the walkway. If the waves are high you might get wet!

636925126.name: Nice Excursion
636925126.author: a TripAdvisor user
636925126.reviewBody: My family and I booked this excursion when we ported from our cruise ship. The Blow hole was nice too see. There is a lot of shops and tasty taco stands there as well. Many of the vendors try to get you to go into their shops, but if you are not interested then you just keep walking. Many people find it a bit annoying, but it didn\'t bother me too much. Some of the prices were a bit pricy, however if you walk up further the same item is considerably less.

636865278.name: Go see it at high tide and it\'s quite spectacular
636865278.author: a TripAdvisor user
636865278.reviewBody: It\'s a fun little day trip from a hotel in Ensenada or from San Diego. There are plenty of curio shops and vendors 2 check out their goods. We\'ve been there many times and always enjoy it, especially at high tide

636197428.name: Beautiful but unimpressive
636197428.author: a TripAdvisor user
636197428.reviewBody: When your tour bus stops you first have to walk through a long line of shops which is okay heading up to the blowhole but coming back it\'s every man for themselves.  It pretty scenery but the blow hole itself is not impressive.  I will say though when you first park there is a red building taco shop with the most amazing fish tacos ever!  I would go back just to eat the tacos and skip the rest.

635621296.name: It is a big "Blow Hole"
635621296.author: a TripAdvisor user
635621296.reviewBody: Was a bit underwhelmed by the La Bufadora blow hole.   Yes - it "blows" at least every 90 seconds or so.   Watched it blow twice and now I can say I\'ve seen it.   The gauntlet of Mexican Craft shops is daunting----with fellows coming out to touch my arm to ask me to shop at their particular tent.  Don\'t like to be touched by someone I don\'t know.  Doubt I will ever return, even if visiting Ensenada again.

634747788.name: Good cruise excursion
634747788.author: a TripAdvisor user
634747788.reviewBody:
The short guided tour of town is fine as you drive to the blow hole. 

The gauntlet of souvenir shops is a bit overwhelming, but does indeed give you the opportunity for buying whatever souvenir you want.

The blow hole is indeed impressive.

634400508.name: Cruise excursion
634400508.author: a TripAdvisor user
634400508.reviewBody: I chose to go to la bufadora and a wine tasting for my shore excursion. I sailed on the carnival imagination out of long beach. This natural phenomenon was amazing to experience. I got great pictures too.

633516874.name: Okay for a day\'s trip.
633516874.author: a TripAdvisor user
633516874.reviewBody:
We visited La Bufadora as part of a tour from our Princess Cruise.  We booked through the cruise line as we thought that way we would be guaranteed a smooth trip, and it was.  Other reviewers have commented on the higher price charged if you book through the cruise line, but we didn't mind paying extra as it was convenient for us.  It’s about a 50 minute bus ride from central Ensenada, so keep that in mind if you have young children. Once you arrive you have to navigate fairly aggressive street vendors before you can even get to the lookout. Our tour guide, Michelle, had warned us what to expect. She had warned us about the charges for using the toilets there and she suggested Habana Banana as the toilets were free to use there.  No doubt she received a commission on purchases there, but we were happy about that.  We all wore labels that were provided with Michelle's name on them so the vendors knew that we were part of a group.  

The tour group that was used through the cruise line was Misioneros Tours and as mentioned before, our tour guide was Michelle.  Michelle was great and even though she probably says the same thing on every tour, what she said didn't feel like she was being repetitive.  The bus however would not pass strict laws here in Australia as their bus' speedometer did not work and the driver was definitely speeding.  On the way there I asked to use the toilet on board the bus, but as soon as I went into the toilet I noticed that it had not been cleaned and was filled with toilet paper and this was on the way TO the tour - YUK,  naturally, I declined to use it.......

In my opinion, I wouldn't recommend La Bufadora as a 'must see' place to visit but it was okay for a day away from the ship.

633420863.name: Family getaway
633420863.author: a TripAdvisor user
633420863.reviewBody: Enjoyed the experience... must see the animal rescue was an amazing experience... interact with baby panthers, lions, cheetahs and tigers... will definitely go again

633394366.name: Worth the ride
633394366.author: a TripAdvisor user
633394366.reviewBody: Took a bus excursion to La Bufadora. We had a great time. Guide was great! We were told the places to avoid and the places to visit along the street of vendors walking to the blow hole. Tide was right and we saw some pretty impressive shoots of water spray. The smoked clams were excellent! and don\'t for get to stop at the taco stand on the way out I think it was called Julia\'s.

631301517.name: Run the gauntlet to get there - but worth it
631301517.author: a TripAdvisor user
631301517.reviewBody: You park and have to run through a gauntlet of tequila and goods pushers, but clear the ad-hoc market area and it is a beautiful view.  The blow hole is amazing and something to behold.  This is a secret destination well worth the quick trip south of Ensenada.

628970500.name: Great excursion
628970500.author: a TripAdvisor user
628970500.reviewBody: This was a nice trip...lots of shopping (as long as you ignore all the people pulling you into their shops it\'s pretty fun) and drinks and food to choose from.  The water was shooting up like crazy and everyone had a great time.  The only reason I only gave it 4 stars was how pushy people seeking were-and that annoyed me a bit but the geyser itself was great!

621641824.name: THE GOOD, THE BAD AND THE UGLY.
621641824.author: a TripAdvisor user
621641824.reviewBody: The good. The Cadillac marguerita is made in front of you is just perfect. We also had an avocado cut and mixed with pico de gallo. Simply perfect and probably one of the best I ever had. The bad. The price for the marguerita shows Mpesos 155 and $6.49 in US$. That is cheating American tourists that do not know better. That exchange rate presented it\'s the US$ exchange at 24 to1 while it is at 18.5 to 1. So the drink was in reality at around US$ 8.50. The exchange rate never was at 24 to 1. It might give the impression to the innocent tourists that the drink is cheap. I gladly pay $8.50 for that exceptional Cadillac marguerita. No need tricky tricks.

621521780.name: La Bufadora worth the visit.
621521780.author: a TripAdvisor user
621521780.reviewBody: We got there at high tide so had quite a show. See the pictures. Walking through the vendors is a hassle but we did find some good deals on a dress for my Wife and Granddaughter. We paid $29 for the round trip bus ride to the blow hole and back to our ship. I thought it was worth it.

621411022.name: Sales attack!
621411022.author: a TripAdvisor user
621411022.reviewBody: We loved the site, but you do have to run the gauntlet of aggressive sales men to get there.  and they are super aggressive, sometimes walking into the middle of the street and trying to bring us to their store.  but after them there was some local cool artisans.  a lady painting plates with just her finger .  Pretty cool.  I bought one from her.  the blow hole is cool too

618274014.name: Cool Spot
618274014.author: a TripAdvisor user
618274014.reviewBody: Cool spot to see while in Ensenada. Lots of vendors on the way down to the spot but all where nice and didn\'t pressure you to buy.

614735987.name: Ensenada\'s top attraction
614735987.author: a TripAdvisor user
614735987.reviewBody:
We visited La Bufadora by our Cruise Excursion on the 2nd day of our 3 day Carnival Imagination cruise from Long Beach port. It is located 30 miles from cruise port terminal of city Ensenada of Mexico. In Spanish language " La bufadora" means 'Blowing Horn' . Because here due to natural rock formation at sea shore, due to waves of ocean water create blowing horn sound and water jetting out up to max 100' high.
mind you 100' high is very rare as whole phenomena  is depending upon water pressure and waves intensity.
I must say there is not proper viewing gallery at this beautiful place. we have to see it from back side . Government must built viewing platform from front side. 
Here you will find lots of small shops for tourist for  1] Very good Pina coloda { drink in real Pinaple} 2] Good quality Tequila 3] Mexican Silver articles[ Beaware : there is heavy chance that you will get fake silver things, so nitros  oxide test is recommended]  4] Mexican leather items 5] sweet churros .

614229667.name: Wow
614229667.author: a TripAdvisor user
614229667.reviewBody: The Bufadora is a beautiful ocean cliff with an special wave that hits the rocks. The views and sounds are just unforgettable. Don\u2019t miss this unique opportunity.

613475949.name: Bello y fenomenal
613475949.author: a TripAdvisor user
613475949.reviewBody: We came to visit this amazing place and it was out of this world! You get the chance to walk through the market eat the best churros with an amazing Pi\u00f1a Colada.

611939095.name: Ho hum
611939095.author: a TripAdvisor user
611939095.reviewBody: I wouldn\'t pay much to go "tour" this place. We drove there and the drive was interesting. The "blow hole" isn\'t really a hole but at high tide the spray traveled up about 50 feet. You\'ll walk a gauntlet of curio stalls unless you drive to the far end and park in the last lot available.

611312423.name: Don\'t buy this trip on-board your cruise ship.
611312423.author: a TripAdvisor user
611312423.reviewBody: We ready enjoyed our site seeing trip to Punta Banda, Ensenada to see La Bufadora and the flea market. The cost of the trip was significantly less than the excursion rate offered onboard the Carnival Cruise ship. So, if you are interested, don\'t buy on the ship.\nWe had a wonderful, funny lady on the bus. Her name was Mikas. She has been a tour guide for 15 years and was very informative about the town of Ensenada and the flea market, pointing who to trust and who were the better vendors. You will have to pay to use a restroom from $.50 to $.75.

611266994.name: Fun if you like natural rock/water formations
611266994.author: a TripAdvisor user
611266994.reviewBody: My wife (along w/3yr old child) were originally not planning on doing this attraction as a shore excursion from our cruise, but got a great deal after taking a shuttle toward the downtown. We got about half off what the cruise company charges. It\u2019s about 50min ride from central Ensenada, so keep that in mind if you have little ones. Once you arrive you have to navigate the \u201cgauntlet\u201d of fairly aggressive street vendors before you can even get to the lookout. But it did help to have a guide that gave us a heads up on what to expect. The blowhole was pretty cool and not something you would see anywhere else. Makes a deep whooshing sound and sprays a lot of water with large swells that come in.\n\nOverall, if you\u2019re not in a hurry and get started earlier in the day, it\u2019s a good attraction in Ensenada. The taco place (I think it was called Lillie\u2019s) was exceptional and some of the best handmade street tacos.

611265819.name: Still enjoyable but not what it use to be
611265819.author: a TripAdvisor user
611265819.reviewBody: Nice place to visit at least once. The drive up and the views are great.  It is not what it use to be back when I was a kid.  I did not see any vendors selling fish tacos and cheese clams that we use to enjoy, maybe because it was Friday mid day.  La Bufadora is cool to see :) Great location to take some nice photos.

610683169.name: La Bufadora
610683169.author: a TripAdvisor user
610683169.reviewBody: Great drive from Ensenada. Must see as the only one in North America.  We loved the visit and taking our puppy.  Go early to avoid the vendors.   The biggest blow is at high tide. Do not go during low tide.

609982558.name: The drive out is worth the scene.
609982558.author: a TripAdvisor user
609982558.reviewBody: A place to go and enjoy with no fee. Not crowded during the week. The water is so inviting, take a picnic.

609058310.name: Kiddos love la boof :)
609058310.author: a TripAdvisor user
609058310.reviewBody:
The blowhole is very temperamental. We have been here several times with our children and have found that high tide in the winter is the best time to go. The sprays are enormous and very impressive. The kids love “sploosh” as we’ve dubbed it. It’s always fun to see their expressions when the sprays come up and get everybody wet. A definite hit the first time. I have to admit the charm wears off after the third or fourth time. 

The shopping though, never gets old. There are so many options but don’t forget to put your haggling hats on. The costs have gone up in the past years because they can convince most tourists to pay just about any price for items that are mostly made in China. 

The food is not bad either. Though I have never gotten sick I have to advise that you take caution and pay attention. Some street vendors have food that has been sitting out for a while (avoid) while others make the food fresh in front of you. There are a couple traditional restaurant options too. 

Overall a trip to La Bufadora can turn into a great family excursion with breathtaking views of the ocean, a bustling atmosphere, and plenty of diversions.

608231010.name: La Bufadora
608231010.author: a TripAdvisor user
608231010.reviewBody:
This was a weekend in Ensanada, BC. We recently took some friends to La Bufadora for their first time.  We have been there a number of times (driving ourselves or taking the tour off the cruise ship). This time we drove down and decided to look into other options. One was the public bus.  The other was a taxi.  After walking around, from our hotel to the bus terminal (in the heat and humidity), we flagged down a taxi. This is how we met Miguel.  What a great guy! He has now become our go to taxi when we return Ensenada.

For $60, Miguel took 4 adults to La Bufadora (from downtown Ensenada), waited 4 hours for us while we were at La Bufadora, then returned us to our hotel (we stayed at San Nicolas, nice hotel for the price).  
An additional benefit with Miguel is that his English is excellent (he lived in California for some time). Our Spanish is barely passable, so English speaking drivers are good for us.  Don’t be afraid to ask him to stop for beer on the way. We stopped and bought him a soda and got us beers for the long ride (approximately 45 minute ride).  

For our traveling friends (on TripAdvisor), who are looking to have a safe and stress free experience, consider Miguel.  He will take good care of you.  Please take good care of him in return.  We asked how his business works, and was told he has to split 50/50 the net proceeds of all fares with the taxi company, but does get to keep his tips. 

As for La Bufadora, bring lots of cash!!  There is a great deal of shopping to do, but most (if not all) only take cash.  We also have learned that the prices at La Bufadora (once negotiated to the lowest possible price) are better than you will find in town. Also, (my wife’s favorite part of a transaction) ask for a shot of tequila to close the deal.

Miguel can be reached at:
Email: miguel0angel169@gmail.com
Cellphone: 011-52-646-195-1569

Enjoy Ensanada and La Bufadora!

D

607057657.name: Shop lined street to the marine geyser
607057657.author: a TripAdvisor user
607057657.reviewBody:
This is a tough one... the actual spout/ geyser is kinda neat. That said, it won’t take up too much time to see and enjoy, maybe 5-10 minutes. In order to get there though, it’s a drive then walk down a shop-lined street.

Drive: The drive there takes about 35 minutes from Ensenada. 

Parking: Then you pay to park (between 50-70 pesos), with one lot stating that you  pay on the way out but if you lose your ticket it was then 150 pesos. 

Ctra: La Bufadora (Main Street): the street is wall to wall vendors, shops and restaurants. Most vendors speak English. Pricing is for tourists. One pineapple vendor wanted $8 for a virgin piña. If you want something, try to negotiate to a fair (for all) price. 

Bathrooms: All sanitarios/ bathrooms have a cost, be prepared.

Self-Drive: We drove from Puerto Nuevo via Ensenada and it was a nice, but long drive. Use the sanitarios/ bathrooms on the toll road. They are well cared for and clean. If you are self-driving, there is a Walmart and Costco just outside the tourist area of Ensenada. 

Trash and ...: this area is not that well cared for. Lots of trash left around, especially the pineapples. It’s really unfortunate that humans can be so inconsiderate of each other and the natural world. Especially when visiting a natural phenomenon.  

Is it “worth it”? I don’t know. If you are on a cruise excursion, and you had other choices, I’d probably pass. If you have a day to do what you like and want to explore the area, then maaaaaaaybe. It’s okay if you like the touristy travel experience but not to our taste.

606779767.name: Way too crowded!
606779767.author: a TripAdvisor user
606779767.reviewBody: I just returned after 12 years to La Bufadora. I started coming here since I was a little girl and would enjoy the leisure walk passed the few vendors and love to spend time enjoying the views. Fast forward to present it\u2019s turned into a huge \u201cattraction\u201d full of vendors. Most of them end up selling the same items. Being the first time for my husband and kids they enjoyed it however nothing they are dying to go back to. Once we finally made it past all the vendors (highly recommend to wear hats to cover up from the sun) the crowd at the Bufadora was insane! We went on a Sunday stood a few people back from the ledge to see it first hand and after 45 minutes of waiting my kids and us gave up and walked away. People at the front never moved and our little kids could barely see unless they looked up when the water came up. I can\u2019t imagine going back but if I ever do it will need to be during the week because the crowd size was just too much! Cash is best US dollars or pesos although most vendors are selling in US dollars up front. Keep an eye on the conversion amount. We bought several souvenirs and snacks along the way but nothing we couldn\u2019t really find in downtown Ensenada. I was glad I went back to show parts of my childhood to my family but will definitely think about it before going back.

603998090.name: Was ok
603998090.author: a TripAdvisor user
603998090.reviewBody: Won\u2019t stop again as it to crowded, to dirty and really nothing special to see, rather spend the time in valle de guadalupe or surfing!

601279462.name: It was ok. Too Busy, Too Packed!
601279462.author: a TripAdvisor user
601279462.reviewBody: We came here and we were pretty dissapointed. Walking to the blowhole is a mission, it felt like a swapmeet. Food and drinks were pretty good there tho. Lots of shopping for sure. The area where the blowhole was too busy. Too many people and the area is small. That day the blowhole wasnt really at its best so we werent impresssed. Dont plan on going back to be honest.

600869695.name: Fraud Alert
600869695.author: a TripAdvisor user
600869695.reviewBody: Del Mar Discount Pharmacy (first pharmacy on right): AVOID this shady pharmacy chain at all costs. They took my money, gave me an empty product, and made ME feel like a thief when I returned. I\'ve never felt more cheated and helpless! AVOID AVOID AVOID! Thieves with management in on it!!\n\nYou must walk past these vendors for the blowhole experience-- just a fair warning. The site itself was crowded on the weekend I went, and the blowhole is hard to see from the angles available. The guy risking his life sitting on the mountain top probably had the best view. Also, take a hat/umbrella during the hot summer days.

600251782.name: Ensenada - Blow Hole
600251782.author: a TripAdvisor user
600251782.reviewBody: We visited La Buffadora during our Carnival Cruise. We purchased a guide tour and they took us through the City and eventually to La Buffadora. It was lots of fun! You can shop, eat, pet real lion & tiger cubs! The prices are reasonable and you can bargain with them! They have delicious roasted nuts and tacos! Also, they give you change in dollars instead of pesos. It was a great experience.

597114705.name: Perfect for kids and adults
597114705.author: a TripAdvisor user
597114705.reviewBody: This is one of three such blow holes in the world and a lot of fun to experience.  For those who have not been to Mexico, there is the added experience of walking a few blocks through street-side vendors selling everything from snacks to souvenirs. If you take a bus tour, as most visitors do, there is an excellent lunch stop at the bus parking lot with great fish and shrimp tacos for less than two bucks.

596423392.name: Natural treasure
596423392.author: a TripAdvisor user
596423392.reviewBody:
Love this adventure. The guides are great-- we felt totally safe with them at all times. They told us stories about the local environment and their community which made us feel connected to the place.

The kayaking is an easy paddle across a small bay, that takes you right up to the blowhole. This is truly an experience. If the conditions are right, the guides will take you close enough to feel the spray from the spout. The noise is incredible from that close!

Paddles, helmets, lifejackets and wetsuits are provided. The Baja Aquatics bilingual staff is experienced and friendly and they’ll take anyone kayaking-- families, children-- no experience needed. Group size is small so everyone gets personal attention. 

We walked up to the viewpoint afterwards and had tacos and margaritas.

593007115.name: Best Experience Ever
593007115.author: a TripAdvisor user
593007115.reviewBody: I\'ve been to La Bufadora with my family in the past when I was younger but I don\'t remember having the best experience like this time. It was awesome, feeling the breeze and the water rising high enough wetting everyone who was at the bottom between and near the edge to the rock wall. Those in our group who had never visit La Bufadora left with the best experience and memories ever.

591906066.name: Go during high tide, don\'t lose your drone!
591906066.author: a TripAdvisor user
591906066.reviewBody: Fun family excursion. We arrived around 930 am the shops were just getting started. Be ready for all the vendors calling you to buy from their shop. We purchased t-shirts from the 2 for $10 place. Nice mother and daughter team and good t-shirts. If you have small kids beware of the phallic merchandise, that always annoys me, especially when it\'s a family environment. The Bufadora was great. It was really strong, my kids enjoyed getting splashed.  Also, if you have a drone make sure it\'s charged and avoid the seagulls.  We lost ours that day!

591279209.name: Cool place to see if you\'re nearby
591279209.author: a TripAdvisor user
591279209.reviewBody: Kind of a weird place to go, but if you\'re close, it\'s worth checking out. The little market along the way has some cool artisans (and a lot of touristy kitchy stuff).

591045307.name: Kayaking tour is the perfect way to see La Bufadora
591045307.author: a TripAdvisor user
591045307.reviewBody: This was our first cruise, and we booked the Bufadora kayaking tour through Carnival. Best activity of our vacation! The tour guides were knowledgeable and friendly, and the company provided shortie wet suits for anyone who wanted them. We opted not to use them. We wore long sleeved rash guards, capri yoga pants/shorts, and ball caps, and that seemed to be fine for the sun and cold water. We were worried that the activity level and our lack of experience might make this less fun, but it was a fairly easy trip. We went around the bay and then got close up to La Bufadora! I think this is the only way to really see it - we got to see the majesty of the whole thing, while people on shore only got to look down. We also saw marine life, and two seals followed us in to shore. We then stopped for tacos and churros - if you only want food, bring $10 per person for this, if you want coke it\'s $2, pina coladas are $8 without alcohol and $10 with. They ONLY take cash. Be sure to also bring small bills for the tip. We were told that the tour guides do NOT split the tip, so bring change so you can give some to the men at La Bufadora and then some to the tour guide and bus driver. We had only brought a $20 and gave it to the men, and then were told that the tour guide and driver wouldn\'t get any, which was frustrating. Overall, a really wonderful day!

590101952.name: Quick views but not much to do.
590101952.author: a TripAdvisor user
590101952.reviewBody: It was a quick ride to get there and seeing the blowhole and just enjoying the views but that as good as it gets. There is a strip of vendors and restaurants all competing against each other and hassling you to buy something. Enjoy the views and get out when you can unless your trying to get overly priced items.

589162041.name: Beautiful views once you are there
589162041.author: a TripAdvisor user
589162041.reviewBody: The views are beautiful but to get to the views you have to get through crowds and pushy vendors wanting to sell their products. Drove 1 hour for a 10 minute attraction. It\'s beautiful but it\'s not worth the time.  Parking is 50-60 pesos, food is good,  toilet costs about 50 cents. The area is very dirty (dont recommend open toes) and appears to not be monitored at all.  Streets travelling to/from the attraction are narrow-would not recommend if you get car sickness.

588701853.name: Fun Yet Quick!
588701853.author: a TripAdvisor user
588701853.reviewBody:
I was there August 2017 with friends and family, It was fun!

Pros: La Bouradora is basically where the waves crash on the ciffs causing then to shoot up 24-50 feet in the air. There is a closed off  street you have to walk down to get to La Bufadora full of vendors, food, souvenir shops, shoes stores, Purses, and a Pharmacy! They sell the best Pina Coladas (with or without alcohol) and Micheladas! There is fish tacos, BBQ Clams, Tacos, and bar. 

Cons:Its about 70 south of the California border, it can get super crowded, back to back. You have to pay to utilize the restrooms (although they restrooms are very clean). After you see La Bufadora there not much to do except shop and drinks. We were only there for 2 hours. Its fun if u are in the area.

588667306.name: Too many "puestos" ruins the experience
588667306.author: a TripAdvisor user
588667306.reviewBody: The Bufadora itself is a magnificent geological feature. There are moments when the height of the water is about 100ft and it comes with such a strength it gets you real soaked unexpectedly. But the area around has been so commercialized, it takes away from this beauty. It is better to go very early in the morning or after 4pm, so the ambulant vendors are gone and closed and not bothering you while admiring this beauty.

588637091.name: Great trip, wonderful tour guide
588637091.author: a TripAdvisor user
588637091.reviewBody: We met our tour guide Eugenia right outside the port and she drove us to La Bufadora and back. Her SUV/Van was nice and clean and she offered us water. We were so happy with how nice she was as she told us all about the things we were driving by. When we got to La Bufadora she walked us through all the stores and pointed out the best places. We had such a lovely time and the La Bufadora was so cool to see!\n\nDefinetly recommend Wine Route Baja for transportation and guidance for excursions to La Bufadora or the wineries!

586982571.name: Day trip
586982571.author: a TripAdvisor user
586982571.reviewBody: La Bufadora was a cool day trip, beautiful ocean views, and the blow hole was cool.  Also we ate at a restaurant that had baby lions and tigers and great food.  Also lots of shopping.

585229048.name: La Bufadora is a natural wonder
585229048.author: a TripAdvisor user
585229048.reviewBody: Was not very impressed with this excursion and VERY glad I didn\u2019t pay $35 per person fromthe cruise. We paid $17 per person. The bus and guide were nice, but the market was overpriced even with bargaining. The most DISAPPOINTING aspects was the area to see the blow hole/ spray was NOT managed so that a decent picture could be taken. Crowds were not moving and there was no etiquette being used at the site. A shame, I had hoped that it being a tourist attraction as well as a tour guided location; there would have been a \u201cpaying customer\u201d area designated so we didn\u2019t leave with the feeling of being driven an hour to shop in a market that has the same stuff as the port town. I would save the time on this and go see one of the other geysers in Hawaii or Australia that may be better suited/managed for customers that have been charged a fee to see, experience, and get a decent family photo without a bazillion strangers blocking the beauty of the spray behind us.

584850062.name: A must see in Ensenada
584850062.author: a TripAdvisor user
584850062.reviewBody: We went on a 3-day cruise to Ensenada and this tour was on my top list. Since we only had about 8hrs on land, options were limited. We thought of getting a tour outside the cruise, but it was much convenient to coordinate with the cruise\u2019s tour. For $35.00 each person, we were taken by the tour bus to a nearby museum for some history lessons of Ensenada, then straight to La Bufadora. Passing through the local flea market was okay. I read reviews saying vendors being pushy selling their merchandise so I was ready for it. But to my surprise, they were pretty much friendly and not pushy at all. They offered us once but when you decline, they move on. No worries. The blow hole was so much fun to watch! We got to see it blew up a great splash and people got wet! A good 15 -20 minutes maybe enough to stay and sink in the beauty of this nature. By the way, the tour guide Pedro Flores, was funny and hospitable. I thought he was more fun to watch than the stand-up comedian we watched at the cruise. That being said, tour to La Bufadora is something you should not miss!

583898660.name: Marine Geyser
583898660.author: a TripAdvisor user
583898660.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a marine geyser/blowhole located about a 30-45 minute drive from Ensenada. The spout of sea water and thunderous clasp is the result of air, trapped in a sea cave, exploding upwards. The attraction is free, but you must pay for parking ($3-$5). The walkway down is paved with vendor stalls selling souvenirs and food. This place gets very crowded on the weekends.

583404838.name: Festive
583404838.author: a TripAdvisor user
583404838.reviewBody: Lots of fun.. nice place spend few hours..\nFun to look at stalls. Took uber there however could not get uber back.. luckily jumped in a local bus and switched to another local bus half way there.

579867467.name: kayaking and tacos!!
579867467.author: a TripAdvisor user
579867467.reviewBody: There were six of us women and we had a fabulous time. Our guides were the best...they were very attentive to our needs whatever they might be and our safety. We couldn\'t have asked for a better activity in Ensenada. Being in a kayak was the best way to experience the blow hole.  We were on the Carnival Cruise and booked through them. After the kayaking we were taken to a taco place that was the best taco I have had in a long time! I would highly recommed the Bufadora tour and the guides we had.

578647949.name: Tacos and pina coladas
578647949.author: a TripAdvisor user
578647949.reviewBody: The kayaking was fun but the street tacos and pina coladas our tour guide took us for were by far the best part, unfortunately they are not a part of the tour. If I\u2019m going to review just the kayaking I would say it was fun but not super exciting. Our tour was cut short due to weather so maybe that affected it but after doing the zip line in Catalina this was just ok.

578564718.name: Second largest blow hole and Mexican gifts and food!
578564718.author: a TripAdvisor user
578564718.reviewBody: About an hour south of downtown in the hills you\u2019ll find an amazing top of the Mountain View of the Pacific. Plenty of fish tacos and normal Mexican fare. Try to arrive as tide is due to come in. ONLY ONE THING!  THE VENDORS ARE AGGRESSIVE; WALK DOWN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROAD.\nBut overall it\u2019s a great food, shopping, margarita, and tourist attraction.

578403124.name: \u201cFirst time\u201d love it
578403124.author: a TripAdvisor user
578403124.reviewBody: Was there when I was a kid so I don\u2019t really remember that at all, so it was nice to go back ...... going back next year

577913512.name: La Bufadora is Worth the Effort to Get There
577913512.author: a TripAdvisor user
577913512.reviewBody: Nowhere has the sage advice not to "...forget to enjoy the journey ..." more true than when visiting La Bufodora, a natural water blow hole in Ensenada. While spectacular in its own right, I found also enjoyed the experience of navigating the quarter mile or so guantlet of souvenir shops and hawkers which hawk everything from alcohol served in hollowed out pinneaples to designer bags. This was a lot of fun! So, if you happen to be in Ensenada, I encourage to experience this attraction for yourself.

577243834.name: must see
577243834.author: a TripAdvisor user
577243834.reviewBody: was here a awhile ago but what a great experience. amazing sight to see and lots of food available near by.

576124771.name: Beautiful! but the marketplace not so much...
576124771.author: a TripAdvisor user
576124771.reviewBody: I went here April 2018.  The site is spectacular.  The ocean hitting the rocks below is amazing. To get here though you get to trek past probably 100 vendors peddling souvenirs, knock offs, churros, pina coladas, and various Mexican decor. I went with the intention of actually shopping but it is next to impossible with the constant barrage of pressuring words.  I pretty much decided I didn\'t need anything that bad.  I bought a couple of trinkets for my grand baby and left. I did eat tacos at the small taco stand next to where the tour buses park.  The tacos were delicious and filling. They came highly recommended by our tour guide and they did not disappoint.

575288862.name: Blowhole
575288862.author: a TripAdvisor user
575288862.reviewBody: The blowhole was not what I expected the bus stops at the top of a hill and as you walk down the hill to get to the blowhole you have to walk through a bunch of shops where people are bugging you to buy their stuff the blowhole was not blowing and it\'s just a cement wall you can\'t even really see down there and then about every 5 minutes water will shoot up but doesn\'t shoot up very high it was still a cool experience and I\'m glad we saw it. Bus ride took about 50 minutes and the tour guide on bis was very funny

574405547.name: Stunning
574405547.author: a TripAdvisor user
574405547.reviewBody: Despite the swap meet feel on the walk to the geyser this place i beautiful.  Great photo ops as well.  I would go again.

573856752.name: Check out tide schedule before you go
573856752.author: a TripAdvisor user
573856752.reviewBody:
La Bufadora

Well, Ensenada isn’t that super exciting when you arrive via cruise ship. (Not sure if it is more exciting arriving via other means...) We booked the “blowhole” tour with our cruise line. The signal to noise ratio is really low, meaning that the ride their, the walk through countless vendors to eventually get through the actual attraction doesn’t really justify the effort (and cost). Unless you love touristy places where souvenir shopping seems to be the main attraction and purpose of the place. 
However, we were super lucky with our tour guide. A true Ensenadian, he gave a lot of insight about culture and living in Mexico. I found the 50 min rides (one way) the best of the entire tour because of our guide. He prepared us for all the vendors and pointed out a few of them that were noteworthy. He also explained the difference between fake silver and genuine silver. (Ask for an acid test!)

My take away is that we felt safe doing the cruise line excursion as opposed to getting around on our own. We got to see some back country life and the beautiful coast of Ensenada.

We could not avoid the “vendor shopping street” to get to the blow hole (and return back to the bus). But these vendors are just doing their job to survive and we were not annoyed by them and even bought some Schnickschnack.

The blowhole itself is spectacular but only if the tide schedule cooperates. We were 3 hours into receding (approximately four hours before low tide) and were able to see some spraying performances by the ocean. The sound this makes gave the tiny town of Bufadora it’s name. 

Conclusion: 
If you are tired hanging out at your cruise ship, the tide schedule is in your favor, this perhaps is a good thing to do to kill a few hours and see some of the country.

573583384.name: Don\u2019t go when it\u2019s low tide..
573583384.author: a TripAdvisor user
573583384.reviewBody: We went to La Bufadora twice during our stay in Ensenada, the first time wasn\u2019t that great, it was low tide so you don\u2019t even get wet or close to being wet.  It\u2019s like a blow hole effect and vendors everywhere. They sell food , drinks, fake purses, hats etc... A lot of them speak English also.  I would recommend going during high tide or when it\u2019s windy.

573032351.name: La Bufadora
573032351.author: a TripAdvisor user
573032351.reviewBody: Spent around an hour at LaBufadora. Saw a couple of good blows but I think it would be hit and miss depending on the force of the sea. Market stalls all the way down to the sea from car park. Around 40 minute ride in a taxi from Ensenada port

572865120.name: Traditional dishes and an ocean view
572865120.author: a TripAdvisor user
572865120.reviewBody: Although this restaurant is a little touristy (room for a busload of visitors), the food is outstanding and the prices are more than friendly.  You know a place in Mexico is authentic when there are chickens roaming around.  If you\'re from the states, don\'t be alarmed--the place is super clean and the food will definitely not cause any traveler\'s curse issues.  They also have excellent drinks.

571545842.name: Fun little area...know how to handle market
571545842.author: a TripAdvisor user
571545842.reviewBody: It\u2019s beautiful.  It\u2019s worth seeing as there are only three in the world and this is the second largest.  Be polite to the market vendors, just say \u201cno thank you\u201d if you aren\u2019t interested and they all said \u201cok, have a good day\u201d.  Yes, they are all trying to sell you something, but I never felt overwhelmed.

570645021.name: Interesting place to visit if you\'re in the area, but it is a bit of a tourist trap.
570645021.author: a TripAdvisor user
570645021.reviewBody: I would not go too much out of my way to visit this, but if you\'re in the area and have a few hours it is a cute and pleasant place to visit this natural phenomenon.\n\nBe warned that it is a tourist trap, with hundreds of vendors trying to sell you stuff. It is competitive though, so you can make some good deals on ceramics, cigars and such if you are friendly and patient.

570182149.name: The Best
570182149.author: a TripAdvisor user
570182149.reviewBody: We stopped at La Bufadora on a cruise stopover it was the best. The blowhole, the scenery, the atmosphere and the music as well as the vendors. I found buying in town cheaper than the vendors out there especially when it came to leather.\nGreat place. Beautiful view of the sea.

568998050.name: Awesome natural wonder with a little dose of reality.
568998050.author: a TripAdvisor user
568998050.reviewBody: We took a cruise with Carnival to Ensenada with our kids who are 12 and 14.  First off, Carnival was awesome and we highly recommend their cruises.  Second, if you are going to La Bufadora don\'t bother booking a shore excursion with Carnival.  They want almost 40 bucks to take you there.  Once you get off the ship there are buses there waiting to take you into town.  It was only a 5 or 6 block walk but we thought it was worth the $4 for each family member to ride and get a short glimpse of the city.  From there you can buy excursions from a local company.   We spent $17 a person to take us to La Bufadora with a guide. Once we got there we had about an hour and 20 minutes to walk around.   The vendors are pretty pushy but if you say no thanks they don\'t bother you.  I made the mistake of wearing a Rams shirt and was accosted by every guy there to come into their shop and see all thier Rams stuff.  DONT wear pro team shirt!  The good thing was many of the shop owners offered us free tequila.  We paid for everything with US dollars.  Just make sure you haggle to get the best prices.  There is also a bar/restaurant called Habana Banana where you can let or play with lion, panther, and tiger cubs for a price.  At the end of the long street of vendors is La Bufadora.  It was amazingly beautiful with a few street performers wanting your tips.  Bring some ones.

568633001.name: The Highlight of our Cruise Ports
568633001.author: a TripAdvisor user
568633001.reviewBody: La Bufadora was the highlight of our cruise ports on this trip.  The blowhole is a must see and the drive there which is 45 minutes is enjoyable.   Our guide was very interesting and told us about the culture, history and current news about Ensenada.  There is shopping here and the vendors are a bit pushy but you expect that in Mexico.  We ended up hanging out for quite a while watching the blowhole and taking lots of pictures .  The views are amazing.  We had some tacos from the shop at the front of the walk to the blowhole and they were delicious.  Great day!

567074804.name: Blow hole was cool to experience, vendors were a little much though...
567074804.author: a TripAdvisor user
567074804.reviewBody: The blow hole was impressive but wading through the vendors was taxing at times.  How many times can you say no thank you without getting asked the same question 20 sec later...

566528326.name: La Bufadora
566528326.author: a TripAdvisor user
566528326.reviewBody: This is a wonder of the world. Only three in existence.\nI grew up there every summer,  in my younger days, so I was excited to see how much it had changed. And boy did it! I remember two restaurants, unlimited access, without walls and shops . It is a fun oplace to try their baked clams w cheese and shrimp, yummy!, Tequilla tasting, and visiting the rescued wild cats. We went with a private guide, and he showed us a fabulous time. One to go see

565688124.name: Fun Tourist Trap
565688124.author: a TripAdvisor user
565688124.reviewBody:
This was a fun tourist trap. The blow hole was fun to watch and the kids liked it. Spent about 15 minutes watching it shoot water. 

The shops on the way to the blow hole were good ole fashion shops where you can haggle with the merchant. They can be pushy, but that is part of the fun.

If you have kids, they will enjoy seeing the lion cubs.

564995729.name: Get blown on
564995729.author: a TripAdvisor user
564995729.reviewBody: Cool thing to see. Big blowhole and the little accompanying street market is decent and fun to walk through. Tremendous vista of the ocean.

564657017.name: 2hour trip
564657017.author: a TripAdvisor user
564657017.reviewBody: We had a good time, the blow hole was more impressive than the one on Kuaui, you do have to walk threw an couple block area of vendors, but we didn\'t mind and even bought a few things after a little bartering.  Had a meal a a nice place right at the start of the vendors and the food was great.

564125274.name: Meh...
564125274.author: a TripAdvisor user
564125274.reviewBody: If you have ever been to Mexico you have a good idea what the shops are. Just a bunch of the same thing. You can barter and get some souvenirs but I usually just pay the asking price. It\'s not much more and I want the good karma. The best blow hole is a bust in my opinion. The best part of the strip in the blue house at the beginning. THE BEST TACOS! Seriously.

562615815.name: To me was not big deal plus rip off American
562615815.author: a TripAdvisor user
562615815.reviewBody:
We took cruise Carnival) to Ensenada , they have shuttles and charges $17 us dollar round trip (kind of rip-off) and plus tip $ 37 with horseback riding not recommend it, They tell you it is by the beach but when after you pay  they told us it has to be far from beach not permitted and walking very far away from beach on the dirt and the guides walk and  hold the horse, you don’t have control to ride the horse the guides they lie to you to get tips, They told us the owner does not pay them if we want we can tip them one of the guide said he didn’t go to school to support his family and had 2 twins baby at 22 years old to give them good tip the other guide was 16 years old, we found out they were owners children they did not want to hire anybody else complete rip off it was confirmed with our guide they were owner of over 50 horses. We were supposed to have one hour after 20 min was finished
complete waste of money and time.

562017274.name: Tourist Trap
562017274.author: a TripAdvisor user
562017274.reviewBody: This attraction was fun to watch, but its a trap to get to. There are pushy vendors and shops that you have to walk past in order to get to the end of the pier.

561363110.name: Was great fun
561363110.author: a TripAdvisor user
561363110.reviewBody: Had a good time, shops were good as always, wasn\u2019t blowing great but still had some fun. Wish more shops were open, but it is the off season

561362875.name: Beautiful place
561362875.author: a TripAdvisor user
561362875.reviewBody: About 45 minutes from the cruise port the La Ensenada around beautiful mountain at la bufadora. The sound of the water when it hits the rocks it amazing. A lot of Mexicans art and food.

561058755.name: just OK
561058755.author: a TripAdvisor user
561058755.reviewBody: Excellent views from the cliffs, La Bufadora was just ok. I\'m glad I got to see and can say I\'ve been, but wouldn\'t be disappointed if I never made it back. The real fun was walking, shopping and talking with the local market vendors. I would do that again! Plus they offered samples of tequila and churros all the way to the blowhole.

560528197.name: Nice place
560528197.author: a TripAdvisor user
560528197.reviewBody: They say there is only 5 of these kind of places in the entire world. Beautiful experience, with local music. you have to walk through the entire market to reach there..but its fun all the stores sells local artifacts, food, pina coladas..etc..\n

559566619.name: Food Review...
559566619.author: a TripAdvisor user
559566619.reviewBody: This is our 2nd visit here and this review is about the food in the area. Lidia\u2019s Tacos and the churros are delicious. Her shop is at the start of the shopping area next to the bus parking, so we stop and get a taco on our way to the blowhole. Next we walk through the row of vendors to the other end. At this end there are a couple shops selling roasted filled large clam shells, we get one or two of these, walk on up to the blowhole, enjoy yummy food and view and the head back through the row of vendors. We shop, eat more churros and stop for another taco on our way back to the bus.

559317923.name: Spectacular!!
559317923.author: a TripAdvisor user
559317923.reviewBody:
La Bufadora is a blowhole that spouts/shoots water up to 100 feet in the air. Its the Largest Blowhole in North America. One of those things you can cross off the bucket list. There is also an animal rescue that has baby tigers, lions, jaguars, and other exotic cats. Your spouse and kids will love you for taking them there, where else in the world can pet or hold a tiger cub? Lots of good sea food and plenty of vendors including leather goods and pharmacies. 

Booked an excursion from Carnival Imagination. Bus took us from the port to La Bufadora.  Our tour guide was friendly and KNOWLEDGEABLE, and we listen to her, and followed her instructions as we were on a timeline. You can and will get left behind if your not back to the bus in time. 
She explained that we should stay on the main street and that the vendors would be a little aggressive, and we should always ask what the price of something is and if its not a food or drink it is negotiable.  As a group walked thru the market area straight to the animal rescue / restaurant, she showed us where the free tequila tasting would  be taking place at the end of the tour. Then the group  followed her to La Bufadora. That being said... Yes you have to walk thru the flea market,  yes they were trying to sell you everything in the world, yes the vendors ONLY exist because of tourism. 
Drinks and food (churros are plentiful) are everywhere. The clean bathrooms are fifty US cents to use but are worth the price. Remember it's MEXICO have fun and just because you bought it does'ant mean its legal in the States.

558916916.name: Amazing!
558916916.author: a TripAdvisor user
558916916.reviewBody: We booked the Bufadora trip from the Carnival Imagination cruise. Well organized, nice bus and a good guide that provided a lot of details about the town and the blowhole itself. If you like the typical Mexican shopping street you\u2019re going to find a lot of stuff there. As the locals are saying jokingly- they help you spend your money buying stuff that you don\u2019t need. \nGreat view, clear water and a good time overall.

557907965.name: Flea market nightmare
557907965.author: a TripAdvisor user
557907965.reviewBody: We sailed on Carnival Cruise Lines to Ensenada. At the suggestion of the shore excursion desk, we booked a tour to La Bufadora. There is a brief mention of a flea market there BUT they DO NOT tell you that you must walk through 1000 yards of aggressive flea market vendors to get to the actual site of the water hole. You are accosted by people shoving samples of drinks I your face, yelling at you to come see their wares many many times over. You are also forced to stop with your tour guide at certain booths (that they are getting a kick back from) and listen to their spiel about how they have the best goods at the site. Since you do not know where you are going... you cannot continue on your own without your guide so you are trapped into listening to their speech as well as being hawked by other vendors if you happen to be on the outskirts of the crowd. There is NO other way to get to the site of the water spout without having to go through this gauntlet of aggressive flea market vendors BOTH ways!!!!! Carnival Cruise Lines takes NO responsibility for this disaster. They state their info states there is a flea market there. BUT they DO NOT mention you are trapped into this 1000\' long path of aggression to enjoy the water spout. I complained to the shore excursion desk, guest services and corporate and was rewarded with $25 on board credit  on my next cruise for over 1 hour\'s time of complaining. I told them that I do not need the $25 as I will never set foot on a Carnival Cruise. They offered the tour took responsibility for the tour but offered not satisfaction for a guest that was very very unhappy with the experience. DO NOT go to this site unless you like being accosted at least 100 times each way to the water spout with NO NO NO option to go around the vendors to get to the site.

557817750.name: Must see in Ensenada
557817750.author: a TripAdvisor user
557817750.reviewBody: At the end of a pedestrian street full of shops, food stands (the churros are great!), tequila stands, restaurants and a lot of vendors you will find La Bufadora, one of the largest blow hole in the world. You can see it from a terrace and you migth get wet! \nIt is about 45 min from Ensenada.  We were told that the best time to go there is early morning (I would suggest before the most of the shops open) or late afternoon when its low tide and the "geiser" is higher. Bring small change, they charge to use most restrooms.  Like in other areas in Mexico, be aware of your surroundings and I would suggest that you pay cash, not using your credit cards (some frauds cases).

557784235.name: While i know this isn\'t kosher - i still held a lion and it was AWESOME.
557784235.author: a TripAdvisor user
557784235.reviewBody: REALLY TOURISTY but still - you have to go. Might want to buy a purse (knockoffs of the super expensive ones), and simply walk around. It\'s fun to see the kids getting so excited when the water geiser sprays up.

557103061.name: Honestly I was surprised I was not expecting this kind of natural beautry
557103061.author: a TripAdvisor user
557103061.reviewBody: If you have an opportunity to to there just "go"  it is worth it to see a natural wonder,  I was thinking that it was going to be something just simple.  And for my surprise it is just a wonder.

556776997.name: Cartel is active here and will rob you/threaten your family
556776997.author: a TripAdvisor user
556776997.reviewBody:
I visited this location with my family including young children. Some of the shop owners were very nice. However a couple of shops will try to welcome you in promising "cash back" or ability to pay for items with your visa card. When you enter their shop they will add $200 USD to whatever you agreed to pay, then surround you with gang members and threaten/force you to sign the payment slip (knowing that there won't be a way to do a charge back).

This happened to me and my family, we were threatened to sign by gang members, and I'm not going to fight a bunch of gang members when my little children are present. When working with our bank's fraud department, they also acknowledged that this type of scam is very common in the region and definitely cartel-driven.

So, BE CAREFUL. The cartel is active here and will prey on you and your families. Maybe stay on the cruise ship or just get some fish tacos in town instead.

555900561.name: a spectacular shower
555900561.author: a TripAdvisor user
555900561.reviewBody: as the waves crash ashore the rocks force the water up into the air.  getting there is a 40 minute drive from Ensenada and then you have to run the usual gauntlet of stall holders all trying to sell you their wares.

555313047.name: Drive if you can, skip a guided tour
555313047.author: a TripAdvisor user
555313047.reviewBody: If you are looking for no-frills fun, this is it. A nice drive out (even in the off season) of about 40 minutes leads you to this hardly inspiring tourist trap. Take it for what it is. You\'re literally watching water spray on rocks. But the experience is so much more. Haggle with the vendors. Grab a shot or a drink and stroll around. Enjoy yourself. This is Mexico, you\'re on vacation. Parking is like $3. Be sure you check the tide chart (google) and arrive during high tide or else you\'ll only be talking to the vendors and no water spout.

554912501.name: One of The best Water Blow....
554912501.author: a TripAdvisor user
554912501.reviewBody: This is one of the place that we must visit, after we arrived at La Bufadora, that\'s amazing.. great.! You must come and see this.

554023601.name: TIP: Check the surf report BEFORE you go.
554023601.author: a TripAdvisor user
554023601.reviewBody:
I used to have a home about 10 minutes from this natural landmark. It's been a memorable part of my childhood and we've taken a lot of people to visit this unique natural phenomenon. However, if you're not interested in shopping and only want to see the blowhole, then it's always a good idea to check the surf report BEFORE you go. 

On a good day the blowhole will shoot upwards of 200 to nearly 300 feet in the air. 

On a normal day, the results are far lackluster and the hole only snorts a fine mist with a lot of disappointed travelers not knowing the truly spectacular potential available only a few feet below. 

Might be better to go first thing in the morning with the tidal influence or just at sunset in the evening. The views are truly amazing.

553216859.name: Met expectations for a (mostly) free attraction
553216859.author: a TripAdvisor user
553216859.reviewBody: I drove to this attraction from Ensanada. The drive was pretty and you can see the Yellowtail aquaculture pens from the cliffs. I stopped at one of the look out points which required a small fee. The view and pictures were worth it. The road to the bufadora is easy to follow. Parking is also a pretty cheap fee. Since I brought my car from the US I didn\u2019t mind paying for parking in what felt like a pretty safe area. There\u2019s a path down to the bufadora that is lined with shops. Many of them sell the same generic touristy trinkets you can kind everywhere for a more expensive price. But, there are some shops with unique, handmade items as well, you just have to look for them. There\u2019s also all kinds of food, again, for a higher price than you\u2019d pay away from a tourist attraction. At a slow stroll, it took me about 15 minutes to get to the bottom and the bufadora. The water was very calm on my trip so the bufadora was not really doing its thing. Also, the viewing area is kind of small in comparison to the amount of people that visit (it was pretty crowded even at the end of the day) so getting a spot in front is pretty difficult. Overall, I had a good time and might go again. For a (mostly) free attraction it met my expectations.

552731860.name: Worth the drive
552731860.author: a TripAdvisor user
552731860.reviewBody: La Bufadora = \'blowhole\' in Spanish, and that\'s this town\'s reason for being.  There\'s a natural rock inlet that narrows to a point, and incoming waves, if big enough, and timed with high tides, create a big splash/spray, mist that rises high into the air.  Great viewing spots all around, on several levels up the clifs.  There are literally 100\'s of vendors in open stalls, side-by-each, over a 1/2 mile stretch along the one narrow street leading up to the blowhole.  They sell everything from pharmacy drugs to tee shirts to leather goods to foods, etc., etc.  Many restaurants along the way as well, some sidewalk vendors with take away food to sit down restaurants.  A regular tourist haven, although the day we visited it seemed to be mostly locals out for the day.

550109240.name: Meh
550109240.author: a TripAdvisor user
550109240.reviewBody: I just didn\'t understand the attraction to this geyser.  It was a quite a long drive to get there as it\'s not near anything.  And once you\'re there, it\'s really not that interesting....just some water spouting out of a hole at regular intervals.  Maybe it\'s more engaging at high tide but I kind of doubt it.  Around there are many, many vendors.  Yes, the vendors are a bit pushy (but far less pushy than those I encountered in China) but you can really get some good deals.  Be prepared to bargain. My kids all bought decent souvenirs here. \n\nTIP: If you go here, drive as far down the road as you can (through almost all of the vendors) and there is a parking lot on the left that costs only a few dollars.  It\'ll put you close to the blowhole and in the center of most of the vendors.

550106919.name: Family Fun, Nature & Kitsch Mixed into One!
550106919.author: a TripAdvisor user
550106919.reviewBody: We recently went here with 3 kids aged 13, 9 and 5.  We all had a good time.  Parking was $3.  Then we walked through all of the crappy stores and vendors who were cheerful and not too pushy.  My kids were delighted to find a cheap mini guitar, have bracelets made with their names, and to drink out of coconuts and pineapples.  What could be better?  The blowhole is actually very interesting and the little rock croppings are picturesque.  When I was at the same place 25 years ago it was a pull off the road and nothing else.  I think it is a lot more entertaining and makes for a pretty touristy yet pleasant excursion for a few hours.

549512750.name: Fun!
549512750.author: a TripAdvisor user
549512750.reviewBody: I\u2019d recommend it! Cheap to get there! Water view is beautiful and fun to see the shops. Free samples of pi\u00f1a coladas. Of course they haggle you to buy everything but that\u2019s expected. Our tour guide was absolutely hilarious. Made for a very entertaining ride. And don\u2019t be cheap. They do it for the tips. Haha

548788615.name: The \u2018blow hole blows\u2019
548788615.author: a TripAdvisor user
548788615.reviewBody:
DO NOT GET SUCKED IN TO THIS MEGA TOURIST TRAP!!!
We got off the ship after an amazing voyage to Hawaii. On the shuttle ($3 round trip to town) our “guide” made it very clear that only a fool would traipse the streets of Ensenada and instead should go to the eighth wonder of the world... “an amazing display of nature’s force”...except when we got there it was low tide (which of course our guide knew!) .. so no show. 
As if the non-starter ‘ blow hole ‘ wasn’t enough,our on-board “”””guide””” ( Jesus) to the blow hole, who claimed to speak four languages, made a complete fool of himself while trying to narrate the 60 minute trip to the placid shore ..aka blow hole. Jesus spent 60 minutes degrading USA citizens on numerous counts.
Summary? Yeah... stay on the ship !! 
 
There is a place for a photo in this review...sadly there was nothing worth photographing.

547099274.name: Blowhole and flea market
547099274.author: a TripAdvisor user
547099274.reviewBody: Amazing the blowhole and flea market nice people and sea food and tacos pi\u00f1a colada I recommend the private taxi driver it\'s a nice a tour guide

545664722.name: Had a great time
545664722.author: a TripAdvisor user
545664722.reviewBody: Its about a 45 minute drive from Downtown Ensenada to La Bufadora. Once you get there, you will encounter tons of little outdoor shops. They sell EVERYTHING from food, beer, wine, candy, toys, clothes etc. These people will try to hustle you so beware and be prepared! One vendor tried to sell me a "Dodger Painted Skull" initial price $35 (yes they will give you the price in dollars) I was hesistant he went down to $30 we went back amd forth til I finally gave in at $10 like whaaat??!!! Please Dont buy anything without negotiating the price Trust me... Everyone will go down on prices just to make a sell. Well once you past all the hustling you will come to the end where the Bufadora is located. If you are there at the right time it will be magical! A once in a lifetime experience. Its peaceful... Mother Nature at its Best!

545332578.name: Skip this excursion and enjoy beautiful scenery anywhere else along the coast
545332578.author: a TripAdvisor user
545332578.reviewBody:
We were very disappointed by La Bufadora in every way. Here's why:

1. It's about an hour drive from downtown Ensenada with not much else to visit around.
2. La Bufadora (meaning blow hole) was not "blowing" when we were there, so I assume it only does during certain times of day. Still, there were huge crowds drinking cheap beer and being obnoxious overlooking the rock formation, making any semblance of peaceful nature viewing impossible. 
3. The walking path to get there is marred with noisy vendors selling the same touristy things. They heckle at you in broken English, promising special deals. Everyone wants money. The experience feels more like a walk of shame than a tourist attraction.

I live in Ensenada as an American expat, and I LOVE Mexico. It is vibrant and beautiful and full of wonders. La Bufadora is a bad representation of this beautiful culture and it makes me sad that people go there and take away other stereotypical impressions. Please, skip this attraction and go discover something real in this amazing country.

544724999.name: A Quiet day
544724999.author: a TripAdvisor user
544724999.reviewBody: We visited on a quiet day, so the bufadora itself was not very spectacular.  But is was nice to see it.  And we had a lovely snack at one of the restaurants

544236062.name: A Giant Flush!
544236062.author: a TripAdvisor user
544236062.reviewBody: An amazing overlook of Pacific Ocean and cliffs, crashing waves and spray. Built on the cliff with a magnificent view of the turbulent water as it hits the craggy rocks. Tour buses abound so there are Mexican trinket shops to explore and a variety of seafood restaurants. \nThe road there is twists and turns over the peninsula with dropOffs. A great natural, mesmerizing creation of nature with a touch of local culture.

542627238.name: Ensendad Fun
542627238.author: a TripAdvisor user
542627238.reviewBody: We had a great time here. The blow hole was a really neat sight. The fish tacos at the end of the street were amazing!!! Lots of vendors with goodies to sell ( pushy vendors) but worth it none the less. Would definitely recommend!

540958431.name: Disappointing
540958431.author: a TripAdvisor user
540958431.reviewBody: If you arrive at low tide the bufadora is disappointing. The short walk from the parking to the viewing area is mostly lined with harrassing shopowners/sales people with the same old pitch for their trinkets. You should time your visit when the tide is high.

540806422.name: Well worth the drive from Ensenada!
540806422.author: a TripAdvisor user
540806422.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous natural blow hole - mesmerizing!  We spent a good 30 minutes just watching and appreciating the beauty...  Great places for photos too. We found fun fruit stands on the way home with lovely customer service and delicious tropical fruits we don\'t get at home.

539980103.name: A Must See
539980103.author: a TripAdvisor user
539980103.reviewBody: The view is amazing, the shops along your walk from parking to the blow hole are quaint and accommodating.  The food, whether it is local and inexpensive, or mid-priced is good.  I avoid the chain type food shops and prefer the local food.  The walk from parking to the blow hole can be challenging if one is not accustomed to the routine approach of vendors trying to make a sale.  Overall, very good event.

539844144.name: La Bufadora
539844144.author: a TripAdvisor user
539844144.reviewBody:
I might be a bit biased because I love just about anything involving the ocean. I really loved standing and watching the water below start forming and then hearing a low rumbling sound leading up to a gigantic eruption of water. You are able to stand close enough to it that if you'd like and if you are there at the right time - it will splash on you (which legend has will bring you a year of good luck). I got splashed enough that I should have about a decade or two of good luck. It was really fun. 
I also enjoyed the bus ride tour over there. Our tour guide was full of interesting information about the different places we passed along the way from town. 
Once there, if you enjoy bargaining for deals, this is a good place to try out your skills. There are many people lined up and down the street on the way to the blow hole trying to get you into their shops that line the street. Reading other reviews, I was expecting to practically be tackled by vendors selling their goods but that was not my experience. Yes, people would come up to you and start trying to get you to come to their shops but all were very friendly and it was easy just to say no or just keep walking if not interested. 
I defiitely thought it was worth my time.

539812174.name: Great place for a half day trip!
539812174.author: a TripAdvisor user
539812174.reviewBody: Yes, it\'s a tourist spot..  but, it delivers.  The shops actually have good deals in food and gifts,  and the restaurants at the end have beautiful Ocean views with good food.  I actually like mist of the Lobster dishes here better than in Puerto Nuevo!

539217726.name: Excellent time and lots of bartering at the Shops
539217726.author: a TripAdvisor user
539217726.reviewBody: There is such an atmosphere at the Blow Hole.  It sometimes takes a while to get the "special one" that goes sky high but definitely worth the wait.  Plenty of Souvenir shopping coming back from La Bufadora also.

539161252.name: Kayak tour with Baja Aquatics
539161252.author: a TripAdvisor user
539161252.reviewBody: The staff were friendly and made us feel safe at all times,  there were a range of experience levels and families with children as well.  I would recommend this tour to anyone as it was an easy paddle and the views are worth it.  The guides take you in small groups with in feet of the opening to La Bufadora for an amazing once in a lifetime view.

537762689.name: Weekend Fun
537762689.author: a TripAdvisor user
537762689.reviewBody: My friends and I had a great time. Shopping & eating tasty foods. Everything was pretty reasonable, as far as price. Nothing was too expensive. Alcohol was on hand, people walking around offering shots. The view of the ocean was nice at the very end. The waves rushing up high on the rocks, pretty cool. Lots of vendors begging you to buy from them. But other than that, nice place to visit at least once. Take a picture at the Ensenada sign.

536999876.name: Beautiful
536999876.author: a TripAdvisor user
