536999876.reviewBody: Such beautiful views and fresh air, and seeing La Bufadora was such an amazing sight to see. The area accepts US dollars as well which is very convenient.

535110089.name: Great experience \ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffd
535110089.author: a TripAdvisor user
535110089.reviewBody: Not too far from downtown ensenada, safe, but make sure to ask for prices before you purchase anything. I learned the hard way after realizing the pi\u00f1a colada i had order cost me $250 pesos $14 us dollars.

534985463.name: See blow hole with friends
534985463.author: a TripAdvisor user
534985463.reviewBody: We went to La Bufadora with 25 friends, booked online as a group. The tour company picked up us outside cruise port. We had one hour at La Bufadora, enjoyed to watch water shoot up to air to form a rainbow. We saw blow hole in Hawaii before, but La Bufadora shoots water much higher. We also tasted local food. It was a good trip!

533804763.name: Ensenada Oct 2017
533804763.author: a TripAdvisor user
533804763.reviewBody: This is one of the main reason we took this trip was to come to see La Bufadora.  The hill going down to the Bufadora is no paved with vendors on both sides.  There are three platforms or viewing areas once you get down into the area to see the water spray upward onto the rocks.  It is an amazing phonemeon.

533791052.name: Kayaking to La Bufadora
533791052.author: a TripAdvisor user
533791052.reviewBody: I went on a cruise excursion from Carnival cruise lines to kayak to La Bufadora. It was such a great experience! We went in May and the weather was cloudy, so it wasn\'t as warm as I would have liked (quite cold actually). But it was still a great experience! I saw that you can see La Bufadora from above, but I must really recommend kayaking. It gets you closer than you could otherwise! Plus it is really fun!

533621430.name: Its Ok
533621430.author: a TripAdvisor user
533621430.reviewBody: I\'m glad we didn\'t sign up to come here at the cruise which is expensive just to come here. We ride a taxi to Las Canadas and came here after. The things that they are selling is way to expensive, a Tshirt for $15USD, and so are the food. I rather gave a tip to the Man who is playing his Guitar and singing and not asking for anything. And end up stoping one of the small stall of Tamales on the road back which is a nice couple and food is great and price.

532440340.name: Cruise Shore Excursion
532440340.author: a TripAdvisor user
532440340.reviewBody:
My friends and I booked a shore Excursion to La Bufadora (blow hole) when we had a port stop while on Carnival Cruise Line. I actually book through Costco travel and saved a few dollars. 
It was fantastic! 
There's tons of vendors lined up on each side of the street when you walk to the blow hole. They are almost in your face wanting to sale you something! 
Our guide was Anna and she was totally amazing!!  She gave us plenty of suggestions how to handle the pressure. I mean pressure. I felt safe with her. She knows her way around and people did not seem to mess with her! 
Our bus driver was great too! 
 The public restrooms there cost 50 cent. If you have a dollar they don't give change back.

531787701.name: was beautiful to watch nature makes  its own  way to delight us
531787701.author: a TripAdvisor user
531787701.reviewBody: The water may not always  shoot up really high.  but wait there and watch the water swirling and enjoy the beauty of the scenery  and you will get a big on  where you will just jump back with the spray. Patience is the name of the game

531420739.name: If You\'re in Ensenada...Why Not??
531420739.author: a TripAdvisor user
531420739.reviewBody:
My husband and I visited Ensenada on a Carnival cruise. We started our morning with a leisurely walk before a massage at Ensenada Massage. Then we hung out a little on First Street. Lastly, we decided to catch an Uber to La Bufadora. 

The Trip There:

The ride was about a 45 minute drive from First Street. The entire ride was interesting for us. Our previous visit to Mexico was to Cozumel in the Caribbean so to see businesses such as Walmart, Sam's Club, Costco, Applebee's, Office Depot, Auto Zone, etc. in Ensenada was quite amusing. We saw homes and vendors and then the most amazing glimpses of the Pacific up winding roads as we neared our destination. 

When we arrived, we were "greeted" by vendors on both sides of the walkway to see the geyser. Keep walking if you don't want to purchase anything, but if you do, you can find some pretty good buys. 

Then for the long awaited view, La Bufadora. What a beautiful sight! We took several pictures and had a great vantage point as it wasn't too crowded the October Friday that we visited. The stronger the current, the higher the water shoots in the air.

Interesting Facts:

1. You have to pay 50 cent to use the on-site restroom. 

2. Our entire visit was adequate and less than an hour.

3. You can get a pineapple pina colada refill for $2 instead of $3 if you bargain. :-)

Our Uber driver agreed to wait for us for about 45 minutes while we walked around for a return trip of $20 USD (this included the wait time). 

Note: Be sure to check your final costs. Our original cost was quoted at $243 pesos (about $13 USD) and ended up costing us about $317 pesos (about $17 USD). Though the amount wasn't vastly different in dollars, this was not the original amount quoted in Uber. I didn't realize until after our ride and looking back at he app. The cost was still cheaper than the $50 round trip taxi ride, however.

529289401.name: Always fun to see
529289401.author: a TripAdvisor user
529289401.reviewBody: If you want a true tourist destination, it doesn\'t get more touristy than La Bufadora.  You have to run a gauntlet of food, curio, and everything else shops to get down to see it, but it\'s kind of fun.

526840356.name: amazing view
526840356.author: a TripAdvisor user
526840356.reviewBody: The blow hole pretty cool with beautiful view. I loved it lots of vendors cool places to visit, lots of food. I had amazing time with the family..

526764412.name: A must see!
526764412.author: a TripAdvisor user
526764412.reviewBody: The natural place is so beautiful BUT you have to walk through a Mexican market to access to the site.\nBe patient to get a spot and see the Bufadora because of the crowd \n

526610424.name: A must go to when in Ensenada
526610424.author: a TripAdvisor user
526610424.reviewBody:
La bufadora is an amazing place to go to! 
Our tour guide Rigo, was a very entertaining, informative and awesome tour guide! He 
made sure his tourists were well informed about the history of Ensenada and was very detailed in his stories. Rigo took the time to also ask his tourists if they had any questions and gave great advice about who or where to buy food and other souvenirs, He was very sincere and you could tell he loves what he does and does not dissappoint you during his tours!
Although I wish we would have had more time viewing the blow hole, I had an amazing experience..
The blow hole consists of one of a kind vendors, some try to get the most money off of you but others are very nice and work with you if you really like something, 
The blow hole has a pretty scenic view and and amazing rainbow if you catch it at the right time. Not to mention, you might get splashed by the amazing water!
The food there is great!  and I would recomend getting tacos right in front of where the bus leaves you. I will be dreaming of those tacos because they do not compare to anything like we have here at home.
I will definitely consider coming back! I had an amazing time!!

525294564.name: Family Vacation
525294564.author: a TripAdvisor user
525294564.reviewBody: Took the bus out to La Bufadora. About 40 minutes but worth it. Had a real knowledgeable and funny guide for the drive. The blow hole was very cool and the scenery around is beautiful. Very picture worthy! Cool shopping with some really good food. Killer fish tacos at the stand by the parking lot going in!

525019033.name: Atv tour
525019033.author: a TripAdvisor user
525019033.reviewBody: We rented an ATV from Ensenada and took the route to La bufadora. The ride is about an hour. The place itself is so crowded with so many visitors and giftshops. They have nice restaurants but a little bit overpriced. If you are on a cruise ship it\'s a nice way to get away and see this wonder. I would recommend renting ATV to go there instead of taking tour from the ship. At least the experience will be memorable.

524700155.name: A must-see in northern Baja
524700155.author: a TripAdvisor user
524700155.reviewBody: La Bufadora is \'The Blowhole\' in Spanish. A knowledgeable friend sez it is the highest in the world. Donno, but it blows high. Crowds are close enough to get wet. Lots of restaurants and small shops. LOTS. Large crowds, lots of paid parking ... but not expensive parking. GREAT views ... sorta like the Italian coast.

524238510.name: Blowhole@ La Bufadora
524238510.author: a TripAdvisor user
524238510.reviewBody: This was both amazing and disappointing! Disappointing because you can\'t actually see the actual source, which is why it\'s not 5 stars. Amazing because the amazing repeated water shoots high up into the air and surrounding rocks every few minutes at varying heights right in front of you! Worth the 45 minute bus ride to get there to witness the beauty of Mother Nature!

523241848.name: La La Bufadora
523241848.author: a TripAdvisor user
523241848.reviewBody: Dont miss out on this amazing experience, it is a must.  The wonderment of it continual action is great picture taking...

522643046.name: Fun diversion
522643046.author: a TripAdvisor user
522643046.reviewBody: My spouse and I heard of this place, and thought we would visit while we were in Ensenada. It was a 30 to 40 minute drive through the countryside, which we really enjoyed. If you drive yourself there, which we did, you have to pay about $2 USD for parking. Not bad, considering that they guard your vehicle for you. There are many vendors and little restaurants along the long street you have to go down to get to the La Bufadora.  Each vendor tries to convince you to visit their shop. They speak English & some are quite humorous in their attempts to convince you to visit their store. There were a number of strollers to rent, which we didn\'t need, but in case whoever is reading needs one. We saw a pretty squirrel scampering around near the La Bufadora. We bought some churros there (our local friends told us to ask them to make a fresh, hot batch for us and they kindly did so, upon our request) and then we stopped for yummy tamales, at a roadside stand, on the way back to Ensenada. It was a positive experience & we had a good time.

522073705.name: Hot and packed
522073705.author: a TripAdvisor user
522073705.reviewBody: It was ok. Guess just to say we went. Nothing overly special to see. It was a hot day! And its a long walk to it once you park. If you have small kids id say skip it.

522005002.name: La Bufadora- Go to say you went
522005002.author: a TripAdvisor user
522005002.reviewBody: La Bufadora is great to go to say you have been, but the marine geyser loses it\'s majesty when you walk through a quarter mile of aggressive street vendors to reach the blow hole. It\'s a substantial drive/bus ride out of Ensenada so plan on the bulk of your time being travel, especially if you need to get back to a cruise ship. Our guide was great, but understand you are being ushered into a tourist shopping trap. Great- if you are looking for fake Louis but Not So Great- if you want to take in a natural wonder. Overall go and enjoy the diversity of watching material and natural wonders collide. *There is no free bathroom so you will need to be prepared to pay a toll to go.

520232291.name: Not worth the time
520232291.author: a TripAdvisor user
520232291.reviewBody:
Flea market is crazy aggressive with vendors getting mad if you aren't interested. Even if you are polite.
The blow hole wasn't blowing.
The view is beautiful though and prices are great. I bought a hand painted plate for $6.
My friend got vanilla, small bottle for $4.
Cab ride from cruise terminal $30 each, he waited, took us horseback
Riding on the beach $20 each. 
Stopped so we could grab cash.
I think the price was a little high but we were very happy with him.

520105827.name: 45 min drive from Ensenada, street filled with vendors, crowded with people, blow hole
520105827.author: a TripAdvisor user
520105827.reviewBody: We drove about 45 minutes south of Ensenada to reach this attraction, you pay a few dollars to park and then walk down a street filled with vendors selling things. Don\'t buy from the first person you talk to, chances are you will find it cheaper as you get further down the street. You can talk someone down and then go to another vendor and use the lowest price agreed upon to get an even lower price. After talking one guy down on a hammock, we found hammocks down the street for even less than the amount we had come down to with the first vendor. If you buy a pineapple drink they can be refilled at other vendors for only $2.00. La Bufadora was super busy when we visited on a Sunday afternoon in August. We had to wait 10 minutes to get up to the front to see the water spurting out.  We back tracked and went higher up the cliff and found a nice view with fewer people in the way.  We tried to find other things to do or see in the area, but we could not. I gave it a 4 out of 5 stars because it was not as cool as some blow holes I\'ve seen in HI.

519551607.name: Ultimate tourist trap!!!
519551607.author: a TripAdvisor user
519551607.reviewBody:
We (a couple) visited La Bufadora after leaving Carnival Inspiration cruise ship that made a stop in Ensenada. As most of the people on cruise, we were attracted by the price of the tour. 3 hours tour for 30 dollars each person looked promising in contrast to 200 dollar tours. However, it ended up to be an ultimate tourist trap that we have never experienced before.

First, our guide didn't tell us anything in 3 hours besides giving us lame lesson in Spanish language like how to say "hi" and "how are you" and recommending "the best" places to buy souvenirs.

Second, after stepping out of a bus, we got harassed by hundreds of locals to buy anything starting from tequila and finishing with Chinese toys. It was very hard to avoid shop sellers as they were conveniently blocking the only walking street that lead us to La Bufadora. 

Finally, when we made it to the natural wonder of Ensenada, we realized that it didn't worth it even that there are only few marine geysers around the world. Instead, we believed that Ensenada and all places around has nothing else to sell for tourists, so something is better than nothing.

All in all, visit it in case you don't want to spend a fortune. Just make sure that you won't leave it in hands of a local sellers.

518963652.name: Packed and a bit far out
518963652.author: a TripAdvisor user
518963652.reviewBody: It was nice to drive along the cliffs but a one stop attraction. Vendors are selling the same stuff they are selling all over Mexico. Couldn\'t even see the blowhole due to minimal space. Cool to go once but I won\'t go there again.

516833442.name: Nice to see on a good day, bad to see on a non-blowing day
516833442.author: a TripAdvisor user
516833442.reviewBody:
This is a blow hole. If it is blowing, it is fun to see, but most of the time it is just blowing 10 - 15 feet into the air. 

There is a toco place as you first enter the street/walkway to the blow hole on the right hand side that is super good.

Your entire walk down the the blow hole are shops and people pushing their wares.

515039457.name: Great marvel
515039457.author: a TripAdvisor user
515039457.reviewBody: I had been there about 15 years before, but every time it\'s an amazing thing to see !!  The street is lined with vendors.  Always remember to haggle, items are priced very high!!!

514426182.name: Would rather of gone to our local flea market
514426182.author: a TripAdvisor user
514426182.reviewBody: There was nothing special here, the market was packed, but only offered selections that I could find in any Los Angeles Flea market or Swap Meet.  The tacos were good, and the beer cold, but again, nothing that made me want to come back to this place.

513472186.name: Decent place to many commerce
513472186.author: a TripAdvisor user
513472186.reviewBody: This is a beautiful natural spot, BUT it is full of shops that are horrible. I would never recomend this place but it is a nice view once you are there.\n

512982762.name: Beautiful scenery
512982762.author: a TripAdvisor user
512982762.reviewBody: We\'ve taken a trip here twice in recent months and find it an attraction that draws you in. The ocean water is a magnificent array of blue.  You can take in the rugged coastline and hear the waves crash against the rooks.  The walk to the blow hole is lined with vendors.  You can eat, drink and be merry while shopping for that perfect souvenir.  When you reach the blow hole, you will find you are not alone.  This attraction can get crowded at times but you won\'t want to miss the awe of La Bufadora!\nThis attraction does have pay parking and pay restrooms for very reasonable prices.

512868353.name: Nice place in Baja
512868353.author: a TripAdvisor user
512868353.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a nice / different natural attraction about 45 minutes south of Ensenada, Baja. I have been to Ensenada many times, and la bufadora is a usual stop. There are many vendors as you walk to la bufadora as well as restaurants. \nIf you go on the weekends, or peak seasons it might be a little too crowded. (Everything closes at around 630pm, and opens at about 10am).

512475569.name: Gorgeous
512475569.author: a TripAdvisor user
512475569.reviewBody: We took a trip to la bufadora. It was about 10+ yrs since I\'ve been there. Completely different lot\'s of vendors and plenty to drink\ud83c\udf7b\ud83c\udf78

512284132.name: Worth a look
512284132.author: a TripAdvisor user
512284132.reviewBody: Excellent attraction with loads of vendors on the approach Paid parking available. Watch for the sellers they are a bit pushy.

511078683.name: Great place
511078683.author: a TripAdvisor user
511078683.reviewBody: Beautiful place to visit. Just make sure you stand at the lowest point near the back wall for the best experience.

510645198.name: Family of 3 and daughter\'s friend traveling on a cruise into Ensenada, Baja California.
510645198.author: a TripAdvisor user
510645198.reviewBody: We loved it.  Beautiful, natural occurring phenomena.  There are a lot of vendors to walk through on the Street, but our tour guide led us into the most "safe" areas, and then to the blow hole itself.  We stayed for the fully allotted time, and shopped a bit. I bought a beautiful, hand painted sea shell with a scene showing the blow hole, and it was very colorful, and a nice keepsake for $3.00!!!

507919938.name: It\'s not a big deal
507919938.author: a TripAdvisor user
507919938.reviewBody: I been wanting to go to the bufadora for many years and to be honest the long drive to get there was not worth it,  I guess its a one time thing!.  We stayed in Rosarito so we took an hour and half drive to get there, there were tons and tons of people there, the walk ways are filled with vendors and I guess that makes it a little more interesting to be honest, there were lots of people by the are were the water blows we had to make our way thru people to get to the edge, and all you see is a bit of water blown up.\n\nOverall I would say this is a one time visit.

507915774.name: Don\'t waste your time
507915774.author: a TripAdvisor user
507915774.reviewBody: First off, I would say definitely DO NOT GO ON THE WEEKEND.  We went on a Saturday, and I expected there would be a lot of people, but it was SOOOO crowded. I couldn\'t even see anything, just an occasional bit of water in the air.   Secondly, you have to walk through a corridor of vendors selling trinkets that is about 1/2 mile long, and there is no way around that.   Maybe during the week it\'s different, but for me it was a complete waste of time.

507882555.name: Cool place
507882555.author: a TripAdvisor user
507882555.reviewBody: This is a classic Ensenada destination. It\'s a nice place to go with family. They have tons of curio shops, also. I recommend getting a pi\u00f1a colada, they\'re very good!

507630109.name: Lots of airborne water!
507630109.author: a TripAdvisor user
507630109.reviewBody: Actually, there are only a few places on earth that have blow holes based on tide. It\'s pretty cool to watch the spouts! Can get wet if you want. Also, lots of tourist hops and a few eateries.

507619128.name: Very interesting site - Happy we went
507619128.author: a TripAdvisor user
507619128.reviewBody: La Bufadora is definitely a must see site when in Ensenada. Some words of caution. Yes, it is a bit of a drive, but not too bad - took me 30 mins from the center of town, but I went on a Monday and there was no traffic. You will pay for parking as others have stated - about $3.00 - no big deal. I guess we were there at high tide or close to it - the water at times was shooting up to the top of the rocks and getting everyone wet - very impressive and lots of fun. Once I was there my family and I were happy we went. There are two trails, a lower one where you may get wet, and a higher trail that will give you a more complete view. You drove all this way so might as well take the short hike to the top (less than 5 mins- called "El Mirador" on signs) as well and take in the great view.  Also as others have stated, once you park it is about 10 min walk through a line of shops. Yes the vendors will try selling to you and the prices are more expensive than in town, but if you do not want to buy anything just ignore the vendors and they will leave you alone.

507580344.name: Not as impressive as I remember it
507580344.author: a TripAdvisor user
507580344.reviewBody:
LA Bufadora is a must see for those with the time staying in the Ensenada area. I hadn't been here in over 25 years. I just didn't find it as enthralling as I did when I was younger.
I especially didn't care for the many dozens of vendors and junk stands.
 I suppose everyone has to make a buck one way or another. There were plenty of people there for a week day, so at least the local economy is doing well.

If you have a free day I would strongly suggest spending it at one of the local beaches.

507483739.name: Must do when in Ensenada
507483739.author: a TripAdvisor user
507483739.reviewBody: I have been to this place a few times and it is always a nice tourist destination. The star is the ocean! Everything around it is a nice way to see the Mexican culture. There is a lot to see and buy as you enter and exit the area. One can spend 30 minutes or a couple of hours here. It is great for families too.

507255163.name: Not as spectacular as expected
507255163.author: a TripAdvisor user
507255163.reviewBody: We expected some more spectacular water explosions. Perhaps it depends on the the time of day. Very very very busy place on a Sunday. Hard to get a taxi to bet away from there.

506606298.name: Definitely Awesome
506606298.author: a TripAdvisor user
506606298.reviewBody: The drive here isn\'t too long, but its hardly short.  Its an awesome place to visit, with little shops, along the way.  The pina coladas are awesome too, straight out of the coconut itself.  If you like nature and beautiful scenery, you will love this place.

505988553.name: Meh
505988553.author: a TripAdvisor user
505988553.reviewBody: I was expecting more to be honest but nobody can control the ocean but the blowhole itself just was not doing much, we might have been a little early as many vendors were still closed, will definitely come back and give it another shot in the future..

505902427.name: Fun and entertaining
505902427.author: a TripAdvisor user
505902427.reviewBody:
I went with my family to La Bufadora. The Bufadora itself was a beautiful experience.    However, there is not much to do there. As other reviews have mention, there is a parking lot that is really close by. In addition, there are sales people that litteraly get in your face to try to get you to buy. 

I took my two toddler children and they loved it. While there there was a small station that gives children the opportunity to paint. In that same spot, there was a man whom can draw a picture of you. The pictures look amazing and watching him actually create them was nice.

If you don't minf the dtive and would like to experience the Bufadora. Then you will enjoy it. But, do not go if you are expecting to do more than that. You can always go back to the embarcadero in Ensenada and enjoy museums.

505318407.name: the bufadora is amazing, the way there NOT
505318407.author: a TripAdvisor user
505318407.reviewBody: we went to la bufadora this past friday. it is amazing to watch and wait and see when it rises! other than that, it\'s pretty much a mess. garbage all over, the walk there from the dirt parking lot you pay to park at, is quite long, and you pass one shanty stall after another selling trinkets, and drinks and food. very agressive sellers too. the mexican government should take over and clean the place up! i think i would actually recommend watching a video of it on u tube, and not waste the two hours to get there and back from ensenada. it\'s too bad it\'s such a mess.

505309908.name: Not as rare as you think but worth a visit. Much cleaner now too.
505309908.author: a TripAdvisor user
505309908.reviewBody: My recent (return) trip was a pleasant surprise. The locals have done a nice job cleaning the place up and it show they are trying to protect their little treasure. I recommend (if possible) park as close as possible but DO NOT go past the first few shops. Although you still can dive down the street of shops, don\'t be that annoying person. The parking even close by is only $3. Everyone sales the same stuff so don\'t feel pressured to buy right away. The only exception is the Pineapple drink. But don\'t be fooled. Barter to get the price down a bit and be sure they remove the core (just ask nicely or even jokingly) to make more room in the pineapple. You can get refills along the way. Churros are made fresh but don\'t eat too many, the grease will make your stomach a little squirly (unless you are used to greasy food) but don\'t blame it on "Monteczuma\'s revenge" as that is unmistakable. Spend some time at the "snorter" as you will get some really nice ones.Stand to the end and you will also get some nice spray. Be sure to listen for the deep rumbling ones, they are the big ones.

503980980.name: Beautiful
503980980.author: a TripAdvisor user
503980980.reviewBody: Really cool attraction, with tons of things for tourists to see and purchase... My favorite was the clams on the half shell, I still think of them months later!!!

503676625.name: Amazing view and awesome seafood
503676625.author: a TripAdvisor user
503676625.reviewBody: The taco restaurant right next to the bus stop is the best. Everything is freshly made. I had the best taco ever, and of course, super cheap $2. Before you get to the blow hole, you will go through a flee markets. The people are aggressive but they are harmless. They will try to give you food samples. Feel free to enjoy :) they are all good. When we go close to the ocean, the view is just awesome!! It was beautiful.... usually crowded but not too crazily crowded. you can shot some cool slow motion videos when the water shoot up in the air.... Don\'t forget to eat the grilled fresh giant clams and shrimps from those vendors next to the ocean.

502664653.name: Awesome place
502664653.author: a TripAdvisor user
502664653.reviewBody: Loved it. Is around 35 minutes from downtown Ensenada and worth the trip. Try to park as close as possible some people will guide you to park way far, ignore them get as close to the entrance as possible there are many parking places.  Go with and empty stomach cause food is everywhere loved it.

502602586.name: Big market, and a blow hole
502602586.author: a TripAdvisor user
502602586.reviewBody: If you\'re willing to drive through Ensenada, then to the end of the road, you\'ll end up at the tourist trap known as La Bufadora. It\'s pretty cool but I think I\'d want to come back when it\'s less crowded, not a Saturday in the summer.

502071418.name: Enjoyed la Bufadora Spouting Off
502071418.author: a TripAdvisor user
502071418.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a phenomenon that is worth the visit. It is incredible how the water shoots up with every ocean swell. Every 45 seconds to a minute it goes again making steam-like hissing noises as the water gushes upward. And contrary to what one reviewer said, it really doesn\'t matter whether you see it at high or low tide. We were there at low tide and it was spectacular. \n\nOne thing to note is that if you\'re driving yourself you will have to pay for parking. It\'s not expensive but a little bit of a surprise. Also make note that you will be coerced into parking before the "turistico" shops on the street but you may be able to find parking (also for a fee) if you drive through the street past the vendors saving the 5-10 minutes walking time. Another advantage of parking closer is you will have less of a hassle with the street vendors.

501983256.name: Worth It
501983256.author: a TripAdvisor user
501983256.reviewBody: Although the blow hole is pretty continuous there are also other things to do.  Eat some Tacos at the recommended vendor- clean food, near entrance. Spent time cuddling with some baby lions, tigers at one of the central restaurants.  It is hard to get time to shop if you are with a tour...

501781068.name: Too many vendors
501781068.author: a TripAdvisor user
501781068.reviewBody: Wear comfy shoes & cool clothes. Long walk through ALL the vendors. The alcoholic fresh pina coladas were worth it! Bring a video camera or camera. The viewing point walk up is better.

500771848.name: Had a blast!
500771848.author: a TripAdvisor user
500771848.reviewBody: When you get off the ship there are buses out front that cost a few dollars each which will take you into town. I recommend this. But the company takes you to a site in town in which they also sell tours. You can do this or just walk around town. The tours here are very inexpensive. Don\'t book tours on the ship use these guys. Ziplining was only $7! Local tour guides on the buses give great local advice on buying things, where to eat, what not to do, Etc. The blowhole is kind of cool but only for a few minutes. But to get there you have to go through the gauntlet of Street vendors. If you\'re prepared for an ignore the pressure it is fun. They hand out free samples which are very good, candies are excellent. Met some nice local people. Met a few bushy ones. Make sure you go see the baby tigers and support their cause. Ask the tour guides are locals and they will guide you to The Establishment where they live.

500568628.name: La Bufadora
500568628.author: a TripAdvisor user
500568628.reviewBody: Is La Bufadora one of the seven wonders of the world? It should be. Spectacular beyond description. Worth waiting around for a big blow of the ocean geyser. Worth any crowds & the slightly obnoxious touristy stuff to see this precious place. On the turnoff from Ensenada, you\'ll see roadside stands with local honey/wine/olives.... stop and buy everything hey have because it\'s all excellent and you won\'t find it anywhere else.

499951321.name: Worth a stop.
499951321.author: a TripAdvisor user
499951321.reviewBody: We enjoyed our stop at the blowhole.  There are a ton of vendors selling everything from tasty local fare, grilled clams and elote, to Chinese made trinkets and stuff no one needs. Shop wisely and don\'t be afraid to negotiate.  Beers at on vendor were $2.5 and the same beers a couple stalls down were about $1.  Don\'t schedule more than 2-3 hours.

499932005.name: Great View, Simple But Good Fare
499932005.author: a TripAdvisor user
499932005.reviewBody: Whenever in La Bufadora, this is where I eat. Sometimes I will drive out there simply to have lunch. The atmosphere is rustic and the view of the Pacific from the patio is beautiful. The food, the view, the venue all work together beautifully.

499705232.name: Make sure you go early and dont park in the middle!
499705232.author: a TripAdvisor user
499705232.reviewBody: Fun place , one of the well known places to visit while down in Ensenada.  It gets very busy though.  You can find many cool things to buy, keepsakes and gifts.  Great food to taste and the famous Pi\u00f1as!

499549429.name: the blow hole tour
499549429.author: a TripAdvisor user
499549429.reviewBody: The tour was very informative, Gloria was very knowledgeable and gave good direction about where to stop and shop or eat at.  However, we traveled with my mother who has difficulty walking on uneven surfaces and Gloria walked very fast and left us behind. So if you are travelng with someone who doesn\'t walk quickly, use a wheelchair. Also the bathrooms cost .50 so bring money if you will be using one.

499547720.name: Meh. Cool splash explosion but...
499547720.author: a TripAdvisor user
499547720.reviewBody: Cool splash explosion but no WOW factor. It was great to hang out there and walk through the \'tianguis\' market and see what vendors had to offer.

498887902.name: good sight seeing
498887902.author: a TripAdvisor user
498887902.reviewBody: the site is very interesting, pina coladas are cheap, but beware of the vendors, haggle with them to get good prices, they see you coming and charge accordingly, also be very aware of counterfits, silver that is not and name brands, etc

498282499.name: Glad I went once, but wouldn\'t go again
498282499.author: a TripAdvisor user
498282499.reviewBody: I have heard a lot about la bufadora from previous trips but I had never been to see it myself. I finally made the trip down and I was not exactly impressed. The blowhole itself was pretty cool, but it was so crowded that you would have to wait at least 20 minutes to get a good view. The souvenir stalls were the same as you would find anywhere else in Mexico but they try to get more money out of you since it\'s a big tourist spot. We ended up hanging out at the Habana Banana bar for a while and all the staff was really fun, friendly and made great drinks. The beat part of the trip was the drive to get to la bufadora from Ensenada, there are some incredible views from the mountain roads. Glad I went at least once, but I\'m not sure if I would go again.

496709606.name: Great day trip!!
496709606.author: a TripAdvisor user
496709606.reviewBody: Went with adults and children and had a blast! Lots of stores and restaurants to visit. The grilled oysters with cheese and shrimp were amazing! They had alcohol for the adults as well which was nice. It\'s a very big tourist spot so they will jack up prices but bargaining was not hard to do. Beautiful walk along the ocean cliffs and great scenery.

494895699.name: One of the best adventures
494895699.author: a TripAdvisor user
494895699.reviewBody: I loved the culture it was so amazing to see, it was so fun. There is a bunch of really cool shops to look at I loved this trip

494885461.name: Meeeh !!
494885461.author: a TripAdvisor user
494885461.reviewBody: Its only open on the date that coincide with the arrival of the cruise ships. So if you go on a random weekend .. it will be hit or miss. The Bufadora is more like a "geyser" the turbulent waters will create a "blow hole" every so often but nothing epic... there are food vendors all over the place and junk to buy along the way.

494716529.name: A natural beauty!
494716529.author: a TripAdvisor user
494716529.reviewBody: It is a short distance from Ensenada. Driving makes this trip more enjoyable since you can stop by at many local vendors. The bufadora site is clean and has too many vendors (all types) . You will never be bored. However, the bufadora is just the best of all! The water splashing is amazing! The cost for parking is $3. A nice place to bring children!

494009831.name: Classic
494009831.author: a TripAdvisor user
494009831.reviewBody: My family has been coming to the Baja Norte area for over 40 years. The blowhole is a must see if you\'re trying for the Baja experience. No complaints about the vendors or crowds, that is a part of the experience. It\'s classic Baja tourism and a really neat natural wonder.

493925327.name: Through the gauntlet to the blow hole
493925327.author: a TripAdvisor user
493925327.reviewBody: We visited La Bufadora and found the street of vendors to be much like a gauntlet.   That said the vendors as well as the blow hole were well worth the time and effort.

492883877.name: Weekend visit
492883877.author: a TripAdvisor user
492883877.reviewBody: Be prepared for crowds and open market vendors.  Do get the seafood grilled on the clam half shell, so good!  Vendors accept both pesos and dollars.

492814216.name: Must see!
492814216.author: a TripAdvisor user
492814216.reviewBody: The La Bufadora is something everyone must see. It is a beautiful natural wonder. The town that you walk through is fun. Just remember before you commit to buy anything lock in a price.

490867988.name: Nice getaway from Enenada...lots of local shops!
490867988.author: a TripAdvisor user
490867988.reviewBody: Got of a Carnival cruise..rented a car and drive for about 30 minutes in what turned out to be a super scenic drive. The shops leading up to La Bufodara hosts tonnes is items including souvenirs, caps, handicrafts, food...etc...\nThe blow hole was allright....I mean if u take away the scenic drive and the shops...I would give it a three star!

490226025.name: Interesting short trip from Ensenada
490226025.author: a TripAdvisor user
490226025.reviewBody:
About 30 minutes from downtown and it's an interesting drive.
I recommend parking before the arch that welcomes you to bufadora. Parking is 50 pesos. I imagine trying to drive through the path where all the vendors are would be hell. Speaking of the vendors, you will be walking through a very long path with extremely aggressive vendors lining both sides. Just shake your head, say no or ignore them. If you come early like before 8am, they're not even set up yet so you'll have a nice peaceful walk to the blowhole. Oxxo is open though should you need a coffee or something.
You will have to pay to use restrooms. It's not much: 8 pesos or 50 cents. Try to bring some quarters with you.
The blowhole itself is kinda cool. You probably won't spend more than a couple of hours here though.

489971162.name: The blow hole
489971162.author: a TripAdvisor user
489971162.reviewBody: We decided to do a tour to La Bufadora in Ensenada because we have a 11 month old which was perfect for us because she loved it! I couldn\'t even get a picture of her looking at the camera because she wouldn\'t stop looking out into the ocean and got super excited when the water blew up from the blow hole. It was an amazing experience!

487695414.name: Visiting La Buffadora
487695414.author: a TripAdvisor user
487695414.reviewBody: Interesting visit with impressive wave "blow hole"! Street vendors line path to site! Enjoyed by some, derided by others! Part of the local color of Baja.

486641108.name: La Bufadora
486641108.author: a TripAdvisor user
486641108.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a natural blow hole in the beach rocks. It is interesting and sometimes exciting, depending on time of year you visit, when the water shoots up high. Note it\'s not as exciting if it\'s at the wrong time and the water is just splashing. There\'s a little shopping in the area and what I think are the best churros...yummy. Keep in mind it\'s a long, curvy drive so if you are sensitive to motion sickness you may want to take medicine, etc.  Some people may find it not worth the long drive.

486153417.name: Looks a little worse for wear
486153417.author: a TripAdvisor user
486153417.reviewBody: I\'ve been to La Bufadora many times, but not for about 5 years. It\'s pretty much the same as far as the vendors go, and even a couple of new restaurants, but the area around the blowhole is looking a little shabby. However, the blowhole is still doing its job spectacularly!

484776363.name: Is this a natural wonder or a market?
484776363.author: a TripAdvisor user
484776363.reviewBody: The sea waves rushing into the cliff, bursting in froth is something worth seeing, if you are in the area. But to get there, you have to walk about a kilometer through stalls and street vendors that will ambush you with free samples of candy, churros, pi\u00f1a colada and many other things. They offer sea food cocktails, corn on the cob, coconuts and souvenirs, half of which are Chinese.  A nice thing is that you can rent a stroller or a wheel chair, and the path is accesible. Also, the parking lots are well organized and at a reasonable cost.\nI spite of the crowds, the place was clean, with a lot of trash cans, I only wish the visitor would obey the signs and prohibitions. I saw a group climbing the slopes and a couple of little girls sitting dangerously on the edge, getting their feet wet with the gusher, leaning to see the water approaching.

484197617.name: A bit overrated!!!!
484197617.author: a TripAdvisor user
484197617.reviewBody:
It takes a while to get here so be prepared. If you come at the wrong time be assured there will be HORRIBLE traffic. If you have really high expectations you will be let down. Then there's the annoying walk to La Bufadora from your parking spot - which will not be free. There are throngs of vendors assailing you from every side. You will be called amigo tons of time LOL!!!! Worst of all this walk is fairly long.

There are tons of people at La Bufadora and finding a spot to film or photograph it will take quite a while at most times of the day. La Bufadora itself is not as cool as I thought it would be. I thought it would be more like a geyser but it's more like a huge splash of water against rocks. It is what it is. It's not a must see by any means but I do not really regret going there just to say I went there.

What can I do without at La Bufadora?

The vendors and the crowds.

What stands out at La Bufadora?

It's kind of overrated.

Four stars!!!! La Bufadora is really ridiculously great!!!!

483076380.name: Amazing blowhole and vendor shops
483076380.author: a TripAdvisor user
483076380.reviewBody: Great view of the Pacific and one of the largest blowholes in the world.  The sound and explosion of water into the air is awe inspiring and you can get wet. Walking down the vendor alley was extremely enjoyable. Variety of items to buy and food to taste, we even stopped by the exotic zoo and paid a fee to take pictures and hold a baby tiger.

482728321.name: what a fun time
482728321.author: a TripAdvisor user
482728321.reviewBody: this place was so cool. just keep in mind that the people need to make money and they can be very pushy, but keep your ground and don\'t pay the first price they give and you can get some great deals here.

481984373.name: Great place
481984373.author: a TripAdvisor user
481984373.reviewBody: We visited La Bufadora (blowhole) whilst on a four day cruise out of Long Beach. Wow what a sight to see, a must see if your unsure what to do whilst on this cruise & we had a very confident, cheeky young tour guide. It\'s such a shame that you have to fight to & from through a street market. The place is a quarter of a mile walk on uneven ground from the coach which is not mentioned when booking.

481482608.name: must see in Ensenada, Mexico
481482608.author: a TripAdvisor user
481482608.reviewBody: a major attraction in Ensenada, Mexico. it is a natural spout by the sea that shoot sea water about 100 feet into the air.  It is located about 20 miles from city center.  have to join local tour to get there.

481433664.name: Ok, not great
481433664.author: a TripAdvisor user
481433664.reviewBody: Pretty cool geologic feature. Not a fan of the 5000 pushy vendors on the way up to see the actual feature. If you\'re here might as well go but don\'t expect anything amazing.

481073042.name: Average attraction, but good experience overall.
481073042.author: a TripAdvisor user
481073042.reviewBody: It\'s worth going because there is a good taco place and shopping where it is. I\'ve seen it twice, the first time was just bad timing, and I don\'t think we saw it at all. \n\nSecond time we saw it, but nothing terribly amazing about it.

481065633.name: A gauntlet run to the water.
481065633.author: a TripAdvisor user
481065633.reviewBody:
I first went to the blow hole while on a cruise.  Negotiated with a taxi driver to take us over for more than half off what the cruise ship charged.  Interesting drive down to the spot through some curvy hills at the end.

Expect a gauntlet of vendors to get through to reach the blow hole.  It was pretty good when we were there at high tide.  Lots of splash.  I have also been to the blow hole in Australia and this one was bigger while I was there.  

For food I would recommend buying the churros, the fresh fruit smoothies and the fish tacos at the stand at the entrance.  Have been a couple of times now when we have new people with us.

480305519.name: just ok visit
480305519.author: a TripAdvisor user
480305519.reviewBody: Nothing spectacular... but we thought the driving there was a lot more fun (what a great view of the pacific ocean!). And yes, I recommend this place for shopping and eating experience too...

475384523.name: What fun!!!
475384523.author: a TripAdvisor user
475384523.reviewBody: Visiting Ensenada on our honeymoon through Princess Cruises. We chose this excursion and are SO glad we did!!! It was so much fun! This is a must see. We shopped at a local open air market and then went to La Bufadora. See pictures below!!

475051645.name: Seen other blowholes -- this one is the most amazing!
475051645.author: a TripAdvisor user
475051645.reviewBody: Watching the water explode into the air is really neat to watch!  Have seen blowholes in Hawaii, but this one is the master.  Great photo and video spot.  Lots of entertainment just walking along the street to get to it as well.

474415877.name: Family friendly
474415877.author: a TripAdvisor user
474415877.reviewBody: Beautiful phenomena. One of three blowholes in the world ( according to our tour guide). Lots of places to eat seafood, drink pi\u00f1a coladas, micheladas. Tons of places to shop.

473497447.name: Fun Day
473497447.author: a TripAdvisor user
473497447.reviewBody: We arrived into Ensenada via cruise ship and on the shuttle into town, the shuttle company also had tours to La Bufadora. We booked through them for only $15/person - great deal! Our guide gave us a great overview of Ensenada on the way there. There are hundreds of vendors there with everything imaginable. We did a small amount of shopping - make sure you barter! La Bufadora was really cool - make sure you get wet, it\'s good luck! Fun day for just a little $$$.

471989880.name: Don\'t book trough the Cruise Ship
471989880.author: a TripAdvisor user
471989880.reviewBody: We got off the boat thinking we were just going to ride the shuttle into town which cost $2.  When we got on the shuttle into town they offered tours of La Bufadora for $15.  This is half the price that the cruise ship offered.  We decided to book it and we were not disappointed.  We LOVED our tour guide Alexa, a young, informed, fun guide.  She gave us many shopping tips and even shared the best place to use the restroom (Habana Banana).  She told us her favorite pina colada place, the best place to sample churros, and the best places to purchase "real" items and not be ripped off.  She also recommended the best place to try fish tacos and we were not disappointed by Lidia\'s Taco Grill.  La Bufadora is a wonderful natural formation that displays the power of the tides.  The day we visited the geyers was very active and we often saw a rainbow!  Highly recommend going to get a flavor of Mexican culture and natural beauty!

470946052.name: Beautiful but hectic
470946052.author: a TripAdvisor user
470946052.reviewBody: If you can make it to the actual blowhole through the flea market portion then you deserve a free t-shirt. The people that work in the booths at the flea market are RELENTLESS. They do everything but actually pull your arm and drag you over to their products. It kind of overshadows the blowhole itself, honestly. Then once you\'ve survived that, if you have to use the bathroom you better have $.50 be ause they even charge for that.

466650551.name: Kind of cool
466650551.author: a TripAdvisor user
466650551.reviewBody:
La Bufadora is a rock formation through which waves shoot up and create a geyser effect...water goes inot the air and you will often see a rainbow.
After the first few times, you've see it.
Great views are abundant in the area. The street leading up to La Bufadora is lined with booths with salesmen pushing tequila, souvenirs, viagra, pictures with tiger cubs, and cheap knock off bags and garments that they make like are the real thing (one trick - they will run a lit lighter over a purse to show it's not plastic - it must be REAL. Meaningless.) 
Fun to shop, to see the stuff, to haggle. The view is pretty.  But the main attraction is a nice few minutes, not as amazing as it is described.
And the shopping is the same going through the main street downtown.

466521873.name: Blow holes
466521873.author: a TripAdvisor user
466521873.reviewBody: Nice place .. must see the place ...0ne blow will take your stress away ... \u2764\ufe0f  you can go shopping like in flea market .. taste the good pinacolada chorrus tacos and grilled clam wt shrimp .. delicious

465861504.name: Not in correct spot on map
465861504.author: a TripAdvisor user
465861504.reviewBody: Fun place shop eat street food coconuts fried churros walk a round take pictures maybe with a lion drink margarita best at going into high tide beautiful rock cliff ocean great place to watch sunset but closes up before dark

465684164.name: Excursion from Cruise Ship!
465684164.author: a TripAdvisor user
465684164.reviewBody: Booked the tour thru Carnival Miracle as last stop on 15 day Hawaiian cruise.  Tour guide Leslie was awesome, very knowledgeable of Ensenada area.  Once arrived at LaBufadora, walked as a group down to the blow hole site while navigating through the crowded shop areas.  The view was spectacular, especially being there at sundown!   Saw migrating whales plus active dolphins from the LaBufadora viewing area.  Many photo ops during the tour.  Would definitely like to visit this area for a longer stay!!

464787009.name: Beautiful place
464787009.author: a TripAdvisor user
464787009.reviewBody: Amazing sights.  Excellent food - clams, churros and fish tacos are a must try. Delicious. Flea market can be a bit annoying with everyone trying to get you to buy something but it has nice souvenirs (just need to bargain).

463835930.name: No Ensenada trip is complete without this stop
463835930.author: a TripAdvisor user
463835930.reviewBody: La Bufadora, also known as the Blow Hole, is a very unique natural phenomenon where water juts hundreds of feet into the air as waves crash along the cove. No trip to Ensenada would be complete without stopping at this location...it\'s roughly a 30 minute drive from town.

463336417.name: Worth the trip
463336417.author: a TripAdvisor user
463336417.reviewBody: We were mildly disappointed as the sea was at low tide and la Bufadora has very little power.  But even at low power it is still pretty amazing.

463333794.name: Nice views
463333794.author: a TripAdvisor user
463333794.reviewBody: This was an excursion by Carnival cruise and we got transport there by bus. The marine geyser is good. The views of the surrounding ocean side are spectacular on a sunny day. Just watch out for all the vendors who will try to sell you stuff at an inflated tourist price. Returning back to the car park, there are restrooms and you have to pay to use them. It\u2019s cheap and pays for cleaning.

462642909.name: IT\'S FREE ADMISSION DON\'T PAY FOR AN EXCURSION. Get Uber! What a cool spot! Worth the drive!
462642909.author: a TripAdvisor user
462642909.reviewBody: This is such a beautiful Marine Geyser. The water is clear, the views are breathtaking. This is such a beautiful piece of nature. Admission is Free! If negotiating stresses you out, this shopping area will make you sweat! Not for the faint of heart. Be ready to negotiate to get good deals on shopping, viagra, liquor, food, trinkets, souvenirs, bags, sandals, and just about anything you can think of. If you have to use the bathroom there is a charge for that. .50 cents.

461547359.name: La Bufadora Getaway
461547359.author: a TripAdvisor user
461547359.reviewBody: Did a quick excursion to Ensenada and went to the La Bufadora just south of Ensenada.  A storm was brewing and with a strong tide, the blow hole was absolutely spectacular.  Even the tour guide said that it was the highest she had ever seen.  This was my second trip there and it was twice as strong as the first time I had seen it.  \n\nA small cantina at the "top of the gauntlet" has excellent tacos.  I call the strip you walk down to get from the parking area to the blow hole a gauntlet because you are attacked by the hawkers selling typical tourist junk.  About one third through the gauntlet, there is a churro stand where the staff were purple aprons - their churros are incredible.  Stores in the gauntlet area sell Molina brand vanilla for $10 to $20 per bottle depending on your negotiating skills.  Stores in the main Ensenada shopping area sell the same bottle for $8 to $12, and in the terminal building at the pier, you can buy it for $3.95.

461279560.name: Beautiful!!
461279560.author: a TripAdvisor user
461279560.reviewBody: This was nice place to visit it was beautiful. We got to see a lot of the area on the 30 mile bus ride out there  which was pretty cool. There is a lot going on here nothing you want you can get and eat. Wish I would have had more time to spend there. Its a busy area. I never once felt afraid but we was with a group if you listen to your guide you will be fine.

460825700.name: Great nature outing in Northern Baja California!
460825700.author: a TripAdvisor user
460825700.reviewBody:
La Bufadora is a blowhole that spouts water about 50 feet high every thirty seconds or so. If you're close enough to the rocks, you can get sprayed and it was easy enough to get a close spot to observe on a random Wednesday. It seemed like the blowhole was caused by the water pressure of crashing waves, but Wikipedia says that it is actually the air pressure caused by trapped air. This makes a lot more sense because the water spouted pretty high.

I can see how some people aren't impressed by this sort of thing, but I thought it was a pretty cool excursion while we were staying in nearby Ensenada. It was only about an hour drive and the route was very scenic, with views overlooking the Pacific Ocean as you climb up the mountain.

Once you get there, there isn't much to do besides viewing the blowhole and getting some souvenirs from the vendors. Maybe it's because we went on a Wednesday, but I  definitely don't think the vendors were TOO aggressive. If you know how to say no, they just move on to the next guy.

I did get some tacos at Tacos al Bufadora, which were solid tacos. We also got a pina colada or two along the walkway to La Bufadora.

I would definitely recommend visiting La Bufadora if you like natural phenomena and have a spare morning or afternoon.

460678731.name: Running the gauntlett of hawkers before you see the Bufadora!
460678731.author: a TripAdvisor user
460678731.reviewBody: Bufadora was lovely, peaceful, awesome.  However to get to this place one must side-step and rebuff about 1/4 mile of desperate Mexican sales persons.  This was a real negative to me.\nThe Bufadora is one of 3 blow holes in the world, and it is majestic in its setting amongst the rocks and the silvery ocean.  It must have sounded like a breathing, snorting sea monster to the first visitors to this site.\nWe did buy lovely gifts at Bufadora and I did appreciate the vendors being there, but the pressure was overwhelming to me.

459786201.name: Fun experience for the whole family
459786201.author: a TripAdvisor user
459786201.reviewBody:
After reading many negative reviews everywhere about how dirty it is and  the venders hogging you all the time ,I was a bit nervous about booking this excursion,but since it's one of its kind ,we decided to go anyways .
And we did not repent our decision a tiny bit.The hot water spouts out of the ocean / caves and it' worth watching .The place was not crowded at all ,and I did not feel that the venders were  pushing us to buy anything,although they were everywhere

459648051.name: Very pretty!
459648051.author: a TripAdvisor user
459648051.reviewBody: We took a Carnival cruise to Ensenada. I took the recommendation of another trip advisor reviewer and rented a car as soon as I got off the ship. It was $45 for the whole day. They give you a map and the locals are very helpful as well. We drove to La Bufadora which was about an hour and then went to Rosarita Beach which was an hour in the opposite direction.  Definitely a great idea and better than any excursion they offered.

459366261.name: Beautiful and FUN!
459366261.author: a TripAdvisor user
459366261.reviewBody: La Bufadora (the "Buffalo") is a geological formation that from a distance looks like a cross between a buffalo\'s hump and the blowhole on a whale.  It is a natural water spout that, every 7 seconds, shoots ocean water from a cave under the mountain to way up high in the air.  It is absolutely beautiful and well worth the trip to see.\n\nWe didn\'t take a tour through the cruise ship because these are usually way over-priced.  When we came off the cruise ship, there was a bus right there to take us to the town shopping area.  Aboard that bus, they had an offer for a tour to La Bufadora for $15 each, which is what we took.  It is about 20 miles on a nice bus to La Bufadora, one of Ensenada\'s most famous landmarks, and it takes about 40 minutes each way, and is a beautiful drive.  Our tour guide, Juanita, was very informative about the sights we were seeing on the way and the history of the area.  When we arrived, the bus unloaded us at a wonderful restaurant ("Tacos al Bufadora" - FANTASTIC TACOS - NOT TO BE MISSED!).  This was at the beginning of a 1/4 mile walk to the actual blowhole.  It is sort of like walking a gauntlet because there are about 200 flea market type stalls on both sides with very aggressive male vendors trying to get you to come into their shops and buy their goods.  I finally had to tell one guy, "DO NOT TOUCH ME!"  I did do some shopping but mostly in shops run by females because the men were a little scary. I don\'t mean that I felt I was in danger of being harmed or kidnapped (it\'s way too public for anything like that) - I just don\'t care for high pressure sales and this was definitely high pressure and "in-your-face".  Many of the shops are just repeats of each other but our tour guide tried to steer us toward the right places.  She warned us about fake silver jewelry and how to tell the difference and actually took us to a store that gave a demonstration.  She also warned us about the stores that carry :"designer" brands... that are really low quality knockoffs.  One store I went into had a fake Michael Kors purse I asked about and the guy wanted something like $300 for a fake!  And he didn\'t volunteer that it was a fake and when I called him on it, he said, "Yea, but if it were real, it would be $800!"  Like that was supposed to make it ok. Sheesh!  Anyway, it is definitely BUYER BEWARE here.  Any price they give you, you SHOULD bargain down - offer about 1/2 or less.  Be ready to walk away because they have the same stuff at another 20+ stores down the line. I bought a few items - mostly pharmaceuticals and tote bags - stuff like that.  There\'s another restaurant right near the blowhole that has great seafood, and another place near the beginning that has awesome Pina Colada smoothies (spiked and non-spiked).

459339577.name: The blow hole was amazing
459339577.author: a TripAdvisor user
459339577.reviewBody: I was with a group of friends on a cruise which stopped in Ensenada. They\'ve never been so we took a tour out to the blow hole at La Bufadora. We were lucky to get huge blows. So exciting, one after another and my friends dug it. We have lunch at Habana Banana. Excellent. Had time to stroll along the vendors. Great adventure. I highly recommend going.

458305971.name: Well worth visiting
458305971.author: a TripAdvisor user
458305971.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a blow hole in Ensenada. It is amazing to watch the power of the sea and the view from that spot of the ocean is beautiful. Caution, if you get too close you can get sprayed by the sea water! You have to walk through a couple of blocks of vendors to get to the spot to see the blow hole. Our advice is go right to the blow hole and then do any shopping on the way back so you know what things are available. There\'s lot of competition and the vendors do their best to get your attention!

457723998.name: Bufadora Sightseeing
457723998.author: a TripAdvisor user
457723998.reviewBody: If you enjoy shopping and sightseeing this is one stop you should make.  You have plenty of sightseeing to do on your drive to the Bufadora and plenty of vendor to select from to shop at.

457137670.name: Wow
457137670.author: a TripAdvisor user
457137670.reviewBody: We visited La Bufadora and thought it was wonderful! Reading a bit about the folklore around La Bufadora is worth doing as we told my 2 1/2 niece the story and when we arrived she just keep saying wow. Not many of the shops were open but I suppose we visited out of session so this is to be expected. The drive up to La Bufadora was beautiful and the views are immense. Well worth a visit to see this amazing natural phenomenon.

456463649.name: Nice natural phenomena
456463649.author: a TripAdvisor user
456463649.reviewBody: This visit was done during a cruise excursion. It\'s a good 45 minute drive from Ensenada Cruise Port. Too bad we were there on January 20th during a big storm. On the way up it was raining, but pouring when we arrived at destination. Thank God we had an excellent driver Antonio. We walked to the blow hole (at the very end of the pathway) under terrible windy and rainy condition. We can brag we did it. And I can tell you I got sprayed more than you can imagine when a big wave came in. Too bad we could not take photos. Nature was too violent. Something to remember for a long time. Unfortunately the shops and stalls were closing one after the other on our way back. Could have been interesting to check their stuff. Luckily Habana Banana Bar was opened and we could dry up a bit and have a drink. On our way back to the ship, roads were flooded and things have been flying around. Wish I could go back in a nicer weather, but I probably had the chance, in a way, to see the strongest splashes you can get from that blow hole.

456112372.name: Underwhelming
456112372.author: a TripAdvisor user
456112372.reviewBody: We had a day here when we got off our carnival cruise and wanted to see some culture. The blowhole was underwhelming but I guess it\'s also different from what you see everyday so pretty cool at the same time.

455755001.name: Beautiful
455755001.author: a TripAdvisor user
455755001.reviewBody: It was a "cold" 60 degree, rainy day when we came. The drive here from Ensenada is a coastal, cliff view. Absolutely worth it. Churros so good. Be ready to negotiate with the vendors

455454834.name: Interesting natural phenomena outside Ensenada
455454834.author: a TripAdvisor user
455454834.reviewBody: This was an interesting side trip from Ensenada.  The drive took about an hour, and allows you to view some regular neighborhoods along the way.  The drive along the coast is very scenic and there were hundreds of what I think were fish "farms\' in the water along the way.  Once at La Bufadora, there are a few small lots that you can choose to park in - there is a small fee for these.  Then you begin your walk to the blowhole.  At first, you pass a long walkway filled with shops and stalls of Mexican goods.  We had fun shopping for family back home.  Then there is a colorful sign "Ensenada" that overlooks the sea and is a great photo spot.  Then at the end, you arrive at the natural phenomena known as La Bufadora.  It was fun to see and the water certainly does spray high into the air.  It is recommended if you have a couple of hours free to explore outside the center of Ensenada.

449680493.name: Christmas Season Tour to La Bufadora, Family of 9
449680493.author: a TripAdvisor user
449680493.reviewBody:
We were aboard the Grand Princess cruise and booked their tour package, 2 buses loaded with about 50 people each. We drove about 45 minutes from the pier through the city and up a cliff drive to La Bufadora. The blowhole is located high on a hill so if you have fear of heights you may not want to look out the window during the 15 to 20 minute portion of the cliff drive.

After arriving we walked through an extremely long path of vendors to get to the blowhole. Just call it the "vendor gauntlet". The vendors are the most aggressive we've seen in the ports of call we've visited in Mexico. Many of them offer churros, drinks, candy or nut samples and beg you to come into their shops. They will stand in front of you without moving and gesture with their arms misdirecting your path. My father was annoyed by it, my kids aged 11 and 14 were fascinated by all the activity. To each their own. Our tour guide had told us to make it to the blowhole first and stop and shop afterwards so we powered on to the end. Good advice.

It's an interesting phenomenon, the blowhole. Water comes into a sea cave and blows mist high into the air. Depending on the tide you'll see variations of how high the water will shoot out. We got some good sprays when we were there. The kids had fun waiting and watching for it. You hear a loud sound before the actual mist so they anticipated hearing the booming of the waves into the rocks. 

It was very crowded when we went and it was difficult to get a good viewing spot to watch. Bring your patience if it's crowded. You'll have to wait for people to drift away from the viewing walls. On the way back up the gauntlet there is a restroom you can use for 50 cents. They have to cart the water in as there is no water source and it's not very clean but if you're desperate it will have to do. 

We did get some churros for $2 a bag on the way back through. They were very tasty and the kids loved them. We also stopped by the taco shop right by the parking lot because I had seen great reviews for it. They did taste great and were on freshly made tortillas that were pressed right in front of you so that was fun to watch. They were $2 each, $3 if you wanted cheese. There's 3 kinds of salsa you can add and if you want guacamole there's no extra charge. I thought it was reasonable, my husband said they may as well have been priced in California. Again, to each their own.

The sunset on the way back the ship was beautiful and overall it was a nice trip. Not overly exciting but pleasant. The kids had the most fun and there isn't much else to see in Ensenada so it worked for our family.

448608208.name: A long way to go for a very little pay off....
448608208.author: a TripAdvisor user
448608208.reviewBody: First, It is beautiful and a very interesting piece of coast line, like much of the other cost line along the Mexican Coast.  The Bufadora its self is well...underwhelming!   It was a blow hole with the water shoots up in the air, and I am guessing it can be pretty high in the air....maybe it just wasn\'t the two times I have been there.   Not sure I will give it a third

448137302.name: Very worth a visit
448137302.author: a TripAdvisor user
448137302.reviewBody: Going to the La Bufadora was an icing on the cake treat for our last day in Ensenada for my family vacation. The beautiful landscape along the shore and its breathtaking view... is priceless. We enjoyed watching the Blow Hole Geyser, the street vendors for some souvenirs, restaurants... all highly recommended. BTW, despite people telling us not to drive down to go Ensenada, well we did and we would definitely do it again!!  Baja Mexico is one place you won\'t want to miss out!!

448089113.name: Theres nothing morre beautiful than nature!
448089113.author: a TripAdvisor user
448089113.reviewBody: Great place to visit! Its bit of a drive but has always been worth it. There\'s quite a bit of shops before you physically get to see the Bufadora. My boyfriend loves to buy their roasted nuts since there willing to roast them right in front of him so he can have them warm.

447215237.name: La Bufadora is a true natural wonder!
447215237.author: a TripAdvisor user
447215237.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a natural blow hole that is spectacular to see. The drive to get there is beautiful and once you park you walk through multiple vendors with all types of mexican goods- the mexican blankets and the pottery is very colorful. Be sure to bargain/barter for the best prices! Walking back from the blow hole there are choices of fresh BBQ clams and shrimp with some cerveza which is quite tasty. It is really touristy but not to be missed for the ocean views and the authentic experience.

447047037.name: What an amazing place
447047037.author: a TripAdvisor user
447047037.reviewBody: Initially we thought how much fun could a blowhole be but we went anyway as it was cheap tickets where the cruise shuttle bus dropped us off (yup, don\'t buy your tickets on the cruise ship but get it when you come off the drop off point as it\'s about one third the price of what the cruise is charging). We had a ball and ran out of time to actually visit the small shops on the way to the blowhole. The taco\'s where the bus drops you off is the best tacos we have ever tasted. The blowhole is amazing as it\'s great to watch nature doing what it does best, blowing water over 10 feet in the air above us when it\'s already about a 20 metre drop from where we were standing to the ocean.

447033918.name: Place you won\'t forget
447033918.author: a TripAdvisor user
447033918.reviewBody:
I saw this 23 years ago and still remember it clearly. This time we brought our kids to share it with them. The were pleasantly surprised. 

The walk down is VERY touristy with tons of shops that sell crap and sales people that are IN YOUR FACE. 

But the actual natural phenomenon is mesmerizing. You can watch it on and on. And the place is very well kept and free of sales people.

If you get there early you avoid huge crowds, but miss the largest "water explosions" which occur when the tide is rising. We got there around 11am and saw water going up to 15-20 meters.

446803813.name: My 4th visit in 18 years - enjoyed it every time!
446803813.author: a TripAdvisor user
446803813.reviewBody:
Yes since it has been about 2 or 3 years since my last visit I just had to make the run out from Ensenada to show my friends. As it was December 24th, 2016 and had rained the night before we still had to try hoping that the rain would let up.

Made our way out early (11 AM) with the 300 yard line of souvenir shops just opening up and trying to push away the rain water from the night before, it was just starting to drizzle so quickly made our way over to the blow hole then the skies opened up and a rain storm hit with a vengeance. Not to worry just enjoyed a few blow hole fountain bursts and got back to our car.

Like I said this is my 4th visit in about an 18 year span and would return again with friends. The only downside is the 300 yards shoulder to shoulder souvenir shops with each one yapping about their wares to peddle.

You got to visit and see this at least once. Here are a few aerial photos I took with my drone back in May 2014.

446353805.name: Worth the time
446353805.author: a TripAdvisor user
446353805.reviewBody: We did this excursion off of the cruise ship with 2 adults, 2 kids.  It was pretty nice and intimate and the guides were great.  You should know that the kayaking out TO La Bufadora requires some effort.  Not difficult, but moderate.  We did have a great time on this trip.

446101644.name: Interesting sight seeing
446101644.author: a TripAdvisor user
446101644.reviewBody:
Probably my 5th or 6th visit to La Bufadora, it is touristy but is fun. 
Went with another couple who had never been and we all enjoyed the time together. 
Saturday's are rough because the cruise ship is in and the street vendors are very aggressive, I have been there on non cruise ship days and it is more relaxing. 
Expect typical shops and wears along with the main attraction The Blow Hole which is a great photo opportunity. 
There is a place to hold and be photographed with lion and jaguar cubs which is a treat. 
It's a lot of fun but can be taxing with the constant sales pitches.

445994598.name: Heaven on Earth
445994598.author: a TripAdvisor user
445994598.reviewBody: The coastal line in La Bufadora is a natural beauty in Ensenada, Baja California.  I have no words to express my feeling about this place, these people they are simply wonderful.  A long drive from San Diego crossing the Tijuana border to reach this place is just mesmerizing, 100 miles drive is just like floating in the cloud.  The weather was so good and the company was just amazing.  This is a MUST visit place.

442497099.name: This pllace rocks
442497099.author: a TripAdvisor user
442497099.reviewBody: There is a canteen where Capt Morgan flows freely and Jenny really enjoyed herself. Mary doesn\'t drink and is always boring and the designated driver.

442438000.name: As part of a tour, it\'s not too bad...
442438000.author: a TripAdvisor user
442438000.reviewBody:
Our trip to la buffadora was part of an all day excursion from a cruise ship.  La buffadora is an hour bus ride up into the mountains.  The guide was, as can be expected, well informed and amusing.  Once there, it's a few hundred meters of junk shops, leather goods stores, fake silver stalls and restaurants of questionable cleanliness.  At the end of this you will find La buffadora, a natural water sluce, which rockets waves up into the air.  It's interesting enough, but the view from there is spectacular.  Prepare to take some breathtaking panoramas!  Once that is done though, you're left with the walk back to your bus or shopping time.  I would go but only if you have 3-4 hours to kill.  Most of it is driving.  

Pro-tip: the restaurants, while suspect make some killer food... there was a place selling 1$ Tacos.  While small, they were the best I have ever eaten.  

Pro-tip 2: Beer and drinks are available at all the shops, but for best prices walk to the start of the market, where you will find a convenience store.  Beer can be purchased here for convenience store prices, rather than the restaurant prices a hundred feet away.

442214197.name: Disappointed
442214197.author: a TripAdvisor user
442214197.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a great natural phenomenon to see, that you can only see it in very few places in the world.\nBut the place was very dirty, the people from the shops were all over you to the point that was vey annoying. \nLast visit from me to the place.

440748330.name: Good deal for an amazing attraction
440748330.author: a TripAdvisor user
440748330.reviewBody: Instead of reserving an excursion on the cruise, we decided to take a shuttle to downtown.  Once over there, there was a window that sold local tours to the "Blowhole" for $15 (with $5 coupon passed out by the tour guide).\n\nThe attraction was amazing and there were a lot of shops on both sides of the walkway.  The only catch was that you need to pay to use the restroom, so be prepared.

438360078.name: Cruise Nov 2016
438360078.author: a TripAdvisor user
438360078.reviewBody: I wasn\'t sure what to expect but Rigo, our tour guide was great.  He was very informative, friendly & comical.  He gave us a lot of history.  La Bufadora may not be much to look at, but the scenic drive and destination is amazing.  Beautiful area.  Shopping was great if you know how to wheel n deal.  I would definitely do it again.  They dropped us off downtown Ensenada and we went shopping there as well.  This was one of the best times I had in Mexico.

437262646.name: Amazing Views
437262646.author: a TripAdvisor user
437262646.reviewBody: We enjoyed our stop at the Bufadora.  We drove our vehicle and it was a little stressful since some of the Stop signs were readily noticeable.  The trip itself was worth the drive.  We watch the current crash the water against the rocks and it was beautiful.  The noise when the water\'s going to spray everyone is like very large trucks rumbling on the city street.  There are vendors lined up on both sides of the street Some of them had really nice items available to purchase and if you get thirsty there are vendors with drinks available.  Great couple of hours.

437256633.name: Bad experience
437256633.author: a TripAdvisor user
437256633.reviewBody: We went to see the natural phenomenon of the waves shooting up through the rocks to a height of 100 feet. This was good but the walk to it and back was awful. The street is lined with stalls selling tacky souvenirs or unhealthy looking food. \nThe vendors are pulling you towards there stalls and when you finally get away you can expect the same on the way back up, with the addition of the verbal abuse of you don\'t buy anything from them.

436926542.name: A MUST-SEE EXPERIENCE - NATURE AT ITS FINEST
436926542.author: a TripAdvisor user
436926542.reviewBody: Located at the end of the Punta Banda Peninsula just 21 miles south OF the city of Ensenada, (Baja California, Mexico) \u201cLa Bufadora\u201d, one of the largest marine geysers in the world, is a one-of-kind, must-see demonstration of nature. The \u201cblowhole\u201d is a little out of the way, but if you love the sea and natural phenomena, go and enjoy \u201cpure nature\u201d. As the waves strike and are trapped in an underwater sea cave, the water explodes upward creating a geyser effect.

436486174.name: Not that impressive
436486174.author: a TripAdvisor user
436486174.reviewBody: This is definitely a tourist trap. Lots of shops and places for food and goods, plus you have to pay for parking. Then the scenic rocks and cliffs, and finally La Bufadora. But is it really with the long drive? Probably not.....

436044646.name: Cool small shops but can get crowded.
436044646.author: a TripAdvisor user
436044646.reviewBody: My family went early like 9 or 10, there weren\'t to many people around thankfully. My nieces and nephew were amazed the geyser, and we managed to get some great photos. All the small stalls were nice too, we managed to buy some souvenirs to take home. When we were leaving, around 12:30, there was large groups of people entering. So for sure don\'t wait till noon otherwise you might be bumping and surfing the crowd to see the geyser.

435651746.name: Private Bufadora Tour
435651746.author: a TripAdvisor user
