435651746.reviewBody: Tony and Martha are very professional and caring. They provided a comfortable and exciting experience visiting Ensenada, Mexico. They ensure your visit is filled with knowledge and excitement and at the same time safe. They made us feel like a part of their family and culture. They kept us away from tourist traps and took us away from the regular pushy vendors, saved us a lot of time and money  909-237 -four zero- 84 .

435460360.name: Private Bufadora Tour
435460360.author: a TripAdvisor user
435460360.reviewBody:
Luigi & Eugenia are very professional and caring. They provided a comfortable and exciting experience visiting Ensenada, Mexico. They ensure your visit is filled with knowledge and excitement and at the same time safe. They made us feel like a part of their family and culture. Thank you so much to both and look forward to visiting Mexico on my next vacation.

Thank you,

Wilson & Marie

435439031.name: Good place for the family
435439031.author: a TripAdvisor user
435439031.reviewBody: It is a nice place to take the family. There is a strip of stores before getting to the main attraction. They sell all kinds of traditional things at affordable pricing and there are a couple of exhibits worth checking out. If you don\'t like the price you can always ask them to go lower and they will. You would probably spend about an hr or less, depending what you want to do. There are a few restaurants around but I wouldn\'t recommend there unless you want to spend good money.

435058510.name: Tourist trap, but fun
435058510.author: a TripAdvisor user
435058510.reviewBody:
La bufador is your classic tourist trap, but it can still be fun. There are about a million vendors selling everything from hats and t-shirts to cigars and silver. The sights at La Bufafora are great for people watching. 

It's called La Bufadora for the "large" blow-hole on the Pacific Ocean, which builds up pressure in a small cave and then sends the water upward splashing tourists who dare to look down at it. It's beautiful and not as cool as it sounds :)

The restaurants at La Bufadora are pretty good. Don't waste your time on parking along the main drag. There is ample parking and easier to access behind the restaurants near the blow hole. 

The view from the restaurants is spectacular. It's highly recommended to get a table up high, order a drink and sit and enjoy the sights and free chips for a bit.

434107903.name: Great natural wonder. Tourist trap.
434107903.author: a TripAdvisor user
434107903.reviewBody: The place is about an hour south of downtown Ensenada, and goes through a couple little towns. The blowhole itself is amazing, and very fun to look at. Other than that, there\'s not much to do at the place. There are some restaurants, and feels like every curio store has a "puller". They won\'t let you go until you either cave in and buy something, or firmly tell them you won\'t buy anything.

434098716.name: La Bufadora - Amazing Blow Hole
434098716.author: a TripAdvisor user
434098716.reviewBody: We very much enjoyed visiting this site.  We were lucky that we visited during high tide which meant there were frequent and large blows.  There are also beautiful views of the rugged coastline from this site. Our tour guide was excellent and conveyed the legend of the blow hole (having to do with a whale).  She led us through the market area to the site, and provided advice about how to make the most of (and be aware of) the shops along the way.  Be prepared to be bombarded by the vendors, but you can simply just keep walking if you\'re not interested in what they\'re selling--they don\'t harass you.  It\'s all part of the experience!

433823837.name: Stunning!
433823837.author: a TripAdvisor user
433823837.reviewBody: When our cruise ship docked in Ensenada, Mexico we were uncertain if we wanted to venture out to see the local sights. So glad we chose to visit the ocean geyser La Bufadora! To and from the site our local guide described points of interest and answered questions. The market at the site is filled with a variety of local vendors selling a huge array of merchandise. A few of the vendors were a bit persistent but none were aggressive, and all were amenable to negotiating. The geyser is a true force of nature.

430957601.name: cruise shore excursion. Amazing scenery. Worth the drive.
430957601.author: a TripAdvisor user
430957601.reviewBody:
We were on a cruise with a stop in Ensenada. Doing some research we found this and wanted to come see it for ourselves. We walked into town and grabbed a cab. Having been on several cruises, I never book through the cruise line, but always find my own transportation and have had great success seeing the sites for less. 
The drive was a decent drive from town, but the scenery was amazing. Our cab driver was fantastic stopping along the way to take our picture. Once we arrived at the Blow Hole, our cab driver said he would wait for us for about 2 hours ( he was true to his word). To get to the blowhole, you have to walk through a large flea market with vendors selling everything from food to Mexican goods. Prices were competitive as were the vendors. Amazing experience that you only get when out of country. 
Upon arriving at the blowhole, I was amazed at the scenery. There is one area before the blowhole that is absolutely amazing. I thought we were at the blowhole at this spot. Some people came by and told us the best is still to come. We walked a little but further to find this absolute gem. The blowhole comes every couple minutes and you can hear it coming. You will get wet, but it is very refreshing. 
There is no cost to visit the blow hole , however you will either need to go by bus, taxi or your own transportation. If you are visiting as art of a cruise line, I would recommend going about a mile from port into the city. I believe that our taxi was $45.00 for the two of us and included him waiting for us to get through the flea market and blow hole. I would defentialy recommend going this route. Also, take some time to go through the flea market. There were some amazing finds at reasonable prices.

429899784.name: Quite underwhelming
429899784.author: a TripAdvisor user
429899784.reviewBody: After researching that there are only so many of these in the world, and this is one of the highest, I was kind of pumped to be a part of this marvel. There is this long alley leading to it full of curious. Which makes getting there very interesting to see and buy street foods. \n\nGetting to the actual Bufadora after walking down the alley, took going down a flight of crowded stairs with people coming and going. Finally, when you get to the end of the path, there is only a small pocket where only a handful of people can fit. Unfortunately, people usually sit for a while to enjoy the view and take pictures. So, what could have been a quick ooo-aaa ended up being a waiting game for people to move out of the way so we could enjoy the view. The picture used in the caption of the title is exactly what it looks like when you finally get to look over the edge...nothing more.

428883283.name: The only real attraction is the "blow hole".
428883283.author: a TripAdvisor user
428883283.reviewBody:
We booked an excursion to La Bufadora from our Cruise Line (Princess). We took a bus ride from the Pier in Ensenada to La Bufadora, which was about 45 minutes away. The scenery was interesting and our tour operator was informative about the area. 

Once in La Bufadora we were greeted by many local, small business owners who anxiously, and eagerly entice you to go into their shops. You must pass through the whole "market place" in order to get to the Blow Hole. Which I'm guessing is about a half a mile away. As you near the blow hole, the smell of trash and rubbish is a bit overwhelming. It was also obvious people have urinated a lot in that area (after all, you do have to pay to use the restroom there) The stench of urine was disgusting. Not to be a downer, but I have seen many other blow holes that are far better than this one. It was nothing fabulous or exciting. IMO. 

There is one restaurant/business that has some wild baby cats you can have your photo taken with. I felt they were too pricey for 5 minutes of playing with big kittens. I believe it was $25 or $30 to spend 5 minutes with the playful cats and have your photo taken. You are not allowed to take any pictures of the cats unless you pay.

The shop owners bombard you with samples (churros, margaritas, nuts, etc) in order to try and get you into their shops. Towards the end I couldn't wait to get out of there as I felt the heckling was a bit too much.The only thing I purchased from the market was food and drinks. All of the merchandise in the shops is not any different than the stuff you can buy in town, right off the cruise ship. There was a taco stand, I don't recall the name, but it is right next to the restrooms, that had some very tasty carne asada tacos! Also, the small vendor right when you enter the market, to the left has some great tasting mango margaritas. 

If you do plan on shopping there, DO NOT pay what they are asking for merchandise/souvenirs. Offer approx. 50% less and bargain from there.

427413652.name: Absolutely a must when you are in Ensenada
427413652.author: a TripAdvisor user
427413652.reviewBody:
There are vendors everywhere offering to sell you souvenirs, food, clothes and more.  

As you make your way through the hustle of the craziness at the end you reach the whale blow hole and the famous Ensenada sign that you must take a picture of/with.  And after you've taken your photo and you are on your way back have some oysters and beer at the first restaurant on the left you see.  Absolutely delicious.  Don't forget to have a Michelada.  there is something different about it when it's from Mexico. 

Keep in mind that if you need to use the restroom there is a small fee, but if you at a restaurant they is no charge.  They do take dollars here so pesos are not needed, but do bring plenty of cash with you.

426752523.name: Very long drive to see a blow hole
426752523.author: a TripAdvisor user
426752523.reviewBody: The blow hole was beautiful, however, the drive to La Bufadora was long. About one hour each way.  Two hours out of my day to see a blow hole was not worth it.  Once you are parked....you must walk the path through many vendors pushing their wares on tourists.  I suggest that if one has seen a blow hole....you would want to pass on this one.

426528525.name: HWY 1
426528525.author: a TripAdvisor user
426528525.reviewBody: Ok, so driving out we were not sure if we were lost.  We kept driving what seemed forever, but the views and scenery where beautiful!  Once we arrived, it was well worth the drive.  The views are just breath taking.  Be prepared to get wet, because the blow hole is crazy unpredictable.  My kids had a blast and enjoyed walking through the venders... take cash, we had a hard time paying for our meal, because they didn\'t have a card machine.

425944080.name: Don\'t get roped in!
425944080.author: a TripAdvisor user
425944080.reviewBody: After a short ride into town from our cruise ship, we somehow got roped into a ride out to Bufadora (hard for 8 women to make one decision). Sure, it was only $15, but it took half the time we had on shore and was not really much of a treat.  Our guide began by telling us how to legally buy drugs at the Farmacia, how to buy booze to bring back on the ship, and how to buy property in Mexico.  When we finally got to Bufadora he took more of our time by taking us to the vendors \'who would give us the best deal\', which translates to his kickbacks, I\'m sure.  I\'m more angry with myself for going with the crowd, as I really do hate haggling at markets.  However, I was able to get some beautiful photos of the water and blowhole.  So it goes, another lesson learned.

425416180.name: Great side trip
425416180.author: a TripAdvisor user
425416180.reviewBody: I have been here several times, diving is good for skilled level divers, shops love to see you and the blow hole wow.

425396839.name: Fun for the whole family for a 1/2 hour
425396839.author: a TripAdvisor user
425396839.reviewBody:
very cool place for a visit.
The place was dirty trash everywhere.
Only need 1/2 hour 45 minutes to experience this natural wonder. 
I bought a homemade pie that was yummy from a little girl in the paid parking area.

425156476.name: Cool nature!
425156476.author: a TripAdvisor user
425156476.reviewBody:
We took a trip out to La Bufadora because we were told that the shopping out there was amazing! 
I actually enjoyed the actual geyser more than I enjoyed the shopping, because it feels a bit tourist trap-ish and there's some pestering that goes on.
I did find some great Corona trays that I love, but the earrings I got were resin, not stone - annoying to be lied to!
The drive is longer than they tell you, and that was not so great, as we missed shopping in town.
I would not go again, but the geyser is super cool!

417676734.name: Weekend visit to Ensenada
417676734.author: a TripAdvisor user
417676734.reviewBody: Nice tourist spot to visit if you are in Ensenada. It is a bit of a long drive from town so be sure to use the restroom before hand (there\'s one that is there near the site but I\'ve heard awful things about it) have gas in the car, plan to stay at least an hour because there is some walking, lots of vendors offering shopping and food and samples of freshly roasted peanuts and pina coladas and of course there\'s the part where you are waiting for the right photo op moment when the bufadora erupts. There a bit of a crowd at the spot but people are kind enough not to stay long in the prime spots so everyone has the opportunity to have a good view and experience the big splashes. Parking is $2 in front of some vacant buildings but it\'s about the same everywhere. Have some small denominations of money available if you want to shop and snack. I was wary of the food and the sanitation but my husband coaxed me to relax a little and I gave in and had the best churro that I\'ve ever had in life. Warm, crisp on the outside soft and light on the inside - delicious! He had some fruit and lemonade which were good as well. There\'s lots of souvenir shopping available and prices are negotiable so your able to score some good deals if you try.

417351773.name: Amazing
417351773.author: a TripAdvisor user
417351773.reviewBody: Check the Internet for high tide to have the best experience. Simply amazing. Enjoy vendors but be sure to negotiate and compare

416669578.name: Okay Visit
416669578.author: a TripAdvisor user
416669578.reviewBody: Well this place was pack, a lot of people. Parking is a chaos, ladies be careful driving to here. I guess the swatmeet took over the ocean view on one side, not very well kept clean. The main point of interest is where you see the ocean wave hit the Rock and makes the sound of a Buffalo.I guess no money has been invested in this place since it started to be known. Now that I been there, I don\'t have any plans of returning.

415553897.name: Amazing
415553897.author: a TripAdvisor user
415553897.reviewBody: While the blowhole itself was amazing, getting there is quite the experience. If you\'re on the carnival cruise, it\'s about an hour away. So keep this mind so you don\'t miss your boat. And once you get there, it takes another 30 minutes to see the actual blowhole because you have to walk through hundreds of vendors who are very pushy and want to sell you things. All in all, worth the experience once you see the blowhole. But just make sure you keep up your time management.

414754227.name: Beautiful Water Spout
414754227.author: a TripAdvisor user
414754227.reviewBody: Several mile drive to the pay parking area.  Walk about 1/3 mile through street vendors until you get to the viewing area.  Pretty crowded as you watch for the next water spout.  Great people watching!

413769561.name: Not much of a blow hole!
413769561.author: a TripAdvisor user
413769561.reviewBody: We came her on a shore excursion. The ride down was 1/2 half through town and 1/2 along the pretty ocean. \nWe parked and had a long hot dusty walk through shopping stalls to the blowhole.  Not much water at all. Very disappointed. I love to shop but these shops were all dusty tacky tourist junk. Very poor quality.  \nThere were bathrooms for a small price. Pretty clean.

412081529.name: La Bufadora - natural ocean activity!
412081529.author: a TripAdvisor user
412081529.reviewBody: La Bufadora, the name given to a natural ocean phenomenon that finds a cave rocks, and when the waves hit this cavity, there is a great noise and the waters burst into the air at heights of over 100 meters, as if the ocean were breathing heavily like a dragon !! Very interesting photo, a single place. Many souvenir shops, restaurants, stand in the way you walk from the parking lot to the site of La Bufadora. Beautiful landscapes of oceanic coast in Mexico.

409881520.name: kayaking la Bufadora
409881520.author: a TripAdvisor user
409881520.reviewBody: My husband, our three children (12yr, 10yr, 8yr) and I kayaked la Bufadora as an excursion with Carnival Inspiration in July.  We would highly recommend it. The guides were excellent, very professional and friendly. It was exciting but you felt you were in safe hands the whole time. The best way to see La Bufadora and get a bit of the wildlife it too (we had a seal watching us watching La Bufadora ;))

409763837.name: You could skip it
409763837.author: a TripAdvisor user
409763837.reviewBody:
I was disappointed in coming here. It was a 45 minute bus ride from the cruise terminal.  On arrival, we had to walk through about 0.5 mile of hawking peddlers selling all kinds of stuff - mostly junk-- and some very aggressive.
The blowhole itself is pretty interesting but is more dramatic at high tide, and we were there at low tide. It is very crowded at the overlook.
We were advised by our tour guide of some of the higher quality stalls and I got some cute silver earrings but really had to negotiate to get even a decent price.
We did enjoy the grilled tacos at Lidia's, which is near where the buses let you off.
Would not go here again.

409583511.name: Ensenada Must Stop
409583511.author: a TripAdvisor user
409583511.reviewBody: It is very traditional that when visiting Ensenada, BC you stop by "La Bufadora" where you can have a drink, eat traditional grill Clams or just watch the nature show. This place could be very crowded durign vacations or holidays.

408958202.name: Summer vacation
408958202.author: a TripAdvisor user
408958202.reviewBody: This location is a little far from the cruise terminal, about a 30 minute ride. If you are afraid f heights, the ride up may be a bit much, it\'s goes up a winding mountain. The blow hole is nice, but it\'s a shopping center and many people trying to sell merchandise to you. If you can endure the walk through the shopping area, the blow hole is nice.

408935166.name: La Bufadora Historic Place in Ensenada
408935166.author: a TripAdvisor user
408935166.reviewBody: The Bufadora is not a restaurant, but a collection of shops (like a mexican mercado) where you can buy all kinds of  snacks, which are typical (very colorful) art and crafts. Bartering is a must, and ALWAYS try to lower the original higher price you get from a vendor since they expect you offering something lower (my wife has tons of fun with this process, and we get amazing prices at the end). They do have a couple of restaurants I\'ve never tried since the food outside of La Bufadora is cheaper and tastier. Alcohol is very expensive (but the quality very low, and I\'m concerned about cleanliness), but most tourists visitors find it cheap since they come from a cruise ship where it\'s really two to three times more expensive (but probably a higher quality). At the end of all the shops there\'s the "Blow Hole" you should never miss (the first time I went to Ensenada with my wife on a cruise ship we missed it...), where ocean water is pushed through a vertical cave and it creates a stream of water that can sometimes be amazingly large (it all depends on the high-tide level) and ANY pictures are amazing. The ocean area of "La Bufadora" is amazingly scenic, and ANY pictures that are taken there will always be amazing for the rest of your lives.

408431729.name: What was once a neat place is now smelly and crowded
408431729.author: a TripAdvisor user
408431729.reviewBody: When I first came to La Bufadora in the 1980\'s; nothing was here except the blow hole.  It was cool and neet to visit.  Now it\'s a street lined with hawkers and smells like an abotoir

408051378.name: Go Early.
408051378.author: a TripAdvisor user
408051378.reviewBody: I would say this place is nice to visit at least once in a life time. The retailers are a bit expensive and I wouldn\'t eat there and parking can be a bit crazy. Go early and beat the crowds and the heat!

407684619.name: A must do!
407684619.author: a TripAdvisor user
407684619.reviewBody: You have to do this at least once while in Ensenada. The shopping that leads up to the Bufadora is good shopping and eats. From food to blankets to meds. We had such a great time.

406862435.name: It\'s La Bufafora, and she\'s bufiando!
406862435.author: a TripAdvisor user
406862435.reviewBody:
Super turistic, they've gone commercial because of so many people from around the world who visit. The food you get here has really declined in quality.

I used to get Chavelas here at the bar; now there's no more bar. Food is just ok. But the bufing girl is what you came for anyways, right? 

If you get straight through, and expediently back on your way out, you'll have a great time. Some of those vendors are hella funny, if you speak Spanish. One offered me a beer, and another gave me two shots of some cheap tequila.. Lol 

I enjoy myself everywhere I go.

406829710.name: A blowhole...
406829710.author: a TripAdvisor user
406829710.reviewBody: The trip to La Bufadora was adequate...the tour guide was superb and the driver was safe. The actual blowhole was a bit unspectacular. I did enjoy the flea market adjacent to La Bufadora...there were great buys and lots of locals. Make sure that you barter...great deals!

404952082.name: Too crowded
404952082.author: a TripAdvisor user
404952082.reviewBody: We went to La Bufadora because it was ranked #1 thing to do in the area, but it was disappointing and way too crowded. I wouldn\'t go unless you have an extremely high tolerance for large crowds. You also have to make your way down a long row of shops to get to the actual attraction, which is exhausting since everyone is trying to sell you stuff. We drove an hour from Ensenada to get there, which was so not worth it. The actual attraction is a cool sight, but we stayed for all of 3 minutes because we were so ready to get out of there. If you really want to go, I would suggest going super early in the morning.

403767951.name: Way to crowded
403767951.author: a TripAdvisor user
403767951.reviewBody: This place has changed so so much.  I remember going there as a child and love it.  Now it\'s more commercialize.  Some of the shops are nice, others remind you of the swap meet with cheap knockoffs purses. When you finally make your way down to the blowhole, way too many people to take a decent picture. Everyone is crowded around the blowhole. I went on a Sunday, maybe during the week it\'s not that busy.

403658985.name: Fun for locals
403658985.author: a TripAdvisor user
403658985.reviewBody: You can tell that is the one thing locals enjoy it. It gets crowded o the weekend, and you have to get a good spot to b able to see the splashes, also eat sea food and find souvenirs

401314644.name: Magical scenery
401314644.author: a TripAdvisor user
401314644.reviewBody: La bufadora was everything and more. Enjoy it and stay as long as you need to get a good spot to see it from. It gets crowded. My family and I really enjoyed it! Gorgeous gorgeous!!!!!

400189110.name: Blah
400189110.author: a TripAdvisor user
400189110.reviewBody: Nothing special here. There are more beautiful places to visit around the area. Get there early and leave early to avoid the traffic.

400078939.name: Interesting and very inspiring
400078939.author: a TripAdvisor user
400078939.reviewBody: Went on July 22nd.  Spent less than an hour there.  Was on the way to Las Canadas canopy tour.  Worth the side trip.  Know that you will be besieged by street vendors as you walk several blocks through the gauntlet of vendors down to the actual blowhole.

399626323.name: Visit to La Bufadora
399626323.author: a TripAdvisor user
399626323.reviewBody: It was a nice experience to enjoy with the daily! We went during the week which made it a bit more relaxing and avoided weekend traffic.

399248749.name: Just ok.  I\'d skip it next time.
399248749.author: a TripAdvisor user
399248749.reviewBody: It\'s a big blowhole that water spouts up when the waves come in.  That\'s it. The reason most people go is that it ties in with Las Canadas Canopy Tour.  (Zip lining and a MUST if in Ensenada).  La Bufadora is essentially a tourist trap with the local swap-meet style market you walk through to get there and back.

398848970.name: Awesome place!!!
398848970.author: a TripAdvisor user
398848970.reviewBody: Took the family there it was a great experience, if you want to see the wonders of Mother Nature this is the place to go to!!

398656783.name: Interested more in the shops than the actual blow hole
398656783.author: a TripAdvisor user
398656783.reviewBody: If you are there you might as well go see it. It is a natural blow hole with many beautiful views. If you aren\'t interested in the people trying to get you to buy items stay clear

396723243.name: Beautiful coast view
396723243.author: a TripAdvisor user
396723243.reviewBody: This place is about a 20-30min drive from Ensenada city center. We traveled by car and it was a nice view of the ocean. The place itself is nice thing to do in mexico while there. There is plenty of vendors before you get there where you can buy snacks or a Oxxo to get drinks or anything else you might be craving. \nA food Specialty in this area is clam shells with cheese onion grilled... Pineapple drinks are also a specialty in this area.

395601483.name: Flea Market and La Bufadora  (blowhole) from Carnival Cruise
395601483.author: a TripAdvisor user
395601483.reviewBody: We were on the Carnival Cruise Inspiration.  We didn\'t want to pay for the expensive excursions,  so we went for the rental car right off the ship.  It was $50 for all day which included full coverage.  We split the cost with another couple.  We had GPS so it was easy to navigate our way to the sights.  It takes 45 minutes to 60 minutes one way to get to La Bufadora. We stopped along the way and took some beautiful pics of the coast line and we stopped and got some homemade tamales.  The tamale stands are everywhere,  but I recommend you have smaller USD or pesos as they are cheap; $1 USD per tamale. The stands don\'t typically have alot of change. Once you get to La Bufadora there is a flea market where you can barter. Again they all take USD or pesos so bring lots of small bills.  You can get cheap drinks,  snacks and Mexico items here. Definitely barter! Several stands will say they are hand painted, etc. Not many truly are, so don\'t let them fool you. We got things like leather sandals for $7 USD, alcohol drinks for $3, a hammock for $20 USD, etc. REMEMBER CASH, because they will want to charge you 15% at the places that accept credit cards!! Be warned! The blowhole is at the end of the flea market.  It\'s beautiful,  but often crowded,  especially if you get there at the same time a cruise tour arrives. I think it\'s worth the drive.  There are several local Mexican restaurants throughout Ensenada,  but many authentic restaurants don\'t have  English speakers. Overall a great stop to get out and see Ensenada La Bufadora.

395172974.name: No words
395172974.author: a TripAdvisor user
395172974.reviewBody: Sometimes it\'s hard for me to realize how beautiful my country is. And in places like this is difficult to imagine a better place than Mexico... So yes, take time and visit La Bufadora.

393971166.name: AWESOME
393971166.author: a TripAdvisor user
393971166.reviewBody: I had a great time! Lots of food options and the vendors had great souvenirs. A must go to place very beautiful.

393113784.name: Great natural wonder, would\'ve like it better if it was more cleaned and no screaming vendors
393113784.author: a TripAdvisor user
393113784.reviewBody: Most reviews will come from tourists coming off from tours of the Carnival Cruise and that is good, but as a Mexican, I urged Mexican federal authorities to clean the federal building restroom that is just a step away to La Bufadora natural attraction, they charge you 5 pesos or 50 cents of a dollar to get inside the restroom which I don\'t mind to pay, and by the time to walk up the street full of screaming vendors you want to get to the restroom, but the bad odor just gets stuck to your nose the whole time your "enjoying" the natural wonder. Don\'t eat there, if you want to eat a popular dish of that area, ride down the main highway and pull aside to a tamale stand and order a queso con rajas tamale instead, they\'re are the best!!  The highway has improved a lot in the past 20 years and the natural wonder is a must see in the region!!

393111968.name: I know Mexican authorities will not read my review but the federal building restroom next to the attraction smelled bad!
393111968.author: a TripAdvisor user
393111968.reviewBody: Most reviews will come from tourists coming off from tours of the Carnival Cruise and that is good, but as a Mexican, I urged Mexican federal authorities to clean the federal building restroom that is just a step away to La Bufadora natural attraction, they charge you 5 pesos or 50 cents of a dollar to get inside the restroom which I don\'t mind to pay, and by the time to walk up the street full of screaming vendors you want to get to the restroom, but the bad odor just gets stucked to your nose the whole time your "enjoying" the natural wonder. Don\'t eat there, if you want to eat a popular dish of that area, ride down the main highway and pull aside to a tamale stand and order a queso con rajas tamale instead, they\'re are the best!!  The highway has improved a lot in the past 20 years and the natural wonder is a must see in the region!!

392646746.name: Rattlesnake Tequila at Los Gordos!!
392646746.author: a TripAdvisor user
392646746.reviewBody: Los Gordos in La Bufadora is a great place to have Rattlesnake Tequila and also great food.\nYou can\'t beat the view of the bay. Every time I come to the area, this is a must see!

392352220.name: Check out Baja Aquatic Kayaking at the blow hole!
392352220.author: a TripAdvisor user
392352220.reviewBody: I took a guided kayak tour to the La Bufadora blow hole.  The guides did a great job of guiding us in to get an up close view of the blow hole.  You can watch from above but this was a unique view.  The guides all spoke good English and were concerned for our safety.  If you have never been in a kayak I would not recommend it.  Baja Aquitic provided all the gear including a wet suit.  They had bathrooms and a changing facility.  It was about an hour away from Ensenada.

392325942.name: Nice but....
392325942.author: a TripAdvisor user
392325942.reviewBody: This natural wonder has unnatural surroundings.  There usually is a crush of people in the viewing area. But first and after you have to go through an open arcade of vendors hawking everything. So once was enough for me.  I prefer my awesome nature in a more real, less populated environment.

392272245.name: A big spurt of water
392272245.author: a TripAdvisor user
392272245.reviewBody: If you are on a cruise to Ensenada you will see one of the excursions is to the famous blow hole called La Bufadora.  The blow hole is located about an hour away from where the cruise ships dock.  You can almost see to the area where it is located by scanning the shore line to the south as it makes a curve around the peninsula. At the far end you will see the hillside get higher right at the end of the peninsula and just on the other side of that is where La Bufadora is located (so I would not try and make it there on your own).  But if you wish to save over half the price charged by the cruise take the shuttle busses in front of the cruise terminal that take you into town and they will offer you the trip for much less than the cruise line.  Also, based on how long the tour from the cruise shows you will have much more time if you take the tour from the shuttle company.  But, be mindful of the time as this tour takes over 4 hours and you do not want to get left behind by the ship.  Now the part that may turn off some people, to get from the parking area at La Bufadora to the \u2018actual\u2019 blow hole you have to traverse between a quarter and half mile of vendors hawking everything from candy and leather goods to pharmaceuticals. There are also several restaurants along the way in case you get hungry.  Now once you get to the end of the road it will really depend on how the tide is at that time which determines how forceful the water shoots up.  Basically every time the tide surges in the water is forced up the blow hole and onto the rocks just opposite the viewing area.  Sometimes you get a big splash and sometime nothing at all.  On the way the escort told us that there were not very many blow holes in the world, so if you wish to view something rare you might enjoy a trip to La Bufadora.

391906444.name: This is a fun place to go see, where the gyser that is shooting up and great for fotos.
391906444.author: a TripAdvisor user
391906444.reviewBody: Coming to see the Bufadora there are many little places to buy things, I recommend the drink in the cocunuts  they are delicious. They have some restarants that you see along the way that look scrumptious.

389447760.name: A must see in Ensenada
389447760.author: a TripAdvisor user
389447760.reviewBody: Half the fun of La Bufadora is getting there. The drive is very peaceful (except for when a bus driver roars around you) and the ocean so beautiful. Once you get there, there are many souvenir shops selling the same things but many also have some items and curios that are unique. What I do is walk down and visit many shops and don\u2019t buy anything but jot down the prices. The on my return, I know where to stop and what I want. A word of advice, it would really help to know some Spanish as the prices are significantly lower of you know Spanish. Also, the vendors are sometimes pushy so just be ready. All you have to do is say no gracias. Some people get nervous and start shouting filthy racist obscenities. They are just trying to make a living so be courteous and just say no gracias.\nThe other half of the fun is trying to get pics of the blow hole and listen to everyone oooohhhh and awwwwwee when a large gush of water reaches massive heights. It\u2019s a natural wonder and simply amazing. The weather is always nice and the people are friendly. If you have to use the restroom, pay in pesos as the price is half of what you pay if you pay in US currency. I am Mexican American and avoid the food so if you have a weak or suspect stomach, just avoid it.

389137015.name: La Bufadora Didn\'t Blow!
389137015.author: a TripAdvisor user
389137015.reviewBody:
This was our fifth trip to Ensenada, and we finally decided that it was time to check out the famous blowhole.  We were on a Christmas cruise last December and took the shuttle from our ship into town.  Instead of spending about $59 for an excursion which could be purchased on the ship, we spent a mere $15 on a local tour bus out to La Bufadora.  The bus ride took about an hour passing through the run-down outskirts of town and finally some scenic views of the Pacific ocean.  We had an excellent guide on the bus informing us about the area before we arrived at the blowhole.  He also mentioned that we would find "boutique shops" after we got off the bus.  

After walking past the "junk shops", we found a spot to view the famous eruption.  Well, we stood in the heat for an hour and never saw La Bufadora blow.  Finally, we gave up and left to find something to drink and wait in the shade for the time to depart.  All in all, it was a waste.

There is a small fee to use the restrooms at the site where a man hands you a few sheets of toilet paper.

389050867.name: Fun thing to see once...
389050867.author: a TripAdvisor user
389050867.reviewBody: Nice drive from Ensenada to Bufadora...Not much to do there, but enjoy the roaring of the blow hole and buy some stuff from the many vendors hawking their goods....free

387967608.name: Fun excursion for our cruise ship stop
387967608.author: a TripAdvisor user
387967608.reviewBody:
We had originally not intended to take an official excursion during our stop in Ensenada.  We planned on walking First Street and maybe hitting a beach.  On our bus to downtown as we saw the condition of downtown Ensenada (not necessarily the most inviting) and jumped at the chance to take a discounted excursion from the tour company operating the shuttle bus.  For $52/ea we got both the zipline excursion at Las Canadas and a stop at La Bufadora.  The cruise ship probably sells the same excursion for $125 - $150, so it pays to book outside of the cruise ship!

La Bufadora is what it is -- it is a fun and unique natural wonder.  The drive is a bit long as you wind your way from Highway 1 out to the peninsula on the Pacific.  But the views of the Pacific are gorgeous, and the blowhole itself unique.  

The flea market is definitely not as good of a deal as you might get in other markets in Mexico.  It is definitely a bit of a 'tourist trap'.  Our guide for the day was a very nice, articulate and fun guy as our host, but there was little doubt that he gets his beak wet based upon his shop recommendations.  That said, if you negotiate hard enough (did a great act with my stepdaughter on a fake Louis Vuitton bag purchase -- "We have to leave NOW!") you can get some good deals on the typical flea market fare.

There is this really cool bar/restaurant that has live big cats that you can touch, pet and put cubs on your lap for pictures.  I was very tempted, but after exploring the blowhole, shopping, eating and drinking we just didn't take the time to seriously consider it.......but it looked AWESOME.

Great tacos at the taco place right at the entrance to the flea market.  We were starving and tried them all.  The fish tacos got huge thumbs up from my wife and our girls.

387819796.name: Short time beautiful experience
387819796.author: a TripAdvisor user
387819796.reviewBody: This is a natural phenomenon that only happens in 3 places of the world (as far as I know). It\'s amazing the power of the sound and pressure of the water. Totally recommend it.

387537871.name: Natural beauty and power!
387537871.author: a TripAdvisor user
387537871.reviewBody: The power and beauty of nature is displayed in this corner of punta banda 15 minutes south of Ensenada, even though it\'s a 2 hour visit (tops) it is entertaining, you can browse the mexican curios shops, eat fresh seafood in a very friendly enviroment.

386799798.name: Probably the best thing to do in Ensenada
386799798.author: a TripAdvisor user
386799798.reviewBody: We were just in Ensenada for the day and wanted to go shopping. We got on a bus to go to the shopping area and during the ride they told us about some excursions they offered so we decided to try La Bufadora. It turned out to be good there were a lot of shops and places to buy food. The tacos at the entrance were awesome.

386233930.name: A beautiful water show
386233930.author: a TripAdvisor user
386233930.reviewBody: Took a Carnival Cruise tour to La Bufadora.  It\'s about an hour ride from Ensenada.  When driving and getting closer  to the spot the  scenic Pacific Coast is really beautiful.  I really understand "It\'s a natural wonder"  but  because of the laid out of the blow hole ...it\'s really difficult to get a good look at it when there are a big group of people on the deck...The blow hole is located maybe 5feet or more down on the right hand corner  of the deck ...so you  actually have to perch  and look down to see the water being pushed in the hole and then spout on a big thunderous white  smokey cloud... It\'s absolutely impressive... but it\'s not easy to get a good look and take a good picture if you\'re not lucky to be in the right spot... But still it\'s a must see...

385955845.name: Ummmmm, It\'s Just Water
385955845.author: a TripAdvisor user
385955845.reviewBody: So after our excursion in downtown Ensenada, we went on the tour to Punta Banda aka La Bufadora. It\'s about an hour drive out to the point. The guide on this trip was exceptional and very informative. Upon arriving at La Bufadora, she gave a disclaimer, "I am not related to anyone down here, nor do I get anything back from any of the stores in the area, so don\'t be taken". She did show the group where to eat, Lidia\'s #1 & #2. I recommend them, all homemade tortillas and dynamite food! The Bufadora itself it ok, its a cave in the mountain side that gets pressurized and spouts out water. The best part of the tour were again the tacos.

385436807.name: Beautiful place for a short stay
385436807.author: a TripAdvisor user
385436807.reviewBody: I like it you can buy a lot of stuff and see the water show its a good place to go just a little far away

385434553.name: Must see
385434553.author: a TripAdvisor user
385434553.reviewBody: Must see when visiting Ensenada.  Good picture opportunities and yummy pi\u00f1a coladas made in whole pineapples. Lots of small stands that sell souvenirs at reasonable prices.  Well worth the drive.

385092050.name: Ensenada cruiser
385092050.author: a TripAdvisor user
385092050.reviewBody: Ensenada awsome experience lots of places to go and see. I found a great personal guide . Blowhole  la bufadora, shopping , ziplines , wine tasting, no tourist traps . I called this U.S number seven 60-4seven4-31six six. Must try the Tacos and sea food

385072961.name: Nice little tourist attraction (take the city bus; not the cruise tour)
385072961.author: a TripAdvisor user
385072961.reviewBody: This is very beautiful and attached to a sweet little flea market (very touristy and not at all inexpensive), but there really isn\'t much else to do in Ensenada.  Locals play traditional Aztec music -- that was nice also. I could have sat and watch the Bufandora itself for hours (personally).

384926906.name: Happy visitors from Mississippi
384926906.author: a TripAdvisor user
384926906.reviewBody:
We loved our visit to La Bufadora. We enjoyed the short walk down the street full of vendors. They had samples of food and of course wanted to sell their goods but they were not too overbearing. We smiled politely and kept walking. We did stop for churro's and they were fantastic!! We got more when we were leaving. Watching the water shoot up was everything we expected. There were alot of people but we were able to work our way to the front to get a good view and some videos. We ate fresh steamed clams that were topped with cheese, tomatoes onions and other things with whole shrimp on the top. They were so good so don't forget to grab one on your way in or out. The cocos locos are good too! 

As far as we could tell we were the only Americans there that day. I want to tell other Americans that this place is very safe and the people are all friendly and the food is fresh and fantastic.

384375284.name: Short Sight Seeing Trip But Worth It!
384375284.author: a TripAdvisor user
384375284.reviewBody: If you don\'t mind walking through a bunch of open market vendors, this short tour is for you. We love finding hidden treasures and taking amazing shrimp, steak tacos. The La Bufador you see, take a picture in front of it then move on to the vendors and eating, there\'s not much else to do but that\'s okay if you just want to get off the ship find something to do as we did. We did not book a tour until we got off the cheap taxi bus from our cruise ship, it was cheaper to book right then and there and it was only about 45 minute drive, The tour guide pointed out some of the spots in town as we headed out and told us a little bit about the history of Ensenada. It was raining terribly when we got on the bus and drove but stopped as we go to LaBufadora. Would most likely do it again if we had some people with us who had never gone, the tacos were that good. :-)

383279323.name: Must see
383279323.author: a TripAdvisor user
383279323.reviewBody: Pretty sight seeing. We were there in May and could see some whales too. Safe to park and wander and people are very friendly.

382863917.name: Gotta go
382863917.author: a TripAdvisor user
382863917.reviewBody: If you have never seen or felt the spray from a blow hole, it is a must do. The view of the ocean is gorgeous.  There are many market stalls along the walkway for you to bargain for souvenirs.

382810249.name: Summer is not a good season to visit La Bufadora
382810249.author: a TripAdvisor user
382810249.reviewBody:
Visit La Bufadora with my parents via Canaval Cruise on 6/8/2016. Since this is the second time I visit here. I have comparison.  In low tide (around 11am), summer, you can hardly see any water blow up. We heard the sound but it is like regular tide to a rock. Very disappointing. Can't even take a picture because it is so low. 

Last time when I was here in November, 2014, Winter, the water blow up much higher and we had good view. 

To avoid disappointment, strongly suggest check the tide and season before you arrange to visit here.

382545252.name: Amazing creation among food and local shopping
382545252.author: a TripAdvisor user
382545252.reviewBody:
This was our last stop after the canopy tour.

Our tour wanted to make sure we tried the cuisine and tequila our guide told us all about.

We arrive late in the day and the shops were already preparing to close for the day; however, they all stuck around and accepted our group as the late comers.

You have to the try the grilled clam shell! Please don't judge a book by its cover because it was so good I wanted more.

Plenty of street vendors with a variation of item to buy, clothing, bags, art, etc.

382368287.name: Beautiful creations of God
382368287.author: a TripAdvisor user
382368287.reviewBody: Amazing place to reflect on the beutiful world God created for us. It\'s a little far out of the town up a hill and windy roads but worth it when you make it to the top

382352069.name: Obligated stop if you visit Ensenada:)
382352069.author: a TripAdvisor user
382352069.reviewBody: You must visit La Bufadora, is only 30-45 minutes away from the Ensenada Downtown; the view while you driving is nice. Once you arrive there are a lot of parking space for 2 dollars. There\'s also a lot of curious and seafood restaurants or bars.

382313993.name: An average experience
382313993.author: a TripAdvisor user
382313993.reviewBody:
We arrived to Ensenada with Princess Cruises from LA. Decided to see something special for the area while the ship was docked, hence we ended up with a bus tour to the La Bufadora.

Maybe we do not know enough about 'blowholes' in order to be thrilled from this. Nice to have seen once but nothing that special. 

A touristy market from where the bus parked until you get to the blow hole. Mainly over priced souvenirs, specifically 'designed' for cruise passengers. 

We did enjoy fresh pineapple and great margaritas from the market stands. Found a nice Mexican restaurant where we enjoyed a few nice local dishes, while watching the sea and waiting for the bus back to the ship.

382295960.name: A cool wonder of nature
382295960.author: a TripAdvisor user
382295960.reviewBody: My family visited La Bufadora as a last minute add on to our tour to Las Canadas. Or guide dropped us off and we had to walk down to La Bufadora but we had to pass a bunch of vendors selling their wares all the way down the street. They weren\'t too pushy and it was interesting see the homemade crafts some of the stores were selling. But it was definitely very touristy. The blow hole was a been there seen that type of deal but it was cool to see. I would recommend buying food from the street vendors instead of going into any restaurants which tend to be a bit over pricey. Overall a fun time and I\'m glad we went.

382069505.name: Wish we had more time here
382069505.author: a TripAdvisor user
382069505.reviewBody: Our guide was awesome.  He was raised in the US and a history major.  Gave us so much information it was wonderful.  Not just about the US but about Mexico and Baja California .  We were lucky to have him.  The blow hole was fun and the kids loved it and getting good wet.  We found some fun toys in the open air market on the walk to it.  It\'s worth the time but make sure you have some it\'s a nice walk to and from.

381960389.name: I\'ve seen more entertaining geysers from drunk people throwing up
381960389.author: a TripAdvisor user
381960389.reviewBody: I traveled an hour each way by bus to see a bland geyser and be harassed by rude vendors and heartbreakingly sad beggars in a gauntlet run of cheap, worthless souvenirs. When you ask the price of a (maybe) $10 item it starts off at $85 and as you walk away it goes down to $25, then three shops later the same exact item starts off at $25 and it\'s anyone\'s guess where it bottoms.\n\nDo yourself a favor and stay away from Ensenada, and don\'t even think about riding the horses they offer. The horses are beaten severely and look emaciated and broken down to former shells of the animals they might have once been. It\'s a terrible day spent feeling waves of despair over the living conditions you see all around you. No amount of money you give away makes a difference, you\'re just supporting the rancid living conditions of a government that doesn\'t care for its people in any way.

381243249.name: You can google it
381243249.author: a TripAdvisor user
381243249.reviewBody: Its nice to go if you are around but if time is limited you can easily skip it and google it. Unfortunately the day I visted la Bufadora the show was not spectacular, also sellers along the way to la Bufadora are very annoying.

380786640.name: Refreshing!
380786640.author: a TripAdvisor user
380786640.reviewBody: Experiencing the la Bufadora was something else. I got sunburned a little just by waiting for it to give out a big one but it was worth it. Once you get splashed you\'ll feel like a kid again. After that, I had grilled ceviche (?) and pi\u00f1a colada. Loved it!

380693954.name: Nice place to visit and take pictures
380693954.author: a TripAdvisor user
380693954.reviewBody: Now they have lot of souvenirs shops the restaurants. Sorry no hotels here, you need to drive (above 1 hr or lest from Ensenada). Easy to go and find, just follow the sings). Have somebody to take pictures wile driving, so is not many place to stop for good pictures (let the other car past on you back if you can so you can slow and take pictures.\nParking is cheep, I recommend to park before the entry sing, so you walk and see all the street vendors before you get to La Bufadora ( I don\'t see free parking at least you want to walk. Don\'t forget you camera or you will regret.

379003523.name: Worth the ride
379003523.author: a TripAdvisor user
379003523.reviewBody: Beautiful and well worth the trip.  Great little outdoor market and great food.  Petting baby tiger and lion great fun. May stay down there a few days next time.

378871501.name: Beautiful display but distant and commercialized
378871501.author: a TripAdvisor user
378871501.reviewBody: I witnessed Bufa almost 50 years ago when you got there via dirt road and there was one or two fresh & hot yummy churros vendors. Now, it is out of control, where the magical swirling water below is compromised significantly by shop after shop, challenging parking & a very long ride from town. Worth a one time trip to see the natural wonder but barely

378839223.name: La bufadora
378839223.author: a TripAdvisor user
378839223.reviewBody: Great site to see when in Ensenada. Drive is well worth it,  not to far from the center of town. Restaurant near La bufadora is excellent.

378817810.name: Awesome Time in Ensenada
378817810.author: a TripAdvisor user
378817810.reviewBody: The Fish tacos were awesome at the little restaurant in the entrance.! The time spent there was awesome, the flee market was my favorite.

378012695.name: Enjoyed it despite the crowds
378012695.author: a TripAdvisor user
378012695.reviewBody: We went on Memorial Day weekend and it was PACKED. 10 pesos for parking... But it was still very enjoyable.  Also lots of cheap shopping (leather, bags, hammocks, mexican clothing, etc) and fresh pina coladas served from a pineapple on the walk down to it.

377967374.name: Unique place.
377967374.author: a TripAdvisor user
377967374.reviewBody: Only 3 sites like the bufadora exist. Great reason to visit especially if u have waves. Wonderful for adults and children.

377151865.name: Beautiful Scenic adventure for a short trip
377151865.author: a TripAdvisor user
377151865.reviewBody:
We just went to La Bufadora on an offshore excursion from the Carnival Cruise. It was a 40min bus ride from the port of Ensenada and was a beautiful scenic drive through agricultural lands and the coast. 

The path down to the Blowhole is filled with vendors hawking their souvenirs at you. Be prepared to fend them off with a smile and no thank you. They all speak english and will haggle prices with you if you so choose to buy. If you're looking for snacks, the freshly made churros are amazing and a bag will cost you between 3-4 bucks. Pina Coladas are also popular, they will charge you extra for it served in a pineapple shell but you can also just have it cheaper in a cup. For something savory, get the tacos near where the restroom and bus parking is. They are super friendly and the tacos are fresh made to perfection. 

Down by the blow hole, its beautiful and they say if you get wet from it, you will have 7 years good luck. Who knows!

376439178.name: Beautiful, areas to shop for local items...
376439178.author: a TripAdvisor user
376439178.reviewBody: Was about a 40-45 min drive from the port, we only had a few hours so we decided to do a tour. The tour guide was great and while they try hard for you to buy the stand sellers were friendly. It is a great place to go for couples or families (we had to younger children and they loved it).

375956940.name: Scenery Awesome
375956940.author: a TripAdvisor user
375956940.reviewBody: The scenery is amazingly beautiful, a lot of the souvenirs are a lot cheaper then in Tijuana the vendor are something else but in a good way most of them are really nice.

375265133.name: The first time I went here I was 18...no rails, no toilets, no commercialism.
375265133.author: a TripAdvisor user
375265133.reviewBody: Even with that said there is something about the shower of sea water you get when the waves hits just right that makes you forget someone has changed the surrounding area into a circus. Bring toilet paper...lol.\n

374297495.name: One Of The Unique Things Of Ensenada
374297495.author: a TripAdvisor user
374297495.reviewBody: This is a fun place to go with the family.  Driving out there to the tip of the peninsula reminds me of some areas in Hawaii.  I say this because of the big steep mountains coming down to the ocean.  I recommend going in April/May which is right after rainy season because the mountains will be very green and much prettier.  The other thing is to know when high tide and low tide are.  If you go during low tide the blow hole does not really blow anymore.  So try and find out when high tide will be there and plan your trip around that.  If you like flea market type shopping for tourist keepsakes then you will enjoy all of the shopping on the walk down to the blow hole.  I personally do not like that stuff and find it a bit annoying with all of the people trying to pull you into their stands and stores.  I also recommend trying out a Pina Colada from the many stands that sell them.  They are awesome.

373734017.name: somewhat interesting place
373734017.author: a TripAdvisor user
373734017.reviewBody: local tourist attraction that they try to full capitalize on. tons of swapmeet style stalls and food on the way to the blowhole.

373733221.name: pretty cool tourist attraction.
373733221.author: a TripAdvisor user
373733221.reviewBody: swapmeet and restaurants a little annoying but still good deals. typical hagglers. eat at the food stalls rather than the larger restaurants. we made that mistake

373109309.name: Getaway
373109309.author: a TripAdvisor user
373109309.reviewBody: Good place to visit. Restaurants with view of ocean lots of shopping for tourists.\nLots of different little side shops. places to make micheladas.

372933580.name: Nature at its best!
372933580.author: a TripAdvisor user
372933580.reviewBody: What makes La Bufadora so special is that it was created by nature, water rises with the tide and as air pushes it out it shouts out to the sky. It is a blowhole, one of the very few in the globe. However, this particular blowhole is the largest. Enjoy the scenic road to the Bufadora, you will have breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and Ensenada. When you arrive make sure you enjoy delicious and hot churros or fresh fruit with a pinch of chili and lime juice. Just thinking of all the delicious snacks my mouth waters.

372652010.name: Must do in Ensenada!
372652010.author: a TripAdvisor user
372652010.reviewBody: This place is amazing! It\'s packed with street vendors and a couple of restaurants. The blowhole itself is a sight to see and it\'s exciting waiting for the next big eruption! \n\nI set up a tour with David Marmolejo, who did a great job organizing our day trip here, horseback riding, and to Las Canadas. The entire trip was only $82, which was about what it cost to do only one of these excursions through Carnival. I highly recommend David as a tour guide!

372400776.name: Try it once
372400776.author: a TripAdvisor user
372400776.reviewBody: The blow hole is a one time thing. You can say, been there and saw that. It\'s a beautiful site and makes great pics. Only down fall was the aggressive flea market you have to walk past to get to the hole.

371225666.name: Very cool
371225666.author: a TripAdvisor user
371225666.reviewBody: Great area to see.  First time seeing the blowhole was amazing.  The shops along the way we\'re cool to see

370823578.name: Road trip
370823578.author: a TripAdvisor user
370823578.reviewBody: We spent Easter Sunday there and we had fun! There are multiple options to eat, shop and relaxed people watching (a great place to practice this sport).

370574799.name: Great time
370574799.author: a TripAdvisor user
370574799.reviewBody: Its been more than 15 years since I have been here. This place is still beatiful. There is also a good spot that sell amazing fish tacos there. The only thing I disliked was the pushy vendors trying to sell you the exact same thing the other 10 vendors had.

370255443.name: One of three wonders of the world
370255443.author: a TripAdvisor user
370255443.reviewBody: We chartered a bus out to the "Blowhole", we got harassed by the locals to buy trinkets and things. It is a great thing to see and watch the water shoot out between the rocks. You have to go through the market to get to this attraction, sweet when you go down.  They get pushy on the way back, be careful that you don\'t get suckered into buy things or paying $.50 to use the bathrooms to pay for the water usage....they have waterless bathrooms.

370227776.name: Beautiful scenery
370227776.author: a TripAdvisor user
370227776.reviewBody: One of the worlds largest marine geyser was interesting to see.  Lots of splash and rainbows everywhere.  Beautiful scenery amongst the cliffs.  Unfortunately, you have to navigate a long section of souvenir shops/flea market type stalls to get there.

370195246.name: Fun place to visit
370195246.author: a TripAdvisor user
370195246.reviewBody: I looked up the high tide schedule and it was about 8am so we got there about 9:30,  La Bufadora did not disappoint.  We were also the only ones there.  Highly recommend going early to miss the bus crowds.  We were one of the first shoppers so the vendors were nice and willing to haggle for their first sale of the day.  We left at noon when it was getting very crowded with the bus tours.  We drove down the street to the bottom where there is a lot you can park at for $2USD.  The grilled seafood in clamshells looked yummy but we aren\'t seafood eaters so we didn\'t try it,

369711301.name: Tourist Trap w/a Kapital T.
369711301.author: a TripAdvisor user
369711301.reviewBody: Yikes. What a waste of time totally. All i could say is its a nice drive out, but guantlet of cheezy vendors you have to pass to get through, and then the blow hole itself is just so underwhelming.\n\nWanna see some good ones? Go to Acadia National Park in Maine, USA.

369494599.name: lots of fun and shopping!
369494599.author: a TripAdvisor user
369494599.reviewBody: The blowhole was pretty cool!  I liked the shopping around the blowhole too! Lots of venders with delicious taste testers of churros, candied nuts, pina coladas!  There was a delicious taco place about half way through the shopping, I wish I could remember the name but it was the only taco place in the middle.  We booked our excursion with David Marmolejo through ensenadatourguide.com and he was amazing!  He knew like every vender in the shopping area and they all knew him.  He made our experience in Ensenada the best!!

368436097.name: Worth A Look
368436097.author: a TripAdvisor user
368436097.reviewBody: We arrived Ensenada on a cruise ship and walked about 5 blocks from the dock to downtown where we signed up for a local tour to La Bufadora, one of the biggest ocean blow holes in the world.  The ride from downtown took about 40 minutes as we could not go fast going on surface streets since the traveled distance was only about 20 miles.  Once you arrived coast side, you will see a beautiful bay with large white and red rings where tunas and anchovies are farmed.  Once parked after arrival, you will go down a street lined with vendors trying to give you samplers of sugar coated almonds, churros and fruit drinks.  You can also shop for Mexican souvenirs from tee shirts to back packs as well as buy prescription drugs from these shops.  At the bottom of the road lies the blow hole where every 2 minutes, there will be a wave causing it to "blow".  If you\'re lucky, the next wave will shoot a stream of water spray high enough to simulate "old faithful" in Yellowstone.  An excellent photo opt here.

367826578.name: Plenty of Shopping
367826578.author: a TripAdvisor user
367826578.reviewBody: Let\'s face it, though quite a spectacle, LA Bufadora in itself is not worthy of being held as the biggest attraction in Ensenada. It was enjoyable experiencing the showers on the blowhole however my highlight was more on the food and the shopping. When in LA Bufadora, don\'t miss the clam shells. They\'re inexpensive and delicious! Drinks are on each corner like margaritas, beers & Pina colada. Overall, with a family of 21 on this excursion, everyone had a great time! \n\nTips for all cruisers: don\'t book your excursion directly through the ship. The tour itself would cost $35 per person. Instead, take the bus outside the ship for $2. There will be an excursion ticketing booth right where they stop downtown. I paid $35 for the same tour plus horse back ridding by the beach.

367605900.name: You will be glad you saw it.
367605900.author: a TripAdvisor user
367605900.reviewBody: La Bufe, as it is often referred to, is one of those natural phenomena that is just worth seeing!  It isn\'t a huge event or a heart stopping experience: it\'s just one of those sights about which you think, "that is so cool!!"\nIt\'s a fun trip from Ensenada, perhaps 45 minutes and it\'s easy to arrange the price in advance with a taxi. 8 of us hired a van which took us round trip to La Bufadora, and waited while we saw the sights, shopped and had lunch for less than $100 including tip.  There are a number of good restaurants, lots of touristy shops and beautiful scenery, all of which make for a satisfying day in Mexico!

367453050.name: Good Getaway..away from town
367453050.author: a TripAdvisor user
367453050.reviewBody: The natural water blowhole is a good tourist attraction if you want to spend half a day away from the town. There are many vendors on the street selling food to accessories.\nIf you visit the place during high tide then you are lucky to see the water spouting high up to 100 feet in the air. The drive to the place is beautiful as well.

367392690.name: Its not the hole most people are interested in
367392690.author: a TripAdvisor user
367392690.reviewBody: We were only in town for a few hours (from the cruise ship); so the obvious wish of this female is to shop for local favors.  I want to go to the shops they have by the blow hole so  thus comes the title of this review.  The shops were quite entertaining, food and drinks are plenty and all good.  Be very careful when you shop, some shops are ok and actually gives quite a bargain (according to US standard) but some shops will actually try to ge away with highway robbery.  Check for appropriate pricing of items from other sources unless you want to give away your money.

367031754.name: Natural beauty spoiled by marketeers
367031754.author: a TripAdvisor user
367031754.reviewBody:
We did not catch La Bufadora at high tide so the spray wasn't that impressive to us. I can see how it would be if caught at the right time of the tide.  The surrounding view is impressive.

The big downside to the attraction is the vendors and those looking to capitalize on your need to park your vehicle. Cash flow from tourism is important, I realize, but here it goes over the top. It seems that one must park up top and walk in, given the number of people waving flags at you to park in their lot. That isn't the case.  You can drive down the road (lined with vendors) and park at the bottom, provided you patronize the restaurant, Los Panchos, who seem to have the rights to the parking area adjacent to their building.  That's what we chose to do as we were hungry and intended to eat anyway.

The four other members of our party did walk down the road. My wife stopped and haggled with a couple of vendors but found their bottom prices to be higher than other similar markets.  One friend was looking to refill his blood pressure medicine and found a pharmacy along the line and was pleased with the price he paid.

Please see my review of Los Panchos for our lunch and drink experience.

365911713.name: Impressive natural site
365911713.author: a TripAdvisor user
365911713.reviewBody: Once you get to La Bufadora, seeing the ocean geyser is an impressive site.  Everyone (even the teenagers) found it interesting.  Challenge is that it is not a short drive to get out there and once there, going thru the gauntlet of shop keepers selling all kinds of trinkets.  I thought the drive was a nice change of pace from the Ensenada city experience.  Two key things to keep in mind:  experience is much better around high tide and bring change for the bathrooms!

365890981.name: Vacation
365890981.author: a TripAdvisor user
365890981.reviewBody: Beautiful loved it, they have like little stands on the way up, so can buy souvenirs. Lots of people from everywhere  go to the Bufadora.

365800060.name: a interesting attraction
365800060.author: a TripAdvisor user
365800060.reviewBody: a nice drive out of town to get to the attraction, it\'s very tourist oriented as you have to walk the street with all the venders and people wanting to sell you stuff and if cruise ship in town, very busy; go early

365501611.name: Our family cruise  vacation. .en mexico
365501611.author: a TripAdvisor user
365501611.reviewBody: This place was nice it had a big flea market ..ooh the pastries were good...the scenery  of ocean awsome..

365479629.name: The perfect excuse to drink, eat, and buy
365479629.author: a TripAdvisor user
365479629.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a great place for the family, the drive may be difficult and even dangerous, but I had a great time with my family

365308552.name: Very touristy!
365308552.author: a TripAdvisor user
365308552.reviewBody: This place is okay for something to do while here but isn\'t as spectacular as you might be expecting it to be! Try to go on a high tide as this is when the geyser is spraying the most! Otherwise it\'s not so impressive! Be prepared for lots of people and to be harassed by the vendors that are choking the entrance you must navigate in order to get back to the viewing area! And if you are driving in yourself be prepared to pay to park"

364737653.name: Interesting But Not Worth the Hassle
364737653.author: a TripAdvisor user
364737653.reviewBody: When we went to see la bufadora, it was almost irritating walking a mile or so long road through vendors just to see this attraction. To get the experience or a good photo, 15-30 minutes is adequate. Make sure to have change on you to use the restrooms and don\'t be afraid to be overly confident with that "no" to the vendors.

364122581.name: Great place to visit and watch the water reach up to over 100 feet in the air. Visitors center also.
364122581.author: a TripAdvisor user
364122581.reviewBody: A must see water spout. People from all over the world come to see this amazing water spout. You can walk the malecon (shopping and restaurants) first and at the end of the road is the Water spout.

364007372.name: Great natural spectacle
364007372.author: a TripAdvisor user
364007372.reviewBody: After walking through the half mile of souvenir stands you finally reach the geyser. It\'s an incredible spectacle to watch the water getting pressurized in the air, an astonishing loud action and you can stare at it forever\n\nWatch it best during or before high tide. So check the website before

363923321.name: Cool blow hole
363923321.author: a TripAdvisor user
363923321.reviewBody: Worth doing for right price, $15-20 not 60-80 the cruise lines charge.  Have fun shopping afterwards and remember to haggle..

363217739.name: Fun Stop on a Cruise
363217739.author: a TripAdvisor user
363217739.reviewBody: I took a tour with the cruise company(Princess). The tour was not worth it and I heard that you can go to downtown and get a same tour for 15 dollars. I paid 35. The trip to the place took about an hour because the highways in mexico go through cities not around. During the trip you can see some poor living conditions of some of the locals. It was pretty fun to see the blow hole shoot the water. Walking to the blow is not so fun. Lots of people trying to sell you stuff. If you are looking to buy some souvenirs there are a lot of great choices. You can have fun while practicing your bargaining skills. Be sure to ask around because a lot of stalls sell the same stuff. Also remember that if you are buying sliver you should ask them to test it first. I was also though that the food there was not safe to eat, it is totally untrue. I had some great churros and had no stomach problems. The best churros are with the guys in the purple apron. I heard from a local that they have been doing it for 40 years and still uses lard. Overall, it is worth it to see.

363180668.name: Not Your Major Tourist Mecca
363180668.author: a TripAdvisor user
363180668.reviewBody: We drove through Ensenada and the countryside to reach La Bufadora, in itself rather interesting as we hadn\'t yet been to that part of the world.  The main attraction, however, was just one of many such around the world that are perhaps not as hyped up.  It was OK to see the spout, but the dark cliffs and crashing waters were more interesting, and so, too, the birds.  A tourist trap is only a tourist trap if you make it so.  These people have to make a living, too.  We decided to stop off at one of the "tiendas" lining the corridor to La Bufadora and buy a shark\'s head as a gift.  That went over big at home!

362218018.name: Kewl
362218018.author: a TripAdvisor user
362218018.reviewBody: It was beautiful. It reminded me of the cliffs in Monterey California and of the hwy leading up to big sur. The spout is funny aswell. There\'s a pause of 2-3 minutes in between each large eruption, and we\'ll worth it. The lil market leading up to it was great aswell. Plenty of snacks, and plenty of souvenirs. Drive there was kind of long. They Only Draw back, But Still Worth seeing.

361812561.name: Always beautiful eyecandy
361812561.author: a TripAdvisor user
361812561.reviewBody: Beautiful place. Nature at its best. Hard to ignore the trash the locals leave behind. Worth it to check off of the "to-do" list.

361332374.name: Fun trip on  cruise stop
361332374.author: a TripAdvisor user
361332374.reviewBody: Took a trip for 15 bucks from a tour company at the pier. Took about an hour to get there. Was really fun watching the blow hole shoot water high into the air. Nice shopping area for good food, silver,  and leather purses.

361332043.name: Great drive from Ensenada...
361332043.author: a TripAdvisor user
361332043.reviewBody: I highly recommend the drive to Bufadora. As you leave Ensenada, you drive through some farmland, and the wind around the bay, and up the mountain for some incredible ocean views. Take your time, there is no need to be in a hurry, enjoy the scenery, and stop at one of the many options for tacos, or c\u00e1rnicas which are very popular along this route. Once you get to the Bufadora, pay $2 to park, and walk through the maize of vendors, you can bargain for some great deals here, make sure you barter, typically around 1/2 of the asking price...You will be offered snaks, food, and variety of drinks along the way. Again take your time and enjoy the ride. The blow hole is not much to see other than 1 of 3 locations in the world were this phenomenon takes place...once you see it, you can say you\'ve done it, and enjoy the rest of your day, enjoying your surroundings. It is worth the trip, more for everything else you see and experience than a water spout...Enjoy!

361320251.name: Okay Place
361320251.author: a TripAdvisor user
361320251.reviewBody: I always wanted to come here to see what was the hype about this place. Well I finally did and expected more. The Ensanada blow hole wasn\'t blowing water as it normally does,can\'t control Mother Nature. The Sea was beautiful. It a long drive from the main Ensanada city (tourist area) \nI don\'t plan to go back. There a great Taco place at the corner as you enter -sorry can\'t remember the name,ask around people all talk about it.

361313589.name: Thar she blows!!!
361313589.author: a TripAdvisor user
361313589.reviewBody: La Bufadora was a great visit.  I enjoyed the natural phenomenon that would spray water several feet into the air.  Luckily, it happens on a very regular basis, so if you missed one, the next wasn\'t far behind.\n\nBeyond the "blowhole" I also visited some of the shops that are nearby.  The people I spoke with were very friendly--even tolerant of my butchering their native Spanish--and quite industrious.  There were times I felt they were a bit too pushy, but hey, we all have to eat somehow.  Because this is a well known tourist destination, prices carried a high mark up.  Some of the things purchased from this market were show elsewhere much cheaper.  That said, I still think the "inflated" price we paid was fair so it is what it is.  My only regret was not trying the delicious clam dish that was being grilled.

361233018.name: Nice but a major tourist trap
361233018.author: a TripAdvisor user
361233018.reviewBody: This is worth the 30 minute drive each way but be prepared for a barage of vendors etc. as you get to the actual Bufadora. It is worth going and the actual Bufadora is quite a cool sight but just be prepared for it being a major tourist trap kind of place. We paid $2 for parking and all the places looked to be the same price so pick one you are comfortable with. Then there is a ten minute walk through a barage of shops and vendors. They were doing the hard sell but weren\'t too badly in our face. Plan on spending 5-10 minutes watching the blow hole as it is kind of neat. Do set your expectations though and your mettle for the 10 minute walk there and back.

361026485.name: Cool natural wonder!
361026485.author: a TripAdvisor user
361026485.reviewBody: As the "largest marine geyser in the world" La Bufadora is a neat spot to visit, and the views along the walkway to see it are spectacular. I enjoyed the open air flea market just a few steps away as well- however please note that it\'s a spot that emits geysers of water at the end of the day, so likely not going to hold many peoples attention for more than 10 minutes. This was part of a day trip that also involved the Los Canadas canopy tour, and nicely rounded out the day.

360758522.name: please don\'t  make me do this ever again!
360758522.author: a TripAdvisor user
360758522.reviewBody: It is a little bit of a bus or cab ride from the cruise port.  When you arrive you have to hike through a multitude of vendors trying to sell you items.  The blow hole is at the end of the gauntlet. Once you arrive depending on the tide you can watch water shoot up..the ocean and scenery is pretty.  At this point you will realize you have to make your way back through all the vendors.  If you like to shop and be hounded to buy things (they are even peddling Viagra) then this might be a fun stop.  My family would much rather do something else.

360507114.name: Fun, Mexican carnival but know rides.
360507114.author: a TripAdvisor user
360507114.reviewBody: You will like this place if you like street vendors. There are restaurants. It\'s a tourist trap but worth it. You don\'t have to spend anything if you don\'t want. The blow hole is a hoot. The drive is pretty.

359490513.name: La Bufadora so overrated
359490513.author: a TripAdvisor user
359490513.reviewBody: I finally had the chance of going to La Bufadora. It was not as good of a location to come and visit as I thought it would be. Way toooo many tourists and the prices for food or beverages are outrageously high. You only need to go there once if that.

359481321.name: If you\'re not into the bar scene in Ensenada this is a decent option
359481321.author: a TripAdvisor user
359481321.reviewBody: I was extremely uncomfortable walking through the middle of the market because of all the shop owners coming at you from all directions trying to get you to buy something. There was nothing to be afraid of and I felt safe but I found out I\'m not a fan of it. My wife on the other hand strolled through looking for leather goods and found some great deals. I think she was having a little fun at my expense watching me squirm. She selected shops with low pressure salesman who were very nice and friendly. I had no idea my wife could barter like that.\nA couple of the food stands had awesome looking food but my wife spent all of our cash on purses and sandals so I didn\'t get to try anything.
