The grilled stuffed clam shells looked amazing and I would go back just to try one. Next time I will keep the cash in my pocket.\nEven as uncomfortable as I was it was still a fun trip. My favorite line from one of the shop owners was, "Come and look! Almost free!"

359451942.name: Day trip whilst on a cruise from LA
359451942.author: a TripAdvisor user
359451942.reviewBody:
Ensenada is like nowhere I had ever seen before! People hustling for sales at the side of the road, beggers everywhere. It might be nicer if you get away from the port area, we didn't go that far.
We took a trip in a terrifying taxi (things falling off it!) up to La Bufadora. We wandered down the tourist street. Saw lots of places that exploit endangered wild animals for tourist 'fun'. We did NOT partake of these things. (Having your photo taken with leopards, tigers, lions etc. The animals from what we could see were sleepy and able to be petted. It was impossible to take any photos for evidence to send to wild life sanctuaries as there were guards at every corner watching. This is a Shocking practice that needs to be stopped.
Unfortunately on the day we were there the blow-hole was fairly inactive, as the weather was too mild (nothing we can do about the weather!) so the we were all a bit disappointed.

The street food was really good though :)

Ultimately we were all glad to be back on the boat!

358578918.name: Beautiful Coastal Scenery & Open Air Market
358578918.author: a TripAdvisor user
358578918.reviewBody: I\'ve been here many times. The road to get here is half the fun. Look for the signs that say "Elote" for the best corn tamales ever. Once you get here, there is a really cool open air market selling purses, belts, knick-knacks, etc. If you get hungry, enjoy coco helado: first you drink the liquid, then you give them back the coco & they chop up the coconut meat for you & put in a bowl. They have all the fixins on the table to season & enjoy the coconut or you can have a freshly made churro with a funny guy making sound effects, but most of all, the reason you came: the blow hole is awesome.

358572273.name: Amazing
358572273.author: a TripAdvisor user
358572273.reviewBody: Loved this tour to La Bufadora. Took some great video. Friendly stall holders and yummy food. Worth a visit as its very unique

358203764.name: Misleading
358203764.author: a TripAdvisor user
358203764.reviewBody: The only good thing about our trip to La Bufadora was the magnificent scenery as we drove there with our fabulous tour guide David (ensenadatour@gmail.com). The place itself consists of an alley lined with souvenir shops and taquieras that lead to the entrance to La Bufadora, an overcrowded outcropping with a stone wall that overlooks the ocean. Plan ahead and bring .50 cents for the bathroom.

358147924.name: La buf.
358147924.author: a TripAdvisor user
358147924.reviewBody: It\'s something worth seeing.  The chaos of the bazaar, the actual landmark.  The people are friendly, can be overwhelming at times, just simply say no and move on if you\'re not interested in buying anything.  Parking is $2 of you\'re driving in.  The cruise ships can take you there as well.  It\'s a nice drive up there as well.

357898091.name: Wasn\'t too active when we were there
357898091.author: a TripAdvisor user
357898091.reviewBody: The drive there and the sites are very beautiful but this review is for the blow hole so that\'s why I gave it an average rating. My teenage son said that he gets the "blow" part of the place. I think we hit it on a low spray time because it wasn\'t really doing anything. The trip wasn\'t wasted however because we enjoyed the drive out there (we rented our own car for $40) and it was really nice. Plus the MASSIVE bazaar you have to walk through to get down there was quite the experience. Dodging people shoving crap in your face turns into a sport so that was exciting. We did actually grab some souvenirs on our way out and they are very nice people. We ate at the little restaurant on the bottom near the blow hole but beware, it is expensive. We should have just grabbed a fish taco from one of the vendors. But I guess where else can you sit down to eat with a view like that?

357773670.name: Arrrrrrre La Bufadora!
357773670.author: a TripAdvisor user
357773670.reviewBody: It is a great drive getting there, the scenery down the\nBaja California coast Is amazing.\nThe Bufadora is similar to the Halona Blow hole or the spouting Horn in Hawaii except the Bufadora generates its energy from a cove instead of Lava Tubes.

357444863.name: Spectacular view
357444863.author: a TripAdvisor user
357444863.reviewBody: Quick view to the natural marine geiser, with a quaint market and good quantity of restaurant to choose.

357365691.name: Beautiful Drive. Ok Site
357365691.author: a TripAdvisor user
357365691.reviewBody: We drove from Ensenada and the drive was amazing! Once we got to La Bufadora we were a little disappointed for lack of view. It\'s a hole, nothing special. If you plan on going spend more time looking at the view on the way.

356827783.name: Fun attractiom
356827783.author: a TripAdvisor user
356827783.reviewBody: We thought the blowhole was kinda cool, it was worth the drive to see it.  15 to 20 minutes at the blow hole is enough, but it is surrounded by shopping and food that can occupy a few hours.  I didn\'t think the vendors were that annoying, they were there trying to entice us into their stores, but a polite no thanks was all it took to be left alone.  But if you haven\'t shopped in Mexico it might suprise you how hard they try to sell their stuff.  We bought some vanilla, Mexican backpacks for the kids, and let the kids get a few braids in their hair.  We ate some of the best tacos at a little restaurant where the buses park near the front of the entrance to the shopping area.  They were the best tacos.  Our bus driver was lots of fun, very knowledgeable and very proud of his city.  It was a nice day.

356815078.name: WOW!
356815078.author: a TripAdvisor user
356815078.reviewBody: You must experience this natural wonder while in Ensenada. It\'s about an hour from downtown and the drive is particularly beautiful along the way.

356678392.name: A nice side trip
356678392.author: a TripAdvisor user
356678392.reviewBody: This was an entertaining spot, but not all that dramatic.  Especially if you have seen other more impressive blow-holes.   The long walk thru food and shopping vendors was rather tacky.

356373492.name: Long beautiful drive to get there
356373492.author: a TripAdvisor user
356373492.reviewBody: Nice drive to get there but dont hold your breath for the end - super touristy and sometimes no water blows.

355655589.name: Ultra scenic Mexican American Restaurant Cantina
355655589.author: a TripAdvisor user
355655589.reviewBody: The actual \'blowhole/ is another 1/4 mile to road\'s end. The La Buf Restaurante provides a mid level [good but not excellent] menu w/ good to very good wines, beers and especially Tequilas. The view out over the small bay and colorful community has some similarity to the Costa Brava of Italy. Looking out over the small U-shaped bay with crashing waves and unique and colorful homes while enjoying good food and drink is what visitors look for when visiting Mexico.

355611237.name: A must if you are in this part of baja California
355611237.author: a TripAdvisor user
355611237.reviewBody: I went without too much expectation, thought it was just something one does in passing time when in ensenada. I was very wrong.  Most of all,  the drive to the point was very scenic.  For about 20 minutes,  you drive along the stretch of cliff coastline that could almost measure up those of the Mediterranean.  Once you arrive,  although the vendors along the stalls before you reach la bufadora could be a bit annoying,  the view itself is simply wonderful for you to overlook other things.  It was not crowded on the Saturday we were there. All the cost needed is 2 dollars for parking.  The bay formed many different angles for fantastic photo op. In short,  the whole experience is definitely a must.

354790299.name: Dissapointing
354790299.author: a TripAdvisor user
354790299.reviewBody: I guess the blow hole was kind of cool, and I enjoyed the drive out to it, but... having to negotiate my way through 1/4 mile of vendors and obnoxious cruise ship tourists, not my thing.

354788101.name: Amazing views
354788101.author: a TripAdvisor user
354788101.reviewBody: Spent a fun afternoon here. The marketplace was bustling and exciting and we were able to find some really cute gifts to bring home (our tour guide from an earlier excursion told us to never pay what they ask, always haggle!!). The coastline was amazing! One of the most beautiful views we saw on our whole trip. Also, there was a place selling grilled oysters that were AMAZING so I would highly recommend getting one before you leave!

354218761.name: Nice place to see lots of local crafts and tacky souvenirs
354218761.author: a TripAdvisor user
354218761.reviewBody: The actual blowhole is cool to look at for a couple of minutes but the entire view is much better than the blowhole. On the way down you will see endless stalls selling local souvenirs and coconut drinks and hats and glasses and......... You will definitely have plenty of hard sells as you walk down, but no one was rude or offensive. \n   Enjoy the view!

353615507.name: Worth the Visit
353615507.author: a TripAdvisor user
353615507.reviewBody: So, this was my second time in Ensanada with a Carnival cruise.  Had a bad experience the first time and didn\'t go to La Bufadora.  That was a mistake.  Went this time and it was a great time.  I\'m into marketplaces and negotiating/bargaining.  So I loved it, but if you don\'t, may not be what you\'d like  The blowhole itself is pretty fun, we got splashed a few times.  Ate at a restaurant, it was spectacular (and no Montazuma\'s revenge, either).  It was the first one as you were coming back with yellow aprons.  Ensanada went from never would go back to magical and would definitely come back.  The blowhole made the difference (and the zipline, see my other review).

353343117.name: Gotta love Mother Nature
353343117.author: a TripAdvisor user
353343117.reviewBody: It\'s surrounded by the usual street vendors found in Mexico but the natural phenomena is beautiful.  To avoid crowds, go early.

353119829.name: Not a great experience but a good one
353119829.author: a TripAdvisor user
353119829.reviewBody: The trip to the blow hole was interesting.  Mexican businesses, homes and agriculture.    Ever wonder where Mexican vegetables come from?  Surprising high tech commercial farming here.  Next comes beautiful coastline and the blow hole, which is very impressive  and did not disappoint.  The market at the blow hole is pretty much NBC ( NOTHING BUT CRAP ).\nThe vendors are aggressive and annoying. The best of the market were the tacos, where the tour buses park. Yum! \nThis excursion is a good experience not a great one.

352741286.name: Local flavor, interesting tour, and worth the time spent
352741286.author: a TripAdvisor user
352741286.reviewBody:
We arrived by Carnival Inspiration, and got off the ship and found an independant tour bus waiting to take us to town for $3.00. on the way we were told of the tour offered for $15.00 that takes you to La Bufadora and the outside market. There were  five of us together and enjoyed our tour with Margareta and learned about the economy, customs, and even some Spanish!  The taqueria at the entrance has wonderful tacos ($1.50 each) and cold drinks. Don't leave without trying at least one!

Then you make your way through the open market and many of the shop keepers want "just one Mexican minute" of your time to examine their treasures that they want to make your treasures.

The La Bufadora was at then end of the paved path, and was in all its glory. We were told that November is the best time of the year to see it.

We enjoyed our day with the Habba Bannana tour!

352724493.name: If you need stuff, the vendors have it...almost free.
352724493.author: a TripAdvisor user
352724493.reviewBody: We wanted to visit the famous blow hole.  We knew that there have been some issues not long ago between the vendors and the land owners...but the day we went everything was smiles and fun.  Large number of places for a quick bite to eat or a beverage.  Middle of the day is more crowded due to the number of tour buses from whichever cruise ship is in port.

351687751.name: La Bufadora Tour Excursion
351687751.author: a TripAdvisor user
351687751.reviewBody: My family and I took this Blow Hole Tour excursion through our cruise ship line.  The bus tour to La Bufadora from the Ensenada port took 50 minutes one-way.  The tour bus guide, Gloria, was very informative and told us that 80% of Ensenada residents makes only $3.83 (U.S. Dollar) per day.  We were not surprised that there were so many merchants/vendors lining the street to La Bufadora selling trinkets, hats, and souvenirs.  Yes, the merchants were aggressive because they need to make a living to support their families.  We tried and enjoyed Very Much the seafood in a clam shell at entrance to La Bufadora.  I would definitely recommend La Bufadora!

351578858.name: Holy Wow......
351578858.author: a TripAdvisor user
351578858.reviewBody: Have been here before.....but the Bufadora was not acting up at all. But we drove up again with friends and got there early before the tour busses got there and we ran the gauntlet of tacky sellers that is about 2 blocks long, and to our delight the blowhole was blowing it\'s top. A few people were there besides us.....when a huge spout blew up way above our heads ...we all got soaked....kids were screaming with fun laughter.....it makes quite the thud sound when the wave hits and explodes with spray and rainbows abound. Our friends from Florida got wet and loved it. Apparently the next giant blowhole bigger than this is in Hawaii.....so La Bufadora is the 2nd. largest blowhole. You have to pay to park...it was $2.00 U.S.  a little aggression from the trinket sellers......there are places to eat, mostly seafood, clams and oysters. We didn\'t eat, but it looked good what we could see.  Will return, it was fun, refreshing and wet on this lucky day we experienced. You will laugh and enjoy this attraction.....try it. The drive up there is beautiful, you get a gorgeous view over the estuary below and out to sea. It was very green....the hills are stunning.

350959514.name: Baja blow hole
350959514.author: a TripAdvisor user
350959514.reviewBody: Went when the cruise ship wasn\'t in port, so we practically had the place to ourselves.....saw whales and seals.  Lots of souvenirs if you\'re looking for shopping.

350479735.name: Better than our Expectations
350479735.author: a TripAdvisor user
350479735.reviewBody:
We recently took a local trip to visit La Bufadora.  We didn't have any expectations, but really enjoyed this short but fun trip.  The guide spoke moderate English, but was helpful & explanatory. 

The little open market on the way to La Bufadora had some authentic Mexican items. The stall holders were a little pushy, which I do not like. I strongly object that there were lion cubs as an attraction for photographic opportunities. I very much shun this kind of tourism.

As it was a little windy, La Bufadora was quite spectacular. We had visited a Blow Hole in Hawaii, but this was far more spectacular.  

La Bufadora is not so far from the center so the return trip was about 3 hours including watching the Blow Hole.

I would recommend visiting, especially if you are on a cruise & have a day to spend here.  You can take the tour with a local company, which is more economical.

350385012.name: First time visit
350385012.author: a TripAdvisor user
350385012.reviewBody: Nice excursion to visit... very beautiful scenery lots of shops to visit. Our tour guide was wonderful the only bad thing is the Harrassment of the vendors

350337085.name: Way over touristy for our liking.
350337085.author: a TripAdvisor user
350337085.reviewBody:
When you get there, you have to either drive or walk through a gauntlet of souvenir shops selling nothing but Cruise Crap. I said to my wife that I wouldn't even want any of this stuff for free. 

There were some interesting looking stands and restaurants too, although we weren't hungry. The clams on the half shell with cheese and salsa looked really good. 

La Bufadora itself is very nice, but again, way too many tourists. Most of the cruise passengers had left by the time we got there so it was mostly independent travelers. 

I'd recommend going on a weekday, when no cruise ship is in port in Ensenada.

349945132.name: Fun and relaxing...
349945132.author: a TripAdvisor user
349945132.reviewBody: La Bufadora came highly recommended by our kids who had just been there the month before. We enjoyed the nice relaxing afternoon stroll and shopping. The bus ride was a great way to see the countryside and the locals were very friendly.

349716819.name: Beautiful Blow-hole but...
349716819.author: a TripAdvisor user
349716819.reviewBody: Scenery was awesome. A bit too political tour bus lady. Some good deals in leather and silver but way too many HIGH PRESSURE sales dudes. Good fish tacos.

349713187.name: Watch Out for Stop Signs
349713187.author: a TripAdvisor user
349713187.reviewBody: We drove from downtown Ensenada with no problem.  Once you turn off the highway the road begins to wind its way around a mountain and then up the mountain and then down the other side.  Watch out for 2 stop signs that are along the road for no apparent reason.  I missed one..... The road is windy, narrow and very scenic.  Lots of taco and tamale stands along the way, they were busy.  Once you arrive at the "town" you can either stop and park, then walk thru all the vendor stands or keep driving and park down behind the stands.  All parking is $2. To get to the geyser walk to the left of the washrooms.  The geyser is amazing.  Beautiful rainbows along the gorge that it sprays up from.  If you stand right at the end looking out to the ocean, photos are fabulous.  You may also get wet if a large wave crashes in and then gushes up.  This was a great start to our day tripping around Ensenada.

349140793.name: A bit of everything ~
349140793.author: a TripAdvisor user
349140793.reviewBody: It was such a random stop for us when we went. The flea market was pretty fun to walk through - so much to see and buy! We bought a couple snacks and some bottles of wine. When you head further down, that\'s where all the food and drinks are at. We had a few micheladas while continuing onward, towards the water. It\'s a pretty nice view. There\'s not much to see there, but I find it relaxing. I will definitely come back again one day.

349020829.name: Very commercial if that\'s on your list!
349020829.author: a TripAdvisor user
349020829.reviewBody: We visited this attraction, about a 45 minute drive from Ensendada, very scenic.  Upon arriving at La Bufadora we were charged $2.00 to park!!  You walk down a street to get to the blowhole, on both sides are the largest vendor market I have ever seen in Mexico!  The vendors verbally  attack you as you walk by, selling everything from fridge magnets to blankets!! Finally you arrive at the blowhole, quite impressive if the waves are sizeable, worth the walk.  Just remember you have to walk back up the street I call vendor alley, you get attacked yet again!  Very commercialized if that\'s your liking!

348861672.name: Sea spray
348861672.author: a TripAdvisor user
348861672.reviewBody:
Beautiful ocean views, however unless you are really (REALLY) into seeing all different natural sites, this is not really a MUST do. Yes, it is a blow hole, however it has the same affect as a big wave hitting rocks and spraying up and in the end may not be worth the 40 minute ride out of town (each way). The attraction itself wasn't worth more than a five-minute view and the vendors lining the street that you had to walk through could be a deterrent for some people. 

The shopping (vendor booths) section was touted as having better shopping at more reasonable prices than the vendors close to the cruise ships however the prices I encountered were outrageous. Yes, the silver MAY have been better quality (I really have no way of knowing though), however the prices quoted were crazy, even taking into account the bartering that generally happens ($85 for a pair of earrings that were worth no more than $30 as an example). The fares offered are the same thing you will see at all tourist stops in Mexico, so don't worry about missing out on anything special. 

If you have other things you want to do with limited time you may rethink this one, or at least make sure you are fully aware of how long your tour will be out there (unless you rent a car, etc. and are on your own time).

348735190.name: Beautiful sight, but not a fan of the flea market
348735190.author: a TripAdvisor user
348735190.reviewBody:
Upon disembarking our cruise ship in Ensenada, shuttle buses are waiting just as you exit the small Port Authority shopping area.  They are $2 USD per person to take you to downtown Ensenada, and $1 USD per person to return you to the ship.   On the way to town, the gentleman onboard the shuttle explained that he was with Misioneros Tours and that his company offered round trip tours to La Bufadora for $15 USD per person.  Of course you can't beat the price.  Several people on the shuttle bus decided to take the tour, so we joined them.   Our tourguide, Sofia, was amazing.  Beautiful, personable, helpful, and you could tell that she loves her home so very much.  As we were driving from the city to La Bufadora which took about 45 minutes each way, she told us about different sights that we were passing by, explaining the military personnel and armed policemen with guns that we might see, calming the passengers of any worry of harm - she explained that this was very common to see.  She explained their sources of income (Tourism, of course - then agriculture).    She provided helpful advice as to where it was OK to get ice (safe for your stomach) and where it was NOT okay.  Every little thing she spoke about was either helpful, or fun, or interesting - I can't say enough about her.

When the tour bus dropped us off at the waypoint at the beginning of the Flea Market, Sophia walked us through and introduced us to her preferred vendors.  They provided our group samples of fresh churros, sweet breads, candied nuts, lots of things.  She explained what we should look for if buying silver (925 stamped on the back) and told us not to be afraid to barter/haggle.  The shopkeepers, of course, make their living selling their wares, and they aren't afraid to get in your face about it, either.  So don't feel offended - just be firm and stand your ground, and they'll get that you're not going to be swayed if you don't want to buy anything. :)

La Bufadora was very calm on the day we went (February 10th, 2016) but we did get a few good sprays that went up higher than the cliffs next to us.  I'm very glad we got a chance to see this!   The area near La Bufadora is just beautiful, with pristine waters and gray-black rocks.  Sofia explained that it's not uncommon to see whales from this viewpoint. :)

348577984.name: The views are gorgeous!
348577984.author: a TripAdvisor user
348577984.reviewBody: The drive to La Bufadora winds through hills along the coast and is absolutely beautiful. Before arriving to the blowhole you have to pass through a couple blocks worth of stalls selling their wares along with snacks. Some of the best tacos I had in Ensenada were the fish tacos I had here. You can actually drive down through all of the stalls and reach a parking lot at the bottom, the views here are breathtaking. Pockets of aquamarine blue and azure waters are so beautiful. It\'s worth wandering along the cliffs near the parking lot for some great photos before heading up to the blowhole which was neat but for me, paled in comparison to the views.

348345483.name: A beautiful new side to Ensenada
348345483.author: a TripAdvisor user
348345483.reviewBody: Came on this trip for Valentines day. Took this tour on a whim. SO WORTH IT!!! The flea market is super fun to go through! The food is awesome! I recommend the grilled oysters with cheese and diced shrimp and a pina colada!

348328023.name: Huge disappointment
348328023.author: a TripAdvisor user
348328023.reviewBody: This is personal preferences, but I would advertise this place as a touristic market which just happened to be on the way to cave or whatever. so you fight through the market to see pretty much nothing (some puff of air) for 2 minutes and then fight your way back to you vehicle. not worth seeing at all

348198064.name: Great fun
348198064.author: a TripAdvisor user
348198064.reviewBody: La Bufadora was fun but walking thru all the sales people was just as much fun. Everyone was in a good mood and we joked back and forth. The food at the restaurant overlooking the sea was terrific.

347892327.name: Well-worth the 45 minute drive, though gimmicky
347892327.author: a TripAdvisor user
347892327.reviewBody: Our hotel had a map, and the signs are excellent, you can\'t miss it. Parking is everywhere, 2 bucks, and you can drive in through the gates and get much closer than you would think. You have to run the gauntlet of vendors, from Churros (delicious) to hats and purses and pottery and shoes and ukuleles. Unfortunate, but you can go into a restaurant like Panchos, with a great view, before going to the attraction. The geyser is impressive - water spray shoots up 20 to 100 feet, every couple of minutes, preceded by a rumble and whoompf when it "explodes". The surrounding wild ocean views are worthwhile in themselves. Won\'t be back in a hurry.

347498614.name: A nice day out
347498614.author: a TripAdvisor user
347498614.reviewBody: You\'ll have to drive out of Ensenada for a while and once you get there pay for parking but it\'s not bad. It\'s a street full of vendors but you can buy street food which I love and there are also restaurants. Then you get to the bufadora and sometimes the tide isn\'t high enough for it to blow. But you could take pictures with baby lions and large snakes it\'s pretty amazing for like 20$.

346960535.name: Taking in the scenery
346960535.author: a TripAdvisor user
346960535.reviewBody: Went with family and friends. It was kind of windy and cold, but every one had a wonderful time even the little ones. We we\'re glad to have seen it.

346950486.name: The worst tourist trap
346950486.author: a TripAdvisor user
346950486.reviewBody: The drive out through green fields is pleasant. When you get to the blowhole, pleasant vanishes - everything is priced in US dollars. If you insist on paying in pesos, it gets a little cheaper. $2 or 30 pesos to park. Then you run a gauntlet of hundreds of stuff vendors. The worst is the display of a baby lion under the guise of "save the wildlife" - the only beneficiaries of this disgusting display are the people grabbing the money. The blowhole itself puffs spray at shrieking tourists. Too bad these same tourists also throw their garbage onto the rocks. It will cost you to use a dirty washroom. There are nicer places. Drive down to Estero Beach resort, free parking, no stuff vendors.  enjoy a drink at the nice restaurant, walk along the seawall and watch the flocks of seabirds.

346702804.name: Love this place,
346702804.author: a TripAdvisor user
346702804.reviewBody: specially when on a high tide.. you can have fun on the streets as well. charming place, restaurants are not as good as in Ensenada

345093736.name: Highlight of an Ensenada trip
345093736.author: a TripAdvisor user
345093736.reviewBody: This is the famous blowhole of Ensenada. A lot of local buses pick up passengers and take them to this attraction. There are tons of vendors and souvenirs but the highlight of this stop is the taco stand by the entrance!

345080018.name: You should go once at least
345080018.author: a TripAdvisor user
345080018.reviewBody: This is one of the "bucket list" things you should do if you are only going once to Ensenada but it is quite a ways out of town so don\'t go unless you have your own car or negotiate the price in advance with the cab drivers.  The do have some street vendors there too.  Seeing the water shoot up in the air is fun but no need to stay very long unless you want to take a hike.

344867133.name: Ensenada\'s Main Attraction
344867133.author: a TripAdvisor user
344867133.reviewBody: We last visited La Bufadora 16 years ago, before the street vendors and taco stands. Our disappointment was having to walk down the walkway with vendors trying to pull you in (literally) to their shops. We were not here for shopping, so to us it was a nuisance. La Bufadora was having a good day with water shooting up so high people were getting wet. It is a must visit on your first trip to Ensenada.

344807343.name: Rustic Charm Coupled With Spectacular Ocean Veiws
344807343.author: a TripAdvisor user
344807343.reviewBody:
Having been visiting La Bufadora for over fifty years, I have watched the area grow from a couple of makeshift curio stands and rustic restaurants to a bustling, but typical Mexican tourist attraction.

In the farm fields at the base of Punta Banda, stop and enjoy an ear of delicious Mexican corn on the cob with the works.  Corn is for sale at stands lining the road.

The view driving up to the the famous water spout is one of the most spectacular views on the Pacific Coast.  It remains almost as rustic as in the 1960's.  Seeing the water spout in action would be ultra-spectacular if tourists would stop dumping massive amounts of trash down the edges of the water spout. 

Several new restaurants have been built in recent years, but the two original restaurants built at the edge of the bay still exist.  You can't miss them.  They appear as old as they are.  Both are located facing the bay behind the curio stands before you begin your assent to La Bufadora itself.  I recommend that you dine at either of them and definitely try the fried whole fish that will probably have been caught that very morning.

When you go to La Bufadora, set aside enough time to visit the water spout, shop for curios, dine and then take a long walk up the mountain through the rancho of summer homes.  It will make for a memorable day.

One word of caution:  Be extremely cautious when climbing the rocks around the bay.  Freak waves come up quite regularly and they can be very strong.  I witnessed divers pulling out the bodies of a couple of honeymooners who were warned, but thought it would be okay to climb on the rock at the waters edge for just one picture.  Don't take the risk even when the water appears safe.

343990578.name: La Bufadora!
343990578.author: a TripAdvisor user
343990578.reviewBody: We hit it just right during low tourist season. The ride out to the point was spectacular. One of the parking attendants watched our motorcycle for 30 pesos. Walking through the  gauntlet of vendors was fun and especially nice since it was not crowded. It all looks like a tourist trap, but getting hit with a big spray is worth it!

343285049.name: Nature at its best but it is nature
343285049.author: a TripAdvisor user
343285049.reviewBody: Was an outing that we took while in port on my first cruise. I have been here before but it\'s still a beautiful place to spend time at. As Maker H. stated, it all depends on weather and tides. We were lucky that the tides were high and the weather was clear. Some sets were over 40 feet. You need to take your time and wait for the right wave to come in have your camera at the ready. As a sidenote, there is a shopping area before you get to the"Blowhole". Walk through first, look at what they are selling and then buy as you are leaving. Also take care on what you buy,  not all things are what they seem with leather and jewelry.

342481540.name: nice little trip to a unique natural wonder
342481540.author: a TripAdvisor user
342481540.reviewBody: disclaimer: the performance of this natual wonder depends of the tide/season. Sometimes you have to get lucky. \nBut when you get there, it\'s awe-inspiring. The sound, the visual spectacle and the general atmosphere are worth it. You might find the tourist shops a bit annoying but it\'s no big deal. Make sure to try the churros or tamales!\nyou\'ll also get a great view of Ensenada bay and can always stay to camp

342430551.name: So Much Fuss for a Little Puff
342430551.author: a TripAdvisor user
342430551.reviewBody: Total tourist trap.  The only good thing is there is no charge to actually see the blow hole.  It is a nice drive and there are some beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean.  However, it is easily 45 minutes to an hour there and back.  Long way to go for a blow hole.  Once you arrive, there is a mile long strip of shops.  Felt a bit like running a gauntlet of tackiness. Admittedly we did stop and purchase some carmelized  pecans and almonds at a candy shop.  If you only have 1 day in Ensenada, don\'t waste your time on a long car or bus drive.  Not worth it.

342177745.name: God bless "El Nino!"
342177745.author: a TripAdvisor user
342177745.reviewBody: This is our go-to attraction when we have visitors.  We went the other day and the water was out-of-control impressive.  Must be due to El Nino.  \n\nIf you have to pick one place to go, this would be the best.  They have really good food and they give lots of samples all along the walkway.  They also sell every Mexican trinket so you don\'t even have to do to Tourist Street.  I\'ve received the best deals here.

340734033.name: Natural phenomena
340734033.author: a TripAdvisor user
340734033.reviewBody: Shore side natural phenomena. Visit enjoyment limited by massive number of vendors and peddlers. Suggest going early.\n

340455489.name: breathtaking view-perfect for pictures and selfies
340455489.author: a TripAdvisor user
340455489.reviewBody: Spectacular view of the geyser although there are some geezers too.  Perfect spot to shop, take pictures and have lunch.  I highly recommend the fish tacos.  Walk away from the vendors and the price drops three times.

340322715.name: Disappointing
340322715.author: a TripAdvisor user
340322715.reviewBody: If you have seen blow holes in Hawaii, this will be disappointing.  Ensenada is a dirty town, the path to the blow hole is lined with barking venders and the blow hole is mini.  The only thing this area has going for it is that it was the site where the water shots where done for the movie Titantic.  We took a side trip off a cruise.  Never again.

340302221.name: Blow hole cooperated for our visit
340302221.author: a TripAdvisor user
340302221.reviewBody: Came here with a tour bus from our cruise ship and enjoyed it a lot.  Personally I would not visit Ensenada without being with a sponsored group since I feel they all drive crazy and I want to enjoy the time spent here.  \nWe arrived at the parking area early in the morning, which I highly recommend, as it was not overly crowded YET.  .You are instantly met by the locals selling their fares at the local flea market - which you have to walk thru to get to the blow hole.  People were very nice, but pushy.  It was about a 45 minute drive from the Ensenada port  one way.  Was told that grey whale season was October thru March and very likely you might see them if visiting at those times.  To use their bathrooms located at the flea market/blow hole area, you will pay them 50 cents.  The restrooms are clean and by paying them you are helping support the local economy.  There is a MUST VISIT eatery - Lidia\'s Tacos that are to die for.  They are fish, shrimp, carne asada and more for $1.50 - $2.50 a taco and sooooo good.  She is located near the dirt parking area.  You will not be sorry.  The blow hole was active for our visit and the views of the beautiful water around is BEAUTIFUL. The blowhole can be anywhere from 10-100 feet high at times, depending on the tides. Glad we came and encourage you to as well.

340098130.name: Nice view and pleasant ride along the coast
340098130.author: a TripAdvisor user
340098130.reviewBody: The water spray and sound  were  impressive due to the high surf but had it been a normal day, I think I would have been disappointed.  We did enjoy the tasty pina coladas sold by the local vendors and the local crafts offered for sale.

340024147.name: Great Scenery and Fun Flea Market
340024147.author: a TripAdvisor user
340024147.reviewBody: Seeing La Bufadora was pretty but it only took a few minutes. The flea market was the part of the attraction that made it more worthwhile. They had lots of authentic Mexican food, fresh Churros and Pina Coladas, tacos, and steamed clams. The shops were filled with souvenirs and friendly sales people. Practice your haggle skills and have fun trying to get the best deal.

338962620.name: Beautiful veiws
338962620.author: a TripAdvisor user
338962620.reviewBody: We visited her and loved how beautiful the view was. We enjoyed it very much. We have been to many outdoor foreign flea markets and enjoy doing so. Even in other parts of mexico. I\'ve never seen so many aggressive vendors. When we walked down the hill back to the tour bus though the market 5 or 6 different men approached us basically surrounding us all at once trying to get us to vist their shops/restaurants. Making my husband very uncomfortable. Most of the time we are able to say no thank you and walk on and most places leave it be but these guys followed us for a while trying to haggle with us. Very annoying. We would have shopped in thier stores but they gave us no breathing room.  Walking away the later shopkeepers were more what we\'re a custom to and more pleasant to shop in. At the end of the strip was a wonderful taco shop recommend by tour guide. It was such good very clean street tacos very reasonable prices made right in front of you.

338577660.name: Modest  Attraction at Best
338577660.author: a TripAdvisor user
338577660.reviewBody:
For those of you who do not speak Spanish, "La Bufadora" means "blow hole".  The effect is caused when the incoming waves are forced into an ever smaller "funnel shaped" cove. The weight and force of the incoming water back up and causes the front face of the water to spew up like Old Faithful in Yellow Stone National Park.

That is it. No big bells and whistles, just a cool natural geyser effect. Watch it for about five minutes... then you want to move on.

For those seeking to reconnect with nature, those seeking solitude and a quiet and calm organic experience, you will NOT find it here.  In order to get to the observation area, you have to walk down a narrow sidewalk which is solidly packed with trinket vendors. Some of the most high pressure salesmen in all of Baja   will be there to delay your progress.

I do think this is worth seeing - as long as you have modest expectation, and a high tolerance for high pressure sales tactics.

338566835.name: Interesting place but crowded
338566835.author: a TripAdvisor user
338566835.reviewBody: Very crowded. So it was hard to see the actual phenomenon. But the drive is scenic and is worth it if you have the time.

338031541.name: Great day trip
338031541.author: a TripAdvisor user
338031541.reviewBody: Great place to go biggest blow hole in North America. Shops great seafood. Must try the black clams on the grill. Pay for parking and bathrooms.

337944528.name: Tourist Trap
337944528.author: a TripAdvisor user
337944528.reviewBody: Not worth to come all the way just for this one. To access this place you have to walk thru tons of shop, I called it a market. The vendors will approached you many reasons from Viagra to pina colada. If you said no politely they will leave you. You have to pay parking as well. If I not mistaken only a few US Dollars. What funny about the vendors here, it was easier if you do transaction in USD than the local currency.\n\nLa Bufadora is exciting for a few minutes after that nothing to see. You could potentially get wet if you stand in front. I saw a few crazy people were standing and sitting on top, not in a viewing area. It looked very dangerous. It\'s still fun if you happen to be in the area.

337814206.name: NOT WORTH THE RIDE
337814206.author: a TripAdvisor user
337814206.reviewBody: After a long ride to get to the blowhole, that you can\'t even see unless you fight your way to the crowd and close enough to the fence, there is a vendor hallway that seems to have no end, it\'s so crowded that at times it feels dangerous, specially for families with children.  Seriously not worth your money and time.

337646681.name: A great sight!
337646681.author: a TripAdvisor user
337646681.reviewBody: We took a tour here from our cruise ship. We got a better deal off the ship to take the bus over to the sight. There are a lot of stands on the walk down to the bufadora so get ready to bargain. They will press you to buy! Once you watch the bufadora a few times there isn\'t much else to do but get a pina colada and some tacos but it is worth seeing.

337416590.name: A bit of a tourist trap, but still fun.
337416590.author: a TripAdvisor user
337416590.reviewBody: There is not much to the Bufadora. It is just a marine geyzer or blow hole in Punta Banda, Baja California. It was not expectacular by any means, but there are lots of small shops and friendly people there. The best thing about it is the drive along the coast there. You get to see some splendid views  up the mountain and the little town at the Bufadora has some good places to eat lunch. Dont develop high expectations and just relax.  Be carefull with the humps along the road, the Alto (stop signs) are not well posted. Watch your speed!

336999404.name: I\'m not sure...
336999404.author: a TripAdvisor user
336999404.reviewBody: This place is exciting only in the first ten minutes you are there. It\'s not clean, there are nice pina coladas (delicious by the way) but... Nothing else interesting. Not sure if I\'d recommend it.

336107351.name: Not sure if i\'d recommend it, if you\'re on a cruise
336107351.author: a TripAdvisor user
336107351.reviewBody: I have been to La Bufadora 3 times, twice on cruises, and once while staying in Ensenada. Both were completely different experiences... First,   I did not enjoy the cruise experiences.  You are loaded on a van, and are driven the 40 minutes to the blow hole. You are given about an hour to experience it, but nearly half of that is burned up by the tour guide insisting that you stay with them as they take you to all the shops that they endorse (slips her pesos?)  This allows you about 40 minutes to walk down about half mile of shops, and to see the blow hole.  The shops are classic mexican wares, cheap jewelry, rip off paintings, and assorted knick knacks, but most of the shop keepers are friendly and not too intrusive.  On the other hand, if you\'re not on a cruise it is a very different experience.  I enjoyed taking the time to sit and watch the blow hole, and enjoy the view of the ocean.  We were able to eat at a restaurant near the bottom of the hill that cooked up and served us the fish that we had caught that afternoon.  We were sat at a table on a balcony with an amazing view of the sunset.  Being able to take our time here, and shop at our own leisure made this a much better destination.

336061942.name: Fun new experience for the kids
336061942.author: a TripAdvisor user
336061942.reviewBody: Really enjoyed going here.  The kids (ranged from 9-15) got their first experience with bartering for souvenirs and loved seeing another culture up close.  The surrounding ocean is beautiful and the purchased items were fun.  Also bought some excellent fish tacos.

335567137.name: For some splashes of sea water - face the throng of street stall vendors
335567137.author: a TripAdvisor user
335567137.reviewBody:
La Bufadora is a natural sea blowhole near the tip of the Baja peninsular. About a 45 minute ride from the Ensenada ferry terminal. To get there, we took a local tour agency, Misionares Tours, for $15 per pax. 

The blowhole itself is interesting. Depends on time you travel, the tide, and angle of waves, how much it blows depends on mother nature. Some photos, and get splashed if you are close enough when a big one comes. Most of it is smallish. 

Getting to it means walking through a passage of street stall vendors, offering samples of pina colada, churros, snacks. Some stalls have baby lion, tiger cubs to 'raise funds' for them. Take as many samples as you wish from the vendors as you head down to the blowhole. Walk leisurely up to buy their wares, if you wish. Two seafood stalls offering BBQ clams/shrimps on seashells. Some fish taco stalls in between. The food offerings actually tasted pretty good, though you probably have enough of it through all the samples given out! Lots of souvenir/trinket shops selling pretty much what you see in Ensenada. Pharmacies selling all kinds of prescription drugs, even Viagra, Cialis, if those are up your alley. Not sure if real stuff or not.

333907536.name: Awesome experience, great family time.
333907536.author: a TripAdvisor user
333907536.reviewBody: We decided to go to the Buffadora due to the fact that we wanted to take my daughter so she can get to know the place. That\'s was what my wife said, I think she just wanted to go herself. We had a nice Pina colada with no alcohol.

333789408.name: Depends on what you are looking for, has become rather sanitized
333789408.author: a TripAdvisor user
333789408.reviewBody: As a tourist site, La Bufadora (The Blowhole) has been safetly sanitized. You can see it, but you can\'t get too close and it can get rather crowded. However, if you enjoy shopping and bargaining one on-one with the vendors for touristy stuff to take with you, the walk back can be a blast. Lot\'s of funky and unusual toys that you definitely won\'t find at toys-r-us.

333751448.name: Beautiful View
333751448.author: a TripAdvisor user
333751448.reviewBody: We went at a great time of the year; 70 degree weather not many tourists. We arrived at about noon and since it is off season the parking attendants arrived later. Our parking was free. It would only be $2 if you did pay anyway. Lots of typical cute mexican shops along the way- make sure you wheel & deal!

333412346.name: A must see while in Ensenada.
333412346.author: a TripAdvisor user
333412346.reviewBody: One of our stops while on our cruise was Ensenada and La Bufadora was highly recommended. It was worth the trip and the shopping there was the best in town.

333180892.name: Fun for the day - barkers will hound you
333180892.author: a TripAdvisor user
333180892.reviewBody: Fun day trip from the Ensenada city but it will take up a large amount of the day. It costs $2 USD to park. As you walk from the parking area down to the Bufadora you pass lots of shops both on the left and right sides of the street. Lots of shopowners/barkers will hound you as you walk but everyone is very friendly. We love the assortment of food, drinks and candy.

333036075.name: The Legend of the Baby Whale
333036075.author: a TripAdvisor user
333036075.reviewBody:
This is a great place to visit in summer.  You will have to pay for parking and walk down the street which is lined on each side with vendors of all kinds.  Food, clothes, trinkets, etc.  la Boufadora is a water spout created by the waves crashing against the rocks and splashing up through a hole that was naturally created in the top of them.  The pressure pushes the water up through the hole in a spout and rains down droplets and mist on the crowd.  It can be crowded too so be prepared.  If you do no like to get wet do not even stand against the back wall, I've done that and still been splashed!  I would not advise climbing on the rocks, you will see people doing this but common sense says do not.

It's a nice place to spend and even take your kids and get wet then the walk back isn't too warm either.  I would recommend making purchases on your way walking back up the street so you do not get everything wet or have to carry everything twice (down then back up the street).  Vendors were all friendly, some take American money, most take only pesos.  Food was good to snack on.  

I definitely recommend La Bufadora.  It is also a great place for photos, fun videos when your friends and family get splashed (make sure to protect your phone or camera and any other electronics!), and overall a great place to pick up some gifts.

332756857.name: Average Waterfront Attraction
332756857.author: a TripAdvisor user
332756857.reviewBody: La Buradora is a rocky beach front which means crashing waves and lot of splashing. Tour van pulls up at parking lot and you go through Flea Market of locals selling Ponchos, Blankets, Viagra / Cialis , ornaments, jewelries and food. Always bargin and then start to walk away, price will drop instantly. I bought a blanket priced at $45 and got it for $18. Poncho\'s were $25-35 , i got it for $10 -15 each. Food was good, i loved the coconuts (if you know how to pick the right one), they will try to get rid of old stock or mature one, so be smart. \nThere are other reviews of the food we had in ensanada. Take time to read them and if you have any questions, fire it away !\nIF YOU THINK YOU GOT SOME VALUBLE INFORMATION FROM ME THEN PLEASE LIKE AND RATE ME.

332539962.name: Best place to visit in Ensenada.
332539962.author: a TripAdvisor user
332539962.reviewBody: Enjoyed my time here. Very friend people. Great customer service. Love the food at Los Panchos Restautant in La Bufadora, Ensenada.

332477299.name: Great views and fun geyser-like spray for the family.
332477299.author: a TripAdvisor user
332477299.reviewBody: If in Ensenada, and you need to get some souvenirs, this is a 2 for 1. Great views of cliffs and coastline, fun to see the spray come up. On the walk to the geyser you pass a quarter mile of aggressive vendors. You\'ll hit them on the way back so just ignore or waive hem off for the return trip. Anything that you can get anywhere in Mexico as a souvenir can be found here. The vanilla is awesome, didn\'t see as many sunglasses here (mostly a Tijuana thing I guess) but there are some good things to find here. Churros are delicious, pins colada as well, but if you buy it inside a pineapple you really only get about 8 -12 oz in the pineapple. You\'d get more in a plain cup. Tacos are good and I didn\'t get montezumas revenge from it, so you\'re probably safe to eat their street meat.

331932733.name: Really Cool Beautiful Views
331932733.author: a TripAdvisor user
331932733.reviewBody: We saw La Bufadora while on a cruise with Carnival. It was great. It spewed pretty well. I even got soaked. The views other than this phenomenon was gorgeous. The road going there is a little narrow and windy. But worth it. Highly recommend. People have to realize this is a natural phenomenon, so there is no control how well is will spout. So you do take a chance that it mat not be a good day, and you may not see much.

331894465.name: Bring a jacket!
331894465.author: a TripAdvisor user
331894465.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a must see if you have an extra day in Ensenada.  The tide definitely affects the level of spray here, but even when its not as impressive, its still awesome.  There is this little oyster bbq place near end of the street right before the bufadora and it is delicious.  Find it and have some!  :)

331779093.name: Good for shopping
331779093.author: a TripAdvisor user
331779093.reviewBody:
La Bufadora's main attraction is the marine geyser. The spray wasn't that much when we were there in November. Perhaps the height of sprays is seasonal. However, the place has lots of shops where you can haggle more than you can in town. It has the best fish tacos (USD 1.5 only!) The restaurant is on the right as you enter the shopping strip of La Bufadora. 

To get there:
Don't take the tours from the cruise ships that cost USD 49. Get off the boat at the port. There are buses waiting for tourists. You'll pay USD 3 (roundtrip) and it will take you to town. The return time is up to you so you can still wander in town after your trip. The bus will stop at the terminal where you can purchase a roundtrip ticket (USD 15) to La Bufadora (tour guide included). Our guide Alfredo was really good and even recommended the best fish taco place on the right as you enter the strip. When you buy your ticket you'll also be given discount coupons for some restaurants.

331421855.name: Quick late afternoon visit to this beautiful place
331421855.author: a TripAdvisor user
331421855.reviewBody: We got their late when the sun was going down, so the stores were closing. It is a beautiful place, wish we had gone earlier.

330840678.name: High tide or bust
330840678.author: a TripAdvisor user
330840678.reviewBody: For cruise ship passengers mostly. A nice way to see some  rural mexican regions. The "blow hole" is not really uch to see most of the time. Lots of vendors at the site and lots of street food which can be fun. Don\'t think Yellowstone!

330590314.name: nice view
330590314.author: a TripAdvisor user
330590314.reviewBody: nice spot for sightseeing. street toward the spot is almost like flea market. but we enjoyed the flavour of the street and food there too. $1 taco was much better than expected actually

330532148.name: breathtaking
330532148.author: a TripAdvisor user
330532148.reviewBody: Such a wonderful experience to witness one of natures magnificent marvels.. Feel the spray of the ocean as it showers up creating rainbows. The quaint little shops are fun and inexpensive.. an absolute MUST for visitors..

330509896.name: The Blow-hole is amazing
330509896.author: a TripAdvisor user
330509896.reviewBody: Other than the natural ocean force geyser at La Bufadora there are many vendors to choose from, I usually deal with the artisan indians since their wares are genuinly hand made...  Some of the vendors have taken to selling items manufactured in China these are usually clearly marked, they do this as a means to maximise their profit. \n There are some indian artiisans the hand paint (by hand I mean literally with their hands and fingers) some beautiful scenes of the area on plates. Local music fills the air and the grilled clams are absoloutly to die for, smothered in cheese and spices.\n If you are afraid of crowds I recomend going during a time when the cruise ships are not in also a good time to negotiate, please don\'t be to agressive on negotiation they still need to make a living.

330254754.name: pretty cool!
330254754.author: a TripAdvisor user
330254754.reviewBody: I go there with new visitors of the city about once a year or every two years. It is a fun place with the spectacle of nature. A few too many street vendors and it seems like a very long walk from the parking lot to the water hole. Worth seeing.

329451868.name: small average viewpoint
329451868.author: a TripAdvisor user
329451868.reviewBody: went all the way from ensenada to la bufadora just to see this one little natural view.... no surprise at all. but the clans were awesome. Make sure to ask the taxi driver to wait for you

328187285.name: Beautiful scenery
328187285.author: a TripAdvisor user
328187285.reviewBody: We went to Ensenada Mexico with Ruby Princess and wanted to go to La bufadora.  The cruise ship charged 39.95 per person so we decided to go with the locals.  It was safe a local bus takes you from the pier to town for 3 dollars and drop you off at a station with large air conditioned buses and take you to La Bufadora for 15.00 each.\nThe bus was full of smart cruise passengers..they narrated to us the different scenery on the way and when we got to La Bufadora they let us stay for one hour and a half.  On the way to the blow hole there are a lot of merchants trying to sell you things but if you do not want you keep walking.  We saw the blow hole and took some beautiful pictures.  The bathrooms are 50 cents to use they give you toilet paper.  On our way back to the bus we bought a few things we bargained a lot and got the price we wanted..Nice trip back to bus depot and then you take same little bus to ship using the same 3 dollar coupon not more

328052193.name: Pretty cool
328052193.author: a TripAdvisor user
328052193.reviewBody: We were late int he afternoon, so tide was not high, but we did see the blow hole perform several good "blows\' of water.  The views from La Bufadora are breathtaking.  There is a shopping area, and in typical Mexican fashion, you are hounded by all the shop keepers.  It takes some of the fun out of looking.  If you are willing to eat while there, at the end of the shops on the seaside, they are cooking some pretty delicious looking lobster.

327872392.name: Go after High Tide
327872392.author: a TripAdvisor user
327872392.reviewBody: We checked the tide schedule before we went there. The tide was still raising when we got there. The tide table said it would be at 5.4 ft that day. The water was much much higher when the ride was slowly retreating. The mist went to 30ft above the lowest observation platform.

327690371.name: It\'s OK
327690371.author: a TripAdvisor user
327690371.reviewBody: It\'s a nice place to walk around and check out some Mexican craft and food. At the end of the street you will find the blow hole, it wasn\'t what I expected but it was OK...  If you are lucky you can take a pic of a rainbow, like I did ;)

327685467.name: Neat experience
327685467.author: a TripAdvisor user
327685467.reviewBody:
We visited Ensenada during our Carnival cruise. There are not really any places at the cruise port to shop, so you need to go to downtown Ensenada to do any shopping/touring. You can take the 15/20 minute walk or there is a bus that will take you there for $2 per person. Once we got on this bus, the tour guide presented us with several other tours (wine tour, horseback riding, zip lining, or La Bufadora) that they offered which were a fraction of the price of the cruise ship excursions.

I really wanted to go on the zip lining/suspension bridge tour but I had a bad cold/sinus infection and didn't think I could handle the strenuous activity involved. Our second choice was the La Bufadora marine geyser (blow hole). From what I read, I didn't know if it would be worth the time but it was only $15pp, so we went with it. 

It took around 45 minutes to get from downtown Ensenada to La Bufadora. We were able to see the beautiful area and our tour guide (Alberto?) was great! He was very knowledgeable about the area and told us so many things about the area that we would not have know about had we skipped out on the tour.  The blow hole was neat but the size of the water geyser depends on the strength of the waves, so the effect is different each time you visit. 

To get to the blowhole, you have to walk through an open air flea market. The vendors were very pushy and although I never felt unsafe, they did make me uncomfortable. So much so that I was not looking forward to walking back through the crowd to get to the bus. When we went back through the vendors were still pushy but not as bad as the first time. After we went in to shop at a few different stands, I felt much more at ease. Don't buy anything at the price they are asking. Our tour guide said they are open to negotiating price and will usually take 25-30% less than what they are asking.

The highlight of our trip was this amazing taco stand in the parking lot. They had fried fish tacos, shrimp tacos, carne asada tacos, and chicken tacos for $1.50 to $3 each. I am not lying when I say these were THE BEST TACOS that I've ever had in my entire life. Handmade tortillas made right in front of you and the meat was grilled/fried right there. So fresh! I would seriously do the tour all over again just for these tacos!

327542453.name: simply amazing place with the blowholes!
327542453.author: a TripAdvisor user
327542453.reviewBody: we travelled along way to see just this place and were amazed at what we saw.  and better yet, the little shops there had gallons of olives for sale there!  loaded up on them and sat and watched the blowhole!

326941099.name: WOW!  The Blow Hole was GREAT!
326941099.author: a TripAdvisor user
326941099.reviewBody: We went on the Carnival Imagination for  stop at Ensenada.  We took the tour for $15 each.  Great trip!  Included were the Blow Hole, the Flea Market, afternoon drinks, and the ride to the Carnival.  Not bad!  We really loved the Blow Hole!  It was fantastic!

326931862.name: Little disappointed
326931862.author: a TripAdvisor user
326931862.reviewBody: We stopped in Ensenada as part of a cruise and i would have rathered stayed and toured the area near the boat. Seems like they had more fun.

326742069.name: Really fun
326742069.author: a TripAdvisor user
326742069.reviewBody: The blow hole is cool, the flea market is fun but towards the end they are very high pressure. I got some very beautiful pottery bowls.  It\'s fun regardless of the salesmen screaming at you to buy stuff :-)

326088784.name: Family Vacation
326088784.author: a TripAdvisor user
326088784.reviewBody: We booked this trip through our cruise line. Do not bother! We could have spent half as much and had the exact same experience. The tour guide did not communicate in a manner that at the very least 50 per cent of the people on the bus could understand. There were people on our bus who never got to see the blow hole because of the totally incompetent advice of our tour guide. We have seen two other blow holes and we were able to see the water forming from the ocean level up to the full extent of the blast. This attraction, although very grand; does not have a venue to see the blasting from start to finish. This attraction from the start must be entered through a swap meet and you are SO hounded that it really takes away from the thrill. I can not, in all honestly; say it is worth seeing. Sorry.

325157481.name: Nice side attraction, but not main event
325157481.author: a TripAdvisor user
325157481.reviewBody: My husband and I and three other couples got to spend the day in Ensenada.  The last place we got to visit was La Bufadora.  The blowhole was kind of underwhelming.  Thankfully, we had other things we did that made our day great.  This was a fun little addition to our tour, but if this had been the whole tour, what a wasted day.  The shops were lots of fun to browse and shop through, but the vendors are pretty pushy.  Just know you will have to say NO a lot as you walk down past them and then back again to get to your car!

323874367.name: Did I miss something?
323874367.author: a TripAdvisor user
323874367.reviewBody: After reading reviews, making the trip to see this natural wonder, I had to reread the reviews. Did I go to the wrong place? \nNo. \nI didn\'t find the drive picturesque, ridiculous parking and walk through aggressive vendors selling same old, same old. I certainly don\'t fault them for having stands selling to tourists along the way, can be fun,  but, I do take offense at pushy, loud, intimidating "barkers". What a circus! Kinda defeats the purpose of visiting nature. Arrived at sight. Really? Maybe we went on a really bad day, tide wrong?  The famous Bufadora was full of famous trash....we even saw two disposable diapers in the foamy water - YUCK! I was so disappointed, although we did have some good laughs. I am tempted to try another visit just because of tripadvisor positive reviews.

323818796.name: Bring cash and QUARTERS!
323818796.author: a TripAdvisor user
323818796.reviewBody:
We came here because it was part of our tour we purchased after riding the $3 shuttle from the cruise ship. The absolute way to go vs what the cruise ship offers. We had a funny tour guide named Jesus and he gave us great information along the way.
It costs 50 cents to use any bathroom there so bring change!!!
Being in a group with a guide helped. We all walked to the geyser first. All the way there we were offered samples of churros, roasted nuts and smoothies. We took a few pictures and split up to shop. I wish I had bought more cash. The artists by the geyser had some amazing handmade art and it was super cheap. The rest of the stalls pretty much sold the same stuff. They do go lower on their prices. The banana place does offer a free bathroom if you buy two drinks. Their caged animals are pretty sad looking. 
The taco place next to all the buses had the best tacos ever! Don't pass that up! 
Bring enough cash, change, hand sanitizer, bottled water and simply say no thank you. These past reviews are pretty harsh. I would at least visit once. We enjoyed our quick stop. The views on the way are beautiful!

321582493.name: Cool
321582493.author: a TripAdvisor user
321582493.reviewBody: It\'s a neat thing to see, plus there are many shops where one can buy tons of souvenirs. FYI, they charge to use the bathroom so be sure to have some quarters on hand.

321235282.name: THE BLOW HOLE
321235282.author: a TripAdvisor user
321235282.reviewBody: Super fun attraction at high tide or just after high tide. Long trek through the town and a good walk so wear comfortable shoes.  Put on your thick skin as well, the merchants are relentless as you run the "shop gauntlet" getting to the attraction.  Just before the blow hole entrance on the right is a great little dive, with an excellent avocado and shrimp dish and tasty fish tacos.

319444296.name: Busy busy busy
319444296.author: a TripAdvisor user
319444296.reviewBody: Our visit to La Bufadora was busy busy busy. We were on a Carnival cruise over the 4th of July. We booked the tour through carnival. Our tour guide Benjamin was very nice and a good story teller. It is a pretty long bus ride to La Bufadora. Once you get there they march you right through the shopping area to get to the sight. We observed the blowhole  actually did get wet. Then we shopped on the way back to the bus. I highly recommend eating at the taco stand next to the bus parking. The tacos really we\'re SUPER good.  The shopping district was literally wall to wall people. But we did pick up some trinkets. Stay with the group if you go.

318759120.name: It was a spectacular show!
318759120.author: a TripAdvisor user
318759120.reviewBody: I\'ve visited many times, and Tues. Oct. 13 was the most spectacular I\'ve seen over 18 years.  The tide was high and the surge of the ocean perfect for very high blows of water.

317618029.name: Day trip, clams, coco, and a white tiger
317618029.author: a TripAdvisor user
317618029.reviewBody: Drove down here with friends. La bufadora is a great to visit and get splashed :) it\'s an under water explosion to the body once the wave hits the rocks and pressure builds up in the tunnel. Make sure to walk down and try every sample haha. Another tip is to go and pet the tiger and the jungle bar and then go to the top enjoy the view. On your way down use the slide and walk out haha. The place is relaxing and the people are used to negotiating so have fun and cheers!

316904156.name: Most likely, you will see nothing
316904156.author: a TripAdvisor user
316904156.reviewBody: It was part of our excursion tour from our cruise. It was 45 mins drive from the port, and some walk through the typical vendors for tourists. Whether you can see a real blow depends on whether you are at a very high tide moment.  We were half an hour from the tide peak that day, and we barely saw anything (1.5 meters tide). I would imagine the disappointment of people on the later tour. \n\nI won\'t recommend La Bufadora, unless you know you will have a high tide. In fact, I won\'t recommend Ensenada as one destination.

316675181.name: Tourist trap, but the kids had fun
316675181.author: a TripAdvisor user
316675181.reviewBody: This tour was offered through Disney cruise line and was a last minute decision by most people in our group. It was affordable so we went for it & decided to take a 3, 5 & 7 year old kids. What we thought we would see is a scenic drive to a beautiful ocean blow hole in a quaint little Mexican village. What we got was a bumpy bus ride through town & desert to arrive at the end of a row of aggressive vendors calling out to us as we passed by to get to the blow hole. When we saw the blow hole we were unimpressed but the kids were liking how it would come out with big sprays so we were glad they were enjoying it. Our tour guides gave us suggestions to negotiate prices but some of the shops were just plain trying to overcharge us. We did like the Banana  Manna restaurant as the kids were wowed by the caged cougar, white tiger cubs & huge snakes on display. Again us adults had a different reaction of feeling sorry for the animals. There was a huge slide in the restaurant that the kids flew down and had a few scraps but loved nonetheless. We adults enjoyed the pi\u00f1a coladas & oysters @ the bar but a little shocked that the bar tab amount was about the same as California tab prices. It was a nice experience for the whole family that we overall enjoyed but would not do this tour again. Additional tips, try the tacos by the bus parking lot, prices seem to go way down when you are leaving, and bring change to use the restrooms avg. 50 cents.

316367474.name: La Bufadora Ensenada
316367474.author: a TripAdvisor user
316367474.reviewBody: I took a  Carnival cruise that docked at Ensenada Mx , I then called a third party Local guide that took us around the best spots in Ensenada , All for a way lower price then  carnival , or the outside the vendors were offering to take us on excursions. We saw the amazing Blow hole it was beautiful excellent experience with the family. I definitely recommend you visit and use the third party Local Guide They also have a U.S Number,seven six Zero ,474, three ,one, six, six .

316194973.name: What a waste of time.
316194973.author: a TripAdvisor user
316194973.reviewBody: The ride to the blow hole is boring and depressing.  Our tour guide talked about how the government is screwing the people of Mexico and how poor they all are.  Once we got to La Bufadora, we were warned by the tour guide of the vendors and shops we were going to walk past.  This beautiful sight is located at the very end of a path that is lined by vendors.   I could not believe how quickly our tour guide walked us through this area, all the while we are being yelled at, harassed and heckled.  Knowing that I had to return to the bus through this same area was frustrating.  It is a shame that a beautiful view is obstructed by such harassment.  It might be worth the drive if I didn\u2019t have to fight with the locals to get back to the bus.  Everything in these shops are over priced and can be purchased elsewhere for 50% cheaper.  During my walk through shanti town, I heard, \u201ccome on in and buy something you don\u2019t need." This place made me sick and oh by the way....you have to pay to use the bathrooms.

316188813.name: Mixed Bag!
316188813.author: a TripAdvisor user
316188813.reviewBody: The blow hole is beautiful, the immediate area is below average and the views are absolutely spectacular, so there you have it! Is it worth driving 30 from Ensenada to the Bufadora, yes, it\'s definitely worth going at lease once!

314483304.name: A must see in Ensenada
314483304.author: a TripAdvisor user
314483304.reviewBody: This is one of the top must see attractions in Ensenada, so I definitely recommend you visit.  The only other blow hole I\'ve seen previously was the Spouting Horn in Kauai, but La Bufadora was much larger - the tour guide told us it was the largest in the world and it definitely seemed like it.  However it was very crowded and we had to wait a bit for folks to leave before making it to the edge.  To get there, you\'ll have to go through the typical gauntlet of street vendors selling you knick knacks and food, but they had some excellent pina coladas there and we also able to get a good deal (from bargaining) for some hats.

314443584.name: Interesting natural attraction, but haggle in the shopping area
314443584.author: a TripAdvisor user
314443584.reviewBody:
Getting there is not quite half the fun. We opted to take the on-shore tour bus to La Bufadora rather than the excursion from the Princess Cruise (California Coastal Cruise). It was considerably cheaper, but the day was hot and humid and the A/C on the "budget" tour bus was not working well that day. Regardless, we got there and saw the cruise excursion bus which looked much more comfy.

Anyway, about La Bufadora...
One needs to be there at the optimum time to see the best show, but not sure what that would be, high tide, full moon, whatever. However, the show we got was good. You have to wait for a few smaller jets of water before you get one of the full effect sprays. An interesting natural experience, but with no fee. There is parking on the way down to the area, but getting through the street traffic is very time consuming.

And, speaking of time consuming, the walk down to La Bufadora is quite long (not measured), but be wary of prices at the multitude of shops! We saw the same item offered at one end of the shop walk at 4 times the price as another place. My suggestion is to "window shop" on the way down to La Bufadora and ask about prices, then stop at the best price stores on the way back up the road. And, be sure to bargain! Never, ever pay full price, and half their first offer!

314307291.name: Nice sightseeing opportunity
314307291.author: a TripAdvisor user
314307291.reviewBody: In order to get to La Bufadora, you need to take a boat ride out to Todos SNtos Island. Interesting views and perspective of this beautiful bay.

313799926.name: Day trip.
313799926.author: a TripAdvisor user
313799926.reviewBody: Delightful oysters from street vendors. Lots to see. Beautiful views. The "Bloe Hole" is very impressive.

313415236.name: La Bufadora
313415236.author: a TripAdvisor user
313415236.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful. I could stay there all day and watch the blow hole. The shops are fun and the people are super friendly and fun!

313394323.name: not that great
313394323.author: a TripAdvisor user
313394323.reviewBody: I\'ve seen other blowholes in Hawaii and the Caribbean that were more picturesque. this one you have to view from a crowded terrace. the trip to get there takes at least 45 min. over bad road. there is some nice shopping and food there. the actual blowhole is worth 5 min. time, tops.

312439073.name: Awesome time !!!
312439073.author: a TripAdvisor user
312439073.reviewBody: I was a fun experience getting soaked by the geyser. Amazing natural phenomenon. The market and food experience was fun too.

312081551.name: Great \r\n Weather
312081551.author: a TripAdvisor user
312081551.reviewBody: Very different to what ive seen before...  Better...Plena y of stores to Shop around, Restaurants AND OXXO FOR YOURE BEER PURCHASE...

310753817.name: La Bufadora, Ensanada, Baja, Mexido
310753817.author: a TripAdvisor user
310753817.reviewBody: Great place to visit and experience a little ocean spray. Beautiful coastal drive from San Diego. Street vendors and restaurants at the site.

310344798.name: Traveling in Baja
310344798.author: a TripAdvisor user
310344798.reviewBody: We\'ve been to Ensenada a few times, but never got out of the city. This time we took a shore excursion from our ship to see more of Baja California. I was amazed how much of the lands we saw were cultivated for farming.  it was a nice drive down to the blowhole, La Bufadora.  It is one of three major blowholes in the world we were told. We enjoyed viewing the action of the incoming waves and the buildup and explosion of the water.  From the bus to the blowhole and back you walk a gauntlet of shops selling their goods.  We were not in a buying mood, so we had refreshments in a restaurant (Habana Banana).  You know the drill_bottled stuff and don\'t drink the water.  I don\'t know if that it is still the case, but I played it safe and had a cold Dos Equis Amber I very much enjoyed with my guacamole.

310127363.name: Bufadora = nice, getting there not so nice
310127363.author: a TripAdvisor user
310127363.reviewBody: Very nice and different natural cove, that because of its shape "snorts" water. The bad news is that to get there you need to walk through a very long corridor of noisy and tacky stalls.

309295761.name: Fun tourist attraction.
309295761.author: a TripAdvisor user
309295761.reviewBody: Quite nice, i was surprised.  There are many little stores with all kinds of arts and crafts and many restaurants.  Fun for a day when in Ensenada.

309118742.name: Popular site and too crowded on Sunday
309118742.author: a TripAdvisor user
309118742.reviewBody: Spectacular site, but incredibly crowded on Sunday! And you have to run the gauntlet of merchants to get there. Worth seeing once; I\'ll probably go again, on a week day when I can get close enough to see the entire cliff.

308800111.name: Small Bus ride and be ready for the shops on the walk to La Bufadora
308800111.author: a TripAdvisor user
308800111.reviewBody: We spontaneously took a tour van just outside of the cruise ship to La Bufadora. The tour guide was a kick in the pants and be ready for all the little shops and restaurant down the walkway to La Bufadora.

308493020.name: Buen tiempo!
308493020.author: a TripAdvisor user
308493020.reviewBody: Nice!! Must see in mexico. If you visit ensenda..worth the drive! Good for a day trip and its best to go about 1:00 in the afternoon for the best sights. Be prepared to get wet..so fun!\n

308392473.name: Buncha Rocks
308392473.author: a TripAdvisor user
308392473.reviewBody: Unless you have never seen big rocks next to the ocean, go ! The vendors in the area need your business !

307340440.name: MUST to visit in Baja
307340440.author: a TripAdvisor user
307340440.reviewBody: This a MUST to visit in Baja!, you will see a natural place where you can see and hear the roarring of the sea!!, on this sightseeing place you cna find resytaurant and a lot of local curious stores.

307010199.name: Shop, eat, and take in the views
307010199.author: a TripAdvisor user
307010199.reviewBody: A nice natural wonder and beautiful views.  You will have to make your way through the market to get to the geyser, which can be overwhelming -- the people are VERY pushy with their wares -- but if you just smile and shake your head you will get lots of free samples along the way.  Free churros and pina colodas?  Yes please.

306980600.name: What\'s the big deal?
306980600.author: a TripAdvisor user
306980600.reviewBody: Seems like everyone that visits Ensenada has been to La Bufadora. I went on a cruise and since Ensenada was one of the stops, La Bufadora was one of the excursions available. We chose a zip lining excursioin, but La Bufadora was added to that excursion. I get that it\'s a natural phenomenon and that there are only a few natural geysers in the world. That\'s cool. However, this stop has to be the biggest tourist trap in Ensenada! The guides will walk you through the shops and point out ones they recommend. I think all the guides make deals with certain shops and get a cut when someone from their tour (they want you to wear stickers with their name on them so he/she can identify you as part of their group) buys something.
