Of course you get a "discount" because you\'re part of "xyz\'s" group. The bufadora itself is ok to see. You see it puff up a few times, take a few pictures, and then there\'s not much more. LOL. So at this point you have to make your way back through the shopping area and all the vendors trying to sell you their wares. If you\'ve never been to Mexico before - or are looking for gifts, this is for you. For those of us that have been before and/or live in So. Cal, you\'ll see the same stuff you can get in downtown LA. (LOL). It\'s Mexico, so make sure you haggle for price. The best part of the area is the taco stand at the parking lot. Pricing is pretty much US taco prices ($1.25+ per taco) - but in a tourist trap like this it\'s expected. Tacos were awesome. So if you\'re doing another excursion and this is part of it - go for it. Just be aware of what the scene is. If you\'re wanting to do this as it\'s own excursion - make sure you like shopping. You\'ll spend 10-15 minutes checking out La Bufadora - then you\'ll have to kill the time shopping until your designated departure time. If you DO chose this as it\'s own excursion off a cruise - don\'t buy it on the ship. It\'s cheaper at the shuttle terminal. Hasta Luego!

306354277.name: Relax and eat
306354277.author: a TripAdvisor user
306354277.reviewBody: Like always is a good place to visit, dont  stop to come down and visit , nice people, good Clamatos and Pina Coladas, exelents churros and lot to shop

305539849.name: Great spot!!
305539849.author: a TripAdvisor user
305539849.reviewBody: Great spot! Amazing views .. Little to none lodging which makes the place special. Only few camp sites that are far from clean but very nice staff. Recommended 100% for campers and RV.

305468889.name: Natural Wonder and a Flea Market
305468889.author: a TripAdvisor user
305468889.reviewBody:
Parking for the blowhole is about a mile up from the viewing area. There is a paved road that goes all the way down, that is lined on both sides with vendors and a couple restaurants. 

We spent about 5min total actually watching the blowhole. Apparently, it's one of three in the world (according to our tour guide...). The rest of the time was spent shopping and eating. 

The vendors are very aggressive. We had fun haggling, but be warned, if you do not like pushy sales-people, this might not be the place for you. It's impossible to avoid the vendors. They stand outside their stalls and offer you samples of their drinks or churros, or try to offer you specials on their products. Most of the stuff if cheap trinkets or knock-off purses, and almost all the vendors have the same thing. 

Best part for us was the taco stand at the top of the hill by the restrooms. The beef tacos were amazing!

305402656.name: Impressive display by mother nature!
305402656.author: a TripAdvisor user
305402656.reviewBody: I asked my guide what \'La Bufadora" meant and he told me Buffalo Snort. I can why they named this so aptly. The water was so calm that it was amazing and impressive how far the water shoots up into the air. All you can say is \'Wow!\'\nThere are two ways to view this attraction called most often the \'blowhole\', you can stand above it and watch it cliff side, or you can kayak out to it and watch it from the ocean side.\nI chose to see it by Kayak and was so pleased I did. I got to see several seal playing and enjoy the time relaxing out in the beauty of the ocean while taking in the spectacular view and the impressive display of \'La Bufadora\'

302977467.name: La Bufadora, a natural wonder... and much more...
302977467.author: a TripAdvisor user
302977467.reviewBody: La Bufadors experience is still here! Hurry and experience the incredible view of  the blowhole and a taste of Mexico\'s great souvenir shopping and food. Whether you arrived to Ensenada on a cruise or drove, La Bufadora will be memorable!

300742722.name: Very cool
300742722.author: a TripAdvisor user
300742722.reviewBody: Beautiful view. Cute little alley shops but very busy with people. And parking is okay but you have to get there early.

300492836.name: Nice day trip but let down by the actual bufadora
300492836.author: a TripAdvisor user
300492836.reviewBody: The trip over was about 45 mintues from esenada. They have it set up so you walk through the street full of venders to make it to the actual blowhole. We were let down with the size of the water coming up must have came at a bad time because Ive seen pictures of better

300354501.name: Worth visiting but rather touristic surroundings,
300354501.author: a TripAdvisor user
300354501.reviewBody: INteresting phenomen located less than 30 min drive from Ensenada. The first impression you meet is street stalls with bunch of souvenir stuff. After forcing this you find the \'Blowhole\' / La Bufadora.

300331496.name: Cruise Excursion
300331496.author: a TripAdvisor user
300331496.reviewBody:
We booked an excursion to the La Bufadora on shoreexcursion.com, and this mini day trip was awesome!

La Bufadora is about 45 minutes away from the port, and we passed by a deep sea tuna farm while driving there. 

The parking is $2, and of course you don't need to pay anything if you are with a tourist group. There are many street shoppings between the parking lot and la Bufadora. The vendors do try to stop you and invite you into their shops. Many shops sell fake brand name pursues and accessories; other sell souvenirs and Mexican candies. You can pay everything in US dollars, but given the current exchange rate, paying in pesos might be a little bit better. You can also bargain in pesos as well :) One shot glass is around 50 pesos, so is a magnet for the fridge (50 pesos is a little less than $3.5). 

La Bufadora itself is a blowhole. We watched it for about 20-30 minutes, and the water kept going higher and higher. It was pretty cool if you have never seen a blowhole. 

*where to get tacos* 
We asked our tour guide where to get tacos, and he recommend the taco shop by the parking lot. We wanted to make sure the place is actually good (not just a spot that tour guide gets commission from), so we asked several local vendors when we were buying our souvenirs (in Spanish). The vendors also recommend the place at the parking lot (see picture). We went and tried the fish tacos, and they were so delicious!!! $1.5 a fish taco, and $2.5 a shrimp taco! They were so so good! I really regretted that I only had one taco :( 

You need about 1 hour at this excursion after parked. 20-30 minutes to check out La Bufadora, and another 30 minutes to shop and get some delicious tacos.

300057594.name: Just relaxing, people watching.
300057594.author: a TripAdvisor user
300057594.reviewBody: Fun shopping, great snacks and view, loved the finger painted plates, the lion cub petting (fundraising for lion preserve and Cabo\'s zoo), Native American dancers were pretty cool.

299849127.name: The only good thing in Ensenada
299849127.author: a TripAdvisor user
299849127.reviewBody: This was a great experience. You have to walk through a flea market to get there (which is white nice in itself to wander through), and the blowhole was fascinating to watch.

299638090.name: Too Busy for me...
299638090.author: a TripAdvisor user
299638090.reviewBody: Vendors very aggressive but friendly, No bad vibes...Ya have to see it once...Nothing to be afraid of and very safe for the family...

299458942.name: Maybe i am just hard to please......
299458942.author: a TripAdvisor user
299458942.reviewBody:
"Underwhelmed" is perhaps the best word to describe this attraction. Took the trip down with my cousin and her husband from Rosarito Beach. It was some 20 years since they had been there and the place reeked of crass commercialism. A full street of hopeful vendors, each selling the same old tourist crap. I do not know how they eke out a living.

 Was a flat calm day, so the blowhole sort of ran out of puff a little, but with a bit of a swell happening,  i guess it would afford a reasonable photo opportunity. Probably not worth the drive though. 

50c for a wee. What is all that about?

298131423.name: still amazing..
298131423.author: a TripAdvisor user
298131423.reviewBody: Went to La Bufadora after many years, still amazing nature marvel... 45 minutes from Ensenada in a so so two ways road, parking available cost $3.00, many souvenirs shops,(be prepared to bargain with street vendors) cantinas and restaurants affordable prices.. crowded on weekends.. Use tan lotion, and walking shoes. (sandals preferred) Trip of a couple hours nothing else to do there.. In the way back stop by one of many "resorts" along the way.. cost around $3 per person on one day usage.. get there early to enjoy the Mar de Cortes warmth waters.. hit the road before dark, lack of light on roads..

297759264.name: Cool but busy
297759264.author: a TripAdvisor user
297759264.reviewBody: The blow hole is neat but the place was really crowded, and the prices of the street vendors were jacked up. Which if you enjoy bargaining it can be a great place... If not you\'ll just get ripped off

297748320.name: Nice scenic area
297748320.author: a TripAdvisor user
297748320.reviewBody: Reminds me of Hawaii. Blue clear water and very scenic. Just a tip. Don\'t park at the very first parking you see. You can drive thru all the vendors and park at the very beginning of the Bufadora. Must see when visiting Ensenada. \n

297688494.name: Great from a kayak!
297688494.author: a TripAdvisor user
297688494.reviewBody: We kayaked here (and in the bay) on an excursion booked through Carnival. The kayaking was fun, especially the part where we just chilled near the blowhole for a solid 25 minutes. It was really great to watch the water shoot up (and listen to it), and especially awesome to see it from the water, rather than up above it. \n\nAccording to our kayak guide, it\'s one of the largest blowholes in the world, so if you\'re looking for some legit sightseeing, this is definitely a place to come.

297078305.name: Maybe a little over-priced, but overall a nice day trip.
297078305.author: a TripAdvisor user
297078305.reviewBody: Although many told us not to bother with this place because it was "touristy", we actually quite enjoyed it. The drive to the Bufadora took us through little towns along the coast, with beautiful scenery which we would\'ve missed. Once there, sure we were hounded by the many stall-owners that you are obliged to walk past on the way down to the rocks, but we gladly accepted their offerings of samplings of frosty drinks and pastries along the way. The only thing we did notice, which was surprising, is that it is not wheelchair accessible. As you arrive at the rock cliff, there are only stairs..no ramp..so anyone in a wheelchair cannot go further. We lingered for quite some time, watching the waves increase in size until they finally disappeared between the rock formations and came splashing up at us...most people were too impatient to wait and missed the show. Too bad.

297042881.name: Amazing Natural Phenomenon
297042881.author: a TripAdvisor user
297042881.reviewBody:
I have been there on 28th July 2015 as part of a Cruise via Carnival Imagination. I think that La Bufadora it self is the best of Ensenada. It is a blow hole where amazing Natural strange phenomenon occur. Simply it is a a path in the rocky mountain on the sea front with two entrances and it happens that the sea currents enter through the two sides at the same time in a very strong force .. they hit each other causing a really very high splash of water. It is very interesting to watch it happining. All of us loved it especially my kids.

Other than that in the surrounding area I didn't find anything thing extraordinary. I could not try any food as I am a Muslim and I can eat only  Muslim food so I can not give any rating for the food.

There was one shop that offers taking a picture with wild animals which seemed crazy a bit because the area is not wild at all and the animals looked wired and seemed to be drugged.

Our guide told us that many shops at that area might cheat us by selling us plated brass and saying that it is silver so be careful.

She also told us about some places away from La Bufadora selling good quality and very low priced vanilla but I was tired and not interested in spending more time at that place. It takes around one hour distance by car to reach La Bufadora starting from the sea port.

If it happens that you have been in Ensenada for any reason it worth to have a visit to La Bufadora.

296688857.name: Tourist Trap, but a Fun Tourist Trap
296688857.author: a TripAdvisor user
296688857.reviewBody:
La Buf, as it's known to English-speaking locals, is a tourist trap, but that doesn't mean it's not worth your while. The blowhole itself is usually a bit of a non-event on sunny days so don't expect Old Faithful but there are good things to be found without too much effort. Skip the knock-off bags and novelty shot glasses (unless that's your thing. I don't judge.) and head for the food stalls. The freshly-made churros from the stand closest to the blowhole are the best I've had in years of living in Mexico, while a bit farther up there are stands that sell excellent traditional Mexican dulces sweets, nuts and bread far better than you'd get in most touristy places. The colorful pottery sells for about what you'd expect to pay anywhere the area so if you negotiate a little (remember to ask for more items for the same amount, not a discount on a particular item) you'll be able to feel pretty good about getting a solid deal.

The sit down restaurants are not great and I'd skip them, but there's great gratineed clams and food to be had at the outdoor stalls. 

Oh, and one last thing: please skip taking photos with the exotic animals. Despite what they might tell you the tigers/jaguars/lions are *not* from rescues/nonprofits/whatever and the animals are bred and kept drugged particularly for that purpose.

296494735.name: I Love LaBufadora!!!  We have the BEST guide EVER!
296494735.author: a TripAdvisor user
296494735.reviewBody: We love visiting "The Blowhole" it is an amazing thing with the water crashing and going so high in the air!  It truly is a sight!  The vendors are great and the tacos are awesome!  We used to use the cruise line for our tours, but not now!  We have a wonderful guide David Marmolejo!  He has been our guide for 4 years now and anytime we want to visit Mexico we contact him!  He is accommodating, knowledgeable and will NOT disappoint!  You will leave feeling satisfied and happy with your new friend!

295634519.name: A flea market that just so happens to have a blowhole next to it....
295634519.author: a TripAdvisor user
295634519.reviewBody: Okay first of all, I would like to write this from two different perspectives. The first review will be from the eyes of a first timer that has rarely been out of the country. The second half of the review is my opinion as a seasoned traveler that has seen much worse areas in Mexico and other countries. \nIf you have never (rarely) been out of the USA, then the poverty viewed on the bus ride to La Bufadora will probably open your eyes a little. These people do not live well. They need to work hard for each and every penny and this is obvious as you look out the windows during the air conditioned bus trip. From the second that you enter the half flea market, half circus atmosphere that is unavoidable during your short walk to see the blowhole, you will be bombarded with sales people attempting to get you to buy buy buy. They know that they have only about 90 minutes of your attention to make an aggressive sales pitch. As soon as you reach the end of the street, your tour guide points to the blowhole and releases you allowing you to take a few pictures and then attempt to navigate the gauntlet of hawkers on your own as you work your way back to the bus. There are restaurants that offer toilets to patrons, but everyone else needs to pay to use the public facilities ($.50).\nNow to be fair, this was not my first time here. Over thirty years ago, I walked this same street. It was not paved at that time and the sanitation was no where near what it is today. The sales people were much less polite and you truly felt lucky to be leaving blowhole (hell-hole as I called it). Today it is cleaner, more civilized, and a simple "no thank you" works perfectly. The blowhole is really just an excuse to attract people to the market. If you are looking for inexpensive souvenirs, this is a good stop. If you are looking to admire one of natures natural wonders, this is not really the best place. The blowhole is here, but almost as an afterthought. If you are curious to see the area, the people, and a small amount of the culture of Baja Mexico, then this gives you a taste of how the people live and the dry desert like climate that they live in.

295063694.name: "AMAZING!"
295063694.author: a TripAdvisor user
295063694.reviewBody:
La Bufadora is one of only 7 natural blowholes available to tourists and it's one of Nature's gems. I visited with my large extended family and it was our grouchy, hard-to-please 8-year-old grandson who pronounced the sight "amazing!" 

There's a vendors'gauntlet to pass through between parking areas and the blowhole. If you want to shop, be prepared to haggle. (A fair price is usually 1/3 - 1/2 of the initial offered price.) If you don't want to shop, just say so. "I'm not shopping" or "I don't want it" will turn the vendors away. 

This is a great place to eat superb street foid. (If you see it cooked, it's safe!) Candy and pastries are delicious and available as well.

The star of the show, of course, is the blowhole itself. Take oodles of pictures!

294671159.name: Gorgeous and Friendly!
294671159.author: a TripAdvisor user
294671159.reviewBody: The blowhole is the most amazing sight I have ever seen. I have been there 3 times and am planning a trip again this fall. The shopping is fun! It seems a little crazy at first, but it is definitely the best place to buy all the souvenirs you are looking for! Can find great deals and they expect you to talk down the prices. (not for the food haha)

293853081.name: Shoppers heaven? or hell?
293853081.author: a TripAdvisor user
293853081.reviewBody: The available view of the blow hole is not that spectacular but to experience what you go through to get to it is a real experience.

293643083.name: La Buf
293643083.author: a TripAdvisor user
293643083.reviewBody: This is a beautiful area to have any meal and if you like to shop and haggle the vendors will let you. Some great prices and the wares are good

293383293.name: Creepy road!
293383293.author: a TripAdvisor user
293383293.reviewBody: Meh! It doesn\'t worth the drive (REALLY tight road). Restaurants there aren\'t good and the place is pretty dirty! The only thing I\'ve liked about it was the local vendors selling all kind of stuff.

293166208.name: A Must-See in Ensenada
293166208.author: a TripAdvisor user
293166208.reviewBody: My family and I traveled to Ensenada for the day and had a great experience at the Bufadora, or Blowhole. While it was very exciting to be able to view it from the viewing area right above it, we had the privilege of going kayaking around the Bufadora. It was a fantastic experience and a highlight of our vacation! The trip was made possible by a good friend, David, Marmolejo, who is a tour guide in Ensenada! We had an incredible time together as a family! It was very safe and David, who speaks English very well and is a very accommodating host, made sure we were all comfortable and taken care of. For more information on specifically kayaking la Bufadora, go to https://www.ldscityguides.com/guide/37/marmolejo/

292485686.name: If your in Ensinada this is a must see
292485686.author: a TripAdvisor user
292485686.reviewBody: We were in port for the day, took a bus to La Bufadora, there is a big blow hole, swap meet style shopping and a number of restaurants and street food vendors.  It was late season so the crowds were small, there were deals t be had dealers of stuff every where. Don\'t buy the ticket on the cruse ship it is less than half price in town, felt very safe, English spoken most every where.

292445742.name: A must see!
292445742.author: a TripAdvisor user
292445742.reviewBody: We have been here many times with the same tour guide! It is an amazing cultural experience that really does show a lot of the Mexican culture. I felt really safe and it was an amazing experience! Ensenada Tour Guide David Marmolejo was the best!!!!

290778183.name: Ensenada Day trip
290778183.author: a TripAdvisor user
290778183.reviewBody:
drove down from Arizona for a visit. My wife has always told me about the Bulfadora so we made it a point to drive there to see it and mark it off my bucket list. We were told just that morning while having coco locos on the beach that the Bulfadora had been closed just a few days prior to our visit. Land dispute between the city and the person who bought the land where the Bulfadora is at. 
Upon arrival its a nice senecic drive, there are parking vendors and it's $2.00 usd. From the parking lot there are vendor boths on both sides of the street. My wife said years ago it was just a few vendors with carts, not its sad to see the on slaught of vendors. 
Once you make it thru the crowded street to the site of the blowhole its a nice attraction to view. 
There was a restrurant who had a guy with a large pyton and a live Jaguar in the place (not a baby lion as one commentor stated) 
FYI, Ensenada is a Olive growers town, you can buy large jars of Olives for cheap on your way to the bulfadora.

288717977.name: If you\'re in the area, might be worth a quick stop
288717977.author: a TripAdvisor user
288717977.reviewBody: This is a natural blow hole that is the definition of a tourist trap. There is an observation to watch blow hole in action but you have to get through a gauntlet of aggressive street vendors to get there. We didn\'t go at night but we were told that\'s the best time to go. Also, while we were there some of the shop owners illegally barricaded the highway leading up to the attraction in over a land ownership. They pulled us over  but because we were staying further up the highway and not going to the blow hole they let us through. One of the  guys had a baseball bat.

288715762.name: One of the better places for Mexican and Seafood in the area
288715762.author: a TripAdvisor user
288715762.reviewBody: We spent a week near La Bufadora and had dinner at this restaurant once. We had a chicken tostada and a beef tostada as well as the chicken soup.  The ingredients were  fresh and the chicken and beef were very flavorful and the chicken soup was delicious. Prices were very reasonable.

288680149.name: Came for the blowhole, stayed for the food!
288680149.author: a TripAdvisor user
288680149.reviewBody:
Was in Ensenada for the day (cruise) and booked this excursion locally (not via cruise line).  It was somewhat scenic 40 minute bus ride.  Somewhat scary cliff side roads especially in the old Budget rental car bus.
Our guide was ok.
The walk down to the blowhole was full of people trying to offer you drink samples and to get you into their shop.  It's all part of the experience which I enjoyed.  It was great to checkout everything on the way to the blowhole and then on the way back you know where you want to stop.
My advice if you buy any drinks find out the price and size first before you agree to buy anything.  If you just order a drink they will give you the biggest most expensive thing on the menu.
We ate tacos at the restaurant by the parking lot based on trip advisor reviews.  They were excellent.   They are known for their fish tacos but liked everything else better.  
Everyone gives change in U.S. dollars even for the 50cent restrooms.  You can buy beer across the fence since this taco restaurant doesn't sell alcohol.
Definitely worth going.  Don't just stay on the ship.

288551163.name: Quick attraction with A LOT of vendors
288551163.author: a TripAdvisor user
288551163.reviewBody: About 40 minutes outside Ensenada, this attraction is worth the drive.  After you pay to park ($2), you\'ll walk down a narrow street with vendors on both sides selling anything from knock-off handbags and pina coladas to photo opportunities with snakes and baby lions.  At the end of your walk is the blow hole.  It\'s a pretty neat thing to experience and depending on where you stand, you may get a decent spray/shower.  Unfortunately, we did not see documentation on this phenomenon at the site, which would have been helpful, so we visited Wikipedia.

288198291.name: Warning: Police Shakedowns
288198291.author: a TripAdvisor user
288198291.reviewBody:
My group and I attempted to visit.  When we were most of the way there we were turned back.  When asked what the problem was we were told that La Bufadora was closed because of "some problems."  I asked when it would be reopened and he said it would be "maybe a few days."  Strange, I thought, this is a major attraction--must be bad for tourism to have it closed.

As we turned the car around I noticed a police truck began to follow us.  Once we were to the main road the police cruiser stopped us.  We were not speeding, we weren't driving erratically, and during the ride down a local on a motorcycle sped past us both going far above the speed limit.  The police didn't stop him.  He stopped us.  He stated we were speeding.  He said we needed to follow him to the police station.  Of course, a high dollar amount would suffice and we could go on our way.  Right.  Way to scare the crap out of foreigners pouring dollars into your economy to see the beautiful sights of your city.  

Cruise shipping is big business in the city.  If you're going to decide to visit, make sure you do it as some sort of tour and not on your own, otherwise local police are looking to take advantage of you.

287655363.name: Cool to See Once
287655363.author: a TripAdvisor user
287655363.reviewBody: We recently went to Ensenada Mexico. We took a side tour to go see Mexicos famous blow hole. It was a fun Expierience to see the water shooting high into the air. The street leading to the blow hole are lined with street vendors and small shops. My only complaint was that the street vendors are a little aggressive. They are constantly trying to sell you their stuff. Nonetheless we still had a very good time.

287429087.name: La Bufadora YES!
287429087.author: a TripAdvisor user
287429087.reviewBody: Fun drive...beautiful scenery, good food on the way and when you get there. Octopus Cocktail is delicious!  Bring your walking shoes for a breathtaking view of La Bufadora!!! Beautiful areas to walk to , shopping is great too!\nA short distance drive from Ensenada.

286990158.name: Nature at it\'s best
286990158.author: a TripAdvisor user
286990158.reviewBody: I enjoy coming to here, however I don\'t appreciate how the small businesses over price you when they know your forgiener.

286609709.name: Amazing view of the coast
286609709.author: a TripAdvisor user
286609709.reviewBody: We didn\'t actually went into La Bufadora attraction area.  However we parked our car opposite of the attraction and hiked down the cliffs where we had the view of the blowhole.  The place is amazing! Not just the blowhole, but if you are adventurous enough to hike down the cliffs on that end, you will be rewarded with amazing view of the coast line and absolute peacefulness which looks so much like Australia\'s great ocean road!  The drive there is also easy

286488583.name: Nothing Special
286488583.author: a TripAdvisor user
286488583.reviewBody: Blow hole depends on tides. So you may go and see nothing but locals, haggling you to buy there goods. Roads very dry and dusty so you better hope vehicle your in  has a/c or you will be blowing your own for days. Minimal landscape/countryside to view en route

286471302.name: Too many vendors
286471302.author: a TripAdvisor user
286471302.reviewBody: I\'ve come for years to show other friends the "blow hole".  Advise: go right through and to the blow hole.  Ignore all the vendors! All the same stuff you\'ll find anywhere in Baja. \nRestaurants are safe and good to easy at.

286137465.name: Great experience
286137465.author: a TripAdvisor user
286137465.reviewBody: Took my kids here to see La bufadora.\nIt took us about an hour to get there driving from Ensenada centro. They have lots of stuff to sell there and really good restaurants. take camera and binocular :D

286136114.name: Great food
286136114.author: a TripAdvisor user
286136114.reviewBody:
Went here last year after experiencing the Bufadora show.
Is really close to the Bufadora.
Great Mexican restaurant. Ordered some chiles rellenos.
Got a margarita and free sample of a tequila shot.
Really well Mexican decorated restaurant. is clean and really good customer service.

285929016.name: Worth a visit
285929016.author: a TripAdvisor user
285929016.reviewBody: "The Bufa" is pretty cool. It\'s a ways from town, so be prepared, but a unique place to check out. If you\'re looking for souvenirs, you can certainly grab one from on the hundreds of vendors you are forced to walk through to see the attraction. They kind of have you cornered when they charge you $2 to park, but it\'s a small price to pay. Try to go on a down time, as the lines crowds can be overwhelming. I understand that it is more impressive when it is in between tides, but that high tide is a poor time to see it.

284920312.name: La Bufadora
284920312.author: a TripAdvisor user
284920312.reviewBody: We had a bus that toured us all over Ensenada and one of the stops was La Bufadora. Watching the blowhole in La Bufadora was awesome. I even got to buy a painting from a lady who painted the blowhole in the shell.

284558551.name: "Must see attraction"
284558551.author: a TripAdvisor user
284558551.reviewBody: The hour long bus ride from Ensenada tour bus terminal ended in an unpaved parking lot at Punta Banda, Ensenada. The site of the blow hole, La Bufadora, is at the end of a long stretch of road filled with food vendors, pharmacies, and souvenir shops. Forget about the long walk, the insistent vendors, and the 50 cents fee for using the toilet, La Bufadora is a must see attraction.

284407901.name: Interesting nature
284407901.author: a TripAdvisor user
284407901.reviewBody: It\'s definitely fun to go down and see the blow hole. A one time must do for sure. But beware of all the pushy vendors. It\'s a tourist spot and Mexico so it was expected. \n\nThe views on the drive up were very nice.

284029914.name: beautiful
284029914.author: a TripAdvisor user
284029914.reviewBody: We got lucky and the surf was great. A lot of activity . There was a wonderful flea market to get a lot of bargains. Wonderful food everywhere, The vendors offer samples everywhere. There are some great bargains

283826095.name: Blow hole is beautiful but beware of the pushy street vendors
283826095.author: a TripAdvisor user
283826095.reviewBody: The bus ride out is an adventure all on its own. Once you get off the bus you must trek down a long road filled with vendors and pharmacies on both side and aggressive vendors all pursuing and fighting for your business. The blow hole is beautiful.

283707459.name: La Bufadora -- worth the visit!
283707459.author: a TripAdvisor user
283707459.reviewBody: On a Carnival cruise we stopped in Ensenada, Mexico and took the bus ride to La Bufadora, the "Blowhole" that spouts water when the waves crash in and force water through a natural waterspout. It was great -- the kids loved it, we enjoyed the spectacle, and I would visit there again.

283171721.name: at a great landmark
283171721.author: a TripAdvisor user
283171721.reviewBody: Mexican food, delicious, but not extra ordinary. The Blowhole is a must to go to in Ensenada. There are great little Mexican shops lining the main street.

282218690.name: A Day Trip to La Bufadora for Fun and Relaxation
282218690.author: a TripAdvisor user
282218690.reviewBody: My husband and I have visited La Bufadora a number of times. It is an amazingly beautiful spot, located on rhe rocky seaside just so of Ensenada. A bus can take tourists there. We park our car and walk down the single street lined with vendor booths where you can find everything from hats and bags to blankets and jewelry to authentic Mexican foods. We walk to the end of the street where we watch the waves break into a cove-like rock formation sending the spray high in the air. Onlookers send out "Ooooos" and "Ahhhhs" and squeals and giggles from children, who often rush to get into the spray.  We make our way back down the street and sit  at a restaurant patio overlooking overlooking the water. We order margaritas and chips with salsa and watch the sea. We have seen whale spouts off in the distance. Giant seagulls sit atop the fence that surrounds the patio, waiting for a table to clear so they can swoop in and grab leftovers. The wait staff are very friendly and accommodating and prices are reasonable. La Bufadora is a wonderful get away and we recommend it to anyone wanting a place to truly relax.  Oh, did I mention the street artists and musicians?

282141984.name: It\'s a local scale attraction, check it out if you\'re around, but not worth a special trip
282141984.author: a TripAdvisor user
282141984.reviewBody: Ensenada has a big port with a lot of tourists coming in on the cruise ships, so I guess this is an attempt to keep those tourists busy. Basically it\'s a place where ocean waves get into a narrow place in the rock and once in a while splash quite high. Frankly, it\'s pretty typical for Pacific coast, so it\'s not something people would travel for days to see. However, having said that, if you happen to be in Ensenada, this turns out to be probably one of the biggest local natural attractions and the road to that blowhole is filled with local vendors selling touristy stuff, so if you want to feel yourself like a proper tourist - sure, It\'s nearby, it\'s convenient, it\'s bright and noisy and it\'s cheap, so why not?

281013399.name: Worth the trip
281013399.author: a TripAdvisor user
281013399.reviewBody: We were in ensenada on a cruise and decided to visit the bufadora as one of our excursions. The bus ride is about 45 minutes and you see a lot of the surrounding area. The road follows the coast and climbs up some mountain hills before coming around to the Bufadora. The actual bufadora is cool to see as the water shoots out of the rocks and you have to sit and watch for a few minutes to see how high the water can get. I watched people come and look for a couple of minutes and then they would leave without seeing how high the water can splash. The road to the bufadora is lined with shops making it a large swap meet. There are plenty of places to eat and drink as well.

280624391.name: Amazing Sight
280624391.author: a TripAdvisor user
280624391.reviewBody: We arrived into Ensenada via a Carnival Cruise.  Prior to departing on our cruise, we set-up a tour with David Marmolejo (https://www.ldscityguides.com/guide/37/marmolejo/ OR https://www.facebook.com/ldstourguide).  We arrived to La Bufadora about 40 minutes prior to our shipmates from the Carnival cruise, so had the blow hole experience all to ourselves.  David is very knowledgeable about La Bufadora, as well as the entire Ensenada, Mexico region.  Along with the tour to the blow hole, we were given a personal tour of the Cultural Center prior to driving down First Street to get a glimpse of the peddlers selling their wares.  If you are looking for a First Class tour with a guide who definitely knows his stuff, contact David Marmolejo prior to arriving Ensenada so you don\'t miss out on the best places to see!

279396595.name: Where the Local Go as well as the tourist!!
279396595.author: a TripAdvisor user
279396595.reviewBody: Great food and service.  The atmosphere is great with all sorts of old relics.  Some of the best  tequilas in the world are there for the tasting.

278775295.name: Agree with others... it was ok...
278775295.author: a TripAdvisor user
278775295.reviewBody: Blowhole / geyser was cool to see but was not an awesome experience.  Too many vendors calling out to you at every stand - spent my time saying "no thank you, no thank you, no thank you"\nThis attraction is kind of exaggerated on ship, could have done without.

278606912.name: It was ok visit.
278606912.author: a TripAdvisor user
278606912.reviewBody: I wish it was no raining when we decided to go to La Bufadora. Actually, the city is not that beautiful for a cruise has it as a attraction for one entire day. From the cruise terminal to the coast it is about 40 minutes; it was ok to see the water splashing in the rocks, but that is all. The attraction from the cruise costs much more, so if you don\'t want to spend the disnecesary money, just take the bus outside to the terminal then they will transfer you to the next bus to

278162342.name: Carnival cruise shore excursion
278162342.author: a TripAdvisor user
278162342.reviewBody: We arrived at La Bufadora on our shuttle from the cruise. 45 min trip from cruise ship to this site. It seemed to go by quick though as our tour guide was informative about the areas we were passing and shared interesting info. On arrival we were told what time we had to be back on the bus to get back to the ship. We walked nonchalantly through the many vendors to see the blow hole first. It was pretty amazing as the water and area of cliffs and nature\'s creation created a marvelous spray upwards of water. After witnessing this and taking many pictures, we made our way to the vendors. At this point we only had 30 minutes. (Way too many vendors for only 30 minutes) I wanted more time!! Lol. No go though, as we had to be back on the bus to make it back to ship. Loved the tour, but would have only spent a couple of minutes at the actual blow hole so we could have had more time looking at all the interesting vendors. Tacos at the place where all the buses parked are amazing! Shrimp tacos the best!! Churros were also great!

277955905.name: It\'s Okay
277955905.author: a TripAdvisor user
277955905.reviewBody: La Bufadora is a pretty highly promoted tourist spot here in Ensenada. I think it can be an enjoyable outing as long as you are not counting on too much, and you aren\'t put off running the gauntlet of shops trying to sell you things on the walk to the blowhole and back. \n\nThe blowhole itself varies in its performance, all depending on the tide. So, you might see some pretty cool geyser type sprays or you might see...meh. Some pretty views of the coast, some nice little places to eat, but very much the consummate tourist trap. If you don\'t mind that, you\'ll enjoy yourself!

277654065.name: great day
277654065.author: a TripAdvisor user
277654065.reviewBody: its 25 min. south of Ensenada\nthe road is great and the view is wonderfull, you enjoy some churros or coco with clamato once you arrive to la bufadora and on the road theres plenty of Tamales and elote shops.

277034049.name: Tidal Blowhole is like a Geyser, Surrounded by tourist markets
277034049.author: a TripAdvisor user
277034049.reviewBody: Over the years the tourist attractions at LA BUFADORA have expanded and improved condsiderably. The major reason for visiting is the Tidal Blowhole where incoming waves are forced up thru rocks with such force that the water shoots into the air like a Geyser every few minutes, especially at times of High Tides. The road leading to the point has been developed and now contains many tourist shops and food stands. Words to the Wise  Take every possible security precaution with your vehicle when you park anywhere. especially in some of the unfenced and guarded parking  areas. We love visiting Ensenada, but lock everything out of sight and in secure garages and use taxis for local transportation for safety\'s sake.

276519373.name: Just a blowhole
276519373.author: a TripAdvisor user
276519373.reviewBody: The area was nice, as its a beach club you can get a bite and a drink at. The Bufadora is a reason to go, but you might be underwhelmed, so stay and enjoy the area, we did sunset and it was breathtaking.

275094734.name: FUN!!
275094734.author: a TripAdvisor user
275094734.reviewBody: Fun very different, the road is pretty scary but once you get there is fun, good shopping, food, and great drinks..\na must stop when in Ensenada

275076775.name: Awesome
275076775.author: a TripAdvisor user
275076775.reviewBody: La Bufadora is awesome. It is fun. Many vendors great place to shop. Shops everywhere. There are also live animals there. Lions , panthers, etc.

274854079.name: Big blowhole
274854079.author: a TripAdvisor user
274854079.reviewBody: Best big blowhole I have seen!  Might even get wet.  Need to time your visit when the cruise ships aren\'t in town, or it is packed.  Lots of cheesy souvenir hawking.  Haggle.  Have to pay for parking

274412894.name: It is OK, mosly a tourist trap.
274412894.author: a TripAdvisor user
274412894.reviewBody: I came to La Bufadora as part of cruise excursion.  Firstly, it was packed solid with people and was difficult to walk around.  Trying to get to the ledge so you could see the water shoot up, was a shore.  There was a lot of peddling from the vendors that line the road down to La Bufadora.  I was able to see some of the water shoot up but unable to take a good picture due to crowds that were there that day.  For me it was just an average experience.  I wouldn\'t come back.  It was, sadly to say, a tourist trap.

274050357.name: Nothing to see here please move on
274050357.author: a TripAdvisor user
274050357.reviewBody: This is one of a few places in the world where a natural ocean current blowhole occurs. After crossing an international border, traveling 45-and hour on a 3 toll booth toll rode (about $2.80 each toll booth) and then traveling (about 10 miles) through Ensenada to get to the rode to the Bufadora, then traveling another 4 mile to get to the $8 parking lot you come to the entrance to the Bufadora. Where you now have to wall about 1/3 of a mile through lots of shops and restaurants selling Pina Coladas in the Pineapple you get to the famous Bufadora. Where after about 7 minutes you get the  "is that all" moment and now have to do all this in reverse except that now you have to cross an international border that can be about 2 hours to cross. Yeah I say it is well worth it.

274044403.name: Natural wonder with a little shopping on the side!
274044403.author: a TripAdvisor user
274044403.reviewBody: Continuing our daytrip around ensenada ( please see my review on the zipline) we decided to check out this natural wonder.. This is the second largest marine geyser in the world and it was best seen by land than going with a kayak.. We enjoyed the experience as it shoots cool ocean water periodically while tourists like us try and catch that perfect photo moment & not get too wet at the same time! There is a local fleamarket on the way down to this attraction & it was really convenient way to get our souvenir hunting out of the way. The vendors can be really pushy at times so  just have a ready smile & say no..you might also meet nice shopowners who support local craft & industry.

273902901.name: View is good, people trying to sell not so much
273902901.author: a TripAdvisor user
273902901.reviewBody: Its a nice road trip with beautiful view, when you get there La Bufadora surprise you with a blow of water and and an amazing scenario, the only bad thing is the people who will try to sell you all kind of stuff.

273810840.name: Fun to watch!
273810840.author: a TripAdvisor user
273810840.reviewBody: We visited La Bufadora as part of a cultural tour of Ensenada. We arrived around 9:00am. The vendors along the dirt road/walkway to the blow hole were just opening for business. Most kept a respectable distance while urging our group to stop & shop. La Bufadora was worth the walk up. Before it sprays there is a loud snore-like sound. When you hear it have your camera ready. Sprays reached as high as 40 feet above the lookout while I was there. Beautiful.

273506396.name: just ok
273506396.author: a TripAdvisor user
273506396.reviewBody: we took this tour when we got off the ship you get picked up by a bus that takes you into the city for 2$ They will sell you the tour cheaper then on the ship and they actually worked for or with carnival so it was safe. The ride is a little long to get there, Once you arrive you do walk a little way thru an open swap meet to get to the La Bufadora  it is interesting to see but just ok. The swap meet is cute and you can get some good deals if you want to talk them down which is what they tell you to do. Everyone speaks english and  uses american money, This is a nice tour if you don\'t mind being tied up for 3 hrs. and you like to shop. Tried a taco from one of the vendors and it was good. only 2$ . You do have to pay for the restrooms .

273133207.name: Tourist Trap
273133207.author: a TripAdvisor user
273133207.reviewBody: The fact that this is a top attraction in the Ensenada area says a lot about the lack of quality things to do in and around this region.  After you walk the gauntlet of vendors aggressively selling the same cheap souvenirs, you\'re treated with a nice ocean view and if your lucky enough to be there when the tide is high, the amazing payoff of seeing some water spray out of the blow hole. \n\nOne more piece of advice.  Be careful if you eat at one of the restaurants.  Our modest lunch for four cost over $100. Like many other places in Mexico, tourists that aren\'t paying attention or don\'t know any better get taken advantage of.

273113846.name: See A Blowhole Up Close
273113846.author: a TripAdvisor user
273113846.reviewBody: We chose an excursion to see La Bufadora during a recent cruise to Ensenada. The bus ride was 45-60 minutes each way from the port. There was a 10-minute walk down a street lined with vendors hawking their wares to get to the blowhole. We watched the blowhole for about 5 minutes and walked back to the bus. We had some churros that were excellent. We heard the other food was very good as well.

272859154.name: A lot of fun
272859154.author: a TripAdvisor user
272859154.reviewBody: Food and drinks at tourist prices - knickknacks and tee-shirts super cheap.  Look around before you buy ANYTHING I found the prices seemed to drop as you walk down the road to the Bufadora.  I personally enjoyed eating fish tacos in a patio on a small cliff over looking the ocean.

271545655.name: Cruise excursion
271545655.author: a TripAdvisor user
271545655.reviewBody: We went on a tour of Bufadora when we went on a cruise. Instead of booking through the cruise we used one of the tour buses from the city which was a lot cheaper. It is fun to see but quite a drive from downtown. Probably the most entertaining part is haggling with the merchants that line the path down to the blow hole. The start incredibly high on their prices but then come way down and actually are pretty good prices. It was fun but not way exciting. They did try to sell my 15 yr old a marijuana pipe so keep an eye on the kiddos. The bathrooms are 50 cents.

270382015.name: Ensenada Blow hole
270382015.author: a TripAdvisor user
270382015.reviewBody: its amazing how the water blow high.  but that is the only attractive from the site, lots of  small business selling same stuff and  its really no where to sit and  enjoy the paradise from there. Its a very long drive form Ensenada.  Eating a Grilled clams  or  fish taco is worthed.

269123480.name: Blah
269123480.author: a TripAdvisor user
269123480.reviewBody: In order to get to the "blow hole" you have to walk though the flea market.  The vendors are pushy and somewhat annoying.  The blow hole is not really visible from the viewing area and is not very intriguing.

268146753.name: A LONG JOURNEY WITH SPECTACULAR LANDSCAPES
268146753.author: a TripAdvisor user
268146753.reviewBody:
To reach this point in Baja California Ensenada you have to go and visit one end to the village of Low Tide.

well worth stopping on the way for while going along the road there are spectacular views.

The point where La Bufadora , which is a kind of cliff where the rough sea hits and makes a kind of characteristic noise.
Lots of tourists come to this area and unfortunately to get to it you have to go through hundreds of shops with a variety of products for sale.

What I liked most of the trip were the views, it is worth everything including the $ 2.00 dollars they charge you for parking the car.

267801807.name: An attraction for cruisers
267801807.author: a TripAdvisor user
267801807.reviewBody: Without La Bufadora, I should probably stay at the cruise ship because there is not much to see in Ensenada. This is my second time to visit this place. We privately hired a small bus that cost $25/person to the site.  There were six of us. It was fun because we made loud noise, drink and laugh without disturbing any tourists. The last few miles drive to the site was beautiful, with long vistas over the sea from the cliff. Thankfully, there was no fog that time. The long stretch walk to the blowhole consists of large vendors, selling arts and crafts, food and even free tasting of alcohol. It was a pretty lively scenario. The blowhole area could be very jammed with tourists and it\'s hard to see. Overall, it was a good visit because I was able to show it to my friends and they liked the experience.

267534724.name: 45 years we\'ve been visiting the Blow Hole
267534724.author: a TripAdvisor user
267534724.reviewBody: I first went when it was just dirt and NO dealers, restaurants, or vendors.  It was a hidden gem in those days.  Still a great place to visit and we go there twice a year.  Take half off any stated price from the vendors and work from there.  Never fear saying no and walking away after your half price offer, they\'ll almost always reengage negotiations.  The people working the shops and friendly and speak excellent english. Most have retired there from the states.  Enjoy.\n\nBathrooms are clean.  Restaurants are way way better then they were 10 years ago.  Senor Frogs now has a choice spot.  It\'s not the blow hole you remember from days gone by.

267419133.name: Natural Wonder
267419133.author: a TripAdvisor user
267419133.reviewBody: La Bufadora itself was pretty cool. We were lucky in that we went mid-week and there were no cruise ships that day so it was pretty deserted. You have to walk through a gauntlet of shops to get to the actual blow hole. Very few were open the day we were there so we got away with all our money.  I wish we had done the kayak trip because you get right into the rock formation and get to see a variety of sea life. We had lunch right on the water and saw whales in the bay. A thoroughly satisfying morning.

267004151.name: La Bufadora
267004151.author: a TripAdvisor user
267004151.reviewBody: Nothing extremely fascinating. Basically water shooting up into the air. Making a distinctive sound as it rises.

266724568.name: Blow Hole was great show
266724568.author: a TripAdvisor user
266724568.reviewBody: Be prepared to walk a bit and through heavy street vendors with all the Mexico wares for sale.  Good stuff, but everyone calling you in to shop.  Good restaurants and some to watch...oysters got a few people sick.  Overall definately worth the trip.  Be in the mood to be invited into every shop and watch the places you eat.

266721306.name: La Bufadora
266721306.author: a TripAdvisor user
266721306.reviewBody: Too many musicians and you could not really hear the natural sounds of the Bufadora. It was a disappointment.

266491019.name: It was something to do (good shopping)
266491019.author: a TripAdvisor user
266491019.reviewBody:
As another person stated we too we also coming off a Carnival Cruise. It was quite expensive to take a tour group out to La Bufadora so we opted to take the shuttle to the city shopping. On that shuttle they offer La Bufadora for $15.00 a person way cheaper then the cruise. (Tickets were purchased in Plaza Pueblo Antiguo)

We had a tour guide of sorts tell us all about where we were driving by as it took us about 45 minutes to get out there. (Interesting to see Tuna Farms in the ocean) everything else was at warp speed and very close to the bus (reminded me of a cab in New York)

One thing the tour guy mentioned and was spot on was you are going to walk through a market to get to La Bufadora.  The market is for hagglers if you can't haggle don't go. We were offered a pancho for $30.00 we were interested but went to walk away and then the guy followed us out and we wound up purchasing it for $10.00..  But do your purchasing on the way back to the shuttle (no need to carry it)

La Bufadora was interesting but it is a (HIGH TIDE) only type of thing.. We were fortunate to see the blow hole .. well blow a few times. Three places to stand and get pictures. One is off to the left as you approach you can see the spray and the crowds. The next is above the main spot looking down on the crowd and the geyser. The main one everyone goes for is right on the rail of the geyser staring into the water geyser..  It was interesting but not all worth the hype. But still something to do.

Heading back I got some grilled clams and fish tacos while my wife shopped (Clam was awesome). She made out pretty good as they have Michael Kors bags (knockoff's Im sure) for $85 and you can walk away with them for $40 or less.. My son got a necklace for $2.00.

DOWNSIDE - BATHROOM (BANO) is $.50 cents to use.. 
Positive - 7/11 type store there to purchase water or soda

Everyone deals with USD so need to worry about exchange rate.

266171846.name: Bufadora - pretty decent natural phenomenon
266171846.author: a TripAdvisor user
266171846.reviewBody:
We went on a Cruise with Carnival and had a day to spare at Ensenada. We booked a rental car (instead of opting for the trip with the cruise which was extremely expensive) and went to see this natural phenomenon.

The blowhole was is really exaggerated compared to what you are able to see. 

One very important thing : Visit this only during a high tide to get the best experience, otherwise it is a completely waste of time.

The viewing angle is very small and only about 20-30 people can get a good view (due to the place and angle from which it has to be viewed). Others will have to wait in line and it's an experience for just 2-5 minutes after which there is nothing left to watch.

It takes about an hour and a half from the cruise port (if you are going on a cruise and then plan to go to the blowhole). 

There are thousands of street vendors on the way to the blowhole (which is at a far end) and you will be inundated with pina-cola offers, cheap toys and lot of food. If you are looking for street / authentic mexican food, this is a good way to try out stuff. If you are of the kind who stays away from hawkers, then be prepared to be haggled.

The street experience was actually more fun than the blowhole itself :-))

Worth a visit once during high tide only (otherwise don't even bother) - no repeat value

266058559.name: Tour guide was awesome!
266058559.author: a TripAdvisor user
266058559.reviewBody: We booked our blowhole trip through the cruise line. It didn\'t leave until 1:30 so that was a little annoying. Our tour guide Belen was awesome!  She is a local so told us about the town and history of Ensenada. Kept us in a group the whole time and made sure we bought from the good shops. It was great fun!!!

265869101.name: Fun, Food Viva Baja
265869101.author: a TripAdvisor user
265869101.reviewBody: One of the only three blow holes in the world(so I\'m told)  Old world shopping , New and Old world foods,  and when the tides are in a fantastic view of the pacific power rising up behind you with the camera shutter in high gear.  One of my favorite hangouts is located on the curve coming down the mountain road.  Connie Morgan

265554781.name: Good Attraction for Cruise Passengers
265554781.author: a TripAdvisor user
265554781.reviewBody: We are a family of four(Couple, Kids (8 and 5) picked this attraction as part of our cruise itinerary. We were there for 2 hours. Timing of the visit is very important so that you can see water shooting up very high only when there are high waves at high tide. Generally close to full moon there will be high tide. Variety of food is available including Fish Tacos, Mexican bakery items. Alcoholic and Non-alcoholic drinks. Vendors on the way to the attraction are moderately pushy but not dangerous. They offer samples of food and try to grab your attention as you walk. Be ready to bargain as you wish. I haven\'t seen any wheel chair paths or accessible arrangements. There are few stairs. Be prepared to pay a dollar or 50 cents to use bath rooms which might not be very clean. Overall it is nice enjoyable place.

265165390.name: Worth a visit!
265165390.author: a TripAdvisor user
265165390.reviewBody:
We did this on a day we had some time to kill, and while it was worth it, it was not as big a deal as it seems. 
Yes it is impressive how the 'hole' sucks in sea water and spits it up into the air, but...so what. Happens many places around the world. 

If you have time to spare or want to check something different out, go here, but if you are only in Mexico for a short time, move on!

264793031.name: Waste of time and money
264793031.author: a TripAdvisor user
264793031.reviewBody: Not worth the trouble or expense. Nothing but a tourist trap to aid the local economy. You\'ll be harassed by street merchants going in and coming out. And some of them won\'t take no for an answer either. The blowing hole itself is just a farce over nothing. Go spend you time and money somewhere else like a nice cantina. You\'ll get a lot more satisfaction that way.

264472018.name: I am torn between a 2 and a 4 star. Must see but boring.
264472018.author: a TripAdvisor user
264472018.reviewBody:
I am torn between a 2 and a 4 star because the blowhole is not that big of a deal most of the time. You need to have bigger surf before it does much of anything more than a spray. It is still one of only a few in the world, or so they tell us on the trip to it. It is though, at least, one of the largest blowholes in North America, so for this reason alone, it is a should see.

The boring part come from getting to the blowhole, or at least from coming back from the blowhole. Let me explain, the parking is up the hill and about a 1/4 mile from the actual viewing area. To get to it, you have to walk past vendors selling everything from churros to clothing to Silver to pharmacies (mostly selling “generic” Viagra) and even a few sit down restaurants. As you walk down people offer you free food and drink samples and ask you to come into their shops to see what they have to offer. After a few shops you start to notice that most of the shops are selling the exact same things as the shops you have already passed.

So you finally make it past the gantlet and to the viewing area for the blowhole. Now you notice all the people, like you, that have come to view it. As the blowhole is rather small, you have to try to find a place where you can actually see it and have to wait for the people that got there before you to leave before you can get a good viewing spot. So after 15-30 minutes you finally get to a good viewing spot (warning! On cruise ship days, the wait can be very long as over a thousand people may be here) and have to wait for that perfect ocean surge to come and make the blowhole blow. When it does, you get to see a 50 foot – 100 foot blast of water come shooting out of the cavern below, you cannot actually see the blowhole without climbing on the rocks and taking your life in your hands. Oh, the blowhole also makes a thundering sound when it blows and this is very cool.

Now comes the pain, you have to walk back up the 1/4 mile street and see all the same people trying to sell you stuff, but this time, they know that they will never see you again, so this is their last time to sell you something. They get very pushy and stand in your way to make you stop. The trip back to the parking lot is pure hell if you cannot just ignore the vendors and push on by.

There is a bit of haven though once you make it back to the top of the street. On the north side of the street, there is a small sit down taco restaurant that has some of the best taco’s I, and my family agreed, have ever had any place in the world. The Tortillas are handmade, the meats and perfectly spiced, the fish is very fresh and the toppings are plentiful and varied. Oh, and the prices are CHEAP! I will go back here just for the tacos and leave! I think it named "Paleteria y Neveria La Michoacan", but it is on the right as you go down and on the left as you come back. It is at the very begging and has white plastic tables and chairs. Most of the eating area is covered with just a few tables out in the sun.

264302390.name: Not Like the Good Old Days
264302390.author: a TripAdvisor user
264302390.reviewBody: We went to La Bufadora for the first time in ages.  There didn\'t used to be anything there but a restaurant or two and some cottages where we stayed.  Now it is all tourist-oriented and you have to pay to park.  There are all kinds of restaurants, shops/vendors, even pharmacies!  The charm and beauty has been spoiled.

262297050.name: a long drive for a short bit of excitment
262297050.author: a TripAdvisor user
262297050.reviewBody: This place is not close, drove from Rosarito Beach about an hour and a half, no waves, when there are no waves, no blow hole!!!!!!!! ended up a long lunch outing

261968842.name: Beauty covered up by junk
261968842.author: a TripAdvisor user
261968842.reviewBody: It never ceases to amaze me how people continue to junk up places instead of working with the natural beauty of a site such as this.  As another reviewer mentioned, from the dirty parking lot, you walk through a gauntlet of merchants that are all selling the same crappy souvenirs.  I think we were offered no less than ten samples of pina coladas in as many steps.  I knew we were in trouble when our tour guide spent most of the 50 minutes to get there telling us how NOT to get ripped off.  Of course, they were in cahoots with all the so called "legitimate" merchants, and had no problem pointing them out as we walked along the pushy stall owners.  I decided to test one of those merchants as I often buy silver from a New Zealand operation that gets its jewelry from Mexico and Bali.  Even with the alleged 50% off, the piece was overpriced and I told him so.  When I was walking out he yelled that the price would be $35 if I paid cash, a long ways away from the $95 price tag seconds ago.  I waived him off and left.  After getting back to the shops at the cruise terminal I found a beautiful pendant, with no pressure sales tactics.  I just asked if there was a discount, and she said yes.  I am so so glad I purchased something there, as I did not want to support the circus at La Bufadora.\n\nAnyway, it was a good day for the blow hole as we saw a couple huge sprays.  The scenery is gorgeous but we had been on the coast for awhile at Big Sur, so it wasn\'t as dramatic.  I was appalled to see two lion cubs and a monkey in cages all for the opportunity to take pictures with these poor creatures.  The cubs were so young, they must have been yearning for their mother\'s comfort.  I understand trying to make a living, but selling fake designer goods, bad silver, and stealing animals from their environment is just down right cruel.  The tour guide also insisted that the restaurant she highly recommended served only authentic Mexican Food that you could not find in the heart of Ensenada.  Well that was another deception, as the place was as touristy as could be and had a menu that looked like Denny\'s only offering more Tex/Mex styled food.  In general, we were told that the town of Ensenada had nothing to offer.  That\'s why we decided to go here.  I would never come back.

261964102.name: Best-seen by kayak
261964102.author: a TripAdvisor user
261964102.reviewBody:
We saw La Bufadora in the late '90s, before it became such a hook for tourists & cruise ship shore excursions. It was then possible to perch yourself at the observation deck above the blowhole with a dozen or so others for an intimate experience with a unique marine geyser.

What an experience it is! Air is trapped in a network of coves & underwater caves at the base of a cliff. Depending on the tide and size of the waves, water shoots up through a hole every minute or so. It is really loud, and can reach heights of 50'.

The twisting ride to La Bufadora - at the tip of the Punta Banda peninsula - is fantastic, with sweeping vistas of the ocean & nearby hills. Figure 45 minutes from downtown Ensenada. At the very end of the road, you see a arch welcoming you to La Bufadora. Parking can range from $2 to $10. There's an OXXO kwickie-mart at the entrance if you need anything.

Then you must walk a half-mile gauntlet of vendors hawking stuff you mostly don't need. Some of it is pretty colorful - the guy with the python, the farmacias hawking "Free Viagra with purchase of Prozac!", caged lion cubs, cocos frios, a sea of lucha libre wrestling masks - but it gets repetitive, cheesy. Some of the hawkers were too aggressive for my taste. A few restaurants & bars looked inviting, as did some of the stands selling nuts & sweets.

As you near the end, you hear the thunder of La Bufadora before you see it. There are several places to witness it (including climbing out over the railing onto the wet rocks right above it...not too bright). You can get pretty wet when the spray & wind conspire. I was there twice recently. At 9:45 a.m., the place was nearly empty. By 1 pm, it was 4-deep at the choice viewing spots, mostly turistas. Probably cruise ship shore excursions. Go early. Free admission; banos are 50 pesos.

Best way to experience La Bufadora? Kayak. During my recent trip, I rented a sit-atop sea kayak from Dale's Dive Shop. $25 for 2 hours, which was plenty of time to see this breath-taking natural wonder from an upclose & personal vantage point.

Not easy to find, Dale's is located to the south of the arch. I don't think he keeps regular hours, so make reservations. You can park by the campground for free. A concrete boat launch is down the hill. 

The half-mile paddle across the bay was eye-popping, but tough due to the heavy seaweed. The water is super clear, considering its proximity to the Pacific's open water. I paddled out to a bird nesting area covered in guana which looked like snow. Head around the point, and you hear, see and feel La Bufadora in all of its splendor. I approached it along the rocky foot of the hill to its north, and probed some of the coves & inlets seen by few. Crystal clear water, heavy turbulence. 

I stroked right up to the base of La Bufadora. Amazing. You can better grasp how it works and how darned high the water goes. You see hundreds of visitors about 60' above you, many waving, filming, yelling. The thunder of La Bufadora is best felt right here.

After 30 minutes, I explored the area just south of the waterspout where the waves got really rough; a cauldron with jagged rocks. Not for beginners. Then I headed out to open water, where the waves were really rockin'. I circled some rocky islands, then headed back across the seaweed-clogged bay, doing more sweeping with my paddle across the surface than stroking. 

The exit was challenging, with a tough current & serious waves by the shore. The round rocks on the beach make a applauding sound each time a wave hits; they should have held their applause for my landing (took several tries).

Yeah, the area around La Bufadora is more touristy, parking isn't free and the view can by marred by cruise ship passengers wielding selfie-sticks, but La Bufadora is still a unique and memorable experience. See it by kayak.

261958769.name: La bufadora (ie blowhole)
261958769.author: a TripAdvisor user
261958769.reviewBody: I like the natural aspect of la bufadora but the stores and vendors on the street before the blowhole really takes away from its natural beauty.  My 2 toddlers loved it...it was exciting for them.  Will I go again...probably not.

261780838.name: Property purchase
261780838.author: a TripAdvisor user
261780838.reviewBody: What ever you do, don\'t get involved with the owners nor the neighbor Mike Gabriel. He\'s a thief and a liar. He arranged for me and my ex wife to purchase a property and after our divorce, the owners and this neighbor took possession and stole my trailers and the property inside. I had a 2 bedroom mobile home on the ranch with a 6 person camper on the property, along with a camper behind the property. I was ripped off by the owners and Mike Gabriel made sure I lost my home there.\n He\'s a liar and a thief. Stay away.

261715783.name: A Fun, but Average Visit.
261715783.author: a TripAdvisor user
261715783.reviewBody: La Bufadora has changed a lot over the years. It\'s really lost it\'s innocence. It\'s not nearly as clean as it used to be and there are too many people. What is the most disappointing is the amount of venders there are, all hawking pretty much the same things. It\'s almost a gauntlet to get to the Bufadora. The Bufadora itself is fun to watch; especially when the tide is such that when the water rushes in, the Bufadora shoots a stream of water hundreds of feet into the sky. It\'s really a sight to behold.

260981895.name: Very neat experience
260981895.author: a TripAdvisor user
260981895.reviewBody: My husband and I went on a cruise with our 2 teenage boys. We chose the excursion to La Bufadora to see this natural blowhole. Unfortunately, we were there on a day with low tide. It was a neat sight but not as extraordinary as it could be during high tide. :) The shopping was fun but lots of people competing for your purchases. Also, the fish taco place was yummy. I had a carne asada taco which was tasty but not "amazing". Although the tortilla was great. My son had the fish taco and said it was "bomb". :)

260182246.name: Perfect Timing!
260182246.author: a TripAdvisor user
260182246.reviewBody: Just got back from our Carnival Cruise ship to Ensenda Mexico and was not disappointed at all when vising La Bufadora spanish for "the blow hole". If youre planning on seeing this attraction dont purchase it off the cruise ship it will be triple the price instead take the shuttle $3 (us) round trip to the bus stop and find a gentlemen name Jon E he will give you a discount and itl be $15 normally its $20 also he is very very funny and lively. on your way there make sure to Bring your selfie stick and appetite because theyre food vendors everywhere. as soon as we got there it was not packed at all seems like we beat the rush hour also temperature was perfect as well. dont use the bathroom at the beginning of the market wait until you reach the bottom of the market its cleaner and not as busy its .50 cent (us) but you cant complain lol. i highly advise not to set your heart on just one vendor explore the market before reaching la bufadora. also if you see something you like chances are itll be cheaper in the middle of the market. fish tacos are to die for and you must try the grilled clams with shrimp and crab meat. 4 coronas, 1 pineapple with rum in it (heaven in a plant) and 5 michellada we finally reach la bufadora. scenic is breath taking every corner is a perfect photo. relax and take in mother nature at its finest. highly recommend this to anybody or to everybody. dont let the media fool you. i never once felt threaten or in danger when walking around with my family. oh also take pictures with the jaguar and baby panther you wont regret it =)

260119818.name: Not worth the drive
260119818.author: a TripAdvisor user
260119818.reviewBody: I would not recommend- long drive from Ensenada, you have to pay $2 to park, walk through a mile of booths with various tourist crap and be accosted by sales people trying to lure you into their shops or try their foods, a couple of stands selling photos with you cuddling with a lion cub purportedly raising funds for an animal rescue operation they have NO information on- and what animal rescue pimps out Lion cubs... another with a python. Just a load of cheap crap. Wish I had stayed by the beach instead.

260101006.name: Beware of low tide!
260101006.author: a TripAdvisor user
260101006.reviewBody: I visited this extremely touristy spot several years ago and was very disappointed with all the street vendors. It\'s been nearly ten years since that last visit. On a glorious 99 degree day after the toll road has re-opened we decided to visit once again. I don\'t know if I set my expectations low but we liked it and we liked it a lot. Safe parking for 2 bucks, clean restrooms for 50 cents, and yes everything is in dollars most likely due to the cruise ship folks that are taken there. Tacos were 2 bucks, mango margaritas 3 bucks and beers two bucks. Not bad considering that the prices are catered to the people arriving on cruise ships. I even bought a souvenir. We had a great time and we waited patiently (20 mins) for the tide to begin to rise and we were rewarded. We loved it! The most annoying part was the loud tourist wining about the blowhole.

259591598.name: Busy busy busy
259591598.author: a TripAdvisor user
259591598.reviewBody: This a touristy place that\'s fun to stop for a bit to see (and hear). The time I went it was a little bit of a tourist attraction vibe, with lots of vendors of kitchy stuff and high prices...plus it was FULL of people and hard to see anything when you got close to the mouth of la Bufadora.

259401608.name: Late Arrival
259401608.author: a TripAdvisor user
259401608.reviewBody: We arrived at around 4pm.  Some of the small shops were closing.  Was able to buy souvenirs for the folks back home.  A little big pricey, but oh well.  You need to haggle the prices down which I like.   The Blowhole itself was fine. Not too excited about it.  That is the reason for 4 stars.  Overall it was a good day to drive and see Ensenada and taste some traffic. Very interesting drive as its about 45 minutes.

259396043.name: Definitely worth it
259396043.author: a TripAdvisor user
259396043.reviewBody: We did a kayak excursion with our cruise and it was amazing to see the Bufadora from sea level as the waves rolled in and out. You can see exactly how the blow hole is working. Definitely a must see and I think better viewed from the sea.

259290496.name: Great natural wonder!
259290496.author: a TripAdvisor user
259290496.reviewBody: Stayed in a community next to La Bufadora.. The blow hole is a must see.   It is better to see it though when the tide is in, more action from the blowhole.  Went up here twice during our stay.  Have a nice selection of vendors & 2 good restaurants there, but most stuff though is only open when there are cruise ships at port A must see when in Ensenada.

258481903.name: A place to visit.
258481903.author: a TripAdvisor user
258481903.reviewBody: This is the type of place that you either like or hate, but its one of those places that you should visit at least once in a lifetime. To know you\'ve been and experienced one of the only few natural blowholes in the world is enough to warrant the visit - at least it was to us. It was worth the visit. We were there mid week and there weren\'t too many people. You still get offered this or that as you make your way down to the bufadora from where the bus, or in our case, our taxi parked, but nothing we haven\'t experienced before in other places. Just ignore it unless you want to buy something you can find in town for cheaper.

258427141.name: See the Blow Hole - Don\'t Miss the Tacos
258427141.author: a TripAdvisor user
258427141.reviewBody:
As many have said, the Blow Hole is a spectacular attraction at the right time. When it is at full force it is a sight to see. We have been to this location 3 times while cruising, and enjoy seeing the Blow Hole, but the last time we went, we specifically went to have the tacos at the parking area.

We were with a group of family and friends who had never been, so while they explored the vendors and Blow Hole, we spent time getting tacos at our favorite taco shop. If you like authentic Mexican tacos, made in front of you, don't miss these. 

Order one of each (fish, shrimp, chicken and beef) and ask to have the cheese melted on the handmade tortilla before the meat and filling is put on. Everyone at the taco shop is friendly, the tacos are wonderful, and the price cannot be beat.

258247579.name: Ensenada port day at the Blow Hole (3 starts b/c of vendors)
258247579.author: a TripAdvisor user
258247579.reviewBody: Spent a day in Ensenada as a port day on a cruise. We took a tour bus to the blowhole. The parking area was about 1/3 mile from the actual attraction and required you to walk down a street lined with various vendors (purses, silver, hammocks, tacos, etc...) some of them are obnoxious and borderline harassing, It was not a pleasant stroll. The actual blow hole area was pretty and the salty air smell was wonderful. We went at low tide so it was nothing spectacular, but still pretty to see. Walked back through all the vendors (there is no way around them) to the bus. Right by the buses there is a taco stand that was packed, and did not have a person standing outside harassing you to buy from them...so we stopped for lunch there. BEST TACOS EVER!  This was the high point of our day at the blow hole! We walked in, ordered 2 beef tacos. They cooked the beef and made us fresh corn tortillas right in front of us and loaded them with salsa and guacamole...so very good. Best ever. We went back in and ordered more. Eat at this taco stand by the busses!!! I wish I could rate the harassing vendors separately b/c the attraction itself is pretty and neat to see, but having to walk through all the annoying vendors really soured the experience for us. I would give the vendors 1 star (maybe someone enjoys that), the blow hole 4 stars, and the nice taco stand with no harassing vendors 5 stars.

257928877.name: Pleasantly surprised!!!
257928877.author: a TripAdvisor user
257928877.reviewBody: The ocean water spout was a great surprise!!! Luckily the tide was in and the water shooting out through the rocks was incredible!!! Before you come to the spout you\'ll walk by so many souvenir stalls. The fish tacos $1 were great and the giant clams on the grill were excellent! Rented a van just outside the gates for $12 per person and kids free. Well worth it as the driver waited and also brought us to the town in Ensenada and back to our cruise ship. Bought tequila in grocery rather than liquor store much cheaper.

256247751.name: Tide was out kind of a let down
256247751.author: a TripAdvisor user
256247751.reviewBody: I think that the tide was out and the blow hole was kind of a bust. Great for out door shopping though.

256072519.name: Natures Miracle plus a great Flea Market!
256072519.author: a TripAdvisor user
256072519.reviewBody: It was fun to visit  this place. Our tour guide took us there straight from the Princess cruise ship. It took us about 30-45min, to get there. Nice flea market place, bring cash! People were selling fake LV designer bags for 20-30$, lots of little things to buy. The best fresh fish tacos I\'ve ever had, right next where bus parked.
