(don\'t miss out on authentic tacos) You have to pay to use restroom.

256035969.name: Make sure to visit when the tide is high
256035969.author: a TripAdvisor user
256035969.reviewBody: Overall it was good to take a drive out of Ensaneda and enjoy some of the countryside. We did not have high hopes for big geyser plumes, as we knew the tide would be low when we arrived, and as expected the geyser was nothing more than a small puff of mist with low tide and calm seas. I wish I could convince all the street vendors there to ease off the aggressive barking to have tourists look at what they are selling. It\'s like walking a gauntlet, and we\'d probably have purchased items if we were not turned off so badly by their bantering approach.

255900831.name: A new sight and information
255900831.author: a TripAdvisor user
255900831.reviewBody:
I had not heard of this place or the phenomenon of a wave surge through a narrow rock passage before. While doing research on the shore attractions at Ensenada, Baja California, Mexico, I got to know about it. 

We were on a cruise ship that had a day halt at Ensenada.

There were a few private bus operators affiliated to the cruise liner. We could buy the tickets for a a limited number of day trips, in and around Enesenada, from the ship itself. We chose the one that covered the La Bufadora. 

The small buses were comfortable and the tour guide, Roy was fantastic with his amiable nature and off the cuff humour. "Follow the Mexican" was the punch line that he chose. 

La Bufadora was the star attraction of the trip. This is located at about 30 Kms from the Ensenada  port. A very rustic set up with a street lined with shops and street vendors. The rock formation itself was free of clutter, but full of tourists. 

Every set of waves send a large quantity of water into a narrow rock formation and pressurises it. This ejects out through a blow hole and resembles a whale's spout. The typical water flow sound and spray made the show spectacular. 

The street shops were hawking all kinds of stuff that tourists go for, including typical Mexican street food. 

Our tour guide Roy had indicated a cut off time for us to return to the bus, but showed a lot of compassion in going in search of two people who did not turn up even after 15 minutes past cut off time. 

A worthwhile place to visit if you have the time in Ensenada.

255701470.name: The biggest blowhole on the planet!
255701470.author: a TripAdvisor user
255701470.reviewBody: This was an awesome experience. Not only do you get to see and get wet from the blowhole but you can pick up a bargain from one of the many vendors at the site. My first but not last trip To Mexico! Oh, the vendors, bargain with them, you might get a better deal. if you are having an off day there are also pharmacies you can get medicine from. Have your picture taken with a big cat or a genuine Mexican guitar player. On the way back to your tour bus or car grab a bite to eat from one of the food vendors.

255529646.name: Taxi from the city provides the best experience and price
255529646.author: a TripAdvisor user
255529646.reviewBody:
Hi Travelers,

We got off our cruise ship early and had an opportunity to stroll around Ensenada before it got too busy.  We then acquired a ride to La Bufadora.  It was great to have a personal guide and we also beat the masses.  We were by ourselves looking at this majestic shooting water.  Very powerful and beautiful.  Our stay was around 10 minutes and then we wished by all the vendors just opening up.  I could only imagine the walk up to the tour buses in the heat and crowds which followed us.  Was it worth it?  Yes, for us being early there and out.. I would not say the same if I had to endure crowds and heat, but I will leave that up to you. We were in a rush to get to a very disappointing ATV and Horseback adventure, but our tour guide promised "local" shopping options.  Maybe next time.  PS the beach south of the cruise port is beautiful and may be worth a short cab ride.

Cheers
Ian

254888669.name: Los Gordos restaurant rocks
254888669.author: a TripAdvisor user
254888669.reviewBody: There\'s also a couple of other decent restaurants there but the touristy shopping "mall" is constantly in danger of being shut down due to properyt dispute.

254583233.name: A Mexican Experience
254583233.author: a TripAdvisor user
254583233.reviewBody: On arrival you walk through a Mexican tourist market with everything you could have thought to find in such a place, from wild animals, souvenirs, and so many sales people. Great fun.\nThen after walking down to the bottom of the hill, the Bufadora itself was spectacular and just blowing away the whole time.

254569266.name: Well worth the drive to look at one of nature\'s miracles!
254569266.author: a TripAdvisor user
254569266.reviewBody: First of all, IGNORE all of the people hawking parking spaces and drive all the way down the road - you can park almost at La Bufadora for the same price + you avoid all of the people selling tourist items.  Next, go with an empty stomach - there are lots of people selling everything from deserts to meats + there are small restaurants along the way.  If you want to, pack a lunch - there are clean bathrooms in the Visitor Center.  This was our second trip and we were still in awe!

254510194.name: AGGRESSIVE VENDORS
254510194.author: a TripAdvisor user
254510194.reviewBody: It had been a few years since I last visited the blow-hole.  Had some big surf coming so thought it would be an excellent time to go.  As usual, getting there & parking was a snap.  The area is actually a little bit cleaner (but not much) than it was years ago - but the vendors selling the tourist junk have gotten very aggressive.\n\nProbably our last visit.

254505300.name: The views are nice....
254505300.author: a TripAdvisor user
254505300.reviewBody: Beautiful views of the ocean and La Bufadora. The market was rough - the merchants basically all have the same stuff, and prices were about the same as in town - even with bartering. Had a wonderful lunch and margaritas at Habana Banana - also note - it costs 50 cents to use the bathrooms at La Bufadora

253769543.name: Running the tourist gauntlet
253769543.author: a TripAdvisor user
253769543.reviewBody: Nice drive there, parking is easy, but you walk through 1/4 mile of people selling \'stuff\' and badgering you to buy. Used to be nice

253599746.name: Beautiful Scenery and Lots of Shopping!
253599746.author: a TripAdvisor user
253599746.reviewBody: My sister and I took this tour in January.  The weather was beautiful, the blowhole was magnificent, but I found the food and shopping to be the best part!  The scenery on the coast there is amazing!  You must walk down a street to get to the blowhole.  The street is lined with shops and places to eat.  We bought several items good items to take home and had a delicious lunch.

253394292.name: Mini vacation with wife and daughter and her boyfriend
253394292.author: a TripAdvisor user
253394292.reviewBody: Nice day to visit the blowhole in Ensenada Mexico lunch at Habana banana with a great view. Would recommend to anyone tour booked off the ship for only $15 pp\n

253394193.name: Excellent Kayak Experience
253394193.author: a TripAdvisor user
253394193.reviewBody: We booked the kayak tour which starts from the beach near La Bufadora (the blowhole).   It\'s about a 40 minute bus ride from Ensenada on a tour bus but well worth the trip.   I doubt I would have enjoyed just coming out to see the blowhole, but by kayaking on the ocean in front of it and then kayaking very close to the cliff, we loved it.   The kayak guides were great and we enjoyed the waves, the kelp beds, the sea lions swimming by us and even having to paddle very hard to get past the rocks.   We\'re age 60 and were the oldest in the group.   We\'ve kayaked and canoed together so we had no difficulty, although it was a lot of work.   Definitely consider this kayak trip.

253352650.name: It was awesome!!!
253352650.author: a TripAdvisor user
253352650.reviewBody: We just got back from our trip!! La bufadora was amazing!! The water was spitting up high!! Everyone was getting wet and loving it! The walk to get to the spot was delightful as well! Nice restaurants to eat at with views to the ocean! Can\'t wait to go back again

253195162.name: Too touristy
253195162.author: a TripAdvisor user
253195162.reviewBody: It was nice to see the blowhole & we lucked out - it wasn\'t too crowded. But walking to and from the blowhole wasn\'t enjoyable due to the large number of vendors trying to get us to try/buy things. Some people might not mind that, it was frustrating for us.

252960059.name: Trinket salesmen are ANNOYING!
252960059.author: a TripAdvisor user
252960059.reviewBody: Walking down the road from the parking area to the blowhole, we were continuously bombarded with salesmen, quite a contrast from the laid back shops in Ensenada. Unfortunately for us, the tide was low and the blowhole was not blowing, but we\'ve been there when it was rocking, and it\'s worth the visit.

252745349.name: must see at least once
252745349.author: a TripAdvisor user
252745349.reviewBody: local tourist spot and breathtaking beauty! There is a flavor of the shopping and dining that is charming in a tourist sort of way.\ncan be great fun with a gruop of friends looking to have a play day!

252464441.name: It\'s worth the $18 spent!
252464441.author: a TripAdvisor user
252464441.reviewBody:
Of course you have to walk thru a long street of shops to get to the blow hole. There are fake watches, brand name bags, silver....along with some real local stuff you can buy if that's your thing.  

This blow hole is not something outrageously impressive but it's a good option out of the list of things you can do in the Ensenada area. The blow hole itself is not forceful enough to produce any booming sound effect as I've seen at other places, but it's strong enough to have you covered with splashes. Rainbows can be seen from certain angle as the water shoots up high in the air and it shoots high faithfully every few minutes. I would say the small bay it's in is quite pretty. It takes 45 minutes to get there. Overall, the trip was pretty relaxing.  

To save some money,we decided to see what tours are available onshore ourselves. Be suspicious of  what the sales people of the tour companies tell you on the street though.  We found totally different pricing when we got to their ticket window.  It was a comical experience that you would never experience in the States. The first sales lady at the port told us that every tour is $20 which opened up all sorts of possibilities for fun activities.  The second sales person on the bus to town ($3 round trip) told us the combo of Ziplining and Blow Hole is ONLY $50.  So, we thought, OK, it's still a pretty good deal!  Then, the lady at the ticket counter told us firmly that this combo tour is actually $68. We were thrown off by the price changes and did not like the feeling of being fooled. As we would still like to at least go some place, we asked for the price of the Blow Hole tour. She said $15!  While dumbfounded, we gladed paid!

The bus ride to town is really not necessary if you know where to go as it takes less than 10 minutes to walk to town center.

252420798.name: Best Shore Excursion Option
252420798.author: a TripAdvisor user
252420798.reviewBody: I went on a Princess Cruise to Ensenada and visiting La Bufadora was the best option. The bus ride from the port to the attraction was almost an hour, but the countryside and view of the ocean was beautiful. The bargaining at the market outside La Bufadora is better than in town and will afford better values. For example, we bargained for a one liter bottle of pure vanilla that started out at $25 and we got it for $6! Also, don\'t bother to buy food until after you\'ve visited the La Bufadora because as you walk down the streets of the market to get to the attraction, you\'ll be approached by vendors who will give you FREE samples of churros, daiquiris, mexican bread and more. On your way back to the parking lot you can buy your churros from the vendor you liked the best. The blow hole is so amazing and if it sprays water on you, then you\'ll get five years of luck! My daughter and I are looking forward to the next five lucky years (yes, we got WET)!

252312808.name: Tour of the Blow Hole
252312808.author: a TripAdvisor user
252312808.reviewBody: We took an excursion from our cruise to go to La Bufadora. We wanted to see the blow hole. It was an amazing experience - but to be honest, the view of the blow hole was somewhat limited, and after about 15 minutes, we had seen everything there was to see. The rest of our time was spent avoiding the shopkeepers in the narrow road back to the where the bus was parked. There was a great tacos stand where I ate the best fish taco ever! Over all, I\'m glad we came, but don\'t need to go back.

252265543.name: WOW!
252265543.author: a TripAdvisor user
252265543.reviewBody: Love La Bufadora!  She was shooting off like a rock star!  Great fun!  After you go past all the shop people hawking their goods, it is great!

252001260.name: jaguars,candy,tacos and blowhole!!!!!!!!!!!!
252001260.author: a TripAdvisor user
252001260.reviewBody: well after about 30-40 min ride up into the countryside we come to the top and down the other side. our guide\'s name was sofia and she kept us entertained all the way out to the blowhole. when you \nget there they take you through the market full of candy, jaguars, taco stands and then you reach\nthe site of the sea and the blowhole. you will spend a few moments there to grab some videos and nice pictures or both, and then stroll back through the market for taco\'s,  pictures with baby jaguars,baby lions or tigers, and lots of candy stands for sampling and to take home... enjoy!!!!!!!!!!

251815379.name: Scenic Drive but Terrible Tourist Trap
251815379.author: a TripAdvisor user
251815379.reviewBody:
This famous landmark, a so-called blowhole, is reached by car in about 45 minutes from Ensenada. Once you leave the gritty city behind on Hwy 1 and turn right on Hwy 23, which takes you all the way and ends at La Bufadora, you are treated to a nice drive with typical Mexican rural scenery. Lots of poverty, though.

Once at La Bufadora, all parking is pay-parking (two bucks for the whole day although you will likely want to leave very soon again!).

You walk about half a mile between literally hundreds of vendors who are not too bad on the way down to La Bufadora (they know you won't buy anything yet except for drinks perhaps). But on the way back up to the parking lot again they were totally annoying and this is by far the worst tourist trap we've seen in Mexico. Mind you, my wife is Mexican and we both speak Spanish so we're not like the typical cruise ship crowds that arrive by the busloads during the day. Gosh, we were relieved when we could get into our car and leave again, for the rural Ruta de Vino and do some wine tasting down at Bodegas Santo Tomas - what a difference!

Apparently there has been some discussion in the Mexican government to remove the vendors but so far no action.

And La Bufadora - the blowhole - itself? Hardly worth it unless it is on your bucket list. If not, no need to add it!

251665765.name: Not much else in Ensenada...
251665765.author: a TripAdvisor user
251665765.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for something to do on your cruise layover in Ensenada, this is a good option. Just make sure you avoid the vendors on the walk down to the blow hole - everything is priced much higher here than in town.

251618505.name: strenght may change depending on the weather conditions
251618505.author: a TripAdvisor user
251618505.reviewBody: When traveling to Ensenada, going to "la Bufadora" is a must. this natural Blowhole is beautiful and amazing...the blowing strenght may change depending on the weather conditions, high tide and wind will make this a unique experience for all the family members. On the road you may also find different viewpoints which totally worth to stop and enjoy the gorgeous landscape.\nThe entrance is free, still you have to pay $30 pesos for parking.\nIf you get hungry, try the Clams topped with melted cheese or the coconuts filled with Shrimps, Delicious!

251128934.name: Blowhole was nice, but very unpleasant to get to...
251128934.author: a TripAdvisor user
251128934.reviewBody: We visited the bufadora while on a cruise, and while it was beautiful to see, walking the gauntlet of VERY aggressive merchants down the ONLY street you can take to get there was incredibly unpleasant.  It took about an hour on bus to get to the site and you are dropped off at the top of the street of merchants of all variety.  While I understand that the vendors of course need to make a living, many of the male merchants were WAY TOO aggressive, and many of them were leering at the female tourists--classy!  I speak fluent Spanish, so I understood all of the nasty chatter.  \n\nI remember thinking I would never, ever want to return to this tourist trap again!  We did buy some churros which were good.  We also saw a lot of fake leather and really bad silver items, so buyer beware...some of the stores were legit, but a lot of it was crap.

251127008.name: La Bufadora
251127008.author: a TripAdvisor user
251127008.reviewBody: We just got back from a cruise on Carnival Imagination.  We selected the Bufadora and Wine Tour combo as our Ensenada excursions.  I must say the ride on the bus to the Bufadora was scary for me with the steep, narrow, winding road and lack of railing.  The views were beautiful and maybe I was the only chicken on the bus because everyone else seemed okay with it.  The Bufadora was nothing spectacular aside from the fact you are told there are only 3 in the world!  We spent about 10 minutes looking at it and admiring the blue waters.  The vendors to get back to the bus were a hoot.  Some had really good one liners to get you to view their products.  The shrimp tacos and margaritas at Habana Banana were spectacular!  We couldn\'t keep our eyes off the jaguar in the 10x10 pen and 2 foot high wooden fence next to the bar and baby puma about 4 months old.  At one point the handler was so frustrated trying to wrestle the humongous jaguar into submission for photos.  He ended up with a cut up arm and had to wrap it in a towel!  The handler was huffing and puffing and looked scared at one point!  Still, people kept going in the pen for pics and our eyes were bulging out of our faces watching and sipping margaritas!  It was one of those things you didn\'t want to watch but couldn\'t help yourself from looking, similar to a bad car wreck on the freeway!  Taste everything, the samples are delicious!  Buy stuff!  They need your money!  Love everyone and have fun!  It was a crazy, fun, experience!  I wouldn\'t mind going back! Oh and the wine was amazing, if you plan on doing the combo tour, also!

251001177.name: Yonder She Blows!!
251001177.author: a TripAdvisor user
251001177.reviewBody: La Bufadora was one of the shore excursions offered on our cruise. The Blowhole wasn\'t very active on the day of our tour, but the views of the coastline was awesome. The trip from the parking lot to the site is full of vendors, so a good bargain can be found if you negotiate well. A neat thing we didn\'t do is to pose with the Puma and Jaguar cubs. They charged $24 to make a photo of you holding the cat.

250996955.name: Very beautiful
250996955.author: a TripAdvisor user
250996955.reviewBody: Cruised here with Carnival Imagination over the weekend; we had a great tour guide named Gio. Ensenada is very similar to many parts of East LA except for the beautiful blue waters and the blow hole. The tour was lovely and shopping was so much fun.  I loved the street tacos, churros and the elderly gentleman playing Spanish romantic sounds on his acoustic guitar. I would love to go back and visit La Bufadora again.

250235810.name: Enjoyed it
250235810.author: a TripAdvisor user
250235810.reviewBody: We loved going to the Blowhole.  I noticed others saying ignore the vendors, but we bought some wonderful Dulce de Leche candy that was delicious.  It\'s like a flea marker or swap meet.  We had a blast.  There is a fee for parking (a few dollars) and for using the bathroom (50 cents).

250114785.name: Fun attraction
250114785.author: a TripAdvisor user
250114785.reviewBody: We drove to this attraction using a 4 wheeler that we had rented off the ship. I wouldn\'t recommend doing this as it is quite a long ride and on some busy streets. Next time we would rent a side by side, it would have been alot less stressful. When we pulled in we drove right up the main strip and parked right by the spout. I am not sure if we were suppose to do this, as we got some pretty strange looks from vendors and tourists alike. But it was nice to pull right up to it. It was very interesting to see it, we stayed for about 30 minutes then started back. I would recommend doing it if you have never been, its worth the drive.

248464735.name: Blow hole with zip line.
248464735.author: a TripAdvisor user
248464735.reviewBody: If you want the best value for your $ book the blow hole and zip line together as a day trip at Las Canadas.  For $50 you get 5 zip lines, 5 rope bridges, and trip to La bufadora and back.  There is plenty of shopping at the blow hole so you dont need to make time for downtown Ensenada.

248077328.name: Go for the Mexico experience, not the blow hole
248077328.author: a TripAdvisor user
248077328.reviewBody:
Unless a glorified wave is your thing, La Bufadora itself is a bit of a let down. However, the overall experience of driving through Ensenada and the shopping area around the blow hole is well worth the $15 we paid. We picked up a bus right off the cruise ship that drove us to town. They then offered us a guided trip to the blow hole on a different bus. The company was called, "Misionerios Tours" and had a deal with a restaurant called "Habana Banana" which gave us a free Margarita. It was much cheaper than the cruise offered trip and had a local guide who spoke great English and did a fantastic job teaching us more than you would ever want to know about the area.

You get to much of Ensenada on the way to the blow whole. Once you arrive there is a 1/2 mile market with the usual colored blankets, handmade trinkets, taco stands, silver shops, and small children offering "Chiclets, Chiclets." We found the shopping here to be better than anywhere else in Ensenada. The blow hole is at the end and we were there during low tide so we just saw waves crashing on rocks. We did luck out and see whales in the distance. 

The overall cultural experience of this trip was not as glamorous as other cruise ports, but we felt it was worth the price and rewarding.

247502260.name: Water feature
247502260.author: a TripAdvisor user
247502260.reviewBody: This is a water spout that is generated by the combination of incoming and outgoing tides.  This feature was about a 45 minute trip from downtown Ensenada.  The water feature was very active during the time I was there, with some sprays being sent 30+ feet into the air.  There are a couple of levels where you can get some good pictures.  There is a wheel chair type path down to one of the levels, but it can be a bit steep for someone with a wheelchair.  Definitely worth a stop to see what natural wonders can be generated by water and land.  There are many vendors that are selling their wares on the entire road down to the water feature.  Be prepared to negotiate with the vendors to get you best price.  Some also offer food as well.

247111638.name: Nice visit, ignore unwanted attention from vendors
247111638.author: a TripAdvisor user
247111638.reviewBody:
My wife and I visited Ensenada as part of our cruise.  We didn't book an excursion through the ship because they were far too expensive, but it turned out really well.  As soon as we got off the boat, we were invited to board a shuttle to the city for $2.  It would have been a ten-minute walk, but we didn't know that.  While on the shuttle, a woman talked about going out to see La Bufadora and riding horses on the beach.  For $35/person to do both, we decided it was worth it.

After horseback riding on the beach, my wife and I boarded a shuttle to go to La Bufadora.  When we arrived, we were led to a bar in the middle of the street.  We don't drink, so we just continued to walk down the street.  We tasted the samples of churros and pina coladas (non-alcoholic!) and continued on to La Bufadora.  Watching the ocean lower and then blow out of the rocks below was pretty cool.  It wasn't super spectacular, but it was cool.  The ocean and the rocks were beautiful and worth taking photos of.

We went into the market next to La Bufadora and bought a Pepsi for $1.25 and it was delicious.  We then ate a clam from the grill nearby and it was delicious too!  No stomach trouble afterward either!

As we walked back, we were hassled somewhat by the people selling things, but that's to be expected.  We bought a pair of leather sandals for my wife, a hammock chair, and a magnet.  We decided to forego getting photos with a panther cub and other exotic animals simply because we didn't have the money to do so.

My best advice for this attraction:
-Check it out
-Wear a plain colored t-shirt without writing on it (vendors will call you out based on your shirt)
-Ignore vendors if you don't want to speak to them.  They don't get mad.  They move on.
-Haggle.  They expect it.  If you can't make a deal with one vendor, make a deal with the next.
-Get a photo with the statue outside the pharmacy.  You'll know it when you see it.
-It's probably not a good idea to buy Mexican pharmaceuticals, but what do I know?

246583394.name: Not worth to go there
246583394.author: a TripAdvisor user
246583394.reviewBody: A day trip from a cruise ship to see a "blowhole" in Baja, California. It was a disappointment because the place was so run down. Then the terror really began. On both sides of the walk to the "blowhole" were vendors packed side by side. They were not polite when you say no. The price was jack up big time. Nobody took "NO" as an answer. They followed us along the walk back to the bus. The tour guide refer us to some store to buy sliver and restaurants to eat. The place so dirty you do even want to sit down and eat. Need to pay 50 cents per restroom visit. Don\'t expect a clean restroom either. :(

246558044.name: Seeing the local Ensenada sites
246558044.author: a TripAdvisor user
246558044.reviewBody:
We arrived around 4 pm. It was not too crowded and a bunch of the street vendors were closed. We did get pressure to buy and to try the jello shots but a kind ko thank you worked. Okay I did buy one thing. 
The bufadora is a long drive and walk to get to for a simple natural wonder. Don't expect too much but it is nice. You need to hang out and watch for a while as the wave sets bring in different levels of splash. The kids around us there loved it. 
We sat at a bar with a view and ate really good tacos. 
The whole experience took 2.5 hours from hotel and back.

245976567.name: No worries!
245976567.author: a TripAdvisor user
245976567.reviewBody: after reading about the pushy salespeople, I was worried about visiting La Bufadora. My worries were unfounded. The blowhole was amazing as it was high tide. The salespeople were very pleasant and really didn\'t hassle us when we were not interested. The ride there has a short piece with gorgeous views. If you are afraid of heights, sit on the driver\'s side of the bus!

244967271.name: YMMV, we got there on a great day
244967271.author: a TripAdvisor user
244967271.reviewBody:
We stopped off at Ensenada on the last day of Hawaii cruise.

We went and it was high tide.  The water spray was very tall and extremely impressive.  

We talked to other people who went on other days and said that there was only a small spray.  Maybe it was low tide.

But for us, it was terrific.

243766076.name: Blow hole...on a beautiful scenary
243766076.author: a TripAdvisor user
243766076.reviewBody:
Going to la Bufadora itself is a nice.ride seeing local countryside ON YOUR WAY.
When arriving there  you can see magnificent views and the famous rock formation where the ocean water comes and explodes going really high offering a nice nature shows..
Take time to walk and see the views...and stop for a local food. 
My husband bought barbecue Clams, fresh catch of the day and were very good.There is also arts and crafts to buy .
Try to go on a high tide and when cruises are not on town ..

243734216.name: One time see
243734216.author: a TripAdvisor user
243734216.reviewBody: This place is worth seeing once for the shops and the wave.\n\nGood for peopel who want to buy things and enjoy the beach and walk.

243650906.name: Not great
243650906.author: a TripAdvisor user
243650906.reviewBody: Too many hustlers there. the drive in is better than actually being there. I\'d rather just get in the truck and drive around - it\'s really, really beautiful there. But going to the Bufadora\'s well...over-rated.

243337447.name: Remarkable
243337447.author: a TripAdvisor user
243337447.reviewBody: Amazing \'blow hole\'.  The peninsula it is on is also wonderful.  Parking is a problem.  The site is well worth the trip

242878662.name: Relaxing(but don\'t mind the pushy flea marketers)
242878662.author: a TripAdvisor user
242878662.reviewBody: During cruise stop we got off in Ensenada.  Decided to do the La Bufadora excursion but did not purchase from Carnival.  We purchased from bus driver going into town for a cost of $15 per person.  Drive by bus was about 35 minutes or so but got to see a lot of country side and ocean.  When we got there, the guide showed us to a blow hole and told us where was "good" to eat and where was "not good" to eat.  Saw the blow hole and the view was amazing.  Flea market was also nice, peddlers were pushy but just tell them no and move on.  Good experience.

242855807.name: Nice place to enjoy the view and relax.
242855807.author: a TripAdvisor user
242855807.reviewBody: Very nice view of the ocean,the blow was vwry exciting to see,went very high,come down have a cocktail and relax!

242165549.name: Worry-Free Environment
242165549.author: a TripAdvisor user
242165549.reviewBody: It is a great place to visit. People think its overly priced but then again every tourist place you go to is going to be expensive. Do you think you\'re going to spend only a couple bucks while your on VACATION? Nature is beautiful, the people are great, the whole atmosphere feels amazing. It is definitely a go to place. Don\'t go to Mexico if you\'re going to be picky about everything!

242132736.name: Nice
242132736.author: a TripAdvisor user
242132736.reviewBody: This was quite frankly more than a little bit cool. I\'ve seen similar phenomena in other parts of the world, and always get a kick out of them.

241457682.name: A great adventure
241457682.author: a TripAdvisor user
241457682.reviewBody: There was an interesting tram ride to the Bufadora; it\'s a must see in Ensenada with cute little Mexican shops and great food. It was warm and sunny when we went; lots of artists and music. We had a great time there.

241422550.name: It\'s worth a stop
241422550.author: a TripAdvisor user
241422550.reviewBody: If you are going to be in Ensenada you have to see this!!! It\'s a must lots of great food and tourist shopping around the area!!!

240855313.name: Big dud
240855313.author: a TripAdvisor user
240855313.reviewBody: On any given day here is what you will get at "La Bufadora"  \nPut your hands together in a sink full of water, make a fist to let water in between your two palms.  Squeeze them together really fast to force the water out.... instant.. La Bufadora

240599343.name: A Beautiful Natural Wonder
240599343.author: a TripAdvisor user
240599343.reviewBody: Yes, its a far (albeit interesting) drive out of town.  Yes its a bit treacherous going rural and up the side of a mountain with buses coming the other way.  Yes, the vendors are over the top even by Mexican standards.  Yes, it goes from them selling cheap knicknacks, to various food items, to viagra, to vendors selling pictures with a live Jaguar and a baby Lion.  However once you actually get there, its a beautiful natural phenomenon second to none.  I could stand and watch that water explode up the hillside all day.  Off peak season, like November the crowds are not huge and you can walk right up to the edge of the observation platform and really enjoy it.  Totally worth the drive!

240566561.name: BEWARE OF THE PINACOLADAS
240566561.author: a TripAdvisor user
240566561.reviewBody: the height and power of the water that is blown up depends on the tide, so go there during high tide to be worth it. you won\'t see anything if the tide is low. i went there during a cruise, didn\'t buy the excursion but bought the trip for half the price when i got off the bus from the ship. going there, there\'s a lot of hawkers, i did try though their grilled clams with cheese which i found good, their $10 grilled lobster and tried the sea urchin which they let you sample for free.\nBEWARE: \nthey use carved out pineapples as containers for pinacoladas, but they reuse those if you just leave them behind without destroying them, and of course you cant clean them. request cups instead unless you see them carve out that pineapple with your own eyes.

240258316.name: Nice classic place in Ensenada
240258316.author: a TripAdvisor user
240258316.reviewBody: A classic original place to visit in Ensenada. A lot of little stores and people selling on a street with good restaurants and seafood. La Bufadora is a nice place to take pictures and take video where the water gets thrown off the rocks. I don\'t recommend taking a paid tour but instead rent a car to get there, etc.

239789572.name: A beautiful sight to behold, and then...
239789572.author: a TripAdvisor user
239789572.reviewBody:
La Bufadora definitely is a one of a kind place to visit however getting there is really a bummer.
The bus ride definitely highlights the poverty in Mexico.
The town you walk through to get to La Bufadora is filled with very aggressive (and sometimes funny) vendors hawking everything from jewlery, viagra, and smoothies.
The only thing holding this sight back from a 5-star review is the fact the town cannot control their overly aggressive vendors.
Everything here is over priced.
Definitely do not eat in the town as you'll find the prices are the same or higher than American prices.

239421755.name: La Bufadora
239421755.author: a TripAdvisor user
239421755.reviewBody: My first time there and it was beautiful! It\'s crazy how nature works, I couldn\'t stop looking at the water as it rose from the bottom. It was amazing, I will definitely come back.

239412385.name: Interesting Place
239412385.author: a TripAdvisor user
239412385.reviewBody: It was many years ago that I was last here. Can\'t dial in a date that goes back that far on Trip Advisor, but it was August, just not 2014. La Bufadora has a fascinating blowhole where seawater is expelled upward and outward when the tides are right. But, what I was most intrigued with here were the street tacos offered in many of the small eateries. I asked a couple tour bus drivers where they ate while their passengers were busy buying things, and they pointed me to any number of taco restaurants. Some of the finest carne asado tacos I\'ve ever tasted. Follow those with a Coco Hilado, fresh chilled coconuts with the top lopped off, chilled coconut milk and fresh coconut chunks. Tasty dessert while you walk around and do some shopping.

239182836.name: Scenic drive, convenient dining, attraction is disappointing
239182836.author: a TripAdvisor user
239182836.reviewBody: I\'ve been spoiled by living along some of the most scenic spots on the US Pacific Coast ( Big Sur, Point Reyes ) so the Bufadora itself ( the blowhole ) was kind of a letdown.  You don\'t get such a great view from the lookout spot and you have to during at the right tidal conditions. Actually I enjoyed the drive out there much more. Mexico has a lot of undeveloped coastal areas so it\'s a pretty drive out there on a beautiful sunny day.  I was ready for good eats at a couple of view dining spots although most of the business was geared toward tequila drinking and quick mexican dishes.  They had iced on the menu but they gave me uncomprehending looks when I asked for it. It would be a more attractive spot if there was more of a hiking trail along the coast but we have plenty of those in California.

238501638.name: major blow hole
238501638.author: a TripAdvisor user
238501638.reviewBody: outside of Ensenada about 30 miles or so in some really nice country you come across a typical Mexican tourist area filled with  restaurants and vendors selling Mexican curios but at the end of the walk is Blowhole that is worth walking the gauntlet of vendors. Restaurants are ok nothing special but nothing bad. There were some wild animals rescues I particularly like the the Jaguar and Black Panther that you could get really close and upfront & personal with. Excellent drive beautiful country. Worth the trip

238088281.name: Cold mist, hot air
238088281.author: a TripAdvisor user
238088281.reviewBody: I\'ve watched La Bufadora (the blowhole) become a major tourist attraction over the years.  You walk to some cliffs and experience a seaborne geyser blowing sea mist into the air on tidal surges.   You need the cool mist after experiencing all the hot air on the way.  You walk a gauntlet of vendors hawking everything from wood carvings to viagra.  It\'s, like, 200 meters of in-your-face vendors hollering, "Hey Honeymooners," or, "We got the good stuff!"  But that\'s Mexico.  Enjoy it.

237840883.name: Breathtaking views
237840883.author: a TripAdvisor user
237840883.reviewBody: The drive to La Bufadora was pretty depressing because of the abject poverty that you witness and the Americanization thrown in there (Home Depot, Applebee\'s, etc). The best fish tacos ever are right at the entrance of La Bufadora. I strongly recommend them!\nTo see La Bufadora, you have to walk through a street filled with vendors harassing you to buy their knockoffs, but most of them are pretty funny. The ocean amongst the rocks is breathtaking. Watching the blowhole form at the base and then explode is absolutely beautiful. So many pictures to be taken!

237819636.name: Best Part of Ensenada, but as for the rest...
237819636.author: a TripAdvisor user
237819636.reviewBody: While the Bufadora is a natural wonder, it takes a 30-40 minute ride along a long boring road that passes by some very poor broken down business and residential areas of Ensenada. We first walked into town to get the "tour" bus encountering the putrid smell of rotting fish as we left our magnificent cruise ship. It went downhill from there...since the area is very economically depressed, shop owners are desperate to sell their wares, which are highly overpriced and mostly made in China.  As soon as you enter the front of their shop, they practically jump out at you begging you to come into their shop. Several times, I had to pull my little Granddaughter out, telling her that she did not have to buy what they were selling. It was also very sad to see a caged Jaguar Cub and an adult one as well, at the entrance to a bar/restaurant as an enticement to come in...Many ships no longer stop at this port and it is easy to understand why.

237756166.name: Nice to see
237756166.author: a TripAdvisor user
237756166.reviewBody:
We drove to Ensedada by car and went to La Bufadora for a visit. It is a lively area with a long row of street vendors and restaurants.  I did not see anything spectacular to buy, but had a good time browsing. If you are a window shopper, there are a ton of touristy wares for sale. 
On the other hand, at the end of the long walk , awaited the delight of the day , an exceptional natural water show. I could have stayed all day!
If you are cruising into Ensenada, just be aware that this attraction is about an hour drive from the port... And takes less than an hour to see everything.
Worth the trip by care. I would pass as a cruise excursion

Paid parking
Wheelchair accessible
Service charge for Restroom facilities

237187175.name: Long walk...   Lots of vendors.
237187175.author: a TripAdvisor user
237187175.reviewBody: Almost seemed like a party going on, when you enter.   Long drive to get there.   Probably better suited to see this with a tour bus.\n  Too many vendors.  But, hey, that\'s the opportunists in Mexico!

236840331.name: Natural formation
236840331.author: a TripAdvisor user
236840331.reviewBody:
It is a natural formation that depend on the whether conditions, however, it is a nice area to enjoy the landscape. 
It is around 50 min by car south from Ensenada, there are restaurants (tourist trap) with Mexican food and shopping places for Mexican handmade craft or cloths.
It is a long drive but do not need more than a short time to spend there in the blowhole.
If your passion is more fun activities or extreme sports do not come here, but if you love landscapes, photography, relaxing time, this could be an option if you are close to or in Ensenada.

236415495.name: Stay on the cruise ship and tan...
236415495.author: a TripAdvisor user
236415495.reviewBody: If you haven\'t been to Mexico, then a taste of the local culture may be worth it.  Otherwise, the ocean experience of la bufadora is not worth the time.  The traditional Mexican shops are the same you see in every other border or Mexican town.  So, if that is your thing, take the two hours of driving and one hour of experiencing this tour.\n\nFor us, we should have enjoyed the sun and the ocean from the cruise ship pool...

236360795.name: A nice walk, bring a hat or buy one
236360795.author: a TripAdvisor user
236360795.reviewBody: Don\'t feel obligated to park right away when you arrive. The streets are narrow and people are walking through, but you could technically drive all the way up to Habana Banana and park in the lot to the left. We paid about $2.50 USD for parking and about .50 cents  per person to use the restroom. Seriously loved that everyone offers you a sample of the food and pi\u00f1a coladas. The bread is really delicious. Caution, I do not recommend breads that contain cheese or cream cheese. Even though breads are mostly covered up, it\'s still sitting in the heat. I had a sucky experience with that- good thing it was only one bite.

235754058.name: Ensenada\'s Natural Blowhole
235754058.author: a TripAdvisor user
235754058.reviewBody:
This is one of the main attractions in Ensenada and shouldn't be missed if you're visiting or even just passing through. This natural blowhole is situated just south of Ensenada and tourists and locals come from near and far to see the ocean and rocks create a natural geyser that shoots water up to 100 feet up in the air. It's free to go visit but they do charge about 20 pesos for parking and it’s 5 pesos to use the bathroom. While La Bufadora can get very crowded on weekends, during the middle of the week, there are fewer people and it's a more pleasant experience.

In order to get out to La Bufadora, you park and then walk down a street lined with stalls on either side. The stands sell Mexican trinkets and gifts, candy, food, etc. Some of the vendors get a little aggressive and can be annoying toward tourists, which is too bad. At the last few stands before you get down to La Bufadora are almejas gratinadas (clams au gratin), which you'll see them grilling. They're delicious and shouldn't be missed if you like seafood and are in the mood for a snack.

Part of the La Bufadora experience is the beautiful views on the drive out there. There’s a small dirt turnoff with a gorgeous viewpoint at coordinates 31.729335, -116.722485, near the tip of the point, about a mile before you get to the parking area for La Bufadora. It’s worth it to stop for the breathtaking views.

235649248.name: Timing is everything
235649248.author: a TripAdvisor user
235649248.reviewBody:
We visited La Bufadora in early October as part of a cruise excursion.  The issue with La Bufadora, at least as it was explained to us, was whether or not it was high tide as the pressure needs to build up in order to produce the spray of water.  We did get to see some sprays about 25 feet high - but as it is a natural phenomenon, you get what you get.  Be prepared to get wet if you are lucky enough to have a really good performance!  If the timing and nature are in sync, I understand it can be quite a show.  

I wasn't quite prepared for the shopping experience, meaning that in order to get to the viewing area for La Bufadora, you have to go down a street lined with shops with merchandise that you may or may not be interested in.  The vendors come out into the street to entice you to patronize their stores.  I know some of the people in our group were happy with the deals they made and enjoyed the opportunity, but at least for me, it somehow cast a shadow on the experience of a natural phenomenon.  Quite a juxtaposition.  

Also, there are no public restrooms available for use at no charge. You can pay to use a restroom - the cost is generally 50 cents. I am told because they have to truck in the water, they charge for the use of the facilities (this is pretty much a desert after all) which is understandable.  So, when you come, have some change or $1 bills handy in case you need to powder your nose and don't choose to patronize a restaurant or buy something at the local pharmacy and use their restroom.  They accept US dollars.  Just a word to the wise.

234746361.name: La Boof!
234746361.author: a TripAdvisor user
234746361.reviewBody: If you want to have a wonderful adventure, you must stop and check out the LaBufadora blow hole. It is very exciting to watch the waves blow up onto the high cliffs and to hear the onlookers squeal in delight as they get drenched by the surf. There is a very nice platform to look out at the sea. If you are there at the right time you might see the kayakers who are viewing the blowhole from the sea. We highly recommend this adventure!

234613603.name: Restaurants and shopping
234613603.author: a TripAdvisor user
234613603.reviewBody: If you are not into the natural site of the La Bufadora, you will end up shopping for souvenirs/junk on the swamp meet vendors.  There are also restaurants in the area for drinks and great food.  I have been here on 2 separate occasions and decided to stay in downtown during my last visit.  It is great to do at least once.  After that, just drink and eat in down town if you are coming from the cruise ship.

234337129.name: Great natural landscapes
234337129.author: a TripAdvisor user
234337129.reviewBody: The blow hole is a natural spectacle that if you plan it right can be accompanied by an awesome sunset.

234272074.name: La Bufadora Ensenada\u200e
234272074.author: a TripAdvisor user
234272074.reviewBody:
We came of a cruise ship and wanted to do two things in Ensenada. One was to have a look at the blowhole at La Bufadora but also to experience the Sip Lining at the Ensenada Camping Ground.

A word of warning that Ensenada is a very poor Mexican City. Some passengers on our cruise ship remained on board as they had previously experienced the port and found it as a port that they didn't want to experience again. I guess from our point of view you will experience beggars in the street and this is quite common. It is sad that to see and I feel those less fortunate. Despite that issue the main part of the town is quite vibrant and if you have the greenback you can sit back and have a lot of fun. Music, food and the occasional drink. The city is duty free. I bought a beautiful wooden chess set for my grandson for $15, he is still trying to teach me how to play.

Be very aware of people approaching you and offering private vehicles for transport around the district. They wait for passengers coming of the cruise ships and offer private transportation. Mexico has a regulated cab system and that is the Yellow Cabs.  You still have to negotiate the price for your journey, but the Yellow Cab System provides safety for tourists.

We grabbed No 22 and I why I mention this particular cab is the cab driver was a very honest person and a grandfather. We were travelling with our two grandchildren and this guy just treated the kids like they were his own. We felt very safe with this cab driver. We negotiated our price for our tour and had one of the most informative and beautiful tours around the district including the Blowhole and the sip lines at the camping ground. For 4 hours we paid $50 USD. Use the Yellow Cabs and not the private companies that are not insured and are a bit risky when it comes to payment or if you have an accident you may not be insured.

The blowhole is one of the best in the world and whilst we arrived on a calm day it was firing up 40-50 in the air. It is understood from the locals that on heavy seas, it can reach up to 150 feet in the air.  We still got very wet but enjoyed every experience.

On the walk down to the blowhole are individual market owners and most are selling the same tourist items. Negotiate hard with anything you want to buy because the traders go very high but with some negotiation they will come down at least 50% of the asking price. I bought beautiful leather belts with an asking price of $40 down to $20.  These were pure leather and not imitation and they will last for 15-20 years they are such high quality. I would normally $60-$70 for the same quality at home.

The zip lines are a camp ground that is on the same road to the blowhole. From a taxi point of view it is 15 minutes from the blowhole.

You have to pay an entrance fee that is refundable if you exit the park within two hours. We have read some negative stories about Mexican Taxi Drivers, use common sense, use your heart and you will experience Mexico. There is a beautiful water play ground for the kids and this is part of the park admission. There are four zip lines and these costs about $20USD. Height and age restrictions do apply and basically you need to be 48 inches. Quite fun and a great experience.

Ensenada is a very dry hot place during the summer months with water restrictions, the winter is the only time it rains and it is a place you can visit on a short term, you probably want to take lots of photos and it is one of those places that I have been there done that lets move on.

I would not discourage any one from visiting the place, make it short, make it safe and have a great holiday.

234207491.name: So much fun! LA BOOF!
234207491.author: a TripAdvisor user
234207491.reviewBody: Just really neat to see. \n\nbut do not shop at the local gift shops they support un eco friendly capture of sharks turtles and other marine life.

234079088.name: AWESOME AT MID TO HIGH TIDE!
234079088.author: a TripAdvisor user
234079088.reviewBody: What a wonder of the world.  i love going there. i dont really care about the shopping in this area, but once u actually get to La Bufadora, i am in awe of Nature!\ngreat place to visit

234078921.name: Tour from cruise ship
234078921.author: a TripAdvisor user
234078921.reviewBody: We were on the Crown Princess.  It was a 4 hour tour to La Bufadora.  You spend 10-20 mins watching the blow hole.  The vendors along the way to the blow hole are exhausting.  I realize they are trying to make a living but it personally drives me crazy.  Not sure the blow hole is worth the trip and expense.

233523953.name: Beautiful geyser but difficult getting there
233523953.author: a TripAdvisor user
233523953.reviewBody:
Beautiful geyser, it wasn't too crowded around it when we went. It was quite fun waiting in anticipation and then hearing all the cheers as the water rose. Brilliant photo opportunity! 

To get to La Bufadora though, you must first walk through a market. This market is most definitely a tourist trap and the sellers are incredibly persistent. Some were genuinely friendly whereas others do try to charge you more. 
-If you would like to buy something from here, which you might as there is a large selection, be aware of the fact that you can always bargain. 
-Wouldn't recommmend the food or drinks there, but the free samples were fine. 
-Avoid all the fake designer bags, they are all incredibly bad quality.
-Buy souvenirs from a shop elsewhere as they are quite highly priced here. 
-Also keep an eye out for dogs roaming about if you're not too keen on animals, there's also an opportunity to take a picture with a young lion/cheetah/tiger, whatever they have that day outside a restaurant. This was incredibly random but if you're feeling adventurous, I do know people who took pictures an were totally fine but I wouldn't try because it just seemed so badly-run and unorganised. 
Still worth a visit, just one of things you have to see once. Hope you enjoy it!

233482849.name: Cool natural wonder
233482849.author: a TripAdvisor user
233482849.reviewBody: The blowhole itself is really cool - It\'s amazing to see the raw power of the waves. It has the usual large crowds that attractions draw, which is fine. There did not seem to be many / any options for vegetarians for food, and shade is nearly impossible to find, so use lots of sunscreen, and don\'t plan to stay long if you burn easily. There are many, many vendors with tacky odds and ends, so lots of eye candy, but also lots of buying pressure and haggling.

233426141.name: fun to watch
233426141.author: a TripAdvisor user
233426141.reviewBody: Went there as part of my Cruise trip. It was fun to watch this wonder of nature. However there is nothing more than this . There are many food stalls selling Mexican food, but nothing vegetarian. \n\nThe ride to the place from Cruise terminal was a bit scary as the roads are cury and the driver of our taxi was driving very fast.

233241213.name: The earlier the better
233241213.author: a TripAdvisor user
233241213.reviewBody: If you want to shop  the best time is after 9 am , I arrived at 7am  and there was no vendors and nobody pushing things at you to buy or getting in the way of pictures. Feels nice to have that beautiful place all to yourself. Of course the later you go the higher the water will jump up but I was very happy with what I saw.

232984413.name: A Tourist trap you need to visit!!
232984413.author: a TripAdvisor user
232984413.reviewBody: La Bufadora is one of those tourist traps you need to visit.  We took a taxi just outside the cruise terminal for the 25 minute drive out to La Bufadora.   Everyone should go at least once (this is our third time over the last 30 years).  When you get to the front you need to make your way through the gauntlet of vendors.  Smile and enjoy, they are just trying to sell a few things.  Go with a great attitude and the vendors will enhance your visit.  When you get to the area of LA Bufadora you will see a flume of water created naturally from the ocean.  Depending of the tide will depend if it little or a large plume.  On your way back buy a bag of Churros for the walk back, but make sure you have them make them fresh (nothing like a fresh hot churro).  Enjoy!!

232752456.name: Waste of Time
232752456.author: a TripAdvisor user
232752456.reviewBody: This place is over rated, with its pushy sales people and long car ride. Avoid at all cost. \nWe wanted to experience it but quickly regretted our choice.

231429406.name: AVOID THIS RANCID TOURIST TRAP!
231429406.author: a TripAdvisor user
231429406.reviewBody: If you are going for the blowhole, this is a 1 hour walk through a huge throng of vicious sellers of pottery and souvenir garbage just to see a blowhole that might consume 4 minutes.  The first dozen shops might hold some mild interest but after that you realize that this is a sick version of Groundhog Day where all of the shops sell the exact same useless crap for a peso difference.  The only thing that changes on the way out is that these leeches realize you won\'t be back and hte rudeness factor increases exponentially.  \n\nDon\'t waste your time.  AVOID THIS RANCID TOURIST TRAP.

231037407.name: good place..
231037407.author: a TripAdvisor user
231037407.reviewBody: it is a good place... sometimes is a little bit dirty because of too much people...  it is a good chance to see this beauty from nature...

230591779.name: It\'s a Blow hole
230591779.author: a TripAdvisor user
230591779.reviewBody: Took a shore excursion from the Carnival Inspiration cruise for $33 pp 4hr tour. The bus ride to the blow hole was okay. Got there early 10am ish not crowded, some sellers was pushy and annoying.\nThe blow hole was okay nice for kids to see; But if you an adult its only good for a minute and your over it. Not really worth $33 pp. The only thing i did like is that we got to take a picture with a 3.5 month old cub for $25 for 2 people.

229282385.name: A quick photo spot and then off you go
229282385.author: a TripAdvisor user
229282385.reviewBody: As there aren\'t many things to see or do in Ensenada, it makes sense to take the 15-25 min. bus ride to La Bufadora.  Our bus driver was certainly entertaining and made the ride pleasant.  The shopping area was very busy.  Pretty much everyone from the cruise managed to find their way there.  Prices weren\'t as cheap as I thought.  Though the vendors were a bit on the pushy side, they were friendly and helpful.  This is their livelihood after all.  At the end of the road, passed all the shops, is the La Bufadora.  It really is just a 5 minute spectacle to take some photos and brag that you were there and then move on.  By the way, if you need to use the restroom, you have to pay a small fee.

229249595.name: Anything done by nature is beautiful
229249595.author: a TripAdvisor user
229249595.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful place to see as longest it\'s not crowded, hearing the water splashing into the rocks and getting a small breeze it\'s worth it., plenty of places to it local food and handmade crafts, it\'s a one time visit.

228758438.name: La Bufadora
228758438.author: a TripAdvisor user
228758438.reviewBody: Our visit in January this year and was surprised to find no carnival nor crowds, we visited early in the morning while the shopping/tourist places and local market around the area still in the sleeping mode so was able to walk at leisurely pace and enjoyed waiting for the blow hole to spout the trapped sea water. According to our guide because of low tide (?) the blow hole show display was not that great, still we stayed for some time and was treated to a respectable sea spray shots for a nice picture to bring home. The road going to La Bufadora is also w/o traffic at the time and able to enjoy the ocean scenario going to and from Ensenada. The walk from where we parked the car up to the blow hole is quite far and accompanying my 85yr old mother is a long walk.

227546011.name: Toursit trap
227546011.author: a TripAdvisor user
227546011.reviewBody: I feel like I am at a carnival midway when ever I visit here.  As I am a local try to avoid the place like the plague, but out of town guest always want to go and see it.  Lots of very aggressive and pushy vendors.  Not on my must revisit list.

227217407.name: Cool to visit just once
227217407.author: a TripAdvisor user
227217407.reviewBody: Kinda cool but no wow factor. It is very crowded area with limited spots to view. In fact, we did enjoy the local market and fresh tacos vendor even more (shrimp, chicken tacos are good but beef is numero uno). I did try cactus taco for the first time and it is alright.\n\nIf you have nothing to do while in Ensenada then go to this place for a sake of being there once. Not worth to revisit by any mean.

226678384.name: Very cool place to visit - nature and shops!
226678384.author: a TripAdvisor user
226678384.reviewBody: What a cool little place this is. First we took the public bus out to la bufadora which was very cheap ($1 each) and the ride was fantastic. Local people on a bus with singing and music playing. Loved it. When we arrived there was a ton of cool shops set up which we picked up some great bargains and delicious mangoes on a stick - yum! We the walked past the shops to the amazing blowhole that spews water high into the air with each wave that comes crashing in. Romantic spot but was a bit busy. Well worth the trek especially if you take the bus. So much fun. To note... Don\'t get offended if your wife gets whistled at while walking around Ensenada. It\'s just how the men behave - harmless but it can be annoying. Otherwise, enjoy Mexico!\n

226550218.name: Tour of the Blowhole
226550218.author: a TripAdvisor user
226550218.reviewBody: This was a great stop in La Bufadora! Caught the perfect explosions and waves mounting up! Definitely a place to check out and hopefully you are as lucky.

226465640.name: Great to experience at least once
226465640.author: a TripAdvisor user
226465640.reviewBody: I love the little shops, sellers were cool and of course a little pushy.  Loved the atmosphere, definetly want to go again.  A little drive but worth it.  The Bufadora water thing was cool to see, but not amazing.  Everything else that went along with the experience made it a great time.

226400895.name: Amazing!
226400895.author: a TripAdvisor user
226400895.reviewBody: Come check this natural wonder and get a taste of the culture with shops and restaurants! Got a picture key ring for 2.50 dlls! What a souvenir!

223670394.name: Bad News for Bufadora
223670394.author: a TripAdvisor user
223670394.reviewBody: The vendors that have been there for years, and are 90 percent of the attraction in visiting the Blow Hole, have been evicted.  The property has been sold to another owner who plans to upgrade the property to a more \'modern\' tourist attraction.  We loved the culture that one was immersed in when visiting and are very sad to see it go.

223347869.name: awesome but packed with people much shopping
223347869.author: a TripAdvisor user
223347869.reviewBody: If u like shopping there\'s plenty of it on the walk to the blowhole but when I got there the place was packed and had to wait to get a front row seat but it was really cool to see how high the water would go each time

222793532.name: It was no biggie
222793532.author: a TripAdvisor user
222793532.reviewBody: La Bufadora was ok! I wouldn\'t spend money again to go back. I am more an adventurous person, not just standing there waiting for 15 mins or more for a blast of water out a hole. What sucked was the currents were low so the water spurt was sooo small. The best thing about the trip was our tour guide Tony Gonzalez omggg you gotta request him when you get to the shuttle station. If you travel to Ense. Via carnival cruise don\'t bother to buy a excursion with them go into Mexico to do it wayyyy cheaper!!! If money isn\'t a issue then go ahead pay over the internet or onboard. About the markets on the way to LA Bufadora, no one bothers you like how I have seen in other parts of the world, but hey keep walking or buy no biggie! Have a good one.

220569467.name: Nice place, original
220569467.author: a TripAdvisor user
220569467.reviewBody:
The blowhole is impressive.
You have to walk through dozens of shops and restaurants to get there.
Going to La Bufadora is nice, we stayed at Casa Mediodia B&B, which is a fantastic B&B. 
it is a good way to avoid sleeping in Ensenada.
the place is worth 2 nights stay, probably more during the whales season

220190871.name: Sea Kayaking La Bufadora
220190871.author: a TripAdvisor user
220190871.reviewBody: What fun! We booked this excursion through Carnival Cruises.  My 15 year old grandson and I enjoyed our sea kayaking!  The sea was calm--almost like glass.  We were outfitted and given good instructions on how to row.  It wasn\'t hard and we had a really good time.  The blow hole was amazing from the ocean level.  Glad we went!

219901838.name: I wouldn\'t go back
219901838.author: a TripAdvisor user
219901838.reviewBody: I traveled here late in the evening, which is not the best time to go because all the shops and restaurants around the area were closing, however we pretty much had the blowhole to ourselves. It is a beautiful view, but the blowhole itself was very mild and less than spectacular. My favorite part about the trip there was were we ate at after we left. Leaving the blowhole on the left is a beautiful restaurant called La Bufadora Resturante and they served us despite it being two hours past their closing time. The food was amazing and the serve very friendly. I am sure the blowhole is much more amazing when it is more active, but I would probably not go back to this area.

219568897.name: Visited via Carnival Cruise
219568897.author: a TripAdvisor user
219568897.reviewBody:
My review is based on my experience traveling here via Carnival Cruise and getting shuttled by trusty tour guides. Instead of opting for one of the cruises' planned excursions, I chose to take the non-affiliated shuttle bus tour to La Bufadora. I don't remember the name of the shuttle company, but they say they cater to the tourists coming off cruise ships everyday. It's a $3/person ride to a stop in town where you decide what trip options you want to take next. I chose just the $15/person trip to La Bufadora w/o the options for horseback riding or zip lining. Who knew that it actually took 40-45 min just to get to the site itself. We had a terrific guide, Ignacio, who explained Ensenada and its history along the ride.

Thankfully there's not another charge to see La Bufadora. Our group walks straight to the sight through the flea market, before doing any shopping or eating. I got there around 11 am on a Wednesday, and it wasn't too crowded. Saw the waves crash up a handful of times--it happens pretty often. You can almost tell when to expect a big crash coming. It's fairly exciting for the first few times. Then, I strolled back towards the parking lot while shopping and trying to buy a straw hat at a bargained price. I also ate cheesy baked clams and some fish tacos, a must for coastal Mexican food. 

Could easily spend the day getting here, shopping, eating and then traveling back to make it back on the ship by early afternoon. 

P.S. It's $0.50 to use most bathrooms, unless you eat at some of the sit-down restaurants where the bathroom could be free.

218790460.name: Crowded
218790460.author: a TripAdvisor user
218790460.reviewBody: The blowhole was pretty mild during the time of day we went. Great prices at the market if you can handle the crowds and slightly aggressive sales people. Got some good deals at the pharmacy.

218729924.name: It\'s okay
218729924.author: a TripAdvisor user
218729924.reviewBody: You park, then walk through one corridor of a trinket market with aggressive vendors....like every tourist trap in Mexico.  I did like the restaurants and food vendors...delicious.  At the end of it is La Bufadora.  You can only see it if you look down over a crowded wall.  It\'s not a big blow hole.  The view of the bay is lovely.

217330290.name: La Bufadora is impressive
217330290.author: a TripAdvisor user
217330290.reviewBody: Come to visit this site during high tide only. Around 7pm is the best time of the day. It is a wonderful site to see. A pride of Mexico.

216968011.name: No internet access
216968011.author: a TripAdvisor user
216968011.reviewBody: The aisle to my room smells smokey and there has not any internet access. It is very contradictory to the promotion of the hotel which says high speed internet access. I will never stay at this hotel again even if I get 50% discount of what I pay (around USD100) for a family room (one double bed plus one single bed). My wife got sick when we check out of the hotel. One more thing, no breakfast is provided by the hotel.

215746598.name: Worth the Trip
215746598.author: a TripAdvisor user
215746598.reviewBody: We took a Carnival Cruise to Ensenada and had no interest in any of the excursions however there was a shuttle off the cruise that offered transportation to the blowhole for $15. Worth every penny. Had no expectations and was pleasantly surprised. La Bufadora is 1 of 3 blowholes in the whole world. The flea market was fun to walk through however be prepared to be bombarded by the shop owners. Very cool experience.

215037598.name: This is a "must do"
215037598.author: a TripAdvisor user
215037598.reviewBody:
La Bufadora is one of those things you should do if you have the opportunity.  It is known as the blowhole.  Ocean water comes in with the tide, hits the rocks and shoots water up in the air from air pressure that gets trapped between the rocks underneath and the water on top.  Sometimes the water gets people standing around the top wet, but usually, the tide isn't big enough to be very exciting.

While this was the original attraction, people built restaurants and makeshift stores around it.  The food is okay, and the prices are relatively cheap.  

For me, the experience is fun when you are shopping for souvenirs for friends and family, and you get to barter with people selling stuff.  After a while, it can be overwhelming.  Most of the stuff is cheap, low quality stuff that you really don't want, but sounds cool while you're there!  Word to the wise:  the "Cuban" cigars they sell aren't really Cuban cigars, so don't blow your wad on fake stuff.  Stick to things you can put a value on.  We have purchased many things- from seashell mirrors, to toys, to shoes.  Most of the watches and silver there are fake as well, so shop carefully.  Don't be afraid to engage with people in negotiations.  It's part of the culture, and if done right, can benefit you and the seller.  

The churros and pina coladas are all great!  Refills on Pina Coladas are $2 if you keep the pineapple the drink comes in.  We were brave last time we went and tried the clams which were also great!  

Also, there is a kiosk where you can take pictures with baby lions and tigers.  The money raised supposedly goes to supporting a reservation where the larger cats go when they are too wild to take pictures with.  After visiting, we checked online, and we couldn't verify whether the people who run that kiosk are really a charity or not, but they are seemingly exploiting these young animals, and when they get too big, instead of putting them on a reservation, they kill them.  Its a great photo opportunity, but we no longer support these people based on what we have read.  

Parking at La Bufadora is 25 pesos or $2.  Using the bathrooms will cost 50 cents or 5 pesos.  

There are many samples of food, and its a beautiful drive up a mountain along the ocean to get there.  Between the blowhole, the shopping, and the food, I highly recommend stopping here for 2-3 hours if you're in the area.

213508123.name: Interesting
213508123.author: a TripAdvisor user
213508123.reviewBody: La Bufadora is an interesting site. On the way one can see the rural areas of Ensendada.  Once you arrive you will have several vendors trying to sell you items so be prepared.\n\nRMS

213298293.name: There are few things to see in Ensenada. This is it.
213298293.author: a TripAdvisor user
213298293.reviewBody: The blow hole is about the only thing to see in Ensenada other than adult or alcohol related.  To get to it there is a gauntlet of hucksters trying to sell you stuff at "99% off" (aka knock-off/cheap).  The blow hole is not a bad place to go under that condition.  But, if you are on a cruise then consider just staying on the boat since there are more attractions on-board.  Toilets cost $0.50 (USD) per use. Recommended time for the visit of ~2 hours includes travel.

213166909.name: You have to do this at least once if you\'re going to Ensenada!
213166909.author: a TripAdvisor user
213166909.reviewBody: We took a tour from Ensenada to La Bufadora.  It was about 30 minutes from town.  There is a portion of the road where its still dirt and a tad bit rough but luckily Ensenada is working on making the road paved completely.  When we got there we saw the flea market which extended for blocks down the pathway to La Bufadora - the blowhole.  You will get bombarded by vendors wanting you to try their pina coladas and churros claiming each one makes the best.  I probably had 10 samples of pina coladas and a half dozen churro samples.  All good and each vendors tasted the same.  Anyways you walk through the flea market dealing with agressive vendors each wanting you to visit their store.  Our tour guide told us which stores to go in. He probably got a kick back of some sort from each vendor because at the end of our trip here he was drunk.  Everyone gave him shots of Tequila or whatever.  Anyways, the sellers will always start the prices off very high.  Offer them 60% less what they are quoting you.  If they don\'t budge, don\'t worry there is a vendor that is selling the same thing in the next booth.  Don\'t believe that anything is designer whether its watches, purses, etc. THEY ARE ALL FAKE!  If you have the patience and know how to deal, it can be alot of fun and very rewarding knowing you got a great deal.  As for eating, I recommend the fish tacos at the first stand on the right as you enter the flea market.  The last taco stand is also very good.  They have these clams topped with cheese and pico di gallo that are fabulous.  I believe it was 3 large clams for $9.  Very very good!  I think the shopping here at the flea market is more fun than shopping downtown.  They are much more willing to bargain with you.

213119218.name: The Blow Hole was GREAT
213119218.author: a TripAdvisor user
213119218.reviewBody: However, you have to walk through what we would call in the US, a Swap Meet.  It would be great to be able to leisurely stroll through and shop at your own pace, however, the PUSHY vendors make it very uncomfortable!  The Blow Hole I could watch all day...fascinating!!!

213104679.name: a bit of whimsey
213104679.author: a TripAdvisor user
213104679.reviewBody: Maybe we were lucky, but the local bus (deserted) took us to a parking lot within 100 feet of the blowhole. Sure, 50 of those feet are filled with vendors but they are just trying to make a living and are harmless. The blowhole is enormous and is an interesting amateur physics lesson - but the fun is watching the locals get drenched if not paying attention. The coastal road is absolutely beautiful as is the jagged but densely vegetated peninsula at the end. I would return if in the area. And for all the budget minded - buses are pennies and the sight is free.

212871479.name: One of only 2 Blow holes in N. America. Neat but you gotta walk through vendor hell.
212871479.author: a TripAdvisor user
212871479.reviewBody:
It's a long walk to La Bufadora so wear good shoes. You get pretty close to the blow and its best at high tide. The tourists buses and cruise ships will show up for high tide so be ready for a crowd. Your will get wet if your there at the right time and get right down on it. The day I was there water was easily reaching 60+ feet and soaking the observers. It was a good time and watching other people was almost more fun.

The downside is the long walk. You have to walk through vendors on both sides the entire time. It gets old fast. Don't drink the beautiful Pina Coladas in the Pineapple! You will get sick. I was so relaxed there I braved one and well, let's just say Montezuma got his revenge for weeks to follow.

There are some decent deals to be had as there are so many vendors competing for you Dollar. Definitely better later in the day around 4:00 as thats when they are closing up.

The bathrooms are semi-public meaning they are at the top of the trail. They are clean but you have to pay in pesos or just give the guy a buck or two.

212705738.name: Good shopping
212705738.author: a TripAdvisor user
212705738.reviewBody: The blow hole itself is not that interesting, but if you like street market shopping, this is a good trip to take while in Ensenada.

211776161.name: A very nice way to spend the afternoon
211776161.author: a TripAdvisor user
211776161.reviewBody: It was a bit of an effort to get there (by bus from Ensenada) but so worth it ! It is mesmerising watching the waves roll in, then whooosh! up the spout it goes. I could have watched for hours - and did for close to 2 - the coastline around there is very pretty too. The site is frequented by Mexican families out on day trips, everyone is very jolly and half the fun is getting completely drenched ! It\'s a hoot !

210212089.name: Worlds 2nd largest blow hole
210212089.author: a TripAdvisor user
210212089.reviewBody: Watching the blow hole is fun for a one time experience.  Unless you are going out there for some other reason the trip is not worth the cost.  DON\'T TAKE A TAXI.\nThe vendors will drive you crazy.  The Pharmacy\'s all sell counterfeit drugs so save your money.

209933007.name: Blow hole
209933007.author: a TripAdvisor user
209933007.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this site, I read a bunch of reviews and it was everything and more.  Not a lot to do the the site was beautiful. Enjoyed the view.

208938574.name: Waste of Time
208938574.author: a TripAdvisor user
208938574.reviewBody: We were on a quick cruise to Mexico with the kids.   We decided not to pay the cruise line for the excursion and booked it ourselves once we got off the boat.  We had an airconditioned tour bus to the bufadora.   You drive through Ensenada and there is really nothing great about the hour long drive, not cool views, nada.    Once you get there, you have to meander through a bunch of people trying to sell you fake louis vuitton and Michael Kors purses.   The bufadora itself is cool to look at for about 5 minutes.   Not worth the time or money.   We only spent $10 per person and that was still too much!  I can\'t imagine the suckers that had to pay cruise excursion prices.

208750233.name: wonderful
208750233.author: a TripAdvisor user
208750233.reviewBody: very nice and friendly place to visit and great sight watching. good place to go with your family. good climate as well

207452701.name: La Bufadora
207452701.author: a TripAdvisor user
207452701.reviewBody: open air market with tons of items to get whether you really need them or not! best tacos I have had! Lots of free samples of foofoo drinks and oysters and the absolute Best Churro\'s I have ever eaten too! Oh yeah, the blow hole is neat too.

206065745.name: One of a kind!
206065745.author: a TripAdvisor user
206065745.reviewBody: The vendors on your way to the Bufadora sell many items relevant to Mexico. Once you get to the cliff to witness the amazing dept of the bufadora, you appreciate the ocean and it\'s ability. If you are too close, the water shooting from the ocean will get you wet! My teens loved this place!

205946145.name: Nothing great
205946145.author: a TripAdvisor user
205946145.reviewBody: We take a few 3 day Mexican cruises a year from Los Angeles and one of the stops is Ensenada Mexico. It boggles my mind why this is a stop. But more on that later. Once you get off the ship there is a small shopping area at the terminal and next to that there are shuttles waiting to take you into Ensenada for shopping and dining.  Once on the shuttle the staff really push the tour to the Bufadora. The way they talk about it you would think it is heaven on earth. So we decided to give it a shot this time.
