Instead of falling for the prices the tour company charges for the Bufadora trip I hired my own cab driver who charged about half what the tour company charged.  Our cab was clean and the driver was friendly. Our driver did stop at the Corona bottling plant and we purchased a couple of beers for the road. This was a nice touch. When we got to the Bufadora area, our driver asked us how long we would be and I told him to meet us in two hours. We then began walking down the street that leads to this attraction. There was shop after shop with vendors yelling out to you as you walked by hoping to make a sale. All of the shops seem to carry the same items. There were t-shirts galore. Candy. Leather goods. We stopped at a few shops and the vendors were not in the bartering mood. I saw a t-shirt I liked and the vendor wanted 20 dollars.  I said that I would give him 15 and he rejected it. So we moved on.  When we got to the bufadora at the end of the street I was really disappointed. It snorted and blew a little water but nothing spectacular.  There were also restrooms oddly located right next to this attraction. And they charged to use them.  We then decided to try a restaurant located near this attraction and found the place to be empty. I had to shout out to see if anyone was working there. Finally someone came out and seated us. The food was okay. There were some decent ocean views from there but the place felt old and rundown.  We made our way back up the road and met our cab driver. He said "already done." I said "yep, I have seen enough."   We will not be back.  I am not sure why the cruise ships stop in Ensenada anymore. There is really nothing to do there. The town is removed from the ocean and it is just like any other place to get a beer and eat a taco.  We actually stay on the ship now when our cruise ship docks in Ensenada.

205579597.name: So, so
205579597.author: a TripAdvisor user
205579597.reviewBody: It was not all that. Items being sold were very expensive. Although I did get a pi\u00f1a colada and it was very delicious.

203250642.name: Beautiful view, but do not go super out of your way for this
203250642.author: a TripAdvisor user
203250642.reviewBody: Nice drive, pretty far from Ensenada. I have been twice and am sure that I will go back when people are visiting. There is a street full of shops lined up, about 10-15 minutes worth, and then the blow hole at the end. About 10 minutes actually watching it is plenty. Clams with the cheese at the end are probably the best part of the trip.

202907533.name: La Bufadora is our Fave Ensenada experience!
202907533.author: a TripAdvisor user
202907533.reviewBody:
We love the la Bufadora trip, and have taken it many times.  When we leave a ship, and take the shuttle to town, we are offered a tour to the blowhole and flea market at La Bufadora.  The trip takes about 45 min by bus, usually narrated by an English-speaking resident of Ensenada, often a college student.  The narrators are often funny, and very informative.  The 45 minute drive goes through Ensenada, past the Plaza de los Tres Cabezas (Plaza of the three heads) which honors three heroes of Mexican Independence with huge statues of their heads.

The ride is past the manufacturing district, much expanded and quite modern since NAFTA, then miles of lush farming land and olive groves, then past beautiful beaches and eventually rising up by the coastline toward the mountains, which are quite lovely.  You also see the "gringo gulch" developments of houses for expat Americans who have homes here.  

At the end of the drive, your bus pulls into a shopping area, a huge flea market with all kinds of stalls selling ceramics, stained glass, leather, knockoff designer purses, handwoven cloth purses, clothing, and the ubiquitous T-shirts.  Surprisingly, this year the tiny Belen (Bethlehem) winery has a booth, with excellent wine for the tasting.  We bought some in January, and again yesterday.  There are also very good restaurants and bars for cocktails and beer.  

Through the middle of this marketplace runs a dirt road, heading toward the impressive, mountainous coastline and the famous blowhole.  The blowhole only spouts water when the tide is in, and the height of the spout varies with ocean conditions. Today, we were told by fellow tour passengers that it was spouting about 60 feet, and got people wet.  There is also a small museum at the blowhole site, and usually people in Aztec or Indian costume and musicians playing.  

the tour gives you about 90 minutes to shop, and asks you to meet back at the bus at the end of that time.  The parking lot has a good bathroom (price 50 cents) and a little taco stand that serves really excellent fish tacos and quesadillas with handmade tortillas for a dollar or two, depending what you order.  

The tour today cost $15, less the $3 we paid for the shuttle ride, and was well worth it. We acquired a lovely piece of stained glass, and some wine, and were very happy with the day.

202542946.name: tourist trap but worth it
202542946.author: a TripAdvisor user
202542946.reviewBody: views of the beautiful surroundings are completely blocked off by all of the booths on both sides of the trail, so you don\'t even know you are in a gorgeous peninsula surrounded by water and fascinating vistas

202477833.name: Must See!
202477833.author: a TripAdvisor user
202477833.reviewBody:
We took a group tour to La Bufadora that left near the little village area near the cruise ships. I recommend that if you are there on a cruise, do not book the tour through the cruise line (Carnival), they overcharge and try to scare you out of booking with the other tour companies just so they can get your money. Trust me, it's a better value to book with a non-cruise sponsored tour company and you'll save a ton of money. Even in the event that their shuttle breaks down, they do have other vans to send so you won't be stranded and miss your cruise. They are all very aware that most people have a cruise to get back to and they are kept on schedule.

La Bufadora itself was surprisingly a bit of a drive from the port, but it lets you see a lot of the city on the way. You will be approached by a lot of street vendors once you get off the shuttle and just remember the magic words "No gracias!" if you want them to leave you alone. Most of the nick-nacks they are selling aren't really as authentic as you might think anyway and it's all overpriced because they expect people to haggle with them to get them to a more normal price. I don't care what they say, I don't trust any of the silver to be real. Don't bother buying the knock-off handbags either, you can get the real thing for the same price as their knock-offs if you visit your nearest outlet mall.

It was really awesome to see such a natural wonder that is La Bufadora. The whole view looking out to the water is very picturesque like a post card and I am glad we chose this excursion over the others.

Once you're done checking out La Bufadora, then go walk around the shops, bargain with the vendors and get yourself some lunch. I only wish that I didn't fill up on my lobster burrito at the restaurant because there was so much great looking food to try like the oysters that I was too full for. The churros were really good too.

202318921.name: So many people!
202318921.author: a TripAdvisor user
202318921.reviewBody: Cruise ships were in so there were many people this time. The vendors are a bit in your face but a firm "Non gracias" will do it. One of the jewelry places isn\'t very honest with their prices - best advice I could give is go with your instincts.

201575066.name: pretty awesome
201575066.author: a TripAdvisor user
201575066.reviewBody: This place is great, the drive up the mountain you get to see pretty much the whole city from above and the  view of the ocean is great, we even got to see some whales from far, the way the water shoots up is incredible we did got very wet, my 6yr old was loving it, it was like a splashing water park, it wasnt so crowded, and there is vendors all thruogh the strip, with souvenirs\n\nthere is a couple of restaurants to eat from, my favorite was the tacos, also there is buss service in case you dont want to drive

201485804.name: Beautiful!!
201485804.author: a TripAdvisor user
201485804.reviewBody: The La Bufadora (blowhole) is located at the Punta Banda Peninsula in Ensenada, Mexico.  According to our guide, there are three blowholes in the world: one in Hawaii, another in Australia and this one in Ensenada. La Bufadora is the second highest geyser after Hawaii\'s.  It is a natural marine geyser capable of shooting water as high as 80ft above sea level, depending on the tide.  Legend has it that the spout of water and the tremendous roar that accompanies it is coming from a whale that was once trapped in the inlet.  Don\'t miss it!

200833337.name: The blow hole
200833337.author: a TripAdvisor user
200833337.reviewBody: Great place to visit well known lots of things to do horse riding, eat and visit curios also the view of the sea and get wet while viewing the bufadora blow water. The drive is a little long well worth it thers lots of puestos on the side to buy stuff.

200832428.name: The Gorgeous Pacific!
200832428.author: a TripAdvisor user
200832428.reviewBody: Ensenada Mexico was one of the stops on our Carnival Cruise. We booked a tour that included La Bufadora along with a guided walking tour of the Civic Center in central Ensenada. Our tour guide Rogelio was extremely pleasant and very informative during our air conditioned bus ride, La Bufadora is approximately 20 miles away from the port of Ensenada so it makes for a pretty good ride along some steep hills and bumpy roads on soft dirt that wind around the landscape scattered with homes and businesses that hang precariously off some steep cliffs!\nUpon arrival to La Bufadora prepare to get your game face on, the salesmen are pretty aggressive and you will literally be chased. Check the rate of exchange before you buy anything, when we were there it was 14pesos to $1! Lots of great souvenirs to choose from and to be honest, the salesmen are funnier than they are annoying.\nOnce you get to the area where you can actually hear and feel the majesty of the pacific ocean you will not be disappointed. Clear skies, gorgeous views, lots of seagulls. There was a man perched along the wall playing guitar and singing, so perfect for the location. If you have kids this is a must see when visiting Baja Mexico. Nature at its finest, wondrous and awe inspiring, how does it do that? We don\'t know, but we love it!

200520022.name: Beautiful Sceneries...  Blow Hole is a neat experience!!!
200520022.author: a TripAdvisor user
200520022.reviewBody: Our Carnival Cruise docked in Ensenada Mexico, got off the ship, and we just chance it by NOT joining an excursion to see the blow hole.  So we just got ourselve a cab and paid $80 for the whole trip. After we arrived, we set a time for return with the cab driver, and he waited for us, drove us back to the dock, then we paid him.  Very safe and fun.  But it is about 50 minutes drive from the dock, so do plan accordingly.  \n\nNote:  Washrooms are available, but you\'ll have to pay $0.25 per visit. Along the way, you\'ll see Mexican pharmacy selling cheap medicinal drugs (like Viagra), don\'t buy it, most likely they are knock offs.

200157462.name: Ok for 1 visit
200157462.author: a TripAdvisor user
200157462.reviewBody: On Carnival cruise line trip, stopped at Ensenada Mexico and La Bufadora was one of the few site tours. Took taxi ride for 30 minutes or so. Lots and lots of vendors with Mexican souvenir items. Make sure you negotiate because they will always give you their highest price first and all though it sounds reasonable, you can alway bargain with them.  Lots of food items but we chose the baked clams towards the end of the pathway and they were very good. Once you get to the actual Bufadora it was a quick viewing of the water being blown out. Interesting but going their once is enough for me. Lots of people from the cruise line were there so it was a little crowded but since not much to view the people would move along quickly. Nice view of the ocean.

200138106.name: wow
200138106.author: a TripAdvisor user
200138106.reviewBody: once you get by the curio sellers the experience is amazing-the sound of the water is a roar- the view of Pacific is beautiful

199831044.name: Do it once in your life, that\'s plenty
199831044.author: a TripAdvisor user
199831044.reviewBody: We went here on a tour from the people who drive shuttles from the cruise ship. The blowhole was not super exciting, but we took a couple of pictures. There are people giving little churro, pina colada, and bread samples every few feet, to get you to buy some from their stand. The flea market area had some fun souvenirs but the people will bother you to come into their little store and try to keep you there until you buy something. It was fun at first but got old real fast, especially bartering for every little thing. Be prepared to spend 50 cents to use a bathroom at La Bufadora. Overall, I\'m glad I went once, but that\'s enough for me.

199800964.name: From Cruise Port to the La Bufadora & Deals
199800964.author: a TripAdvisor user
199800964.reviewBody:
From Carnival Cruise port:
From the ship and cruise port terminal turn left and walk towards town, it is about 5 minute walk.  Once at the end of the street turn left and there will be taxis.  Many offered the trip to the blow hole for $50 for your group, keep walking!  

Speaking with several locals they told us that the local price is $8.00 per person round trip.  We secured a nice taxi van for 8 of us for $65 total.  It is a 45 minute trip there and was allowed to stay an hour and a 45 minute trip back to ship.

At the La Bufadora- vendors are aggressive, just keep walking and a polite no thank you, works.  We did purchase several items and haggled the prices, but in the end their stuff was the same price as in town.  Any kind of souvenir you would like.

Restrooms- $.50 and you received a small allotment of toilet tissue.

Blow hole-  Best at high tide, but if not a small spurt of water still happens.  

Along the way:  see the city, shopping areas, coast line, olive trees, and fields.

******BETTER DEAL******
Some of my other family went out of the cruise terminal and took a bus (not arranged ahead of time, they are just there and offer it).  It took them to the La Bufadora, horseback riding on the beach for 1 hour, zip-lining, and dinner....all for just $70 per person.  (That included their transportation also). They had a fantastic time and felt safe in all the activities.

199689301.name: Try it once
199689301.author: a TripAdvisor user
199689301.reviewBody:
La bufadora (also known as the blowhole) is a natural geyser located off the Punta Banda penninsula, about 20 miles south of Ensenada. It's one of the main attractions in the area and comes complete with its own shopping area between the parking lot and viewing point.

There are a few options here. You can walk over to the viewing area, kayak, or scuba dive in the water. Depending on the time of year and day, you may see a giant wall of water up to 65 feet, or just a light mist. So it can be awesome, or a let down. 

You have to pay to park or use the bathroom, and everyone accepts US money. 

The shop vendors (flea market style) can be annoying, but if you avoid eye contact you should be okay. If you do want to buy something, just remember that they start with high prices but will usually give you a lower price if you walk away.

It's something worth doing once, if only for the drive from Ensenada, as you get to see the countryside (which includes a lot of roaming dogs in case you were interested) on the drive over.

198834581.name: We drove in to park instead of "shopwalking" in to see the Bufadora
198834581.author: a TripAdvisor user
198834581.reviewBody: If you are in a car SAVE YOURSELF HASSLE and DON\'T park when they wave you to stop at what seems like the entrance to shops.  The "street" is lined with stores and they try to stop everyone and get them to walk through, but you can drive in on the street to a pay for parking lot.

198014405.name: The Blowhole
198014405.author: a TripAdvisor user
198014405.reviewBody: It was exciting, however, the photos do look better than what I saw. So, at different time frames the geyser is better. I would definitely go again. Plus, the flea market is pretty great. You can bargain to your hearts content to get a better price. :)

197985602.name: Site to see
197985602.author: a TripAdvisor user
197985602.reviewBody: Looks like the mountain has a blow hole! Also make sure you eat fish tacos at that first taco stand. They are insanely good!

197794232.name: Very Interesting water show
197794232.author: a TripAdvisor user
197794232.reviewBody: It is a bit of a trip to get their from a cruise ship, but it is a must see at least once.  They charge to use the Banos there so try and get that out of the way before going.  You will also be subjected to a large group of vendors during the walk down to the blow hole.

197715803.name: For god\'s sake, it is just a blow hole
197715803.author: a TripAdvisor user
197715803.reviewBody: Going to La Bufadora is worth it more for the drive than the blow hole itself.  The drive passes through the countryside with lots of places to stop to buy olives, olive oil, and honey.  The shops at the blow hole are reminiscent of Old Tijuana, touristy and plentiful.  Still, it is worth seeing the blow hole at least once.  The coast line here is spectacular.

197444638.name: Tourist Trap
197444638.author: a TripAdvisor user
197444638.reviewBody: This was my second visit here & I still don\'t get it.  It is tough to see & what are you looking at?  I just thought this was a complete tourist trap.  I did love the fresh tacos & churros served here though!  Just know what you are coming for & enjoy the drive there.\nYou do have to pay to park, but the "attraction" itself is free.

195504332.name: Interesting place
195504332.author: a TripAdvisor user
195504332.reviewBody:
You have to drive at first through a very busy area, the the road is easier, even when not in great condition.
After driving or walking to an endless street market you finally find the place.
It is amazing how the water raises and falls, you can spend a good half an hour just watching.
Highly recommended.

195276893.name: A bit of a tourist trap aside from the blow hole
195276893.author: a TripAdvisor user
195276893.reviewBody: You have to walk thru 3 blocks of Mexican vendors to get to the blow hole.  The hole blows whenever a big wave comes in so it\'s not like Old Faithful where you have to wait 45 min between sprays.  Some are better than others & you can avoid getting wet rather easily.  There are bathrooms & food vendors also.

193917307.name: Tourist Trap
193917307.author: a TripAdvisor user
193917307.reviewBody: I gave it three stars because it\'s a tourist trap however if given the choice I would still go. You need to time your trip with high tide to ensure the blowhole actually blows.

193775806.name: beautiful setting!
193775806.author: a TripAdvisor user
193775806.reviewBody: The road here from Ensenada is very scenic....up and over the mountain...I think  it\'s called  Punta  Banda.   Very funky walk down to the La Bufadora...a couple of blocks of solid tacky shops selling junk.  Some hustling from food vendors and shops.  When we got down to La Bufadora, it was a very quiet day....waited and waited for it to act up...then finally , only a small spray.  We didn\'t stay long, stunning vistas from this viewpoint. We liked it and will comeback for another try. Beautiful....

193728763.name: Disappointing
193728763.author: a TripAdvisor user
193728763.reviewBody: This was pretty unexciting as a destination excursion, but then I am very spoiled by my access to the beautiful Oregon coast, which has similar spots.  The blow-hole wasn\'t blowing much while I was there, so it felt like a bit of a bust - perhaps the tide was low?  More interesting was the long roadway of shops and stands, where some of the shop-keepers were pretty aggressive at trying to get passers-by into their stores.  Check out the fish-taco place near the entrance (uphill side) - highly recommended!

192988012.name: 1 of the excursions of the sapphire princess cruises "The Bufadora"(blow-hole)
192988012.author: a TripAdvisor user
192988012.reviewBody: During a 4 day cruise on the sapphire princess to mexico. They offered a excursion to the the Bufadora (Blow-hole). The tour bus took us to the site it was beautiful to see the clear blue water crashing against the rocks. To hear the crashing water just took me away to Gods beautiful creations. The Blow-hole was beautiful I\'ve never seen one before every couple minutes it just shoot up with such a beautiful rainbow behind it. It took my breath away.I thought to myself my children would of loved to see this and they would of shouted "WOW". Yes the locals called out to come see try their food and drinks. Me and my Aunt tried the non-alcoholic Pina Colada they were made in real coconuts they were terrific. There was one exceptional stand they had all shells from lg. ones to lil baby ones. They also had starfishes,sea horses,shark heads,sting rays.I stayed in there for seemed like hours so interesting...loved it

192479804.name: One of Three Blow holes in the world
192479804.author: a TripAdvisor user
192479804.reviewBody: As a natural wonder, this blowhole was beautiful to look at. We went early morning with a private driver when the tides are higher and the sprays gorgeous. The other blow holes are located in Hawaii and Australia. \n\nAfter checking this area out and taking some pictures, we visited the La Bufadora marketplace with 300 vendors. The souvenirs are cheaper than downtown when you bargain.

192243283.name: The Blowhole
192243283.author: a TripAdvisor user
192243283.reviewBody: Worth a visit - however far away from downtown Ensenada. About a 45 minute drive. The ocean waves enter a cave under the rocks and a fountain of water spouts out with an enormes force about a  hundred feet away in the middle of a cliff. Do not go to close to the relling otherwise you might get wet ! I heard that there are only 3 places like this one in the world. You might be able to hire a taxi to bring you and wait there to bring you back. I estimate a cost of around US$ 50.00 for the round trip incl. waiting time. Ideal for group of people ! Negotiate your price for the Taxi before you go.\nThere are also plenty of food stalls and a bunch of small shops offering everything a tourist might need.- including a cold beer and soft drinks.

192182432.name: Tourist trap but worth the annoying locals hounding us to buy their goods.
192182432.author: a TripAdvisor user
192182432.reviewBody: Beautiful and oh so much fun! We went with a group of couples and shared lots of laughs getting sprayed by the water. The view is outstanding and very romantic. You just new to get past the locals hounding you.

191101917.name: The blowhole rules!
191101917.author: a TripAdvisor user
191101917.reviewBody: The blowhole itself, La Bufadora, can be spectacular or boring, depending on tides, weather, time of year, phase of the moon, etc.  The stores have some good bargains and it\'s great fun shopping and haggling.  The restaurants aren\'t anything to write home about, but each has its own personality and are worth a visit, if only for a drink.  Particularly recommended are the margaritas at La Bufadora Restaurant.

190772761.name: Nice natural phenomena, hard to reach.
190772761.author: a TripAdvisor user
190772761.reviewBody: After 1 hour bus ride, we arrived at La Bufadora location. You need to walk through 20 minutes of harassing merchants from the local market. This experience could be intimidating as some of them are very insistent\u2026. Once you are at the location itself, it\'s a nice natural phenomena. Once done, you need to walk back through the market. Beware of the roasted nuts, they taste great, but my husband got very sick after eating them.

190317151.name: Great view, great shopping and lots of  tourist
190317151.author: a TripAdvisor user
190317151.reviewBody: The most interesting shopping and  fun  we had in Ensenada was at La Bufadora. The water spout was interesting but the walk towards it was exciting. On both sides of the street, there\nwere at least 100 little shops. The shop owners were giving free samples of their baked goods and food products. Several shops had exotic animals on display as they attempted to lure you in to look at their wares. There were several street musicians playing local music. It was exciting, very colorful and the air was filled with the smell of exotic foods and spices. The smart thing to do is to walk the entire market and check out the prices, so you will know which vendor will give you the best deals. Or you could do as I did and just take in the colors, smells and sounds and buy what ever you like. What a fun and safe place to go shopping.

190171268.name: Nice for a Time or Two
190171268.author: a TripAdvisor user
190171268.reviewBody: The Blow Hole is  fun to see a time or two, and I have taken friends who have not travelled to this area here for years. it is a thing to do, but honestly I have been here too many times and other than the blow hole which does not take a lot of time to see, it is stuff you can find in town.   There are some fun and campy places to eat and shop, but I would not leave Ensenada for them.

189673807.name: Wonderful art of nature.
189673807.author: a TripAdvisor user
189673807.reviewBody: Get a local tide chart. Go when the tide is coming IN for the best view. You want to time it midway between low tide and high tide. Not too high as it chokes and the blast isn\'t as powerful. You can drive past all the people telling you to pull in to their parking areas. Head almost as far as you can, and you can park below the restaurants on the left for $2 or in the public parking. Again, drive past all the vendors telling you to pull over. You can access this with a wheelchair. You will have to walk a couple hundred yards or so to see it. It can\'t be seen from the road.

189177608.name: Ok
189177608.author: a TripAdvisor user
189177608.reviewBody: We went here with an excursion offered by the cruise line. Long drive it is pretty once you are out of the run down town and on the costal highway. It was crowded and people tended to hog the railings. I did enjoy the view and we saw some whales as well. Beware that they charge for the restroom. It would have been nice of the tour guide to tell you this. There is a marketplace with lots of shops and the churro was good.

188784526.name: La Bufadora
188784526.author: a TripAdvisor user
188784526.reviewBody: We drove from Ensenada to La Bufadora in just under an hour.  The drive was lovely, with wonderful ocean views.  The blowhole itself is just amazing to watch - we went in December and saw several whales far out on the ocean as well.  Lots of little shops line the entrance to La Bufadora, and we had some good tacos at a stand there.

188071411.name: Neat attraction with lots of shopping
188071411.author: a TripAdvisor user
188071411.reviewBody: Visited La Bufadora during our Carnival cruise in December.  The blowhole is about 45 minutes from the port and only costs about 20 bucks to visit.  The guide is very friendly and enthusiastic and answered any questions you may have\nThere are only 3 of these types of natural formations in the world so this is something to see.  There is also a ton of shopping around La Bufadora from leather bags to T shirts, churros to rattlesnake tequila, and everything in between.  \nOne of the best attractions in the market by the blowhole is the nature preservation booth that houses baby animals.  During the time we were there, they had a lion cub named Pancho.  25 dollars gets two people the opportunity to hold him and take pictures.  All of the money goes toward the nature preserve where the animals are born and kept as adults so this is a worthwhile cause and a one of a kind experience.

187837277.name: TERRIFIC VIEW AND THEY TAKE VISA
187837277.author: a TripAdvisor user
187837277.reviewBody: The water spout is visited by a scenic ride around the bay in Ensenada. This route leaves you with a good understanding of life in Mexico (at least in this area).Nothing notable to add in the "gift" shops you pass through (200 yards) in the walk to the spout. If you purchase, offer at least 60 % less than asking price. Be advised, 50 cents to use the washroom.

187458463.name: Depressing
187458463.author: a TripAdvisor user
187458463.reviewBody:
We visited in Nov. 2013 as an excursion with our Sapphire Princess cruise ship.  Luckily for us, we were driven in the local baseball team's very clean and comfy bus, that was the positive of our experience.

The ride from Ensenada to the blowhole area is long, at least an hour and the areas you drive through are very rundown, some town, some rural but this is not a lush tropical paradise in any way and there is visible saddening poverty.  Like most people, we know this isn't the worst povety the world has to show but we also don't think we're alone in not wanting to spend thousands of dollars on a vacation in order to visit those environments.

The La Bufadora Blowhole immediate area has been converted into a little marketplace.  There's a dirt compound for buses and cars to park and then people must walk down the center of stalls lining each side filled with everything you can think of.  There are foods being cooked, packaged foods, bar counters and lots of clothing and leather crafts.  If you like shopping, the prices here were the best we'd seen out of the stops at Puerto Vallarta and Cabo San Lucas where everything seemed the same as in the US.

Most of the vendor stalls have temporary housing built to the back of them for the people selling to live so you will see a lot of garbage strewn.  We were told the whole marketplace is owned by one guy who leases these shacks and items to people to sell.  Apparently it's his racket.

We wouldn't advise anyone pay to go to La Bufadora.

187407980.name: Cool sight, but SUPER touristy
187407980.author: a TripAdvisor user
187407980.reviewBody: I get it. Tourist attractions are touristy. And they\'re usually popular b/c they\'re cool. I also get that this is one of the few/largest blow holes in the world. It\'s fun to watch (especially at high tide, or maybe only at high tide? Wouldn\'t know b/c we didn\'t stick around until low tide to find out if it was any good then) but you\'ll walk through a very long gauntlet of shops and people hocking their wares. If you stumbled on it organically, it\'d be really impressive and worth telling friends about. Considering it\'s SUCH a tourist stop though (at least when we were there), it kind of loses its appeal. And I get the slight hypocrisy in this, but those are my thoughts. On the plus side it\'s free (though we did pay a few bucks to park nearby). Maybe try a random Tuesday in November :)

186080328.name: Umpteenth visit- but still love it.
186080328.author: a TripAdvisor user
186080328.reviewBody: The best time to go is just as  high tide comes in- a very unique experience! We retired in Ensenada about 25 years ago and still enjoy a visit to the Bufadora. The view from the  "end of the bay" is really spectacular and the seafood  is excellent\' I love sitting outside with a drink, some food and  the incredible view.

186066739.name: Much more worthwhile than I had thought
186066739.author: a TripAdvisor user
186066739.reviewBody:
Our weekend cruise stopped in Ensenada and my first inclination was just to stay on the ship. I have been to Mexico several times and thought there wasn't much more to see. But the ship's excursion wasn't that expensive, so we decided to take a chance. 

I was so wrong!!!

First of all our guide - Belen - was outstanding. She has a great pride in her country and is very knowledgeable about its history and especially her city of Ensenada. Our first stop was La Bufadora. While I have seen blow holes before, it was the shops, surroundings and people that made this special. I would definately recommend going to La Bufadora and if you are lucky enough to have a guide like Belen, it will be extra special.

185875227.name: only a few on the world a must see...
185875227.author: a TripAdvisor user
185875227.reviewBody: a must see place, onlya  few over the whole world.\nthere is good food and drinks and you can see the blowhole for free, theres some fee parking and free parking.

185851476.name: Don\'t miss La Bufadora - Best seen at hight tide!
185851476.author: a TripAdvisor user
185851476.reviewBody: One of a few blowholes in the world.  It is a short drive from Ensenada.  Lots of shops and restaurants in the area.  This is a "must see" if you are in the Ensenada area.  The best time to view is at high tide, and if there is a surge in the ocean, so much the better.  I live near it and always take company to enjoy it.  There is a small charge for parking.

185583540.name: Like seeing the world\'s largest ball of string - meh!
185583540.author: a TripAdvisor user
185583540.reviewBody:
Like most of the reviews here, I agree that it wasn't much.  Perhaps if you go when the tide is coming in, it's more spectacular.  We waited for 30 minutes or so (hey, we rode a 4-wheel ATV 26 miles to see this thing! Rent a car, NOT an ATV!) it only had a few good snorts and with lots of mist.  No geyser.
The view of the ocean along the way was beautiful, so stopping for a few minutes to take some pictures will be worth your time.
As for the many vendors lining the way to La Bufadora, one summed that experience up the best.  "Hey, come to our shop!  We rip you off for less!"  Don't pay the asking price, they expect you to dicker.
Oh, and they charge you for the use of the filthy restrooms there, as well as parking.  If you must use one, try to use one in one of the two big restaurants.  They were decent and free if you ate.
I can't remember the name of the restaurant we ate at, but it had a "monkeys in trees" decor.  It was really very good and we shared the "giant burrito" and it was more than enough.
Overall, it's one of those places that may be worth visiting once.  Maybe!

185162905.name: Hardly Worth the Trip
185162905.author: a TripAdvisor user
185162905.reviewBody:
Hey, it's Mexico. Whad'ya expect? I could understand why it is named after a buffalo - I happened to catch one good blow during my ten minute wait and it did indeed sounded like a buffalo snorting. But I think you need extraordinary conditions to see a geyser of water come through the hole.

There is a gauntlet of vendors along the 500 feet of road you must walk between parking and the attraction. They weren't too pushy, but they were definitely motivated salespeople. Parking costs 25 pesos or $2.50 no matter where you decide to park. So you might as well drive as far down the hill as you can, unless you don't want to miss any shops. There is a public restroom right at the attraction. As I remember, you could roll a wheelchair within sight of the attraction - as far as the restrooms, but there is a steep flight of stairs at the very end to get down to the rim of the blow hole. 

There are a couple nicer restaurants with ocean views at the bottom end parking. But we were told by an American expat in Punta Banda that the only place to get good food is La Bufadora Cafe, on the north side of the road at the very top of the hill. We didn't heed the advice and ended up getting average, cheap seafood tacos at the little cafe at the top of the hill, on the south side of the road, with a commanding view of the ocean. It was fine. The people were friendly, courteous and eager to please. It was clean. The food was fresh.

The blow hole would definitely be more entertaining after 2-3 beers.

184984556.name: La Bufadora is spanish for "disappointing"
184984556.author: a TripAdvisor user
184984556.reviewBody: A natural marine blow hole that requires a one hour ride on bumpy dirt roads.  The blow hole is minimal - told it blows up to 20 meters, not while I was there.  The bus drops off visitors at the start of an outdoor market filled with aggressive vendors who want your money and your precious vacation time.  There are a few places to eat.  The taco stand at the entrance of the market is good, clean and friendly.  Be prepared to pay to use the restrooms.  50 cents American per use of the facilities.  There are some larger restaurants in the market area which will allow free use of restrooms if you are dining there.  Be prepared - bring lots of small bills if you are planning on shopping and the aggressive guides at the blow hole who insist on a tip.

184781094.name: Great place to visit
184781094.author: a TripAdvisor user
184781094.reviewBody: the Bufadora is a natural blow hole. It has a flea market type atmosphere with a lot of good food and shopping. A great experience. We go every year just for the almejas asadas (grilled clams in their shell).

184610388.name: Blow Hole Tour Blowed
184610388.author: a TripAdvisor user
184610388.reviewBody:
Our 'tour' turned into a scene out of a Robert Rodriquez or Rob Zombie movie...I'll get to that,,,,,but...
First, the ride: You go thru areas where there are no roads, or the road is half there. Dusty, bumpy, and not scenic at all. Almost one of hour of nothing,,,no stops nothing.
Nothing to learn here, be on your way...

Once you get to the Blow Hole area, you have to run a gauntlet of rude, loud vendor Mexican men, yelling at you trying to get you to buy. In my case, since I am African-American, I got rude references such as, "I habe big size for black ladies", or, "sistah!  sistah!" and "my queen".
No thanks. 
Then, the nightmare: as the suns sets, shops close and every bus has left, we get on our bus and start to leave. The drivers finds out we have NO HEADLIGHTS. NONE. And we are in the middle of nowhere and have to go back down a mountain-side IN COMPLETE DARK.
Needless to say, it was a nerve wrecking experience.
About halfway back, we had a another bus meet us and got a ride with that bus back to the ship.
This company & excursion was thru Carnival cruises, and was totally irresponsible for our safety in not checking the bus to make sure everything was in complete working order......save your money on a 15 minute experience, (or in our case, and hour and a half  nightmare!).

184607628.name: Neat Experience
184607628.author: a TripAdvisor user
184607628.reviewBody: The blow hole is pretty awesome! It can catch you off guard if you\'re not careful. There are lots of vendors and shops around if you are interested in shopping or eating as well!

184537360.name: la bufadora is amazing
184537360.author: a TripAdvisor user
184537360.reviewBody: was beautiful at sunset. its part of the kumeyaay creation story and is very special to them so don\'t litter! didn\'t like the lion cub in the cage

182636731.name: If you\'re in Ensenada why not go shopping for a bit?
182636731.author: a TripAdvisor user
182636731.reviewBody:
It's not the prettiest thing you'll encounter and they hype it a bit, however they it's worth doing at least once in your lifetime. There are vendors and they aren't as cheap as one would hope for however they have these guys that do paint plates and they do an amazing job and they are only $8 or $5 bucks depending on the size you get.
The candy stands are great, the pastries are good and the fresh fruit is amazing. Get some souvenirs while you're there and see the blow hole.

It does take about 45min ride from the downtown area where the cruise shuttle drops you off at. It costs about $15 per person but it's ok.

Get the pomegranate it's AMAZING IN MEXICO.  

If you're afraid of people then this is not the place for you but if you're not afraid of people asking for a sale then you will be great.

182016494.name: La Bufadora
182016494.author: a TripAdvisor user
182016494.reviewBody: The views travelling to La Bufadora was amazing. The blow hole was awesome. Remember when parking, it is $2.00 american and not pesos.\nBeware of walking down to the blow hole as tremendous amount of TJ type vendors.

181859261.name: Open air souvenir market and la bufadora
181859261.author: a TripAdvisor user
181859261.reviewBody: Very pushy vendors that you must walk through to see La Bufadora.   Would have been extremely disappointed to pay a tour price for this visit. Took a van taxi for $15/person.  Long drive and very bumpy due to construction.  La Bufadora interesting, but not worth the hype.  My husband is very uncomfortable with the vendors constantly approaching and touching him, however felt safe overall.  Able to get a few souvenirs, just be ready to haggle!

181205992.name: Spectacular Ocean view
181205992.author: a TripAdvisor user
181205992.reviewBody: This is a unique place and is a blow hole where the ocean is like a guiser.  Fun little Mexican town.  some good places to eat.

181072102.name: Over-rated tourist trap
181072102.author: a TripAdvisor user
181072102.reviewBody: If you\'ve been to any ocean coast anywhere in the world, this will not impress you.  Not worth the drive or the tourist trap gauntlet leading up to it.\n\nNicht sehenswurdig.  Mann sollte hier nicht kommen, wenn man der See vor jetzt gesehen hat.

181020691.name: It was OK, nothing out of the ordinary
181020691.author: a TripAdvisor user
181020691.reviewBody: It\'s not far from downtown Ensenada, but the construction that is going on makes it a long trip. The ocean view and the blow hole were nice to watch, but the shops with expensive Chinese merchandise it\'s a little bit sad to watch as I was expecting to find Mexican souvenirs instead.

180945360.name: Should see it but few things to be aware of
180945360.author: a TripAdvisor user
180945360.reviewBody:
We were on a cruise ship that took us here via tour Oct 11. 
It was a fairly long bus ride from ship to site - they are rebuilding highway so long stretches of dirt bumpy roads to contend with to get there and back. 
The ocean display of water shooting up is something to see, it was happening roughly every 30 - 45 seconds and some of water shot pretty high accompanied by a roaring sound and a nice rainbow as a result - nice photo Ops.
We didn't like the walk through the vendor area to get to the blowhole and back to the bus. Kinda felt like we were thrown to the wolves a bit. We have been to Mexico 9 times now and are familiar with what to do: Try not to make eye contact (sun glasses help) don't wear a hat that has Canada or wherever you are from on it, try to walk in the middle of a group and not by yourself ( there is safety in numbers) we found by walking towards back of group you get ignored as they are trying to engage folks at front or on sides of group. Just look down at ground smile and say no thank you and they will leave you alone for the most part. 
I think even with the annoyance of the vendors (they got to make a living - they just don't get that if they were less pushy, more folks might actually go in an shop) it is worth the trip. P.s. Use the bus bathrooms as the locals charge .50 for restroom unless you eat at certain places. The food place next to OXXO where busses park has amazing beef tacos.

180744489.name: Beautiful but was it worth the drive?
180744489.author: a TripAdvisor user
180744489.reviewBody:
The drive here is long and bumpy due to all the construction going on. Makes for a horrible drive. 

The walk through all the shops with shop keeps trying to get your attention gets extremely annoying. I mean, they ALL SELL THE SAME THINGS! 

The Bufadora was soothing, the sounds and watching the water spray were relaxing! I would definitely like to see it again, but I'll wait until all the road construction enroute is complete.

180689011.name: ho hum, and pushy vendors
180689011.author: a TripAdvisor user
180689011.reviewBody:
It's a long bus ride fro the cruise port to this attraction, and then a long walk to the blood hole site.  You can expect to be constantly barragedby street vendors pushing their Made in China junk on you.  

Instead, opt for the Winery tours in the beautiful country side, or even the downtown shore tour to take in a lunch.

180616481.name: Short Visit to La Bufadora
180616481.author: a TripAdvisor user
180616481.reviewBody: You should plan your trip accordingly and early to avoid vendors and parking issues. It\'s just another site you visit when on vacation to say you\'ve been there. I went deep sea fishing with my son in law and my wife and daughter along with grandkids went to La Bufadora and was very exciting for them. There are shops and some really good fish tacos to eat before you leave to your next site seeing place. If all else you can venture into the small towns and visit with the local and stop for a drink or two and give some dollars to the local community. Always ask where to go next or hot spots from the local. Be surprise sometime what they come up with. Your on vacation take everything in stride but most importantly have fun!

180494439.name: Not worth the trip.
180494439.author: a TripAdvisor user
180494439.reviewBody: A set of traffic lights would be more interesting. toughts are just to much, letting you pass down the street then get you on the way back. Best thing is the rusty Buick on the coach park,  it makes a good picture.

180275842.name: Boring!
180275842.author: a TripAdvisor user
180275842.reviewBody:
Boring! Boring! Boring!

Water shooting up out of some rocks about 20-30 feet...ZZZzzz...

I don't get what all the excitement was about...I was more excited about getting a Corona from one of the bars nearby. 

Surrounded by tourist shops, tourist restaurants and children begging for money or trying to sell gum.

180231289.name: La bufadora rocks!
180231289.author: a TripAdvisor user
180231289.reviewBody: So there isn\'t much to do in Ensenada for a quick day visit other than drink and party.  The cruise lines charge $30+ so a group of five of us walked into town and spotted a van taxi.  We negotiated a great price of $12 each.  Our driver Manuel was super nice, he took us and waited for us while we walked to the blowhole.  The road there is a bit rough right now, they are re paving the road so it takes extra time to get there.  If you get lucky you can be there on a clear day.  Beautiful view for sure!  There are a number of food stands and shops to negotiate a souvenir from.  Never ever take the first # thrown at you always walk away! I guarantee a 75% discount.  If you like fish the tacos are a must, super fresh ingredients abound.  I think Ensenada gets a bad rap being it\'s considered a border town.  I would like to go back for a longer visit.  Go to La Bufadora, it\'s an interesting sight to see.

179393140.name: A must
179393140.author: a TripAdvisor user
179393140.reviewBody: Very nice spot! The way from Ensenada to La Bufadora is very enjoyable. I would recommend to stop for tamales on the street!!!

179287563.name: This hole blows!  (in a good way!)
179287563.author: a TripAdvisor user
179287563.reviewBody: Best Tacos at the very beginning of the shops.  BEST. PERIOD.\nNever a bad view of the water blowing up.  An amazing natural wonder.  Been twice.

176826693.name: Hard to get to, and a little disappointing, but interesting
176826693.author: a TripAdvisor user
176826693.reviewBody: The road to La Bufadora is very challenging - about 55% of the time you are on a very bumpy dirt road that does not bode well for your car\'s suspension.  It takes about an hour to get there because of this.  Once you arrive, you have to work at getting past the street vendors to see the actual blow hole.  It is nice and refreshing on a warm day, but make sure you check the tide before you make the long trek (it is active only a high tide).  Thankfully, we got to see it in full action, got sprayed by the mist, and were able to cool off after a long dusty ride, but it seems like a lot of work for such a small pay-off.  Also, keep in mind that the  tide pools are very dirty appearing and you must pay to use the restroom facilities (not much, but you should be prepared).

175811291.name: Stop at La Bufadora
175811291.author: a TripAdvisor user
175811291.reviewBody: If you are driving the Baja, you may be tempted to drive on past the Ensenada area, but if you can spare the time, stop and see La Bufadora, the blowhole, just south of Ensenada.  You will have to drive about 20km on a partially paves road ( construction) but the view of the bay is amazing.   Drive all the way to the end.  Park ($2) and walk past the annoyingly touristy hawker stands, all the way to the end where you can watch water spout up from the rocks.   May sound silly, but it was a nice break, and the view was worth the drive.   Once the coda is complete, it will be much easier and faster.   Stop for a Corona at the restaurant deck overlooking the ocean ( about half way on your walk to/from.

175638343.name: Pretty cool!
175638343.author: a TripAdvisor user
175638343.reviewBody: I believe there are only five blowholes in the world and when you\'re standing right in front of one it\'s pretty amazing. The views from the Bufadora are gorgeous and there are some good buys to be had if you know how to haggle. The food is kid of touristy so if you\'re looking for a dining experience the restaurants at the Bufadora is NOT what you want.

175492091.name: Go when you know it\'s high tide
175492091.author: a TripAdvisor user
175492091.reviewBody:
Everything is great! 
By the time you get to the actual blow hole "bufadora" you have had margaritas, sweet mexican bread, churros, mexican candy, sugared almonds, taken a picture with real lions, elotes (corn on the cob) etc, etc, etc... so make sure it's HIGH TIDE or all of the above will have been in vain, no blowing! no pictures with the water!! and get back to the car as dry as you got there.

But all the goodies will be worth the trip, and believe me, you won't get sick!

174656290.name: Touring
174656290.author: a TripAdvisor user
174656290.reviewBody: A nice stroll, many places to eat, or if you are in the mood for a snack there are nuts and candy shops, corn on the cob, churros and prepared fresh fruit. I don\'t like that it is so commercialized now. Too many shops. If you are into buying souvenirs it\'s great.

174528824.name: Fun, fun, fun
174528824.author: a TripAdvisor user
174528824.reviewBody: I heard La Bufadora is one of the world\'s largest blowhole. I heard some days, it shoots up very high. When we went, it may not have  been very high as people say, but was good enough and worth our 40 minute drive. The shops in Bufadora are busiest on Wed and Saturdays (cruises dock on these days) but I loved how I was able to spend time bargaining with the vendors because it wasn\'t busy. I think it was worth looking for a taxi to come here. I enjoyed the scenery coming up. True glance of Ensenada/

174015880.name: Fun
174015880.author: a TripAdvisor user
174015880.reviewBody: I loved the grilled open giant clams with cheese that you can eat on the way down to bufadora. Children love this place and the drive these is serene.

172502653.name: Go if your on a tour.
172502653.author: a TripAdvisor user
172502653.reviewBody: This part of our tour from the cruise we had just done visiting Hawaii. Think it was about an hour bus ride to here. Very interesting place.

169826812.name: well worth driving to
169826812.author: a TripAdvisor user
169826812.reviewBody: doximom2 said it perfectly well,please read that.Also park at the very end of the road to bypass most vendors.,avoid the lots in the beginning as you will have to "fight off" all the street vendors\nwalking past them.

169679757.name: Awesome!
169679757.author: a TripAdvisor user
169679757.reviewBody: La Bufadora (the blowhole) is awesome.  Best to find out when it\'ll be high tide and go then.  The shop keepers on the way to the blowhole can be somewhat obnoxious - ignore them unless you really see something you want to buy.  The restaurants are ok - splendid views, mediocre food.  I actually live about 7 miles from this attraction and visit occasionally.

169251537.name: Nice little area for shopping and seeing the hole
169251537.author: a TripAdvisor user
169251537.reviewBody: Sort of hard to get to because working on road. Little shops lining the street and several nice restaurants to eat at with beautiful ocean view.

168934519.name: Go at high tide
168934519.author: a TripAdvisor user
168934519.reviewBody: Go at high tide or you could be a little disappointed. lots of shopping. a few sit down type restaurants others are stands. i like the grilled giant clams and the candied peanuts and almonds.parking is 2 dollars.

167736171.name: Kayaking to La Bufadora
167736171.author: a TripAdvisor user
167736171.reviewBody: This was an excursion off the Carnival Cruise Ship Inspiration.  I don\'t know if you can arrange to go independently of the Cruise, but I highly recommend seeing La Bufadora from the water.  The view is amazing.  There is some strenuous paddling needed to get to the cove where "La Bufadora" is, but it\'s all worth it!!  We even got to see jellyfish and other little sea creatures.

167689227.name: fascinating natural wonder!
167689227.author: a TripAdvisor user
167689227.reviewBody: we came beach camping and drove up to La Bufadora.  The weather was great and the Bufadora was wonderful to look at and experience.  The kids loved standing in the farthest corner (splash zone) and got totally soaked.  We all enjoyed the experience and took video and great shots of the ocean spray.  The vendors didn\'t bother us much as we all speak Spanish and a simple "No thank you" backed them off.  We purchased some fresh made "gorditas" and cheese bread and they were awesome.  If you\'re looking for cheap, try the "Mercado Negro" in downtown Ensenada.

167354065.name: Beautiful sights and delightful trinkets!
167354065.author: a TripAdvisor user
167354065.reviewBody: T-shirts, candy, pina coladas, fish tacos, you name it! You\'ll find it all here while you enjoy this free attraction that will get you wet while you watch the ocean. It\'s quite off the city but it\'s worth the visit, be ready to lunch or shop in here.

166745188.name: Worth Seeing Once
166745188.author: a TripAdvisor user
166745188.reviewBody: I went on a cruise that went to Ensenada, and going to La Bufadora was one of the excursion choices - So we went. \nIf you enjoy shopping, then you\'ll probably really enjoy it. The blowhole itself is a little cool, but I probably won\'t go back, mostly because of the shopping and crowds,

166548698.name: Over "Blown", but worth the visit
166548698.author: a TripAdvisor user
166548698.reviewBody: Okay, if you are familiar with Mexico "Shopping" then it more of the same things over and over again. I would give 3 stars, but the trip over was pretty scenic and the bluff where picturesque. so I added a star. If you are in Ensenada, then this is a must visit. Parking is 2 dollars and everything is "almost free"

166500856.name: Ugh. Not worth the drive
166500856.author: a TripAdvisor user
166500856.reviewBody: An hour of bumpy roads from Ensenada only to arrive in a touristy "town" leading to La Bufadora, which is concreted on all sides and painted and looks rundown. The natural beauty is pretty much masked by all the things going on around it. Skip it.

166086142.name: It\'s, it\'s, it\'s...
166086142.author: a TripAdvisor user
166086142.reviewBody: not that amazing. The drive there while staying in Ensenada was nice, but don\'t think it\'s a must see. There\'re restaurants near and along the way but, basically an over-rated phenomenon that is not that phenomenal. If you do get the chance to visit Ensenada though, I highly recommend spending a few days there. The town has many small bars, cafes, and interesting shops. There\'re many street vendors who sell interesting things. We stayed at the TraveLodge and it was a good value. Visited on the recommendation of a friend but that was back in the 80\'s and things may have changed somewhat even though BC Mexico is not that progressive. Went there when on a west coast vac. as a side trip leaving San Diego. Check it out if in Ensenada but don\'t make the blowhole your priority.

165346439.name: Great attraction!
165346439.author: a TripAdvisor user
165346439.reviewBody: The scenery is great! Outside the bufadora there is like a little market where you can buy handcrafts, food and even drinks.

165232642.name: La Bufadora
165232642.author: a TripAdvisor user
165232642.reviewBody: To us the actual attraction was just okay. The drive from Ensenada and the little shops were more interesting.

164521049.name: Great If You Like Tourist Traps
164521049.author: a TripAdvisor user
164521049.reviewBody: The hole does blow but save your time and money if you see small ocean waves breaking on your way from Tijuana. With small waves no action at all. Divert to the Guadalupe Valley on Mex 3 going to Tecate instead. Visit the wineries.

162221229.name: Great 1 hour attraction
162221229.author: a TripAdvisor user
162221229.reviewBody: Being raised on the beach from California, I thought the blow hole was what I expected - water shooting up when the waves hit the rocks. It is a must see when you visit Ensenada but after 15 minutes you\'re done. Now the street vendors were a site to see and experience. I love crowds and vendors so it was nice talking with and seeing the different shops. This area is very safe. The people friendly and funny. We bought a plate painted by hand from a lady at the blow hole entrance - $8. We arrived by cruise ship Inspiration on May 18. We did the horseback riding first (9am) and then the host Miguel lined up 2 taxis for $15 per person to ride to La Bufadora - half the price of the cruise ship. We also had the taxi stop by the free beach for a few minutes and then back to the ship. It was May and the weather was 70 so no swimming.

160126030.name: Boring
160126030.author: a TripAdvisor user
160126030.reviewBody: La Bufadora is boring, especially at low tide. If you HAVE to go see this have a fish taco at the stand up the hill - best in the world.

159043202.name: Must See for Every Visitor
159043202.author: a TripAdvisor user
159043202.reviewBody:
You must try the fish or shrimp tacos at the end of the open market closest to the blow hole.  They are legit and super yummy. They also bake these giant clams right on the grill that are seriously the best thing I may have ever eaten. The public restrooms cost $0.50 to use, however if you are at Habana Banana you can use their restrooms for free.  I've never eaten there so I'm not sure about the food - I usually just eat at the little place at the end.    

The vendors, while quite pushy, are good natured and funny and will usually accept "No Thank You" as you keep walking.  If you see something you like - keep walking because you might see the same thing further down the walk for a cheaper price.

This may not be a good place for small children because they could become easily overwhelmed with all the activity.  If you're going only for the blow hole, be sure to come when the tide is high or you may not think it's worth it.

158118271.name: Tourist trap!
158118271.author: a TripAdvisor user
158118271.reviewBody: Sure, it is a nice sight to behold, for five minutes at the very most. Everything else is are just restaurants and stores. A real tourist trap.\n\nI came here by a cruise and really regretted not doing the other activities that were more fun.

157344334.name: Over hyped.
157344334.author: a TripAdvisor user
157344334.reviewBody: Horrible, over hyped, dirty and full of smells. It is a traditional place though that you have to visit once in your life.

157133324.name: love this town
157133324.author: a TripAdvisor user
157133324.reviewBody: i love the local shops and stores. personally i have been retreating to this city for the last 16 ;years and would recommend it to everyone....very friendly as well as English speaking merchant who love to satisfy guests as well as get you the best deal when purchasing from the markets...make sure you barter...they respect it and also love to have the conversation

156982316.name: Great Day at La Bufadora & Awesome Fish Tacos
156982316.author: a TripAdvisor user
156982316.reviewBody:
We toured this blow hole on a shore excursion from the Sapphire Princess cruise ship.  What a great day!  It is just amazing to stand and watch the water simply explode!  The scenery is stunning too.  Our guide told us there were only three blowholes like this in the world - one in Maui, and another in Australia.  

 There are lots of venders along both sides of the path going to the blow hole, but you can easily just smile and say no thank you if you are not interested and you don't have to walk into their shops.  Our guide recommended "The Leather House" if we were interested in silver jewelry, as they carried .925 pieces.  Very lovely things.  I purchased several pieces and had fun bargaining with them.  They were very nice and rather funny.  

Don't pass up the FISH TACOS!  We ate at the little shop close to the bus parking and they were incredible!  Only $1.50 too.  Great people as well.  One more thing, the bathrooms cost 50 cents because they have to truck water out there, but I figured it was helping out the attendants.

156637955.name: never get tried of that amazing blow hole
156637955.author: a TripAdvisor user
156637955.reviewBody: Just got back from my quick Ensenada spring break trip and had to make a trip to the blow hole and flea market. the blow hole experience is so much fun, I never get tried of seeing the water explode from the blow hole. Also the flea market is better than ever with lots of food and drink choices.

156034667.name: Worth a trip once
156034667.author: a TripAdvisor user
156034667.reviewBody: Watch out for the Viagra sales man! The set up is you walk past an alley of things for sale & when we went a man was dressed up like a big blue pill with an erection trying to sell viagra to tourists.

155902631.name: Beautiful!
155902631.author: a TripAdvisor user
155902631.reviewBody: We sat outside, ate tacos, and had the perfect view of the Ocean! Kodiak Moment! If your going to Ensenada, you must go to La Bufadora.

155650195.name: Great if tide right
155650195.author: a TripAdvisor user
155650195.reviewBody: Great height of the wave and noise if the tide is incoming.\nLoud music blaring from bars (in the am even) takes away\nfrom experience.  Vendors are hurting there if your a shopper.

155460922.name: The blow hole blows
155460922.author: a TripAdvisor user
155460922.reviewBody: The blow hole was beautiful. There are no free bathrooms. You have to pay to use them. To get to the blow hole you have to walk through a gauntlet of aggressive vendors yelling at you, trying to get you in their stores. Our whole group felt very intimidated. Our tour guide suggested Habana Banana so we stopped there for lunch. I got a taco plate. It consisted of 3 each dried pork in corn tortillas, (NO cheese, cilantro, onions, tomatoes, sour cream just pork jerky and tortillas), a spoonful of bright orange rice (no flavor), and about a 1/2 cup of beans. Cost 13.00 US. A lunch for 4 people with no alcoholic drinks cost us $ 72.00 US. They also added a 15% tip to the bill but the service was the worst. Our tour guide talked about the history of the US stealing California because we bought it so cheap from the Mexican government. She went on to talk about how we stole Texas from Mexico. She did a good job of telling us which vendors to buy from. The bus driver passed a vehicle on a winding road where you could not see around the bend and to the right was a 300 foot drop off. I think the whole bus load of passengers were freaked out by that maneuver. I would not ever do the Blow Hole tour again and do not recommend it. Carnival should remove it from their shore excursions list.

155212871.name: Touristy but do it at least once.
155212871.author: a TripAdvisor user
155212871.reviewBody:
If you're docking in Ensenada on the Carnival Cruise or have never been to La Bufadora check it out. I thought it was the coolest little market village before time spoiled it down a peg.

Yes there are pharmacies there that will sell you anything. That is both a pro and con. The clam guy slicing and grilling right by the blow hole is the secret find. Cheese and bread crumbs on top it's possibly the best thing in the world. I had about 5.

The shopping is really no better than anywhere else in Ensenada or Tijuana for that matter but it was built around the natural wonder which is a cool thing to see. You don't need more than an hour there -- especially if you're not eating. 

Parking is easy, bathrooms are NOT.

155175214.name: Enjoyable
155175214.author: a TripAdvisor user
155175214.reviewBody: The blow hole is great. you have to walk through a line of vendors trying to get you in their stores. very cool experience.....just know this is how they make a living.

154570424.name: Great natural show!
154570424.author: a TripAdvisor user
154570424.reviewBody: I think this is one in a life time experience, there are very few places where you can find this natural phenomenon! The way to La Bufadora is very entertaining it is like a Mexican fair where you can purchase diverse mexican articles and candies. Definitely a must in Ensenada

153574031.name: La Bufadora - go or no go and how to get there for a low cost
153574031.author: a TripAdvisor user
153574031.reviewBody:
Ok, your in Ensenada - either via a cruise or a relaxing weekend.  You have heard about the La Bufadora.  Historically, everyone goes there once for themselves then again with kids.  Its neat, it wet, and its interesting.  My understanding is that there are only a few in the world.

You will go either on a tour bus, cab, local bus or rental car.  Tour Bus or Cab will be expensive, maybe $ 50 - $ 100 US Dollars.  If you speak a little spanish and have the time, you can take the local busses to it for a few dollars. (dont do this if you are on a cruise). You can rent a car for the day in Ensenada for $ US 70 at Hotel Corona by the beach and cruise line.  Then drive 3-4 people there and have enough time to do other things as well.  Best and lowest cost option for the tourist (rent a car).  To rent you will need DL and Credit card. There are lots of signs and it easy, worst case follow a bus.

Now when you get there, you need to park.  If you came on a bus, thats easy, if not, keep driving until you go UNDER the main entrance.  Ignore the folks trying to get you to park, just park inside the area for around $ 2.00 (same as outside). If you took a cab, ask him to wait, and dont pay until you return to Ensenada.

If you like you can rent a boat ride or ki-yack in the ocean down the hill for around $ 15.  But that's not why you are here.  You will now walk the vendor path from the entrance to the La Bufadora, which means everyone is going try and get your money.  Its the worst part, but sometimes in it there are some gems.  You will need to negotiate, and dont be afraid to walk away.  Best to pick a side and walk as you see fit.  I suggest the Churros and the Pineapple drink as snacks then find a $ 4 hat or t-shirt.  I would not suggest eating here (more on that later).

You will get to the blowhole, you will get wet, you will take some great pictures, maybe even listen to some music and buy some local art.  All in about 20 min after you exit the vendor path to the blowhole.  Now, you are hot and wet, and maybe a little hungry.  Don't go to the 'restaurants' , walk back down the vendor path quickly (other side) and look to the left up the hill just before the exit, maybe near where the bus parked. Look for the fish taco stand (they sell lots of diff tacos).  Buy here. Seriously, its the best and while the lines can be long - its the best food.  It will not make you sick. (or should not).  This is where the locals eat, while you will pay gringo/tourist prices, its still cheap and very good.  So grab some tacos (beef/fish/shrimp) and a pepsi and enjoy your time.

Now that you are done, if you drove, you can drive back - choosing to stop at the variety of stands for some oil, tamales, or other nick nacks. Fruit stands are good as well.  There are a lot of treasures on the way back, and if you went early enough, you can go visit a winery or two.  Just look at the map you got when you rented the car..you did rent a car..otherwise you are on a bus or taxi going back to Ensenada (or another touristy schick). On the way back, look for the riding horses, the 'zebra horse', the art galleries, the bakery, and several other things you can do on the way back.

Oh final thoughts, if you can choose when to go and you are not on a cruise, dont go on Wed or Saturday, or wait on those days until after 3:30pm.  The place is better without the Cruise crowd which goes on Wed and Saturday.

152868857.name: Horrible experience
152868857.author: a TripAdvisor user
152868857.reviewBody: The blow hole was beautiful. Although you have to walk through a big line of vendors trying to get you in their stores. I felt very harrassed. Not a very comfortable experience. Would I ever visit Ensenada again ? NO WAY

152312539.name: SUPER TOURIST TRAP
152312539.author: a TripAdvisor user
152312539.reviewBody: Apart from a wonderful natural sight to see, walking the gauntlet of hawkers trying to sell everything that is cheaply made draws away from the natural reason of seeing La Bufadora, if they would only limit the number of hawkers it would be nicer

150943729.name: Fun
150943729.author: a TripAdvisor user
150943729.reviewBody: really great! nice scenic drive outside of Ensenada. La Bufadora is great to see, and the shops on the road leading to La Bufadora are fun to browse. I suggest getting a Pi\u00f1a Colada with rum while you walk around.\n\nThis could be a half day trip from Ensenada, easily.

149197098.name: La Bufadora, beautiful blow hole
149197098.author: a TripAdvisor user
149197098.reviewBody: Walk down a pedestrian street lined with shops and food outlets to La Bufadora, said to be the largest blow hole in the world. Many tourists. Visiting once in a lifetime is enough. On the day of my visit, my patience with touts was not high. Walking to La Bufadora, you are offered samples of pina coladas and other foods and drinks in hopes you\'ll find the sample so delicous, you\'ll make a purchase. For those who enjoying shopping for bags, scarves, jewelery, 925 silver, vanilla, dresses, t shirts and other tourist "must haves," this is the shopping place for you. US dollars readily accepted. Charge to use most restrooms. The drive from Ensenada takes you through beautiful countryside, once you get past the Walmart, Starbucks, Costco, Applebees shopping areas just outside of town.

147020476.name: La Bufadora ....Blow hole
147020476.author: a TripAdvisor user
147020476.reviewBody: Great blow hole my daughter enjoyed it. We were ther by 12nn and we were told that its high tide and waves doesn\'t get that high. they told us that the best time to go there is early morning or late afternoon when its low tide...there is a market place which is full of cool stuff and the churros, fish and beef tacos are awesome!

146659729.name: A Cool Attraction In Ensenada
146659729.author: a TripAdvisor user
146659729.reviewBody: La Bufadora is basically a huge blow hole in the ocean.  Essentially, the waves crash against the rocks, and the water sprays really high through a hole.  It\'s something cool to see, especially if you have kids.  But don\'t have too big of expectations, because that\'s really all there is to it.  The waves crash and the water sprays up high -- that\'s all.  If you\'re into that sort of thing, then definitely check it out . . .

146485043.name: Experience is worth the drive...ONCE!
146485043.author: a TripAdvisor user
146485043.reviewBody: We recently sailed on Carnival\'s Inspiration for 3 days, our only port was Ensenada.  Instead of taking the shore excursion from the ship we hopped on a shuttle and then paid 1/2 the price with the bus company.  We each recieved a sticker that gave us a free sample margarita at Havana Banana restaurant.  It was FABULOUS food, atmosphere, margaritas.. FUN.  The lobster was HUGE! The vendors selling had the same stuff you see in downtown Ensenada BUT they were open to dealing down the $$.  The Blowhole was really cool and gave us some great pictures, and the view from that area was pretty too!  :)  TAKE quarters for the bathrooms!!!  All in all a fun 1/2 day..and we were back on the boat almost at the same time that the shore excursion trip was leaving, so that was nice also.  P.S. The churros are to DIE for!  :)  Will we go again if a ship stops in Ensenada, probably not, but we were entertained this first time!  Enjoy!

146179895.name: A great natural wonder.
146179895.author: a TripAdvisor user
146179895.reviewBody: Great sea-side views; but the trek past the street vendors is taxing.  Parking is US$2 at the edge of the "commercial zone." Bring a windbreaker if the weather is cool.

145705612.name: Run the Gauntlet
145705612.author: a TripAdvisor user
145705612.reviewBody: You have to walk through about 100 tourist shops to get to the bufadora. Enjoyed the area. The Pi\u00f1a Colada\'s in the pineapple are the best.

143955705.name: kids only
143955705.author: a TripAdvisor user
143955705.reviewBody: Loved it as a kid, now as an adult with my girlfriend it was not worth the crazy drive and onslaught of vendors once there.

142832976.name: Incredibly crowded with tourists
142832976.author: a TripAdvisor user
142832976.reviewBody: Jam packed little alleyway leading up to La Bufadora was teeming with vendors trying to sell people things. Everything cost a fee, from the bathroom to the parking, which was very different from the rest of our experience in Mexico. Only go if you\'ve run out of things to do.

142752683.name: We moved here Started a Bed and Breakfast and enjoy the shops and blowhole every few weeks
142752683.author: a TripAdvisor user
142752683.reviewBody: The first time we came to Bufadora I did not want to go and my wife talked me into it.  But, there were whales with calves in the bay and I we just enjoyed the noise of the crowd and the waterspout.  I had a Coco y Camarone (cocconut with Shrimp and Clamato and mango) and was hooked.  The next time a couple of years later and we actually looked at some propperty behind the bay to the west the little town of and I had the fish taco\'s.  They deep fry the fish, so you might want to remove the greasy breading before building your tacos, but everything is wonderful and fresh.  We ended up staying and have even started a little bed and breakfast you can ask about at the visitor center.  Yes it is a clunky, wonderful place.  Watch the seagulls, look for whales and listen out for the seals barking in the distance and if you can go when the tide is high and the waves are crashing you will enjoy an amazing performance for "The Buf".

142751703.name: Natural water fauntain!
142751703.author: a TripAdvisor user
142751703.reviewBody: Its awesome nature water fountain. Way to get there is little bit scarely(but also u can c nice view). N water fountain is like whales blowing. Its happy time in baja caliponia.

142672964.name: Beautiful drive
142672964.author: a TripAdvisor user
142672964.reviewBody: We drove out our second day there.  I think the drive is more spectacular than the blow hole, but the water was calm and it doesn\'t blow when it\'s calm.  We had lunch and a beer which was good.

142511392.name: no wind
142511392.author: a TripAdvisor user
142511392.reviewBody:
We took the advice from the reviews to stay in the middle and don't make eyes contact. it worked.
It wasn't a lot of people on Oct 7 around 11.30 am. The water didn't shoot up high, local said because there is no wind. i've tried the grill clam, delicious, $4 should be cheaper:) 
a taco for $1, Cup of beer $2, $3 churos but i got $1 off on mango T_T" after all it is tourist area.
For souvenior, there's white t-shirt 2 for $10. If you don't want anything just keep on walking in the middle:)

142325627.name: Great Sightseeing Tour
142325627.author: a TripAdvisor user
142325627.reviewBody: First of to all of those complaining on the vendors, they are just trying to make  a living and you can haggle with them if you really want something. We found some of the best food out there from seafood to tacos, the Bufadora was great for people who say they can\'t see it or only see a sprinkle " WALK UP TO IT AND LOOK OVER THE LITTLE FENCE" its amazing. My only downside to this tour was the distance from Ensenada, a little to far but well worth it as i got a great gift for my brother and picked up some good food and snacks.

139275079.name: great place.
139275079.author: a TripAdvisor user
139275079.reviewBody: Great Place to go. i went when they barely started to open their shops. its the best time because you don\'t have to wait for the crowds. i was lucky enough to go when the ocean current was pretty strong. i went towards the end of January. so the bluff was pretty strong. and yes the vendors are more cheap there because some people wait until they cross the border to buy stuff. i bought a purse/bag for my daughter and a zarape for myself, i only paid $15 american dollars. i went to the border and asked for the same things. they wanted $20 for the zarape and $10 for the purse/bag, what a ripoff. and i recommend buying the pickled chilis they sell on your way up. if you like spicy i would diffidently get them.

138817085.name: Gauntlet of vendors
138817085.author: a TripAdvisor user
138817085.reviewBody: You have to go through 1/2 a mile of street vendors on both sides to see the blow hole...at the blow hole there is a place to take pictures with Baby Tiger and Lions for $25, $35 for both at the same time, the sign states that they are saving the animals..don\'t know how true that is, but the baby cubs was annoyed...

138189727.name: It is what it is, don\u00b4t expect more
138189727.author: a TripAdvisor user
138189727.reviewBody:
La bufadora is a blowhole and that's it: a huge and natural spurt of water; it's nice to feel the gentle breeze and also to hear the sound as it comes up.

As a mexican I must say the truth: It is a place for foreign and national turism and the people of the flea market are desperate to sell something... If you have travelled around México, you will be used to the situation, if you are not, you might feel overwhelmed.

Yes, you have to walk across the flea market and people will come close to you trying to sell anything. You just have to pay no attention to them and DON´T TALK TO THEM, just walk by, take a free sample of Piña Colada and admire the "desert roses" as I called them :)

Enjoy!

PS. Prices here are higher than Downtown Ensenada. You can try to bargain over but you won't get a good deal. I wanted a colorful backpack, at la bufadora prices were between 150-120 pesos. At downtown I got it from a woman selling on the street for 90 pesos.

137098638.name: you have to visit these place
137098638.author: a TripAdvisor user
137098638.reviewBody: it is crowed on holydays, saturday and sundays, if you can avoid that is much better, you can walk all way  down  the stears and enjoy this natural wonder.

136903251.name: hahahaha
136903251.author: a TripAdvisor user
