136903251.reviewBody: is a joke,  the food here is no good at all,  you only have to eat here because you come for the scenery of the blow hole

136336007.name: Blow Hole Sights
136336007.author: a TripAdvisor user
136336007.reviewBody: This is beautiful to see, but be prepared to wiggle your way to the rock wall to look over to see. It was very busy and hard to get good pictures without someone walking in your way or pushing you along. The street vendors were very Very aggressive and became a little uncomfortable as we made our way back to the bus....I just tucked my head and kept walking quickly. On the few places I stopped to look at something, I found them WAY OVER PRICED. Like $55 for a T shirt- I think not...I go to Rocky Point, Mexico often and usually get the same stuff for $8-15....Another tried to sell us a braclet for 280.00...again....I don\'t think so. I would have stop along the way more just to look but couldn\'t look without being hounded and pushed to buy. \n\nI would go back to see the Natural Beauty...knowing it\'s one of three Blow Holes....but my expectations would be a little different...all you need is 10-15 mins to take a look but much much longer to get through the walkway of street vendors.

135706306.name: worth the money and great guides
135706306.author: a TripAdvisor user
135706306.reviewBody: Went on a Carnival cruise.  It was a three day to Ensenada and back to Long Beach.  Wanted to see if my wife could cruise without being sick.  In Ensenada we did the kayak tour to see the blow hole La Bufadora.  The bus to the location was the only thing that keeps this from being excellent.  It was an hour of poor roads under construction.  Once there the guides took care of everything and were very nice and helpful.  It was not that strenuous and really adds to seeing the attraction.  Did not go into town we went back to enjoy the ship, but glad we did the tour and would recommend.

135639909.name: A natural beauty
135639909.author: a TripAdvisor user
135639909.reviewBody: The Blowhole is Ensenada\'s natural attraction, be prepared for all the street vendors. The best churros EVER! try them.

135286414.name: La Bufadora, one of the worst places in Mexico.
135286414.author: a TripAdvisor user
135286414.reviewBody: Ensenada Mexico. This is one of the most horrible places in Mexico now July 21 2012. It shows all the misery and poverty of Mexico, bathrooms are horrible, you must pay $0.50 to use the toilet with limited amount of toilet paper. It may be a natural beauty but a tourist nightmare. Restaurants there are low quality. Do not expect to enjoy your visit there. Stay around downtown Ensenada. It seems that Mexico is not interested in attract tourism. In our trip to there you only see all the property been abandoned, only you see the people trying to survive, feel sorry for these good Mexicans.

135143444.name: Go early to beat the crowds
135143444.author: a TripAdvisor user
135143444.reviewBody: The blowhole wasn\'t that impressive and you have to run the gauntlet of souvenir sellers and restaurant touts to get there.

135031368.name: Not much has changed, and the hole is still blowing!
135031368.author: a TripAdvisor user
135031368.reviewBody: Travelers who have been to "the blowhole" in the past several years will find nothing has really changed, although it is rumored the vendors selling goods along the walkway towards the water spout have been instructed to tone down their hawking and touting, in response to complaints from cruise ship passenger complaints. This may be so; I seemed to have noticed fewer pushy store owners selling Viagra and (almost always fake) Cuban cigars. \n\nThe blowhole itself is a neat experience, but I have a hard time saying the view of water spraying a hundred or so feet in the air from a tidal geyser-like rock formation is worth the hour or so drive from Ensenada. Go if you have never been -- it is trip to see; but, if you have been their before, you will likely find it a "been there, done that" kind of experience.

134286508.name: Not worth it!
134286508.author: a TripAdvisor user
134286508.reviewBody: I visited this abut 14 years ago and it was interesting. Now it\'s a huge number of vendors selling the usual trinkets.  By the time you get thru the vendors you see a puff of water when the waves come in, but you can\'t see the actual blow hole which in the past you could walk right up to.  Now the hole is not visible at all.  Very uninteresting.  sorry it\'s changed so much for the worse.

134064424.name: Great place to go when the blowhole is blowing hard.
134064424.author: a TripAdvisor user
134064424.reviewBody: We took a local shuttle bus tour to La Bufadora, It is an informative and fun ride. It was about $15 round trip and was worth it. The drop-off point is right next to a great taco stand at the top of the market street. La Bufadora is a short walk past the end of the street. Great area for pictures, kayaking, and some shopping (if you can handle the vendors).

134015597.name: for da kids
134015597.author: a TripAdvisor user
134015597.reviewBody: this is a wonderful natural attraction for younger children. la bufadora is a marine geyser than can shoot upwards of 100 ft! it\'s a refreshing visit during the summer. while walking to the blowhole, you\'ll definitely find yourself bombarded with many vendors looking to sell their baja souvenirs and churros. try the churros, yolo.

133883577.name: Experience Ensenada
133883577.author: a TripAdvisor user
133883577.reviewBody: This place is one of the coolest naturally occurring water spouts ever. The shopping and food here doesn\'t get any more authentic and enjoyable. The ultimate price negotiations and hand made goods are here! Mariscos fresh out of the water from that morning and all of the original Coke and Pepsi with real cane sugar you can drink!

133778131.name: Quality touristy area.
133778131.author: a TripAdvisor user
133778131.reviewBody: A fun place to spend a day.  Cruise Ship passengers love it.

133715787.name: beautiful and fun
133715787.author: a TripAdvisor user
133715787.reviewBody: i loved this place. it\'s awesome to to go there in family, and it\'s better to go before ten because that\'s when all the tours and other people come and it starts to get crowded.we went on Friday 7/6. it\'s fun to see the water shoot up in the air and fell the mist on you.and if your lucky you might see dolphins!! we were lucky enough to see the dolphins out in the horizon. the best is that it\'s free.

132481205.name: beautiful natural show.
132481205.author: a TripAdvisor user
132481205.reviewBody: Be prepare for all sort of peddlers and shops of useless souvenirs. The kind of stuff that always ends in garage sales.

131296415.name: A good 3 hour getaway from our Cruise Ship
131296415.author: a TripAdvisor user
131296415.reviewBody:
Loved the Blowhole at the La Bufadora. We visited Ensenada on a Carnival Cruise Trip and bought an excursion to La Bufadora. The ride from the port to the Bufadora was 45 minutues each way.  Some Pros and Cons of the trips.

Pros:-
1) Amazing Blowhole attraction. The sight is a delight to watch. The thunderous noise that the wave makes when it roars over the blowhole is awesome.
2) Beautiful landscapes and views of the Bays when the Bus was about to reach the Bufadora.
3) A Mexican market gives a good experience of Authentic Mexican visit. The shops and foods at these stalls were very interesting.

Cons :-
1) The 45 minute drive each way means , more than 2 hours spent on the Bus. Some may not like to spend that time away from the ship when on cruise.

Other than that, I absolutely enjoyed my visit here and would recommend this place.

130827712.name: Great place
130827712.author: a TripAdvisor user
130827712.reviewBody: Go here is a beautiful place something different and free!!!

129558756.name: rude tour guide
129558756.author: a TripAdvisor user
129558756.reviewBody: It was a long trip from Ensenada to LA Bufadora. Our on bus tour guide who started out interesting and giving us cultural info later started in on reminding us how the US has destroyed Mexico and of course I knew it was coming, it was Bush\'s fault! Geez I can understand being proud of your home country of Mexico, but leave your US bashing out of the tour.

128538682.name: Bufadora is Always Fun
128538682.author: a TripAdvisor user
128538682.reviewBody: I\'ve been visiting Bufadora for about 25 years now and never tire of the scenic drive and creative vendors.  The whole scene is a little campy with the stroll through the market and all the vendors trying to get in your pocket-it can be overwhelming if you aren\'t used to it, but I can always find something for the family that is inexpensive and fun.  You can really haggle with the vendors here, unlike other spots around Ensenada. A fresh batch of churros is a must-they come right out of the hot oil and are thickly coated in sugar and cinnamon.  I\'ve enjoyed some good food at a few of the eateries too.  The blowhole itself?  Well, on a good day it puts on a great show, but if it\'s calm and the tide is out you won\'t see much.  I think it\'s worth the trip.

128440213.name: my day at la bufadora in ensenada, mexico
128440213.author: a TripAdvisor user
128440213.reviewBody: Very interesting natural phenomenon.  You have to walk thru about 500 yards of outdoor vendors hawking you aggressively to buy their wares.  taco restaurant serves good fish tacos where the bus stops for the attraction.

128307969.name: Fun Experience
128307969.author: a TripAdvisor user
128307969.reviewBody: My husband and I are in our early 20s and enjoyed this very much.  It was beautiful and we loved all the shops nearby, including the aggressive vendors :) The walk from the bus to the blow hole isn\'t very long but the drive was about 45 minutes--a lot longer than we thought it would be.  My only complaint was that I wish we would have had longer than 90 minutes there to shop and see the blowhole.

126918813.name: Depends on how you see it and what you like to do.
126918813.author: a TripAdvisor user
126918813.reviewBody: I\'ve been to La Bufadora twice, both on cruise ship excursions.  The first was on the Bufadora/Wine Tasting tour - you took a bus, then had to walk through the guantlet of vendors to see the the blowhole.  I hated that part, but if you like being seriously attacked by everyone and haggling for good deals, you\'ll love it.  Plus the tides were not in our favor that day, so you finally got there and said, "this is it?"  That trip was 1 star for me.  The second excursion was a bus trip and then taking kayaks out to see it from the ocean.  Better tides and no vendors.  The tour guides were great, and we actually saw it spout pretty high, so I\'d give this trip 4 stars.  It\'s still a bit of a long bus trip though either way, maybe 45 minutes.

126813351.name: You have to visit
126813351.author: a TripAdvisor user
126813351.reviewBody: Before you get to the actual bufadora you pass through a little flea market with lots of interesting thing to look or buy

126177462.name: Very nice day, pleasant
126177462.author: a TripAdvisor user
126177462.reviewBody: La Bufadora is very cool: amazing how high it explodes the water, the force of the water rising. It\'s fun to watch. The views are spectacular. The town surrounding it quaint. Nice drive from Ensenada. Nice hiking/walking nearby.

125767125.name: Awful
125767125.author: a TripAdvisor user
125767125.reviewBody: I thought this was a complete let down. It took a really long time from downtown Ensenada to get to this place and it was mostly an icky little town with people yelling at you to buy their stuff of each side of you- at the same time. The blow hole wasnt very big and it seemed everyone lost interest within minutes.

125596574.name: nice and fun place
125596574.author: a TripAdvisor user
125596574.reviewBody: Do not miss this place, is fun , tasty candies fun peoples

125299769.name: Waste of time and money - Fake items sold at flea market which is apparently the main attraction
125299769.author: a TripAdvisor user
125299769.reviewBody: Just got back from a cruise where one of the excursions was a long trip to La Bufadora.  That was cool, but the walk down and back is directed through a flea market.  There are two pharmacies with the same name.  We bought $300 worth of pills and found out they are FAKE.  Shame on us, but don\'t make the same mistake.  The whole trip was not worth the money or time spent.

125100173.name: avoid, avoid, avoid
125100173.author: a TripAdvisor user
125100173.reviewBody: this was a day trip from a cruise ship to see a "blowhole" in Baja, California. The bus parked then we walked maybe 1/2 to 3/4 of a mile to the site. It was a disappointment because the wave motion underneath was minimal thus the "spout" was minimal. Then the terror really began. On both sides of the walk to the "blowhole" were vendors packed side by side. They were polite and cordial on the walk down but on the walk back, all us tourists were innundated and surrounded by the hawkers. Nobody took "NO" as an answer. They followed us along the walk back to the bus. The tour guide did nothing to discourage them. So, if that\'s your thing, have at it. If not, steer clear of it.

124479935.name: Labufadora
124479935.author: a TripAdvisor user
124479935.reviewBody: Took cruise bus trip.  Do not go to see the spouts if it is noy high tide.  No high tide. No spouts otherwise it is a bus ride and a maize of vendors.  It you are shopping then yes.

123980875.name: Visit to the Blow Hole
123980875.author: a TripAdvisor user
123980875.reviewBody: Great scenery on the ride to La Bufadora.  You see fields of flowers and vegetables and a great view of the Ensenada Harbor.  Lots of vendors and restaurants but the ocean view is the most spectacular.

123532363.name: Awesome!
123532363.author: a TripAdvisor user
123532363.reviewBody: Great marine geyser!  If you\'re ever in Ensenada, you have to visit this place.  Beware of the "Gauntlet" of vendors who will do their best to sell you their stuff.\nMake it to the end, though, and you\'ll get to see "La Bufadora", or, the Blow Hole.\nThen you get to go back through the gauntlet...

123179886.name: A lot of fun
123179886.author: a TripAdvisor user
123179886.reviewBody: We enjoy going to La Bufadora every time we come to Ensenada. The vendors have a lot of inexpensive stuff and I\'ve bought blankets and bottles of vanilla there every year. We\'ve also bought inexpensive silver and jewelry. Habana Banana is my favorite restaurant there.

122832468.name: Bus trip to La Bufadora. Natural beauty.
122832468.author: a TripAdvisor user
122832468.reviewBody: Cruise ship stop in Ensenada and they shuttle you to town for $3 Round Trip. Grabbed the bufadora scenic trip for $15 PP from the bus drop off. Took about 1 hr each way, got the full history and local info from the guide. Drop you off and you walk down the flea market strip to see the Blow Hole which was really quite a show of nature. Then walk back up through the shops and snack bars. The ladies bought some jewelry, leather, and had some food from the shops along the way. All very good, no issues. were at the site for less than 2 hours and made it back to the ship for our 3 :30 departure. Didn\'t have any extra time to spend in town, it was a short stop. ( bring money for the restrooms , 50 cents.)

122796110.name: A beautiful drive, a beautiful place, and fun tiendas
122796110.author: a TripAdvisor user
122796110.reviewBody: The drive to La Bufadora is truly beautiful and once you get there, the scenery is well worth it. The fun part about going there is "shopping, shopping, shopping", and, oh yes, the actual blow hole itself. I\'ve been there twice, once now in 2012, and once last year in May 2011. I\'m planning on making it a monthly excursion because it\'s amazing and lots of fun...

122631037.name: One of my favorite places
122631037.author: a TripAdvisor user
122631037.reviewBody: Yes, there are souvernir shops of flea market quality and a few places serving tasty treats, but the prime attraction is the blow hole.  Now, it is nothing more than a spot where the waves come into an inlet in the rocks and then shoot up high into the sky.  But it is captivating.  Even on calm days it only takes a little bit of swell to get some nice displays.  On days with good breakers it is astonding.  I\'ve never been there when there were really big waves, it must shoot a hundred feet in the air then.  Whatever the sea conditions, when I\'m in San Diego, I put Ensenad on my list of places to go because I find this little natural phenomena simply captivating.

121163060.name: Fun..tons of market stands and cantinas
121163060.author: a TripAdvisor user
121163060.reviewBody: The blowhole is a Mexican destination.  People come from Mexico City to see it. The stands selling Mexican tourist stuff are many blocks long.  American style restaurants with American music and Margaritas - same restaurants as Ensenada: LG, Mango Mango etc.  Probably worth visiting once but if you only have the afternoon from the Cruise Ship explore Ensenada instead.  It\'s not Niagara Falls.

120482734.name: Low Tide Disappointment and a Gauntlet of Aggressive Vendors
120482734.author: a TripAdvisor user
120482734.reviewBody:
Just finished a four day cruise with Carnival Cruises and one of the tours we took was to see La Bufadora. Before leaving Ensenada proper, we stopped at what is now the Ensenada Cultural Center. Originally, it had been a speakeasy/gambling hall for various VIPs back in the day. Now, it's mostly used as a rental hall for weddings and parties. Interesting history and lovely grounds. At the end, we were served our choice of a margarita or draft beer in tiny plastic cups. I had the margarita and the only cue that what I drank WAS a margarita was the salt clinging to the top rim. It was more like margarita flavored water.  

Then, on to La Bufadora, our tour guide, Irma, was friendly and personable. Though, she did struggle at times with her English and it was clear that she had given this tour hundreds of times due to the rehearsed nature of some of her jokes. The bus was comfortable and relatively clean, but nothing to write home about. 

We drove through Ensenada, and what became evident to me was that Ensenada needs to be more aggressive when cleaning up its graffiti. Graffiti is everywhere and so is trash. Of course, off in the distance hills beautiful homes and mansions can be seen. We drove through farms, etc, and about the last 15 minutes of the drive through hills was lovely when the coastline could be seen. 

We pull up to a dusty "parking lot" and exited the bus to see La Bufadora. However, to get there, one must walk through about a quarter of a mile of very aggressive vendors selling, what mostly likely is, cheap goods imported from China. Knock-off designer bags, glass-beaded and silver jewelry (sold all over the Ensenada), NFL (!) ponchos, medication (Viagra was loudly touted), ceramic Mario Bros, and other typical junk peddled to tourists. I get that the people are mostly poor and trying to eek out a meager living, but the carnie behavior was off-putting. 

Finally, having survived the mercado, we climb the steps to see La Bufadora; which looks like a large crevice or crack in which water enters. Thing is, to experience spout of water, there has to be a large amount of water rushing into the crevice. This doesn't happen if the tide is low, which it was when we went and this was very much down-played by our tour guide. So, we stood looking for about 15 minutes hoping and praying we were going to be the "natural phenomenon" of La Bufadora. Nothing. 

However, right before we left, there was a little rush of ocean, and we got a little taste of what must be really amazing on a rough, or stormy day. It was quick and fleeting, and then back to faint deep whistles emanating from the crack.  We decided to head back and braced ourselves for the onslaught of people wishing to part us from our money. 
I may have been interested had they any merchandise worth purchasing, but it was difficult to differentiate one seller's stall from another. We did decide to stop at a stand and get a margarita. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't good either. 

Back on the bus, most of us expressed our disappointment at a non-spouting La Bufadora. Irma just shrugged and told us as a "natural phenomenon" they didn't have control of such things. I was thinking that perhaps she could have better prepared us or at least informed us of how the tide impacts the height of the water spout. 

So, if you are planning on visiting La Bufadora, MAKE SURE the tide is high, otherwise, the trip just isn't worth it.

118541900.name: Fun and Worth the Drive from Ensenada
118541900.author: a TripAdvisor user
118541900.reviewBody:
The area where you actually see the spray (and get wet) was lots of fun and very refreshing on a hot day.  The view of the coast is beautiful, as well.  My best friend and I were there on a Friday morning and there were very few other people, allowing us to get as close to the spray as we cared to.  It was fun to watch all the people get up close to see where the spray was coming from, and then scream and run when they saw it was about to hit.  We didn't speak the same language, but we all laughed together!

The downside to going on a quiet day was that we were aggressively hounded by the vendors.  You have to walk through a long gauntlet of vendors before you can get to the sight itself and you have to walk it again, of course, to leave.  Because it was such a slow day, we at times had up to 4 men surrounding us and yelling over each other trying to get us to go into their stores or restaurants.  It was overwhelming and a little intimidating for 2 women on their own.  I'm sure it's much better on a busy day, or if you're part of a larger group. 

All said, though, I would go back to enjoy La Bufadora again.

118332042.name: la bufadora- blows!
118332042.author: a TripAdvisor user
118332042.reviewBody: ok  so we went to this la bufadora tourist site \'cuz the pic. looks amazing and huge! when we got there after an hour or more drive through tourist bus...it was disappointing \'cuz it was crowded and it didn\'t really blow a lot. i was expecting big and high blows from the hole...we should\'ve just gone to papas and beer. we tried shopping in the alley butyou only have 2 an hour so you really don\'t have time to shop around and really enjoy it.

118034653.name: SKIP IT unless you have nothing else to do
118034653.author: a TripAdvisor user
118034653.reviewBody:
When you get off the Carnival cruise you go through a little building with expensive shops (which you will  buy stuff from later because you forgot to buy while in town). Once outside the building there are shuttles which makes you think that downtown is sooooo far away so you pay the $2 per person for this shuttle. The shuttle drives you to the right a  bit and then goes to the left towards downtown. You find out later they made it seem like a long ride to make it worth your money. While driving you the long way, they try to sell  you this tour to La Bufadora for $15 a person. We were a group of 12 so we paid for 12 and got 2 free. So on the shuttle they tell  you a bunch of lies like you can get a mexican blanket for $4 but in downtown it's more. It's not possible, I tried about 15 shops and I got a small one for $10. 
The bus ride is about 40  minnutes in a hot shuttle. they have ac which doesn't work and even the driver has his window open so once we opened the windows it felt better. They have this stop to the corona factory but it's really to a convience store in front of the corona factory. But you can buy coronoas $1 per bottle or $2 for 40oz. to drink on the shuttle. Pretty basic tour. Once you get to La Bufadora the guide shows you some shops he says we should "trust" but they are the ones that ripped us off the most. Went to the Blowhole and out our guide disappeared. That day the Blowhole was unimpressive as it was a beautiful day so it just looked like waves splashing on rocks. All our pics never show the Blowhole you see in pics, so it looked like we were just takuing pics with rocks. So we went to look for the free magaritas, which were small and ended up watered down. Weren't sure there was any alcohol in it. But we didn't buy anything, used the clean bathrooms and left. So if you go, pee here!!! everywhere else you have to pay 50 cents. We spent the rest of the time walkign around and not really buying anything as it was not cheaper like the tourguide said. 
We wanted to go to the beach after and the guide and driver dropped our group off at the beach. We tipped them $10. but it wasn't asked for. At the beach we had a great time, with locals. and then it was the long walk back which our guide said 15 minutes fast walking and 30 slow. it took us over an hour. and we found out how close downtown was to the ship. 
So we ran out of time and didn't get to see downtown but others that didn't opt for this tour enjoyed downtown. They said the shuttle wanted $1 a person to take you back and it wasn't worth it because it was so close. SO DONT TAKE THE SHUTTLE!!!

118006575.name: Its something to do while in Ensenada
118006575.author: a TripAdvisor user
118006575.reviewBody: Its a cool place to go while in Ensenada. Its over an hours drive by bus to get there though. Its not a real scenic drive until about the last 10 mins. At this point you will drive through winding hills with views of the ocean. If your prone to motion sickness this may start to take its toll on you but luckily it doesnt last to long. Once you park you have to walk down this street filled with vendor shops....and the employees here are salesman!!! You feel like a guppy in a shark down! Everyone has their eye on you and will try to get you into their shop. If your not interested in shopping just walk down the middle of the road and dont make eye contact with these vendors...as rude as you may think it is, ignore them! If you make any eye contact or verbal chat they will keep pestering you until you go in their shop. It takes about 10 mins to walk from the parking lot down to where the blow hole is. Once there you will see water spray up from out of a rock crevice and up into the air. Its pretty neat for a first timer. I have been there 3 times now (just because there isnt much else to do in Ensenada I think). It is kind of a fun place, the major down side is the long drive to get there and back. If you have never been....I say go! If you have kids they will probably enjoy it as well.

117405902.name: Hooked on La Bufadora - good place to see Whales and Dolfins too.
117405902.author: a TripAdvisor user
117405902.reviewBody: We first visited Bufadora in 2007 and ended up leasing and building just behind the hill opposite La Bufadora and plan on retiring there.  On a stormy day you will get wet from the blow hole and it is fun to watch and people watch.  Shopping and anyoying the vendors is a fun sport, however I have purchased my share of shoes, shirts, pharmacy products, etc.  On a calm day the blow hole is pretty boring, so it depends upon what the sea is up to that day.  If you are there after New Years through May, it is likely you will see and hear the whales blowing.  If you are lucky you will see hundreds of dolphins swim and circle their prey, although it is recommended that you get up high to see them properly.  My favorite treat is fresh soft green coconut opened and mixed with shrimp and octopus in clamato and hot sauce.  It just gets more fun everytime we go and there is so much else to do in the area, espcially if you like to walk the beach or explore the tide pools.

116632396.name: Good excursion but less expensive going local rather than with cruiseline.
116632396.author: a TripAdvisor user
116632396.reviewBody: My husband and I just got back today from a 4 day Mexican Riviera cruise with Carnival. This was our third time on Carnival so we opted to try a local tour guide (as we did in Jamaica) rather than take the Carnival tour. We got on a bus outside the cruise terminal to take us to downtown (about 2 miles). The tour guide told us that they also operate a tour to La Bufadora Blowhole and that it was $15 each rather than the $29.95 that Carnival charges. We would ride the small bus to the site, see the blowhole and have 2 hours total as there was also an open air market. We chose this option and what a good deal! She was a great tour guide as she filled us in on local facts and suggested that we shop after seeing the blowhole as it takes time to see all the merchants. She counted to ensure that all of us had returned and one couple was left behind by another tour bus so they rode with us. Now, my only complaint is that they give each person a free margarita at the local restaurant (which was clean, etc) so we took advantage but later that night my husband began having stomach cramps and have the next day I had the same symtpoms. I made a joke that it must have been the ice for the drinks but I think I may have been right. None of the other passengers had the drink so they were smarter than me. I just assumed it was okay as it was a real restaurant and had regular customers. Guess not.

116447057.name: awesome natural attraction
116447057.author: a TripAdvisor user
116447057.reviewBody: LA BUFADORA is a wonderfull natural attraction in Ensenada Mexico, you can see as the sea hits stones and the water raises in spurt bathing all the visitor.

109974895.name: The Bufing Tacos are worth the trip
109974895.author: a TripAdvisor user
109974895.reviewBody: Near the dirt parking towards the entrance toward the Blowhole is a stone/mortar taco stand (to the right). The owner popped out and said best tacos "guaranteed" or your money back. Our tour guide even told us these were the best tacos in Ensenada. She was absolutely right. My friends, a group of four, took a chance and were blown away at the perfect flavors that came out of the Carne Asada, Camarones (Shrimp) and Pescado (Fish) tacos. The tortillas were are made fresh to order and the myriad of flavors (cream, guacamole, salsas) were amazing and to US standards, cheap. I\'ve been to La Bufadora 6+ times while cruising on Carnival and Royal Caribbean Cruises and this new found gem gives me even more reason to come back. The owners guarantee of the best tacos is solid like diamonds. The churros from the street vendors are excellent as well ($3 a bag (May 2011)). The ~$20 bus ride is worth the cost for another chance at those tacos. While the Blowhole is an amazing feat of nature, engross yourself in the cuisine of Ensenada.

78433933.name: Nice to see "ONCE"
78433933.author: a TripAdvisor user
78433933.reviewBody: My husband and our 2 children ages 16 and 20 took our first Cruise and stopped in  Ensenad.  Due to prices for most excrusions we chose to go on the Blow Hole Tour LA Bufadora. (Tickets for turor were $15.00pp after $5 discount coupon u get from the tuor bus co. we paid $3.pp to get to the place where u purchachse your tickets and catch a different tour bus for the Blow Hole Tour) Realized later we could of walked over to the booth to purchase the tour tickets but dont know if u can get the discount coupon so all in all we still saved a little.  Our tour guide who\'s Name was Alex aka "Cookie Monster" (ask hinm Y) was great very informative about what to do and no to do.  Stopped on the way to L a Bufadora for a free bathroom break and drinks and snacks at the Corona Brewery. Alex walked us through the flea market again pointing out the 2 free bathrooms (free does not always mean clean) and other informative tips (dont accept ANY free tequlia) Alex left us at the blow tour and told us if we needed him before time was up we just had to ask for him by nick name and the vendors did know who we were talking about. The Blow Hole was pretyy but eveytime we tried to take a picture of family in front of the spout it wouldn\'t get big eneough so we switched picture with 2 of us at a time and what dou you know we got them,  I wasnnt ready for the pushiness of all the vendors and about quarter away through we stopped going into each stop (they all have the same stuff}  went almost to the end where we found a shop with only 2 peoploe woking and we purchased everything we wanted and that was that.  The best part of the whole tour had to be the tour guide Aex he was great so if you go ask for him.  We returned to downtown Ensenada and more shops of the same things but also children on the corner as well (hard to take) we used almost all our cash and the store did not take debit/credit cards  on the cruise they said there is a $27 service fee if u use the atm machine in Ensenada however we were told different form those on land we didn\'t walk the 3 blocks to the bank figured it meant we spent enough and went back to our ship.  Like I said it was nice for the money but we probably would of chose smething different (off road if the price wasn\'t so high for a family of four) didn;t think it would b safe to break up and the guys go one way and the girls go another. I would recommend to others but only if they can add more to the trip like other excrusions and if your low on funds (as we were) it is better thannothing

52047995.name: La Bufadora (Natural Blowhole)
52047995.author: a TripAdvisor user
52047995.reviewBody: This was amazing..and seriously fun! You walk through a shopping market full of souvenirs including knock off name brand purses, beautiful sterling silver, gold and gem jewelry. At the very end of the market street is La Bufadora the blowhole (think a backwards waterfall). Everyone gathers round the huge rocks and waits for the water to build up...and then it sprays way up over the mountain ledge and on to all the spectators! Amazing and super fun, even if your not a little kid! The view around La Bufadora is spectacular. Highly recommend it :)

50629912.name: Very interesting and beautiful
50629912.author: a TripAdvisor user
50629912.reviewBody: Me and my husband visited La Bufadora as part of our Carnival Cruise trip. We took a tour bus and our tour guide was very knowledgeable and told us a lot of the history along our drive. The market is filled with lots of tourists nick knacks and if you just learn to say no thank you, the vendors won\'t pester you that much. The blowhole was very cool and the area and view was very beautiful. We probably won\'t go back again but it was a nice thing to see once.

48854593.name: Bufadora
48854593.author: a TripAdvisor user
48854593.reviewBody: Well Ive only been there twice with my family and friends... Ive always lives in Tijuana and San Diego but only been there twice.. Ive taken all my american friends with my family and they love it... there are lots of nice shops along the way but the really nice part about them is that they have stuff even I have never seen... things from Guerrero Mexico, Morelia, Guadalajara.. etc.. I love cultuiral stuff reminds me how beautiful Mexico is.. and all the art and beauty in it... my dad has a hotel there too.. so I just love it.. =)\n\nI recomend it 100%

36945126.name: La Barfadora
36945126.author: a TripAdvisor user
36945126.reviewBody: All I can say is that this trip is a way less than advertised.  The blowhole is pretty nice but it\'s not that big of a deal.  And you have to walk a few hundred yards down through the "flea market" which is more like a professional pestering.  There are hundreds of vendors that won\'t leave you alone, all selling the same stuff with "the best prices" and offering "30% off for you today".  They all use the same lines and they start at prices higher than in the US.  A fake D&G purse that started at $180 went down to $10.  I have had more offers for Viagra than in my emails and, I am not kidding, was offered steroids.  There was one family on our bus and they seemed to have a good time, but I don\'t think this is a place for kids.  Maybe if I slammed 3 margaritas before hitting the flea market I could have had some fun.

34784322.name: Rent a golf cart, don\'t take the bus...and bring sunglasses and a hat!
34784322.author: a TripAdvisor user
34784322.reviewBody:
My husband and I rented a golf cart for fun, and it was the best!  We travelled from the port in Ensenada to La Bufadora, "the blowhole".  Didn't have to ride in a smelly bus with a bunch of sweaty people, and were able to get parking in town easily, and it was fun!  I got pretty sun burned, and wind burned, so be sure you have a hat, and keep a hold of it in the wind!

La Bufadora was pretty, but you have to walk through what seems like miles of street vendors that aren't easily discouraged.  Trying to sell you a bracelet with your name woven into it, or a grain of rice with your name on it, a poncho, pharmaceuticals, Chiclets, etc.  Typical Mexico.  If you can get through all that, and the blowhole wants to cooperate, it's a great sight...if it blows high.  You may have to stand there for a while before the ocean gives it the power it needs to really spray up high.  But if you drove or took a bus all the way out there, you might as well wait a few minutes.  

You also have to pay to use the restroom.  And to take a picture with some guy's donkey.  It was fun...bring pesos or change though, and definitely bargain with people.

17580716.name: Tour of the Blow Hole in Ensenada
17580716.author: a TripAdvisor user
17580716.reviewBody:
If you realize that the vendors along the way are just trying to make a living and not take your shopping too seriously you can have a little fun on this tour.

We got off the Carnival Paradise here and took the tour that brought us to La Bufadora and the Santo Thomas winery (reviewed separately).

The scenery was very nice and the walk from the parking lot to the blow hole was not very long...maybe a city block or so.  Yes, you have to pass vendors trying (with all their hearts) to sell you something, but if you give them a kind 'no gracias' they will not harass you.

The blow hole was nice to see, not something I would make exception for, but a beautiful sight.  Not much to see but the ocean swells coming into the cave and causing a nice spray of water way in the air.

If you have time, take the tour and if you have a savvy tour guide you can use the bathrooms at Habana Banana for FREE!  We did buy some t-shirts and cigars, though...

17570173.name: Loved it!
17570173.author: a TripAdvisor user
17570173.reviewBody: My husband and three of our kids spent a couple of hours at La Bufadora.  We got off the cruise ship and found a taxi that would take us there.  We paid $45 for him to drive the 5 of us and to wait 2 hours while we shopped.  The kids loved bargaining with the locals and had a blast buying cheap souvenirs. We thought the "pushy" store owners were hilarious and we had a fun time joking back and forth with them.   My 8 year old daughter had fun getting her hair braided.  The blowhole was beautiful.  It spouted so high, that all of us watching got wet.\n\nIt was about a 45 minute ride to La Bufadora.  My kids have never been to Mexico before and we all enjoyed the ride.  It\'s always interesting just seeing how others live.

17271045.name: La Bufadora, June 2008
17271045.author: a TripAdvisor user
17271045.reviewBody:
My husband and I came off a Carnival Cruise Ship, and went to see La Bufadora on one of the excursions. The problem with seeing Bufadora, is that there is a string of open shops before you get there.(About a half mile) You have to watch out for some of these shop owners, they are really aggressive. And don't walk into their shop to just look because they will hound you on the street coming and going. Don't accept the first price they offer you. Some of their merchandise is not geniunely Mexican.
They think that every visitor is a big spender. Be especially cautious if you are a single woman, or get separated from your spouse. 

The Bufadora site is a very interesting phenomena. It is amazing how it can spout that much water from that tiny little cove! There is a Native Mexican Man dressed in his original headdress and clothes nearby, he plays his drum and flute. Very nice touch!

13963713.name: bufador was not like we were expecting
13963713.author: a TripAdvisor user
13963713.reviewBody: i dont know what bufadora they went to but my experience was not as good. you can hardly see the blowhole what you end up seeing is a mist that comes out from under a rock. the flea market they advertise is nothing more than about a hundred open air markets with very agressive sales people selling all kinds of junk that i wouldnt consider buying. i thought it was a waste of time and we ended up spending about two hours in habana banana eating and waiting for our bus to leave. i didnt care for the excursion at all. oh and they charge you 50 cents to use the rest rooms how is that for tourist trap.

7846683.name: A Great Few Hours from the Cruise Ship
7846683.author: a TripAdvisor user
7846683.reviewBody: My family and I were on Royal Caribbean\'s Monarch of the Seas, and decided to go visit La Bufadora  on 6/7/07.  The cruise offered a 3 hour tour for $21 adult $13 child, but we decided to save money and go with an independent tour company.  When we got off the ship, we took the shuttle to downtown Ensenada ($3 round trip).  My 5 year old daughter was free because she sat on my lap for the short 5 minute ride.  During the shuttle ride, the person will announce to you the tours that they provide, including a tour to La Bufadora.  With a $5 off coupon they give you, we each pay $15 for the tour.  Children 5 and under are free.  When we arrive at the downtown location, we get out and go to the blue window to pay for the tour.  We get on a different shuttle and wait approx. 10 minutes before we leave.  It\'s approx. a 45 minute ride to La Bufadora.  Our tour guide Ignacio kept us entertained on the shuttle with background information about Ensenada.  When we arrived, Ignacio leads us through to the end of the flea market to view La Bufadora.  Afterwards, we\'re given a couple of hours to eat and shop.  We had fish tacos and shrimp tacos at Mexico Tacos restaurant.  It was fun to eat above the restaurant overlooking the flea market.  The service was great and they gave you free chips & salsa/guacamole.  Oh, and if you eat at the restaurants, you can use their restrooms for free.  Otherwise, you need to pay 50 cents to use public bathrooms.  We bought a bundle of churros for $2.  Merchants were asking $4 for a coconut, but I finally got one for $2.50.  My daughter got her hair braided for $8.  My daughter bought 22 wooden flutes (souvenirs for her classmates) for $25.  On our way back, we get dropped off in front of Papas & Beer; it\'s a short walk back to the blue window parking lot where we catch our return ride to the cruise ship.  I also found out that if you are a party of four, you can take a taxi to La Bufadora for $10 each.  I will definitely do that next time.\n

6717553.name: Beautiful Place! Good Shopping
6717553.author: a TripAdvisor user
6717553.reviewBody: We had an opportunity to go see the blowhole.  It was beautiful.  Weather was great and it is amazing the beauty.  Then we headed back and did a little bargain shopping.  Had fun bartering and got some stained glass, crafts, and great Mexican blankets.  Make a day of it!\n

3747805.name: Fantastic scuba diving
3747805.author: a TripAdvisor user
3747805.reviewBody: The deepwater upwelling that goes past La Bufadora has carved rock spires where the traveling nutrients encourage wild growth on the vertical surfaces.  We saw cowries, nudibranches, dorids, tunicates, sponge, hydrocoral, cupcoral anemonies, seafans covering every inch of rock.   There were piles of huge starfish and an occaisional 30 armed sunstarfish.   The visibility and terrain made for a breathtaking 2 dives.   This is done on boats taken out with the local Dale\'s La Bufadora Dive.\n

2112165.name: great SCUBA, fun shopping...
2112165.author: a TripAdvisor user
2112165.reviewBody: We went to Dale\'s Dive shop, right down at the Bufadora. The morning boat was full, so we had a few hours to visit La Bufadora and the shops.  The shops were fun, and the diving was great - colorful and clear!

925646.name: The Blowhole
925646.author: a TripAdvisor user
925646.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit, the first time anyway, you will find that going back a second day really is kind of boreing. This is a must-see tourist trap if you do visit Ensenada. You have a mile of road with shops, bars, street actors, and restaurants and then the Blowhole at the end of it all. You will want to go when the tide is big and when it is in, you will get soaked and that is half the fun. Also when you are down there, ask the bartender, waiter, or entertainer about the myth of the place...
